You disturb and replace several of the weapons on the wall, taking a a few thick staff, a couple of especially long longswords, and even try to pick up a greatsword that looked to be longer than you are tall.
You step back and look over the room, sighing. Seconds away from asking for advice from Henry, a glinting handle, sticking out from the aforementioned pile, catches your attention. The handle itself looks rather ornate, too ornate to fit in with the rest of the weapons in the room. Yor move over to it and get a closer look at the blade as you slide it out of the pile. The handle has a ring made out of a gold-look-alike material around the top of it, with spikes pointing up from it. Were it not in a rectangle shape and leading up into a blade, you figure that it would resemble a crown. The blade itself is long and wide, obviously crafted to be used in two hands. Taking it out of it's sheath, you begin handling it. You're quite clumsy with it, given that you're brain is telling you to move it with arms much bigger than yours, but you manage to not look like a complete idiot in front of your new mentor with it. You take note that despite it's girth, the blade itself is surprisingly thin, along with two sided, symetrical, and engraved in symbols that you, surprisingly, don't even recognize.

Henry, who has somehow managed to fall asleep while leaning against an empty spot on the wall, still with the same grin, wakes up upon your approaching him. "Hm? Oh, that's the one you want? Heh, alrighty. Really won't be a big deal, in the long run. Given that magic will be your real weapon, what you've got there will be more of a means to an end. Chances are, you'll eventually find something that you work better with, but you won't want to continuously replace it, given how your weapons will get stronger the longer you use them, as they'll become more attuned to your magic the more magic that you channel through them... Waitaminute." He leans in forwards, and you would guess that he would be squinting at your weapon were his eyes not already performing that task. "Isn't that... Yeah! It is! That's so cool! What you've got there is a sword that was made as both an alternative for and replica-ish sword for our own king. He sort of decided that he prefered his old one and didn't like how it was being copied, so he up and threw that one out. Wonder how it ended up here... Meh, who cares! You've got it now!"
He goes and skips, or, atleast you guess that it's skipping that he's doing under his robe, back into the large, open room that you came from. But, he then turns back around to you, and opens up his robe, reavealing an almost pitch black vest underneath it. The robe itself has several pockets inside of it, each of which containing a book of some sort. Given the bulky size and number of the books, you're quite surprised that they weren't visible from the outside. he ends up surprising you by taking out one of the books and tossing it into the air before doing tne same with four more books. He catches each, tossing them up one after another - it dawns on, and amazes, you that he's juggling them, about at this point - and after a moment of repeating this for a few more cycles of gravity and tossing, he looks down from his activity and to you. "These here are my 'weapons', if you want to call them that. Given how much I like to read, I ended up casting several spells while I was cramming in information from my favorite book. Eventually, it got attuned to my magic. However, this effect can be forced, so why don't you go ahead and try it out?"
1233312122.title: How to do a magics.

choices: Meanwhile, in the dark void that is your unconscious mind...
12333121222.content:
You nod back at Henry, and move your line of sight to your sword. You're rather certain that this task will be easy for anyone with any inherent magical ability at all. Given the magic nature of your species, it should be a snap for you. Or, at least you think so. Focusing energy along with an incantation is simple enough, but you can't very well do that here without catching your blade on fire or blasting it out of your hands. After a moment of nothing more than staring, you relax and look back up to Henry. Once again, he is looking at his five books, which, somehow, he is still managing to juggle.
Without looking down to you, he continues with his own personal experience, "Of course, a person's favorite book eventually changes, especially after being read for the twentieth time. So, as time went by, I ended up with several different titles. I tried to make each one have a different set of materials, like different covers, binding, you know, bolk parts. Just like the experiences of others, each one had the same qualities after a bit of charging. Seem as though you could hold a rock and it would work just as well, heh. Unlike other wizards, I ended up holding onto my old 'weapons' after getting a new book. Ol' sentimentalities, I suppose!" He shrugs and laughs for a bit before composing himself and moving on. "Given the fact that my channeling weapons are books and not actual weapons, it also kind of helps that I seem to have picked up the ability to channel through more than one of these at once. It's allowed me to create all kinds of combinations of spells with ease. I once drowned a guy while burning him to death! Neat, right?"

You immediately try and shake that image out of your head, and after failing, go back to focusing on your weapon, if for nothing more than a distraction. You hold it straight up, this time, and look at it in the dead center before closing your eyes altogether, so you can think. You begin trying to think about magic in general, and begin trying to think of it as a physical force, imagining it running through you. You think of it as in your veins, your nerves, and then as you as a whole. You are a magical being- no, you are magic itself! Your eyes snap open, and your pupils have dilated to tiny ovals, oh-so slightly revealing your draconic nature. Your breath becomes shallow before you begin holding it altogether. You begin focusing even more intently on your sword, going cross-eyed. You hold it even higher, with the hilt just under eye level, and the golden colored decoration on the blade being just inches away from your forehead. Then, a foreign thought enters your head. You're certain that you didn't put it there. Suddenly, you are envisioning your sword as an extension of yourself, with magic flowing through it just as easily as yourself. Time around you seems to slow, and your lungs seem to be ready to burst from holding your breath, but you find yourself unable to exhale. Your arms feel suddenly weak, but you are unable to let go. Your senses seem to disappear: you hear nothing but your own heartbeat, seemingly slowed down to a constant rythym of once every ten seconds. You see nothing but the sword in your hands, darkness seeming crowding around you. You feel nothing, as even the floor under you seems to melt away, though you would swear that a gentle breeze was blowing through your hair. Slowly, the gold ornament above the hilt seems to grow. The spikes on it seem to get larger and larger, growing upwards to the top of the sword, meeting at it's tip.
Then, you're completely overloaded with the return of your senses. Time returns to normal, you can hear Henry, still juggling and speaking, not ten words into his new topic, and the floor returns to under your now slightly numb legs. Then, all at once, you look away, towards Henry, exhale, release the sword, and let your legs give out. Simotaneously, the golden lines adorning the sword seem to both explode and implode, as the lines both shoot out an assortment of sparks and seemingly melt away into the blade, turning it's color into a bright, hot red. The sword, as you relinquish its hilt, doesn't drop to the floor as you are currently doing, but flies away from you. As you hit the ground, eyes still open and pupils returning to normal size, you see the sword across the room, along with Henry's smiling face turning from looking at it to you.

The last thing you experience before succumbing to sleep is Henry yelling, "Do that again!"
12333121222.title: Explosive success.

choices: A fire started. Your secret is safe, but your apprenticeship may not be.
The only real damage done was to yourself. You're in a bed, being attended to.
123331212222.content:
When you next awake you aren't actually, well, awake. You find yourself looking at what looks like yourself in a rather surreal experience. You look quite different than your usual self, both being female in appearance and ragged in your clothes' appearance. You're walking down a corridor- er... the you that you're watching, that is. The corridor is iluminated directly around yourself, though no further in either direction, and glancing around, you find it nearly impossible to determine where the light is coming from. The corridor itself seems to be natural in its construction: a cave, perhaps.
The further that both you and the other you advance down the corridor, the more defensive the other you seems to get, and reasonably so, given how the area is getting dimmer. Soon, you brandish the same sword that you had been handling outside of the dream, as the your actual self curses the blade, and yourself, for causing the trouble you figure you're in.
Suddenly, you - the other you - begins to channel through tge sword, the same action that had knocked you out. However, despite watching it occur outside of your body being surreal in itself, none of the surreal effects that happened to you happened to this version of yourself. However, something new did occur, as after the golden lines formed from the ornament and met at the top, they seemed to expand, covering the whole of the blade in a golden glow. Seems that this glowing effect was quite fortunate, as a few steps after creating it, the light surrounding the area vanished, leaving the only thing in your field of vison the sword's glow. But, while the sword seemed to be giving off light, none of it could be seen as reaching the floor, as if the light was being devoured as it reached the ground instead of reflecting back to your eyes. You don't give this any thought, though, as you're in a dream and don't even have eyes for light to reflect into.

Moments into this almost pitch-black scenario, you see another hint of light, though not from another light source. Looking closer, you see that it's actually another sword, reflecting light from yours. You can tell that some words are said, though, to you, they sound like nothing but someone gargling water. This sound soon stops, as you enter a defensive stance as the sword that is not your own comes swinging towards you. You resist the urge to try and dodge, given that you're simply an observer in the situation. The other you stays put as well, opting to parry, allowing the overhead swing glance off before swinging your sword around for a counterattack. This is met with another parry, this one from your opponent. You soon lose track of the fight in a fast clash of metal moves around with skill that you don't even remember 'remembering'. Your efforts to pick back up on the fight are abruptly stopped as one of the swords swings to the location your head would have been, were you an actual person there, observing. More than cutting your would-be head, your vision of the fight also seems to have cut out.

Left with nothing but the surrounding darkness, you find yourself thinking about exactly what happened after you passed out. You had both caused an explosion and demonstrated your capacity for magical output. You could have started a fire, in the castle, no less. More importantly, you could have also been discovered while you were out! It would seem you're about to get your answers, as the darkness gives way to an intense light as you open your eyes.
123331212222.title: Despite the saying, there's no 'land' for dreams.

choices: Time to actually start! How to spell for dummies-the magic kind of spelling.
Start out with a task. Looks like you'll have to earn your apprenticeship.
1233312122222.content:
You awaken to an unfamiliar set of four walls surrounding you in a rather close proximity. Sitting up, you find that you are - er, were - lying down on a bed inside of what must be the smallest bedroom that you had ever seen. That is, until you noticed the tiny table jam-packed with medical equipment hinting towards the fact that this probably isn't a guest room. Still, even for, or especially for, an examining room it was far too small. It barely had room for your miniscule bed and the other man in the room, whom you just realized has staring directly at you since you woke up, interrupting your thoughts about your surroundings.
He breaks the awkward silence and staring contest between the two of you. "Ah, I was expecting you to wake up right about now. Right on time, actually."
You respond with your own query, apparently having decided to skip past any introductions or pleasantries, "On time? Er, what do you mean?"
"Oh, I had you figured for waking up, right about now. If one could simply observe another's unconscious eye movements to tell when they were about to awaken..."
He trails off, raising an eyebrow at you along with a hand to his chin, giving him a pensive look. You kind of feel pressured, as the way he's looking at you simulates the way someone looks at an fool who doesn't know what century he's living in. Feeling the need to explain yourself, you quickly blurt out, "I've never heard that in the countryside before. It would actually be useful, if you would teach me what to look for."
He raises his other eyebrow before continuing, "...it would be rather neat." His previously stone cold face cracks for a smirk before it settles down and he continues talking, "You really ought to let people finish their thoughts, lest you risk asking for things that don't exist. Might make you appear as hasty and foolish." He juts his hand straight out, requesting a reciprocation to complete a handshake, which you oblige. "My name is Jade, and I've been treating you since you knocked yourself out. I hear you got too hyper in trying to resonate with a weapon and replicated yourself a reoccurrence of some of the very first grand wizards' attempts. Henry was probably right with what talent he saw in you. Probably. Anyways, I am an actual doctor, certifications and everything." As he stops for a moment and shrugs, you take note of the fact that he looks clad in gear for killing people, not healing them. He has a rather intricate and blue vest on over a set of chain-mail with the added touch of having small metal shoulderpads on. What really seems over the top is the fact that he has three weapons strapped to his back: a spear and two bows. Why in the world he would have two bows and no quiver to use with either one of them is beyond you.
However, he picks upma nearby knife and continues before you get the nerve to ask about it, "My doctorate isn't actually in the medical field, mind you, but that really shouldn't be a problem, especially since that'll stay between the two of us, right?" He runs a finger over the blade of the knife in his hand, as if to accentuate a threat the likes of which he hadn't made. You nod frantically at this, overcove with a sudden onset of fear that isn't becoming of your stout personality. He nods once back at you before tossing the knife in the air, only to catch it and set it back on the table. As he turns around to head out the door, you swear that you caught a glimpse of the same smirk that you had seen earlier.

As soon as he walks out the door and shuts it, you breathe a sigh of relief. You then mentally berate yourself for getting so frightened in a situation where there wasn't any definite danger to yourself. But, there was just something so menacing about that man. Perhaps it was his attire, or his cold facial expression, or even his aura of authority. You note that the last of those also came from Merlan in the few moments that you had met him, and, now that you think about it, it probably comes from being advisor to a king, which you now recognize Jade as being. The last of the three advisors was certainly startled you the most, though after a moment of thought, you realize that you were the butt of two jokes that he had laid out. Having been led into both 'interrupting' him and into thinking that he was threatening you, you feel just a bit foolish for walking right his jokes.
But, then, you really do need to do some walking. Out of this tiny room, that is. You get out of the bed and open the door, thinking that you're ready to face whatever is next for your training, despite never having really started it.
1233312122222.title: A rather Jaded experience.

choices: Bandit. It's what's for the dragon's dinner.
Better safe than slain. Seek them out as a human.
12333121222222.content:
Walking out of the medical room, you find that you have no idea where you are. Glancing out of a nearby window, you note that you are atleast on the second floor - the likes of which you had never even had a chance to venture up to before. As such, with Jade already having walked out of sight, you find yourself completely lost. So, as any lost young person would do, you start wondering around. This may not have been the best method of getting yourself un-lost, but you did manage to mentally map out a good chunk of the castle before you stumble upon a conversation between the three advisors you previously met.

The first voice you hear, you recognize as your own mentor's, Henry's. "...alm down will you two? Well, atleast you, Merlan. I'm not sure what a more composed Jade would be like. He would probably become too concentrated and start sucking the composure out of everyone around him!"
The second belongs to the wizard of your initial encounter, Merlan. "Don't be preposterous, Henry. Jade knows better than to try and treat injured people. He would keep them alive, sure, but the man went and scared off the nurse the last time he did."
The third to chime in is the one Merlan was scolding, Jade. "I object to that, Merlan. I did what I needed to do to save that man, and you know it."
Given the intensity of the conversation, you follow it to a door, but remain outside of it as you doubt that it would be wise to interrupt, especially given how they are likely talking about the fact that Jade was in the medical room with you. Also, the conversation is simply interesting, and you'd like to hear it to it's end. As if to your wishes, Merlan continues, "Sure, if you consider Necromancy to be an art of healing. That Luke fellow was dead in the bed in there for an hour, yet now he's walking around, though he acts as if he was still mostly dead. You scared the daylights out of Anise so badly when you 'saved' that Guy that she insisted on leaving this entire land, the dear. She was such a nice nurse, too. It really hurt me so see her leaving in that cari van. As such, I don't want to see you messing with any patients in the near future."
"Now, that's just unfair and unreasonable," Jade started before getting interrupted by Henry.
"Come now, guys, don't you think that this is a bit much? There isn't even anyone in the medical bay that's dead and needing of reviving. Unless, of course, you killed our newest apprentice while you were in there. Nya ha!"
Both Jade and Merlan answer at the same time, "NO." before Jade continues with, "It is much better to deal with a potential problem before it arises."
To which, Merlan interjects, "No, this is a matter of principle! New corpse or not, you should not touch any patients. I don't want to lose another nurse!"
To this, Henry simply bursts out laughing, and tries to say, "Alrighty, I tried!" over the incoherent squabbling that suddenly breaks out between the other two. At this, he opens the door that you were standing behind and listening through and walks through it. He just stands there, clutching his side with one hand and laughs for a moment before he seems to notice you.

"Ah! Great timing, er, Opal, right? Right. Well, I think it's riiight about time that you go and really prove your worth to this castle and its people, and more importantly, to me. I want you to do two things. First, go and get some rice and bring it here. We're out, and I simply can't seem to find any in town. Now, for the significantly-easier-than-finding-nonexistent-rice task, go wipe out the dry bandits. They seriously need to stop robbing people, but they're super cowardly. Heck, I heard that two of them ran away from a ten year old kid, once. The trouble with them is finding them. Past that, you could really just explode them into a pile of blood and guts. Mmm. That actually sounds pretty fun. Well, you should do just that: have fun!" He then abruptly skips off down the corridor, leaving you to listen to the bickering if the other two advisors and to your thoughts. Rice can come later. Defeating bandits won't be at all easy for you, unless you tyrn into your dragon form. But, that runs the big risk of getting caught.
What. To. Do.
12333121222222.title: Sit, stay, fetch, fight. Good dragon!

choices: Rover, a male, red, eastern dragon.
Kelly, a female that prefers to make her human self more dragon-like.
124.content:
Two more dragons for your selection.

I'm sticking this here as I have no clue where else to put it. I feel uncomfortable doing anything without explaining myself, so, I'll do it here, if you care to liste- er, read.
Anyways. I'm quite new to writing, as these excerpts that I'm adding to this interactive story are my first experience writing anything outside of mandated papers for my schooling. They are also the first work of fiction that I've ever created, though I've had ideas floating around for quite a while. Taking that into consideration, I hope that anyone that happens upon this will understand why it may appear sub-par when compared to other works.

124.title: More dragons + a note from one of the authors.

13.content:
Light burned into your red eyes as you woke. The sun had aided in keeping you fed like a normal Dark Hunter for whatever amount of time it was that you were unconscious. Then you remembered what happened and after looking around you started to cry. You looked at your body and saw the scars from where your mother’s fangs had chewed your tiny body in her attempt to kill you. You knew but as a child didn’t understand why your own mother would do something like that. But you had little time to dwell on it as you opened you eyes just in time to see and dodge wolf’s jaws that snapped where you used to be. You bolted behind a tree and looked at the wolf as it readied itself to chase you. You then climbed up the tree with relative ease and too quick for the wolf to catch you.

You roared at the wolf but at your small size it only sounded like a squeak. You soon found that drawing attention to yourself was not a good idea as a hawk was the next to attempt to make you its lunch. You were able to use your tail to slice at it. Your tail, like all Dark Hunters, was usually normal looking but could flatten into an ultra thin but ultra strong serrated blade that had a spade shape to it. The serrated parts worked like scissors but could come together to slice depending on the dragons needs. Your tail sliced off the hawks talon and it screeched but sped away. This time you didn’t hazard a roar as it didn’t work at your current size. It was more of a dinner bell right now than a proper roar. You saw a hole in the tree and made a quick dash for it. You learned from your first two encounters to not take it for granted that you were safe so you propped the hole with your keen senses. After finding nothing dangerous you went in and coiled around so your head was facing out and your tail was protecting you. In the dark of the hole you were near invisible, except of course your blowing red eyes as they quivered at the prospect of the dangerous world around you.

For months you steadily learned the things every predator should know. And at your current size, flying didn’t cause any attention so you developed it was well. Like your other talents like mind reading, fire breath, magic, your healing saliva, and a host of other things the genetic knowledge gave you, it came almost naturally as you needed it. However you still needed to practice. For instance you could hear conversations from the few humans that came by while you hid or when they attacked you but when you tried to talk back they would only hear growling, hissing, and snarls. You quickly became afraid of humans, even if you could turn into one. You didn’t use your human form as it left you to vulnerable at the moment but when you found a cave behind a waterfall that no one knew about and the water washed away your scent so you couldn’t be tracked there, you started training that part to. Not much, just walking, running, using your arms and hands. You even found out how to combine your dragon half with your human half. Like when you got big enough but another wolf found you. A one year old human doesn’t have a lot going for them in defense or offense. So your human fingers grew into claws and a tail and wings grew out of your back. At that point you had wolf for dinner.

But you were lonely and with no one to talk to you just kept on living and growing up, learning what you could while practicing what you thought you might need, talking being one of them in both forms. You thanked the out pouring of knowledge from the past Kings, otherwise your vocabulary would have been limited to what the hunters and knights that attacked you. Those weren’t very nice words. But you were still growing and hoping that one day you would be able to make a friend or at the very least not be alone.
13.title: You are not found and wake alone.

choices: Take a chance and try for both.
132.content:
You whimpered as you swallowed the remains of the human you were eating. You didn’t like eating or killing humans but they always attacked you and even after you ran they would find you and try to kill you. A few times they almost succeeded. You even fired warning shots and then verbally warned them but it did little good and they would almost force you to counter attack. The human you just ate was what was left over of a knight that was on one of those ‘holy missions’ they go on to slay dragons. The humans from this realm knew better than to attack you as they knew that Dark Hunters in general were not dragons you looked for on purpose much less attacked. Heck most of the time when a Dark Hunter was around the humans laid their weapons down or in the other direction. However sometimes a few would come through a portal on their missions and search dragons out for multiple reasons. If they didn’t force you to they were safe, from you. Most other dragons could smell the difference and ate them regardless. Only humans from this realm were protected by Dragons. The humans or creatures from other realms were fare game. One of many reasons you hated dragons.

It was strange but you thoroughly enjoyed humans, even if all they did was curse, attack, or fear you. However as a 500 foot Dark Hunter King you ironically hated other dragons with a passion. Most of the time if you saw a dragon, which was often because you could see pretty far, you killed and/or ate it. Besides you figured that they had more meat on them anyway. Even the longer snake types that were the one dragon that was larger than Dark Hunters at 800+ feet you took down. Those usually lasted you a month as you rationed the meat. However other Dark Hunters were your favorite. Not only did they taste almost as good as humans but there was another reason that was the spawn of your hatred for them. A reason you had buried and rarely addressed but was still there. The unspoken and unfounded hatred that was shown to you when you were young was now unconsciously reflected on them. Didn’t matter if it was a baby or full Queen, if they came to close to your territory they died and most of the time before they knew you were even there. Needless to say, fighting such difficult opponents all the time toned you quite well and gave you a decent amount of hidden scars that most never were close enough to see.

You sat in your new cave that easily fit and hid your frame. It was on the side of the mountain and not easily found. It usually took extremely skilled hunters and knights days to find it. Then they could only get in if you left the door, which was a large boulder, open. You tossed the armor from the knight into a side room along with his blade and shield, trying to forget him and the fact that you had been forced, yet again, to kill/eat him. You stretched your wings as you left and rolled the door closed with a bit of magic. It was impossible to close it without magic from the outside as the large bolder was on the inside and was quite heavy, even for you. You looked around and then took to the sky after making sure no one was around.

It was then you saw something you had never seen before, as you soared far above so you looked like a bird to any human on the ground. You could of course see them just fine, you could even see the ants under the ground if you desired to. But this was a new site for you. A dragon was walking on in a city. You marveled at him and the fact they actually figure out you wouldn’t attack them if they were invited by humans. You saw the street clear and any humans that were outside quickly went in doors. The situation was getting more troublesome by the moment, even more so when he snarled at a few guards as the dragon entered the town center and went for the center. In the center was a little girl, not any older than you were, strapped to a pole in the traditional sacrifice manner. Seeing sacrifices to dragons were common and you never accepted them but usually the sacrifices were thieves or criminals that were going to be executed. You decided that this dragon might be worth breaking your usual rule of entering towns to deal with. So you ducked in the nearest clouds and road them down so you were a thousand feet above the town square without being seen. Then you observed, maybe there was a good reason they chose this girl.

“This is it!” the dragon said as he circled the obviously frightened girl. “I said I wanted a meal not some abused little human that is nothing but skin and bones.” He snarled at an old man that was the only other person in the center of the town square.

“Please, have mercy!” the girl begged and cried but the man slapped her in the face and from the look of her not for the first time. She slumped in her binding from the force of the slap as the mayer turned fearfully to the dragon.

“We are working on breeding you more meals. The only others we have are the men or too old. You said you liked the young women so we brought you what we had. There should be a few coming from other villages next month. We will keep them here for you if you will accept her now. She may be small but I’m sure she will be more than satisfying.” He said as he brought his hand to her near naked body. Most dragons that received sacrifices don’t like the taste of clothes so they have them prepared without them. The dragon walked up to them and sloppily licked the girl as if giving a taste test. She was uncontrollably whimpering as she probably crying all the tears she could already.

“You know, for a human, you have excellent taste in women. She does in fact taste to die for.” He almost growled and gave a toothy grin that made the girl turn away in fear and the mayor become uncomfortable.

“Please someone, anyone, help.” She whimpered, not expecting anything to save her as both the mayor and dragon looked at her again.

“And she still has the hope that someone will save her. That always makes them fight longer. I am really starting to get excited.” The dragon said than got close enough to her that his tongue was touching her as he spoke. “No one cares about you little girl. No one is coming for you. Only me and my tummy.” He said in a arrogant voice that you had enough of. You either needed to kill him or save the girl. You didn’t have time in one pass to do both. If you landed in the square you would wreck some of the buildings and maybe hurt some of the innocent humans. So you had to choose; to save the girl or eat the dragon for by the time you had time to do another pass the girl would be dead or the dragon would have left.
132.title: 12 years old.

choices: You wait for her to talk.
1323.content:
Just as the dragon said his last words the girl looked up than gasped at you as you revealed yourself. You size and proximity to the ground made a shadow pass over them. The dragon and mayor noticed this and as you roared loud enough to shake the buildings they saw your form. Your kind was well known by the humans and you were well known to the dragons for your actions. So both of them settled back in defensive positions as you took an angle and swooped down. You had one chance at this. The pole the girl was on was too thick to break without your teeth, claws, or tail if you wanted to not harm the girl on it. Since your claws were going to be out of range and your tail was what you were going to attempt a slice at the dragon with that left you teeth.

You gave another roar as you came closer that effectively froze everyone in terror. When you got directly over the girl you put the hole pole in your mouth and bit, severing the pole at the base and trapping both the pole and the screaming girl in your mouth. With the follow-through you draped your tail down and flattened it and your aim was dead on. As you took back into the air the dragon’s head was rolling on the ground as the mayor fainted. At this point you were glad no one was watching as you didn’t want the rep of attacking villages. You stripped the mayor of what happened other than a Dark hunter took her. You made sure he thought it was a female and not you. As soon as you got to your cave opened your mouth and carefully pulled the pole with the girl out. The girl was unconscious, probably fainted from shock. You looked her over and after a bit you sliced the ropes holding her to the pole which was the only thing keeping her from being completely naked.

“Great, now what do I do?” you asked yourself. You now had a naked 12 year old girl in your claws that looked the definition of an abused child; malnourished, beaten, emotionally scared, and dirty. You figured that humans liked being clean so you blew some flames into a waterfall that sat to the right of your cave so the water was comfortably warm for humans and put her under it. You thought she would wake with the water but she didn’t. In a way you were glad so you could wash her off without her screaming at you. After you finished you carried her into your cave and shut the door. You lit some torches that you had built in the wall while in human form. Unlike you, humans couldn’t see in the dark. Your cave was now flooded with an orange flickering glow and you lit the fire in the center as well to keep the now shivering girl warm. But it was too hot of her so you placed her just far enough were you saw that her body was acting kindly to the warmth and not shivering. You then laid down on the away from her and against the far wall so she could wake up without having a heart attack. You knew that humans didn’t like you for some reason and didn’t like all the screaming and when they tried to attack you. You were actually scared of it. Not what they could do to you physically but you hid from the mental abuse that every attempt brought. So with that done you hesitantly fell asleep to the smell of the fire and a human in your cave. It was a pleasant smell and you slept soundly, for a while.

You woke to a sound of a grumbling stomach. Not yours as you had eaten that human and a dragon in the last week. It was the girls and as your eyes darted open you saw she was awake and must have been formerly scavenging around for a way out but now, with the loud sound of her stomach, she was staring at you. Probably more so now as she saw your glowing red eye dart open and looking at her. Your head was turned so she only saw one eye but it was big and bright enough to notice you were now awake. Eventually after a few minutes her current pose was too much for her to maintain so she straightened and faced you. She was still looking for and exit but now also trying to find a way to remain on this side of your teeth.

“I’m… sorry if I… woke you.” she said and you just laid there. This was the first time a human had talked to you without including the word beast, monster, dragon, or other like words. Your slit eye followed her as she moved and she must have figured there was nowhere to hide from you in here. Her stomach growled again and she held it as if to tell it to be quite. After all it was her stomach that got you to wake up in the first place. But you could tell she was very hungry, if nothing else as evidence to her malnourished body.

You started to get up and she backed against the far wall, thankfully away from the door. You then opened it and walked out, then closed it despite her sudden pleading to keep it open. You had saw her shiver when it opened and didn’t need her dying on you either from the cold or running off and into another predator’s stomach. You went off and retrieved some deer than came back. You opened and closed the door as before and she had taken her place on the back wall as she saw you bring in the three deer that were in your jaws.

You spit them out and heard once again the girl’s stomach growl at the sight of them, even uncooked. You then retrieved a large metal grate of sorts and placed it over the fire. Then with expert precision you began gutting and cleaning the deer, eating all the insides yourself as to not waste any food. When you got done skinning them you cut the meat off and started placing them on the fire and they sizzled in the heat as they cooked. You had learned a while back how to do this in both forms. Dragon form was a little harder as your claws were too big but your tail was more than sharp enough to do this kind of thing. And if that didn’t work you always had magic you could use. You ate the rest of the three deer and let about half of the last one cook for a little bit. Then when it was done you placed them on a shield of the knight and carefully nudged it over to the girl. She flinched at first but her hunger was far out weighing her technical reason and after you put some distance between and laid back down where you had started she dug in. You growled a little as you saw her eat which made her stop. You didn’t know much about normal humans but you had seen a beggar eat like that once and he actually died from it. Something about his stomach not being able to handle the mass quantities of food. She tried to grab another but you growled again and her hand backed off.

“No more?” she asked in a wary tone. You came over again and grabbed the shield with the end of your teeth as she sat where she was frozen. You dumped the meat in a mixture of salt and other magical substances you made to preserve it than threw the shield back in the room with the rest of the armor as well as the grate you used to cook it. You then opened the door again and went out but didn’t close it. You laid down outside until she made her way out and saw you were there waiting for her. “Are you letting me go?” she asked.

You growled in return and then looked over to the stream and waterfall then back at her.

“Right, suppose I can’t have a decent meal without something to drink.” She said and she went to the water and drank from it. “Wow this water is amazing!” she said as she continued to drink but you saw the same problem and growled to correct it and she looked up at you as you approached and got the message as you corralled her back into the cave and close the door behind as you both got inside. You went and lay back down and she watched you for a while but then another noise came from her stomach and she looked at your once again opened eye with fright but relaxed as your stomach gave a similar noise as it digested the deer. You watched her and after she sat at the opposite end of the fire for a while she lay down and went to sleep and you did as well. You weren’t sure what to do next as it seemed to be doing well for now. You thought you might be able to talk to her but that might make her more scared and you didn’t want that. Maybe she would talk first, you hoped so, after all that other dragon could talk.
1323.title: Take a chance and try for both.

choices: "...the only known dragon King friendly to humans."
13232.content:
The next morning you showed her where the meat was and she noticed what the substance did as far as preserving the meat. She ate just enough and then you went out and let her drink. When she wanted to bath you allowed it but watched her closely and skewered a few fresh water predators as they got too close to her. She thanked you as she saw a large wish and a hippo looking thing but when you brought a croc out that was easily twice her size she decided her bath was over and she didn’t need the hint to go back inside to which you closed the door again. This time you went out on a limb and sat closer to the fire. At first she retracted to the wall but she was a smart girl and probably figured that if you wanted to eat her you would and shivering away from the fire wouldn’t change that. So she sat on a chair of sorts that you picked up a while back and would occasionally look at you as you stared back at her.

“So… umm… can you talk?” she asked as she didn’t want to wait in the uncomfortable silence any longer. You raised your head to this and after a thought of how you should answer you slowly nodded at her. “Then why aren’t you? At least tell me why you brought me here. I can’t tell if I should be thanking you or waiting for you to get hungry.”

“I…” You started and watched as her eyes almost immediately shot to your teeth as you started. “I didn’t want to scare you.” you said and shrunk back a little as you tried to look as nonthreatening as possible, which wasn’t really working.

“Well, I don’t want to sound ungrateful but… why did you bring me here?” she repeated.

“I saw you being sacrificed to the dragon. I didn’t want you to die so I took you instead. I usually don’t do that.” You said in a bashful voice or as much of one that your incredibly deep voice would allow. This new revelation that you intended to save her was a pleasant reprieve but then she noticed your words.

“What do you mean you ‘don’t usually do that’?” she asked.

“Sacrifices to dragons are common. But usually they are criminals or at the very least someone old enough so their spot could be taken. I’d never seen a child on as a sacrifice before. Plus I don’t really like going into human towns. They usually try to kill me and stuff.” You explained.

“Then I guess I should thank you for saving me. Thank you Mr. ...?” after a moment she noticed that you weren’t getting what she was trying to ask. “Do you have a name?” you just shook your head and she saw a twinge of sadness in your eyes from her question. “Mine is Sarah but I can’t go around calling you Dragon so… do you mind if I give you a name?”

“You mean you want to give me a name? I would love that!” you exclaimed but perhaps too loud as she winced at the outburst. You wanted to nuzzle her but when you brought your head forward she got visibly more nervous so you just settled in a neutral position.

“Ok, ok. but I only know human names. Is that ok?” she asked.

“I’m sure whatever name you pick will be perfect.” You replied and she smiled involuntarily at your seemingly childish behavior.

“How about I name you after…”
13232.title: You wait for her to talk.

132321.content:
You watched her as she continued. She didn’t know yet but being named after a dragon slayer was ironically accurate. After all you had kill and eaten more dragons that any human was ever done so the term fit rather nicely, even if you were a dragon yourself, well half dragon at least.

“The dragon slayer’s name was Max. He was known because he was able to take down any dragon he came in contact with. He died do to old age, which is unheard of for people in his profession. Do you like it?” she asked as she was unsure of giving a dragon slayer’s name to a dragon but it was the best she could come up with, as her education was far below despite her apparent intelligence.

“It’s perfect.” You said and brought your head down. You hesitated and she flinched but you both, at the same time reached out for the other. She with her hand and you in an attempt to nuzzle. It ended in her petting the front and side of your snout, first with a extreme amount of nervousness but as she saw you liked it she grew more bold and continued until you both drew back. “Sarah? Why were you chosen as a sacrifice?” you asked and you immediately saw that her face expression changed to a sad one. “I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have asked. You don’t have to answer.” You said.

“No, it’s ok. I suppose you should be entitled to your curiosity just as I am. I am sure we both have loads of questions for the other.” she said as she forced a smile then sat on the chair. You hesitantly scooted over and placed your head to her side within arm’s reach of her. She was anxious at first but relaxed when you stopped moving, with the exception of your eye. “That dragon was very specific with his sacrifices. He wanted fit young women and if my village gave him anything else he would disembowel them and leave them there, demanding double payment for the next month. My family… let’s just say they never really cared for me. My father was a drunk, my mother an overpaid and arrogant prostitute, and my brother a sexually abusive military brat. Being that I was the youngest they would each use me in whatever way they wished. Wither that be for beating, selling me to clients, or as a… sexual outlet. This sacrifice was no different. When they found that there was no one other than my mother to sacrifice they eagerly gave me to the task. Now that I think on it you saved me from more than just that dragon.” She said and reached out to pet you on the ridge above your eye. You purred lightly at this which made her freeze at first but she quickly realized the difference between your growl and a purr so she continued.

“Looks like we have more in common than I thought.” You said but you quickly lowered the profile of your speech as you saw her freeze in momentary terror at your teeth when they were visible. She looked at you quizzically at first and especially when you pulled away and leaned so your underside was facing her. You then extended a wing s she could see the ever present scars of where your mother sank her teeth into your hide and wings. She gasped at them as she first thought they were just how you looked. But when she followed the pattern and saw they were jaw and teeth marks she just stared at them for a moment in disbelief. She had never seen such a bad injury that didn’t result in death.

“Who…? What happened?” she asked in a combination of wonder and disbelief. You retracted your wing and sat back to where you were before, but with your head snaked around in front of her so you could more easily talk with her.

“My mother. My kind has strict rules on what is allowed to live as far as newborns are concerned. Any that have even the slightest abnormality are killed and discarded like trash or worse. When I was born she… well she didn’t have a problem with showing me she didn’t want me around.” You said and met her gaze as she looked into your glowing red eyes.

“If you don’t mind me asking, what abnormality did you have for her to do that to you? You look more than capable to me.” She said and you forced a smile, being careful not to show any teeth so not to frighten her.

“Thanks Sarah, however that was the abnormality. I am what is known as a King in my species. The males of my kind are usually vastly weaker and insignificant than females, mainly kept around as breeding slaves and such. But once in many generations a King is born with the genetic knowledge of all the Kings before it. A King is the biggest threat to a Queen’s rule so they are taught to be hated and killed on site.” You explained and she was trying to come up with ways to make you feel better.

“Well they obviously failed, you’re too good for them.” She said in a tone that indicated she was trying to put you on a pedestal.

“Not for lack of trying. If my genetic knowledge didn’t cover an advanced healing ability I would be dead. My mother was the Queen and not by any means incompetent. She truly thought I was dead or she would have sent the whole clan after me if need be. However, word of my existence has gotten out and they do send queen ranked dragons to take me out from time to time. Just means more food for me.” You said, the last part more casual as you tried to bring the mood of the conversation up some.

“Wait, you eat other dragons?” she asked and a hardened expression came over you that had her flinching.

“I hate other dragons. All they do is push their weight around and put humans down whenever they feel like it. I hate all of them, every last one.” You growled at the thought of other dragons but then snapped out of it when your eyes saw Sarah’s fearful reaction to your sudden anger. “Sorry, I didn’t mean to scare you. You don’t need to fear me. I don’t harm humans, well most of the time I don’t.” you clarified but the last part you hung on for a little.

“What do you mean by ‘most of the time’?” she asked and you supposed it was a fair question.

“I mean I don’t go looking for fights or humans to eat. I even flee a fight if I can. But sometimes they catch me in positions or follow me back here. I do everything I can to get them to go away and stop trying to kill me but…” You said and looked over at the pile of armor and weapons. Sarah followed your gaze then looked back at you. “I don’t enjoy it at all but it does happen from time to time. Mostly those knights that are on those ‘Holy Missions’ they do to slay dragons. I just wish I could talk with them, with anyone but most humans either run or attack, never anything in between.” You said and slumped down as your head lay on the ground.

“Well you have me…” she said as she came over and rubbed your snout, trying to make you feel better.

“You mean you’re going to stay? Even if I kill and eat humans?” you asked, perhaps a little less gracefully and you could have phrased it better but she got what you were asking just fine. She was still wary of your teeth as you spoke but didn’t move like before.

“As long as you don’t act like those other dragons and go looking for humans to eat than yes, I’ll stay with you.” she said and from the little she knew of you she knew that strategically placing the dragon trigger in the sentence would help drive the point further in. “Besides, both of our families pretty much suck so we can start a new one with the two of us.” she said and smiled but noticed you still had something on your mind and hoped it wasn’t something to do with what she just said.

“Sarah… before you say that there is one more thing you should know about me. It is the primary reason why Kings are killed by both humans and dragons. One of the default abilities or information is that I am not completely dragon or human I am half and half but stronger than both. I retain all human traits as a dragon and the same in reverse as a human. It is probably why I like humans so much but the feeling is not usually returned.” You explained and you hoped that she would take it well.
132321.title: "...a ledgendary dragon slayer."

1323211.content:
“I have heard of that before. Every human in this realm knows what to do if they meet a human or dragon that can turn to the other. We are supposed to identify as much as possible and tell the royal city so they can destroy the threat. We are told that these half breeds are vicious, death dealing creatures that only wish to destroy and rule both sides, dragon and human alike. They are considered worse than demons.” She said with her hand still resting on you lightly. “Max, you are no demon. You’re my family now, half breed or not. I don’t care if I am considered a traitor. As far as I’m concerned they all betrayed me and are the real demons.” She said and ended with her hugging as much of your snout as she could, which wasn’t much. You didn’t really know how to hug her back so you brought your tail over and lightly pressed it against her back.

“Thanks.” You said which made her moved back and you retracted your tail.

“Can I see you in human form?” she asked with a curious gleam in her eyes.

“Sure, but I gotta warn you. I’m not too good at it yet. I always forget something.” You said back.

“Forget something?” she asked.

“Yeah, like the first time I transformed so that a human wouldn’t run. I couldn’t understand why they did anyway. I wasn’t showing red eyes or wings or anything. It was on my way back when I heard a young man say as he went by to put some clothes on. He didn’t say it very nice but I got the message. Don’t know why you humans use clothes but I use my scales to look like clothes. But I think it still needs work.” You explained and she laughed at you then slightly covered herself for the first time. She was naked after all but this was the first time she noticed her indecency.

“That reminds me, you don’t happen to have any I could wear do you?” she asked a little bashful.

“No, but I know a little magic that can materialize them for you. Just think of what you want. Remember to think practically as we are in the mountains and those human things called… dresses are too drafty for up here. Make sure it is through to. I can only materialize what you think of. I don’t know enough to fill in any blanks.” You said and she nodded sheepishly and she closed her eyes and thought.

“Ok I’m ready.” She said with her eyes still closed. You reached into her mind and saw the outfit she wanted. It was simple enough; sturdy pants that you saw some female hunters wear as well as the typical and over used body covering for female hunters. They were all leather and with a fur coat for windy or cold temperatures. Gloves and wrist braces for top and a type of shoe/boot hybrid and shine guards for the bottom. Along with some small undergarments you saw no use for but materialized anyway. After the light from the spell wore off she opened her eyes and looked at herself. “Wow, thanks for the clothes Max.” she said like a teen age girl that went to a mall for the first time.

“No problem, Still don’t see why humans wear them to begin with.” You said and just left it there. “Ok now for the hard part.” You said and then with a snarl that drove Sarah back a few feet as she saw your muscles flex and your claws start to dig into the solid rock under you. Your teeth were bared against the pain as you continued to growl and snarl. Slowly your body started to shrink and morph into more and more of a human shape until you lay on all fours with spikes that were usually on your head and back left and scaled cloth coverings formed black pants, boots, and a sleeveless shirt. Your hair was just over an inch long but spiked back and of course black like your dragon self. You were completely ripped and not a single ounce of body fat was visible. You stood up after breathing hard and steam rose from your body as your human body cooled its temperature to a human’s level, your red eyes dimming into a dark blood red color that settle and was hardly noticeable. Even if you were only 12 you had he body that could have been made out of solid rock and just lightly tanned as the temperature from the transformation always burned it that color. “Ah… transforming is sure a pain, literally. Specially into a human form like this.”

“Max… you scared me a little. You didn’t tell me it hurt that much. You were snarling really bad and stuff.” She said as she walked toward you. You were actually smaller than she was like this.

“I’m sorry. I was trying to keep it down. It’s just it hurts a lot to transform. My body literally has to rip its self apart to do it. But once I’m changed I can do all kinds of cool stuff.” You said as your tail swayed behind you.

“Max, you missed a spot.” She said as she looked at your tail and you followed her gaze. You hadn’t even noticed until she said it.

“Damn, I always forget something.” You said and simply retracted the tail into your back and stumbled a little to gain balance. “I don’t know how you humans do it without a tail.” You said then after you got your footing you looked at her and saw her confused face. “What?”

“Doesn’t it hurt to do that?” she asked.

“You mean growing and retracting parts, like my tail or wings?” you asked and she nodded, not wanting to get closer until she knew you were done snarling. “Growing individual parts is no problem, it’s the anatomy and size that are a pain. Humans and dragons are just as different on the inside as they are on the outside. That is the stuff that really hurts. Can I ask which you like better?” you asked.

“Better?” she asked, not quite catching what you were saying.

“Dragon or human form. I would prefer the dragon one but I can really stay in either. Since you’ll be sticking around you should have a choice in the matter. Just don’t ask me to change on a dime or whim.” You explained and she agreed than thought about it. Having a dragon as family could be interesting not to mention cool. But the size difference not to mention his full set of teeth made her cringe. In human form it would be easier in that regard but harder on you, if nothing else a conflict with your personal preference. But then again you wouldn’t have asked if you weren’t willing to stay in either. So which one would she pick?
1323211.title: She still wants to stay.

13232111.content:
“I think having a dragon around would be more… cool for lack of a better word.” She said in a smile.

“Ok, Dragon it is. Not gonna lie, I prefer dragon form over human. Well unless I am going into a town. A 500 foot dragon is easy to see.” You said with a laugh than stretched a little for the oncoming task of changing back. “Right, transforming part two.” You said than bent over in pain but caught yourself on all fours. You grunted and gritted your teeth to prevent from yelling or screaming. That was until the dragon parts began to show. You started to hit the ground with your fists until claws appear to which you just sank them into the same grooves you made earlier. Grunting and gritting was replaced with snarling and growling, you actually foamed a little bit at the mouth as you bared your teeth. Your skin started to visually burn off and were replaced with scales. And both your wings and tail formed. When everything was said and done you were frozen with your joints locked until your breathing and the pain subsided. It was then when you saw Sarah bracing against the far wall in sheer terror but was coming back down from it as you were no longer snarling and otherwise scaring the crap out of her. You started to walk over but collapsed onto the floor with a thud. You tried to get up again but your muscles creamed at you and you had no choice but to listen to them as you winced.

“Are you ok Max?” Sarah asked in her position against the wall as she saw you struggling a little.

“Just a little tired. Transforming takes a lot out of me. My body just needs time to recover, that’s all. Don’t think I’ll be moving for a the rest of the day though.” You said with you head on its side as you talked. Your breathing was still a little heavy but it was coming down. You felt a small presence near the V your neck and head had fell into. Sarah was there and after sitting down she leaned against you and placed an arm to rest just above your eye, her hand gently caressing its ridge. You purred at this and she smiled into your large blinking eye.

“You’re so warm. If it is ok with you, can I sleep here tonight?” she asked as she snuggled deeper into the relatively soft underside of your head and neck. The scales there were no less resilient but felt more like snake skin but warm, apparently.

“I’d love it. Goodnight Sarah and thank you for everything.” You said, careful not to move your jaws to much when you spoke do to her proximity to them and your teeth, that she was still wary of.

“Anything for family, Goodnight Max.” she said than fell asleep against you. When you had enough strength you draped your wing over her as you coiled your body as much as possible and followed her into a dreamy state. Finally you had a family and you loved the feeling not to mention her smell. It wasn’t like a predatory delicious smell. Rather like a smell that completely relaxed you and just made you happy. You couldn’t describe it but you fell asleep to the lovely scent.
13232111.title: You as a dragon.

132321111.content:
One year went by in no time. You and Sarah we as close as you could get for a couple of thirteen year old kids. She taught you what she had previously learned in school while you taught her predatory and fighting basics. She could pretty much hold her own in the wild as long as it wasn’t a dragon she was fighting. She wasn’t at Knight level yet but she was definitely getting better. You both got kind of down when humans came to kill you. Sarah was insanely smart so she was able to talk them down a few times but there was a few of them that didn’t back down and you had to deal with them. Sarah didn’t look while you fought them which usually ended with you eating them. Not that you wanted to but if you left corpses then others would be drawn to you or the other dragons would eat them and blame it on you. Either way, eating them was just more logical and you were more than willing to let them go if they decided to not attack you anymore. You even puked one up after he apologized, and that was after he saw his armor melting in your stomach. Normally they were dead before you swallowed by a multiple of causes; teeth, claws, tail, height, fire, ice,… but occasionally you if you thought your stomach would convince them to save themselves you made an attempt to let your fleshy organ negotiate with them.

“Uh, not again.” You said as you plopped a bear you just got done lugging back for your and Sarah’s dinner. Sarah looked to the entrance, which you rarely left closed anymore, and saw a single knight standing there with his sword drawn and shield between you and him. Not that shields did much against you. You typically steered clear of them because they made great serving dishes, but only if they didn’t have holes in them.

“In the name of…” the Knight stated in a speech that you heard dozens of times.

“Yeah, yeah.” Sarah interrupted and the Knight looked at Sarah, who was just sitting in a new chair she made for herself. “You are here to kill Max for some lord or great noble cause that a blood thirsty beast like him would never understand. Does that about cover it?” she asked in a board tone and you just snickered at her complacency and familiarity of their ‘holy missions’ or ‘just causes’.

“What are you doing girl? That is a dragon!” he stated.

“Wow, he sure has a brain on him. You think you can reason with him while I get dinner ready?” you asked and she waved in a ‘yeah, I got this’ motion. You then went over to the bear and began your work as usual and within moments had fresh slabs of meat cooking on the fire, and of course you gobbled up the rest.

“So brave knight, do you have a name?” Sarah asked politely as she got up and addressed him but far enough so that he couldn’t ‘save her’ like others tried to do at times.

“Nick.” He stated still in a defensive position.

“I’m Sarah, it is a pleasure to meet a knight that doesn’t just blindly attack and throw around insults like most do. They don’t tend to last long around here.” She said, the last part in a warning.

“So you are in league with this… dragon?” he asked as if to clarify.

“Well at least he didn’t say monster or beast. That’s a step up.” You said and got Sarah to giggle a little and make the Knight get confused.

“If you are asking if I live here and call him family than yes. If you are accusing us of some kind of act you will have to be more specific. We get a lot of… intruders here and they all accuse him of something, most mind you are false.” she answered.

“Before I even touch the family part, I will state my claims. It is said that there is a dragon that slaughters humans and dragons alike. A dragon that feels nothing even for his own kind. I will grant you that there are many dragons so I may have stumbled into you by mistake. Your apparent relationship is intriguing so I am willing to hear you out.” The Knight stated and you looked at Sarah then gave her a nod to which she sighed and faced Nick again.

“Unfortunately, you do have the right dragon and place. But each of those things you mentioned has an aura of rumor over fact. Max has… good reason why he hates his own kind and to his credit he always does more than enough to try and persuade humans and would be attackers from making him kill them. He eats them after so other dragons don’t flock and attack the nearby villages. And lastly he is strong enough to make normal fights seem so one sided they could be considered a slaughter. So he is technically guilty of al you listed but then again, as a knight, haven’t you killed dragons and humans as well?” she explained and he both flinched and relaxed at certain spots of her claim.

“You make a good point. I have killed many men and a few dragons in my time. But I wouldn’t consider myself a murderer. I can’t kill him on suspicion or false rumor. But then again I can’t just leave until I know for sure.” He stated and lowered his guard but was clearly keeping his senses on high alert.

“Then why don’t you have dinner with us? Max is an exceptional cook and we are having bear tonight.” Sarah suggested and pointed to a chair next to her’s but so she was between you and Nick. He took a bit to consider it than sheathed his sword and placed his shield next to and leaning on his chair. He looked to be observing every move you made and would become unnerved when gazing into your glowing red eyes or if you spoke and your teeth and mouth were open in such close proximity to Sarah. Half the time he looked like he was ready to attack and the other looking for an excuse that he didn’t have to. As you moved around and spike he seemed to realize that you would be much tougher than any dragon he ever faced. But he was teetering on the edge of that choice. You hoped he didn’t attack, you didn’t want to kill him. He seemed different than the usual.
132321111.title: Another day another Knight.

1323211112.content:
“Water?” Sarah asked Nick and he accepted it but it was getting dark and you wondered how long he planned one staying. You rarely closed the door but the night was an exception. You both slept a lot easier if the door was closed so you didn’t have to worry about a croc coming in during the night from the stream and taking a bite at Sarah.

“Uh.. I don’t mean to be rude Nick. But are you planning on staying the night?” you asked.

“Why does it matter?” he asked still a little coldly to you. You didn’t care that much as you just took it that he was being careful.

“Max closes the door at night.” She started and pointed to the large bolder. “He may be a dragon but I am human and this mountain has many predators still around other than dragons; wolves, crocs, bears to name a few. They don’t really bother Max but they would take a bite out of me. We just sleep more soundly if we don’t have to worry about it. Kicker is that Max is the only one that can open or close the door. So if you want to stay or go than now is probably the cutoff point.” She explained.

“I still don’t know if you can be trusted. So I will be staying the night.” He said to you in the same tone.

“Ok.” you said and got up and headed for the door. You slowly pushed it closed then lit a few more torches in the walls so Nick could see. You and Sarah new this place by heart but Nick needed a little more light to see around properly. You then cleaned off the grate and put the meat into the salt substance before putting the grate with the other armor that Nick was purposefully turning his back to. Even though he knew why they were there and that you didn’t murder them he still had the thought lingering that they all passed through your jaws and that made him more anxious than anything. You than lay down and coil around yourself. Sarah got upand after cleaning herslf off went over and took her usual spot by your head and neck.

“What are you doing?” Mick asked in a concerned voice and she looked up as you blinked an eye open to look at him as well. She rubbed your eye ridge and you purred to which she smiled.

“I am going to bed. It can get cold at night and there are few things that are warmer than Max.” she explained.

“That can’t be safe. What if he rolls or yawns in his sleep?” he asked.

“Then I fall into his mouth. Wouldn’t be the first time it happened but I’m still here. I trust him and he trusts me. We are close enough that even if he does eat me in the night by accident his body stops itself. You might want to keep your distance though.” She said and just smiled before settling down again.

“And why is that?” he asked, not believing what her just heard.

“I’ll be serious with you for a moment Nick.” You said from the other side of your mouth so Sarah didn’t have to move. “You may not trust me but I definitely don’t trust you. If at any time I believe you are a danger to Sarah I will not hesitate to remove that danger. I trust you understand that it wouldn’t be pleasant if it came down to it.” You said with a growl and a deadlock glare to him.

“That’s enough you two!” Sarah said and you stopped your growling and both of you stopped your glaring. “Now I’m going to bed, so goodnight to both of you.” You both took your turns returning the gesture then Nick headed for the wall and leaned against it and his sword and you spread your wing over Sarah and your head after you were mildly content on Nick’s position. It took you longer than usual but you finally went to sleep but kept and ear out for either of their heartbeats. If they so much as increased by a single beat for any reason you would know about it. And with that you attempted to get some rest.
1323211112.title: He listens.

choices: She wants to take the long way.
13232111121.content:
“Knock, Knock, time to get up sleepy head.” Sarah said playfully as she lightly knocked on your eyelid. She didn’t do it hard or anything but it was the most sensitive place you had for her to get your attention if she had to get up for any reason. You quickly checked on Nick to be sure he wasn’t standing with a sword out to kill her or something. When you heard his heartbeat in the same chair you felt satisfied and retracted your wing for her to get up.

“Good morning Sarah and good morning Nick.” You said sleepily after Sarah got up as did you. You stretched and yawned when Sarah was far enough away for you to do so. Then went to open the door and check for danger. As you opened it you were the first outside and you looked around for a while. There were times when a dragon or such would follow a knight’s scent and be waiting for you to open the door but you let one dragon go as a request from Sarah once and since then you didn’t have that problem. You went over to the stream then Nick and Sarah came out into the morning air. Their heads snapped to you as a hiss and a growl filled the otherwise quite morning air. They saw a rather large croc on the stream’s shore and you growled at it, causing the croc to retreat down river. After taking a drink and checking the bed of the stream for threats you walked away from it. “I’m going to get my breakfast, is the bear meat good or do you want something fresh?” you asked more to Sarah but Nick was standing near her so the question was open.

“Ooo, rabbit sounds really good right now if you can find any.” Sarah asked and you smiled and headed off to hunt. As you did you started thinking about your and Sarah’s situation with Nick here. He obviously had more up to date information and he could teach Sarah how to defend herself more than you could. He looked highly trained so it was possible he would be a better teacher. But he must also have a life that would prevent him from staying. You would have to ask him when you got back. After catching a few wolves and a half dozen rabbits you carried them all back and when you got back you saw Nick talking with Sarah but was more silent when you came in. You deposited the wolves and rabbits in separate areas so you could eat and they could fix them how they like. And after Nick got the cue from Sarah that this meal was for them to work on he took half the rabbits and helped Sarah prepare them. It was well into eating your meals and you finished when conversation sparked up again.

“So where do you come from?” you asked Nick to which he snapped his head to you.

“Why so you can go there and attack the village?” he sent back and you broke eye contact, this was going to be harder than you thought.

“Nick, that was low. Max has only gone into a human village once and that was to save me.” She said when she saw the effect it had on you. She knew you didn’t like the stereotype you were given as a dragon and really didn’t like when people used it despite any good deeds you did.

“Then why does he want to know where I live?” he argued.

“I don’t know you would have to ask him.” She said and she turned to you and gave you a look to answer the question.

“Because I was… I was wondering if it was possible for you to come back here after you left or if you needed a ride back. I usually don’t go beyond the Cape village, where Sarah is from but I could fly you part way.” You offered.

“Why do you want me to come back? So you can e…” he started but then got and elbow from Sarah before he could finish.

“I was just thinking. Sarah doesn’t get to hang around many humans or have any to learn from. I don’t want her to leave but… if you were able to teach her stuff or take her into town to shop. It might make her happy to see other humans other than when they are trying to kill us.” You clarified while Sarah and Nick’s eyes went wide.

“You want me to leave?” she asked with a slightly hurt voice.

“What! No! That’s not what I meant. I just… I see the way you look at villages and other humans when we fly around. I know you want to interact with them. But I can’t take you to those places if you want to do it normally. You’re my family, I don’t want you to leave for good. But if going into town every once in a while makes you happy, than it would be… useful if Nick would be able to take you around.” You explained and she looked down as if she said something hurtful, which she did. She should’ve known that you didn’t want her to leave like she said, and to say it like that was a little hurtful. She then looked up after clearing her mind of it and smiled at you lovingly which made it all better when she said stuff like that.

“You’re right Max, I do need to get out more. Maybe some shopping and mingling with others will do some good. I certainly sounds fun.” She said and gave the part of your snout she could reach while in her seat a rub. “Sir Nick, do you live far from here? I can’t really go back into Cape, not that I want to.” She asked and she must have told him her past because he looked to completely understand.

“Not far at all Miss Sarah. It is only 30 or so miles to the east of Cape. It is known as Crobalt and it has a fine assortment of activities and things that may interest you, as well as very high defenses.” He said, the last part directed to you. But to his credit it contained the smallest sliver of concern in the tone that you barely picked out.

“I can drop you two off anywhere you feel it safe.” You confirmed but his eyes were still stern. “And I can wait high in the air and out of site until you call.” You said and he just barely nodded as he was still highly concerned about his home.

“We don’t really need to fly there. The journey would take only 5 days.” Nick said as another option, probably to avoid relying on you at all.

“Nonsense, Max can span 30 miles in a very short amount of time. But I suppose a long journey would be more… normal.” She said as she seemed to be torn between the two. She loved flying with you and it did make sense as far as time was concerned. But then again you knew she had been thinking about having a normal life as a human for a while. You both loved each other like family but she did have… needs that you could never please. Even if those needs were a simple interaction or tea party. Things that little girls should be able to do.

“We’ll leave it up to you Miss.” Nick said and you nodded in pretty much the only agreement since you two met.
13232111121.title: Leaving in the morning.

choices: They come back to bring you into the city.
132321111211.content:
You flew high above the landscape with both Sarah and Nick at the base of your neck and beginning of your back. You used you protruding bones to make a sort of saddle for them to use as well as safety belts of sorts so they didn’t fall off and they could keep their hands free. That part was necessary for Nick because he refused to have you hold his shield and sword in your storage gut with Sarah’s belongings. He put on a brave face but you could tell he was thoroughly enjoying the feeling of flying and the look of things from the air. Sarah always loved it, especially if you picked up you speed, but for the sake of Nick’s breakfast she settled with the default.

“There it is. Crobalt.” Nick said as you circled the second town you had found in this direction. It was more like a city than a small town and you saw what he meant by VERY well protected. You guessed you would not like trying to force your way into that place. “There should be a large field to the north of the city. You can set us down near the tree line.” he said and you located the spot then carefully used the clouds to cover your decent. You landed gently without any humans seeing you, even if some farm animals in the field were running like mad away from you.

“I’ll head up to the sky until you call me down.” You informed after you brought up Sarah’s stuff from your storage gut. It was a little slimy but fine after she wiped her sword and coat off.

“That won’t do.” Nick said, Sarah and you looking at him confused. “They will eventually notice a dragon circling the village no matter how high you go. I own this field so just lay down among that tall grass and out of site. That way we will know exactly where you are when we come back or need you.” he said and you looked to where he was pointing and noticed the grass there was tall enough to hide you rather well and nodded in agreement than turned back to Sarah. Then materialize and sack then carefully picked it up with the front teeth and gave it to her.

“Make sure you have fun ok?” you said and when she opened it she quickly closed it again than with a smile lunged at you and gave your neck a hug.

“I will, thanks for this Max.” she said into your neck than backed off and after a wave she started walking with Nick toward the city. You could hear him ask what was in the bag and she showed him the large bag of gold coins you gave her.
