You didn’t need such things but you knew humans went wild over the stuff so you weren’t surprised when he shot a glance to the spot where you were now hidden thoroughly surprised that you could do things like that. You then laid you head down and as you had nothing better to do took a nap as the warm sun beat down on you and energy filled you as its warm rays penetrated your scales pleasantly.
132321111211.title: You fly them there.

1323211112112.content:
Sleep was good to you and you got a lot of rest as your body felt relaxed and energized due to the sunbathing. However as darkness fell you just rested in you spot until you heard footsteps coming and of course other stuff a predator is keen on; heartbeats, scents, brushing bodies against the terrain, metal sounds to name a few. You left your eyes closed as you knew from Sarah that they could easily give you away in the dark if you weren’t careful. You smelled Sarah and Nick but there were a lot more with them. If you had to guess you would say soldiers and other knights. You heard chainmail and the clanking of different weapons. Horses and their noises as they began to sense you were nearby but to weighed down and directed to do more than follow their orders. It was well over 50 humans fully armed coming your way with your sister. The only thing that kept you from suddenly grabbing Sarah and bolting was that she was completely calm. You could hear her heart beating as if she was just taking a stroll. This was just getting weird and you wondered what they were up to, but you would find out soon enough as the light from their torches grazed the long grass where you were waiting.

“Damn, Dark Hunter indeed. If we were going to try to fight him now we would be in big trouble.” Said Nick as their eyes searched for you. Dark Hunters were definitely rare and approaching one in the darkness was an idiot’s errand. They could sneak up right behind you and in some cases people have walked straight into their claws, tail, or mouth without even knowing it until it was too late.

“Max, it’s ok. They just came to bring you to the castle. Lord Hizer has offered to put us up for the night or maybe more.” She said as she searched for you as well.

“Why so many humans?” your deep voice came as you addressed them but they still could find you.

“They need to escort you and make sure no one panics as you walk down the streets. They are just here to provide any who see you with misguided comfort of mind.” Nick explained.

“I guess if they don’t attack or anything it will be ok. Do you trust this Sarah? You think it is a good idea?” you asked as you did sometimes when you were unsure of human behavior. She was infinitely better at reading humans than you were, minus reading their minds.

“I do, I spent a very pleasant half the day with Lord Hizer and he seemed ok to me.” She said and at this you opened your eyes and the company suddenly noticed the glowing red orbs mere feet from them. You got up and shook the extra grass, dirt, and other things that fell on you during the course of the day. You gave a yawn and shook your head a little which made most if not all the other humans quiver. They could barely see you the way it was and their torches reflecting off your teeth weren’t helping.

“You have fun today?” you asked as you brought your head down near Sarah.

“Oh yes! Load of fun. I got to shop and talk with the other girls. I even ate this new pastry thing they were making. I also won a sword dueling contest, they only used wooden swords but it was fun none the less. Well for me it was, the boys I beat weren’t very happy.” She said as she smiled, very pleased with herself then jumped on your head and snout to get closer to both eye then hugged the top of it. “But I missed you. All day I kept asking you questions before I remembered you weren’t there.” She said and just lay in her hugging position. You raised you head a little, perhaps more than Nick was comfortable so you could lay properly in the open.

“So, what’s this human Lord want? I mean not a lot of humans like dragons around, present company excluded of course.” You asked and she didn’t even bother sitting up as she must have been tired out from the day’s events. Made sense, you two were usually in bed by this time.

“Something about better you being on the inside than the outside. He kind of lost me with the technical stuff. But I thought you would like it if you were near more people. They may be afraid of you for a little while but at least they aren’t attacking you right?” she asked as she wasn’t sure if she had done the right thing by volunteering you like that.

“Plus you finally get to sleep in a bed again right?” you asked.

“Beds are overrated. You’re more comfy.” She said sleepily as she was trailing off to sleep as your warm body soothed her to sleep. You used a careful claw to pick her up and place her in her usual spot at the base of the neck. And after she was secure and at this point sleeping against your neck you turned to Nick.

“Well, I guess we’re spending the night.” You said and it was all the agreement he needed to just motion you forward and the soldiers nervously surrounded you in a large escort formation. You stepped as light as you could to prevent Sarah from waking as you followed Nick.

You were a little intimidated by the large walls and gate that were many times bigger than you were as well as the weapons on the walls pointing at you as you approached. You followed Nick through a deserted street and to the castle. You occasionally saw a face in a window that quickly ducked in as you passed or a human in one of the areas between the buildings. You smelled so many smells that you thought you were going to be sick, everything from grass to rotting blood. It got better as you reached the castle and when you passed its walls the smells were more distant and stronger more pleasant smells were present. You were brought into the inside and into a huge room that was far bigger than your cave. You smelled lingering scents of hundreds of humans and you looked around to grasp where you were as the door closed and locked behind you.

“This is where my lord will meet you in the morning. Since we are unsure where to place you and I doubt you will allow us to bring Sarah to a separate room, you can sleep here tonight.” Nick said as he gestured to a spot at the back of the room but more than enough room for you to curl up or stretch out comfortably.

“Thank you N… I mean Sir. Nick.” You said as you caught the gesture from some of the others who had addressed him. He bowed politely as you saw the others do for him and left you alone with Sarah in the large, now dark room. You curled up and carefully placed Sarah in her usual sleeping position to which she subconsciously snuggled into you. Taking in her scent you covered her with you wing and went to sleep.
1323211112112.title: They come back to bring you into the city.

13232111121122.content:
You immediately woke up when you heard doors around the room open. You didn’t move or open your eyes but you kept you senses open. You smelled fire then light fell on your eyelids. The sense of fire was dispersed to a few places and you reasoned it was torches like back home. Then you heard multiple footsteps around. At first they were light and shaky and you didn’t hear the clanking of metal like a knight or guard would have so as soon as you heard them shy away you opened your eyes. Some saw this and were quivering as they did tasks from cleaning to arranging. A few looked brave enough and they took the chance and clean closer to you and were glad that you weren’t moving at the moment, and probably that you weren’t eating them either. Your observation was interrupted by a loud thud at the door as a man in full armor but his weapon not drawn came in with more than a dozen guards. The man stopped a decent distance away and looked at your eyes as you looked back. He ushered for a guard to do something and you watched as he got closer. You didn’t mind until he started trying to lift you wing where Sarah was. You growled a little and he jumped back as if expecting you to attack.

“Max… No growling this early in the morning.” Sarah wined groggily and you immediately stopped then retracted your wing so she could get up. She leaned on your snout as she stretched and got up. She looked around and was confused for a moment to where she was. after she took a few steps away you joined her in stretching and yawning. The other humans didn’t like it but what else was new, only Sarah was comfortable around you at this point and that was good enough for you.

“Good morning Sarah, did you sleep well?” you asked and she nodded then looked at the heavily armored man and the guards as if she couldn’t figure out why they were here. “That human lord you spoke of let us stay in the castle. You were asleep when we got here. Sorry about the growl.” You said and she noticed it was probably towards the armed men that were facing you.

“Captain Beltree, what the hell are you doing!?” came a serious voice as Nick came from the still open door. He looked enraged at the apparent Captain and his guards aiming their weapons at you and probably more specifically Sarah.

“We were only trying to bring the girl to a safe room for the morning when this beast growled at us.” the large Captain accused. You ducked your head a little at his remark and Sarah came over and gave your draped head a little attention.

“You’re lucky all you got was a growl. Taking anything away from a dragon is not advise, much more someone he is protecting. And you dare raise your weapons at honored guests of our lord Hizer?” Nick rebuked and the Captain suddenly seemed to get a fear in his eyes and immediately sheathed his weapon as well as dismissed his men. You were pretty sure Nick was mad because Sarah was involved but either way you appreciated his support.

“Sir Nick! Good morning! Thanks for letting us sleep here for the night.” Sarah said with a smile and he bowed politely to her in return.

“You’re welcome child.” Said a voice from a smaller door as an old looking man came out, well dressed for a human, and came near the Captain and Nick to which they both knelt in a bow Sarah also looked at them and took a similar pose. You couldn’t exactly do as they were so you just tilted your head down and then back up in a bow attempt with your neck and head. Then they all got up with a gesture from the man. “It is wonderful to see you again Sarah and of course Max is it?” he asked politely and you nodded to answer. “It is an honor to have a distinguished dragon like yourself as a guest. I am Lord Hizer, I assume you met Sir Nick and the Captain of the guard Sir Beltree.”

“Yes Mr… Ah Sir… Umm…” you stumbled as if not really sure how to address him personally and looked at Sarah and she leaned over to you to whisper advice. “Lord Hizer… they treated me with a very warm welcome.”

“Ah, you are too kind. I know they can be a little harsh, however they have never met a dragon they didn’t have to kill for the safety of the city before. They mean well and are surprisingly selfless in that regard.” He returned.

“If you don’t mind me saying… Lord Hizer. You seem to be handling my presence in a way I’m not used to. Well other than Sarah your Captain and Sir Nick are as good as it gets. I am curious to why that is.” You asked in a serious gaze. You couldn’t tell what it was but you didn’t like the way this Lord smelled. But you couldn’t put a finger on it. Whatever it was he was about to answer so you listened carefully.
13232111121122.title: Captain of the guard first.

choices: Sarah want you to try getting along with Kara.
Lord Hizer asks you two to leave, but Kara follows.
132321111211221.content:
“I think I’ll show you instead.” He said and you sat up properly as he motioned for a large door to open on the opposite side of the room he entered. It almost looked like a hidden door because you didn’t even notice it until this point. Sarah was off to the side near you and Nick and you caught a heightened sense come from both Nick and the Guard Captain. This sense wasn’t like they had for you but similar. More of a threat respect but not fear. You then got a whiff of an unmistakable scent that made you lightly growl, just enough for Sarah to recognized it as it was lower than the rumble coming from the doors were opening. You stood up at the scent your muscles began to flex a little as it opened. Your head came instinctually down like a dog or wolf does when pointing, low enough for Sarah to reach but not on the ground either. You didn’t want to alarm anyone or act until you were sure but the scent was very strong, the scent of a dragon.

“Kara can you come out and meet our new guest?” the old man asked sweetly like a grandfather would to his granddaughter.

And as if in slow motion a small horse dragon that was little bigger than 30 feet long came out, a baby or what a dragon equivalent was. The dragon was slight blue and almost birdlike with her wings carrying feathers in some places but only on her wings. Her face was innocent looking with blue eyes that matched her scales and wings. The rest of her was delicate and actually quite beautiful if you had to place a word on it. But that was for the others, you went into a full on snarl and continuous growl as spikes came out of your spine which was your equivalent of a wolves hair standing on end. With your teeth bared your claws began to dig into the floor in preparation to leap forward and to tear her apart. Upon seeing this everyone was driven back in sheer terror including the young female dragon, but her door was closed so she was in a corner as she curled up whimpering.

“Max no!” you heard through the blood rage that was coursing through your veins at seeing another dragon. The only voice that could reach you like this was Sarah but you were still snarling and a single flame from that dragon could have set you off. That was until you felt a pressure on your snout and a scent that gently started to calm you. “It’s ok Max, please don’t. You’re scaring everyone, you don’t want that do you? I told you that you don’t look nice when you’re like this. You need to calm down.” She said slow and lovingly and your muscles started to relax and she soothed you until you were laying down and other than a slight and random growl you were finally laying on the floor with her stroking your large snout. The same snout that no one would have gone near for all the money in the world as you were just seconds earlier. People die when dragons get that mad, period. The feat that she was able to calm you not to mention that you were a Dark Hunter amazed the rest of the room.

“Why does he hate me?” came a voice from a whimpering dragon that was curled up in the corner. She was crying but and it got everyone to look at her with pity except you.

“Oh, I’m sure he doesn’t hate you my dear.” Said Lord Hizer. “But I would like to know what that was all about.” He said as he looked from Kara to the two of you.

“Actually he does.” Sarah said as she saw your full attention was still on the dragon in the room, crying or not you still let out random light growls that she had to soothe to stop. “Max… he… well in short he hates all other dragons. It isn’t that he hates her in particular but she is a dragon and… well he usually rips them apart when he sees them.” She explained and they could see that Sarah was pretty much the only thing keeping you from doing so.

“Why does he hate his own kind so much?” Hizer asked and Kara looked over but like a child trying to hide her gaze. “That is not just a normal hatred that can be quelled in a short time. That is deep, I can see that he still just want to… Why is he like that?” he repeated.

“Max can you show them the… you know.” She asked and it snapped you back to her and her request. It was a good thing she knew the whole story because you didn’t like to revisit it. You gave the little dragon a final snarl before turning ad rolling onto your side and opening your wing to display the horrible scars that covered your body. You stayed that way for a bit until you heard a scratch of the other dragon’s foot move. To that you spun around and snarled at her again as she was trying to get closer or at least in a more comfortable position. She froze but there was Sarah’s hand on your snout again an you lay your head on the ground and she continued to sooth you.

“My word, what horrible wounds. What happened to him?” Nick asked in disbelief. He had inflicted far less sever wounds on many dragons and they all met their end. For you to still be alive not to mention at your current development was baffling.

“His mother happened. The day he was born his mother hated him and, to her mind, killed him. For years after what must have been a miracle he was targeted by both humans but more specifically dragons after they learned that they failed. So when he was strong enough he fought back and now that he is… well more than they can dream of being he sees his mother trying to kill him and the thousands he has seen die at the claws of other dragons. I myself was almost eaten by a dragon when he saved me. So that just adds to it. I don’t think he had met a dragon that he hasn’t eventually killed or eaten.” She explained and as they soaked in the information it started to make sense and the little blue dragon stared at you in a strange longing that replaced her fear and sadness. They didn’t really like the eating other dragons part and Sarah didn’t even bother with you only being half dragon and had eaten humans. One surprise at a time you supposed. However you just couldn’t shake this feeling when Kara’s gazed at you. Her gaze seemed familiar and not a bad light but like you were looking at you before Sarah showed up. At the very least it took the edge off the rope of your emotions and you suddenly stopped growling all together but continued to glare at her as if the slightest false move on her part would warrant her death.
132321111211221.title: He already has a dragon.

choices: "So, you want to learn to fly or not?"
1323211112112211.content:
“Max?” Sarah inquired and your eye closest to here came to rest on her. “I would like to go and make sure that Kara is ok. But I don’t want you to be mad or angry.” She said and you brought your full attention to her. You definitely didn’t like that idea. “Max, I want you to try and get along with her. If nothing else just don’t… you know. Please, for me.” She asked, almost begging.

“No need to beg Sarah. What makes you happy makes me happy.” You answered and looked back over at Kara and let out one last growl. “Doesn’t mean I’m going to like it though.” You finished then as Sarah started over to Kara you reluctantly and slowly followed her and reached out with your mind to the young dragon. “I want to make one thing clear to you little dragon. If you harm Sarah, ever, I will make you suffer before I gut you and use your for an ornament. Clear?” and she nodded furiously.

“None of that Max.” Sarah instructed as she gave you side a slap that you made a mock sense of pain. She knew pretty much everything about you, including your mind reading and was well aware that you could have complete conversations in the confines of you mind. But she was quickly rubbing the spot she slapped as she was never able to stay mad at you for long. Sarah gave Lord Hizer a nod as she knew that he was hoping the dragons would get along and this was the best shot currently at making that happen. You flexed your wings a little as you saw Hizer move to Kara to comfort her as well as calm her as you and Sarah approached.

“He’s not going to kill me is he?” Kara said as she put her head on the ground and tried to look as small as she could so you didn’t even expect any aggression from her. As you reached her you brought your snout down and smelled her more closely then brought it back to full height. Then at Sarah’s silent request you reluctantly curled up in front of her with your head facing her. You could still snap her head off at this distance if you wanted but you just lay there as Sarah gave your head a pet before walking over to Kara, your eye glued to her and her safety.

“No he isn’t. He needs to learn that not all other dragons are bad. Can you help me with that?” Sarah asked as she instinctually stroked the wincing dragon’s eye ridge and she purred like you would. It was a definite surprise for Lord Hizer for it was evident that he had not been able to cause her to do that. She lifted her head a little and nodded, making sure it was low profile enough for you to deal with “I’m sorry that he scarred you Kara.”

“He really hates us that much?” she asked.

“Dragons? Yes he does. I’ve only got him to release one other dragon before. To be honest, even if you two become friends and such he will probably still feel that way with others. You don't have to tell me but why are you here. You seem a little young to be on your own.” Sarah asked in a tone as she sat by her and continued to pet her neck as she raised her head to talk.

“I am kind of like… him.” She started and this perked you up a little. “I understand there are many reasons for each type of dragon to abandon their young and mine were no different. They just didn’t try to kill me at that point. I was born last among my siblings and as tradition would dictate. The last dragon born in a litter has to be sent away as part of a superstition of back luck or something.” She stopped as she held back some tears but Sarah’s comfort as well as Hizer’s attempts at the same did her good in controlling them. “So when I hatched I didn’t find myself in a nice cozy nest with siblings I found myself on the edge of a cliff and almost fell off as I got my bearings. I learned quickly that crying about it wasn’t smart because after a few minutes of me crying for my mother a mountain lion took a swipe at me. I was too little to fight back so I leapt off the cliff. I didn’t know how to fly but I found gliding to be pretty easy and despite the bitter cold of the outside around me I kept up my attempt to get away from the mountain lion. The thing was far gone but I thought that if I could fly he might be able to as well. I landed in a couch next to a sweet old man and he took care of me after that. That about sums it up.” She said and with a smile nuzzled the old man gently which gave his old face a smile, again like a grandfather would give to his grandkids. After a little while Sarah got up and came back over to you and sat against you so you could talk.

“Her story sounds familiar doesn’t it?” she asked in a sad tone that matched yours at hearing her story.

“Unbearably so. What is it with my kind and dumping their kids?” you said softly with a bit of anger mixed in with the sadness.

“Listen Max, would you mind helping her out?” she asked and you looked at her in surprise but she didn’t see it as she was still looking at the interaction between Hizer and Kara. It was similar to yours with Sarah. “Don’t worry, I’m not asking you to go out with her or anything. It’s just she doesn’t have another dragon to teach her the basics or even any extra passed down knowledge like you have. She even admitted she can’t fly. She needs you Max. That man won’t be around forever and when she finally is alone she will need someone.” She said and you sighed as if about to go do a lot of work.

“Why can’t I ever just say no to you?” you asked a little playfully and she gave you a playful pat and got up then approached the other two to which they looked at her and you as well. It looked like she was going to say something but she just stood off to the side and nodded to Kara for you to say something. At this point you had your head raised enough to be above hers but not enough o strain necks to look you in the face. What are you going to say to her?
1323211112112211.title: Sarah want you to try getting along with Kara.

choices: She practices the rest of the day and more the next.
You take her along to "deal with another dragon".
13232111121122111.content:
The question caused the whimpering and scared dragon under you to freeze in a collision of emotions. She didn’t know what emotion to act on but finally joy won out and she, without thinking lunged forward and nuzzled your lowered neck and her body against yours in a dragon’s version of a hug. You raised a claw out of instinct but held it as the Lord gasped, seeing what you almost did. You then just placed it back down and sighed in a sort of defeat. This was the first time a dragon had gotten this close to you without you killing it or getting very close to doing so. Nick immediately took you too out to the guard’s training field so that she didn’t wreck buildings with her landings or yours for that matter.

“Now take it easy Max. She needs to learn not get herself killed.” Sarah said up to you and you just nodded than looked at the smaller dragon beside you. As everyone got clear so you could start you quickly grabbed Kara and took off into the air. The site made some almost panic and Kara started to cry again. You didn’t address it until you felt you were high enough so she could learn and if she didn’t you had enough time to catch her. You gave a few extra thousand feet of a buffer beyond that point then started to sore with the crying little dragon still in your claws.

“Would you stop that!” you said in an irritated tone. “If I wanted to eat or kill you all the crying in the world wouldn’t stop me from doing it.” You reasoned and she sniffled and stopped until she was proper enough to address you or at least here instruction without distraction. “You wouldn’t have been able to take off anyway. Taking off and landing safe enough for humans is going to be the hardest part. You need to learn to fly in general before you can take off, otherwise what’s the point?” you asked.

“I’m sorry.” She said and looked up at you then down as you soared. You could tell she like the feeling and was amazed at the site.

“I’m going to drop you now.” You warned and before she could argue you did it anyway. She flailed around in the air pathetically until she used her gliding she already knew to catch the wind and rise a little and at the very least wasn’t falling as fast. You came near her as she circled. “Now go higher.” You instructed and she tried batting her wings and she made some progress before losing control and catching her fall in a glide again. “You’re not a bird so stop flapping around like one! You’re a dragon so fly like one.” You said as you flapped your wings in a more solid and complete sense and climbed a little then circled to see her try. It took her multiple tries but after expending multiple tries she got her wings to work right, probably out of blind luck, and she ascended to your level. She took a moment to level off but now she was soaring rather than gliding, pumping her wings like you did to keep the height at times.

“I’m sorry.” She said again.

“Don’t be sorry. You can be sorry on the ground when you or those you’re carrying aren’t in danger of you crashing. Keep your mind on flying. If you lose control I’m not going to catch you so you will just plummet to your death. Keep that in mind.” You said and she stared at you for a moment but almost lost control then nodded in understanding. “Good, lesson one complete. You can now fly up and maintain your level. I am sure you can figure out getting down as gravity is the best teacher on that. Let’s try something more… fun.” You said and she looked at you than with a large build up you pumped your wings and shot passed her into the sky with dizzying speed but not a speed that she couldn’t match. You saw you look at you and surprisingly quick she observed your movements and started to accelerate and in a short time she was chasing after you.

“Isn’t this too fast?” she asked as she was just keeping up with you.

“Not if you have another dragon on your tail wanting to eat or kill you.” you said than with another aerial maneuver you appeared behind her and snapped your jaws behind her tail. Her fear came back and she began flying away from you and making sharp turns to avoid your jaws as you made swipes for her at different angles. She was learning quickly, granted if you really wanted to catch her she would be but she was flying better every second as she dove and ascended, twisted and even fired a few fire balls at you mid slight. But one false move and she began panting as she was rather tired. She slowed for a few seconds and you caught most of her body from her front legs to the top of her gut in your jaws, careful not to actually injure her. However injured or not she was freaking out as your jaws were now around her. You left her there for a moment than grabbed her with your claws and held her steady as you release her from your mouth.

“What was…” she started but you growled and she stayed quite.

“Did you think just because you are tired your enemy was tired to? Would you risk whomever you have with you on that fact?” you asked and even though she was facing you instead of down she lowered her head. You dropped her again and she quickly caught herself. “If this was a real fight and I was trying to eat you along with whomever you let fly with you. You would have been solely responsible for their and your death. You’re never safe up here and neither is your rider. If they fall you catch them, if you fall you make sure they don’t die, if you are attacked you keep going to protect them until you have no life left. If you fail in this your enemy will win and you will die, period.” You said and she thought on it.

“I understand, thank you… Max” she said in a pure gesture of her phrase.

“You’re welcome.” You said with a momentary lax of emotion. “Now, for the hard part, landing.” You said and you dove to the ground and Kara followed you to her next lesson in flying. She was tired beyond belief but she wasn’t going to show it. You smiled at yourself as you glanced back at her than you continued your lesson.
13232111121122111.title: "So, you want to learn to fly or not?"

132321111211221112.content:
The lessons went like the first one. Despite most everyone’s disagreement with your methods she was making significant progress in the areas you were teaching her. In particular she was an expert flyer. She had even evaded you at times when you were actually trying to catch you, not for long but not too many could out do a Dark Hunter in anything so that she able to come close was impressive. She didn’t have the same luck in other aspects though. While you worked on them with her; her flame was weak and inaccurate, her fighting on the ground was pathetic unless the other was on their back, and she had virtually no hunting skill what so ever. After about a week you insisted that she receive no food unless she could catch it. This was another topic but Kara accepted and if worse came to worse she would use a dive bomb snatch and grab to attain her prey. She was also used to humanly prepared food so she was exceedingly wasteful until she started getting bigger and needed all the meat she could get. With the no feeding rule in play she had to make the most out of her meals but she still didn’t eat the insides at all, to her they were “Gross”, even more so when you lapped them up so the evidence of her meal was no more.

One particular day Lord Hizer had received a notice that a rouge dragon was making trouble near the end of his lands. You volunteered to “deal with it” which was understood what that meant if they sent you after it. Lord Hizer agreed but only if you took Kara with you as the dragon was smaller than she was (now 60 feet long) and she needed to learn to defend from a real threat. You and Kara soared high above in the sun so others wouldn’t see you two and you both soon saw a small dragon attacking some humans but hadn’t managed to get any yet. The dragon would roar like a vulture then swoop down and scare all he could. You could see the burning homes and dead livestock that were spread around from this dragon’s fun and you started to snarl a little, not wanting to give away your position.

“Can I do it?” Kara asked as she saw the look of bloodlust in your eyes. She obviously wanted to prevent yet another dragon from you and you looked at her than back at the dragon on the ground. You figured the dragon was small enough so you didn’t see the harm if she wanted to.

“Very well. But you need to make sure he knows to never come around here again. If that means killing him than you need to do it. If that dragon thinks he can just attack later, than more will die because of your sympathy. Make no mistake though. No matter what you promise him, if I see him again I will gut him.” You instructed and she nodded in understanding than dove down to the soaring dragon below.

The other dragon barely had time to think before a shadow hit his eyes and she slammed into him, forcing him to the ground on his back with her snarling at his well restrained and almost broken body. You had to admire the combination of restraint and power as any harder would have caused his wings to break but any weaker and he would have evaded it. You watched the conflict as she spoke with the other dragon and after a while she got off him and did something foolish, she turned her back to him to fly away. You could see that whatever they had agreed on he had no intention of upholding. And with a quick few attacks they had switched places and he was on top and under his mercy. Then you finally heard what you were waiting for as she called your name and you dove down to her.

“Max? what is that your boyfriend?” the other dragon asked with a laugh. While you two had gotten close neither of you had even thought about that before. It was easy to forget with you constantly threatening to kill her every day.

“Hardly you smelly lizard. He’s my teacher. He told me that I should kill you, I should have listened.” She said.

“Yeah you should have.” He said as he licked up her neck and face with a slimy lick that was purposefully more sloppy than any you gave her on occasion.

“You creep! That was disgusting! Max! get this loser off me!” she yelled.

“Loser?!” the other dragon snarled.

“Well if you would’ve killed him like I told you this wouldn’t have happened. But I guess this way I get lunch.” You said after sneaking behind him to the point where you were towering over him but not making a shadow on him. Before the dragon to back of her you swiped him with a claw and pinned him down with it, once again on his back. “I told you before Kara, you and I are rare and most other dragons act like this guy. Give them a little and they will demand everything.” You looked down and saw a wiggling in his stomach or rather felt it under you clawed hand. “He didn’t even take the courtesy of killing his meals before swallowing them. Like others he wants the feel of prey still moving in his gut. Probably turns him on.” You said as you adjusted your hand so she could see what you were talking about.

“Oh my is there still people in there?” she asked in horror.

“Their my prey!” the dragon tried to roar but you just took a claw from your other hand and sliced his gut open, spilling two young kids not older than 9 onto the grass. They shivered as they were introduced to the comparatively cold air outside the stomach. You could see some acid burns from early parts of digestion.

“Not anymore they’re not.” You said in a cold tone as the dragon screamed in pain. “Kara, why don’t you take them and clean them off. They still have a little stomach acid on them that could do some damage. I’ll join you when I am done with my lunch.” You instructed and she, without any sympathy for the screaming dragon grabbed the two little kids carefully in her jaws, as she they were to fragile at this point to ride on her back, and took them out of human earshot from the screaming dragon than placed them down and started to lick the acid off. She obviously didn’t like the taste but she was dead set on not letting it harm the little ones any longer. When she was out of the way you looked down at your meal and with no emotion what so ever you took his head and upper body in your mouth and severed it from the rest. You may hate most dragons but you still had the courtesy of putting them out of their misery. You gulped that down then the lower half. You licked the remnants of blood and what not off your muzzle, claws, and teeth then went to join Kara as she Kids were now clean, wet with drool, but clean. “Gave them a tongue bath huh?”

“You said to get them clean?”she asked confused as the children were shaking more out of the fear of getting eaten again than the cold. A crowd with an assortment of weapons that were mostly farm tools surrounded you and approached slowly.

“Well you could have heated that tub of water over there for them and let them bath themselves. But I guess clean is clean and they are out of danger at least.” You said and Kara looked at the freshly filled water trough you were referring to.

“Oh.” She said and looked down again at the two kids. “Why are they still scared?” she asked as she was not used to human interaction like this.

“They were just eaten and almost digested by a dragon. After that all dragons pretty much look the same. Not to mention they probably don’t know or had a tongue bath before. They probably thought and still think you are just tasting them.” You said then brought your head down to them. They closed their eyes in fear but you just breathed a gust of warm air at them which dried them almost immediately. When they noticed this and that they weren’t in another mouth they looked back at you while you retracted your head a little. “You can go little humans. We aren’t going to eat you.” you said and they quickly got up and ran to a pair of extra anxious and approaching parents. “Now we wait and see if they attack or not.” You said to her as you both lay down comfortably in a less threatening position.
132321111211221112.title: You take her along to "deal with another dr...

1323211112112211122.content:
After the kids were ushered by their mother away to join the others somewhere the father and apparent leader of the small group of people came forward. Unlike the others, who were armed with an assortment of useless farmer’s tools that wouldn’t even scratch a dragon, this man had a sword and held it like a knight would. This told you that he at the very least had some training and could pose a problem if he attacked.

“So you are the dragons that live at Lord Hizer’s castle in the city of Crobalt?” he more stated than asked.

“Yes sir, we are…” Kara started but the man’s sword was instantly raised at her speech to him. “What? Did I say something bad?” she asked.

“Ssh.” You started. “Humans get nervous around us when we talk. Especially when we get bigger. All they see is a flapping mouth full of deadly teeth. So don’t talk unless you have to and even then do so without opening your mouth so much.” You instructed as you talked in a manner that demonstrated the technique to which she nodded and looked back to the human that was talking before.

“Why are you here?” he asked, still with his sword pointed more at you than her.

“We were asked to stop a dragon that was causing trouble. That dragon won’t be bothering you anymore.” You said and the man must have seen you eat because he looked immediately at your chest and stomach than back at you. You knew your eye unnerved most people so you did your best to make yourself look as nonthreatening as possible.

“I would say that you were a little late as most of the buildings are in ashes. But then again without you here my boys would still be in that beast’s stomach.” he said and lowered his sword to which the rest of the people around did likewise, some a little hesitant but still. “So I guess the only thing to say is… thank you.” he said in a pained face that was clear he was forcing himself to say it. This was normal since most had lost much to dragons so trusting or thanking one was against what they knew. However the moment was broken by a young little boy, not more than 8 years old, running around and into the circle. He was out of the human’s reach before they knew it and he came crashing into you. He fell back and you instinctually looked at him. He looked up at you with an innocent face as if not knowing the potential danger he was in. The adults were back in stance as they awaited what you would do.

“Wow! A dragon. You’re big.” He said and Kara chuckled a little and you just smiled down at him.

“Are you ok little one? I didn’t hurt you did I?” you asked and the boy just shook his head and scampered up to his feet then looked up at you.

“I’m not a little kid! My name is Richard and don’t you forget it.” He said as he crossed his arms in annoyance at being called little.

“I won’t.” you said in a mock sense of fear that made the little boy proud. It was at that point when you noticed a little wooden sword in the kid’s belt. “You must be a brave warrior.” You said and the kid took out his sword and started swinging it around like he was fighting then looked back at you.

“Not just brave, I’m going to be a dragon slayer when I grow up. I’ll be big and strong and make sure no nasty dragons attack my family again.” He said with that same innocent confidence that most kids his age had. You could see that the humans around you cringed and were even more anxious as the kid said this. Admitting that he wanted to slay dragons in front of one was usually not smart.

“Well I better watch out then.” You said and he was so busy waving his sword happily after your compliment around he didn’t notice he was coming closer to the humans that promptly grabbed him and took him away when they could. “Cute kid.” You said then turned your attention back to the man.

“Why didn’t you eat him?” a woman asked and you winced at the question. “Haven’t you eaten humans before?” she said before another human came and calmed the emotional woman down from asking such questions.

“I don’t like harming humans. I admit I have… well I try not to but… yes I have eaten a few. If it makes any difference it was only after I exhausted all other options. I am a dragon so humans try to kill me a lot. If I can’t run or they are threatening a human I care for than… well I do what I have to.” You tried to explain but there wasn’t really a nice way to say that you eat humans. You looked away for a bit then back at the man, hoping for a change in topic.

“That isn’t very convincing. It doesn’t exactly look like you’ve missed a meal. You even eat your own kind so why not a human?” another said and the man began to see that the situation was spinning out of control as you ducked again at the question.

“Just look at his eyes. If that doesn’t say he’s bloodthirsty I don’t know what does.” Another man said with a raised pitchfork. With the loss of his control the leader looked at you and nodded up for you to leave while everything was relatively ok. You did the same to Kara and in a gust of both wings the crowd turned mob were taken off their feet by the wind while you and Kara took off into the sky.

“Why were they acting like that?” Kara asked as she still didn’t get it.

“Humans are afraid of what they don’t understand. Oddly enough they are much more respectful when they are running for their lives than if you were to have a conversation with one. But there are a few that know better like Lord Hizer, Sarah, and that little boy.” you said let out a smile at it which Kara saw.

“He was cute for a human. But don’t you eat dragon slayers?” she asked and you just sighed and she immediately regretted the question.

“Not really, I have a feeling that Sir Nick is a dragon slayer to have been able to defeat so many in his life. I am technically one as I kill more dragons than any human does. I just eat the ones that put me in a corner and I find that they would eventually be a danger to Sarah. They tend to do anything to win, including using humans as bait. If that Kid wants to be a dragon slayer, hopefully there will be two dragons that he doesn’t come after.” You said and it was her turn to smile as she like little kids like that. In the castle they usually play on her if she isn’t busy.

“Max?” Kara asked but her voice tone completely changed and you waited for her to continue. “Are we friends?” she asked. You were just going to give a hardened answer but you could tell it was a serious question. Sure she had many humans that served her under Lord Hizer. But she wasn’t really friends with any of them.

“Yes Kara we are.” You said and you could feel her joy as she flew beside you. “But don’t think that means I’ll go any easier on you in training.” You said and she groaned while you laughed at her sudden change in reaction.
1323211112112211122.title: They thank you.

choices: They want passage to the portals.
13232111121122111221.content:
As time went by and after Kara had learned more than enough to hold her own, not against a Dark Hunter but with most others which included a deep gap between her own kind. You also started to train when you both got to the point of letting riders on you. Sarah was the only one allowed on you the two of you became a deadly combo. Kara mostly took your roll in dealing with the dragon intruders to the land but as more dragons saw humans living with dragons the more it spread. The castle started to have dragon visitors, mainly in the clans surrounding Lord Hizer’s land. You and Kara had either driven out or killed every dragon and they were getting rather nervous of the power Lord Hizer had under his command. You of course weren’t under his command and you made sure Lord Hizer and some others know that you and Sarah were not to be bossed around and that if they wanted you to do anything substantial that you didn’t feel like doing that Sarah was the only one to convince you otherwise, even if Kara was getting closer to you and you gave and received advice with her even she knew that Sarah was in a league all to herself. So it came to her to calm you when dragon representatives came to see Lord Hizer. You would sit or lay like a statue in a corner of the room with your eyes closed to prevent an outburst. Many times you were mistaken as a statue and the dragon they smelled was Kara who was on the opposite side of Sarah as she sat between you but close enough to pet both of you. There was only one instance where you intervened and it only took the opening of your eyes to quell the visiting dragon’s attitude. Otherwise there was a constant, low, rumble in the room when another dragon was in it other than Kara that was white noise to most except for those who knew it to be your growl. It was during one of these visits when you had an unexpected surprise.

“Rarely do we have two dragons plead their case to me.” Lord Hizer said in starting. “I am honored to have you. Should we start out with a…”

“We want our daughter back you thief!” the female dragon roared and it hit all in the room weird. There was only one they could be talking about as they were of Kara’s kind, known as Sky darts as they were near the fastest dragons in terms flying. However you remain in your posture and Sarah’s hand momentarily froze as she soothed you but started back up after your growling started rumbling her chair.

“There must be some misunderstanding. I found Kara yes or rather she found me. I took care of her and had here trained but she is free to leave if she wishes. If you really are her parents than I am not the one you need to convince. I did not steel her nor am I holding her here. She stays because she wants to.”

“Insolent human, I will hear no more of you lies!” the male said and lunged forward. You would have moved but you felt as Kara’s warmth left your side and you heard a round of snarls and growls as Kara got in between the dragons and Lord Hizer.

“We may be humans.” Sarah said as she pet you and the dragon’s head looked to her as she spoke. “But we have been more family to Kara than you.” she said in a cold tone that infuriated the male as they snarled at her. At this you opened your eyes and gazed at them while parts of your snout were rolling into their own snarl but Sarah played with them and you just gazed at the now quivering dragons in front of you. They were by no means scared of Kara as they thought themselves higher than she was, even if it was a false assumption. However you were pretty famous for your… activities and even if you weren’t Dark Hunters were never taken lightly.

“Sarah is the last human in this room you want to snarl at.” Kara said. “She is the only thing keeping Max from doing what he will with you or any other dragon for that matter.”

“Why are you protecting them our daughter? Dragons are above humans, they are nothing compared to us.” the apparent mother said and was about to continue when you let out another snarl at this. Understandable since they had just insulted every human in the room including Sarah but she just soothed you back.

“At least I am something to them.” Kara said and her parents’ heads snapped to her. “Max and I have something in common we both had our parents abandon us. These humans have been and will continue to be my family. Everything I am today is because of them not for anything you’ve done since throwing my egg away.” After she got done with her little emotional tirade she took a breath while her birth parents took it in. They had obviously expected that she choose them over humans so this was a surprise if nothing else.

“Why do want her to go with you anyway?” Sarah asked and they all looked at her including Kara. “Kara is loved here and we would like her to stay but of course we won’t force it, that is why we want her here. But what is your reason why she should go with you?” Sarah asked and Kara took a moment to soak in the LOVED word but with that little hesitation she missed her blood father’s tail, perhaps instinctually, moving to impact Sarah for her words. Dragons in general weren’t used to humans speaking to them and if they do they are used to being both feared and respected. They usually had the power to force such treatment. Sarah was thankfully paying attention and the moment she lifted her hand off your snout you darted forward and within inches of the tails impact it was pulled away as you grabbed the comparatively small dragon in your clawed hand, and perhaps too hard, slammed his back and wings into the stone floor. Your claw covered half of his upper torso which included a well placed claw over the base of his neck and digging in a little. The weight you were putting on him was nearly suffocating him while one of your rear legs pinned his tail so he could trash around. You snarled viciously at him with your teeth slightly open but fully showing, like you did when going for a kill.

“Filthy dragon.” You snarled as you pinned his head to the ground with your other front claws and prepared to rip out his throat.

“Max!” Sarah’s voice came as your jaws just made contact with his neck. You froze at her word and after a little growl retracted your teeth from their target and then looked back at her. “Remember? Not in here.” She said. You had reluctantly agreed after the first dragon tried attacking when meeting Lord Hizer. You had of course caught the dragon in a similar fashion and ripped it apart. But it took 2 weeks to get the blood out of the room from the multiple places it went with the act. So you were not to do a like event inside if you could help it. Your muscles flexed a little in an obvious attempt to restrain them as you took the your claws off his head so he could see you.

“Try that again and these walls will be coated with your blood.” you growled quietly into his ear, to quite for the others to hear. It wasn’t really necessary to say as he got the message quite clear already, as did the other dragon as she cowered but whimpered for her mate’s safety. The site of you upon them was enough in of itself, factor in that you nearly killed him and threw in a death threat only solidified the fear. “Damned rat…” you snarled as you took your weight off him and went back to Sarah were she calmed you until you were in your previous position. She at times had to tap a tooth that was showing to get you to cover them but you were back to a low continuous growl but you were now watching them with very attentive eyes.

“That was a stupid move on your part.” Kara said to her parents as they recovered. “Max hates other dragons, as it stands he might try to follow you after you leave to… well do whatever he does to dragons, mostly eats them. I wouldn’t push him further in that direction if I were you. A little hint; he cares for Sarah more than anything so be careful how you treat her.” she warned and they gave an overly frightened look to her than back to you as they steadied themselves and the male checked the small gash left over from your claw that was barley bleeding but it was still noticeable.

“Now that we have the formalities out of the way. Care to continue?” Lord Hizer asked in a more authoritative voice than his earlier one.
13232111121122111221.title: Kara's parents.

132321111211221112211.content:
“We… we just want our daughter back.” Said the mother. You looked inside her as you had enough of it and saw a certain amount of sincerity to her words as the father nursed the cut on his neck.

“One again, it is not me you must convince.” Lord Hizer said. “She is here because she wants to be. If you want her to go with you than you must convince her. I know that you are her blood parents by how you look at her. But as far as raising her as a proper dragon and the person she is. That is my doing and her dragon training was from max. We are her family and we will accept any decision she makes.”

“Kara… that is the name you were given, yes?” her mother asked and she nodded in confirmation.

“You should come home with us.” her father said bluntly.

“Why should I?” Kara asked rather coldly. This made both parents look at her with a mixture of anger and confusion, but they dared not to act on them from what happened last time. “You wanted me to die even before I hatched, and now that I have made some friends and family that actually care about me you want me to leave it?”

“They are not your family!” her father boomed, angered that she would consider humans higher than him.

“Says you.” Sarah said and they looked over at her but cautiously as they were forcd to look into your eyes as they glared at her. “True she is a dragon and from what Lord Hizer said you are her blood family. But that is where your involvement with her ends. I am both proud and unmistaken when I consider her as my sister, and Max even closer than a brother. I love both of them more than my blood relatives and we have taken care of one another like a proper family should, regardless of if they are dragon or human. You best look for another strategy to convince her to leave because convincing her we aren’t family won’t work and Max trained her enough to take both of you on and still have enough energy to do a few laps so you can’t force her.”

“What do you know about it!?” the mother roared but was silenced by an escalated growl from you.

“There is one thing that binds Kara, Max, and I to each other. It was the reason Max left her alive in the first place and rescued me from a dragon’s belly. We have all been thrown away by our parents. No matter how hard you try you can’t know what that feels like. I have more in common with Kara than you do at the moment. You have nothing to force her to your side.” Sarah said and with that the father began to cough up something from his storage gut. When he was done there was an egg of sorts on the ground. He put his good claw on it and tapped it just hard enough to make a sound but not damage it.

“We have this.” her mother said and you felt a type of magic coming from it that you didn’t recognize. You didn’t know what it was but the smell only brought pain to mind.

“What? Another egg for you to discard?” Kara asked with a snarl.

“No, this egg was made by a combination of a blood mage and dragon fertilization. Such eggs were made in order to identify King dragons, normally in human populations.” Her mother explained and you looked at Sarah and her back at you with a bit of fear. “As you know a King Dark hunter, also known as a half breed, are the scourge of both dragon and human races. Not to mention they have enough power to cause a lot of damage if left unchecked. One ability they have is to turn into either form, dragon or human at will. The vapor in this egg will force the half breed to transform into its other self thereby identifying it.”

“Go ahead. The legends say that the half breed is a demon. There are no demons here. I will even go as far as to order the death pentalty if you can prove a half breed is here.” Lord Hizer said before you could stop him. The father smirked and you knew that he was thinking one of two things. He could release the vapor and get the humans you loved so much to turn on you. Or her could use it as a blackmail tool to make you convince Kara to go with them.
132321111211221112211.title: They want Kara.

1323211112112211122111.content:
“Wait don’t!” Sarah said but with a smile the Kara’s father lifted his claw and brought it down on the egg. The vapor was like a green mist that billowed and exploded out, covering the whole room then it seemed to seep into your very skin which cleared the air but brought everyone’s eyes to you. Your eyes closed and Sarah moved away as you began snarling uncontrollably as the intense pain that came with transforming took over your senses. It continued until you were completely changed but was on all fours like you were as a dragon but breathing very heavily. “Max!” Sarah said as she caught your falling body. The mist must have done more than just force a transformation. It must have emptied your reserves as well as part of the forced transformation.

“Seize him!” came Lord Hizer’s voice. You didn’t take offense to the action for two reasons. One he had promised something and Lord Hizer always kept his word. The second being that he had been brought up, like everyone else, to hate and fear half breeds. In fact, that was one of very few things that humans and dragons came together on. You hadn’t interacted very much on a personal level with him so this action was… predictable. However before the guards could get to you and Sarah a snarl drove them back as a blue body stood over the both of you. Kara stood in a ready position to defend both of you, her fangs and teeth bared and her tail swinging in a sweep that covered her back side from any attacks.

“Kara, what are you…?” started her father but was cut off by a roar from her.

“You shut up! You had no right to force your way. As far as I’m concerned the only thing you’ve done here is prove what kind of filthy dragon Max thought you to be. You are not getting your way in this. Max and Sarah are my family, I don’t care if he is a half breed. One thing is for sure, he is no demon or he would have killed me and everyone else already, that includes you two.” Kara roared at the two dragons and turned their grins into angered expressions. They were hoping that showing her “family’s” lack of trust for her would force her away but this was exactly the opposite.

“Kara, I’m sorry my dear but the law is clear and I agree with it. Laws are there for a reason and it clearly states that half breeds must be purged. I have no choice in this.” he said as he waved a hand which brought scores of guards and knights into the room, past the other dragons, and all aimed at Kara and the humans she was protecting. “Kara, you have one chance to stand aside before we must include you in the half breed’s fate.”

“His name is max! And I’ll die before I give my family up.” She roared and then noticed a tap on her paw from you. She kept her gaze but was now listening to your barely audible voice as you fought the fatigue that was pressing in on you.

“Wall is weak behind me. Leads to the outside. Use a… fire… weaken and fly… away… fast… take Sarah.” was all you could say before you passed out.

You tried for the life of you to remain conscious but you couldn’t and you drifted off into blackness, a weightless void until you saw a light. Nothing worked right but your body was being pulled toward it. When you finally could move your eye shot open but stayed still. You found yourself back in your cave. You recognized the smell and the cold. But then you felt warm all around you. You looked down to see Sarah cuddled into you but sandwiched between you and a blue scaly wall that took you a moment to identify as Kara. You looked up to see her wing above you like you do for Sarah when she sleeps. You looked to your right and see an eyeball looking at you. It almost made you just as the sudden realization that someone was watching you. You finally understood why humans were frightened by your eyes so much. Not that her eyes were scary but it was just the situation and the sudden realization.

“Good you’re up.” Said a groggy voice as Sarah lifted her head and met your eyes. “We weren’t sure if you were going to make it after you passed out. That mist must have had poison in it because you have been out for 3 days.” She said and you were noticeably surprised at the number.

“I’m sorry if I made you worry.” You said and she just laid her head on your chest. “I suppose this means you were able to get away.” You said.

“Compared with running away from you, they were easy.” Kara said and you smiled at it. “Even had enough time to go the other way and lead them in the opposite direction of your previous cave.” She said and with a motion that indicated you were starting to sit up she removed her wing. You braced yourself as Sarah held on to you and you leaned up against Kara’s body while looking at the cave in the darkness. It hadn’t changed at all, except of course their meals littering the floor in places.

“Kara, I’m sorry.” You said and she looked at you confused. “I… we had every intension of telling you about… me but it turned out we waited too long. We should have told you sooner.” You said and her face turned to a concerned looking one.

“Don’t worry about it. Sarah already filled me in on everything. I never really knew why your mother did what she did. Even if I still disagree with her and love the two of you… it just makes more sense now.” She said and you smiled back at her with a silent thanks. “It also makes sense why you like humans so much. Not that I like them any less but you can actually become one. Still weird that you hate dragons though, but I understand that to.” She said and chuckled a little but got a tired mumble from Sarah’s sleeping form for the movement.
1323211112112211122111.title: They expose you.

choices: Stay and let Nick go, for now.
13232111121122111221111.content:
You quickly recovered but for some reason you were unable to transform into full dragon form. You had been able to almost do it and each day it came a little closer but it was still not enough. However you were far from defenseless as you retained all your draconic power in your state, a fact you made painfully obvious when you resumed training with Kara and Sarah. You could easily fly and fight in human form, remembering all you had seen Sarah learn while at Lord Hizer’s castle. However Kara was now the one that had to deal with intruders of sentient origin. She began to see why you had made it sound so ruff. While defending herself was a breeze, dealing with them after was almost more than she could bare emotionally. She hated eating dragons and you constantly took them away and burned them to ashes if you could. She also strongly disliked eating humans regardless if the flavor was enjoyable. If for no other reason you tried transforming daily for her sake. You promised her that you would handle them once you could and she agreed but you couldn’t help see that she was feeling guilty around you and Sarah and you knew exactly why. She had tasted human flesh and being that you knew the taste you also knew she craved it, regardless of her moral objections, as did you. However you knew it was only a matter of time before someone of legitimate stature would come for you and as you heard the sound of a horse and a heavy metal thud you knew another knight was approaching as you all rested in the cave. You and Kara recognized the smell as Nick so you let him come in further than others were allowed before a confrontation.

“I feel like I’ve been here before.” Nick said as you all looked at him. You and Sarah were leaning comfortably on Kara’s side as he approached and stopped a little ways away but close enough to be friendly. “I here you have gone back to your old habits.”

“Then you heard wrong. I haven’t been able to change back to dragon form for weeks now. I do take care of some of the garbage from time to time but not like I used to.” You said and he lowered his head then looked back to you. “Are you here to slay us Sir Nick. I would prefer not to have to fight you.”

“Nor I you, although I have slew my fair share of dragons even I know you are far beyond my skill. I am not suicidal but I did come here because I was wrecking my brain on a solution to our little conflict and I think I came up with something. The portals.” He said and you all caught your breath than looked at each other.

“You want to exile us?” Kara growled.

“No, not all of you.” he said quickly and you all listened to him in an attempt to explain. “Lord Hizer still has a duty to purge the King Dark Hunter but that is all the law says. It doesn’t say that the purge must result in death. He still cares deeply for all of you but is caught between the law and his honor as a friend to you all. We both feel that way and so we thought hard about a way to solve this without death. Now this may sound harsh at first but please listen. We want to send Max through the portal.” Nick said and before any of your could speak he continued. “If we do that and somehow Max is able to come back he will be in a loop hole. The law sais you must be purged but it only sais to do it once and it never states that you have to die. So…”

“If Max comes back from one of those realms the law can’t touch him.” Sarah said and Nick nodded, glad that Sarah was able to sense out the advantage of it.

“What of Sarah and Kara? If I go into the portal what will happen to them?” You asked.

“They will have technically helped purge you so they would considered heroes and receive appropriate compensation. At which point Lord Hizer would be more than happy to look after them until your return.” He said and you all started to see the positives of the suggestion. “There is one thing though that I should mention. Not a single person has ever come back from a journey through the portal. However we know it is possible because that is how humans go here in the first place. We are hoping that Max being a King will help his journey to return. So in short, there is a very strong possibility that you will be stranded there, never to return and even then it will be a while.” He said and you all fell back into the weight of this decision.

“What do you two think?” you asked the two beside you.

“They are exiling you, which is not fair, but then again we are kind of exiled now and I miss Lord Hizer.” Kara said in a pang of guilt.

“I don’t want to see you go Max.” Sarah said as tears began to grace her face. “But if you go than you will be able to return and we’ll be able to live in peace or relative peace. Not to mention this is the only way to prevent more bloodshed and death. If we don’t agree we will have to kill every human and dragon we see and if we accept Kara and I will be looked after. Selfishly I want you to stay but I don’t want so many to die for it. So whatever you think is best.” Sarah said as she buried her face in your shoulder as she thought her time might be limited with you. You cupped her head with one hand and stroked Kara’s eye ridge with the other. You didn’t want to leave either but if you stayed they would only be in danger. What should you do?
13232111121122111221111.title: You're found by Nick.

132321111211221112211111.content:
“Are you ready son.” Said Lord Hizer as you stood in front of a portal the size of a human. The big portals that transported dragons were in the capital but each major city had one just in case such an occasion should arise. You were able to transform back to dragon form but didn’t as they advised you that any realm you went to would probably more easily accept a human over a full sized dragon that was at this point was more than 500 feet tall and proportionally long and frankly too large to expect an immediate pleasant reaction. There was no knowing for sure what realm you would be deposited in and because no on e had ever come back no one knew the first thing of what would happen.

“Not really.” You said looking back at Sarah and Kara. They were both crying as neither of them wanted you to go and in a way that made you feel good. Knowing someone on this end cares did wonders for your resolve and motivation. “If there is a way back I will find it.” You assured them and they each forced a smile and you did the same, each knowing the other couldn’t form a real one but not from lack of trying. You looked to Lord Hizer to address him.

“I will make sure they are here when you return. They will come to no harm.” He said as if he was reading your mind.

“Thank you… Lord Hizer.” You said and her smiled as this was the first time you addressed him so formerly and knew it was a very high level of respect for you to do so. Then you looked at the portal and with a deep breath as if you were going swimming you walked through it. As you entered you felt your breath leave you despite your efforts to keep it. You were spinning and almost suffocate as the spinning was so severe that you couldn’t take a breath. You were tempted to put your wings out to slow yourself but you thought that might just break them off so you waited and hoped it would end soon. Just as you were about to pass out your lungs took in a breath. You greedily took more of it in and then a light hit your eyes as you were forced from the blackness and spat out onto the ground.

You were dizzy and highly disoriented but alive as shapes began to form and you saw movement. You tried to smell them but that was more out of whack than your eyesight and hearing was. You grabbed your head as you nurtured the worst headache you had ever had, even after free falling and hitting your head from 2000 feet up with Kara. The trip must have been designed to level any opposition if it was a means of attack. You felt energy around you like the energy you used to walk on walls and water even air, but it was weaker as it was coming from infants. The spinning kept up and soon you found yourself dreaming. You didn’t realize it at first so naturally you tried to moved but that didn’t work either. When you finally noticed you were dreaming you woke yourself up but not before wondering what realm you had crashed into.

Author’s note: Ok, just for clarity, the options are not there to limit someone’s creativity. You don’t need to stay true to either story for two reasons; 1) Max doesn’t watch TV or read books, yet so he knows nothing about preserving the realms accuracy 2) Neither has a giant dragon in them so that in of its self changes things. If you want to direct it to one side or another than add and take control of the realm’s accuracy or lack thereof. Just don’t rip on anyone’s ideas if you weren’t willing to take a risk and write it yourself. That being said have fun and enjoy.
132321111211221112211111.title: Go through the portal.

choices: You tell the Third about your... other side.
1323211112112211122111111.content:
You fluttered open your eyes as and they painfully adjusted to the light that was coming in from the window. Your eyes may have been overwhelmed but your body was thanking whoever put you in this bed as it soaked up its rays. You quickly sat up and placed your back against the head board and wall to hide your eye from the intense light and let them adjust more slowly. When they had your other senses came on high alert as you realized your situation. While in no immediate danger you were in a bed and some kind of nurse or maid was in the room near the door. However as soon as you looked at her she ran out of the room and called for a name you didn’t understand or know. You looked down at your hands and moved them to see if you were… the way you used to be. You felt normal and grew a spike just to be sure then put it away. You looked around and you noticed you still had your vision and all your other senses were just like they were when you left. You heard down the hall as the nurse told someone you were awake and a set of footsteps came down to your door. You grabbed your head as you wondered what to do. You wanted to start looking for a way back home but you didn’t even know where to start.

“If you are still in pain I can call in a nurse.” Said an old man as he walked in and shut the door behind him. He had a primarily red colored set of clothes with a hat that looked to be more ceremonial than having any practical use. You walked over and stood to the side as he let you take in his presence. You could sense that of all the people around you that this guy smelled and felt the most impressive as far as maturity and potential ability. The energy that you felt rivaled dragons back home, not strong ones but to even be on their level at all was remarkable for a human.

“No, I... feel ok. A bit confused. Who are you? Where am I? Are you gonna try and kill me?” you asked in rapid succession.

“Hold on there little one. You are in a Leaf Village hospital. We brought you here to heal you not to cause you any harm. But you must be far away to not know of ninja or our world. I am the third Hokage and otherwise leader of this village. Now it’s your turn, what is your name?” he asked in a kind manner that you studied for a few seconds then began to relax. If this man meant you any harm he sure wasn’t showing it.

“Max… my name is Max.” you said and he smiled in response and in a way was its own reward.

“Well Max, do you mind telling me where you are from? It might also help to know who it is that is trying to kill you. I wouldn’t want them surprising us.” he said and you looked down a thought for a moment.

“My home is called Base realm. I was exiled and left to die for being… different. If you haven’t heard of my home than it is certain that I am not being followed. I would really like to go back but no one has ever returned from exile before.” You explained and the man rubbed his chin wondering who would exile a child like you. You didn’t look that threatening to his eye and you looked barely 12 years old.

“Max, I feel sorry for you and what has happened for you. Under normal circumstances I would hand you over to your village as it would only be proper. But seeming that you have none I am at a difficult spot. We can offer you a place in this village if you wish but under one condition. That is you must attend the ninja training academy. A young boy like you should be in school.” He said as he looked at you with a half serious and half cheerful face. But he noticed that you still weren’t completely relieved yet. “What is it little Max? you look troubled.”

“Well I assume this ninja school place is some kind of training for children my age. If that is the case I gratefully accept I just… well I don’t have a place to stay. I don’t want to be a burden to you. You seem nice and all but…” you started, not exactly sure how to say that you didn’t want to be abandoned.

“Is that what you are worried about? Little one, there is plenty of room for you in the village. We’ll get you set up in a dwelling of your very own before you start your schooling. How does that sound?’ he said in a similar tone of voice and body language that Lord Hizer used with Kara. Like a grandparent and a smile grew from ear to ear.

“Oh thank you, thank you very much… MR… Sir… Uh…” you stumbled as you weren’t sure what to call him, you didn’t want to be rude to this nice man.

“Lord Hokage.” He hinted as if telling you a secret.

“Thank you… Lord Hokage.” You said and thought that things couldn’t have gone better for meeting your first human in this new realm. Not only was he the leader but he was an insanely nice man. You weren’t concerned with whatever school they had as you had watched Sarah study and, due to the King’s genetic knowledge, you were already pretty smart. Sarah used to tease that you were only half as smart as she was and it was probably true but that was like comparing a stone to a mountain so you took it as a compliment. Either way you were looking forward to what was coming up for you. Despite the urge to get home you almost immediately felt the need to help this man or at the very least do whatever he told you to do. It was strange but you felt more at ease at this moment than you had ever felt in your whole life.
1323211112112211122111111.title: Naruto

choices: You're with Kakashi, Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura.
You are drafted into the Anbu forces.
13232111121122111221111111.content:
You were put in a dwelling and while it was small you didn’t really care. You didn’t need a human dwelling that much anyway. It was just there to keep your books and other school or human related things. You were delighted to learn that the Ninja training was rather interesting. You always felt energy inside you but other than using it to fly, help you climb, or fight you didn’t know about these things called Jutsu, techniques that could be used by using your energy or “Chakra” as they liked to call it. The learning of these jutsu or other things weren’t hard, in fact they were so easy you began going and inventing your own jutsu or copying ones you saw the older ninja do. You particularly liked shadow related and transformation jutsu. With this new understanding you developed a more instantaneous way to go from Human to Dragon form and it didn’t hurt that much. Well it did but it was kind of like jumping into the water rather than slowly wading into it. You only experimented a few times so not to reveal your true nature to anyone. However certain Jounin level ninja looked at you different if you did too well on school stuff so you toned it down a little. Your classmates were pretty much all wimps except one kid. You could feel his energy and it almost rivaled yours although it wasn’t all his. It was like there was something inside him that was like having a living power plant in his body. The kid was always getting into trouble but you looked past it, as well as all the cold stares he got and saw he was a rather interesting kid.

“Come on, show me. I need to learn how to do the Shuriken Jutsu.” Naruto said as he begged you for the hundredth time to teach you. He was far from pathetic but he was nowhere near the other students either.

“You just need to practice. There is no magic trick to learn it Naruto. That’s the trick with any Jutsu really.” You explained.

“But I…” he started and you could see you weren’t going to get any sleep or rest from this kid unless you helped him.

“Fine, you got some Shuriken?” you asked and he responded with twirling a few on his fingers. “Ok, hit these marks.” You said and you made marks in a practice board then stood between them.

“What the… get out of the way.” He said a little annoyed.
