“I’m not in the way. You can see all the targets and I have seen you hit your mark in class. So hit them. If you miss I’ll be dead.” You said without flinching at all or having the slightest amount of worry.

“Don’t be an idiot. I’m not going to throw them while you’re standing there.” He said.

“You asked for my help and this is it. If you can’t do it than just say so.” You said and you could tell her was battling with his pride and his morals. “Here, I’ll make it easier on you.” You said and threw a Kunai with a paper bomb on it right behind him. “If you try to run it will go off and if you don’t throw a Shuriken in the next 30 seconds it will go off. So throw one and don’t miss. The only way to get out of this and neither of us dying is if you hit one of these marks. Time starts now.” You said as the paper bob started to fizz.

“You’re crazy!” he yelled.

“20 seconds.” You said in a calm tone that you rarely differed from. He held one Shuriken and aimed, sweat rolling off his face. Then with 5 seconds to go he threw it than closed his eyes, hearing a thud as it hit its mark. The fizzing behind him stopped and the knife disappeared in a puff of white smoke, signaling a deactivated clone. He looked up at you, afraid of what he might see and to his surprise and relief his shuriken was planted in one of the marks, dead center. “Lesson complete.” You said in a casual tone as he fell over. You came over to him as he panted with exhaustion. “Don’t doubt yourself so much. I knew you could hit the mark and I was right. Now you need to see it. You can do anything you put your mind to.” You said with a pat on his shoulder than walked away. “See you in class.”

After that point Naruto never really asked you for any help with his training but every time he threw a shuriken in class he looked over at you than always hit his mark. Other than that he was in constant competition with just about everyone, especially some Uchiha kid that was always above him. You watched as a stead rivalry grew but the lonely kid that played jokes on people never did it to you. Mainly because your little training had scared the crap out of him not to mention it caused him mto have a deep respect for you that he would never admit to.

You kept as far away from the spot light as you could and observed everything you could. Sometimes you would go to the great stone faces and just stare over the village as you watched them below. Your senses could observe them in great detail as well as when the leaf ninja silently protected the village from random threats that were dealt with so quick that word never even reached the crowds the fight was held in. Every once in a while you felt someone watching you but that was fine. You just didn’t do anything worth mentioning when you felt that feeling.

You steadily made your way with the class and eventually graduated with Naruto. It was quite a surprise to see him graduate but then again you felt he had enough potential and saw a future beyond his troublemaking antics. You wondered as you sat waiting for the announcement of your Jounin instructor what was going to happen. Teams usually consisted of four members which meant three students for each instructor. However with you in the class there was one extra and you wondered how you would be sorted.
13232111121122111221111111.title: Ninja training dragon style.

choices: They ask you about it as you walk to the land of waves.
132321111211221112211111111.content:
You were pleasantly surprised when you got assigned to the same group as Naruto, Sasuke, and Sakura. The other three all had different reactions. Naruto was excited about being in the same group as Sakura but disliked being with Sasuke and almost crapped his pants when you were named as well. Sakura was highly irritated when she heard Naruto was in her group but that was overshadowed when Sasuke’s name was mentioned, she really didn’t know or care on your presence. Sasuke just looked like someone had shoved a pencil up his butt, you could tell he didn’t dig the whole team thing. When you were all dismissed you waited around in case they wanted to meet up but they all went their separate ways. You really didn’t need lunch so you just sat in the window soaking up the sun as you waited. Class was over so there wasn’t really a reason to sit in a proper desk and you watched as the other teams left. When Kakashi finally showed up and told the team what he thought of them “a couple of idiots” you just silently followed him out the door until you were all sitting down and introducing yourselves.

“And you.” Kakashi said as you were last in introducing yourself.

“I am Max. I like learning new things and making true friends. I hate dragons. My hobby is observing people and learning about them. My dream for the future is to gain a family and get home.” You said as each topic brought up a different set of emotions but to the untrained eye were invisible from view.

“Dragons. There is no such thing as dragons.” Sakura said in an almost degrading manner but also to show off her knowledge to Sasuke.

“Doesn’t matter, I still hate them.” You said with a clear bloodlust in your eyes but only Kakashi saw it and that was only for a second until it went away. Your tone of voice however got Naruto to flinch but otherwise nothing else.

“Good, you each have your own unique ideas. We’ll have our first mission tomorrow.” Kakashi said and they again bombarded him with questions and he answered them in an elusive yet skillful manner.

Finally he dismissed you and you went straight to the practice field to wait. There were three posts and you leapt on one then sat on it with your leg draped over the side of it. It was early the next morning when the other kids came and late in the morning when Kakashi got there. You all stood and took in your task as he presented you with two bells and easily subdued Naruto as he tried to attack before Kakashi said “start” but once he did you faded into the forest and used your heightened predatory instinct to outmaneuver him. You watched as beat a few of naruto’s attacks back without breaking a sweat as Naruto plunged into the river. You had preiously tried to speak with the other two but Sasuke told you to get lost and Sakura said something similar as her one and only concern was Sasuke. So you waited for Naruto as he was flung into the river then got stuck in a trap. You waited as Kakashi was attacked by Sasuke then left to “teach” the others.

“Hey Naruto.” You said as you threw a shuriken and cut his rope.

“Yeah what do you want you crazy coot?” he asked.

“Just thought you might want to work together to get the bells.” You said as you threw another shuriken and cut a rope of another trap he was about to step into. You then walked to him and he finally located you as you had made your voice come from a different direction in case Kakashi was around.

“Get real.” He said as he crossed his arms and turned away. “I already figured out how to win.” He said and before you could say anything else he ran off and you were left alone in the field. You sighed then slipped back into the forest and pursued Kakashi as he subdued the others one by one with a variety of basic moves and jutsu until he was lecturing Sasuke then took off a little. He was still reading when you appeared in front of him.

“Got to admit, didn’t see you there.” Kakashi said as he still had half his attention in his book.

“Didn’t see me take these either.” You said as you held up the two bells. He felt down and saw the wooden replicas that you had coated with a light Genjutsu so they seemed real. You then threw them to him and he caught them, confusion on his face. “I tried to work with them to have them help. But they aren’t much for the whole team thing yet. If you need to send someone back then send me. They may be rough around the edges but I can see they have potential.” You said then started walking to the posts where you smelled Naruto already. You walked back to the posts while Kakashi went ahead and tied Naruto to one. You leaned against another post as Kakashi explained their position and their lack of teamwork despite your efforts.

“Did you know that Max was able to take the bells.” Kakashi said and they were shocked them looked at you as you sat there and looked down a little as they stared at you. “He said that if I was going to send anyone back that he should be the one, that is what teamwork is supposed to be like.” He said than lecture them some more and gave them a second chance and left them to eat lunch but gave specific instructions not to feed Naruto. After a little while they heard Naruto’s stomach growl and then gave in and fed him.

“Why aren’t you helping? And why aren’t you eating?” Sakura asked when she and Sasuke saw you still weren’t moving from your spot.

“I don’t have a lunch. I don’t need one. You only need food if you need to build up strength by nourishing our bodies. I have conditioned mine so I don’t need to eat as much. As for helping, if Naruto would just push out than he would see that his ropes were cut from a Shuriken I threw 5 minutes ago.” You said still not looking at them. You heard Naruto push out and with some effort his ropes fell free. At this point Kakashi came back and tried to scare the four of you but the others stood firm and after a little deliberation he looked to you as he pressured them. “I didn’t tell them to do it. Looks like they figured it out all by themselves. Although I might have thrown a shuriken and it just might have lodged into the post at a downward angle that cut his ropes free.” You said with a smile, completely unaffected from Kakashi’s theatrics. After that he congratulated them at the aspect of passing and lecture them about the nature of those who abandon their friends, being worse than scum. As he dismissed the four of you he had questions for you as did the others but both wanted to ask you in secret but were unsure of when or how. You were obviously allot more experienced than you let on but they couldn’t nail down why it bothered them.
132321111211221112211111111.title: You're with Kakashi, Naruto, Sasuke, and Sa...

1323211112112211122111111112.content:
“So…” Kakashi said as the others on the mission to escort the bridge builder to the land of waves lay asleep while you leaned against a tree and watched over them. You needed very little rest when traveling in the sun all day so it was not strain to stay alert at night. You looked to him as he took a seat to the side of you so he could both face you and the others as well. “Are you going to tell me or am I going to have to guess?” he asked. You looked down for a moment then back up and more into the night then at anything in particular.

“I’m not sure how much to say. I’m sure you were told that I wasn’t born here and probably were told every event from the point I arrived to now. What no one knows is why I was exiled. I told the Third that I was exiled for being different but I didn’t tell him what that meant. He probably thought I was just a victim of some random family feud that left me stranded in the village or something like that.” You said and paused for a moment and looked up to the sky as you longed to soar in it like you used to. Kakashi seemed to pick up on this as he too looked up than back at you.

“We’re a team Max. You can trust us.” he said in a kind tone like the third addressed you with and made you look at him with your red but not glowing dragon eyes. Most people just thought your eyes were weird and didn’t bother asking about them. After all in the world of the ninja there were far more impressive eyes than your human looking ones, even if they retained some draconic traits.

“I know I can. I just… don’t want to lose that. I guess there is no easy way to say it.” You said and waited a second for Kakashi to ready his mind then continued. “I am only half human. I can change from human to my other form at will while losing none of my abilities or power. That is how I am so advanced in most areas. I am what my people call a Half Breed. They exiled me for it and here I am.” You explained

“If you are half human than what is your other half?” he asked and you looked to make sure the others were still sleeping then looked him deep in the eye as he looked to be gathering information like a true ninja would.

“Dragon. I am half human half dragon but stronger than both.” You said and he looked shocked.

“What!” he said perhaps a little too loud not enough to wake anyone. “Are you serious?” he asked as he settled down.

“Yes.” You said as you flashed your eyes red so he could see them then turned them back to human again. “I can grow dragon parts at will like wings, horns, teeth, eyes, tail, and scales to name a few. Actually transforming is quite painful and even though I have made a Jutsu to help make it more instantaneous but I still don’t look forward to it.” You now looked away as you continued. “I did a little research on what the equivalent power measurements are. According to the records my Chakra level is higher than the nine tailed fox.” As you said this his eye strained in surprise as well as concern.

“Hold on, you said you hate dragons.” He said as if trying to discout part of your story.

“I do. When I just hatched my mother tried to kill me. She hated me and after doing her best to rip me apart she threw me off a cliff for what I am. After I was well again and she heard rumors of me alive she sent some dragons kill me so I ran and hid until I could defend myself. After I grew to full size and had enough power to confront them I was permanently bias against dragons then from that point I killed and ate them whenever I saw one.”

“You ate them?” he asked as his expression changed a little as he saw how answering his questions were effecting you.

“Dragons are big and if I just kill them than not only does meat go to waste but another smells the scent and it becomes a never ending cycle of search and attack after that point. If I eat them or burn all the evidence than they wouldn’t come, but burning it would again waste meat. Another reason I kill them is that dragons tend to have a superiority complex towards humans. Most in my realm eat humans and push their weight around as much as they could. Just another reason why I hate them.”

“And you have never eaten a human?” he asked and you winced at the question.

“That is complicated. I tend not to spread me being a dragon around because of slayers that rise up to kill me. Not just me but everyone around. Most slayers are so cold they would sacrifice their own mother to get a better chance to slay a dragon. I tried to run and turn them away but eventually they put me in a corner and I have to fight back. Like I said before, their scent would attract dragons as well so if I have to kill them I eat them so not to draw dragons around which would cause me and the villages I protect any more problems. On my realm, I sadly have eaten quite a few humans like that. If it makes any difference, I haven’t killed anyone since I got here.” You said and Kakashi looked at you in a stunned glance than up to the stars as he thought about what you told him. He then sighed and looked back to you. “So what now?” you asked as you looked down and expected the worst.

“I think that you were right not to spread your… other side around.” He said and you waited for his decision. “We will eventually have to tell people and they should be some of the first.” In a clear tone that he was ok with your condition.

“You mean you are ok with me being a Half Breed?” you asked.

“Ninja are used to large animals around, we summon them to fight like the fourth did against the Nine Tailed Fox. You being half human is all I need to know to accept you. You being half dragon just adds an extra skill set that I can really on in the future.” He said and you looked up at him as he placed a hand on your shoulder. “You can trust us Max.” he repeated and you looked deep in his eyes as yours looked full of life.

“Thank you Kakashi Sensei, you don’t know how much that means to me.” You said as you looked away and wiped some tears that leaked out.

“We can talk about your assets one the way back so the rest of team knows. Until then just act like you have and if you have to use your… other side than say it is a Jutsu and make it believable.” He instructed and you nodded to which he smiled warmly at you.
1323211112112211122111111112.title: Kakashi asks privately.

13232111121122111221111111121.content:
As you walked it wasn’t long before you started to smell some other ninja in the area. You told Kakashi about it and he noticed as well. They were comparatively low level to him so he told you to let them come so he could assess what they are after. You obeyed and walked along with them until you passed a puddle. You both glanced discretely at it then when two ninja’s attacked you Kakashi feigned his death to observe. You grabbed the bridge builder and put some distance between him and the attacking ninja while the others attempted to fight him. You stood guard and ready as the two came after him. You looked over at a tree where Kakashi was and he nodded that you could take them out but, as he said before, not kill them. He needed to question them so you used a wire attaching to Kunai and threw it so that they were pulled to a tree and the wire wrapped around them. You quickly ran forward and with a gut punch knocked them both out. You removed them of their weapons and neatly placed them off to the side. After addressing the others and the bridge builder he dealt with them and you all headed off when Naruto drained the poison he got from the two ninja. The bridge builder explained on a boat ride about hireing them and the ninja that were after him, under the employ of Gatou. So when you got to shore you were on your way to the Builder’s home. Naruto was mad embarrassed by Sasuke saving him so he went off as you and Kakashi looked around for a moment.

“He’s here.” You said and the others looked at you but Kakashi nodded as you both were on high alert. Just as you pinpointed the attacking Jounin a large sword came into view as it was hurled and narrowly missed everyone as they dodged then a man you didn’t recognize stood on the its hilt as it buried itself in a tree, which made the miss look intentional.

As they talked and Kakashi introduced Zabuza to the group as well as being introduced in return. The Sharingan was introduced and the fight began while you and the others took protective stances to guard Tazuna. No one could see them as you were only looking one way but your eyes glowed as your full dragon vision was observing every move this Zabuza made. You followed him and noticed some Chakra appear behind you and you knew it to be a water clone.

“It’s over.” Zabuza said which got everyone in the group gurading Tazuna flinch except you.

“Like hell it is.” You said and your tail came out of your back, cutting the clone in half than retracting before even Kakashi noticed completely but he was able to fill in parts from what you told him before. To most everyone it looked like the man just exploded in water.

“Nice move, for a kid.” Said Zabuza.

“Yours is a little overdone. But I guess whatever works, for an old man.” You retorted back and a growl that sounded comical to you came from the mist around you. Zabuza came out and tried attacking you but Kakashi came and took him out but it was only another water clone. Zabuza sliced Kakashi in half but Kakashi had copied the water clone Jutsu and came up behind him. That one was also a water clone and Zabuza finally attacked the real Kakashi and it ended up sending Kakashi into the water to which Zabuza used the water prison Jutsu and sealed him in a sphere of water. At this you all were scattered out of your previous formation. “That’s a little more like it.” You complimented.

“Ha, the kid is impressed. Glad you enjoyed it. Now that the main threat is out of the way…” he said as he formed a water clone and it moved to confront the group. The others tried attacking it but the clone was easily more powerful than they were. And soon you were the only one between the clone and Tazuna.

“Hey Mr. Tazuna. You aren’t afraid of fire are you?” you asked him as you tried to figure out a way to protect him and fight.

“Not especially.” He responded.

“Good, don’t move and you won’t get burned.” You said then started a Jutsu that you were working on. Zabuza watched as your made your final hand sign then place your hands on the ground. The ground began to rumble and seconds later a large barrier of fire rose and surrounded Tazuna. The barrier was special as it was hot enough to render steel to ash but on the inside it didn’t cause any ill effects to even a leaf that was inside. Using the distraction Naruto worked together with Sasuke and was able to break the water prison apart by a complicated bunch of team work and a well thrown Shuriken, which was actually Naruto. The whole thing was rather impressive and while the clone looked at what he missed you sliced him in half then joined Sasuke and Sakura as you watched while the freed Kakashi started to fight again. “Nice move.” you said and Naruto joined you and laughed as they watched Zabuza fight with Kakashi.

“We got lucky. But you…?” Sasuke asked.

“Yeah, how did you do that?” Sakura asked as she looked at the wall of flames that protected Tazuna from even to water flying around.

“I live by myself, what do you think I do when I wasn’t at school? I am particularly efficient at fire type Jutsu so I created my own set of Jutsu that utilizes it.” You said and they looked at the wall of flames then their attention was snapped back as Kakashi was forming water dragons and you almost growled at the site of them. In fact a little bit of it escaped and the other two noticed as you released the fire barrier and Tazuna was able to watch the show as well.

“Right, you hate dragons.” Sakura said as they looked at the two water dragons right as did their masters underneath. “Are you ok?” she asked Tazuna as he was splashed with water.

“Couldn’t see anything from in there but I’m alive.” He said as you all watched the fight. You could sense another ninja watching but with all the mist, commotion, and the water washing off all the scent you couldn’t smell where the other one was.

You were all slightly surprised when the other ninja finished off Zabuza with ease and after a little explanations on tracker ninja he took Zabuza to “deal with the remains”. Naruto didn’t like him getting away but was calmed by Kakashi but when you all started moving Kakashi started to fall and you quickly caught his suddenly unconscious body.

“What happened? Kakashi Sensei!” Naruto exclaimed as the others rushed over. You could here his heart beating in a pattern that indicated extreme exhaustion.

“He’s ok, just tired. His Sharingan must be hard to use and it must take its toll on his body. Zabuza was no lightweight you know.” You said and they all felt a little better at this and as you picked him up. “We should get him to a place where he can rest properly.” You said and Tazuna started to escort the four of you to his house.
13232111121122111221111111121.title: First attack.

132321111211221112211111111211.content:
“At first you’ll need to run at the tree, using your momentum to carry you up. Make a mark at the highest point without using your hands then try to get past it the next time.” Kakashi explained as he started the tree climbing exercise with your squad to help your ability to control chakra but you already knew how. Heck you could climb trees, walk on water, and even walk on air to an extent but that last one was extremely tiring so you rarely did it. However it was useful if you had to slow your decent in a free fall if your wings weren’t usable.

You picked up the knife Kakashi gave you and watched as each of you picked a tree. You didn’t even both running and just climbed it with hardly any effort at all.

“What?”” you asked as you hung in a similar position as Kakashi was, on a branch and held to the bottom of it with your chakra. You gave Kakashi a look as if to say ‘You expected any less?’.

“Are you good at everything?” Naruto asked, thoughtly confused and irritated that once again you were far above his skill level.

“Like I said. I live alone so I have a lot of time to learn this kind of stuff. I admit I wasn’t aware of the precise mechanics of why it works but I still can do it all the same.” You answered then dropped to the ground while Kakashi made his way as well. “But it looks like Sakura has a good handle on it as well.” you said as Naruto and Sasuke both looked at her while she was sitting on a high branch smiling. Kakashi addressed each of them with praise and motivation and afterwards he left you there to help them if they needed it while he went back to Tazuna’s place. You then sat against the tree and watched as the three of them worked on it. Naruto finally had enough of falling down and knew better than to ask you for help in this kind of stuff so he went to Sakura.

“Max.” asked Sasuke as Naruto refused to help him in telling him what Sakura told him. They were after all fierce rivals and pride would dictate a certain amount of hostility but also a healthy cooperation when needed. “What is the secret to doing this?” he asked and you saw Naruto laugh as he remembered his training lesson with you.

“This will help.” You said as you touched his feet and they immediately began to burn. The burning didn’t injure him but it did all the other things that standing on hot coals would feel like. “Now you don’t have to climb the tree. Just concentrate your chakra like you should when you climb the tree. If you bring the right amount the burning will stop. After you reach the top of that tree the effect will wear off and you will have learned how to do it.” You said and he first plunged his feet in water but it didn’t help at all. Finally he concentrated and as he brought chakra to his feet and they began to feel better.

“What the hell! I asked for help not for torture!” He yelled at you but cringed as his concentration moved and he brought it back to soothing his feet. Then he looked to a laughing Naruto. “What is it looser?” he said and Sakura looked at him then you as if you had committed a crime then to Naruto to hear his anser.

“That is how Max helps train people. You’re lucky, when he trained me on how to throw a Shuriken he threw a paper bomb Kunai next to me and gave me 30 seconds to hit a mark he set near his head. If I missed he died and if I ran or took longer than 30 seconds the paper bomb would have killed me. He definitely taught me how to throw a Shuriken. That is just how he trains people.” He said as Sasuke worked on it as you looked at him with an unwavering gaze. He walked around as he learned and Naruto got higher and higher. Finally as Naruto was able to get to the top Sasuke also was able to do so and the burning stopped.

“That wasn’t very nice.” Sakura said after you got back and you all ate dinner. She had waited for the others to rest before talking to you.

“It wouldn’t have been nice if Zabuza came by and they weren’t ready either. It helped didn’t it?”you asked and she looked at you then after thinking for a while then smiled.

“Just don’t teach me anything.” She said and you smiled back.

“I promise to wait for you to ask before I set your feet on fire.” you responded and she nodded again with her smile then went off to sleep.
132321111211221112211111111211.title: Climbing a tree.

choices: Show and tell with the team.
You are forced to use something that exposes you.
1323211112112211122111111112112.content:
Kakashi put you in charge of protecting Tazuna as the others fought. Even when the others were having some trouble you were told to let them handle it so you did. You were surprised to sense the massive amount of chakra when Naruto went berserk for a moment but that only lasted a short while. You also constantly watched as each fought and put every Jutsu you saw into your memory, more particularly Kakashi’s lighting blade. But when everything was said and done Gatou came forward, approaching the dying Zabuza and the already dead Haku.

“I got this.” you said as you stepped in between the large crowd led by Gatou and the others. They looked at you as if you were crazy. “I just need to stretch my legs a little.” You said as you let your eyes glow in the clearing mist.

“You only need to take out Gatou. Don’t kill anyone else.” Kakashi instructed and the rest of them now looked at him the same way they looked at you.

“Got it. Didn’t want to kill them all anyway.” You said as you started to run at a speed they could all follow. You made a bee line straight for him and when necessary went through someone but, true to your word, didn’t kill them. Gatou was at the edge at this point and with one quick move you took out an edged spike and cut him in half vertically. His insides spat out into the water as he fell off the bridge and the two sides of him plummeted into the water, staining it red. You then looked back at them and let out a low growl that shook the immediate area. The large group was stunned and scarred out of their minds at what you did. “Beat it.” You said as you nodded to their boat. You got no argument as they trample over each other to get off. They would have ran toward the tired ninja but the whole town had come to help drive them away. After they left you walked over to Zabuza as he lay next to Haku, soon to be joining him.

“What are you?” he spat and as it stood Kakashi was the only one in earshot of him or you so you knelt down to him.

“I’m a Leaf Village Ninja.” You said simply and he looked at Kakashi who nodded to him then returned his gaze to you.

“Very well.” was his last words as he faded out, getting one last look at Haku and the snow that was falling. This battle was over and he left in a strange form of peace.

“Later.” You waved as your squad left the village. Naruto was almost Idolized in the village by that point and the bridge was completed so your team’s mission was over. Tazuna asked you a few times about yourself but you gave patented answers but ones he accepted. You also had helped bury Zabuza and Haku. But for now you drove that from your mind and followed the others as they all said their goodbyes and you started back to the Leaf Village. However you wondered as you left if Kakashi was going to make you tell the others or to transform for that matter.
1323211112112211122111111112112.title: Gotou's end.

13232111121122111221111111121121.content:
“Max, I think it’s about time.” Kakashi said as you all reached a solitary but wide open space in the woods. You had stopped for lunch and were talking about the mission. Your own abilities, not to mention your previously glowing eyes, were mentioned more than once.

“Ah, crap.” You sighed as you hung your head a little in an attempt to brace yourself of even the idea of transforming.

“Time for what?” Naruto asked as he was the more vocal.

“On the way to the land of waves Max shared something that we both agreed should be kept a secret but not from us. We are all a team and no matter our differences it is safe to say we all care a great deal for one another. Which also means that we trust each other.” Kakashi explained. You rubbed your head and neck, hoping you didn’t have to.

“What’s so special?” Sasuke asked and you looked at Kakashi who nodded for you to continue and so you did. You didn’t think that just words would be good enough so you let your eyes glow again and then grew wings and a tail. They looked on, including Kakashi as this was his first time seeing any dragon part of you, with surprise and amazement as you swished your tail and flexed your wings than returned them to your back and changed your eyes back.

“What the heck was that?” Naruto asked as he was usually the first one to blurt things out.

“I uhh… They are my wings and tail. I can form them in human form along with other aspects of my… other side.” you explained and rubbed your head to try to find a better way to say it.

“What other side? What are you talking about?” Sakura asked.

“I…” you started then looked again at Kakashi who was now next to you and placed a hand on your shoulder in support. “I am only half human. My other half is… Dragon. I am a Half Breed and can transform into either side at will but retain all my abilities no matter what form I’m in.” you started, trying to get as much information in at one time.

“What? Dragons don’t exist!” Sakura said and you just sighed.

“I guess I have to show you then. Damn this is going to hurt.” You said as you got up and walked to an open part of the field. You didn’t lose nearly as much energy as before and if you used the Jutsu you made it was better. But you had a feeling that they wouldn’t believe you if you did it in one big poof so you prepared yourself to change. “Keep everyone back. I’m going to do it slow so you can see it, which is going to make this hurt like hell.” You said to Kakashi and he nodded to you. You started and as you punched at the ground and began changing the others almost immidiatly tried to help and were confused as to why Kakashi wouldn’t let them. But little by little they watched as your grunts, yells, and sometimes a scream turned into snarls, growls, and bared teeth. After you had changed you stood there breathing heavy, like usual, but it wasn’t as bad as before. Besides it was a while since you had been in dragon form so you stretched out and flexed your wings than gave them a few courtesy flaps before turning your huge frame to your team. Your gaze was no doubt frightening as they had never seen a dragon before. They went on alert and raised their guard as you brought your head down to them.

“Max?” Sakura asked, hoping it was still you.

“It’s still me. This is what I look like as a dragon.” You said and took this as a sign to lay down to appear less threatening as well as lowering your head. “I’m not going to hurt you.” you said as if reading most of their thoughts.

“Then why were you growling and snarling at us?” Sasuke asked.

“It hurts a lot to transform. I developed a Jutsu to help it become more instantaneous but I thought you four deserved to see if done the original way first.” You said then as your moving mouth was still unnerving them a bit you placed it on the ground and sighed. It took a few moments before you saw Kakshi come over to you. He had his Sharigan out and you could see he was on his toes. You thought he would be ready for it after you told him but to his credit he was holding together quite well. He reached out a hand while the other held a Kunai. His hand eventually made contact with your snout. You looked at him then away as your eyes were causing him to shake a little. After a good deal of time he straightened and put away his knife.
13232111121122111221111111121121.title: Show and tell with the team.

132321111211221112211111111211211.content:
“I’m sorry Max. You told me about this and I acted rather foolish.” He said. You backed your head up a little so talking didn’t cause a heart attack.

“No need for all that, I know what I look like.” You said slightly off but holding it together for now. He smiled, or at least you think he did with his face almost completely covered with his ninja gear. He then called the others over and you backed your head away a little but stopped when Kakashi motioned for you to move forward as well.

“You’re a dragon.” Sakura said in amazement. “Oh sorry, half dragon.” She corrected herself, hoping the 500 foot tall dragon before her wouldn’t take offense to it.

“So this is why you are so good at fire jutsu?” Sasuke asked and you nodded slowly as any quick movement seemed to scare them.

“So you’re like me.” Naruto said and the others looked at him. “Well not exactly like me but… you have a great power inside you that everyone is afraid of.” He said as he grabbed as the seal on his stomach. By this point you all had your suspicions of what was inside him. You knew from the research you did that it was the Nine Tailed Fox. It was probably the reason you seamed connected to him sense you came to the village.

“Yes” was all you could say and looked away again.

“Can I?” said Sakura as she came a little closer with her hand out in an obvious petting or at least touching gesture. You responded by slowly bringing your head down to her and made contact with her hand. Her heart rate quickened as she rubbed around your snout. You closed your eyes and rested your head on the ground. “I’m touching a dragon. This can’t be real.” She said with more fascination than fear.

“Well we need to get moving.” Kakashi said which broke all their concentration on you. “Why don’t you carry us Max. You may not be able to fly without causing a panic but it would save a lot of time, even if you are just walking. Not to mention we can get to know you in this… form while we travel.” He suggested.

“Ok, I guess that works. But if any of you tell me to giddy up or any of that crap you’re walking.” You said in a comical tone indicating that you weren’t a pack animal but would carry them if they were polite about it. You were still unsure about others riding you other than Sarah but Kakashi had a point, as he usually did. The others tensed as you said it but were overall more relaxed that you were telling jokes instead of snarling.

“What the…” Naruto asked as he was the first to jump on. He was referring to the spike you strapped him down with. You snaked your head around to where he was.

“Can’t have you falling off if you fall asleep.” You said and he just shook his head and agreed as there wasn’t much he could do about it. The rest got on and you did the same for them. When they were all comfortable you started to walk silently through the forest.

“You know for how big you are, you can sure move quietly and pretty fast.” Naruto said and the others looked at him as if they weren’t ready for him to ask such questions.

“I’d have to be to catch food like this. Toppling over trees tends to scare off all the wildlife.” You responded and he nodded in understanding but was interrupted by a rumble from your stomach which made them all turn pale. “Speaking of which, do you mind if I catch something to eat?” you asked and they all agreed, secretly relieved that they weren’t on the menu. You crept through the woods and soon came upon a herd of deer. You snatched a few that didn’t look to important to the herd and wolfed them down in gulps, you didn’t think that your passengers would like to see you tearing into your meals.

“Do you always swallow your food like that?” Asked Naruto with another set of looks for the question.

“Not really, if I can I like to savor them and take my time with them. I just didn’t think you four would like to see me eating them like that so I just skipped a step.” You said and they again nodded and thanked you for your consideration. For the rest of the trip they asked you questions and Naruto always tended to ask the ones you didn’t want to answer. But by the time you were half way home they had asked and learned everything that you had ever experienced and fell asleep on your back. You were glad it went so well but you hoped that if anyone else found out that it would go just as smooth.
132321111211221112211111111211211.title: Kakashi calls them over.

1323211112112211122111111112112112.content:
As you all got settled back at the village you all went on more D rank missions. They were still a little nervous around you despite you being in human form but they quickly got over it as you helped with the missions a great deal. Naruto was too busy anyway competing with Sasuke to dwell on it for too long. Kakashi had you talk to the Hokage about your dragon half. You were once again pleasantly surprised at his kindness even when you transformed for him. He was certainly a very exceptional man. He agreed to keep your nature as closely guarded as Naruto’s condition. He had to let curtain people know in case they needed you but it had yet to affect you at all. After a little bit you began smelling other scents in the village that you didn’t recognize and you were particularly interested in one of them that smelled like Naruto as far as potential power output goes. You hoped onto a fence that overlooked a squabble between a newcomer and Naruto. The guy that Naruto was yelling at had a weird outfit on and had something on his back, wrapped in bandages. He was holding up Konohamaru in a rather rough manner. You were quiet enough that no one had notice you sitting on the fence as you were. You then spit a little flame at his wrist that was barely larger than a needle but effective enough to make him drop Konohamaru and put out the little flame from is clothes.

“Naruto, I can here you from across the village. Ninja are suppose to be quite.” You said and he stubbornly turned his head then consoled the little kids while keeping a lot of attention on the two that were still there.

“I was going to do that.” Said Sasuke as he juggled a rock in his hand.

“Well I can’t wait for you every time. I get board to. Besides these three smell weird.” You said.

“Great, more weaklings to piss me off.” The painted face guy said as you could see a little embarrassment. “Not to mention dumb as a rock. Can’t you leaf ninja count? One, two, where do you see a third?” he asked in a clear attempt to demean you. You simply pointed to a branch next to the one but on the other side of the truck that Sasuke was on. His face immediately drained of color as he saw a red haired boy with a gourd of sand on his back. The one that was then addressed as Kankurou started to stutter out excuses until he was silenced by the one they called Gaara, under the threat of death no less. The girl named Temari had mostly kept her mouth shut so she just went along with it. You could also see Gaara assess you and Sasuke before he started to walk away. They were stopped by Sakura asking questions and was answered by Termari informing her they were here for the chuunin exams. Sasuke and Gaara exchanged names and as you remained relatively silent Gaara almost overlooked you.

“And what is your name?” he asked. You leapt of the fence and landed near Sasuke.

“Max, just Max. Can I ask you a question?” you asked.

“You answered mine so I’ll answer one of yours.” He informed.

“Then I’ll make it quick. You seem… different than most people. I know about certain seals of certain… things that they seal in people. My question is do you have a similar situation?” you asked in a cryptic tone that you saw him understand right away. In a way his reaction was all you needed to know he had a tailed beast in him. “You don’t have to answer if it too personal. I understand that some things must remain hidden.” You said and the boy turned and started walking as if holding something back. You turned to the rest of them. “Well that was fun.” You said sarcastically than started to walk off. Soon you were called with the others and Kakashi gave each of you Chuunin exam applications. You took it and went off. You observed many other Genin from other lands and was attacted by Iruka as a test. A test that was over as you easily identified him and he left agreeing that you were ready.
1323211112112211122111111112112112.title: Meeting other land's Genin

choices: You are put on a seperate team for the second test.
13232111121122111221111111121121121.content:
You watched and almost laughed at the other candidates’ attempts to intimidate you. They were all a little cross with your group because yours was the first in the exam’s history to have more than 3 people in it. But you just kept you composure and made it to the written test. Ibiki was good at getting under peoples skin but you weren’t effected at all. You looked at the test and before he even said start you had all the answers figured out, one of few perks behind having memorized every word of every book you could find. Originally you did that to learn obscure Jutsu or help you create others but it formed a double purpose. As soon as he said start you magically wrote the answers down and flipped over your test. This caught the attention of a sentinel but because you were doing absolutely nothing accept leaning back he couldn’t do much about it. However that was what you looked like you were doing, you were really figuring a way to help your team mates.

“Hey” you said in their minds and each of them jumped a little. They knew you could read minds from their questioning while you were a dragon but this was the first time you talked to them like this. “Don’t react just look down and act like you are concentrated on your test.” You thought to them and they did so. “I’m sure you all figured out that this test is actually designed for you to cheat so it can test your ability to gather intelligence. I already finished my test so I am going to magically fill your tests out. Just don’t react and act like you are working on it while I do. Then turn them over so no one can cheat off your answers.” You instructed and you saw their bodies twitch and Naruto nodded a little but not enough to arise suspicion. At that point you took your answers and magically filled their tests out like a magical stamp. Within 5 minutes it was all done and they all turned their tests over. “Now they can’t nail us for cheating. It may be obvious that we did something but I can read that they can’t figure out what. So we pass and don’t worry about the last question. If needed, I’ll answer that one as well.” you thought to them. Naruto was laughing a little but otherwise the others just relaxed.

“What do you think you are doing?” asked Ibiki as you opened your eyes from feigning sleep. He was trying to be intimidating but you just looked up at him.

“Taking a nap.” You said simply.

“You think this is a joke?” he asked.

“No, it’s the Chuunin exams. We already finished and you can grade them if you like. But I’m not about to act like I am paying attention just so I can be docked for cheating. The safest thing for me to do is to make it obvious that I am not cheating. And what better way than to take a nap?” you asked. Ibiki turned around your test and looked in shock as all the questions were answered perfectly than placed it back on the desk and walked away.

After that little interaction the test went on and finally the final question was brought up. You had to admit that Ibiki was doing a pretty good job scaring everyone but one outburst from the charismatic Naruto and everyone stood firm. He then surprised everyone that the last question wasn’t really a question, well a not a written one anyway. So you all passed and in the middle of a good moment a loud cranky woman burst through the window and gave directions for the second test and dismissed you all.

“Thanks Max.” Naruto said as you were all walking from the exam room.

“For what?” you asked.

“For helping us with the test.” Sasuke clarified as you all walked together.

“Well, we were going to pass anyway so I didn’t really do much. I doubt the next test will be so easy.” You said and they all were quite as they thought about it. “But I’m sure we can handle it. If I have anything to say about it we will all pass no problem.” You said and they smiled at this. Having you around defiantly took the edge off. Who else can say they have a full sized dragon on their team?
13232111121122111221111111121121121.title: Written exam.

choices: Help the others in the second task.
132321111211221112211111111211211212.content:
“What!” yelled Naruto as Kakashi was talking. “I thought this was supposed to be a team effort.”

“It is but don’t say that you were able to score a perfect score on that test because you studied.” Kakashi said and he looked down. “These tests are designed to determine your worth as chuunin but if Max does everything than you three aren’t being tested.” Kakashi said.

“So I go alone for the test?” you ask.

“Yes, you can still help them if you want but you still need to get your own set of scrolls. On top of everything else it isn’t fair for your team to not only have more members but also someone that is more than capable of finishing on his own to add to the off balance. It was either this or withdrawing you out of the exam all together.” He explained.

“I guess I can find you guys and help you out. At the very least you don’t have to worry about having a dragon as an enemy.” You said and they all nodded and Kakashi disappeared.

“See you around.” Sasuke said and you waved and went to turn in your consent form.

You received your scroll and headed to a gate. You could sense hundreds of threats in the forest as you gazed into it. You had given your scroll first and without hesitation so you were near Anko to start.

“You scared?” she asked in a voice that was there to freak you out.

“Nope, just not used to not having them around. It’s quieter without Naruto around. I don’t like referring to them as enemies.” You answered.

“You need to focus on the threats in the forest, they can take care of themselves.” She said and you nodded in understanding. “Wait, you’re that kid aren’t you?” you looked at her as if to be more precise with her question. “You know, the one that… has a thing for dragons.” She asked as she found a way to ask without saying anything.

“Yeah, that’s me.” You said and flashed your eyes at her as confirmation. She took a step back at this and you sighed. “I’m not like that. You’re safe, I am half human you know and if nothing else a Leaf Village Ninja.” You said and she relaxed a bit.

“Well that takes a load off. You know I was expecting you to be a little more intimidating.” She said with her crazy smile on.

“Well I am still only 14 years old so I’m still a kid. That and my dragon form is much bigger. Even had Kakashi Sensei losing it for a minute when I showed him. It isn’t something I like to show people. They tend to either run or try and kill me. Not too thrilled about either reaction. So it is just easier for people to see me like this than as a full grown dragon. Doesn’t mean I can’t do cool stuff though.” You said as you grew wings flexed them for her than drew them back into your back.

“No offense, but I hope I never have to see it.” She said and you smiled back at her which got her off the hook. You both talked for a little bit about the test and other things that she was curious about. Not to many recognized you so now that she knew who you were she had a bunch of questions that most everyone had that knew about you.
132321111211221112211111111211211212.title: You are put on a seperate team for the second t...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122.content:
You decided to take Kakashi and Anko’s advise and let the others handle this one on their own. So as soon as the gate open you sped as fast as you could and with your quick and silent movements reached a team grabbed their scroll and headed for the tower without them even knowing you were there. You easily avoided the dangers and in a total of 10 minutes you were in the tower and finished the exam. You were greeted by an Anbu black ops member as you sat waiting for the others. Garra also got there pretty quick but sense you were already done you couldn’t help anyone inside. That was until the Anbu approached you.

“You are Max?” he said from behind his mask but you could see he was a little nervous.

“I am.” You answered.

“Anko has requested back up but we don’t have anyone available for a few hours. Can you go and make sure she is ok?” he asked.

“Alright.” You answered and with a silent relief the Anbu left and you walked off into the forest again. You made sure no one was around after going into the forest a little than used your transformation jutsu to get to dragon form. You shook your head then took off silently to the air in the dead of night where you would be nearly invisible. You followed Anko’s scent than found her staring down some rather large tigers but she wasn’t really at 100% and they were ready to attack. You quickly landed behind her with a thud as your claws shattered the rock and wood under them. The tigers moved toward Anko with a growl but you returned one and stepped over her in a clear sign of possession and protection to predators. Anko looked up at your growling head as you forced the tigers back than to run. When you were certain they were not coming back you stopped growling and looked to the injured Anko. “You ok?” you asked and she jumped as you spoke to her. You had moved around to face her but she was by no means ok with seeing you like this.

She was about to speak when she collapsed with pain as she grasped her neck. You saw a mark on her that you didn’t like the smell of.

“I’ll take that as a no.” you said and she looked at you, still not over you yet. “I finished pretty early and was just sitting around. An Anbu said you needed help and said they wouldn’t have someone available for a bit so they asked me to come by. You need a lift?” you asked.

“Well… Yes, take me to the tower.” She said, at first more contemplative but the rest more serious. You lowered your neck so she could climb on. She slip to the bottom and you wrapped her with a spike. She quickly learned the function as you took off and fly to the tower. It would take a few minutes so you had plenty of time to let her enjoy the feeling of flying. “This is nice.” She said finally

“It’s most human’s dream to fly and you are the first human in this realm I let fly with me. Mostly because I am too visible during the day. It does feel good to stretch my wings again though. Haven’t flown in a while.

“And you are ok with people riding on you?” she asked.

“Of course, as long as they don’t plan on attacking me or acting… uncivil. Although for future reference, I don’t really enjoy carting around people I don’t like. For example some of those arrogant ninja or lords that come by every once in a while. They tend to think I’m a toy or pet that they can just order around. Or at least that is what they are like in my realm. But people like you or other respectable ninja, it is a pleasure to help someone out if I can.” You said then took her down just behind the tree line. You let her off and changed back with a puff as you both made your way inside.

“Thanks for the ride Max.” she said before rushing off.

“You’re welcome.” You said but it was unlikely that she heard.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122.title: Finish the task quickly.

choices: You convince Gaara to not fight you.
13232111121122111221111111121121121222.content:
“So you all made it.” You said as you saw Naruto and the others get there.

“I thought you were going to help us.” Sakura said.

“I was, but I noticed that if I did and didn’t trust you to be able to handle it than what’s the point of being on a team. I would prefer to trust you over pampering.” You answered and they all looked tired. “But you all got here and are alive so it ended up alright.”

After that the Third was joined by some of the other Jounin to explain the preliminary round. A call was made to see who wanted to drop out and a few did. You were first along with a sound village ninja named Dosu. You had watched and figured out his attacks and other than comparatively weak skills he had that nasty little sound thing on his arm. As the others left you stared down the ninja then looked at Kakashi who gave a sign for you to take it easy and you nodded.

“I’ll make this quick.” Dosu said as he looked at you with that uncanny look on his face.

“As you wish.” You said and made a few hand signs that visually didn’t do anything than ran towards him. At your approach he swung at you and when his fist was going to glance you, you purposefully got in the way and let the punch connect. The moment it did you exploded in a furry of fire that destroyed his little toy. He was equally shocked at this as he was that you exploded so you took advantage of it and used the headhunter jutsu you saw kakashi used to bring him under the ground with his head the only visible part above it. You also pricked him with a poison needle that prevented jutsu like clone, replacement, and Substitution jutsus then leapt above ground.

“What the hell, you exploded.” He said and you smiled a little.

“That was a fire clone. Something that I have been working on. Still haven’t figured it out completely so they have a nasty habit of exploding when destroyed, making them useless in a team battle. However in a one on one battle they are quite useful.” You explained which made some of the others quite interested. As far as you knew no one had ever used a fire clone.

“This isn’t over!” he said as he tried to wiggle out.

“Yes it is.” You said and gave his head a light kick as you went by, effectively knocking him out. You were declared the winner and joined the others on the platform.

“That was so cool!” Naruto said as you got to them.

“Fire clone, when did you learn to do that?” Sasuke asked

“Same time as the shadow clone. I am pretty good with fire you know.” You said and they smiled at that. “I just never used it because of their tendency of exploding when they are destroyed. But it was the perfect thing to use to get rid of that pesky sound maker of his.”

“True enough. You also used the Head Hunter Jutsu. That’s pretty advanced” Kakashi added and they looked at you just for you to shrug and look at them as if to ask ‘are you really surprised?’ “right.” Kakashi said then the rest of the preliminaries came and went. There was a bunch of neat Jutsu that you put on your to do list. When Garra took his turn he was a little arrogant after to which you just ignored him. You could tell he wasn’t used to being ignored so he followed you as you went home that night. You had requested a place that had a little more room and they had given you a dwelling that was little better than a shack but the outside was more than adequate as you lay on the grass and look at the stars.
13232111121122111221111111121121121222.title: A fight with sound.

132321111211221112211111111211211212221.content:
Leaning against a small rock so your back was supported you looked out into the forest. You sometimes enjoyed just observing life in its natural state. With your heightened senses you could sense everything within a great distance but your moment of tranquility was interrupted by a presence that only could have been Gaara. He was coming to you and you just sighed, knowing this guy wouldn’t leave you alone.

“Gaara, I doubt you came here for small talk so what is your purpose for disturbing my peaceful rest?” you asked without even looking at him as he came to you from your left. He was rather quiet and probably could have sneaked a lot closer if you were someone else.

“I came to kill you.” he said with very little emotion and the only emotion that was present was desire.

“Oh really, and what makes you think that you can? Perhaps you think because you have a tailed beast in you. That it makes you strong, or perhaps you think that all people are as weak as the people you have killed so far.” You started and his eyes showed their first emotions since you interacted with him. He was surprised that you knew what he was and confused that you were so calm and confident. “I have no desire to fight a weakling like you.” you said with no emotion and continued to look into the forest. You felt sand run across the ground toward you.

“I exist to take life and I will not cease to exist.” He said with a slight urgency as his sand wrapped around you then lifted you off the ground. You had seen what it was capable of and at his current strength your scales were more than enough to hold his sand at bay.

“You ignorant fool. You are already doing that by yourself.” His eyes increased in bloodlust and tried to crush you but you weren’t affected. “Everyone dies eventually and there is only one way to live beyond that point, at least that I know of. That is in the hearts of those we touch. After I die I will live on in the hearts of those I have touched. But you, you will die alone and be forgotten like dust in the wind. If you kill everyone there you will cease to exist when you die. No one will remember you, no one will miss that you are gone. Because of your actions you will be forgotten.” You said and after he exhausted enough chakra trying to crush you his sand dropped you and retracted to him.

“I will not cease to exist, I won’t!” he cried.

“Then prove me wrong Gaara. Touch someone so they carry your existence to the next generation and make you immortal.” You said and he looked up at you as you looked down at him. He was after all just a little kid. You didn’t have any intension of killing him. “I like to rest on the grass so clean your sand up when you leave.” You said as you headed out into the forest, the same forest of death that the others had just got out of and feared. However this was a place that you could relax as a dragon without prying eyes. It was also an awesome place to train.

“Wait!” said Gaara as he looked at you with longing eyes. “Are you my friend?” he asked as he obviously had a very limited definition of friend.

“No Gaara, I’m not. You have to earn my trust before you can have that distinction. Trying to kill me is not a good way to start. You need to learn how to make friends instead of killing everyone you meet. I am not scared of you so I am not going to sugar coat this. If you want to be friends with me you need to prove to be what I consider to be a friend.” You said and his eyes went wide as if you broke his heart.

“But if I am not your friend than why did you not kill me when I tried to kill you?” he asked, obviously not getting your thought process.

“Because I put a high value on human life.” You said and the words hit him and you started to walk again than vanished into the forest but left him with a few last words. “That and I would like to be your friend in the future, if I can trust you.” you said then left him to think on it and off to catch your dinner.
132321111211221112211111111211211212221.title: Gaara tries to fight you.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You trained in relative peace for the third exam. You had seen a lot of useful jutsu and you soon learned them all, definitely not as good as their original wielders but learned them all the same as well as counters for them. However no matter how hard you tried you couldn’t figure out how to keep you fire clones from exploding, and in only got worse when you were in dragon form because of your size it increased the explosion. But you had shadow clones you could use so you weren’t too worried about it. Waiting for the applicants to finish their matches in the exam was long but entertaining. You got to see Naruto use the Nine Tails charkra, and a host of other jutsu from the others. However a genjutsu fell over the arena to which you broke its hold on you then joined Kakashi as he fought the invading ninja. You were all relatively surprised at the attack but had little time to dwell on it. There was scores of enemy ninja as well as giant snakes that they summoned. The villagers were out of the way but they were causing a lot of damage. Then it came to Kakashi giving you and the others assignments. A group went to go help Sasuke but you were held behind for a bit.

“Max.” Kakashi said as you knocked out an enemy ninja at his back before Guy Sensei got there. “While the others are concentrated on the ninja I need you to take care of the snakes.” He said and you looked at him as if to ask if he was sure. Taking care of multiple animals of that size in a manner he was referring to required you to change to dragon and he nodded than looked back and deflected an incoming Kunai.

“What about after I’m done?” you asked.

“Ha, you think you can take out such enemies by yourself?” Guy Sensei asked in a clear jab at Kakashi but in a rivalry sort of way.

“After you are done assist from the air with the other ninja. You are free to use lethal force but try not to kill too many of the ninja. You can destroy the snake anyway you wish.” He instructed.

“Understood Kakashi Sensei.” You returned and jumped to the field. A few kunai immediately came at you but you deflected them with your now showing tail. You transformed with you jutsu which made the rest of the incoming shuriken and kunai bounce harmlessly off your scales. You blew the smoke away and both the enemy and your allies were stunned for a second at your sudden presence but the current battle drew them back in as you let out a growl and took off to the sky.

With you keen eyes you saw almost everything that was going on and quickly located the snakes Kakashi was talking about. They were nearly as long as you were if short by 100+ feet. The first one you came to was attacking a gate with the guarding ninja not doing so well. As the snake attacked you blew a fire ball and its head erupted and was burnt off its body, the snake crashing down dead. You soared past and ninja were scared but, like the arena, they were quickly snapped back to the battle. You reached your second target and this one was too close to humans to take out like the other one and it had enemy ninja riding it. You roared to catch its attention and as it stopped mid strike from a downed set of Leaf ninja you dropped on its body with your claws piercing multiple parts of its body. With a quick snap you grabbed the half of the snake’s head in your jaws along with some of its neck and dug in. Ripping the piece from either side with a few enemy ninja along with it, you chewed a little and gulped it down.

“Yuck, these snakes taste like crap.” you said which broke the stunned silence in the area and you took into the air to go for the next target.

You took the others out as quickly as you could and finally there was only two left. They were together in an attempt to use numbers in sight of you taking out the others one by one. One of the snakes watched you fly towards them while the other had some guy that was near their size. You assumed it was Chouza, Chouji’s father in his full expansion jutsu. The snake was constricting the man and you saw another corps the man must have killed. With only a second to decide you went straight for the one around Chouza. You were able to grab the snake by the neck with your jaws, jaws that were by this point dripping with snake blood, and ripped the head off and gulping down the meat still in your mouth. But even though it was the right move it wasn’t the smart one. The act left you completely vulnerable to the other snake and it stuck, wrapping a few coils around you then squeezing. Unlike most enemies this snake had enough strength to cause you serious injury like this. You snarled and growled as it quickly worked on you. But it forgot one thing, your tail. With a quick flick you flattened it and started swinging it back and forth, cutting snake coils as it hit them. Eventually it minced them all the way up to the head that was clamped on your wing but it soon became lifeless and dropped. With a little more effort you slit the coils off Chouza as well then toppled over.

“Damn.” You said as you tried to get back up. You felt poison coming from the wound on your wing, not to mention the few broken bones from the snake’s constriction. They must have coated the snake’s teeth with it before the attack, or possibly during after you started killing them. Some enemy ninja saw you collapse and tried attacking but you breathed a heavy amount of fire at them, which incinerated any in the path they were coming from. But then you fell over again, snarling and growling you tried to get up but it wasn’t working. You could even transform. As the poison crept through you induced that it must be powerful, enough to instantly kill a human. But sense you weren’t human it merely paralyzed you.

“What is it?” Chouza finally asked after he got up. He was bigger than the others and you were sprawled out almost limp so he thought it ok to approach despite your still blood soaked jaws and your snarling. Most of the Jounin were informed about you and at this point glad for your help.

“Poison. I think they laced the snake’s teeth with it. It’s paralyzing me.” You said then tried to get up again but a hand rested on your side, pushing you gently back down.

“Max is it?” and you nodded against the ground your head laid on. “You’ve done enough, rest and recover.” Chouza said and you once again nodded as you were too paralyzed to speak. You were also exhausted from the poison. You drifted off to sleep and hoped everyone would be ok.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The attack.

choices: You have to be locked up.
He brings you with Naruto to find Tsunade.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You woke a few times as you slept but only for a brief second as you went in and out of consciousness. You were being moved but you didn’t know where or how. However when you finally got to wake with a majority of your strength restored you still couldn’t move. Not because of the effects of the poison, as that had already been purged from your system. The snake had either been really smart to bite you in your comparatively weaker skin on your wings, or just really lucky. You felt most of you injuries were healed minus a scare where the bite was, yet another one to add to your collection. But you saw the reason you couldn’t move was a generous amount of restraints. You were in one of the practice fields but a makeshift building had been erected to shield out onlookers with Anbu guarding the entrances. You didn’t know if it was intentional but they had left windows in the ceiling so the sun was covering for your lack of food. You tried to move each part of your body but almost every inch of it was chained to the ground so you couldn’t get so much as a twitch of momentum to possibly break you binds. The chains rattled as you tried anyway but without any room to move you couldn’t muster enough strength to break them. You decided after trying for a bit that it was wasting to much energy for just the sun to replenish it so you just looked around. If push came to shove you did have a few things that could get you out but they were crazy and wouldn’t even consider them unless you had no other option.

“Don’t even bother.” Came a voice and your eye on that side of your head snapped to the source. “Those binds are treated to resist chakra so you really have no chance of breaking them.” An old man said, being accompanied by an old woman. You didn’t really know their names but they were known as the “elders” in the village.

“The Third might have been ok with you wondering around but we sure aren’t. It is unfortunate that he has passed but it does give us an opportunity to remedy some of his mistakes.” The woman stated and your eyes narrowed at the news. The Third Hokage was dead? You couldn’t believe your ears. Who could have killed him? Why would someone want to kill such a kind man? Then anger started to combine with your sudden shock and grief. You didn’t know why you had neglected this before, perhaps because you were in human form a majority of the time. But your retracted spikes started to come out and shredded the chains enough for you to move and there by easily break the rest of them. The two headed for the door but your blocked it with your tail. An ominous growl hit the air as you brought your head down to face them, there wasn’t much room to stretch in the thin building anyway.

“Who killed him?” you asked, still in a growl.

“Orochimaru…” one said in a whimper in response to your demand.

“Where is he?” you asked next in a clear indication on what your intensions were.

“They don’t know, none of us do.” Said a voice from your right, it was Kakashi’s. You turned to look at him and another who was standing next to him. To most your eyes were very frightening and unreadable but Kakashi and a few select others could, to some degree. Your were not in a bloodlust at the moment or even that angry, more sad and guilty. There was also a strong tie to the Third as well as your loyalty to him that dictated an almost vengeful response. No one picks on people close to you without serious consequences. You then looked at the older pair for a moment and now saw they were scared pretty bad so you retracted your tail and transformed to human again. Your tail and wings were still out as you walked around trying to deal with the information you were given. Your wings flexed as they were unable to in full dragon form from in here but they did so now as your tail twitched and cycled. Your tail in human form was just as long, if you wanted, but more proportionally thick to your human body. Eventually you had to cool down and take a breath so you went to a wall and sat against it, breathing hard but making a noticeable attempt to calm yourself and slow your breathing as your dragon parts retracted fully.

“I don’t understand… anything.” You said simply and buried your head in your hands to relieve some of the stress but it didn’t seem to be working.

“You don’t need to.” Kakashi said to which you looked up to him. “That’s out job. Let us worry about it.” He said and you nodded than started to look around again then your eyes fell on the broken chains you were held with. “We told them they wouldn’t hold you.”

“It was a mistake to try.” Came a voice from the man. “We know next to nothing about dragons. Even if it was right to do, which it wasn’t, there is no way to know what would work without a dragon testing it out.”

“But he is dangerous. Just look at what he did to those snakes. If he were to…” started the old woman but was silenced by a glare from the man near Kakashi.

“He exposes himself and gets poisoned for you and your reward is to throw him in prison. That is not how the Leaf treats its own and you know it.” He said and the elders looked like a dog with their tail between their legs. Whoever this man is, he is respected enough to make them think about their actions.

“We have no choice Jiryaiya. He originally wasn’t from our village. The law dictates that we need to confine dangerous elements that’s origins are not of the leaf. Noble as his intensions are we must follow the law until a new Hokage is installed and can override them, like the Third did.” The elderly woman said. This little bit of information hit Jiryaiya like a sour lemon. It looked like he was looking for a way out of this mess but you had your doubts at the moment, although those doubts could’ve just been an aftermath of the information that was just shoved at you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You wake in dragon form.

choices: She can stay but you have to train her.
She will be trained as a Leaf Village ninja.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It was decided that you would remain in dragon form and in the Forest of death until Mater Jiriaya and Naruto got back from retrieving the Tsunade and she became the Fifth Hokage. You were allowed to do pretty much anything inside the forest, barring burning it down. This was because Kakashi and Sasuke were hospitalized after a run in with Itachi Uchiha, and since Sakura was pretty much attached to Sasuke’s bedside there was no one willing to take care of you in a prison setting, mainly feeding you. But the forest of death had more than enough room and food that you could chow on. A barrier was erected so no one could see in and you couldn’t leave, unless you destroyed it. The barrier went straight up so you could fly around to stretch your legs, or wings as they were. Humans weren’t allowed in so anything in the area was fair game. There was even a few enemy ninja that had used the forest as a haven when they couldn’t get away from the leaf in time. You escorted them out and they were very surprised and grateful that you didn’t eat them, as you told them that you were authorized to. So it was a surprise when you saw a group of people in the forest near the tower and in a field that was big enough for you to land. You observed them from high above what a normal human could see and when you saw that the people the woman in the green coat had with her were; Kakashi, Naruto, Sakura, Sasuke, Jiraiya, and a few Anbu you descended to meet them. You fly over them once close to the ground then landed gentle enough to not cause any damage, minus your body weight and claws. You circled to meet them, felxing your wings before you laid down so you were more on their level. Although for some reason you smelled a peculiar scent in the air, if you didn’t know better you would say that it was Sarah. But you didn’t see her and the scent was ominous instead of directed so you brushed it off, for now.

“Hi everyone, long time no see.” You said in a calm voice. It had been a little while and as you looked at the woman in the green coat you had to admit that she gave off the same feeling as Master Jiriaya did. Although she was visually in awe of your presence rather than frightened, which you didn’t mind in the least.

“So you can talk.” The woman in the green coat said in wonder.

“Of course I can talk. All dragons can talk, well in different fashions but still talk none the less. My name is Max and yours would be?” you asked as politely as possible and without opening your mouth to much.

“She’s Lady Tsunade and the fifth Hokage.” Kakashi explained and you looked directly at her with the statement, making her flinch a little.

“I’m sorry, honor to meet you Lady Tsunade.” You said more formerly with a slight but noticeable bow of your head and neck.

“Wow, you really are a dragon.” She said and this time you just nodded then smiled without showing any teeth.

“Hey Max!” interrupted Naruto to which you looked at him as Lady Tsunade continued to look you over. “We got a surprise for you.”

“Please don’t say it’s another half cooked dairy cow. The thought was nice but it was a little messy, not to mention unsightly.” You said and the half that knew what you were talking about laughed a little. You had admitted that you liked both cooked foods and raw foods. So he tried to do both of them but it was rather… interesting and not in the good way. The raw parts mixed with the cooked which made both rot and stink so bad it took a month to get the smell out of the ground where Naruto dragged it.

“No, this one presented herself. She asked for you and we thought bringing her would be a way of saying sorry for them locking you up in here after saving the village.” Kakashi said and you sighed out a sigh of relief. One of the Anbu came forward and after a second she rid herself of the black cloak. It must have been treated to hide scent because after that Sarah’s scent came from her and when she rid herself of the mask you froze in awe as Sarah stood before you.

“When…, how…, Sarah you’re here.” You said, stuttering over your words as you brought your head closer and she was at this point running and threw herself on your snout when she got there. You were both 16 years old at this point and you couldn’t be happier at the moment as she hugged the top you’re your snout as much as her arms would allow.

“Max, I missed you.” she said.

“I tried to look for a way back. I couldn’t find one…” you started but Sarah sat up and shushed you while petting you like she used to.

“I know you did. I was told that there was none from this side. Kara and I rose so much hell to find a way that they sent me here. Kara remained there because she couldn’t fit in the portal. Luckily your Sensei was the one to find me and here I am.” She explained then slid off of you so you could talk easier.
