“I’m glad you’re here. But are you ok with staying here in this realm, probably forever?” you asked with a little worry.

“I came here already knowing that. Plus you’ll show me won’t you?” she asked.

“Sure I may not be the best but I can teach you a few tricks. But if you want actual training you’re going to need to ask them.” You said and you turned her attention to the others. They all seemed content with you saying hello to Sarah and were observing highly so they knew what you were referring to. Someone who knows little about Ninja wouldn’t last too long so the question was if they would train her.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You have to be locked up.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You wanted to catch up with Sarah but the new school year was starting and they had agreed to enroll her at the academy and in time become a full fledged Leaf Village Ninja. You said your goodbyes and she was escorted by the Anbu before the rest of you started talking again. It was understood that you might not see her all the time, but some is better than none. As you turned your attention back to Lady Tsunade she seemed fascinated with you and took every move you made into her mind to process. You were the only dragon around so there was hundreds of things buzzing through her head, from stories to ingredients for new her medical needs.

“Thank you Lady Tsunade.” You said to her with an obvious gratitude that almost radiated from you. “Is there anything I can do for you? Perhaps something you are afraid to ask or would otherwise be improper?”

“Ah well… no that’s ok. It is the job of the Hokage to get to know and help those under her.” she said to relieve you of some dept to her for excepting Sarah into the village. But you could still see there was something just on the other side of her mind. You were tempted to read it but you had promised the Third to never do that unless you were asked or to an enemy.

“Ha ha… She wants a ride into the sky.” Naruto said then received a whack over the head by Sakura. Lady Tsunade seemed embarrassed and almost instantly annoyed at Naruto for saying it.

“Is the Barrier still up?” you asked to Kakashi and he shook his head. “Then I guess I could drop you all off instead of walking through the forest again.” You said and Naruto almost jumped onto your back. The others looked at him but you just smiled. “It’s Naruto, what’re you gonna do?” you said and they all agreed. Trying to keep a lid on Naruto was a losing battle, for anyone. You lowered your neck so they could step up more easily and reluctantly at first but they all got on. Most, even if they don’t admit it, dreamed about flying. Since there wasn’t a lot that could take them into the air you were the next best thing. As they got settled in you strapped them down with spikes that Kakashi explained to Lady Tsunade and Master Jiraiya.

“Alright, take it slow Max.” he said as you started moving and spread your comparatively massive wings. You looked at the two new ones and they both had a death grip on the spikes you provided for them to hold on to. You nodded and with a few waves you took off and headed for the sky. You were going slow but for them it was a pretty decent speed. You went higher and higher until you were above what little clouds there was that day. Once you hit a very decent altitude you leveled off and soared at an angle so they could see the ground.

“Is that?” Tsunade asked as the village was still visible but not very clear.

“The Village, yes it is. How far up are we Max?” Kakashi asked.

“About 30,000 feet give or take.” You said back as you flew.

“I thought he said to take it slow.” Master Jiraiya said as he just got over his upset stomach from your ascent to this height.

“That was as slow as I could. It was about 1% of my speed.” You informed and he looked like he swallowed a bug.

“Can you take us down? Not that I mind the ride but I still have a lot of work to do. Those old relics are so eager to bore me with their “necessary” prattle.”Tsunade asked with a sigh.

“That can’t be easy. I accidently scared them to much when they told me about Orochimaru. Got to say that I don’t envy you in that situation. But if you ever want to fly again all you have to do is ask.” You offered.

“Thanks but doesn’t it feel… degrading for people to pet you and ride you like an animal?” she asked.

“If that is what they think of me when they are doing it than yes. But otherwise no it feels natural. There is a reason why Dragons usually had riders with them. As much human there is in me there is an equal amount of Dragon as well, as you can see. That means I have the temper of a dragon while the reason of a human, the Knowledge of a human but the wisdom of a Dragon, and yes as the instinctual side would dictate, I do enjoy getting pet and being useful like an animal or dragon in my position would. Though if you ask me to carry someone that treats me like a pet or toy and they get to much they may ride the rest of the way in my stomach.” you said and you could hear an audible gulp. “I have two stomachs, one for digesting food and the other for storage and healing where someone is safe and protected. But if someone doesn’t know any better, the moist and dark environment could easily be mistaken for the digestion stomach.

“Healing?” Tsunade asked and the others clued in as well.

“I know magic as well as healing jutsu. But the main problem for both is that you lack the concentration to effect the whole body at once, even if it means your hands aren’t that big. Well if the person is surrounded by me I can contract the stomach walls to press on them all at once and heal them more effectively. Kind of like healing a bird that is small enough to fit in your hands. But I’m not sure the extent or the effectiveness it has. The only one I tried it on was Sarah, when she was badly injured. So I know it works on potentially lethal gashes and cuts but beyond that I’m not sure.” You explained and most got it except, of course, Naruto. All he got was that you could swallow people and either heal them or digest them.

“That’s good to know. Now if you don’t mind taking me to my new office. You can land on the ceiling if you want.” She offered.

“As you wish. Hold on.” You said and as she did you dove to your destination with some of them screaming in a combination of fear and thrill. You were pretty sure Master Jiraiya would lose his lunch but for now they were all enjoying it.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She will be trained as a Leaf Village ninja.

choices: A child runs to you for protection, from one of the puppets.
You're sitting against a sacrifice pole for the puppet master.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Max, thanks for coming.”

“Always a pleasure Lady Tsunade.” You said back. She had taken a rather high shine to you after giving her a dragon scale for her to experiment with. She even let you roam around free again. Of course size was an issue so you had to remain in human form but she also let you fly around in either form which helped. Not that you had a lot of free time while helping the village rebuilding and Sarah train. She had a lot of catching up to do and was moving along insanely fast. Her high intellect had her learning things in a small fraction of the time, she was already performing midlevel jutsu and getting closer to beating Skikamaru at different selected strategy games.

“I was wondering if you could go on a mission for me?” she asked.

“I’m a Leaf ninja, of course I will. As long as it is clear that I am doing it for you because I trust you, like the Third I have a lot of respect for you. You are the only one of the nations that has a dragon at their full disposal. So use me in whatever area you need.” You answered and she smiled at the sentiment.

“That word has spread pretty far as well. It makes it easier to send you on missions if I don’t have to worry about keeping a lid on you being a dragon. In fact this mission was sent in hoping you would be the one to be assigned.” She said, holding a paper that looked like a message. “In a village on the edge of the land of fire someone is causing trouble. Something close to an army of soldiers come through their streets every night. Until recently they were just a weird occurrence that caused no harm. They are not human they look like puppets that puppet master would use but for there to be so many is unheard of.”

“You said ‘until recently’. Does that mean something happened?” you asked.

“In the last month people have gone missing or have been attacked by them for no apparent reason. Your mission is to solve this problem. If you want to address the leader or try to do it without fighting or destroy all of the puppets, it is up to you. But you are there to stop them so act accordingly.” She instructed.

“As you wish.” You said with a bow than turned to leave. When you closed the door to the room you saw her smile at you but not for you to see. Ordering around a dragon must be exhilarating.

“Awe, you’re going on a mission?” Sarah protested as it meant you would be gone for a good amount of time.

“It comes with being a ninja. I’ll be back as soon as I can.” You said and she pouted at it. She didn’t like being away from your and almost demanded that you take her flying on almost a daily basis. “I’m sure you have a lot of jutsu to learn and I can leave you with a new one to learn.” You offered and handed her a scroll with a shadow hiding jutsu that you just learned. She liked shadow and lightning style justu the most. She almost forced Naruto to show her the Shadow clone jutsu and Shikimaru the shadow possession jutsu. Kakashi wisely avoided her when she was in the mood to learn the lightning blade.

“I guess it’s ok. But you are spending the whole day with me when you get back.” She demanded as she took the scroll and gave you a little kiss on the cheek.

“Of course, I look forward to it.” You said and with a few more goodbye remarks you headed off to the village.

True to your word, you hurried there at a very high rate of speed that sometimes shook the trees as you went passed them. Finally you reached the village and saw almost nothing as you walked through the streets. It was morning by this time and either they were all still asleep or they were hiding from whatever army it was that came through every night. You continued to walk through the village until you got to what looked like a main building for whomever lead the village. You could sense multiple eyes on you but you paid them no heed as you knocked on the door. You heard voices inside but no one answered. You knocked again and still there was nothing. So you looked around and ground a lost near the front of the building. You made your way over and sat with your back against it, waiting for someone to come so you could start the mission.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A mission.

choices: She doesn't and you eat her.
The town leader pleads on her behalf.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
The village remained silent until you heard/felt large thuds from a currently unknown source. You Smelled around and found the scent of something like a human but much bigger coming your way. You thought it might be someone from the town at first but the quivering humans in their homes negated that theory. You saw a few faces poke out of windows and a cry off in a remote part of the village but other than that the constant thuds were only joined by wood clanking sounds. Finally you saw who was coming, A large 60 foot tall human woman and about 100 puppets around her. She was either a giant of using the expansion jutsu, either way you could sense chakra threads connecting her to the puppets as they marched in front of her. She was very voluptuous, perhaps too much. Kind of like those people who are at the top of the “hot chart” but tries to improve herself more and it backfires.

“Wow, have to say that I wasn’t expecting the village to comply so quickly.” She said as she looked down at you.

“I don’t know what you are referring to. I was sent here from the Leaf Village to sort out trouble with puppets. No one answered when I came knocking so I decided to rest here, end of story. Judging on the puppets you have I would guess you are the one controlling them and causing all the trouble, am I correct?” You asked as you stood up to face her. She on the other hand laid down so she could better observe you. She flaunted her body but you were unaffected. If you wanted a big woman like her you would have taught the expansion jutsu to Sarah or brought Kara along to this realm. No this was just bordering on annoying.

“That’s right, and what are you going to do about it?” she asked then pushed you with a giant finger to which you went flying but easily caught yourself and stood back up like nothing happened. “Little man.”

“Well the Hokage gave me free reign to deal with you as I saw fit. So it comes down to what you decide. I will ask only once that you stop your behavior and to stop causing trouble. If you accept than mission accomplished and I can go home. If you refuse than I guess I’ll have you for lunch.” You said in a bored expression as your stomach growled. You didn’t relish the thought of eating her but you were hungry and it would be better than killing her and leaving her body to rot. But your contemplation was interrupted by her laughing at you.

“You’re funny little man. You threatening to eat me, I do believe you have it backwards. Perhaps you don’t know who I am. I am Selina, the last remaining giantess and I eat people your size for breakfast.”

“I am Max and even if you haven’t heard the name you should have heard of me indirectly. You should ask yourself why the Leaf Village sent me out by myself instead of in a squad like they usually do. Then ask what one unit in the Leaf Village could handle a mission like this and threaten to eat you. I gave you enough clues the way it is so let’s see if you can figure it out but my offer stands. I strongly suggest you figure it out before answering.” You advised.

“I don’t pay attention to stuff that far away. So why don’t you just tell me what you are referring to and I’ll decide.” She said as she playfully blew a gust of wind at you.

“No dice lady. I don’t go around flaunting myself to others. If you don’t already know that that is your fault for not paying attention. So this decision just got a lot more difficult for you. I have given you a warning so I’m free from any moral obligation after you answer. Know that no amount of begging will help you if you choose the latter of the options I gave. Besides I have a feeling that if you don’t choose to leave on your own than you will just come back when I leave.”

“Perceptive aren’t you? I don’t think I will give up such a rich feeding ground to you.” she said than made a grab for you. You thought about dodging but you needed to get out of the village or your transformation would wreck more than you wanted. “Let’s go somewhere more private little man. Wouldn’t want my little feeding ground getting all messed up now.” She said seductively and walked off to an open field behind a wall of trees. This was perfect as you could fight and transform without anyone seeing you, well most of you. You were big enough to dwarf the trees around you but even so it was better than nothing. As soon as she sat down again and started to “play” with her food you broke her hold and jumped a good distance away. “Ow!” she said as she nursed the part of her wrist you whacked with your tail.

“Well I can’t say that I am happy with your choice, but at least this way my mission is completed and I get a free meal out of the deal.” You said then with a flaming mass that signified your form transformation jutsu you changed to your dragon form. The sudden change in her situation made Selina fall back and try to run but you quickly pinned her down under your claw so she was facing up and into your gaze. “Lunch time.”

“Wait!” she said as you started and you stopped halfway with her head almost entering your jaws. You pulled back and looked at her.

“What is it Selina?” you asked, hoping she gave you a reason not to eat her. As much as you had to admit the idea made your stomach growl with excitement you didn’t like eating humans, even large ones.

“Please don’t… I don’t want to…” she cried at her sudden predicament.

“Give me a reason not to. I need to finish this mission and you are the only thing in the way of that. Not to mention I warned you, did you think I was joking?” you responded
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You're sitting against a sacrifice pole for...

choices: You get back to bad news.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“I’ll speak for her.” said a voice to which you both turned your heads to see a human, who’s scent you recognized as one in the building you had knocked at. He seemed well kept if a little nervous. “Would you be willing to let her go if we came to an arrangement?” he asked.

“That depends. The Hokage gave me this mission from the leader of this village. I was told that I had to solve the trouble by any means I saw fit. I do not want to kill anyone but if she won’t stop or continues to cause trouble I will have to do what I must. So in short this whole thing hinges on me completing the mission. Do you have an idea that would save her life?” you asked.

“I would…” Selina started but you growled at her which cut her off.

“You have lost your right to speak. You will remain silent until I allow you to speak.” You said and she nodded he understanding.

“What if you burn all the puppets and we set up a contract that sais she will protect this village as well as take orders from only you or the Hokage. That way you solved the puppet problem and she is no longer a threat.” He asked.

“Why do you want to save her so bad? It would’ve been easier and safer for me to just eat her. You know that and you are still here defending her, why?” you asked back, not really getting it and not willing to expended the energy to read his mind.

“She… She reminds me of a daughter I lost to disease a long time ago. Their likeness is so close that people in the village actually thinks that my daughter never died, she just ran away and came back like she is. I admit and know that she isn’t my daughter but I just can’t help but to protect her.” he said as he looked Selina in the face with tears in his eyes then back at yours.

“Damn… why can’t this be a simple mission?” you said as you thought about it. You then materialized a contract and it floated in the air between them. “This is a contract that states that she will not harm anyone that is a part of the village unless given permission by the person or the current leader. It also binds her to do what I tell her to do. If this agreement is breached at any time it will send her location and mark her for me to deal with. To sign it you must only put a drop of blood on it.” You said and released he closest arm. She was hesitant but the man did so without hesitation. He flinched a little as she brought her hand over to him but she stopped with a finger facing up.

“Do you mind?” she asked and he nodded then cut a small hole in her finger so some blood could seep out. She let it drop on the paper to which it glowed then floated over to the village leader.

“Where are the puppets?” you asked and she looked the other way to where she kept them. You saw under massive army and with a large breath you spat flames across them. When the flames ceased there was not a single puppet left. “The contract only allows for one leader at a time. So when you die your blood will be voided and the next drop after that will bind that person to it.” You said than turned to look Selina in the face. “You better be thankful. He just saved your life so don’t forget it.” You said then lifted your claw and backed away from them, taking a seated position. She immediately got up and recovered while checking her body for flaws and injuries. Then she hesitated under your gaze but turned to the man who saved her.

“Thank you sir.” She said as she respectfully bowed to him. She was lifted by his hand on her bowed cheek.

“You may not be my daughter but I hope we will be able to mend your relationship with us and maybe you will eventually be that.” He said and you didn’t know why for now but she smiled at him. They were brought back to reality with a large gust of wind as you took off into the sky.

“You both take care. Maybe if I come by again it won’t be to eat you. I’d like that.” You said than with a thankful bow from the man you sped off to go and report to Lady Tsunade.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The town leader pleads on her behalf.

choices: You get there in time to help fight.
You are too late and help with transportation and healing.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
After you arrived back in the village you noticed none of the other Genin were in scent range but with them being ninja as well you just brushed it off as they may have been on missions. First you changed to human form then went to go see Lady Tsunade to file your report. When you arrived Master Jiraiya was also in the room as they talked. You gave your report and she was concerned but in the end delighted that the mission was completed with no deaths and gaining a valuable resource.

“Max, we need you to go on another mission. Something happened when you were away but before that we need to ask you something. What do you know about black fire.” she asked as Master Jiraiya also was intently observing as well.

“It is the panicle of fire breathing for dragons. Only very high level dragons can use it but no matter how high they are it is the one set of flames that can burn us. It is so hot that not even water can put it out right away. It also has a nasty habit of spreading because the area around it is so hot it spreads rapidly. To give you an idea of how hard it is I can only produce black flames for a maximum of 30 minutes at full breath before my energy gets low enough to be fatal. But even a teaspoon of the stuff would be enough to burn down an entire village if left on its own. How do you know about it?” you asked.

“A rogue ninja came by and used it while he fought us.” Jiraiya stated.

“A human capable of producing black flames? That must be an impossibly strong jutsu.” You marveled.

“Yes he is quite strong but he left as it seemed to take its toll on him. Anyway the mission I wish for you to go on is an aid mission. You probably noticed the absence of most of the Genin in the village. That is because Sasuke has been taken.” She said and at this information your eyes turned red. “I see that you understand but your mission is not to rescue him. Reason being he might have gone willingly so we left it up to the Genin to assess what his intensions are. Your mission is to make sure the rest survive. Orochimaru has some strong followers and he rarely leaves things done halfway so he most likely has some kind of escort with Sasuke, and they won’t be pushovers. I have already enlisted the help of the Hidden Sand Village and sent Kakashi as well. I just have a bad feeling so as they are part of your team I thought you would also like to help.” She said but also asked.

“So to be clear. I am to help fight the guards or kidnappers and make sure all the others aren’t dead by the conclusion of the whole thing.” You stated and she nodded. “What if I meet Sasuke while I’m doing that?” you asked.

“If you can convince him to come back than go ahead but do not force the issue. At this point he has probably crossed the border anyway so bringing him back will only be for execution or imprisonment.” She advised.

“I understand and thank you. I’ll do my best.” You said and visibly resisted the urge to rush out of the room. You politely excused yourself and went directly to the roof. You then changed and took off into the air and raced toward the direction of where they were supposed to be. You had a feeling that you might get there too late to help with any fighting but you or they might get lucky.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You get back to bad news.

choices: You have to carry more in your gut.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
To your delight you weren’t too late as you could smell and hear multiple battles going on. However you had to make two pit stops as you saw Choji and Neji in near death situations. You debated it and with a lot of reluctance swallowed them and started to heal them in your storage gut. You also squished the walls in on them so if and when you fought they wouldn’t be disturbed. That done you headed over to the closest fight which was Kiba’s with Akamaru already down. You could smell another scent that you recognized but didn’t have time to judge it so you dropped down, crushing trees and such but away from Kiba and Akamaru. The attacking ninja backed off from his assault as you stood over Kiba.

“You ok?” you asked without taking your gaze off of the enemy.

“Hey! you mind getting off my puppet?” a voice came from the direction of the scent you had smelled earlier. It was Kankuro from the Sand Village.

“As soon as you tell me what it is doing next to Kiba and why I shouldn’t torch it.” You growled which got him to back off. You were after all a very big dragon and not someone to get on one’s bad side.

“Well for starters we are on a mission that was requested by YOUR Hokage.” He answered.

“Well in that case.” You said then spat a fireball toward him. He dodged but the one behind him didn’t as it engulfed the attacking enemy and soon only ash remained. After that you took your claw off of his puppet and looked at the bewildered enemy ninja. The ninja then tried attacking in blind rage with another fireball he too was nothing more than ash. “If you are ok here I’m going to go help the others.” you said as you cleared the area and walked around so you were facing the three before you.

“By all means don’t break a sweat.” Kiba joked and you just smiled a little then took off to the next battle.

It was a little further but you reached it and was having a hard time flying as the wind started to pick up. Then a gust blew a few trees down and you saw Shikamaru and a sand ninja you remembered as Temari fighting a girl with a flute. You soared just above them in circles which caught the three’s attention.

“Hey you need help?” You asked down as you circled.

“Looks like we’re fine after a brief conversation with Temari. “Kiba and Akamaru should be fighting close by.” He yelled up.

“You don’t have to yell, I can hear you just fine. I already took care of that. He sent me over here so if you don’t need help I’ll go over to help Gaara and Lee out, if they need it. If you go and gather the others and meet us over there I’ll give you all a ride back.” You said and he nodded to which you sped off and you could hear a sigh come from the enemy as you left, which you laughed a little at. It wasn’t long before you saw a large wave of sand hit someone and when you flew over it the sand rumbled as it obeyed its master. You soared in circles around the now sandy field then when Gaara got up and Lee stepped near him you landed near them.

“Max, did the Hokage send you to?” asked Lee.

“Yep, barely gave her my report from the last mission before she had me race over here. But it looks like you both are having some fun.” You answered as Gaara looked at you in a combination of fear and awe. Lee just smiled as he knew what you considered fun. “It looks like you’ve come a long way.” You said to Gaara as he composed himself.

“Yes Naruto taught me many things that reshaped my life.” He recited and his slightly monotone voice made it seem practiced but you could tell that he meant it.

“Well he is one amazing kid. Not surprised he helped you out somehow.” You replied.

“Look out!” Lee said as a small impact hit your hide as you lay there talking. If you had been a normal animal it would have been a perfect vital shot but you had yet to meet a human made object that could penetrate your scales easily. You looked at the frozen enemy as he realized that the only thing his attack did was get him noticed by you.

“And what the hell do you think you are doing?” you asked the horned, anthro looking, young man who tried to stab you with some sort of large bone from his body. You weren’t mad by any means more like a little annoyed and contemplative. “Who in their right mind would attack a dragon with such a weak attack? Unless that was some kind of weird love tap. In which case I would have to say that I don’t play on that side of the fence.” You said which made even Gaara smile a little. Attacking you was something he had found to be useless and didn’t wish to do it again. You were nice only to a certain point and, like most Sand ninja, he had seen what you could do during their attack.

“I will defeat you!” he said as he backed off and tried again, this time with some kind of overgrown bone that actually made an impact but not more than a light irritation on your scales. His second failure made him even more angry as he continued to attack to which you sighed.

“You aren’t giving me a lot of choices here. Are you going to stop or are you going to make me kill you?” you asked in a board expression.

“I’ll only stop when I am dead!” he bellowed as he made a break for Lee and Gaara. Halfway there you lunged your tail into him and it skewered him through the middle with little effort. You didn’t even have to flatten it or anything. You waited as everyone watching looked on in shock, including the enemy as he saw the foreign object that had run through his middle. He shortly slumped over then you burned what was left of his body to ash.

“Amazing.” Gaara stated as he wondered at the ease you dealt with their troublesome foe.

“Glad you think so. I rather dislike when I have to kill people.” You said and he looked at you as if that was not what he meant. “I know what you meant and thanks for the compliment.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You get there in time to help fight.

choices: You pass out from trying to heal and fly at the same time.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
As you waited for the others to arrive you talked with Lee and Gaara. Lee told you what happened with Sasuke and you smelled in that direction and was about to go there yourself but you also smelled Kakashi’s scent rapidly closing in on them so you left that part to him. Besides your mission was here and it would take a lot to kill Naruto. Gaara was delighted to hear that he was now you friend as well. Simply put a friend of Naruto was a friend of yours and he stated that he owed Naruto even more. Finally the others appeared almost carrying Kiba and Akamaru.

“Hey Max, did you pick up Choji and Neji?” Shikamaru asked with a rather concerned face.

“Yes, they were near death when I found them so I put them in my storage gut to heal. They have stabilized for now but are still far from ok.” you answered.

“You’re talking about your second stomach right?” Kiba asked to which you nodded. He looked over at Akamaru highly concerned and with the same at you, more specifically at your jaws and stomach. “Do you have room for two more?” he asked with a noticeable hesitation, more so than the rest of them. Except the Sand ninja but to their credit they were picking up on your conversation very quickly.

“You sure? It is kind of awkward and neither of you look like you’re going to die any time soon.” You said and your hesitation was possibly more noticeable than the others. After all you had spent a lot of time convincing people that you were safe to be around. For you to eat them, even if it just to your storage gut, was a contradiction of sorts.

“What are you talking about?” Temari asked as she was the most wielded out.

“Max has a second stomach that is used for storage mostly that doesn’t digest anything. It has also been determined that if he uses magic or healing jutsu inside it would be 100 times more effective because the person would be surrounded by his living tissue. In theory it is a great attribute to have but he does have to eat the person to get the person into it.” Shikamaru explained and the sand ninja all looked on with interest and surprise.

“I don’t want to see Akamaru in any pain and as tough as I am I know that I am in no fit condition to ride on your back.” He said as he leaned heavily on Shikamaru for support. You looked at them then away and back at them again trying to find a better way but failed. Now that you observed him more he was right. A ride on your back would just further open his wounds as well as the cold air from you flying.

“Fine just get in.” you said as you opened your jaws wide and an audible tension of fear gripped the group at the sight but they quickly recovered. The first you felt was the small shivering form of Akamaru. You used your tongue to bring him and carefully deposit him to the throat. You gulped and with a rumble of your storage gut you found him a space away from the others that were already in there. There was a little more hesitation with the next one, probably because he was still awake and for Kiba, feeding himself to another animal was purely against his instinct. You kept you tongue as still as possible so he didn’t slip on the way in and land on your teeth. As soon as he was laying down you closed your mouth and swallowed him as well. A louder rumble came as you moved the gut’s walls around to fit him.

“What’s that noise?” Kankurou asked, clearly referring to your stomach growling.

“I contracted the walls around them so they wouldn’t be disturbed as I flew or fought. The noise is me relaxing the walls so they can enter than compressing around them once they reach a secure and separate spot from the others to heal.” You said and wither he believed you or not he nodded that he understood your explanation. “Well unless you all want to stand around here for the rest of the day you can get on.” You said as you lowered your neck so they could jump or climb on. Again they were understandably hesitant when getting on and when your spikes formed to hold them in place but they kept it together and when they got settled you took off into the air and leveled off at a pretty impressive height. You could even see the Leaf Village from this height and they marveled at it.

“Good thing we were strapped in.” Kankurou said as he realized he would have fallen off otherwise.

“It’s amazing up here.” Temari stated as she took it all in.

“Max, do you know where Naruto and Sasuke are?” Shikamaru asked.

“Yes, Sasuke defeated Naruto and left beyond the border and is still going. Kakashi Sensei got there and is carrying Naruto to the Village as we speak.” You answered and they could see that the news you gave was wearing on you. Sasuke was your friend like he was with Naruto or slightly behind his level but still friends none the less.

“Well we should get back as soon as we can.” Shikamaru said and in a second wished he hadn’t as you agreed and took off at near full speed toward your destination. You weren’t sure what kind of reception you were going to get when you got back but you needed to rest and a place to concentrate on healing the ones inside you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You have to carry more in your gut.

choices: Sarah is there when you wake and they are all sorry.
They placed a bomb in your chest for their future safety.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You did what!” Said Tsunade as you gave your report on the roof. Because you had multiple people still in your storage gut you were unable to change to human form. Shikamaru had just told her that you had most of the seriously injured in your stomach but wasn’t wise enough to add the “storage” or “second” in front of the phrase. As it was you were extremely tired from fighting and flying while healing 3 humans and a dog to full health. You had hoped that they would be well enough to let out bu the time you got here but their injuries were more severe than that. Kiba and Akamaru were almost done but Neji and Choji were far from healed however their condition was no longer critical.

The others had noticed and addressed the sluggish pace and actions you had while flying and landing. You had told them as much but at this point you didn’t have the strength to both heal and carry a conversation of any stature. So when her question hit it seemed like it was an actual bullet as you toppled over with fatigue. You were still conscious as you had to be to prevent any unfortunate actions like your second stomach pushing its guests into the digesting one. As well you needed to concentrate along with the healing jutsu you were using to properly heal them. To the onlooker you looked like you were in an almost unconscious daze as your eyes were barely open and most of your body except the sounds of your Storage gut and other comparatively massive organs working.

You could see and feel what was going on around you but most of your other senses were shut down to further direct your body’s focus on healing. However it was like a silent and stuttering movie in which your lack of perception would skip to the live feed then skip again to stay updated but it was a losing battle as you tried to follow what was happening. You began to see and feel things that didn’t make sense like tools under your scales and multiple hands on your body, tipping it over and moving around the relatively softer scales on your underside.

Then all of a sudden you began as you close your eyes you felt immense pain and after a few rounds of pain then and the feeling of someone cutting into you it dawned on you that they were trying to cut their way to your stomach to get them out. You didn’t have the strength to resist them and heal its occupants. So you concentrated all your energy on healing them. At this point Kiba and Akamaru were completely healed yet unconscious but if they tried to force Choji and Neji out at this point they would die from the shock alone. So you spent every bit of energy you had on healing them faster but as it sometimes did when you needed it the ancient knowledge in your mind came up with a solution. It wasn’t much of one but it would save them so you gave it a try. The magic transferred all their remaining injuries to you so your body and its healing properties could better deal with them. It was just in time to as the invading forces to your body ripped through the first stomach than the second and its occupants spilled out. At this point the pain was too much and combined with your fatigue level and new injuries you faded out.

You knew that the injuries you had wouldn’t kill you as they were much less than what your mother had done but it was who did it that hurt the most. You were helping them and saving them and they still turned on you. You didn’t know what to think of that. Humans were good people and these were the best, aside from Sarah, you had ever met. So why were they causing you so much pain? You clung onto the hope that it was just a big misunderstanding and it would be sorted out when you awoke. But that hope didn’t stop nightmares from coming as they did whenever you were in a similar position. They reminded you of why you hated dragons so much as a replay of your mother played over and over again until you woke up.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: "Get them out now!"

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
There was a few times during the time you were asleep that you were able to partially wake up but it was for only a second the fell asleep again. The nightmares were beginning to wear on you, you particularly didn’t like when you started seeing similarities between your mother and the humans you had grown to love. It was at this point you started to try to break the nightmares and force yourself awake. It finally worked as the disturbing images faded and you began to notice things around you. Most noticeable and comforting was a warmth against the crook of your neck and head where Sarah used to sleep. You felt a hand on your eye ridge which was making you hum involuntarily to the touch. You smelled the soothing smell that was around when Sarah was near and before becoming fully aware of yourself rationalized that she was here. You slowly fluttered your eyes open and took in the area around you. You were still on the roof of the administration building where you originally landed. You induced that they must have moved you and cleaned up because for the amount of blood you lost when they cut you open there was not even the slightest whiff of it around you.

“You’re awake!” Sarah exclaimed as she hugged you from where she sat then backed off and continued to pet you.

“How long have I been out?” you asked.

“About three weeks. They said you lost a lot of blood and your injuries were extensive. Not to mention they were to afraid to feed you anything and wouldn’t help me open your mouth to get some food down so you’ve been on a sunlight diet.” She said in a sore tone.

“That still hurts.” You said after trying to push off a leg to get up but the pain didn’t allow you to move without reminding you of your weakened state. You growled a little at the pain than just sighed in defeat as you lay there.

“It isn’t right.” Sarah said to which you looked at her with you’re the eye she was petting above. “They had not right to do this to you. When have you ever done anything even worth a tongue lashing? They cut you open with little regard for wither you would survive or not. Can’t believe they did this to you.” she said as she traced part of the scare that now lined from the top of your chest to near your groin where they cut you open. It must have taken hours to make a cut that long in your scales and even longer to correct it after correcting the damage they did to your organs. Your body probably helped a great deal but now seeing the aftermath of the damage you realized it was a rather serious endeavor they went on to get the others out of you.

“We should’ve done a lot more for what he did.” Came an old voice you knew to be one of the elders you had previously met. “You gave your word that you would never eat any from this village or its allies unless instructed otherwise and you did just that. Not only that but you ate multiple ninja children while they and you were on a mission.” She said and you let out a little growl at the remark.

“Before you decide to do the same to us you should know that we had an enhanced paper bomb sewn in next to your heart. Any one of a few people can detonate it at any time, taking your heart with it.” Said the other elder as Lady Tsunade walked up enough to hear but not participate in the conversation until this point. For the first time in a very long time there was fear in your eyes that the two took as a good sign and Tsunade used to gauge your understanding.

“I had hoped you had been telling the truth about healing them but they had no injuries what so ever. They didn’t even have the signs of the injuries.” Tsunade stated. “They said you healed them but we know you have mind powers that allow you to manipulate one’s mind. You could have implanted that situation into their minds and the fact that the stomach we found them in had a direct path to your digestive system I think that is the case. I will not even bother to ask why as you would just give an answer that may sound believable but still far from the truth.”

“This is ridiculous! Max would never do that!” Sarah bursted out. “If he said he was healing them than he was healing them!” she insisted.

“Enough! It is clear he has you so enchanted that you would believe that the sky was pink if he said it. You need to be cleared of this influence.” Tsunade stated and within seconds of a hand movement a few Anbu came and took her away after rendering her unconscious for the struggles she was putting out. You started to force yoruu body to move wither it wanted to or not but with another move from an elder your knee exploded in pain. “Do not think we only placed one bomb in your body. As much as you are dangerous you are also too valuable of a resource to let go. So those bombs will remain as insurance for your cooperation. Sarah will be removed of your influence and set free as soon as that is finished. Get some rest and heal, you are going to have a lot of work to do.” She finished as she patted you on the nose to which you flinched at each drop of the hand, expecting her at this point to hit you or something to get a response. You would have previously not flinched or thought it possible for her to hurt you like that but now you didn’t know what to think. You were so confused, sad, angry, and again in a lot of pain as your injuries healed, including your new one on your knee.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They placed a bomb in your chest for their futu...

choices: On a remote but plentiful island.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
As time passed you continually reminded what you had done. In a weird sense they were right. You had broken your word and what was worse you didn’t even know if it was the right circumstance to do it in. They weren’t dead when you ate them and they could’ve been saved be the multiple medical personnel Tsunade sent to help. From that moment on you were shunned by most everyone as you had been reduced to little more than a pack animal used for transport. You were forbidden to fight in any situation or learn anything more that may increase your effectiveness in battle. Instead you were used as a pack animal and a quick transport system for ninja or just about anyone dependeing on what was going on.

When Sarah was finally released her brain was altered. From what you could tell from reading it they had to cover over what they thought you did and start fresh. That was the most degrading and hurtful thing they could’ve done. She looked and treated you like you were no more than an untrustworthy monster for “degrading her mind” as she had been taught. You thought about making her aware and uncovering what they covered in her mind with your power but they would just redo it again and you didn’t want her in any pain. But after Naruto left to go train with Master Jiriaya you were left without anyone to talk to. He was the only one energetic and “foolish” enough to do it. Finally after what was the last paper bomb went off, other than the one by your heart, for snarling at the scent of an invading ninja you had enough. You had waited for this moment as you only had enough skill to destroy one in your body and the fact that all of them were linked so destroying one would have set off the rest. You wasted no time as you thought that they may try to kill you now that one was used or would try to put more in. You carefully destroyed it so it didn’t go off nor was there any trace left of it in your system.

“Max! What are you doing?” asked Sarah as you had changed to human and took her to a secret place you had dug in preparation for this. It hid you completely and even extremely high level ninja would have a hard time finding it. “Everyone is looking for you. You better show yourself before they detonate your last bomb. What are you doing out of dragon form anyway?” she asked as you were not allowed to do that as you would be able to evade people easier as small as your human form was.

“I can’t stay here anymore. I can’t stand what they did to you. If they want me gone so badly that is what I’ll be, gone. But not before I undo what they did to you.” you said as you lay a hand on her head as her other limps were restrained by a paralysis jutsu you had picked up from just watching the others. They had thought they were keeping you from getting stronger because you didn’t practice but you had stored them in your mind and were able to use them just fine. She was about to scream but you quickly broke the cover they made over her memories and helped her ease into them as they flooded back to her. Her face stayed in a horror state. Originally it was there because she thought you were going to kill her but now it was there because of what she and the others were doing to you. “Do you remember?” you asked.

“What have I done?” she asked as she collapsed as you took the Paralysis jutsu off her. “Max?” she asked as if she were asking a tuff question. Indeed it was as she reached out you flinched like you had been doing for months at people’s touch. She saw this and started to cry, like you she never wanted anything bad to happen to you. You both were very close and hated those who hurt the other. The fact that she was one of those people that hurt you was not easy for her to take in.

“Like I said, I can’t stay here anymore. I brought you down here against your will so you could go back if you wanted. Or you could come with me but either way you wouldn’t be branded as a rouge ninja.” You said and she looked up at you as you dropped down to her level awaiting her answer.

“You forgive me?” she asked and as you nodded she threw her arms around you. “Then they can go to hell for all I care. What right did they have to do this? Let’s get out of here.” She said and backed off so you could transform to which she got on you and strapped in. You shot some fire at a fuse that started to bury the tunnel you made behind you as you ran. You made it long so you could come out near the edge of the village but far enough away so the wall patrol couldn’t see you. So you came out of the tunnel and leapt into the night sky and allowing your natural features to blend with the darkness as you flew away from the village. “I’m sorry.” She said finally as she lay on your neck and back, still crying.

“You have nothing to apologize for. You acted that way because they put it in your head it was right. You have always done what was right no matter what. I have always been proud of you and will continue to count myself luck y that you are with me. You even completed the academy in two years. That has to be a record. I would never do anything to harm you and I hate to see you hurt. So no more crying because of me ok?” you said and she nodded into your neck then cleared some tears away.

“So where are we going?” she asked as you flew. It was a good question. You didn’t want to be somewhere near any ninja or they would just come for the two of you. But if you picked something to remote it would cut off essential living like food or water. So you had to pick wisely where to go.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A year goes by.

choices: Akatsuki try to recuit you and Sarah.
Master Jiraiya and Naruto track you down.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You landed on a small island called Tear Island. It was far off the coast and very far from any of the great 5 nations. There were ninja here but very few that interacted with the villages and there was just as many sword’s man, knights, and pretty much any other type of fighter that had washed up. The island got its name from the occasional person that washed up after being shipwrecked. Together with the fact that there was constant storms and whirlpools around the island they were stuck there. Since that was the main and usually only way to get to the island you and Sarah were welcomed warmly, of course you had remained in human form since you landed and it helped that no one saw you flying. They supplied you with some basic tools, area to build a house, shack, or whatever you could with the materials around.

It was awesome as you were able to build a small house, less impressive than any of the others but more sturdy. But the house was only what it looked like on the outside. Inside was normal except a sealed door that only you and Sarah could open. It teleported you deep below the ground into an area big enough to house and maintain 5 hidden villages for 10 years. Complete with a water vein and a teleportation set that brought in animals that were thoroughly screened for any sign of alteration like being a ninja dog or having a bomb in it. You didn’t want your and Sarah’s secret place to become discovered. It was a serine place with a complicated system to bring in sun light, display the stars, and just about anything you or Sarah could think up. It was a place only for the two of you and neither of you had any intension of sharing it with others around no matter how nice they seemed, after what happen with the Leaf Village. It was also an optimal place to train and you both were becoming vastly more powerful, Sarah more than you since training with a human did improve your skills but not as much as a human training with a dragon on her side.

Other than that you also built a blacksmith shop and Sarah built herself a tailoring shop. Originally it was to make weapons and armor that you both wore out while training but as people began to see it and notice the high quality of some of the things you both made they began shopping. And just like that you both were interactive and completely natural part of the village. However neither of you ever showed anyone anything that might point to the conclusion that either of you were ninja and definitely not a dragon rider couple.

“Here’s your sword. Try o be more careful with it but you can always bring it back if you break it again.” You said as you handed a katana back to its owner.

“Exceptional work for such a low price. You sure you don’t want more?” he asked as he examined the blade than sheathed it.

“I’m sure, besides Mike the amount of times I see you I’d be robbing you blind if I charged what the others do. You really do go through a lot of blades.” You answered with a smile.

“You’re right about that. Max, I think you see me more often than my mother.” He said and you both laughed at the truth of his statement. “But seriously man, if you ever need anything just remember that I got your back.” He said with a hand raised.

“Thanks Mike I’ll remember that.” You said as you shook his hand and he left for home. There were a lot of people that you and Sarah sold to like that. You had been bullied a few times and she harassed, as either of you wouldn’t fight back in any impressive fashion. However you had grown to supply some of the most honorable and notable people in Tear village and Island that the culprit never got to far before someone came to your aid. In a way you two were more protected than the town elders and leaders. “Hello, welcome to my shop.” You said as the door opened and in walked a man with orange hair and cloak that was Black with red cloud shapes on it.

“Your… business partner referred me over after she repaired my robe. I need some Kunai.” He said directly and if his posture didn’t scream ninja than the way he held himself did.

“Sure thing, I have some in stock. How many do you need?” you asked

“500” he said simply to which you wrote it down on a slip of paper. Than did some math and came out with a number for a price and gave it to him for approval. “Is this a bargain shop? Such a low price means that either it is just as low of quality or that you got them with questionable means.” He stated.

“I make them myself and I can give you a sample free of charge so you can determine wither they are quality is an issue.” You said as you went over to a box where you had them neatly packed in so they didn’t rub or scratch each other. You pulled one out carefully and handed it to him. He grabbed it and handled it around, checking all the things that makes a good blade. “Is it acceptable?” you asked when he placed it on the counter.

“Yes, now why are they so cheap?” he asked and you laughed a little. “Did I say something that was funny?”

“Kind of, I just get that question a lot. They are cheap because I don’t really need a lot of money. You see I do this and make weapons for fun and they just so happen to be a market for the stuff. So if I have what you are looking for than you are just financing my talent so I can continue. Even if you didn’t buy any I would still continue making them so you are just freeing me of some of the extras I have around. However I have learned the hard way that just giving them away can be hazardous so I do require a fee but just enough so kids can’t come in and buy them like candy.” You explained.

“I see, then do you have what I need?” he asked.

“It happens that I have 700 Kunai in stock so I will be able to help you in such a large quantity. Do you need help with transportation?” you asked but you were answered by a few other men and women with equally orange hair coming in. The first one counted out the money and placed it on the counter. “Very well then, those four boxes have 250 kunai each just like the one you previously sampled. Please come again if you need more, although the odds on me having such an abundance in the near future is somewhat slim.” You said to which he nodded and followed the others with the boxes out the door. For a moment you wondered what his name was but you noticed he filled it out on the sales order you made. ‘Pain’ was his name. You then wondered if it was an alias or a self appointed name. Either way you filed them with the rest and started on making more kunai.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: On a remote but plentiful island.

choices: They start to realize their fault.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Max! Max!” came a yell from Sarah’s store which got you and the people in it to run over and rush into her store. There was two people you were actually hoping not to see again. Master Jiraiya and Naruto. Well to be honest out of all the leaf ninja they were in the top five you wouldn’t mind but pretty much everyone in that world you felt a high distain for. Naruto was confronting her and Master Jiraiya turned to address the crowd of people coming into the store. Luckily the door was closer to the counter and they the two were at an angle so Sarah jumped the counter in a very believable way for an immature fighter to do. She hung onto you as the crowd of people came in at your back at her scream and calling.

“We don’t know what you two are up to but these two are off limits. They do a lot of good in this town for vermin like you to rough them up.” Mike said with a chorus of agreements amongst the others. Among them were a few that were Jounin level or higher in their perspective arts so the crowd was not to be taken lightly.

“Rough them up? They are the ones you should be worried about!” Naruto exclaimed as he pointed towards the two of you.

“And you think we would take your word over theirs? We all have known them for a little over a year now and they have done no wrong to anyone. They make us quality stuff for less than fractions of what they are worth, they help the children with their homework, and are overall more protected than the elders as we all owe them more than we can repay in a lifetime. They even help deliver babies and help newcomers when they come. All you have done is barge in, insult them, and by the looks of things threatened Sarah.” Another man said who was a respectable master of martial arts. And it was obvious now to Jiraiya that most of the people in the group would be hard to defeat and were far from being brainwashed.

“Ok… I think we all need to relax. We were just a little surprised to see them and overreacted. However we would like to talk with them privately, just talking nothing more.” Master Jiraiya said as he waved Naruto’s rising temper down along with the others as they recognized he was at least an honest man.

“It’s ok.” you said as they looked at you for an answer. “We do know these two and if nothing else they can be trusted to keep their word. But such a conversation is best suited for a more private setting. Mike, if you wouldn’t mind showing them to our house. I am afraid we are going to have to close early today.” You said and some moaned at the news but they heeded your request so the two were escorted by more than just Mike to the house than backed away after you and Sarah made your way following the early close of the shops. They all gave you your privacy but it was clear from a look that they would be nearby in their respective elements.

“What do we do?” Sarah asked before you were in earshot of the two but after closing the door to the village.

“Let’s just hear what they have to say and hope we don’t have to run again. I don’t really want to kill them.” you said and she nodded as she didn’t either. Underneath all the subterfuge they were really kind people, kinder than most people you knew. You both made your way to the small seating area where they were waiting. It looked like Jiraiya had to make Naruto sit down to prevent an outburst. You and Sarah sat in chairs facing them before you spoke. “Now what have you two come here for?”

“We were just passing through when we heard rumors of a couple that made the finest arms and armor around for cheaper than you would find at a cheap secondhand store.” Master Jiraiya stated.

“Cut the crap. You can’t just pass through Tear Island. You either wash up shipwrecked or it takes quite a bit of effort to get here.” Sarah stated as she was highly defensive in her obvious accusation.

“Unless you were practicing the Giant Rasengan on the whirlpools.” You stated and they both were stunned silent at your knowledge of it. “We’re in solitude not dead. We get all kinds of people here and not all by accident. Judging on the fact that you already knew the Rasengan the only other reason to come here where whirlpools are ever present is to practice a larger version of it. However I doubt you both came to our stores to replenish supplies. You probably heard our names somewhere in the village and came to see the only lead you had on where we might be.” You ended calmly.

“That makes a lot more sense than just passing through.” Sarah agreed.

“Well since we established why we are hear why don’t we continue by asking why you are here?” Master Jiraiya asked.

“Isn’t if obvious? We came here to get away from all of you.” you stated as if they should’ve known.

“So you turned yourselves into rouge ninja to escape your punishment for what you did?” Naruto stated.

“What he did? We didn’t do it to escape what HE did. We escaped because of what YOU did.” Sarah yelled at him. You were thankful that you built the house to be sound proof or the whole village would’ve heard it.

“He ate 4 of us! how are you ok with that?” Naruto shouted back.

“He was healing them you idiot! If he really did implant the whole thing than where the hell is Sasuke? Or did he implant that to? Didn’t you have to fight for and against him? Wasn’t there injuries from fighting Orochimaru’s best servants? He saved their lives and you all repay him by cutting him open, rewriting my mind, and enslaving him for a year. How are you ok with that?!” she shouted back in which the point about Sasuke hit him harder than the rest. Even Jiraiya was looking different at you as if just being hit in the gut.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Master Jiraiya and Naruto track you down.

choices: Tsunade and Kakashi come in person with a few others to appologize.
Anbu Black Ops attack regularly and you must leave as a child is hurt.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Why didn’t you say anything?” asked Naruto before Jiraiya could stop him.

“You got to be kidding. You all had a paper bomb go off every time he opened his mouth without permission and rewrote my memory. How the hell were we suppose to do that? Even if we could everyone already thought he was a lying, bloodthirsty, betrayer!” Sarah continued to yell until you put your hand on hers that was gripping the chair so hard it was cracking. Jiriaya did something similar to get Naruto back under control as well.

“I could talk with Tsunade, maybe get you cleared to come back. Your absence left the village in a tuff spot as they were depending on you for future missions and jobs they had to cancel.” Jiraiya offered with a little guilt on the end for good measure.

“You don’t seem to understand.” You said calmly. “We left to get away from everyone. We don’t want to go back. And while I do feel for the hardship they have from time to time I don’t feel bad for freeing myself and Sarah of their influence and demands. I don’t know if you can imagine being treated like a pack animal but I have no desire to go back to that, or the people who forced me into it. I have absolutely no trust for anyone in the village at the moment and feel no pull to help them get out of whatever they got themselves into.” You stated.

“How can you be that casual about all the lives in the village?” Jiraiya asked.

“I could ask you the same question. Why didn’t you help when Orochimaru attacked the village? If you had helped the third in his battle he might have lived.” You stated and got a rather serious look to grow across his face. “My point is that we all have our reasons and we don’t need to explain them but they are reasons none the less. The Leaf Village was doing fine before I crashed into this realm and it will be fine after I am gone.”

“And you are ok with being rouge ninja?” Naruto asked as the idea didn’t make sense to him anymore.

“You are under the assumption that we are.” You said and they both looked quizzically at you. “Shortly after I was turned into a pack animal by you people I was stripped of my ninja status. It went so far as to say that I was property of the village and not a resident so being considered a ninja at all is a step up from that. As for Sarah, I technically kidnapped her before I freed her of your mind tampering. So she is still a Leaf Ninja by record but if what you are saying is true than she is no longer bound to the leaf but by no fault of her own. In both cases we had no part in making ourselves rouge ninja. That was done by the same people you want us to go back to. Yet another reason we don’t wish to return.” You explained and waited for them to make another statement that was false or misguided.

“In the end this is the hard truth.” Sarah said and they both looked at her as she spoke. Even if they didn’t see her as a friend or such anymore she was still unnaturally smart so people tended to listen when she was talking reasonably. “The Leaf betrayed US.” she said and let that set in before she continued. “Max is more passive about it than I am. Personally I wouldn’t mind if I never hear about the Leaf Village again. All it is to me is a bunch of people that hurt and made me hurt the one person I swore I would never harm. Do you have any idea how long it took to get Max to stop flinching after we got here. Every hand raise he looked away, every hand sign was a possible paper bomb inside him. It took weeks to be able to touch him without his heart racing in fear. Even now he sometimes shuns away from my touch. You and your village did that and I will never forget it.” She said with a deathly serious voice that was almost visible. She was again shaking with anger and you just squeezed her hand to which she calmed down but kept the serious face she had on.

“You must hate us.” Naruto said as he broke the silence, finally understanding your position and as a first, before Jiraiya.

“I said it before, I only truly hate dragons. But I far from trust any of you. Now that you have found us we might have to move again. I could see the leaf or another country sending ninja for us eventually when we are discovered. At best it out reveal that we are more than a tailor and blacksmith and at worst it would end up taking the lives of the people around us that we have grown to care for.” You responded.

“What if we don’t tell anyone?” Master Jiraiya asked.

“I wish I could take your word for it but as I have said we don’t trust any of you anymore. However I don’t call the shots on if we leave or not.” You said to which they almost asked in, ‘silence who does?’ and you simply looked over to Sarah.

“I wouldn’t count on us being here if you come back.” She said bitterly.

“I guess that is expected.” Master Jiraiya said then he did something and was followed by Naruto that you never thought you would see from the two usual jokers. They got down on their knees then bowed with their heads to the floor. “We know that this won’t change anything that has happened but…, we are truly sorry.” He said and Naruto spoke similar words if a little less skillfully as Master Jiraiya did.

“You’re right it doesn’t change what happened. I still don’t trust you and it is pretty safe to say that Sarah hates your guts.” You said with a pause as it sunk in. “But at least it is a start. Maybe we can try taking you at your word and stay for a little while. I don’t think Sarah nor I want to leave. I guess if ninja start attacking and searching for us we will know if there is any stock in your words.” you said and Sarah quietly agreed but went to the bedroom and slammed the door. She didn’t want to leave but every sane part of her said she should.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They start to realize their fault.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were slightly saddened when one evening you smelled something that you didn’t want to smell. It was hard to mistake the scent of Lady Tsunade and Kakashi along with some of the other jounin and others that you used to know rather well. This meant that either Jiraiya and Naruto told them or they had some kind of network that happened to coincide with the estimated traveling time it they went there and back. Sarah wanted to bolt right away but you made a deal with her. If they approached either of you during the day at work she was to meet you in your secret room and they would leave from there. However if they came by after hours than she would at least have to hear them out. And to her dismay while you two were waiting they came knocking. You had left the door open so when they knocked the door swung open as a result. You had moved the door to your secret room to the wall that you and Sarah were sitting directly in front of. All you would have to do would be to touch the wall to get in if it came down to it. The door was hidden well so it appeared that you both were cornered. This would flush out their intensions with minimal damage. They came in and closed the door behind them. The house was small enough that their number forced them into the room where you both were waiting.

“Well I wish I could say that I was surprised or glad to see you all.” Sarah said with a clear irritation in her voice.

“I thought you had more respect for your Hokage than that.” Neji stated.

“Ha, my Hokage? That implies that I trust her to that extent and accept her as such. You all lost that when you implanted false memories and made me harm Max as if he was a vile beast. Not to mention you branded both of us rouge ninja which forfeits any claim you might have had.” She stated but was interrupted by a crack as the arm of the chair you were on was cracking as you gripped it in a visual state for fear. Over half the people in the room had more than once detonated the paper bombs that were your torment for so long. And when they didn’t want to waist one they would discipline you in other fashions. Either way you were working hard not to run or assume the position that you were required to do back then when they were near. This state seemed to anger Sarah even more.

“There is no need to be scared. We didn’t come to harm you.” Tsunade stated as she and the others took seats you had prepared ahead of time.

“It took me months to get him to stop flinching around me. You think a few words are enough to erase the mental torment you inflicted?” Sarah said back.

“We came here to resolve this mess, not cause more damage.” Shikimaru said.

“It looks more like you are here to get the big bad dragon back under your thumb. Well he’s not going back and he sure isn’t going to let you put more bombs in his body to control him with.” Sarah shot back.

“Is that what he thinks or just what you think?” Kiba asked more you than her.

“Sarah is the one person I trust 100%. If she says something than I believe it. She is also far smarter than I am so I tend to do what she says.” You said in a hesitant tone as the last time you spoke that way around them your spleen exploded and your hand moved to the spot as if readying to receive the pain but when it didn’t come you returned your had to its firm grip on the chair. Tsunade however remembered Sarah saying something similar about you right before she ordered her to be cleansed.

“But he is more passive about the whole thing. Maybe he has too much hate for dragons that he doesn’t have enough to cover people like you. But he thinks that it might work out in the end. I think it is absolutely idiotic but that is Max for you. If he was anything like me he would have charred you the moment you stepped through the door.” She said and the last part finally made them flinch.

“If he really cared at all he wouldn’t have just left.” Sakura stated.

“Shut up! Do you think he enjoyed being your little slave? Did you think he would’ve reveled the thought of you putting more bombs in his body under threat of killing him? You treat him like garbage and make me do the same while you judge him for any move he makes as an act of treason. He is not your property and he will never be. You all put him through hell and made me help and after he decided to leave in place of that or burning his place of torture to the ground you say he didn’t care. You all make me sick.” She lectured as a return.

“We have all done things we regret. This and was definitely something we wish we could take back. Haven’t you done something you wish you hadn’t?” Tsunade asked.

“I have pondered that many times.” You started and they looked at you and noticed your pained face before you continued. “I think back and wonder what would’ve happened if I didn’t do anything on that last mission. After all the medical core was on its way. They might have been able to tend to the wounded just fine. The sand ninja were there and didn’t really need my help. Everyone was alive enough to survive so why did I do what I did? I don’t know what is worse, knowing that what I did was bad or that I could’ve prevented it if I had thought more clearly. Perhaps I could’ve followed Sasuke to Orochimaru or stopped him all together from leaving the border. There are a lot of if(s) and just as many possible answers. I don’t have the wisdom to know what would’ve worked.” You said and looked even more pained at the end of your little ponder.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Tsunade and Kakashi come in person with a few o...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“No Max, you did the right thing by putting the lives of others first.” Kakashi said after staying silent through the first part of the conversation. “After everything I taught you about team work what is right and wrong we… We should be ashamed of ourselves, I know that I am. I even have you questioning the selfless decision you made. You must have also known that we would react in a similar fashion but trusted that we wouldn’t.” he said as if looking back on an old war mistake.

“You even told us that it would be awkward and we told you to do it. To top it off you healed us perfectly while they were trying to get us out. We didn’t even acknowledge it and punished you for it.” Kiba added with a wine from Akamaru that got you to again flinch at the sound.

“Can I ask how you saved me?” Choji asked with all heads turned to him. “I mean the pill I took effected my whole system so it wasn’t some hole through the chest or limited to one area. I know I have just as much to apologize for than the rest but I would like to know everything before.” At this point Sarah was about to rebuke him but you shook your head at her and she let you answer.

“When I got back I had stabilized everyone’s condition but at that point the sudden exposure to the harsh environment outside of me would’ve killed the ones I was healing. So when I was cut open I realized that if I didn’t find a way to heal everyone completely they would die. So as my body often does, it supplied me with a solution using the genetic memory I possess. It gave me a magic that allowed me to take on all the problems that still needed to be healed and transferred them to my body. That way the healing power of my cells would be better equipped to handle and deal with it. I didn’t get a chance to see if it worked as I passed out from the pain quickly after my stomach was cut open.” You explained and even more guilt was passed on to them in more than a few areas.

“So even then you were trying to save them. I am ashamed I had any part in it.” Tsunade said “I was going to offer you both the clearing of your rouge ninja status and give you the forest of death as your home as compensation for our crimes against you. But if I were in your position I wouldn’t want anything to do with us.” She admitted.

“We accept.” Sarah said with would’ve made the whole room drop to the ground if they weren’t already sitting.

“What!” Tsunade asked in disbelief.

“I’m not exactly sure why myself but Max seems to understand.” She said.

“The Third was a great man wasn’t he?” you asked.

“Of course, we all miss him.” Kakashi said as he was the only one to recover from both Sarah’s answer and your mention of him.

“He took me aside when he to determine one thing before I was accepted into the village the first time. I didn’t even know about it at the time. But I came to understand as he met with me over and over again to see how I was doing and adapting to the village. He spoke of the ‘Will of Fire’. It was then I realized that I couldn’t just sit by while those of the Leaf suffered. I couldn’t help but to keep them from harm. It was why I endured the pain and didn’t take vengeance on the Village afterwards. Even if the Village had lost faith in me the ‘Will of Fire’ that the Third spoke of prevented me from turning on it. We simply can’t bring ourselves to abandon it. However things couldn’t stay the way they were so that is why we went so far away. So that the problems of the Leaf wouldn’t reach our ears and compel us to intervene. I left when I was considered property so I was no longer a ninja by record. I kidnapped Sarah before I freed her mind so she wasn’t considered a rouge ninja by choice. But now that you have come and expressed a need for us we can’t ignore it, even if we want to.” You explained and they listened to a speech that the Third may have given himself at one point.

“We don’t know what to say. We weren’t expecting you to come back or so willingly trust us again.” Sakura said in a clear shame.

“Then you are still misunderstanding us.” Sarah said and they all looked at her confused. “We will come back as we can’t seem to help ourselves. However we far from trust any of you at this point. You have to earn that back which won’t be easy. The village itself will bring back many bad memories for us, more so for Max, not to mention the inevitable person that will shun him even after we legally accepted back” she said and they nodded in both same and understanding. “I suppose you all will need a ride back? Boats don’t tend to work around here.” She asked

“If you are willing Max?” Tsunade asked with her head bowed at the request.
