“Come.” Was the only word you said in response as you stood and touched the wall to get into your secret place. You turned to a dragon and waited for them to come through. As they came through they looked around at the serine atmosphere of the place.

“What is this place?” asked Kakashi.

“Max and I made it so he could stretch his dragon side as well as train. The village we just left doesn’t know we were ninja much more dragon and rider. But down here we can practice, train, spar, relax, hunt, and anything else we would need. Usually only the two of us know of this place but it would work well for disappearing from the village. We set it up so that if we were to leave their minds would be altered just enough to prevent any fallback. This is our paradise in a manner of speaking. So get on him already so we can get you all out of it.” She snapped the last part and motioned over to you as you had laid down for them to get on. They took one last look around before they did so. Each one felt a definite ping of guilt as your body flinched and quivered at their slightest touch like an abused dog waiting for their master to hit them.

“Aren’t you going to strap in?” asked Tsunade as Sarah jumped on your neck while you raised it and started walking. She was halfway up but facing them as if making sure they didn’t hurt you. They were all tucked securely in with your spikes but she was just sitting on you with ease, not even shaking for balance as you moved and walked.

“I am his rider. We have trained not only as ninja but also as a dragon rider couple. I can ride from anywhere, and I do mean anywhere. Unlike you I don’t need a safety belt to ride Max.” she said as you made it to a wall than pressed it with your snout and you were all instantly teleported to a high mountain near the Land of Fire. Sarah moved to the top of your head as she looked out over the land. “So we’re back. Let’s get going before we second guess ourselves.” She said to which you leapt off the mountain and soared high toward the village. The others were amazed that Sarah could stand on your head as if you were standing still while they were hardly hanging on even with safety spikes and hand grips provided. You whimpered a little when you got close to the village but Sarah sat down and stroked your head soothingly. Then with a sigh you dove down to once again enter the village you both had run so far from.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They admit their fault.

choices: Temari convinces them to not attack.
They attack until they see the others on your back.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It was unbelievably hard to adjust for you. Even after both you and Sarah were awarded the level of Jounin as you two were vastly stronger than Tsunade herself. People treated you pretty much the same except those who knew better. For this reason you more or less stayed in your new home of the Forest of Death. Sarah on the other hand was more aggressive and people were more used to her as an ally. She got right back where she left off and was making remarkable progress fitting in and accepting their apologies. However her temper flared when anyone badmouthed you. However you both still thoroughly enjoyed riding with each other. It was also understood that missions were carried out by one of you would be carried out by both. She was the only one fit to be your rider after all and you both were increasingly more effective together than apart.

“Hey Max!” said a voice as you looked over from your rest. You saw Kakashi, Sakura, and Naruto. The voice belonged to Naruto as he was usually the first to speak. “So you came back.” He said a little nervous at what was said the last time you two met. He also glanced down at the noticeable scare that decorated your underside. It was a constant reminder to people and you of what happened. Most of the more serious scares from your mother were hidden under your wings but these were hard to hide.

“Likewise, I was told you were gone from the village for two years total. It’s quieter around without you here.” You said and Sakura laughed at it. You had stopped flinching for the most part at people’s gestures and touch but every once in a while you let one slip and it hit whoever was around with regret. You didn’t like seeing people like that so you tried your best to overcome it.

“Max, we have a mission if you are up for it?” Kakashi asked. You were about to ask where Sarah was but that question answered itself as she came running over from the tree line. “Gaara has been taken by a group known as the Akatsuki. We think they are after the one tailed beast inside him. We need to head to the Sand Village right away.”

“I assume you’re coming.” You said to Sarah and she gave a ‘no duh’ face. “Well if we are all set I did get a nap after breakfast so I’m ready to.” You said as you lowered your head and neck for them to get on. Sarah jumped to your head and the others took spots on your back. It wasn’t long before you were up in the air and leaving toward the sand village. “Hey did Temari just stop by?” you asked.

“Yes, she should be on her way back. If you see her we should give her a ride back, Gaara is her brother you know?” Sakura said to which you dove down which caught Temari’s attention as you landed in front of her. It didn’t take long for the others to address the situation and with Gaara’s safety in her mind she was less frightened at approaching and taking you up on your offer to fly her there with you. With a gust you took off and as it was her first flight on you she was a bit queasy until you leveled off high above the ground.

“Hey do you mind if we go a little faster?” Sarah asked the others and more specifically Temari.

“Faster? Are you saying he can go faster than this?” Temari asked in disbelief.

“Ha, this is less than a quarter of his speed. But most people barf when he reaches half speed so he tones it down for your sake.” Sarah said as she walked over to them

“If it gets us there quicker than please.” Temari pleaded to which you could almost see the smirk on Sarah’s face even with your head facing the opposite direction.

“You heard her Max.” Sarah said.

“Maybe we should talk about this first…” Naruto said but was cut off of what he was going to say by you suddenly increasing in speed. But after about three hours of the intense speed that left them all out of breath you slowed and circled above a village at an angle so they could see down.

“Any input on where we should land?” You asked back to the frozen Temari until she was snapped back to what was going on.

“In front of the gate would be best. Guests have to go through security before entering.” She advised.

“Alright.” You agreed and dove down to the front gate like she said. The sudden appearance of a dragon caused an alarm and you had to hope they didn’t attack. You weren’t really looking forward to taking hits from whatever they decided to throw at you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Naruto's return.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Despite they sending for you the sight of a dragon was too much for the guards so they started attacking you as you came down. You grunted and gasped as large spiked spears or poles were launched and sometimes implanted themselves into you. It wasn’t until you were in earshot of humans that Temari got their attention and they stopped. When you finally landed and came to a stop you let them off and proceeded to pull the protruding weapons out. Each one let out a significant amount of blood before the hole was sealed as your body healed. Sarah helped with some of them that you couldn’t reach until they were all out and you had recovered.

“We’re sorry sir, please forgive us.” said a guard as they bowed to you after you turned to human so you could go with everyone else into the village.

“Don’t worry about it, happens all the time.” You said and continued with no further thought However Sarah ended with a glare as if to add a death threat if they did it again. It wasn’t long while chasing a running Temari to find Kankuro as the news reached her she had rushed to him. However you had little time in the room to dwell as a rather old lady tried to run Kakashi through as she mistook him for someone named The White Fang, a ninja that apparently looked just like Kakashi give or take. The people in the room didn’t take your presence much better as you all entered. After getting him conscious with some fast and precise medical implementation Sakura called you over.

“What the hell is HE doing here?” he spat as you still had a rather bad reputation among those that heard about you before you returned to the village. You expression sank a little but otherwise looked to Sakura to see what she needed.

“That’s a long story but for now he is saving your life.” Sakura stated then turned to you. “I got most of it out. If you could… you know… do that thing? Your body would be able to handle it since it was a poison meant for strictly humans. I have enough to make an antidote later but he needs it out of his system before it spreads again.” She asked and you nodded, taking a position near his head. You placed a hand on his forehead and despite his protests you started. A light game from his body as it glowed then looked as if the light was easing its way through his veins and into your hand. When it was done there wasn’t even a scratch from his battle and he was able to sit straight up as a bit of blood came from the wounds he once had. You walked over and sat down while clapping your hand to one of the bigger wounds and put another hand to your head as your body dealt with the injuries and poison.

“What did he just do? I feel better than before I fought.” Kankuro said as he flexed his limbs to be sure and looked over at you while you nursed the pain with the aid and soothing of Sarah.

“Max has an unusual ability. He can take in the illness or injuries of someone to his own body, leaving the other person completely healed. You may notice all your scratches and wounds are also gone. Even if you had a headache he would absorb that as well. His body can heal itself very effectively but the pain and wounds don’t tickle as they feel the same or worse than when you had them.” Kakashi explained.

“What manner of jutsu is that child?” the old lady from before asked. You heard someone call her ‘Granny Chiyo’ and she seemed to be like a less idolized version of the elders in the Leaf Village.

“It’s not a jutsu.” You answered as you looked up at her a scratch across your chest healed and it was hard not to notice. “If anything it is magic but the term doesn’t quite fit either. I am not exactly sure what it is but it is useful.”

“You have beautiful eyes. Almost reminds me of Uchiha eyes but more standard. That shade of red suits you well.” she complimented. You looked at Sarah as if to ask if you were slipping as sometimes you missed something during your transformation.

“No, you’re ok.” She answered.

“Thank thank you Ms. Chiyo.” You said to her with a smile. After that she seemed to notice the reaction of the people in the room toward you.

“I don’t know what has their underpants in a bunch but you seem ok in my book.” She smiled back and laughed an old lady laugh.

“I need some air.” You said after Kakashi sent out the ninja hounds in search or Gaara. You had said you could just as easily track him but they said that was what they were for so you were benched for the moment. But all the glares were getting to you so with a sigh of relief when they allowed you to sleep on the roof. “You sure you don’t want to sleep in a bed?” you asked as you stretched your full dragon body out then curled up for the night. Once you were situated and the guards stopped panicking she took her spot in the crook of your head and neck.

“Silly, you are my bed. I never sleep better than when I’m with you. You’re so nice and warm and safe. Sleep well Max.”

“You too, something tells me we’re going to have a busy day tomorrow.” You returned to which she hummed and cuddled into your neck then fell asleep with you following shortly after.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They attack until they see the others on your b...

choices: He is no contest as you can see past the Sharingan.
He uses a hostage to keep you out of the fight.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You left as soon as the ninja dogs got back. Kankuro and Temari were angry that they were ordered to remain and it was the one time they showed that they were glad you were going. However Granny Chiyo joined the group and was surprised at the sight of you. It took transforming to human and back to convince her that you were the Max she was talking to before. Then with that settled you took off and flew toward where the dogs had tracked the one Kankuro fought. You could also smell Gaara, however because of Granny Chiyo you couldn’t fly that fast. It was a premature stop when Kakashi asked that you set down for a break. You had been flying for a day straight so you agreed then went out to hunt.

“Hey Max, how’d your hunt go? Bring back anything tasty?” Sarah asked while the others ate. Some didn’t even notice you until she said something. You were a Dark Hunter and very few could follow your movements but being that it was light out it was a lot easier.

“Had a bear and a few wolves. But you always like deer don’t you?” you asked after you deposited the deer on the ground for her to prepare if she wanted. She hugged your head and gave you a little peck on the snout before going to clean and prepare the meat for cooking. You used to do it for her but as she got older she insisted that you didn’t do everything for her.

“Hard to believe a creature such as yourself is so gentle.” Granny Chiyo observed and it was a good thing Sarah didn’t hear it.

“Thanks, I think.” You said, not sure if it was a compliment or a criticism.

“We talked about Gaara and Naruto’s story and why they are so different from the stereotype that marked them. What makes something, that legend says is quite dangerous, so kind and gentle.” She asked.

“He’s not always that way.” Sarah said as she came back with some meat and placed it on the fire to cook. She nodded back to the carcass and you covered yourself while taking in the rest she didn’t touch then after cleaning yourself off so blood wasn’t dripping from your mouth you turned back to the group. “He can get quite ferocious, especially if he sees another dragon. Back home he was dragon’s worst nightmare, along with some human groups that liked slaying dragons.” Sarah said and the others listened as if she was telling them a deep secret.

“Why would you kill your own Kind?” Granny Chiyo asked.

“Because I hate dragons.” You said with a growl then stopped as she was getting worried.

“The question was why?” she asked again but after she was confident it was safe to do so. You were laying so the side where your mother’s teeth marks were more prominent. So all you had to do was lift your wing and the light shown off the scars while the ground covered the one the Leaf Village gave you. There was a gasp than after a few seconds you folded your wing back up. “What could do that to you?” she asked as if gathering information on a foe that could do that to a dragon your size.

“My mother did that not more than a few minutes after I was born. I was then discarded like trash and hunted by any dragon that felt they could kill me. So when I was old and strong enough I fought back. I hated the way they treated me, I hate how they treat humans, I hate the arrogant stride they have without a care for anyone but themselves, I just hate them in general.” You said as your eyes flared as if remembering a past event.

“So you hate your own kind?” She asked.

“Not all of them. He doesn’t mind Kara.” Sarah said and they all keyed up at a dragon you didn’t hate. They were all under the impression you hated all other dragons. So this was news to him. “She’s a dragon that was abandoned like he was, not as hard but still abandoned none the less. She was raised by humans and it took a lot for Max not to eat her. But we are both glad he didn’t.” she said and you both thought back to Kara and that she was waiting for them. Good thing dragons live for a long time.

“You eat them too?” she asked.

“Well they were dead anyway and it would be wasteful and inconsiderate for me to go hunting with a ton of meat already provided. That and the other dragons would track the scent and attack the nearest village as retribution if I didn’t take care of the corpse. It also scared the crap out of any dragons that thought they could sneak in and eat a few humans like they did elsewhere.” You explained.

“So do you eat humans as well? If you are half and half, and you do eat one side…” she asked concerned on the topic.

“That is a touchy subject.” Sarah said for you as you looked away and the others looked down. “He has eaten a more than fair amount of humans and he says that to a dragon a human’s taste is a delicacy, which is why so many dragons on my world eat humans. However Max only truly eats a human for digestion if he is given no other choice. He even prefers to waste the energy to burn them to ashes rather than just gulping them down. He also has a storage gut or second stomach that he can rapidly heal humans and keep them safe under his scales. Both instances require him to eat a human and he doesn’t ever like doing it.” Sarah explained for you. “However he has recently been scared from doing the positive form of eating to heal people so I doubt he would do it again anytime soon.” She added which got the others to sulk and Chiyou to repress some ideas she was having.

Granny Chiyo was still curious and for a time while they ate you answered them. You figured this was the first and probably last time she would see a dragon so she had to get her fill. Eventually the camp was cleaned up but right before you were about to leave a man blocked your path. The others were instantly on guard but you didn’t see why. He was just a man on the council from the sand village.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Nothing like a good breakfast...

choices: Help from a large old friend.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ah… what is going on?” you asked as you were currently unaware why everyone was on guard.

“Max, that is Itachi Uchiha, you know as in Sasuke’s brother.” Said Sarah as she was the one to read up on all the people but as Sasuke had been and still was a friend of yours you had also learned as much as you could about him and this man wasn’t it. The only thing that warranted caution, as far as you could see was that he had an Akatski Cloak on.

“Are you sure? He doesn’t smell or look anything like him, if those samples you gave me were accurate.” You said as you leaned your head forward and sniffed him a little.

“What do you mean?” asked Kakashi.

“I mean if I remember right that man is a council member from the sand village. Although there is some kind of genjutsu around him, well not exactly but it he is shrouded in something that seems to be transferring control over his body to someone else.” You explained.

“Well we can’t look at him because Itachi has the sharingan. You think you can take him out?” asked Sarah which got you to look down. You didn’t like when they told you to kill someone. It was too close to the constant betrayal pattern to be comfortable by any means. Not to mention that the Sand Village thought you were still a threat, and you didn’t think torching one of their council members would heal any wounds.

“We need to get passed him. It is most likely that the man that is being used has already betrayed the Sand Village to allow this to happen to him. Either that or he needs to be freed of this torture.” Kakashi stated as you looked at him as if asking if there was another way. You thought about it while the man possessed by Itachi was waiting for them to look at him and they were deflecting shuriken and Kunai as he was trying to get their attention and sight line. But in the end you didn’t see any other way so you stood from your position and toward above the enemy ninja.

You used a form of shadow possession jutsu but a form that only paralyzed him and didn’t transfer any injuries to you. You then loomed one of your claws over him and after hesitating again you ran the man through with a single stroke, effectively pinning him to the ground and lodging the claw through what used to be the majority of his torso. With that done you released the jutsu and your now bloody claw from the dead body. Granny Chiyo was noticeably freaked out on how easily you dispatched a very strong opponent. But you walked a little way to a small stream to clean what little blood you had gotten on yourself from the splatter.

“You know that they aren’t going to lock you up every time you take out an enemy.” Sarah said as she walked up beside you with the others investigating the corpse of the fallen ninja. You were still down as you were when she asked you to do it. Just like you were whenever you had to do something like that on every mission since you got back.

“I know I just… I don’t like it. Even if they don’t think of me as the ‘big bad dragon’ anymore. It just seems that I am recognized as one. I know my appearance doesn’t help the matter but… Is it so bad that I don’t like killing them?” you asked as you got done cleaning your claws and blood spatter from nearby scales.

“Oh come one I think you look cool.” Sarah said as she gave you a pat on the leg, as that was all she could reach at the moment. You genuinely smiled at her joke as it was always a joke between you two. You looked ‘cool’ and she looked ‘hot’, as evidence to all the guys checking her out. Not to mention she was the only one that wasn’t afraid from you smiling normally, which usually showed your teeth. It was a tell she was happy to see but most everyone else was afraid of the deadly assets to your arsenal.

“Alright sulking moment over, party pooper.” You said as you brought your head down and nudged her a little. She just playfully hit you back than got on, which usually meant either leaping to the top or climbing up. When she would climb up it usually caused a panic of people that didn’t know better. She was after all using deadly parts of your face for hand and foot holds, meaning your teeth, lips, nose, eye lids, and horns. Things that most people wouldn’t touch with a 100 foot pole.

With a little more debating they all climbed up on you then you took off, as gently as you could for Granny Chiyo’s sake.

“Are you ok Max?” asked Naruto to which most of the others other than Chiyo and Sarah were also thinking on that as you had been a little down when you killed the enemy.

“Yeah, Sarah helped and I feel fine.” You said back to them as you flew, Sarah petting your head as she sat on it.

“Why were you feeling bad? You did well and dispatched a powerful opponent with ease.” Asked Granny Chiyo as she was confused why an action that usually spawned pride was apparently caught with such distaste.

“Max said it before but he doesn’t like killing people. Doesn’t matter if they are like that or not. We might have something to do with his emotions on that part.” Kakashi stated so you or Sarah didn’t have to answer a question that brought up some unpleasant memories.

“What do you mean?” She asked.

“Let’s just say that we have had some trust issues with him in the past that was to our fault and none of his. We can’t and don’t want to go any further but it was hard to get over and still leaves a scare there for both sides to remember.” Sakura stated and as Chiyo must have a few instances in her past in similar positions she let it drop there. For now she just expressed that she understood and you all just enjoyed the ride in your own ways. That was until…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: He is no contest as you can see past the Sharin...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Another shockwave went through the surrounding land as you put your whole strength into a blow to break the 5 seal barrier around where Garra was. The shockwave was strong enough to cause miniature earthquakes and title waves but the barrier and those inside remained unaffected. You were tempted to try burning your way in but apparently that would only be a disastrous choice as it would destroy the seals needed to lift the barrier in the first place. You snarled at the once again unaffected barrier as some of those with you quivered at both this and the force you were unleashing to do it.

“Looks like we are going to have to do it the old fashion way.” Kakashi sensei stated which the others agreed and you snuffed and relented to his knowledge of this. “Guy, you and your team take care of the other tags while we deal with this one and get back to us as soon as you can.” He instructed and with a few more words to each other and small talk they were off. Shortly after the radios were activated and they destroyed the barrier by peeling all the seal tags off at once. “Ok Sakura, why don’t you give it a try this time. Max I don’t think you can fit in there so you guard the entrance.”

“Very well.” you responded and crouched as if ready to pounce on the slightest movement. Sarah stayed on you as she usually did, being your rider and all. With the last ‘boom’ of the day the boulder covering the entrance collapsed and they all rushed in with you and Sarah guarding the hole but glaring inside. Naruto of course started making demands and the other two, although unnerved by you, argued than one of them made some kind of bird out of detonation clay and after grabbing Garra took off towards you. You caught his movement and would have just incinerated him but with Garra’s body with him you didn’t dare to do so. You made a grab for only him but with him being a comparatively smaller target than the whole bird he was on you missed and he flew out. You now saw how such an opponent could defeat Garra, he wasn’t half bad. You snarled then turned to give chase as Naruto and Kakashi leapt on your back and you took off. They used their chakra to hold on which hurt a little as they were not as skillful as Sarah was but your current attention was on the flying clay bird with Garra inside.

“Can’t you get closer?” asked Naruto to which you just growled as you concentrated on doing just that.

“He is trying, but a bird is naturally more agile in the air. If he speeds up and that guy moves just a little bit to the side we could be miles away and him moving in the opposite direction. That and if he just attacks him he will blow up that bird and kill Garra along with him. He needs to be careful.” Sarah stated as you made another snap for the rider of the clay bird and only got a clay spider blown up in your face. You snarled at this but was otherwise unaffected. Finally after a lot of cat and mouse you missed again but managed to damage but no destroy the bird’s wing. As it tumbled to the ground you followed and tried taking the man out while he hit but the man was able to dodge and disappear and despite your urge to chase him you stayed with the bird and Garra.

“Garra!” Naruto said as he tried to get Garra to wake but you could now smell as he was out of the clay bird that he was dead although it looked like his body wasn’t detraining as quickly as if his spirit was still holding on but not inside his body. It was a weird feeling but that didn’t stop Naruto to suddenly start to get more powerful and actively look for the enemy. You watched as a type of cloak enveloped his body and after a little tussle Kakashi put something on him that instantly brought him back. After that…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Art vs fire.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Be careful, he’s a long range righter that uses explosives.” Said Kakashi as Team Guy got there and chased Deidara out and back to his bird. He wasn’t doing so well as Kakashi had taken both of his arms as you flew after him with his knew Sharingan. They were facing him down but you growled and took a step forward toward the enemy.

“It has been interesting to say the least but I still have my masterpiece.” Deidara said as he chewed some of his bird up and swallowed. You began to see before Neji that he was going to explode and what little time you all had to get out. Even you had to admit that for the level of chakra he was putting out this would be an impressive explosion.

“Get behind me.” You growled to which they were already looking at you from your previous growl so they did as you said. You snarled at the man as he was almost ready to blow but as he did so you readying your breath as well as a good amount of chakra to enhance your already insane attack. It was so intense that even before you let it go you were drooling actual drops of fire from your snarling form. As he exploded you let go the immense power you were holding back toward Diedara and his explosion. Your flames easily overtook his and pushed them back, although you had your claws dug into the ground to brace yourself from being driven back from the sheer force you were unleashing. Like a stationary and insanely powerful rocket. When you were done and breathing heavy from the exertion there was a three mile trench of incinerated space. You had to make it that powerful or the extra flames would have started a forest fire, but if there was nothing to burn than it eliminated the problem.

“Damn Max did you have to wreck half the country side?” Sarah teased as the others stood in utter shock.

“Any lighter… and… the… extra fire… would start a forest… fire.” you explained between breaths as you walked a little so you weren’t standing over anyone then laid down to relax and panting until you gained control of your fatigue.

“Sakura can you…?” Naruto asked as they all then turned to Garra and his limp body. Naruto carried him to a field and there she examined him in every way she could to be sure. But you already knew, he was dead. You could smell it and you didn’t hear a heartbeat, not to mention a couple dozen other tells that concluded the same thing. Finally she looked uup and gave him an answer with a shake of her head. He began to cry than turned to you. “Max you can do something can’t you?”

“If he was still alive I could. Sadly I have no power to help after death sets in.” you said solemnly and after a crying speech of how unfair it was and what not Granny Chiyo came forward and started a jutsu that you had never seen before. You didn’t know what to make of it. However soon it seemed she didn’t have enough Chakra to finish and even when Naruto placed his hands over hers she was still having some difficulty so you inched forward as your body was a little sore and tired.

You extended a single claw over to them and even though they were insanely scared, seeing what it did to Itachi or at least who he was possessing, but they stayed and continued. You rested the claw on their hands and over Garra’s body and also transferred your chakra to help her out. It was clear to you that this was not a healing ninjutsu and from the look of her she wouldn’t survive it. So you helped as much as you could and soon the glow that was formerly just around her and naruto’s hands was now including Garra’s entire body. Granny Chiyo then said a few words to Naruto and also Sakura then she looked over to you and for the first time without a scared thought in her head.

“Don’t give up on us humans. I know we don’t look like much and we have hurt you deeply. Yet you are so kind and gentle to us. If you remember anything I say remember this. Don’t ever regret the good you have done and don’t let others make you think that it is bad. You are strong and you will carry the burden of many as you already do. Don’t let us humans destroy our bond with you. Without living we are just a worthless sack of meat like any other.” she said to you and you nodded then retracted your claw as she fell asleep and soon after breathed her last while Naruto was bringing Garra back. Shortly after his attempts the area was surrounded by sand ninja and while they were hesitant around you they came forward and surrounded Garra, so many of them that Sarah had to leap onto your head get out of their way. You almost made a circle around the whole group as you all waited for him to wake. Finally after a long wait his eyes were open and he was reacting to the people around him. He was so out of it he didn’t even notice you until he turned around and almost fell over. You just held still, with your head on the ground, as Sarah waved from your head.

“Can you do anything for her?” Garra asked which got you to move again. You weren’t expecting him to address you as he was probably still under the impression you were a danger.

“I can’t bring her back. But I can send her off with style.” You said than stood up an looked up to the sky. You had been working on using your massively superior abilities to make visually appealing things like images and fireworks in the sky. So with a breath in you blew a constant stream of fire into the air than started to add other aspects to it as time progressed. You added ice and crystal to change light spectrum, and used snow and shadow to make the shade and tint until what looked like an angelic version of Granny Chiyo was seen but was so big that the sand village could probably see it. You had her smile like you had seen her do and with a final gust you made a fixed location so she was looked straight at the sand village as if both she was proud of it and at peace. It was like a huge memorial and as you finally finished and left her there you looked down and relaxed to catch your breath.

“It’s beautiful, how, when did you learn to do that?” Sarah asked and was a question shared by the others as they either looked at you or at the Chiyo in the sky.

“I have been thinking that I should develop something that isn’t purely for combat but so I can add something besides fear and death to this world. This is what I have come up with so far. It should stay for a month or so before the flames and other elements are carried away by the breeze and natural elements around.” You explained but as hard as you worked to suppress the feeling that accompanied their usual vision of what you are, you let out a sigh and laid your head on the ground. Instead of Sarah saying anything she just laid on your head, between your eyes and gently pet you as she looked up at your creation.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Regeneration from Chiyo.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Thank you for what you did, for Lady Chiyo.” Garra said after you all were resting and in the village. You all were going to leave right away but you convinced them that if Kakashi was able to fly you could get them back within a few hours at top speed. So they were helping him rest up for the journey and you were in need of serious recharging before such a trip. You had used more energy in one day than you had in a long time. You were right to assume that the image you made for Chiyo could be seen from here and it could. It was like she was saying her goodbye to her beloved village. The paradox of what she was known for and what she did along with this was enough to make many cry when they looked at her face, starring back at them.

“I couldn’t save her.” you said as you looked away. You were more or less required to remain in dragon form, not that you minded but the concept of them still not accepting you hung on you a little. Although they did bring you food and water. But it fell to Sarah to bring it within eating range as most thought they would join the food they gave you. Of course they didn’t say it but it was in their eyes and actions, not to mention you could hear almost all of them if you tried. “But it looks like you are doing good for yourself.” You said in a more cheer tone of voice. It was good that Garra was usually not very outgoing as far as emotions were concerned or he would’ve fled from the outburst.

“Indeed, I have people that I care for and people that care for me. Naruto has shown me this… and you too.” He added and you looked at him as if you didn’t understand. “You told me that I should prove worthy of your friendship and trust. For the longest time I didn’t know what you meant. Then something else hit me while you were imprisoned in you village. I know you could’ve fought them and won but you didn’t. You didn’t want anything after you returned either. You said you had a high value on human life and now I know what you meant and how far you would go for it. If you, not even fully human had such a high value on it than why didn’t I? That was the point where it set in for me.” He explained.

“Awe, you’re going to make him cry.” Said a voice you both snapped to as Sarah came over to you. She gave you a pet on your snout before walking over and leaning against you as she looked over at Garra. “He may look all cool and sometimes scary but inside he is a big softy.” She said as she gave your leg a pat as she leaned on it.

“And you’re a know it all Hottie.” You said back and a moment of comical relief came as you both stuck out your tongues at the other.

“Um… Max. I asked you before if you were my friend and now I understand how infantile my understanding of such things was at the time. Would you consider me a friend now?” he asked as he was now showing a rare form of emotional twinge. Perhaps it was because he could finally sleep but he seemed more rested to you. You looked at Sarah and she nodded for you to check him out. With that you moved your head closer and took in his scent. Despite his usual demeanor he was slightly unnerved by your jaws so close to him.

“You smell much better now. I would be glad to call you ‘friend’.” You answered.

“Did I smell bad before?” he asked as if there was a bathing requirement for being your friend. This made Sarah laugh and you just move back so she could answer.

“Max is a dragon and like most dragons they can tell by the very scent of someone wither they are friend, foe, ally, food, evil, or pretty much anything else in between, age and skill pending. You probably smelled really untrustworthy before and now I would guess you smell on the far side of the friend line or he would’ve asked me my opinion before deciding.” She answered.

“I see. If you don’t mind me asking. Who smells the best?” he asked as if wondering who you were closest to and to target trustworthy people out.

“Sarah, no contest.” You answered. “She has never really feared me and always has done what she thought of as right. Not to mention she is the closest thing to family that I have. Ever since we first met her scent just calms me down, even if I am in blood rage with another dragon or something. A simple whiff of her scent or the sound of her voice is all it takes to bring me back.” You answered which made Sarah blush a little, ok a lot.

“Oh stop embarrassing me.” She said as she whacked you and you gave her face a lick and you both laughed which was followed by a smile from Garra. This was turning out to be a good day.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Garra's wish.

choices: Elders want you gone, too bad for them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
The ride back was hardly pleasant as Guy Sensei would continually barf from traveling in such a fashion. You were in the middle of soaking in the lake, taking a much needed bath for your dragon form, when Sarah came by looking for you.

“Max, come on break’s over.” Sarah said as she addressed you through the layer of water and down to your massive form underneath. You rose from your soaking spot and lightly broke the water as she jumped to the shore to prevent getting wet. You shook a little to get the water off but not enough to get water on her. Directly after you were done Sarah landed on your head and you looked up to her. “Lady Tsunade wants us to see us, both of us. Something about a request or something.”

“Ok, but it better be good. That was the first bath I’ve had in a month while in dragon form, I was rather enjoying myself.” You answered back and she just teasingly traced her finger on the top of your head to check for dirt.

“Well you’ve never had a problem smelling bad, even after eating a beer your breath smells rather nice.” Sarah stated more as a compliment but knew well that it doubled as teasing.

“Careful little hottie, I haven’t eaten all day and you smell good.” You teased back. Most people were scorned heavily for even suggesting it but between you and her it was accepted. However even with you two getting close again, the teasing never got further than the entrance to your throat. You were still to scared to swallow anyone alive that you didn’t want to digest. A few times Sarah tried sneaking her way into your stomach to get you over it but it never worked.

“But then I would need a shower. Fine you win Grumpy.” She relented as she didn’t want to appear in front of Lady Tsunade with your drool soaking her. You carefully walked through the village with most people getting out of your way. The ones that didn’t you were able to avoid well enough as you made your way to a balcony that they had build on the side of Lady Tsunade’s office. She did this so you didn’t have to revert to human form every time she needed you for something. It was just under a normal sitting head height for you and was large enough to hold a few dozen people.

“Max, thank you for coming.” Tsunade stated as she looked slightly up to you. The way it was set up they didn’t need to strain their necks to look you in the face but, as your head was taller than they were, they did have to glance up to make eye contact depending on how close they were to you.

“Lady Tsunade, good to see you again. What did you need me for?” you asked then your large red eyes snapped to a few entering the platform as well. They were each older than she was and all three were ones you weren’t greatly fond of. The elders were always biased against you no matter what you did and Donzo seemed to be trying to extort you at every turn. You had to suppress a growl at their presence. “So it something like that?”

“Pretty much, Donzo would like to have a word. But that is as far as my participation goes with this. If they weren’t part of the village I would suggest eating them.” Tsunade answered.

“Tsunade! It is clear that…” the old woman elder started. You had never even bothered learning their names but cut her off by rapidly approaching them and taking a good whiff of them, letting your teeth show a little to further dictate that you weren’t too fond of them. After smelling you backed off and let out a little comical growl.

“Wouldn’t do that, they smell horrible.” You stated back to her and both Sarah and Tsunade slimed/silently giggled at it. The elders didn’t attempt to say anything in rebutle.

“Do you know what they say about those that insult their elders? They call them ignorant fools.” Donzo stated.

“Do you know what they say about insulting a 500 foot tall dragon? They call them arrogant idiots.” Sarah replied back as she moved and sat on the tip of your snout with her legs draping over the front, so she was closer to the others and could more easily observe.

She knew you liked her scent more than any other so she knew that putting her bare legs in front of your nose was a sure way to please you and keep you calm, depending on what she was trying to do. As she rarely wore shoes to better connect with you in riding, she used Chakra as shoes in other instances, but in instances like this you could lick the bottom of her feet. The feeling was good for her, as it apparently felt like a warm, wet, and velvety massage. It obviously gave you a good taste of what was hanging just over your nose and enticing your senses in that fashion. And other than a few select people that were close to you and Sarah, almost everyone else reacted in a way that indicated that you were going off the deep end. Usually the feeling would make you feel lonely and sad. However you only did so when you were trying to get on someone’s nerves and get a reaction from them that some of the others nearby could laugh at. This was no exception as they looked at your little lick of affection to her feet as a horrendous act and got the elders to shake noticeably and Donzo to sweat. Tsunade had to turn in a fake attempt to scold you, when what she was really doing was grinning from ear to ear at the both of you then turned and you acted like she had just snapped you back in line.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: refusing Donzo.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Max, we have come to insist that you remain in the village and not go out on any more missions.” Donzo stated. This was a constant debate between you and them. Basically you had a treaty of sorts when you came back and they put you to the level of Jounin. In the treaty you could contest any assignment anyone put you on and you had the freedom to leave if you wanted. You still had to act in a way the shown on the Leaf Village in a good way; Not attacking Allies, Watching your step, not burning down anything expensive, and other stuff like that. Otherwise you could walk or fly pretty much anywhere you wanted. People around had almost gotten use to you from a distance as they saw you soar above them or walk in the forest. Most didn’t go anywhere near you but they did accept that you were around and you weren’t hunting them.

“Not this again. My answer is the same as before. I am not budging on our little treaty I have with the Leaf. I really don’t care how many times you ‘insist’ that I follow your orders. You are not getting your way in this. I am never going back to what it was before, so stop asking.” You answered. All three of them looked like someone just put a crab in their pants as they huffed and mumbled to each other as they left. You may have gotten a little too close and scared them out of the area but no one still there minded that in the least.

“I wish you were here every time they came to see me.” Tsunade sighed then turned to you and exchanged light smiles between the three of you. “I actually was thinking about something that you two could do as a part of the Leaf Village rather than a tacked on force.”

“Really, did you finally figure out what we could do… officially I mean?” Sarah asked as she jumped down from your snout and you back up a little to give them some room.

“Well, it is a huge asset to have even you, Sarah as what we have all called the two of you, Dragon Ninja. Ever since you shared your eyes with her Max she has become a very coveted part of our village, even more so than the other visual eye based jutsu that we have had and still have in the village. You recall when Donzo required you to pass it along to him as well.” Tsunade replied.

“Indeed, I do believe he left with a burning robe that time.” You replied as they remembered the instance and, again, smiled at the memory.

“Well I have a similar request but one that gives you more control. I have been thinking for a while about what kind of team you should be a part of. While you were originally on Team Kakashi it was more of a last minute thing since you were the odd person out in the selection. I have felt that you should be afforded your own team under your sole command and part of the Leaf Village Military system.” Lady Tsunade stated.

“I guess sense we’re both Jounin it makes sense. What did you have in mind?” Sarah asked as she thought about what was being presented as it was.

“If you both accept, I will legitimately form a separate training core under your guidance and leadership. The sole premise of this faction will be to train more Dragon Ninja. The selection will have to be finalized by you, but once they are, you will have complete control over them. You can take them out of the village or even eat them if you wish. Not that I think you would but that is the level of freedom you will be given in this. If I have a mission for your faction I will come to its leader and they will hand it out when an agreement is reached.” Tsunade explained in a tone and way that stimulated the aura of trust, regret, and anticipation. She was giving you a huge responsibility and gift at the same time.

“So, in a sense, you want me to head up and start a Dragon Ninja Training Faction? Wait, you said ‘its leader’, as if you were expecting us to leave.” You responded.

“You told me yourself. That you may leave one day and that was why you didn’t want to do anything big. If this… Faction, works as I am hoping then the ones you train will take over when you are done and gone for whatever reason.” Tsunade quickly explained so that it didn’t seem like she was trying to get rid of you.

“I see, so this will start something like the Uchiha clan and such. Basically a separate faction that will live on in the village.” Sarah interpreted to which Tsunade nodded in agreement.

“And sense the Dragon’s Eye is hereditary it will be passed down among that faction and, eventually, clan.” You added and she nodded again.

“I know that I am asking a lot. Effectively this would take you out of most activities and keep you in the village just like Donzo said. Even if you can leave whenever you want you will still have responsibilities here as the leader and starter of this… Well I guess if you approve… this clan.” Tsunade revealed the darker side of the idea. If said the wrong way, it could look like she was trying exactly what Donzo did but in a different manner.

“What do you think Max?” Asked Sarah as she thought about it.

“Well you’re the brains, you first.” You responded.

“Well I think that it has two possible outcomes. You can start this Dragon Ninja Clan and be its founder. But that would cause obvious hostility for a while among the Village and from those that don’t wish to be part of it at the start… and those that do. You will have to deal with people possibly stealing your gift like the other Clans in the Village and eventually they would be just like those Clans and possibly end up like the Uchiha Clan.” Sarah revealed, paused, then went on to the next option. “Or, you could train a small unit that is always with us. The Dragon’s Eye will be limited to only them and you don’t have to worry about the long term effects. But that will possibly cause resentment among the village and ostracize the those we train so that the diluted Dragon’s Eye can’t be passed down. So in a sense you have either Hostility or Restentment.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Donzo's command.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“I don’t really loath the idea of bringing the hostility that I have known on others. However a single force would be useless to the Leaf Village in that sense. So I think I will pick making a Clan, as strange as that sounds. Maybe that way if Kara ever comes here she can help with it, or if other dragons come they will not be as helpless as most would be.” You answered after thinking on it for a very long moment. “I assume you know what needs to be done in order to make this work?”

“Yes, you will need a large sum of willing families that are all worthy and able to learn the new styles. Personally I would say they should all be from the same bloodline already. We have a few Family lines that have no real specialty and would jump at the chance to rival the Noble Clans of the leaf. Let me gather the heads of those families for you and explain so they know what is going on. Do you mind waiting at one of the practice fields so they can bring their families if they wish?” Tsunaded answered and asked.

“Not at all, we’ll head there now.” You stated to which Sarah got the message and jumped onto your snout. “You know, there is a chance that I won’t pick any of the families that you bring right?” You asked, not wanting to seem like you were promising to pick one of them.

“I understand that. Just as long as you understand that while most of each family MAY be acceptable, there is always a few bad apples in a bunch.” She replied back to which you nodded then set off toward the training field you used the most. It was the same one you were just recently taking a bath in. On top of that it was right next to the Forest of Death, your official home and present from the Leaf when you came back. You still let them use it but you had the official run of the place.

“I told you that they would want it. Your eyes are just too awesome to ignore.” Sarah said as she activated the jutsu that was used to unseal the eyes once given.

It was like the other optical powers in the Leaf with one main difference. When someone uses the jutsu to reveal and utilize the power it doesn’t use up that much chakra at all. What uses up chakra is when the eyes and abilities the afford to excessive amounts. Like trying to look 4 miles away at a pin inside someone’s pocket. Or using the enhancement that it gave to the style type that the person was good at, specifically fire or shadow. There was other things that Sarah and you were just learning and experimenting with. The strangest thing, that took a considerable amount of energy was dragon parts she seemed to be able to access. It must’ve been part of the Dragon DNA that was now in her but, if she really pushed her limits, she could sprout wings or a tail that resembled yours. She was getting better at it and when both were out all her abilities almost improved by 10 times, but she was still only able to do it for a maximum of 15 minutes before she needed medical attention.

“Are you cool with a whole Clan of people having the same ability I gave you. You know, I was originally only going to give it to you. It was supposed to be a special gift to you.” You answered back.

“Oh I know you love me Max, you don’t have to prove it to me. This just means other people will adore you like I do. Think of it as my gift to you if it makes you feel better.” Sarah replied back as she turned and hugged the top of your snout.

She would nuzzle into the top of it in instances like this. You thought it was something to do with being a small part dragon now. She just loved being close to you and you had a feeling that was the main reason she wanted to be swallowed by you so bad at times. She completely bypassed any of the boys and men that pursued her and went straight for you, as if they were woefully inadequate. She didn’t want a romantic relationship or anything. It was more like a human asking a dragon out. The dragons at home might do it only to trick them into their stomachs but otherwise the female dragon would rather go hang out with another dragon than anything close to that kind of relationship. Since Sarah was already designated as your family long ago she just adored you like a really, really, really close sister.

“It definitely helps.” You said as you made it to the field and was able to lay down in the sun, basking in it. Another thing that she gained with your DNA was the affinity for basking. She didn’t get as much energy from it as you did, maybe 1/1000th of it, but the little bit made it significantly better than any normal human would find it. “You know you are going to have to teach them too right?”

“Ah, didn’t think about that part. I suppose activating your eyes aren’t the same as when I do it, or your other parts for that matter. Heck if it was that hard for you all this time, I can’t imagine what transforming actually takes out of you.” she returned as she traced small invisible shapes on the top of your snout as she talked. She didn’t mind the slight movement as you talked but you talked with just moving he bottom most of the time. Heck, talking with her in your mouth was the harder of the two. Compared to that talking without moving the top of your head was easy.

“You get use to it after a while, but yeah it stings a lot to transform all the way.” You admitted and snaked your tongue up, wrapping it around her legs but she bat it away.

“We still have to meet all those people. I would prefer to do it without being drenched in dragon drool.” She said to which you retracted your tongue.

“Fine you win, grumpy.” You returned, repeating the word she used on you earlier and she just giggled cutely and giving your snout a playful whack then pat. She was close in physical strength to Tsunade, do in no small part to your DNA once again. She was strong before but now she was getting ridiculous. What she didn’t know what that you gave her more than she thought you did. You would only give maybe half of it to the Clan, if you found one that you could accept.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Hostility

choices: Get to the selling points already!
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
The two of you were interrupted by an expected disturbance as hundreds of people crowded into the area, separated by family. Some were married into the family lines and had other traits but most of them you could tell were family. Sarah sat up and in a similar position as before, with her legs draping down over your snout and in front of your nose. She gazed over the large group from her vantage point. Most didn’t get to close and were behind a lead family. It wasn’t until the green coat of Lady Tsunade came forward with Kakashi hobbling along. He was well enough for now to oversee this and was hoping that he was at a point that you could heal him. You didn’t even wait for him to ask as you shot a ‘healing needle’ at him. He knew what it was so he didn’t dodge. Most others gasped at, what they thought, was a sudden aggressive action. Only after the green light faded and they saw him not limping anymore did they realize what you did. Tsunade just smiled and waved over for the heads to follow her to you. They did so reluctantly but also had an underlining anticipation in their step.

“Thanks for that Max.” Kakashi said as he stretched and what not.

“No problem Kakashi Sensei.” You replied back with a slight bow that didn’t seem to effect Sarah at all. However she did see how having a full conversation in her current position would be a problem so she got down and joined the group but on your side. “Wasn’t expecting you to bring all their families, very impressive.”

“Well I thought you could get going before Donzo tries to put his foot in the way, again.” Tsunade stated and you nodded then looked directly at the 2 men that stood near them. “These are the two heads for their families that decided to participate. They are both have their perks, but I’ll let them explain.”

“Very well, and you’re right. I’d hate to know what he’d do if he could get his hands on the Dragon’s Eye. Probably peek at every old dog in the village” You said and comically shook your head to get the image out of your head that got Tsunade to cover her mouth to stop her laughter. Not a lot of people were willing or even thought about insulting him, even when he wasn’t there. You then turned more directly to look directly at the other two she referred to. One was an old man but despite his age had blaze orange hair and his physic was impressive, two traits that looked to be common in the family he brought with him. The other was an equally old man with a more sleek figure and black hair, darker than Sarah’s or any other you’d seen in other families, almost shadow of black color. Both had an impressive amount of Chakra potential. However, for the moment, they were both quivering under your gaze. “Ok, no need to introduce names. If I choose one of you then it will change anyway. Just tell me what separates you and why I should consider you to be part dragon.”

“Wait, part dragon?” Kakashi asked in confusion.

“That is what I’m offering. The reason why Dragon’s Eye works is that I share my DNA with another person. This turns them into part Dragon and not just any, Dark Hunter Dragon DNA is more potent. Even if I am only changing a very small part of them to that it is what makes dragon attacks and sight available. It also is impossible to steal as the power doesn’t reside in the eyes like other powers in the Ninja world. It resides in only the DNA, living DNA, and once separated from the person has no effect on anything. If you were to take some blood or any body part from them to test it would only read as a normal human. It is an exclusive power that can’t be diluted but it does have a downside.” You explained.

“The down side being???” Lady Tsunade asked.

“Well in a way Dragon DNA is very selfish. It doesn’t allow any other powers to reside. So if someone had another abnormal power like a tailed beast, Sharingan, Byakugan, or any other Kekkei Genkai that hinders the growth or the rooting of it. It destroys or removes everything in its path, effectively wiping it away and leaving only Dragon’s Eye. You simply CAN’T have Dragon’s Eye and another Optical or like trait.” You revealed.

“But there how can we use things like Gentle fist without Byakugan?” asked the black haired one.

“Dragon’s Eye can easily see the Chakra networks of people if you look for them. Trust me when I say that Dragon’s Eye is superior than all those other ones… well I guess I am bias and never had the other ones. But there are very few things that can effect a dragon like Max and all that comes with the Dragon’s Eye. Genjutsu is useless against it, I can see a mouse at 5 miles away and hear it squeak if I concentrate. My strength, speed, and other physical abilities are multiplied by 10 when in the Dragon’s Eye final Form and this is all just the beginning of what it can do. Yeah it is a chakra hog at first but the benefit is way worth it.” Sarah stated for them.

“Why can’t you tell us the rest of it?” asked Kakashi, now that his curiosity was peaked.

“To be honest we don’t know much more than that. Everything else is hard to explain. Kind of like seeing with your Sharingan, people just don’t understand unless they have it. Since Sarah is the first I gave it to, she is still mastering it and finding all the neat tricks she can do. Unlike me, she needs to use Chakra to use the abilities that a Natural Dragon like me can just use with almost no penalty.” You answered.

“I see, being a dragon must be exhilarating.” Tsunade stated.

“You’d be surprised. Sure I am big and powerful and all my senses are fine tuned but that makes looking at things difficult.” You stated.

“What do you mean?” Tsunade asked, the others just taking in everything that was going on and the possible power increase they were going to have to convince you to give to them, as well with being under your rule afterward.

“Well, with such high senses when I look at a sunset I don’t see the beautiful scenery, I see the grass seeping in the warmth, the birds getting ready, the change in tones, the noticing of residual heat leaving inanimate objects, all the petty details that ruin such a moment. When I look at Sarah aesthetically I don’t see what others see when then compliment her. I see everything about her, down to her cells, blood speed, and heart rate. The same goes for my other senses. So sometimes I just want a lack of detail to just enjoy things the way you humans can do all the time.” You explained. “It is also why I like tasting things. As awkward as it seems, the detail in taste as a dragon is a soothing aspect, well as long as I don’t have to taste something horrible. Otherwise I have a detailed description why the thing tasted so bad… way more information than I needed.” You said in an attempt to joke, it was actually successful for once as they got use to the mass forms of unusual information.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Multiple families come in bulk.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Well, rather than asking a bunch of meaningless questions I think we can just take your word for it. Let’s get this going before our good luck runs out.” Tsunade suggested and they all agreed.

“If you don’t mind?” Asked the fiery red haired old man to the other to which the Black haired man nodded a single nod. To this the man walked forward to begin. “Max, I will skip most of the pleasantries and get right down to what you need to know. We are a family that specializes in fire jutsu and it effects us outwardly, to our very hair and bodies. From what you said, your DNA will slingshot our natural abilities to almost god like proportions. We are a strong people that like to face our enemies head on in battle.” He said then bowed to you in a fashion you usually didn’t get.

“And what do you think about becoming part dragon?” asked Sarah.

“It would be an honor to share the same traits as such a powerful being as yourself Max.” he responded without looking up. His answer was truthful but a little too power hungry, almost arrogant.

“And what of you?” you asked to the other man to which the two old men changed spots.

“An honor Max. My family has been in a long line of shadow style users. We prize ourselves for being able to get to our enemies before they even knew we were there. Like my distinguished friend here, our style bleeds into our appearance. We prefer skill over power. While we are no slouch in other aspects, including Fire as well, Shadow is our main form of skill. Mostly as Ninja we are chosen for assassination missions and a fair amount of us are in the Anbu division.” The black haired old man stated.

“And what do you think about becoming part dragon?” Asked Sarah again.

“If we are deemed worthy then it will be a welcomed gift that will never be misused.” He stated. This answer was seeped in word play. Unlike the other, he wasn’t as forward in what he said but he seemed also genuine if a little naive in thinking that the power would NEVER be misused.

“To be fair to both sides, your attributes help but being able to do fire or shadow style jutsu have nothing to do with it.” You stated and they looked confused. “Sarah is a lighting style user and… well you want to show off a little?” you asked. She nodded then turned to the lake, breathed in then let out a massive flame from her mouth that dwarfed most Fire style jutsu most of them could do. She burped up a little smoke and giggled before turning back to their shocked faces. “A dragon’s flame is separate from their chakra flow. Sure chakra can be used to enhance the flame and direct it to enhance and understand fire style jutsu but it is separate, same goes for Shadow style. A Dark Hunter is naturally good at both sides so you will gain at least that. What I am looking for is underneath all that.”

“So how are you going to choose?” asked Lady Tsunade as she seemed to think it was a hard choice.

“Simple, the one that is ‘worthy’ as you all put it will give off a certain scent. As a dragon I trust my instincts. Most of the time they don’t make sense right away but they are the most accurate determining factor that I know of.” You said then moved your head over and sniffed both of them in deep gusts that almost made them fall into your snout at times. They were shaking with having your deadly fangs and teeth so close to them, very similar to the others that had gotten use to it. Sarah even had a problem when she first saw them. It didn’t bother you, at the moment. After a considerable amount of time going from one to the other you backed up to decide.

“Well???” Sarah asked as she was now just as anxious to hear you decision as the other were at this point.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Get to the selling points already!

choices: Takes you longer to move around.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Hmm… How interesting.” You said as you looked at them from your laying position. “To be honest, from just your introductions and profiles I would prefer your side.” you said as you looked over to the red haired man. “You’re right, your flame mastery along with the power of a dragon would make you almost godlike in that respect. That idea makes me interested more than anything. However from both of your scents, my instincts are telling me that I should pick you.” You stated as you looked at the black haired old man. “I would be a very pathetic dragon if I didn’t follow that suggestion.”

“So that is your decision?” asked the red haired man.

“I am afraid so. I wish I didn’t have to choose at all but your side smells strange. It is not something you can prepare either. Aesthetically you smell very impressive but there is something underneath all that, a distinctive hint of something that gets my blood to boil, and not in a good way. I don’t really know what it is but I would be taking a risk with everyone’s life, including yours, if I didn’t listen to my own senses.” You answered and his head went down. “But I feel really bad to just let you go without anything. Especially since you all came out here to meet me, that really means a lot to me. So I give you this.” you stated then materialized a set of scrolls in front of him, along with the table the lay on.

“What are these?” he asked.

“Secret fire style jutsu that I have created, including my fire clone jutsu. There is a high possibility that you and your family will not be able to do them. But if there is any human outside the Dragon Ninja that can do them it would be your family. Hopefully it will help, if not then I wish you the best.” You stated with a noticeable bow.

“I thank you for your generosity and gifts.” He said then took the scrolls and had his family follow him out of the area until only the black haired man and his family remained.

“Well that went better than I thought.” You said.

“No kidding, I was expecting a few more ‘but why’ begging sessions.” Sarah stated, on the same wave length as you.

“So how does this work?” asked Kakashi, bringing both of your attention back to the current situation.

“Well the passing of the Dragon’s Eye is rather simple, painful but simple.” You revealed.

“Painful?” asked the old man.

“I am forcibly injecting a new DNA type into your bodies, of course it is going to be painful. But after about an hour the pain will be gone. The problem is afterward. If this is going to be some kind of Clan now, where are we all staying? I assume somewhere inside the village walls but where?” You asked.

“We all have our own dwellings.” The old man stated with some pride. But you looked at him and he relented. “Most of them being in the old or ruined house districts. We haven’t needed much more than that and haven’t been able to finance anything more.”

“Until now.” You stated and he looked up to you with both longing and questioning eyes. “I am starting the Dragon Nina Clan from your family. You don’t really think that I would just sit by while you all starved and lived in poverty did you? The only question is where? Lady Tsunade, you don’t happen to have any space that I could take over do you?”

“There is large area that needs to be demolished and redone. No one lives there anymore and has been cleared, but we haven’t been able to find the time or money to destroy a part of the village and rebuild it. You could use that area, ironically the area you first had for your dwelling, you know it?” She answered.

“Yes, so I can do with it as I wish? Well in terms of demolition and reconstruction.” You asked to be clear.

“Yes, I will be eager to see your addition.” She said, eager and happy to have the spot be redone with no cost to her or the village. The starting of a new Clan usually took a lot of backing and financing. However if you were able to bypass all of that legally it would only improve things. Plus, who would attack the manor or a dragon?

“See, you’ll all get new homes and not downgrades either.” You stated and a round of hushed cheers came from the group. It was a more private conversation but it was hard to cover up your words from them, do in no small part to your size. “I can start as soon as your family is ready. I’ll need some time to recharge after that but it should be around the same amount of time for each of you to adjust as well. I recommend that you make sure everyone is sitting or laying down and securing infants. The sudden pain could cause them to be dropped and what not.” You explained and he nodded then went off to do likewise.

“Do we need to leave?” Asked Kakashi as he wasn’t sure how the process worked.

“Actually it would be better if you stayed. I will not be in the position to help when I do this. So if there is a problem, like a mother falling on a child or something it would be helpful if someone was there. They will all be in a considerable amount of pain for about 15 minutes and the cool off for about an hour. Nothing fatal but still very painful. The process will only turn those I designate so you have no worries of collateral damage or effects.” You answered to which he nodded then went off to the far end, Sarah did likewise as she stood at a far end opposite of Kakashi while Tsunade stayed on this end.

“We are ready Master Max.” stated the old man with a bow as the people were all sitting or laying down in secure fashions.

“Please, just Max.” you replied to which he nodded and you likewise but nodding him to join them as you got up and walked over to them until you were standing over the large group but far enough away that you could plop down when finished.

You sighed then, after taking in a noticeably large breath you made contact with all the family members. You found a few Donzo spies that thought they could fool you and excluded them. With all the correct people targeted you let out a roar that also spewed a thick black fog into the crowd. They instinctually held their breath but it wouldn’t help. The fog seeped into every entry into the body including sweat pores but only in the ones you designated. I also appeared alive as it found and seeped into each of them. The screams and cries started as the fog cleared out and into them without a trace. As expected you collapsed. It was a lot of work to disperse your own DNA to over 50 people, not to mention in a fashion that was safe and changing them to part dragon. It would’ve been easier if you didn’t have to exclude people and just shoot but that wasn’t the case.

“You lay there at a sideways angle so you could see what was going on. You were limp but still your eyes worked, bringing in images for you to watch and audio. You could see that your suggestion for Kakashi, Sarah, and Tsunade was correct as they had to come to the aid of many among them. You had just changed the Leaf Village and their lives drastically and you hoped it would be for the best.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Shadow type side.

choices: Some trouble over the new Clan that night.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It turned out that it was a good thing that you almost scared them to death with the roar. It opened their bodies’ senses up and allowed a flawless entry and conversion of their cells to the change. Within an hour they were all up and moving, making sure each other were ok then coming over their Hokage, Kakashi, and Sarah as they were over by your head. Sarah was concerned about you when she first came over, almost ordering Lady Tsunade to help you as you couldn’t move. You didn’t need it but she did so anyway. In a short amount of time you were talking but still needed more recharging.

“You still can’t move?” asked the old man as they approached, slightly off that they had to feel such pain but, if it did what it was suppose to, it would be more than worth it.

“You know the pain you all felt?” you asked with your head unable to lift so you were just talking with your lips and limited movement. He nodded as did the rest of them. “Well not only did I have to ready all that change and implement it but, sense they were my cells and DNA, I felt all that pain as you all did and on top of each other. It will be a little longer until I can move at all. It took more out of me than I thought it would, maybe a few hours. Perhaps in that time Sarah can start telling you the basics.” You revealed then shut your eyes and gently fell asleep to the sound of Sarah explaining things.

Like you had come to accept and fear, your dreams weren’t pleasant as you relived your worst memories over and over again. Most of the time it left you restless and Sarah had to watch it when she slept in a dangerous area like your mouth or around your claws and tail. It was not uncommon for you to wake up to very large trenches in the ground because of it. However with all these people around you were glad that you didn’t have the strength to do so. You woke with Tsunade gone but Sarah still explaining the jutsu while Kakashi stood by you. With your eyes so big and noticeable it was hard not to figure out you were awake when you came to.

“So you’re awake, how do you feel? From the sound and look of it you didn’t sleep that well.” Kakashi stated.

“Actually it was more sleep than I usually get. I’ve never slept well like most people or even other dragons.” You answered.

“Is that another dragon thing?” Kakashi asked.

“No, that is just the way it is with me. It might be a byproduct of the genetic memory. Either way, when I dream I relive every mistake and grief filled event in my life, over and over again. When Sarah is near it tends to blur the image a little with her scent but otherwise it can get rather depressing.” You answered.

“Not easy being you is it.” Kakashi stated.

“Grass is always greener I suppose. People wish they want to be like me and I wish I can be more like them.” you returned as Sarah and the old man came forward. “I never got your first name.”

“Pha, my name is Pha… is there a short version of Dragon Ninja we can use for our new last name?” he asked half way between his introduction.

“If you’re looking for brain power then you’re looking at the wrong person.” You said then you all looked over at Sarah. You were starting to straighten and stretch but was still listening as she was thinking.

“Kara… I think that will be a perfect name. The only other dragon we both like.” Sarah stated and you smiled perhaps too much then nodded your agreement.

“Very well, we are the Kara Clan.” The man said to which there was a cheer amongst the crowd. You noticed some of the younger ones that had figured out the Dragon’s Eye were leaving it on while chasing each other. You stood all the way up and gave yourself a very large stretch and yawn with your wings out as far as they went. This got most of their attention.

“Well now that I’m all rested up and it is near the end of the day I guess I should start on our new house. It might take about a day so why don’t you all meet me there tomorrow, with your immediate needs to live then you can move the rest at your leisure.” You suggested.

“Very well, we will arrive tomorrow then.” Pha agreed.

“Come on big boy, we got a lot of work to do.” Sarah said as she leapt on your snout and gave you a pat. The move was slightly comical as you did as she said, heading to the place to begin the process or building your new home… and theirs.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Takes you longer to move around.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Life was pretty much hell for you after that point. What had originally started as insurance turned to be and outlet as the paper bombs sometimes went off with no apparent reason. Most of the time they went off when you didn’t do something right, made any move that was preserved as threatening, or even talked in general.
