You transformed into a human again then took her to a cave and after starting a fire and getting something to eat you sealed the entrance with a boulder and just watched her. You had thought that perhaps the long time and bad memories would’ve dulled her effect on you. However her scent still had the same calming and pleasant effect that in once had. After about a day she started to squirm and move around. It wasn’t until she got her bearings did she realize she might be in danger. To be fair if she was with anyone else she would be so you didn’t take offense to it as she looked around then her eyes fell on you as you stared back at her. You didn’t bother hiding your draconic features and there was no point.

“Max? Is it really you? I mean this isn’t a dream or a trick or something?” she asked.

“Can anyone else turn into a Dark Hunter King and back to human? I’d hate to have another like me out there. I got an image to maintain you know.” You answered and she dropped the Kunai she had armed herself with at your confirmation.

“But you left… you said this place was hell for you. Why would you come back here?” she asked as she didn’t understand.

“It wasn’t my choice to return. I bet they didn’t even tell you they were going to go and get me for some reason of another. Anyway they arrived in the realm I was in but couldn’t get back so I had to use the research I had done into the Portal Jutsu to bring them back. Although I can never go back to that realm. A pity, that realm was full of amazing people and a lot of good friends.” You explained and she just took a seat against the opposing wall from you.

“I bet you don’t want to have anything to do with me after all that. You said it yourself, we are your own personal demons.” She said as she looked down into the dirt.

“There is only one person in this whole realm that I want anything to do with and I’m looking at her.” you responded and head bolted up.

“What? After what I did to you? How many times did I bring you down? How many times did I set one of those bombs off just for the fun of it? Why would you want anything to do with me?” she asked.

“Well for starters you only did that stuff after the messed with your mind. I’ve always admired your ability to act on what you felt was right. That has not changed. Second, you’re family aren’t you?” you said and after that point she flung herself from her position straight at you, hugged you around the waist and buried her head in your chest, her legs curled away from the fire and into your lap. “That and Kara will kick my ass if I go back without you.” you joked after you let her cry and snug up so you were holding her more properly. She chuckled for a moment and hit your chest as a return for your joke. But then it stopped and she looked up at you curiously.

“What do you mean?” she asked.

“Well I was going to wait until you had some breakfast but I guess there is no point in hiding it. Your smart ass would just figure it out anyway. I was able to return to this realm because I found out how to go in a reverse order in the portal jutsu. So in short…”

“We can go home!” she exclaimed.

“Well I’m going so if you want out of this place than this is your shot. I’ll understand if you wish to stay, well not really but I’ll support your decision. They are probably going to try everything short of releasing the nine tails to stop us from going.” You said and she turned her head into you again then hugged you tighter and you could feel her fists turn into tight balls and could even smell a little blood from her squeezing them together.

“Let them rot in this hell of theirs. I don’t give a dam.” She said and you were going to get started but she just held you. “Just a little longer. I just want to hold you here for a while, if that’s ok.”

“Take as much time as you need. I’m not going anywhere without you.” you responded as you held her back and stroked her a little. Not that much but enough for her to feel your warm skin on hers. So you stayed like as you pondered how you were going to do this and if they would try to stop you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You enter with no further interuptions.

choices: Home is where the heart is.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
When you sensed the other ninja come in after you as well as setting off some of Sarah’s alarms you both left the safety of the cave and went to the clearing near the center. Sarah placed enough traps to stall them for a time. Then you set up a barrier that surrounded the two of you in case they arrived before you were done forming the reverse portal to home.

“I don’t think I have to tell you just how dangerous this jutsu is. I wasn’t exaggerating when I said it could wipe out everyone for miles. I need my full attention so I will be solely concentrated on forming it. I need you to act as a buffer so I am not interrupted. The barrier should hold them like before but if not I can’t stop or make the slightest mistake.” You said to Sarah and she nodded as she accepted the assignment you gave her. This would be the first thing you trusted her with since you taking her back and she wasn’t going to mess it up.

You then began your work and as such you were completely engrossed in the work for a little less than you did before. You had gotten better at performing the jutsu and it showed. After you stopped and bent over to catch your breath Sarah came forward and almost touched the portal as she tried to come around and make sure you were ok. You quickly grabbed her and took a few steps away.

“What?” she asked as she was confused.

“The Portal is touchy. It needs time to stabilize. All it takes is a touch for you to go through it. As it is now you would’ve been sucked away to an unknown realm with no way for me to know which one you went to.” You said and she looked at the portal then back at you and nodded.

“Wait!” said a voice now that you allowed the soothing sound of the jungle to come through the barrier but not weaken its field to any degree. You both looked over at a group of people that had gathered.

“How long have they been here?” you asked her as you both gazed over at them.

“They’ve been banging on the barrier a little after half the time you were doing your thing. So selfish, it looks as if they want you to stay.” She answered.

“You dare talk to us about being selfish? You are leaving just when we need Max the most.” Tsunade accused.

“Why do you need me?” you asked and she was about to answer but it looks like she was biting her tongue as she had very little control of what you did at this point. “I am guessing it has something to do with a great power that you need my power to fight against to give you a better chance. Maybe you misunderstand yet again. I am not a weapon or a tool or whatever you think I am. You make the same mistakes over and over again and in all the time I’ve been gone among people… well not like you, none of you have changed. There is only one person in this entire realm other than Sarah that I find to have a slight glimmer of light in this dark and hellish place. Sad thing is, most try to snuff it out or at the very least try to cover it. Even him you treat as a weapon. However, unlike him I don’t have to suffer it. I have two other realms that are as in ‘need’ of me as you are. One I can’t go to because of your medaling and the only other is my home, where I actually belong.” You answered back to which some of them glared at you and others looked either at Naruto or down as what you said hit them a little harder than what they were ready for.

“He is right.” Sarah said as she separated from you and went over to stand in front of Naruto. “You are the only light in this place. The only one that I might actually miss about this place. But don’t keep all that light hidden inside. Share it with the rest of them. You’re going to make one hell of a Hokage.” She finished then went back and waited by the now stabile portal. You now walked over to Naruto as he stood shocked as he was once again the last one to realize something cryptic you said. To this Kakashi and Sakura moved up to join him.

“I understand, you respect us but you believe in him.” Kakashi said.

“If I couldn’t stand you or thought you were evil I would’ve left you in the other realm and helped them bind you there. I have always known that despite your actions toward me you three are… well my team and as far as I’m concerned the three most respectable ninja I have encountered.” You said than pulled a single Shuriken out of a pocket and held it up to Naruto on your side of the barrier. As you suspected, only the three in front of you knew you well enough to know it wasn’t an attack. “Do you remember this Naruto?”

“Is that… the shuriken I threw when you trained me?” he asked.

“It is. Do you want to know why I kept it?” you asked and he seemed to not understand himself. It didn’t look different than any other shuriken he had thrown over the years. “Because what I said back then still applies today. I know you can do it.” You said then pushed it through the barrier and dropped it in his hand. “Now you need to see it. When I look at you I don’t see a nine tailed fox, or a weapon, or a stupid little brat. I see Naruto and the only and brightest light in this realm. Even the smallest or largest of shadows can be illuminated by the light. So shine brightly.” You said as a last comment as he stood shocked with the shuriken in his hand while you bowed to the three then walked over to Sarah.

“Hold on.” Kakashi said and you two turned your heads to see him. “I know that your world is not an easy one so… good luck.” He said.

“Thanks… Kakashi Sensei.” You said than you and Sarah went through the portal, not sure what you were stepping into but as the portal closed behind you there was no going back, and neither of you wanted to.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They appologize and wish you luck.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“What the hell?” Sarah asked as you both stepped into an environment that quite aptly fit the description. The structures were well known as they had been in your mind as a goal to return to. However they were burning and in ruin. As if the people had just lived through a war.

“Damn I hate that smell.” You said as you both continued to walk in order to find someone that could explain what you two were seeing. It was morning and by the time you got to the top of the hill that overlooked the city you were both catching your breath. The entire city was destroyed and it was obvious through many signs that no human was to blame.

“I can’t even smell like you and I agree. There is only one thing that could do this. Correction there is only one thing that WOULD do this.” She said and you rumbled a growl as an affirmative but it was trumped by a crash of weight and the rush of knights as they surrounded you. “They must have used the underground sewers.”

“Before you turn around. Do you want to tell me why I shouldn’t have my very hungry friend to hold her urge to feast?” Asked a very recognizable voice, of Sir Nick.

“Well I am afraid she would not find me that easy to catch.” You said as you slowly turned with Sarah and looked up at Kara as she growled at you. “Kara, you’re all grown up but your scent is still the same.” You addressed her to which she just snarled.

“Knowing her name is not a sign that we know you. Many are aware of her as one of the only dragons capable of defeating a Dark Hunter. We have dealt with more than our fair share of slayers and my instinct sais that you are one.” He stated which caused all the knights and soldiers to further point their weapons at you.

“Well I was named after a very successful dragon slayer and I have killed more dragons than anyone alive probably ever will. I am trying to jog your memory but it seems only a practical approach will suffice.” You said and Sarah just smiled as you grew wings, a tail, and let your eyes go. Your eyes themselves were always a dead giveaway but even if they weren’t there was only one able to do what you did and you were well known. “Does that help?” You asked to a stunned crowd of people and even Kara’s snarling and growling came to an end to make a completely silent space.

“Well this can’t be good. Sir Nick is never speechless unless he is either really shocked or really angry.” Sarah said to you but loud enough to snap them out of the haze they were in. “Max, I am not really feeling that we came at the best time.” She finished as the eyes that now looked at you ranged from overjoyed to betrayed.

“If you really are the real Max than you’re late.” Said a boy that came from behind Kara’s neck to which she lowered for him to jump off and stand with the others.

“Well seeing as we weren’t expected to come back at all I thought we made good time. Although judging on the sight of this city I’m guessing that you all had a hard time.” You responded.

“Everyone, please go back down. I need a word with our returning half breed.” Nick commanded and with some reluctance they all did so except Kara and the strange boy that she was with.

“Sir Nick, Kara; what happened here?” Sarah asked and Kara just turned her head away from your glance.

“Dark hunters happened. They had been tracking our little half breed here but were too afraid to do anything after the mountain of bodies they had lost in their attempts. After Max joined us the word spread quickly that a Dark Hunter was at our disposal. However when the word spread that he was the half breed and that we had sent him through the portal instead of killing him. There was hell to pay. An emissary of the Dark Hunters came and demanded Lord Hizer’s head in exchange for his actions to help him. We naturally refused and even after Kara barely defended us against a few smaller Dark Hunters they decided that our fair city was to be made example of. So last night they came in force and wiped out the entire city and before we could stop him Lord Hizer attempted to quell the slaughter by surrendering himself to them. Their leader and your mother gutted him and continued anyway.” He concluded as you left Sarah’s side and started walking in circles, leaning on the rubble than continuing until the last statement was pointed at you.

“Never in my wildest dreams did I think that coming back here would be so painful. It was my goal and my reward for enduring what happened in the realms I went to.” You said as you stopped at the ruins of a wall, playing with the fire that still burned on the top before putting it out. “But I find that it is not better than the hell I left.” You said and with a twitch of a finger the low wall exploded into dust.

“Max, you need to calm down.” Sarah said as she approached but you turned to them again and she was stopped by your eyes. She had seen you in a bloodlust before, more specifically when a dragon was near or the worse one was when one was attacking her. But she nor did the others ever see you eyes so dark and yet so bright. As if your eyes were the window to hell and you were about to send someone there.

“Not this time Sarah. I’ve lived with this ghost long enough and it ends now. I will be the last Dark hunter to ever plague this world. If they wanted me than I was fine with it. But nowhere is safe if they are willing to go this far just to please…her.” You stated as an aura of flames seemed to lace around you as if it was the physical manifestation of your mental state. It was all hazing over for you at this point and you didn’t think it was going to stop, worse, you didn’t want it to stop.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Home is a little different.

choices: An emissary of the dark hunters comes to the city, again.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“No Max, no” said Sarah as she grabbed on to you and pressed her face into yours. “Not like this.” She said calmly but with purpose. She knew she was the only one to reach you like this and she did so well. In such close proximity, her scent soothed you and brought you back from any bloodlust. “Do it if you must but only when you have control or it won’t be you.” she said and you just nodded to which she backed away. “Plus, you should help them with their living situation.” She advised and you saw what she meant. The sewer wasn’t any way to live if you could do something about it.

You nodded again than went to look over the town. You had learned a few types of jutsu that helped in building such as stone and wood styles, along with a few others. You made a few hand signs, ok more than a few, then when you had accounted for everything you could remember about the place you truck the ground as the final motion. This caused the ground to rumble and in seconds wood and stone began shooting up from the ground and remade the city like it was never attacked, minus the people. You were still receiving some very unappealing looks so you decided that it was probably better if you took off.

“Sarah, let’s give them some space. Looks like they need it more than us right now.” You said as you held out your hand.

“You’re right Max, nothing like what we dreamed.” She said as she took your hand and with a sudden motion you picked her up and took into the air. “What if they come back?” she asked as you flew. It didn’t take you long to reach a high cliff that overlooked the city that now had no name. It was a spot you made when you thought Lord Hizer would kick you out. It was a place that only dragons could get to as it took wings to do so. You had hollowed out a cave like your other one and a platform where you and a few other dragons could watch over the city. The concept was to eventually train young dragons, perhaps Kara’s kids, here so they could see what they were protecting. But now it just served as a perfect lookout spot for you.

“Then they will die. You may have stopped me from wiping them out Sarah but don’t stop me from that.” You said as you looked at the city with her.

“As long as it is you that is doing it. You know you lose all sense of self when you get like that. If you want to do it than do it but promise me you will remain in control.” She almost commanded.

“Fine I promise that any Dark Hunter I kill will be on a clear head.” You relented.

“Beyond that I’d say you better not waste the meat. Living up here will be no picnic and it will be tuff to secure food.” She said and in her own way she was supporting your decision.

“We are ninja. I doubt we will have that much trouble. But yeah, it has been a while since I’ve had dragon meat. For now I think it is high time I let the neighborhood know who’s back.” You said and she got some distance while you burst into dragon form again. She then came back and stood just in front of you so she could see over the edge as if on top of the world.

“Make sure they can hear it. If you’re going to do something then at least do it all the way.” She almost commanded then used a combination of a barrier jutsu, healing jutsu, and her fingers to plug her ears so you could do your thing.

With that you took a deep breath then let out the loudest and most ferocious roar you could, drawing from the pent up anger of seeing what your kind did to the city you once called home. You wanted to make sure SHE heard it and you had no doubt, by the time you were done, that she did. With that little exertion out of your system you laid down so Sarah could lean against you as she looked out on things.

“You know something Max. I have no idea what your mother is like. But they have no idea what they are walking into.” She said as you were thinking the same thing. After all a dragon that has all the abilities as a ninja, including jutsu, was something this realm had never seen before. They were shaking in their skin when you were just a normal scared kid. Now that you were highly trained and skilled in battle, both as a ninja and as a dragon. She was right, they had no idea what they were walking or more accurately flying into.

“Then I’ll clear it up for them when they come.” You said.

“Oh and don’t worry about them coming after me. If they are stupid enough to try than I’ll keep them entertained until you decide to show up. Might even take things into my own hands.” She said with a smirk.

“I don’t doubt you for a second but what are you talking about?” You asked.

“I never told you this before but no matter how close we got I was always afraid. Not of you but of dragons in general, has to do with that whole dragon sacrifice thing. Well got sick and tired of being afraid of a dragons inside so I took your example and made a few tricks that makes me a real pain to swallow. Stuff like reversing stomach lining so a dragon’s acid eats through their own stomach, or this little thing.” She said and held up a small knife that she pulled from who knows where. She hit a switch of sorts and it opened up from both ends and you immediately saw its function. With the force it had along with the thin and sharp blades that protruded it would even puncture your neck and you didn’t think it would feel any better anywhere on the inside of anyone. Potentially she could use it in a dragons throat to cut off its head or in its mouth to send on end into the dragon’s brain. Or even hollow out a dragons insides from the inside.

“Then I pity the pore soul that thinks you’re and easy meal.” You said with a smile and a little lick to which she blushed for some reason but it might have been because of your compliment and your lack of reaction that she was previously afraid of you all that time.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They talk you down.

choices: You catch the scent of another dragon.
Darian still hasn't caught the hint.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
A year goes by and there was still just you and Sarah. After your declaration to the surrounding area there was only one Dark Hunter that came to check out the suddenly rebuilt city. However he didn’t get within a mile of the city before you grabbed him and meal for you and Sarah for the following month. It was like that for most of the time. You and Sarah practiced riding together as well as individual skills for fighting both humans and dragons. She even came with you and was able to take down a few dragons before you ate them. You also helped her with devising ways to slay dragons that she hadn’t thought of yet. However, even if she ended up in your mouth during training, you promptly spat her back out. You had a now permanent bias against eating or even pretending to eat anyone that was on your side and especially friends and family. This saddened Sarah as your storage sack was an excellent healing source when she was injured but it was not used at all. No matter what she did she couldn’t get you over that instant emotional drain when the topic was brought up in conversation. She even tried to force herself down your throat. But since your body hadn’t used the storage sack in so long she went into the digestion one. The experience wasn’t pleasant for either of you and she promised she wouldn’t do it again.

“Max, can I come in?” asked Kara. It had taken her a year but she had finally came up to speak with you. You had seen her flying with that boy very often but this was the first time she came by. You answered by joining Sarah in the cave while she cooked her meal. You heard her land behind you and after a little hesitation and a slight argument with the boy she carried she followed you into the cave. More accurately you were already laying down against the far wall and watching Sarah cook as you both waited for them to present themselves.

“So, you finally came up to see us.” Sarah said as you just stayed still and quiet.

“You could’ve just as easily came down.” The young boy accused.

“Apparently you’ve never been shot at by those nice installments you have on the walls around the city. They aren’t fun and a pain in the ass to take out, sometimes literally.” You answered.

“You think we would attack you?” Kara asked.

“Well we didn’t exactly get the warmest welcome when we got back. We weren’t sure what your stance was after that little incident but even if you were ok with having us around the others obviously wouldn’t share your feelings on the matter. As Jake said, it isn’t fun getting shot at.” Sarah answered.

“Then why are you living up here?” asked the boy.

“Well just leaving doesn’t mean the city won’t get attacked. I wasn’t here to defend it the last time but from here I can see pretty far and tell if something is coming.” You answered.

“So you’re just going to stay up here?” asked Kara.

“Got a better idea?” Sarah answered back.

“You can stay at the castle like before.” Kara said but it was unintentionally aimed more at Sarah than you, which Sarah caught on to.

“I can’t believe you just suggested that I leave Max. He’s the only family I got left. Why do you hate him so much. All he could think about when were out there was getting back here and your face was one he wanted to see. He worked so hard to get back and endured so much pain to do so in a, honorable way. So he could tell his stories and we all be proud of him. Do you have any idea what it felt like to have all his hopes and dreams smashed from the very people he worked so hard to see again?” Sarah almost yelled at her. Most people would think twice to address a dragon in such a manner but not Sarah. She had her ninja training, her dragon slaying techniques, and you at her back. She had long shed her fear of dragons and almost dared any to make the mistake of attacking her.

“You dare talk to Kara like that?” The boy said as he instantly defended her.

“Word of warning boy.” you started to which stopped him in his tracks. “Sarah is highly trained to the point where she would have a fair chance at taking me down if it came down to it. That and she has a temper. I wouldn’t provoke her if I were you.”

“What’s that? Some kind of pirate flag? Pirates are so lame compared to dragon riders. It is probably why they are all dead. It looks silly and doesn’t even match on both sides.” The boy said as he went on to yet another hot topic. The insult to the flag didn’t fall on deaf ears and you let him know with an ominous and very low growl that shook the ground but was more of a vibration than a sound. However loud enough to cause Kara to snap out of her trance since Sarah’s yelling at her. She realized that her, apparent rider, was quickly hitting all your buttons and even she on her and your best days would stray far away from even one of them.

“Kara, is this your rider? If so what is his name?” asked Sarah as she looked almost concerned at the boy. It wasn’t often you growled at someone that was clearly precious to a friend.

“My na...” the boy started but was interrupted by Kara nudging him and shushing his argument.

“His name is Darian and yes he is my rider. He is the sole survivor of a village destroyed by dragons. He even tried to kill me with a sword that is still too big for him. He’s a good rider.” She introduced.

“Well you would do well to teach him some manners. As you know, Max is patient but he does have his moments. Your little friend here has insulted a lot of people very close to him in a very short amount of time. I’ve seen him attack for less and I think you have as well, much less. I think the only thing keeping him there is that he is YOUR rider.” She advised.

“I agree, but it is hard to teach manners to someone who has no fear. That was one of the reasons I took him as a rider in the first place. He has a strong moral center and an even stronger heart. But he is so lacking in fear that he does tend to overextend himself.” Kara said as if talking to a child and he winced a little as he knew without looking that she was glaring at him.

“No fear, really? Care to test that theory?” Sarah stated.

“Now you are the one going too far. Are you really going to use a genjutsu like that on a little kid?” You asked as you knew what she was thinking. She had a genjutsu that she made to scare off dragons. It brought out their innermost fear and had them live it in a sort of imaginary sleep. They were still awake but interaction like a vision or something.

“It would prove if he had fear or not.” She retorted as if justifying herself.

“It would put him in a bed for a week.” You countered.

“Fine, no fear image genjutsu on little Darian. Doesn’t mean I won’t give him a sound lashing if he pushes any further.” She warned the little kid that was half surprised and half offended. However there was definitely a fear deep in his heart that he didn’t want to admit. He was like Sarah was at his age and if her confession was correct he was scared of dragons just like she was.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: 1 year later.

choices: The town is Cobalt ( Sarah's home town)
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It was at that point that a scent hit you. Wither they were far enough away or not there was another perk about your location. Most of the wind brought scents from all areas so you could easily tell when someone was coming or a dragon was in the area.

“Smells like dinner to me.” You said as you sniffed the air.

“Go ahead, I need to cook mine anyway.” Sarah said to which you got up and started walking towards the door. Kara still wasn’t sure about you so she quickly got out of your way with Darian, far out of the way.

It didn’t take too long for you to find the little dragon as you leapt off the cliff and followed the scent. As you got closer you were amazed at how small the thing was. It was obviously an infant fire dragon with its red scales and another female. It usually made sense that they send females as they were usually bigger and they might’ve figured that you had a soft spot for them as you let Kara live. To you it didn’t matter if they were male, female, white, black, red, large, or small. If a dragon came around your protected area they ended up in your stomach. What was strange about this little one was that she seemed to be looking for you. Usually dragons that came by were hunting for humans so they were looking down. This one was looking around in the air and if anything going higher. However something was nagging at you about this one. It was no bigger than a year old or in lamest terms about the size of a human, that and it was apparently searching for you, why?

You thought about just diving down on her and swallowing her in one gulp, as she was small enough, but your conscience got in the way. You Still wanted to give it a scare so you dove down and used the clouds for cover and as soon as you were close enough but not visible you started to growl at different directions. This caused the little one to swing around looking for you and whimpering. Like most dragons at this point, she probably knew what happened to dragons around you.

“Hello Mr. Dark Hunter sir? Is that you, I have a message from a human village I stay at. I…” She started in a remarkably composed voice except a few whimpers, despite her fear of her current situation. But that was all she got out before she flew through a cloud that you were passing through and her sight coming out of it was being half trapped in your jaws. You had caught her but with her wings out and sudden move she was able to almost escape. He neck, front left leg, and left wing were outside your teeth while the rest of her were on the inside. “Please! They need your help!” she said as your jaws were beginning to close. That was the final steak in your decision. She was definitely worried about her current state of being between your tightening teeth but she chose to put the safety of the human village over her desire to beg for her own life. You thought about it for a moment then with a flick you brought her completely inside your mouth, if for no other reason so she wasn’t so awkwardly placed. Didn’t stop you from tasting her though. You licked her around a little and she was whimpering as if she had failed and was about to die. She suddenly went silent when she heard Sarah’s voice when you returned.

“You brought one back? Must’ve been good or you would’ve just swallowed. Let’s see the thing then.” Sarah said as she eyed your jaws and from the second you walked in she knew something was in them, if not the crying from inside then the slightly level state you were keeping your head. You then spat the young dragon out in the corner rather roughly and went back to your spot behind Sarah.

“Damn conscience of mine got in the way. She said something about a human village. Didn’t beg for her life once, just for me to help them. Stupid little rat didn’t even tell me where the village was and made me skip dinner.” You explained and almost pouted the last part.

“You’ve always had a soft spot for humans.” Kara said in an attempt to start a pleasant conversation with you.

“Yeah well, what can I say? When someone hates dragons as much as I do the other side looks that much better.” You said back and she seemed to smile that you were talking to here as if nothing had happened.

“Ok little dragon, tell me the reason why Max missed his dinner.” Sarah said to the recovering dragon.

“I… my village is in trouble.” She said with the first part rather slow but as she got back on why she was there in the first place she was more animated.

“You’re village? Explain.” Sarah said as those words were usually used by dragons when they had possession of a village but enslaving it and being worshiped, and obviously touchy subject for all those in the room.

“My parents were killed by dragon slayers and a farmer found my egg. He raised me since I hatched and that was about 3 years ago. He kept me secret from the rest of the town but when another dragon came and demanded sacrifices he went to the elders and after a little convincing he said that I would be able to contact help. This area is well known to almost everyone for its lack of dragon problems so I went this way to find the half breed that is rumored to be slaying them.” She said but when she said ‘half breed’ a few growls hit the air and your snout came forward, driving the little red dragon back into wall. You were stopped by Sarah’s hand as was Kara stopped by Darian.

“Well, it looks like you have their attention. But I would advise you little dragon not to use that phrase when referring to my friend here. Now what is your name?” Sarah asked.

“Dibela…” she whimpered and immediately understood Sarah’s warning and advise. She quickly thought back and found that they had started growling when she had referred to him as a half breed. It must have been a soft spot, one that she shouldn’t revisit.

“Well Dibela.” Started Kara. “That is about as friendly Max is going to get with you for the moment. Lucky for you he hates dragons attacking humans more than his usual hatred for dragons. It also probably wouldn’t be wise to keep him waiting. You want to come with?”

“Of course, where you go I go.” Darian said as if she should know that by now. She just lowered her neck and he climbed on. Sarah simply jumped on your head and looked down at the rest of them from her perch.

“Well little Debela, Max hasn’t eaten in over a week so I would get going if I were you.” Sarah said and as if to add to her words your stomach growled with the smell of this new dragon so close. If you didn’t have the self control you would’ve been drooling. The little red dragon scampered out and took off as soon as she hit the air. You and Kara took off shortly after and followed behind her, very closely.

“How do you do that?” asked Darian after a little while of seeing Sarah still standing on your head and without losing her balance even once.

“Both Max and I have picked up a bunch of new tricks from the realms we went to. This along with training together all the time has made us a pretty good team.” Sarah answered.

“I bet I’ll be able to do that eventually.” Darian boasted.

“Perhaps, but what about this?” Sarah asked as she walked around your head and stood upside down on the underside or your snout. She stood there, again without losing balance or even the slightest strain, then came up to her original position.

“Not fair.” Was his only comment to which you and Sarah laughed, followed shortly by Kara and eventually Darian.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You catch the scent of another dragon.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You got to be kidding me.” Sarah said as the group started towards a very familiar town. It had grown since your last visit but it was unmistakable in that it was Cobalt, her home town and place she didn’t really give a damn about. “Max, if you want to eat this one and leave I’ll have no objections.” This comment almost got Dibela to fall out of the sky but for the sake of what she was trying to do she kept going and hoped the human she barely knew was just kidding.

“Why, what is this place?” Darian asked. During the short ride over he had suddenly gained a deep respect and most definitely a crush on Sarah.

“This is her home town little one.” Kara responded as she also recognized the place and remembered Sarah’s stories about it. “I told you about how she was sacrificed and how her family was.”

“Regardless, I am rather hungry at the moment and that glutton would do nicely. Sarah, if you don’t mind?” You called up and she knew what you were talking about. When you ate… fresh meat it could get a little messy and this one was rather large so the blood spray would be all over by the time you were done. For now the dragon in question was just laying in the much large sacrificial square and it looked like they were getting ready to feed the thing, and not just with one girl. The space was big enough, just barely for; him, you, and Sarah so landing wouldn’t be a problem.

“Hey Kara, think I can catch a ride while Max does his thing?” she asked.

“Sure, I’ll come pick you up.” She agreed.

“No need.” Sarah said and with a leap she was able to jump over and land near her neck and swing around until she was standing next to the seated Darian, still not effected by riding in this manner.

“So that’s how you do it.” Kara said as she began to feel the subtle connection between Sarah’s feet and her neck. It was a pleasant sensation but recognizable. “I got her, you go have a great meal. I’m sure Sarah won’t mind if you make a little mess.” Kara said.

“Huh, bloodstained walls would fit perfectly to that village.” Sarah said a little spiteful but also in complete agreement.

“You, stay with them and don’t cause any trouble.” You commanded the Dibela to which she nodded furiously after hearing what you were all talking about then watched as you dove to your prey.

“You call this a feast. You have saggy, oldy, and baldy. I want some that actually looks as good as they taste. Like… that one.” The dragon on the ground said as he pointed to what must’ve been the leader’s daughter and was and eye catcher, for a human; about 14, black hair with blonde highlights, and a lean athletic figure.

“That’s my daughter!” the man said.

“Well you could always take her place.” the dragon suggested. With a reluctance he motioned for her to be brought forward.

“What! Daddy, you said you loved me and would never feed me to one of them.” she cried.

“Sorry dear, but my life comes before yours in this village. You be good and do what he asks and it won’t be that bad.” He responded with a surprisingly small amount of concern for his own daughter. It was such a disgusting attitude you almost contemplated not helping them at all. At the rate the dragon was eating the whole town would be eaten in the next month.

“No, I don’t want to be eaten. Someone help me.” She yelled before she screamed as the dragons claw was slowly approaching her. The dragon was having so much fun with it that he failed to realize the shadow you were making before you landed in the square, crushing the sacrificial platform and making indents in the ground. Your head was over the girl and you were snarling in the face of the other dragon. He was to shocked to move at the moment, though he was a large dragon for his breed he was still not even 1/5th your size on top of that you were a Dark Hunter. The girl was also too shocked to even look up at your arrival. You knew that despite her position that she wouldn’t recover from being soaked in this dragon’s blood while watching you devour it. So you wrapped your tail around her and placed her on top of a building but behind a small wall like structure on the ceiling so she was at least a little protected.

The dragon finally snapped out of it and moved to escape. But you were too hungry and too angry at this point to allow him to do that. So as soon as his neck was fully exposed you snapped and sunk your teeth in, meanwhile pinning his body with some of your claws and lopping off his tail with yours. The dragon screeched and roared in pain until the blood loss caught up with him and he slowly faded. You had bit his neck in a way that the blood was not only gushing into your mouth but also spraying the entire area like one of the spray guns you saw in the other realms, and by the time the tail and neck stopped the whole square and any people still inside were covered with it. You then began to work and within 10 minutes you had devoured the whole thing. The blood soaked into the ground so it was ok for the others to land and they did so as you finished cleaning yourself of the mess and laid there content with a full stomach. You almost forgot in your current bliss but you reached up and retrieve the girl with your tail and allowed her to run off after you let her go.

“Have fun?” asked Kara as she looked at the blood soaked houses. Dibela also landed but was halfway between mortified and amazed at the sight, as was the rest of the town’s people that were coming out.

“Mmm, he sure was tasty for such an idiot.” You responded as you licked what remained of your meal on your lips.

“I think I’ll take your word for it.” Sarah said as she never really understood why you liked the taste so much. She didn’t even like it and she had a pretty broad food preference, bugs and paste included.

“You sure made a mess.” Said Darian.

“What? You don’t like my paint job?” you asked sarcastically.

“I think it brings out the town’s pleasantness.” Sarah said in a half joking and half serious tone. The others couldn’t do anything but laugh, except the gathering town’s people and the now absent Dibela.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The town is Cobalt ( Sarah's home town)

choices: Split up and go to your cave.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Why do I have a bad feeling about this?” Sarah asked out loud as she leaded against your neck as you rested.

“I could always eat a few of them if it makes you feel any better.” You joked.

“Careful what you offer, I might actually call you on it this time.” She said as she observed the people coming toward them. Kara took the hint from your behavior and laid down with Darian in a similar but more protected position.

“Ok, you know I’ll back you up in whatever you want to do. Just at least try and play nice.” You more asked than told as she was in one of her moods. She just nodded as the leader and somewhat of a crowd came within speaking range.

“I am Mayor Tate and leader of this village. What is your purpose here?” the man that had been cleaned off but still his clothes were now a bloodstained red. He also clearly had a high opinion of himself and with his little attitude to his own daughter he was not your favorite person among the crowd by any means.

“Sarah?” came a voice from one of the guards. The heads of those around went to him as he took off his helmet and exposed a scared but otherwise halfway attractive looking face. But as you felt Sarah’s heartbeat increase you had a pretty good idea who it was. “Is that you sister?” he asked.

“I have no family here.” She simply said but if there was one thing, other than her scent, that hadn’t changed it was her voice. It was almost musical yet direct, one of many reasons why she could stop you with a single word.

“That is definitely you sis. Wow, you look… great.” He said as he eyed her up in a way that you didn’t like in the least bit.

You let a small growl rumble through the ground before Sarah was able to express her distaste for his gesture. While it was true that Sarah could turn many heads in a crowd, dragon and human alike, and normally you didn’t care and she thought it was hilarious when they saw her leave with you. But this was different since this man was her brother and had both done and was probably planning to do less than honorable things TO her. But growl was all you did as it would probably be a mercy to eat or kill him, compared to what Sarah would do to him if he tried anything. But the growl was enough for those around to flinch back and look at her and you as she pet the back of your head from her position.

“Why don’t you keep your eyes to yourself before something bad happens to you.” Sarah warned.

“What makes you think you can talk to your older brother like that?” said yet another male voice from a older looking man that stepped next to her brother. From his scent you guessed he was her father but unlike her scent his was almost repulsive.

“To answer your question Mayor Tate, a little Fire Dragon by the name of Dibela risked her life just to beg that we take care of your previous dragon problem.” Sarah said as she ignored the man and her brother. This was obviously not what they were used to from her, or what the used to know as her.

“So that little demon actually made it huh? Got to admit, if I thought it would actually work I wouldn’t have fed that farmer that was raising her to the dragon first.” The Mayor said as if he was talking about the weather. “Maybe I can take over and train that thing into what a dragon should be.” He finished.

“Sarah, are you going to do something or can we leave? I’m about this close to gutting more than a few of these humans.” Kara growled.

“Yeah, I’m done. We should probably go get Dibela though, since she is in the same boat most of us are in now.” Sarah relented.

“There’s no need for that.” You said as something darted from the crowd and toward you until the little red dragon was out of breath and heaving where she stood.

“I can’t find him. My father, I can’t find him.” She said as if asking for your help again.

“Well it looks like they didn’t have any faith in you so they sacrificed him to the dragon Max just ate.” Sarah said rather unceremoniously. The little dragon stood in shock for a moment. Then looked at you and you could tell what she was going to ask.

“There was no human remains in its stomach when I sliced it opened. I checked just in case and there was nothing.” You answered then quickly intercepted her before she could lunge at the Mayor for what he did. Her rage didn’t even manifest by the time you had her on her back and looking up at you with her usual scared face. “If you kill him now you are no better than he is. Do you want your father to be remembered by his dragon daughter that killed the Mayor of a town or one that sent his daughter to save it?” You asked to which she looked at the man than back at you and down.

“That is the last time Max or I will be helping this village.” Sarah said as she leapt onto you head.

“And where do you think you are going young lady?” asked the old man that was her blood father.

“Same place I’m going if you’ll take me?” asked the girl that was being sacrificed as well as the Mayor’s daughter. She was standing closer than most even dared to you. You looked at Sarah then Kara as she was helping Darian mount and while you were strapping the exhausted dragon to your back with spikes.

“Well they were about to sacrifice her anyway. If she wants to come then the least we can do is take her to Dragon’s Keep (new name of the city you rebuilt). That and your new… friend might want a rider.” Kara suggested.

“Well you better tell them at the palace about it anyway so we don’t get in trouble for kidnapping someone. That and I’m not exactly high on their guest list. What’s your name little girl?” You asked.

“Brandy.” She answered.

“Well if you want out of this place I’m your ride. Darian, make sure she’s strapped in will you?” asked Kara to which Brandy almost jumped on her without hesitation as her father was coming forward to get her but backed at the movement of the two large dragons as you and Kara readied yourselves to take off.

“Sarah, you will come down here now!” yelled her father as her brother was equally mad but had an image to keep so he was letting his father do the shouting.

“Says the strange old man that used to beat me as a child. I don’t have to suffer your presence any longer you drunken old bully. If you think you can make me than come get me and see where that gets you.” Sarah said to the enraged old man but you and Kara wisely chose to leave before the situation got anymore heated.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They recognize Sarah.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You sure you don’t want to come with?” asked Kara.

“Like we said before, we are not welcome there at the moment. That and the city is way too crowded” You said back.

“I guess I understand. But at least if it gets better than you should visit when we aren’t up by you.” she insisted.

“We’ll see.” You relented before you both split ways and shortly after you arrived at your cave. “Alright, off you go.” You said as you unlatched the dibela from your back and gave her a little heave that sent her in the air and onto the ground with a thud.

“What do I do now?” Dibela asked as you and Sarah went inside to relax.

“As long as you aren’t doing stuff that would make Max eat you than we don’t really care.” Sarah said.

“And what would make him eat me?” she asked more to you than her.

“Eating innocent humans or any at all before I can trust you, attacking cities, stealing farm animals, insulting Sarah, or trying to kill anyone I like or tell you to leave alone are some of the big ones.” You answered.

“Now you’re scaring her Max.” Sarah said as you chuckled at the fearful dragon. “Why don’t you go sleep and digest some of that dragon you ate while I formally welcome her and teach her the ropes.” She suggested to which you nuzzled her a little then did as she said.

You were rather sleepy and a good rest would do your digestion good. Unlike years ago, you didn’t have to worry that your new dragon guest would harm Sarah. So you got comfortable then drifted off to sleep. It wasn’t until the next day when there was someone prodding you awake. The touch was very familiar as Sarah was the only one that could wake you without worrying about any negative drawbacks. You quickly looked around and saw her at her as she was perched on your head and the others, along with including Dibela and the new human girl sitting around the fire as well.

“Hello in there?” Sarah said as she knocked on the top of your head, a sight that the others were somewhat in awe of. Darian didn’t even think about treating Kara like that and the others were to afraid of you in general to even approach.

“Yeah, yeah, I’m up.” You said in response then gave a long yawn and stretched a little.

“Good, now since we have a bunch of people and not a lot of extra room at the fire you better switch to human.” she said than leapt off you and took her seat next to an open spot beside her for you. You were still a little tired so you just did as she said and with an explosion you were human and took your seat beside her.

“When did you learn to do that?” asked Kara.

“I got sick of constantly going through it the long way so in the other realm I developed a… technique to make it instantaneous. It still hurts like nothing else but at least it is quicker and way less tiring.” You answered.

“So you are the half…” Darian started but was nudged by Kara in an attempt to stop his progress into the verbal minefield. “Sorry, it was a little hard to believe that such a large dragon could become a human. You must be weaker and that while like this, so why do you even bother doing it?” he asked.

“Actually Max doesn’t lose any of his strength when he is human. We have both trained a lot to be strong with each other when he is in either form. However he does have two separate yet similar ways of fighting for each one.” Sarah answered, proud of you in that sense as well as her proximity to your skill level.

“I can grow some dragon parts if it makes you feel better.” You said sarcastically as you flashed your eyes at him before returning them to human again.

“This isn’t the time for show and tell” Kara said as she broke up the little fun you were having. “Lord Nick has been made aware of young Brandy here as well as Dibela but doesn’t want them at Dragon’s Keep until they are a little more experienced and trustworthy by our standards. Which means they have to go somewhere.”

“And you bring them here because you think I’ll look after them?” You asked.

“Please will you let us stay?” asked the girl you now knew as Brandy while Dibela looked distracted that the dragon she was so afraid of was now a human smaller than her.

“You misunderstand. If I didn’t want you around you would be dead, or at least Dibela would. Anyway you can stay here if you have Sarah’s trust and in time mine may follow. However we have no food stores here nor do I plan on babysitting the two of you. What food and training you need is up to you to obtain. Since this place was built for dragons to get to Dibela would have to look after you if you stayed and so that is up to her. This is a dragon hideout, not a human one.” You said.

“But Sarah is here.” Darian interjected.

“You’re not implying that I can’t take care of myself are you?” Sarah flared. “Max hasn’t brought me any food for a few months and I am fully capable of defending myself against anything that comes around, as well as finding my own food all with coming and going without his help.”

“True enough, Sarah can be a very scary person if she chooses to be.” You approved.

“Like you are any different.” She said, obviously in one of her moods. You both stuck your tongues out at each other in a comical exchange of childish behavior that contrasted the seriousness that was around.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Split up and go to your cave.

choices: Dibella agrees, she wants to prove she can be trusted.
Darian just agrees to be trained, without the demonstration.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"How hard is it to live here?" Brandy asked.

"For us, not very. If you don't have a dragon or ninja training aiding you, impossible." You answered simply.

"You want my opinion?" Sarah asked.

"Please." Brandy answered while the others listened.

"I don't think this is the place for you. I can tell that you don't really like dragons. Who could blame you, I was in the same position you were in, but worse, a while back. I know, just like you do, how that village works you over. But I enjoy being a dragon rider, and hanging around them. That isn't a feeling you can just pick up. I think you were just wanting to get away from THAT place. If I were you, I would go to Dragon's Reach and try to plug in there. The dragons may not be welcome there, minus Kara, but you are free to live there. A smart and kept girl like you, will get far there. That, and we could use some kind faces in the city to help us when we need it." Sarah explained.

"You really think that is best?" Brandy asked, more so the whole room than just Sarah.

"Can I talk?" Dibella asked, not sure if she earned the right yet. Even with you in human form, her life was hanging by a trust thred as thin as a cotton one.

"Go ahead." You relented, obviously not liking her that much, yet. But then again, it took you months to get use to Kara.

"Brandy, if you don't like us dragons, than you shouldn't be in a dragon tower. And, to be honest, I can't see myself giving my freedom over to you as my rider. Your scent makes me angry. Although I know it wasn't your fault, you still smell like your father, the one that gave my father to that dragon. I wouldn't be able to trust myself around you, and I do believe you share the feeling about us dragons, almost being eaten by one of us." Dibella responded nervously. She obviously didn't want to say how much she wanted to rip this girl apart for what her father did to hers, or not in so many words, especially with you looking for a reason to eat her. She seemed confused by you. One moment you are threatening to eat her, then next you are giving her a morality lesson about not acting on anger.

"I... You're right. I was afraid to say it with 3 of you in the room. I HATE you dragons. Not to say that I am not grateful for you all saving me. But... you're right, this place isn't for me. I can do more good in Dragon's Reach. But, if I ever get over my hatred, could I be one, a dragon rider that is?" She asked.

"Sure, if you find a dragon that wants to bond with you instead of eat you." You said bluntly, to which Sarah gave you a whack. "Sorry, that was a little blunt. What I mean is, you don't just ask and we give you a dragon to have, like a pet. We aren't animals that you can just order around. You need to find one, and they need to find you. As you can imagine, that is hard. That is why there are rarely a weakly connected Dragon Rider unit. They are bonded by more than just loyalty."

"Ok, can someone besides Dibella take me back?... no offense." Brandy asked.

"None taken. We hate each other, and strangely are ok with that, both of us." Dibella answered.

"I'll take you. I'm the only one that can fly near the city anyway." Kara offered as she got up. You all were glad that was done, and Brandy was eager to get away from all the dragons. Kara was beautiful enough for her to like her a little more. Seeing you tear another dragon apart, and hating Dibella also inclined her choice in transportation. You didn't mind, as you didn't want to change back so soon after going to human form.

"Come on you, we need to train." Sarah said to Darian.

"But I don't need to train." He whined.

"Really? Max, eat him." She said, not expecting for you to actually do it, as she knew you wouldn't. But that wasn't the goal With Kara gone, he was vulnerable and he knew it. Sure he was fearless, but not stupid.

"What? No, you can't!" He said, backing up towards the entrance. Dibella was watching this as well. She was wondering if this was a rare instance in your set of rules that it was ok to eat humans. She was raised by humans, so morally she knew better but, like you, knew all to well how good they tasted. Unlike you however, she didn't have the mental scaring to prevent you from eating any one besides enemies, sometimes not even them.

"No? You mean you can't force your way out of a dragon? Dibella, come over here please." Sarah asked and requested. You didn't know how well they were getting along, but you knew what they were up to, so you were ready to object. "Max, unless you are going to take her place, which I won't ask cause I know you have a problem with that, than you are going to have to trust us on this one."

"I trust YOU Sarah. It's the little rodent that I don't trust at the moment." You responded in a tone that she knew as an agreeable one. You looked over to Dibella as she came over to Sarah and Darian. She was nervously glancing at you and Sarah. She didn't know what she was going to be asked to do, but it was enough for you to give her a death threat, more serious than any you'd given her before. "You so much as scratch her, and I'll tear your throat out and feed it to you."

"She wont, and I expect you to play nice when she proves she can handle this." Sarah teased. Even if she could be scary and smart, she knew that this one area that you were VERY serious on. She dredded what you would do if she was harmed by someone she didn't want killed, especially a dragon, like in this case.

"What are you doing?" Darian asked, thinking that she was going to have Dibella eat him. Dibella was small, barely capable of swallowing an adult human. But her type of dragon allowed for her to expand slightly, like a snake, kind of.

"I'll let you off the hook if you can get out of a stomach, or even a dragon's jaws... without weapons. Otherwise, you will do what I say, when I say it. I will not have some weakling be in charge of Kara. Fearless or not, you will not be a burden if I have anything to say about it." Sarah said with a no nonsense tone.

"No one can do that. Dragons are stronger than humans, even I know that. Take away our limited amount of protection, our weapons, and we are easier than sheep to pick off." Darian stated proudly, but also nervously.

"That is why I called Dibella over here." Sarah said than faced the young dragon, very nervous dragon. "Eat me, only swallowing please."

"What!?" she asked, not belieiving what she was hearing.

"I asked you to eat me. I want to prove that I can forcably get out of a dragon's stomach. Max has a permant scar from something very bad to do something like this. I won't kill you, and you can't use your teeth. But I want you to try to keep me down, and I'll try to escape." Sarah explained.

"But... no, what if you can't get out?" She argued.

"Ha, then I'll get her out." You huffed, which didn't do the situation any favors.

"Max, I'm trying to teach here. Can't you be at least a little supportive?" Sarah asks.

"Asking me to stand by while I watch another dragon eat you, that is pusing it Sarah. So I think I'm entitled to as many threats and morbid jokes as I want until you are safe again." You answered, subconsciencely growing parts to flex and relieve your stress. This didn't go unnoticed by the already nervous Dibella.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Only Dibela stays.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"I-I'll do it." Dibella stated, stuttering at first but more confident at the end. It appeared the part she latched onto was getting you to trust her, at least more than you were at the moment. It would take a lot more than this to have you do that, but she was now committed to that goal. Maybe it was the way she saw Kara and her interaction with both humans and you, or it could've been her primal mating instinct, wanting the biggest and strongest and all that, or maybe a bit of both, or neither.

"Great. Let me get some of these off." Sarah responded then started to pile up her hidden weapons on a small table beside the fire. At first that wasn't anything to gawk at. But as she continued pulling weapons out of... suggestive places, the room became more in awe, except you, you'd seen all of it before.

"How in the world could you have so many on you?" Dibella asked for her and Darian. Although Darian was more enamored by WHERE she pulled some of them out of rather than WHAT they were and how many. He was still a teenaged boy after all.

"A girl has her secrets." She replied simply. There was one thing that puzzled you over human interaction, and that was the ways of a woman. Apparently, so said Sarah, that was the way it was suppose to be. In this instance however, you wondered how she was able to effectively hide and carry all those tools and weapons. She had all her ninja tools, beauty supplies, armor, dragon rider weapons, and chemical stuff like adrenaline and poison. You had a feeling, no matter how good your relationship with her would get, you would never understand women in general. Then again, perhaps you weren't meant to. So now she stood almost naked, except a few pieces around her more private sections, just enough to not be too open, but enough to make Darian's jaw drop.

"You sure about this?" Dibella asked, even in her drive to prove herself, she was insanely nervous. If for no other reason, than to not harm or offend the one person keeping you at bay from making her into a snack or trophy. But there was a certain bond as well. She was actually beginning to like this human. You could see why, Sarah was... special in that regard. Everyone liked her, wither it be her looks, smarts, ability, or scent.

"I already said I was. Now let's get this overwith. I would prefer to get this conversation done before Kara gets back." Sarah repied back, moving toward and in front of Dibella.

"Ok then, as you wish, crazy human." She sighed and tried to joke. Sarah merely smiled reassuringly as she saw her eye dart toward you then to her again. She could do little more to assure her at this point but smile. She knew it also made you happy when she smiled or laughed. Your tail whipped around nervously as you watched, unblinking, just in case Sarah was in trouble.

With a yawn of her jaws she slowly brought then down over Sarah's head and shoulders. That is when her head hit the back of her thoat. She had to close her jaws around her a bit to properly swallow. She kept her scaly lips up so her teeth were easily visible, both to you and her... as well as Sarah's non bloody status. But the sight of Sarah in the jaws and among the teeth of a dragon got you even more on edge, while Darian stared at the sight, not believing what he was witnessing. With Sarah relatively safe, Dibella started to swallow. Each gulp you could see Sarah decend down the neck of this small dragon. It was making a noticable bulge. You had to dig your fingers into your seat to keep from running over and slicing that throat open. But gulp by gulp she went down. You could tell that, despite her best efforts, Dibella was enjoying her taste quite a bit. As the bulge moved and settiled in her stomach, Dibella yawned on last time to get the soreness out of her jaws. It was obvious that she usually didn't swallow things that big, or swallow them at all for that matter. Most dragons liked the taste of blood, fresh blood from a meal most of all.

"Are you ok in there?" Dibella asked nervously as she nudged her bulging midsection with her snout.

"A little cramped, but fine. Bring Darian over so I can speak with him please." Sarah answered and instructed.

"She wants to talk to you." Dibella relayed and beckoned him toward her slightly squirming gut. He was hesitant but in too much shock to resist. To her instruction, he put his ear to the exposed section that Sarah was in.

"Y-yes?" Darian asked, signalling that he was there.

"Ok, now I am going to get out of here. I expect you to keep your end of the bargain when I do. You agree that this is a good test of my skill right?" She more commanded than asked.

"Y-yes Ma'am." he choked out. He was getting to realize just how scary Sarah could get. To feed herself to a dragon, friendly or not, just to prove a point. That was just crazy. And if she could actually get out, force her way out, which was impossible to him, she would be like that ultimate human bad ass. He backed away to watch, but made sure he still kept an ear out for her.

"Ok, well normally, if I had my tools I would use a specially made knife or spear to cut my way out, thus killing the offending dragon. But in this case, with no weapons, I will have to do things the old fashioned way. Dibella, this is going to hurt a bit, sorry."

"It's fine. I'll work to keep you down, like you asked. Please, if you can actually do this, don't do any lasting damage." Dibella answered. She was just as freaked out about this human as Darian. But unlike him, she actually was the brunt of this experiment, and as they just learned, it was going to hurt.

All of a sudden, the movement in her stomach started to get rapid and Dibella sprawled out on the ground in pain. She snarled and roared, unintentionally laying flat on her stomach to help solve the pain problem, hopefully crushing what was causing it. The feeling started to travel up her throat. She swallowed, gulped, and did everything she could to keep her resident inside. She even, at one point, started strangling herself just above the ascending lump. But it did her little good. Eventually they saw two hands protrude from her scaly lips and force her jaws open. Sarah hit two points to both dislocate Dibella's jaw and keep it in place. But she kept her limbs against them, just in case. She wasn't even looking, as her head was still down Dibella's throat, as she did this. But as soon as this was all done, she began to pull herself out. Dibella, in a last effort to keep her inside, tried to force her jaws close with her whole body wieght behind her claws. But it did little good. You got nervous when Sarah's upper half was out and it looked like Dibella was trying to still seal her jaws. That would've bit Sarah in half, no room for you to save her then. But Sarah managed to use a few typed of jutsu on her feet to propel her out and onto the floor, landing on her feet in a ready posture. You were glad she didn't ask you to help her with that. Using that style of jutsu, like that, would be very painful... and effective, as evidence to her status of being outside Dibella now.

"And that is how you do it." Sarah stated as she wiped off some of the drool and fluids off her. "Oh, sorry Dibella. Bring your jaws down here. I'll undo that trick."

Dibella did as she was told and with a quick succession of jabs, put her back to normal. Her claws immediately went to massaging her sore jaws, glad it was over.

"Please, don't ever ask me to eat you again." Dibella almost begged past her sore throat.

"I don't plan on it. Sorry for the trouble, and thanks for the help." Sarah responded, gingerly stroking the young dragon's head. They looked over at you grinning from ear to ear. "What's so funny over there?"

"Oh, just that the amount of dragons that find you a pain to eat seems to be growing. I do believe you are the only human in existance that makes dragons afraid to partake in you as a meal. That, and I can't say I am sorry Dibella found that out ever so clearly." You answered. "You are one scary human."

"I'll take that as a compliment." Sarah stated as she allowed Dibella to go back to her spot to rest and started to wipe the remaining dragon juices off her, then put her gear back into their places. "Did I taste good?"

"What?!" Dibella gasped, hoping she wasn't going to have to do that again.

"Max says that I taste really good, but obviously isn't willing to taste me anymore, well not for desire anyway. I was wondering, with his whole eating dragons taste, if it was accurate to you as well." Sarah clearified.

"On the way down... uh... yes, very... tasty, delicious. On the way up..." Dibella stuttered, not wanting to offend either you or the now very scary human. "... I hope you don't mind me never tasting you again. That was horrible. No more, if I can help it."

"I don't plan on making you do that again." Sarah reassured then looked over at a still shocked Darian. "As for you, we got training to do. Any objections this time?"

"No Ma'am!" Darian answered. You chuckled at this and she smiled, not needing to ask why you were, this time.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Dibella agrees, she wants to prove she can be t...

choices: You are needed to help train them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"You let her do what?!" Kara exclaimed in an obviously angered voice. She couldn't believe what you told her about what happened while she was gone. Dibella now had yet another scay person to be afraid of. She laid, curled up in fear, in the farthest corner.

"Darian, I swear... if you sit down one more time, I'll kick your ass!" Sarah blared at Darian, after he sat to rest after trying to climb the wall without hands. To this threat, Darian got up and continued his strict training session under Sarah's teaching. You had reverted to Dragon form again. You still didn't trust Dibella, although, the whole ordeal did lighten the load of her presence a bit. You could at least trust in her fear of what Sarah COULD do if she tried anything.

"Right, like I volunteered her for it." You growled in a tense sarcastic tone. "If I didn't have a bias against eating people, She'd be having a very long time out in my stomach."

"And she suggested Dibella eat Darian too?" she asked, anger running toward her view of their new arrival.

"No. She threatened that I would. Yeah, like that would happen. Although, I got to say, the next time he rips on that flag..." You answered, still brooding with your head on the ground. You didn't trust yourself to move at this point. You might lash out at Dibella out of reflex, and whacking a wall out of anger would only make part of the room collapse. What you really needed was a dragon you could hunt and kill. You weren't that hungry, but you could use the outlet. Sadly, they were never around when you needed it.

"I can see you're in a pleasant mood." She said, changing subjects, convinced that Dibella wasn't a threat, for the moment at least. She glanced over at the quivering little dragon in the corner. Yes, that was the safest place for her to be right now. Away from you and her.

"Watch it, meat." You grumbled, now she knew you were pissed. You only called her 'meat' when you were angry enough to not trust yourself. She now recognized your posture. The way you were laying down in a straight line, with your body taking up a good portion of the room, wasn't meant to be comfortable. It was meant to relieve anger and stress. When she first started to train with you she knew this was a sign to stay as far away as she could. The one time she didn't... let's just say that it was a good thing Sarah was there.

"I... I think I'll go train the runt." She informed to which you just grunted, which resulted in a waft of smoke from your nostrils. Yes, when a dragon was brooding, it was obvious. "Come on little girl. Trust me, you don't want to be anywhere near him right now... And I wouldn't eat Sarah again. He might kill you the way it is now, when she isn't looking." Kara called.

Dibella got up wearily, but hurried out with Kara as they heard you growl at the thought of Sarah being eaten.

-------------------------------------------------------------

"Why is he so touchy about eating humans?" Dibella asked as they flew and Kara taught her a few easy things that could be learned without that much thought. This wasn't really training, just passing the time while you brooded.

"Oh, that is a long story. But it would've been better if you ate a different human. He is really pissed that you ate Sarah. So am I, but I understand not to disobey her. But unless he suggested it, I would shy away from even thinking about eating her. She is the one person that he cares for more than anything. When it comes to her safety, you better hope he doesn't think you a threat." Kara answered.

"Ok, but why her of all people. There must be thousands of humans that could be just like her, right?" Dibella asked, still not getting it.

"Not a chance. She was the first person to love him like family, ever. Even with her insane abilities and danger to us, he still feels the need to protect her. I remeber this one time, a dragon came to the castle, when we lived there. He was so arrogant and this was before he was more stable. The dragon threatened everyone in the room. Max didn't even wake from his sleep. He usually slept or pretended to, so he looked like a big statue. But the moment he threatned Sarah... didn't even take him 3 seconds to rip the offending dragon's head off the pull the poor thing appart, piece by piece, eating it as he went. It took 2 weeks to clean up the blood from that incident. That and, he says, she calms him. Which is hard to do. I've seen him in bloodrage and she just puts a hand on his snout, his snarling snout mind you, and he just calms right down immediately. No, she's definitely special to him." Kara answered and recalled. She knew 2 things for sure about Max. First; that he HATED dragons. Second; that he LOVED Sarah and NEVER mess with that.

"Have you ever been... you know?" Dibella asked, obviously referring to being on your bad side.

"He hates dragons, so yeah, a very long time ago. He actually swallowed me a few times while training. Partially digested me as well, until Sarah made him spit me out. He said he was just teaching me human worth and what it was like to be eaten, but I know he enjoyed it perhaps too much. He also can get a bit rough in training. Had to heal a few things on account for that. I'll say this, be glad I'm going to be training you. His way is, learn quick or die, especially for dragons... in which case he does the killing, and eating." Kara answered.

"Does that mean you will be training me, like to be as good as you?" Dibella asked.

"I am glad you think so highly of me, Dibella, but I'm not even near Max's level. I can take out a Dark Hunter, if I'm VERY lucky and the scale is tipped in my favor. I hope you know that it won't be easy, even to reach that level." Kara responded, for the first time, concerned for Dibella's life alone.

"I-I, understand. Please teach me. I want to be as good as you, maybe good enough to impress him." she said, the last part a bit quieter.

"You'll be at this a while then. He doesn't impress easily, especially if he still wants to eat you. So let's get started." Kara said, then they started. It was weak, but this was the start of something great. Slowly, your little cave was becoming a standard for dragons that wished to live like you, or close to it at least.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Dibella's training...

choices: They rethink and want an alliance.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were awoken by a whiff before a noise and voice of Darian. You caught a whiff of a dragon through the cross breeze that brought most scents to your cave. You were about to get up, to which Sarah noticed as your dragon form was not hard to see move, when Darian came in with Kara, her slightly angry.

“Max, Sarah, come quick!!!” Darian exclaimed.

“What is it now?” Sarah asked.

“A dragon war.” Kara said, shortening the explanation that Darian was ready to give. Despite her harsh treatment and training methods, he still thought her good looking enough to lengthen any amount of interaction with her.

“Is that the scent I smell?” You asked.

“Indeed. They sent a human slave to Dragon’s Reach to say that a Dragon clan was going to challenge the dragons that claim this Territory. They should be arriving today sometime.” Kara answered.

“They didn’t give us much time…” Sarah stated.

“Well, the warning and challenge came a month ago, but I was busy training Dibella and they thought they could handle it. When they learned from the slave that the dragon clan numbers in the hundreds… they made efforts to get my attention,” Kara revealed.

“Which meant sneaking up on me while I was resting ant they were doing some flight training…” Darian said with an annoyed tone.

“Which means you need more training.” Sarah stated, and Darian sighed, knowing that meant more hard work for him in the very near future.

“Well, I suppose that means it’s time for me to get down there. I can already smell them coming. I eat well tonight.” You said, the last bit with a grin.

“You mean you can take on an entire clan by yourself!?!” Dibella gasped. She knew you were strong, but didn’t know how much so.

“It should be easy.” You replied, growling at her menacingly.

“Cut it out, big boy.” Sarah commanded, whacking your growling snout. “You’re going to have to get over the whole, her eating me, thing.”
