“Maybe, but not today.” You responded, then moved toward the entrance. “Kara, it would be nice if you could let Dragon’s Reach know that I am coming. I don’t need to fight with them trying to kill me too.”

“Alright, come on Little One.” Kara responded and let Darian climb on her back before taking off. Dibella following close behind, not trusting you with her safety, but obviously trusting that you could and would slaughter the incoming dragon force.

“Well, they are pretty fast, aren’t they?” Sarah asked as she leapt on your head and you looked down to see the sky above Dragon’s Reach full of enemy dragons. With your enhanced vision, the cross breezes, and sound perception you could tell what was happening as Kara, Darian, and Dibella made it to what looked like the area that the leader was and Lord Nick now resided. It was the calm before the battle.

“Sure are. Let’s see how stupid they are…?” You suggested, then let her link into your mind so she could hear the negotiations with the leader.

“Ah, the beautiful Dragoness and her sidekick. I’ve heard tell that you are the only one fore leagues that can take down a Dark hunter Queen?” Said the leader as Kara landed and her group joined Lord Nick.

“I can. But I will not be fighting you, if you still choose that course of action.” Kara responded.

The opposing Dragons were not like Dark Hunters, Dibella’s type, or Kara’s type of dragon. They were a little more stocky and muscle bound. Not meant for in air battle, but more so in attacking ground targets. They had harder back scaled than Kara did and more developed legs and claws but lower grade flames and teeth. Then again, dragon teeth were dragon teeth. No matter how relatively small or big they were, to a human, they were still bigger than what was comfortable. Their size was about Kara’s size, but a greenish color. Apparently, they liked forested areas as they blended in with the trees very well.

“If you are not fighting, then have you surrendered?” He asked.

“Hardly. Max just said he would like to do all the fighting, if it came down to that. I think he is waiting in his cave until he you decide that you are fighting. He has ordered us to not get involved, if possible.” Kara, responded, the last part to Lord Nick. He nodded and whispered to a General of is, then looked back to the dragons. Knowing well that Dragons hardly liked Humans interfering in their conversations. So he remained quiet, for now.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A Dragon clan challenges you.

choices: Some of them come visit you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Well, I think you are bluffing. No one could observe us from that far away. Knowing this Dark Hunter King’s Reputation, he would’ve already started attacking and feasting if he knew we were here. We were victim to your bluff before, but not this time. I bet he isn’t even around, at least at the moment. Even if he was, we number in the hundreds, and he is only one. We will defeat him well enough, when he gets here.” The leader stated rather matter of factly.

“You have no idea what you are dealing with.” Dibella responded, not sure to be more scared of you or the hundreds of dragons that were ready to attack.

“Ah, I think I do, little one.” He snarled happily. “You will all die, for not surrendering. And we will take over this territory for our growing population.”

At this point you heard enough, so did Sarah. She was ready and waiting for you to take off. She plugged her ears as you let out a roar that sent shockwaves toward the hundreds of dragons below. They all seemed to quiver and shake with the rest of the terrain as they looked and darted around for the roar’s source, the leader quickly but nervously taking off into the air. You took off and they saw you shortly after as you made quick work of closing the distance between them.

“You ready?” You asked to Sarah.

“You kidding? I’ve been waiting for a good battle like this for a while.” Sarah responded with excitement.

It was true. You and her had talked about utilizing ninja skills to fight an uphill battle, but had so far not been able to try it. This was a perfect opportunity. The offending dragons all made a course change and started coming at the two of you. Hundreds of Dragons filled the sky, but you didn’t want to spring your trump card until they were too close to turn away. Even before that though, they were quivering as you got closer. Like many types of dragons, your size as a Dark Hunter King easily eclipsed theirs. None of them wanted to be the first you ran into. With a few thousand feet between sides, you sprung your trap.

“Multi-SHADOW CLONE JUTSU!!!” You and Sarah said at the same time.

To this, the sky was filled with smoke on your side of the coming battlefield. And out of the smoke, to the other side’s horror, was an even 100 pairs of you and Sarah. The other side of dragons, still outnumbering you 8 to 1, halted. Their battle plan before was very straight forward, apparently. Overwhelm you with excessive numbers. Which, before your trip to the realms, would’ve worked. But now, things had changed. However, with that halt, they lost any and all the momentum they had. With no time to correct the massive force of Dragons, you and your clones met their side and started tearing the offending dragons apart in a wide variety of ways.

The sky rained with blood as the dragons above feasted on their foes. You could only imagine what it looked like from below. It was probably a mix or Morbid fascination, uncontrollable fear, and great thankfulness. As for you, it was quite a fun experience. You swallowed the first one whole. At the speed you were flying and the torpedo like posture they had hesitated in, it was too hard to resist. After that you basically got a bite every time your teeth came together. There was a little fire in the fight, but in the end there was little need for the energy drain. After about an hour of fighting, eating, and chasing down fleeing dragons you were done and ended the jutsu with Sarah. You circled Dragon’s Reach a little bit, making sure everyone was ok. Seeing that no harm was done to the village, you gave out another roar that shook most of the city, then bolted back to your cave. In the background you could barely hear some cheering going on.

“Why didn’t you land?” Sarah asked, after you landed and started cleaning your blood soaked body off. A few struggles from the digesting Dragon making you smile a little. It wasn’t that you were insanely morbid or mean. You just hated dragons, and this one was getting what it deserved for threatening over 800,000 humans that lived in Dragon’s Reach at this point. “You know they would have let you, and they probably would’ve welcomed you in a very high manner for this right?”

“Yeah, I… I just don’t know. I normally wouldn’t care if they wanted to do that. I just, I guess have gotten used to the solitary life up here. I am just as happy digesting my meal and hanging out with you and a few others than being bombarded with loud noises from crowds. Not to mention that me arriving blood soaked and all that would’ve not been my best return trip…” You answered sheepishly.

“Ok. But you are going to have to visit them at some point.” Sarah said and went to go wash off herself. Like you, she was soaked in dragon’s blood. Unlike you however, she couldn’t just lick it off… nor did she want to.

The underlining reason though, for you not wanting to deal with a village, much less a whole city of people, you both knew, was because of Naruto’s realm. You still had a very fresh memory of a whole world and multiple villages, including the one you were trapped in, that feared and hated you. Normally Sarah would just talk/push you through it. But she knew that she was partly the reason for it. It was still a touchy subject, and she had even less desire to bring it up than to lick the dragon blood off of herself.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
The new place emmidiatly violated your senses with the amount of noise and foul smells, Sarah, not as sensible as you to such strong stimulus was fine, but you took some time to get used to it, during that time you two bought a house in a less crowded area and learned as much as possible from this new realm, first of all it was more technologically advanced than any realm so far, the language and writting was the same as in the realm of Naruto, althought it was somewhat diferent in some parts, but any thing that you didn´t knew could be easely searched with the help of the convinient internet, Sarah was expecialy fascinated by what the humans of this world called video games, since this world was at peace and no one would suspect you two as long as you add the proper paperwork, you could just relax for the first time in a while, in the end 3 months passed without incident, the house you bought was big enough for a big family wich you bought in full with the gold you matearilized.

" C´mon Max, lets go in together ! ", pleaded Sarah one morning when she came home after going shopping for a pair of strangly designed helmets, you recognised them as the Nervegear, a game devise that allowed to be inside the game instead of controling a avatar, " Ok, but don´t expect me to be there for long, games are fun and all, but we have to be reasonable, by the way what´s the game called ? ", you answered, being completly powerless when she asked nicely like that, and at you question she asnwered, " You should have seen it on the news, Sword Art Online ! ", she answered cheerfully, you smiled.

" It was more trouble than i expected !, " you said some time later, after finally getting the apparatos to work, because of your natural protections as a dragon, the sensors of the device didn´t pick up your brainwaves until you sealed then, right now your strenght was that of a normal human of your age, althought your senses where still as sharp as usual, " Sorry, i didn´t thought about this ! ", she said already with the Nervegear in her head.

" It´s surprisingly heavy ! ", commented Sarah, " It´s because of the batery ! ", you answered as you followed the instructions on the manual, " Ok calibration complete, what are you going to call yourself in the game ? ", you asked so that you could meet each other, " Mmmh... Lynia ! you ? ", " Drake ! ".

There was a few minutes before you could enter after saiyng ´Link start`, since you add no acount, making one took some time, you tried to make your character as look alike as yourself, but you didn´t wanted to keep Sarah waiting, after being satisfied you entered.

As your feet touched the ground you emmidiatly felt the diference in between your how body and this virtual one, your senses where all there but you touch was somewhat dulled, " Not to feel any pain huh ! ", you said with a sight, no one liked physicall pain, but whithout it the fight wasn´t the same, " Yo Drake, over here ! " a voice called, as you looked at the person calling you saw a very familiar face wraped in the female beginer clothes, " S... Lynia, have you been waiting ? ", you asked, she shoke her head, " I´ve just arrived as well ! ", she answered happily.

All arroound you people where appearing seeamingly out of nowhere, you figured it was how you entered this world, there where people inside the game that weren´t clad in the beginer´s clothes, Sarah or now Lydia, said they where NPC´s, programs created by the game to give a enviorment in the game, they where easely identified by not having a cursor or a health bar, you felt annoyed as you looked at your own health bar, pulling the menu you saw your status, " If this represented my real strenght as in the real world, all these parameter´s would be giving error message, for being overpowered, ! ", you commented and Lydia at your side smirked.

The beginers town was huge, shops with all sort of equipment lined the streeets, weapons, and armor or all shapes and sizes, the beginers equipment came with a thousand of the game´s currency, and a short blade, looking at it you felt it was unapropriate to your figting style, after all as a human you fought using your feet and fists, " We kinda need help here, i mean we literaly know notting of how this game operates ! ", you voiced, Lydia looked arround and blurted suddently, " Quickly Drake, lets go ! ", and broke in a dash, you quickly followed althought in this body it felt like you where a slowpoke.

" Hey wait up ! ", she called for a boy that was running with balck hair that purpose, he stoped and looked behind at who was calling, and behind you another person with red hair as following, " Is there something you need ? ", he asked with a confussed face, it was Lydia that asked, " Your a beta player right ? ", she asked cheerfully, he nodded, " Oy would you teach me ropes ? please, " The dude with red jair asked, you looked at him annoyed, " Ok, i´ll teach you three the basis, name´s Kirito ! ", he answered politely at the same time he announced his name, " Drake ! ", Lydia ", " I´m Klein ! ", you each presented yourselfs one at the time.

" How did you knew he was a beta ? ", you asked Lydia Later, she smiled and answered, " This his not the first MMO that i play, all the beta´s are always running arround when the game starts for real, ! ", she answered, you smiled, Lydia add learned a lot more from this new realm than you.

Kirito whent arround town with you two and Klein, explaining that diferent usage of weapons would lead to difent skill learning, when you asked if there where skills that allowed the usage of your fists in combat, he answered yes, but to unlock then you add to complete a quest in the second level of the game, there was no magic on it making the skills learned on game extremely important.

Lydia put weapon throw and one-handed dagger in her skill slot, and for some reason that you didn´t understoud, cooking, you whent with the one-handed straight sword for now, and put Detection, to avoid ambushes.

After that the party headed outside to the field, only outside could you see the size of the city as it really was, now that you where outside you decided to test your dragon eyes, without Kirito and Klein notecing of course, but you where surprised as the scenary was replace with code lines everywhere, dissapointed you returned your eyes to normal.

* * *


" Arrgh ! ", where the painfull sounds of Klein when he was hit once again by some sort of blue boar, Lydia was trying to contain his laughter, on the other hand you where looking at him with disdain of his poor stance, and his health bar was already yellow, " What are you complaining about, you don´t feel any pain in the game ! ", said Kirito as Klein grabbed the area in wich the pig hit him on wich was the groin.

Picking a rock from the ground he got in possition and the rock was covered with a red glow, he add explained that this was the skill activation setup, then flinged it at the boar´s rear, at the same time he explained how to activate the skill wich was pretty vague, but enough to Klein to get in position and with a red glow from his curved sword he dashed at the boar in a awkward way, the cut didn´t spilled blood as you expected, instead red poligons appeared in the air arround the cut and then it broke and dissapeared.

" Oh yeah !! ", he shouted as he add defeated a boss, " Good work, but let me tell you, that boar was as weak as the slimes in other rpg´s ! ", he revealed wich got Kelin to say something stupid.

" Well, what about you two, care to try ? ", he asked, " I´ll go first ! ", said Lydia as she looked arround and imitating Kirito she picked a stone and flinged it at a boar, it responded by charging at her, she charged as well, Klein and Kirito watched astountned as Lydia dodged to the side and without activating a skill, cut the left side of him and then jumped for a stab in the back of the head, she then sheated her dagger and rejoined the group as the boar dissapeared.

" Did you have to show off ? ", you asked with a smile, she answered by sticking out her tongue, " Woah, your girlfriend his incredible ! ", said Klein with jealous eyes towards you, " When did i said she was my girlfriend ?, Lydia his my sister in real life ! ", you corrected him, " Oh !, sister he ! ", he said with a smile, " Let me warn you thought, she will stab you, if your not carefull ! " you warned at the same time Lydia flashed her weapon.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The game world.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
" What a load of horse dung ! ", exclaimed Lydia in a very bad mood, yourself, Lydia, Kirito and Klein, add stayed on the fields until it was 17:25, when that time came, Klein said he was going to logout to have dinner, you add to admit that after a few rounds of taking down boars with severall attack´s instead of the one-hit kill, the game was more entertaining so you stayed longer than you planned, and that´s when it started.

" What the hell ! ", said Klein as he pulled the menu, " Where´s the logout bottom ? ", he asked confussed, you pulled your own window and just like he said the logout option was empty, you tried to press it but notting happened, " Kirito, his there anyway to logout ? ", you asked him.

" ... No, if one wants to get out, he as to use the logout bottom, unless someone from the outside removes the Nervegear ! ", he explained, and with that Klein tried to remove it while inside the game, but it was pointless, " We live alone !, what about ...! ", you where going to ask but at that time a bell rung from the city, followed by a blue light that enveloped the party, and you where back at the first place that you started along with the rest of the players that bought the game that day.

After that a huge figure appeared from a warning message in the sky, it was a figure that was notting more than clothes, he started explaining what hapenned, and what was going on, "Well so much for the peacefull realm ! " , you thought sarcastically, as he made his speach, the mirror in the inventory was the only thing that you where gratefull for since it allowed to completly correct your face and Lydia as well, looking at Kirirto and Klein, they didn´t looked like they did a second ago, and they weren´t the only ones, you even saw something as disgusting as male players that where crossdressing as female and vice-versa.

It was when he dissapeared and the people arround you started to panick that Lydia snaped, " What a load of horse dung ! ", this cought Kirito and Klein by surprise since they problably expected you to panick as the rest, " Well, talk about a twist, we came here to have some fun and now if our hp bar reachs zero even, the Nervegear his gonna fry our heads ?! ", you blurted annoyed at all this mess, right now you couldn´t move your body in the real world no matter what, meaning you where traped as the rest of the guys.

" You two are pretty calm considering the situation ! ", said Klein with sweat running down his brown, " In times like these, what´s the point of panicking ?, " you retorted, " Anyway, we got to plan this out !, Lydia ? ", you said then asked as you saw her running to a girl with chestnut hair caught in braids by the side, and pulled her by the hand, she didn´t resisted, you understoud what she was doing without even asking, and with that the five of you sneaked to a alley.

" Do you know her ? ", asked Kirito when you where already in the alley, " No, it´s just that she reminded me of myself when i was younger, or more precisely her eyes ! ", Lydia answered with downcast eyes .

She then turned to the girl and asked, " What´s your name ? ", she looked arround at the party, you took notice to her eyes that where also chestnut, they looked hollow at first but a light shined in then, proof that she was the kind that didn´t give up easely, " A...asuna, my name his Asuna ", she asnwered in a low voice.

There was a round of presentations after wich Kirito produced a virtual map and presented his plan, " We are going to the next village, as things stand, if we stay in the city, the experience and col will be harvested in a short time, so the best course of acton if we want to head to the second floor, his to head here ! ", he said, you were inpressed at his deductions and calm demeanor.

" Is it possible ? ", was the question from Asuna as she stared at Kirito, " I´m certain that reaching the ext village his possible for me at my current level even if i were to bring two other, Klein his still a rookie along with you, but even if it his their first time playing, Drake and Lydia can take care of themself´s, so it his possible ! ", he assured with conviction.

" I asked if it his possible to clear this game !? ", she said now a little irritated, this time he didn´t answer, " If you are determined you can do anything, even topple a god ! ", you answered for him with all the confidence in the world, the rest of the party was stunned and speecheless at your scale, excepet Lydia that smiled confidently.

" A god ? ", asked Kirito bewildred, " If you think about it, that Kayaba his acting like he his a god, so it his a good analogy ! ", said Lydia, there was a silence after that, it broke when Klein gave a laught, " Man you two are something else, ok i decided, sorry Kirito, but i have friends that are in here with me, so i´ll be satying here ! ", he announced with a new spark in his eyes, " I see ! ", was Kirito´s answer, " Don´t worry, i´ll catch up with you eventually, i hope whe meet in the real world ! ", he said and returned to the plaza were the rest of the player´s where still scared.

* * *


After that the four of you made a party of four and hit the road, Kirito and yourself where in front and took out most of the monster´s that attaked, Lydia with Asuna in the back managed to take down a few themself´s, when the night fell, you were still only halfway throught, if Asuna wern´t with you three, stoping wouldn´t be necessary, but she was tired and with your current status, carrying her on the back was impossible.

" Now that we are stuck in this world, the coocking skill really comes in handy ! ", you said as Lydia took out some boar meat that was droped from the blue boar´s that you slew, " Indead, but at my current level of skill, i can´t do much more than this ! ", she said, as she pulled a small pot and with water from a nearby river and some salt put it to boil as a stew, the process was oversimplified by the game system, one touch even with her dagger would cut the meat in small cubs wich she put on the pot.

" I do have to admit, i never put cooking in my skill slot, since it his a skill that as no point in battle ! ", he explained, and while he said that, you saw Asuna next to Lydia setting a skill in her slot, you smilled at guessing wich was, " But you know, even if we eat in this world, we are just fooling our brain, in the real world, our bodies still need to be nourished ! ", you pointed out, " Indead, but Kayaba said that our bodies would be transfered into hospitals, there are problably ways to locate the players that are traped inside the game ! ", continued Kirito.

You were still not convinced, what if they never found your bodies and you would die of hunger, " Now that i think about it ! ", started Lydia, " I add to give my adress when i bought the game ! ", she said, there was a releaved sight from you, "Good thing the security system back home his completly normal, it would be bad if i add installed a deadly one ! ", you thought.

" How long will it take to reach the village ? ", asked Asuna, getting in the conversation for the first time, Kirito pulled the map and after a few seconds he said, " We should be able to get there by midday tomorow, if we keep the same pace as today ! ", he answered, " Ok, it´s ready ! ", called Lydia as she took the pot out of the campfire and placed it on top of a flat stone, the smell was great, it was hard to believe that it was actually notting but codelines mixed togheter.

" Oh, not bad, normaly to make something like this you need some points at the coocking skill, otherwise, there his a big chance that it will fail ! " pointed Kirito, when he said that Lydia pulled her window and made a frown, you gave a smirk, as you thought that she was problably lucky that the food didn´t go bad.

Everyone ate in silence, when it was over you drawed your sword saying that you would keep watch, Kirito and Asuna gave their thank´s, but Lydia gave you a look of understanding, but said notting.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The death game

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
A week passed inside the game, during that time you heard of many people who died thanks to the newcomers in town, Kirito add told the party to stay away from the village at first, so not to lift suspicion of any of you being a beta tester, you where confused at first, but soon realized why when you heard that there where a lot of people who hated the beta tester´s, for not sharing the information of the game or taking by themselfs the best hunting spots, " They are wierd, it was Kayaba that put us in this possition, why are they blaming other´s ? ", asked Lydia to you, making sure that Kirito and Asuna didn´t listen.

Closing your eyes as you thought of an answer, " Because when not threatned by anything, all creatures became complacent, they live thinking that no harm can come to them, and when it does happen, they whant to blame someone or something ! ", you explained, " Kayaba his not here for them to blame, so they have to blame someone else, ", you finished.

" That sounds awfull ! ", she said with a downcast face, " I know, but either that or doing what that guy did ! ", you answered also in a bad mood, Lydia frowed at this, you add learned from some newcomers that a few hours after what happened in the plaza, a person threw himself out of the floating castle, effectively commiting suicide.

" Well lets just forget about that, for know we should focus in clearing the first floor ! ", you voiced out with determination, currently the four of you where in the field grinding, in the spawn of the week you all managed to reach level 6, wich according to Kirito was very good considering that the experience gained was devided fourways as a party, Asuna switched from the one-handed straight sword to a rapier, looking at the weapon it looked like it was weak, frail, and would break at first contact, but being on a virtual world meant that things where diferent than what they should be, surprisingly sturdy and fast it easely and quickly delivered precision strikes at a monster´s weak points.

Thank´s to Kirito´s knowledge in the Beta, the party managed to get some good equipment, or at least good considering the low status on the first level, at first you where going for the martial art skill in the second level but changed your mind when you found out of a extra skill that could be aquired in the first level( Scythe-wield), you add to do the quest alone to recieve it, your health bar came dangerously close to the red area, but in the end managed to clear it, so now you where swinging a weapon that was as intimidating as it was deadly, and for some strange reason it suited you.

" Another one down ! ", you claimed as you sliced another monster in half, a look arround and you saw Kirito delivering a horizontal slash on another monster, then switching with Asuna that trusted her rapier, while Lydia finished another with a iron nail, " Ok, that´s enough for today, our items won´t last much more ! ", called Kirito after that, you took a look arround making sure that no other monster´s were going to attack and, put your weapon on the back, despite the huge size, the scythe was remarkebly easy to carry arround, the others sheathed their respective weapons as they aproached Kirito.

" Anything good ? ", asked Lydia in a good humor, Asuna said nothing, althought a smile drew in her face at you next words, " Got a D class ingredient, dinner should be good today ! ", you annouced at wich everyone smiled, one of the few pleasures of being stuck on SAO was the food, the other was something that you discovered when you where fidling with the menu and discovered the ´Ethics code off`, confussed you asked Kirito, he explained that the ethics code was in order to prevent people from having adult relationships inside the game whithout consent from both sides, wich self-explained the use for it.

* * *


" So Drake, how´s the Scythe ? ", asked Kirito curious about it, " Well, it´s attack power despite being a novice Iron Scythe, his very high, pretty easy to handle, i can see why the quest to obtain the Scythe-wield extra skil his so damn hard ! ", you resumed while Kirito took notes to later give to a little girl called Argo the Rat, you add no idea why would someone pick such a name, problably because of the whiskers, the thing was, she sold and bought information for the right price, so information on a weapon or skill and how to obtain them was good money.

" A quest that starts by using a monster drop that drops at 0.1 %, no wonder i never heard of anything during the Beta ! ", said Kirito bewildred, " 0.1 !?, you mean only a one in a thousand chance to drop ! ", you said, he noded and closed the window.

You keept discussing on such topics, before this all happened you would never have found much interest in all this, but now despite it being all virtual, it was as real as it would get since you would die for real.

Aproaching town, Asuna and Lydia put on a robe that covered their faces, the reason was, not to draw attention to the two of them, they where booth female player´s, and their appearences where by human standards, very beautifull, so they bought a pair of cheap and ugly robes to avoid the jealousy of the male player´s.

But quickly removed them once inside the rented room, Kirito´s knowledge about MMO´s shined yeat again, the rented room was spacious enough for four people, and add all the commodities, it was somewhat more pricy than the inn, but on the contrary of the rented house, the Inn add no shower, or kitchen, or even a fireplace.

While the girl´s whent ahead to take a shower, you decided to bring up a certain topic, " Kirito, in your opinion, how long will it take to conquer this game ? ", you started, he stoud silent for a minute before answering with a heavy heart, " A optimistic scenario would be 3 years, " he started gloomly, " I can´t even imagine how many people will die until then ! ".

You whent quiet for a while as you runned over what Kirito told you, " The beasts arround here won´t be able to keep us leveling up for much longer, should we take that quest that you mentioned ? ", you asked, he clossed his eyes and noded before opening them again, " I guess so, it gaves a lot of XP, but even with the four of us, it might take a few days, we should stock up ! ", he pointed and started doing a inventory of necessary items.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You walked out of the portal more or less confused. You had been to enough realms to know that your home wouldn't have black top. The portal closed and you looked around.

"Uh, Max. This isn't home." Sarah stated, more to ask what went wrong then the statement it sounded like.

"Yeah, I noticed that. There is only one thing that could mess with the portal system like this." You replied as you thought about it.

"What is that?" She asked.

"Well, if someone wants me, or all that are traveling through bad enough then it reroutes to that realm. Honestly, I was going to research it to see if I could get back to another realm if our home didn't work out. But I've never been to this one. So I am not sure why it spit us out here." you responded as you looked around some more.

"Well wouldn't the people that wanted us to come be somewhere around here?" Sarah asked.

"Should be... I guess. Never been summoned like this before. So you tell me, smarty." You replied, joking about the last bit. She smiled at your willingness to joke with her so soon. Then she started thinking. Whatever she though of was usually right, in the intelligence aspect at least. Instinct you were a little better.

"Well, the way home is probably sealed until we take care of this realm one way or another. So, we should find the person that requested us. Since neither of us have been here, we were probably summoned by someone wanting an aspect that we both share. We should look around to find the person." Sarah decided with confidence.

"Ok, sounds like a plan," you agreed and you both started looking around.

Who do you find?
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: More choices

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"Found him!" Sarah yelled as you both had split up to cover more ground. You marveled at her ability to overshadow your Draconic abilities in such a way. You walked over to her standing over a very short man and a few beaten up men, that looked like body guards. You walked up to her, looking at her sideways. "What?"

"Did you have to beat up his bodyguards?" you asked.

"Hey, they attacked me when I asked what they were doing. Not my fault." She defended. She was still walking on egg shells with you. Not that you were on edge, but she thought you should be, in regards to her. She still wasn't over her part in harming you. But that was for later. The little man stood near and was... smiling?

"You look awfully joyful for someone who's bodyguards just got beat up in an alley," you commented.

"Well why shouldn't I be. Is it right to assume that you two are a package deal, you being just as good as she is?" He asked, actually jumping with excitement. You found this strange to say the least, but agreed with Sarah's assumption that this man was the one that summoned you two here.

"Actually he is many times stronger than I am." Sarah revealed, which got his eyes to sparkle and he just leapt up and hugged you.

"This is such a good day!" He cheered. You were getting annoyed. You reached and picked him off you by his collar, holding him up as his bodyguards started coming around.

"Look buddy. You are the reason we can't leave. I suggest you explain why you were looking for us, and quickly." you almost growled at him, but your demeanor didn't seam to do anything but escalate this man's excitement. You sighed and put him down, seeing the nervous look the recovering men were giving the two of you. "How about starting with your name. I am Max, and this is Sarah."

"Ah, yes. Wonderful. You can call me 'Mr. Tokugawa'. I am most pleased to meet two fighters in my own backyard." he revealed.

"So that is why you wanted us here. We are more than adept with multiple marital arts. You are wanting fighters. Makes sense. But, you should know. We are trained to kill, not to spar or fight in a match of some kind." Sarah said while eyeing the bodyguards.

"That will work perfectly!" Mr. Tokugawa exclaimed as he jumped up and down.

"Right, are you going to tell us what you want us to do or what?" You asked in an annoyed tone. If Sarah couldn't have guessed before she could guess now. You were rather home sick and sore about being ripped from the other realm you were in before the Leaf ninja came for you.

"Oh, of course. But not here. Some place more private, yes!" He replied and ushered the two of you to follow him. He was almost skipping as he made his way to a limo. The bodyguards were surrounding your group. He obviously was a hotshot of some kind. As you saw the street signs you wondered where you were. But whatever, you were there to fight, apparently.

The little guy was like a little chatter box as he talked with someone over something called a "cell phone". It was an amazing piece of technology. Allowing the user to speak to someone leagues away in real time. But you held in your curiousness. After all, hopefully, you two wouldn't be there for very long. He kept on saying things about how Sarah beat up his guys. Apparently one of them was suppose to be fighting in some kind of tournament of his. He was looking for the best fighters in the world. Seeing as you and Sarah weren't from his world, this tournament must be extremely important to him. Although Sarah was blushing about being recommended so highly, even by a stranger. She sat close to you, but was still uncomfortable in too formal of a gesture. Understandable, you supposed. She had just spent a good amount of time drowning herself in guilt. It would take a little bit to get her mind off of things. Eventually you all got to a huge building and were escorted inside with him. You all entered a room, deep underground and saw an arena of sorts with a sand pit in the middle. You guessed that this was where he wanted you two to fight, but who?

"This is what I need you for. What a stroke of luck to find you both. Unfortunately, women aren't allowed to fight in this place. A rule I wish I didn't make. But I never thought I would meet someone of your skill." Mr. Tokugawa stated then looked at you, her, then you again. "You sure he is better than you?"

"Indeed he is. Ok, since we want to get out of here as quickly as we can, and we have to help you before we can do that. We will be blunt about what and who we are." Sarah informed to which he sat in a special area and gesture to two seats for you two to sit. He looked at both of you with apt attention. "We are ninja, well trained. We can do jutsu. Things like summoning fire and other elements, as well as clones of our selves. The are all techniques but would seem unfair. Max on the other hand..."

"I am not human." you said bluntly, now getting what she was trying to do. If this guy could just backslide on his desire to have you two there. Then you two could go. But no luck. He seemed even more excited now... if that was even possible. "I am not getting out of this am I?"

"Not if you are depending on me to get you out." He said, secure in his belief that you would be amazing in a fight.

"Then it is ok if I transform to fight, if I have to?" You asked, trying to gauge just what he was going for.

"Absolutely. The more excitement and new skill you could bring to the arena the better. Except weapons." He answered. With one last ditch of effort to get him to recall you sprung some of your dragon parts out. But that was a mistake. "Ah, yes! That will be magnificent!"

"Ah.... I give up. You'll have my skill in your tournament. As long as you take care of us while we are here. We were summoned here for you after all. We didn't exactly bring our beds. Oh, you should probably not match me up with anyone you don't want me to beat right away. Save that for a final match or something. I haven't met anyone I couldn't beat yet. Seeing as not many survive when picking a fight with a dragon." You tacked on.

"Oh, happy day. It sounds like you are asking me to fight the King."

"The who? Your King fights in these things too?" You asked in an obvious confused tone.

"You mean you don't know of the King, Yujiro Hanma?" He asked in awe. "Someone as apparently powerful as you should've heard of him at least."

"Never heard of him. We are not from this realm. But if he is a normal human, can't imagine he is that hard to beat. Then again, Sarah is pretty tough and she is normal as well. So whatever. I can fight him if you want. If you don't mind me beating him. I am not planning to lose against anyone you put me against." you answered.

"Not from this realm? Oh, I don't care where you came from. This is too exciting!" He said and talked about things he could put on the roster for you, as well as accommodations for the both of you. Finally you both were in a room of your own, fed, rested, and alone.

"Can you believe this?" she asked as she looked around at the strange things in the room.

"I suppose I can. I guess this culture is into a plush way of living. Everything is so soft here." You answered.

"Looks like this is the future, or something like that." She responded comically, holding up another sweat food she had taken a liking to.

"Well, I still can't wait to get home. As soon as we are done here, hopefully we can get there." You stated.

"You really are homesick aren't you?" She asked, sitting next to you, placing a hand on your shoulder.

"I've missed a few things in my time in other realms. You being one, Kara being another, and dragon meat being the last. All of them at once will be a very welcomed experience." you answered with a look into her eyes to emphasize she was one of the things you were glad for. She needed to get over this guilt she had. But that would take a while, you'd imagine. For now, you had a tournament to win.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A man looking for fighters. (Baki the Grappler ...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Originally you were put with the other fighters and Sarah was in the stands, trying not to beat up half the people that were around. But you quickly found the locker room, if you could call it that, to annoying. There was always someone wanting to pick a fight. Really? They couldn't wait till the arena? So you went out and sat with Sarah, waiting for your name to be called. She was happy about that. She needed time to spend with you. As both of you watched the fights it gave some interesting improvements to moves and fighting styles you both already knew. Most though were only good against human sized opponents. There were a few that weren't, but mainly they were humans fighting humans.

A little bit into the event you saw Yujiro Hanma. His son was impressive enough, and he looked a head better than other people as far as fighting ability was concerned. But that wasn't saying much. You coming from the other realms, where people had abilities that made guns and missiles useless, this guy didn't compare to that. Still, for a human, he was pretty good. His mind and morality was another story. He seemed to think he owned the place. You guessed that is why they called him "the King". Finally, they brought out an alternate provided by him. You didn't even bother remembering his name. You, hopefully, wouldn't be here long enough for it to matter.

"Max, please report to the ring." The announcer called, as it was probably reported to him that you weren't in the back with the rest of the fighters.

"That's my call." you said and got up.

"Max..." Sarah called before you went to leap down to the ring. You stopped and turned to look down at her. "Have fun alright."

"I'll do my best." you replied with a smile, one she was more than glad to see and returned. With that you leapt down and landed in the arena. Other people were surprised by this. Even more so though was that you still looked like a upper High School kid. Dragon blood kept you from ageing too much. You barely had to brace for your landing, so you just stood there with your arms crossed.

"You are my opponent? This isn't a place for children." Said the man across from you with an almost genuine smile. You couldn't tell if this guy was nice or psychotic.

"Then you should go." you said, still not really taking a serious stance. Not like he could do much against you. People kept stalling it so you looked to Mr. Tokugawa.

"My apologies, our friend here is a rare find. He is older than he looks and more than capable. Start the match already!" He said, never seeing you in action yet, he could barely control himself. Yujiro was next to him, having a bored look as he sat back in his seat. Probably expecting you to get your butt kicked.

With Mr. Tokygawa's order, the match started. The man seemed indifferent, despite his claim earlier. He took a posture that reminded you of a swan, kind of. His limbs were longer than normal people, but just. he seemed to float up and come above you. You didn't move as he approached and he started with a barrage of kicks that you didn't even bother dodging. You just let them bounce off your face with no effect on you other than irritation. He was slightly confused when he came down for a landing.

"Really? I was brought here for this level of fighting?" you growled lightly. His kicks weren't even registering. The most they did was move your hair and get swet on you, foot stink of humans.

He didn't seem to know what to do so he tried it again. This time you got out of your posture. "That trick is a little old at this point, don't you think?" You said calmly as you caught one of his ankles and whiplashed him on the ground hard enough to cause an indent in the ground. You had no intension of killing him, but you didn't want to suffer this guy's boredom any longer. He was alive, but a good number of his bones were broken from the impact. "Pest..."

You looked over at the referee, as shocked as anyone else. He flinched at your gaze, but you just nodded to the broken guy now out cold.

"Match Over!" He called.

"Wow, I can clearly say that was not expected. This child has easily beaten the King's chosen fighter, and did it with a single throw." The announcer called. You turned and started walking toward the locker room. You and Sarah knew that you couldn't sit in the stands after your first match. Otherwise you'd get no peace and it would defeat the point of sitting up there in the first place. So you strode back, but was stopped by a thud from behind you. You turned your head and saw the big man, Yujiro Hanma, standing there, glaring at you with great joy.

"What do you want?" You asked, slightly angering him by not even turning to address him.

"What a find you are. You may be worth taking this one's place under me...?" He offered. He was asking you if you wanted to be trained by him. Great.

"Not interested." you answered then turned to walk away but something whacked the back of your head that made you stop, again. You turned all the way to face a much closer man. He stood much taller than you. From a normal human standpoint he would be very fear worthy. But you didn't bat an eye. "What now? You are getting too clingy for my taste."

"You think you are superior than I am?" he asked, asking if you thought you could give him a good fight, you thought. This guy was hard to read, or at least part of him. He was more instinctual that he let on, but not enough to realize you were out of his league.

"Ah, so you want to fight. Sorry, this is Mr. Tokugawa's tournament. So HE is in charge. Get him to set up a match, and I'll kick your ass without having to be convinced by your lame attempts. And you can finally stop annoying me." You answered with a calm face, then looked past him to Mr. Tokugawa. "How about it? You want to enter him in your tournament as my next opponent? I know you got your system, but he can be a warm up if you want to get past that little rule."

"Done!!!" he said with excitement. You didn't know what he liked more, your apparent power, or for it to be put against this guy's. The crowd seemed to like it as well.

"There, wise ass. Happy now. Now, if you excuse me, I would like to take a nap." you stated but he kept his gaze.

"I will destroy this whole tournament. Impress me, then I will wait." he stated.

You sighed and brought a finger to his chest, which is where your head met in a height to his posture. He watched you as you got closer then, you flicked him. He definitely wasn't expecting to go flying through the wall and down the tunnel on the other side of the ring. You shook your head with annoyance, turned, and continued to walk to the locker room.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Meeting the King.

choices: Offer to take him with you to your realm.
Offer to send him to Naruto's realm.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Sarah met you back in a private room, where you could get the nap that you were hoping for. She remembered that you couldn't really sleep peacefully. So when you asked if you could sleep near her, she almost burst with joy. That meant that her presence still tamed you, and helped you sleep without having those nightmares that sometimes caused you to rearrange the very ground you laid on. As a 500 foot tall dragon, that was easy. But either way, she sat next to you as you slept. You didn't mind the noise of the screen, letting her watch the other fights. But soon enough it was your turn again, so you both walked over to the tunnel you were suppose to come out of.

"As stated before, Max will fight with the King, Yujiro Hanma, before his match against Doppo Orochi. One has to wonder, how much of a chance he has. However, his previous show of power has definitely tipped normal logic out the window." The announcer called out and cheers rang out as you both stepped out of the tunnel.

"You ready for this?" She asked.

"Only a preliminary match. I plan to take a little longer against the other guy. I like him a little be better. This guy though... " you answered, then finished with a growl. You stopped as she hugged into you.

"I just got you back, and you accepted, forgiving me for hurting you so much. Please don't get angry. I just want to see you happy for a while, ok?" She almost pleaded.

"How can I say no to you?" you asked as you tipped her face to meet yours. She sniffed then smiled. "Ok, for you, I will not kill him... even if he asks for it."

"Thanks, doesn't mean you can't have fun." She said as she let go and gave you a small kiss on the cheek. "Go get him."

"Will do," you said with a wink. Then you jumped onto the barrier and out into the ring with noticeably little effort. He wasn't in the ring yet, but your next opponent was on the other side. You sniffed and found him sitting where he was the last time, right next to Mr. Tokugawa. His face, it was... best word for it would be lustful. He really wanted this. "Well, are you going to come down so I can kick your ass, or are you going to make me sing a song for you first?"

With that little outburst, he jumped clear out of his seat and hit the ground in the ring, a crazed look on his face. You couldn't tell if he was excited or angry. You looked at him, then at Mr. Tokugawa, then back and forth a few times.

"Having second thoughts?" Yujiro taunted as he got into a stance.

"Kind of." you answered then looked up at Mr. Tokugawa. "Uh... are you sure I can transform? It might be a little much, if exciting."

"Yes, as long as you don't use weapons." Mr. Tokugawa answered. You nodded then looked at Yujiro, then at the referee as if to ask if he was ever going to start the match.

"Begin!" Came the call from the Ref.

"Right, here goes nothing," you said then let your eyes go and sprouted wings and a tail. Flexing them a little then, as they started to gaze in amazement, you started to change the rest of your body until you were a towering hybrid, looking down at Yujiro. You gave a growl as a light fireball rolled off your tongue and sent flames around your snout. You then let out a deafening roar that shook the seats around. "Ok, King, Let's play."

"Finally, an opponent worthy!" he said with excitement and got into a posture. You let him get ready then bat your wings, propelling you forward and sending a clawed fist to him. He avoided it and it hit the ground, making a crater and an audible "THUME" echo through the place. But you didn't miss a step as you send the same arm in a backwards strike position to where he moved to. He landed a few strikes on you, but they bounced harmlessly off your scales. He kept moving, but while moving behind a normal opponent was a good move, not with you it wasn't. YOU had a tail. With that you wrapped him up and threw him into the barrier, breaking it. He flipped up and landed in the ring again. "This is what I've been missing."

"Glad you are enjoying yourself. How about we take it up a notch." you suggested but didn't wait for him to agree. You increased your speed and came at him. His fighting prowess was better than you though, but not enough to save him from your ninja and dragon skills. At one point you caught a foot he aimed at your face in your jaws. You used the hold to restrain him while you got a grip and threw him to the air, only to use your tail to whiplash him into the ground like you did to his little student. But this guy was much stronger than the other kid was. "Not a wise move, putting your foot in my jaws like that. If not for Sarah's request NOT to kill you, you would be one foot short."

"I suppose she is your weakness then." He heaved out. He was breathing heavy, while you were still calm.

"Nah, she's my strength, and way smarter than I am. Probably the only human that could kick my butt if she wanted. She is one scary human, when she loses her temper." You answered, giving her a toothy smile to tell her that it was a compliment. One she took comically brooding. "So, are you done? Or do you still want to continue this entertaining diversion?"

"We keep going, till you lay broken and dead at my feet." He answered with a growl of his own.

"You do realize how comical that sounds coming from a human, threatening a dragon, right? You can't even breathe fire." You said back.

"Oh, and she can?" he asked, more to prove his point.

"Uh, yeah," you answered as if it was only natural. He stood shocked for a moment. He looked over at Sarah, who had just got done doing the last hand sign and let out a huge jet of flames to prove you were right. He attacked again, but you caught him and threw him into the ground, again. But this time you pinned him down with your foot, your sharp claws around his body, digging into the ground underneath him. He tried to get up, but wasn't having any luck. "So, should I have a barbeque or would you like to save the flame roasted look for when you actually can challenge me? Perhaps when you can at least manage a spark of flame?"

You blew out some flames around you so you were among the fire, but it wasn't touching him, yet. The crowd had been going back and forth between screaming to cheering wildly. But little Yujiro was not backing down. Then you got an idea. It was a long shot, but it just might appeal to a guy like him.

What is your idea???
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A King's fight.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
During the time after the fight you could tell everyone was treating you different. You had thought that getting rid of Arlong and his crew would win them over but now they were more afraid of you than they were happy Arlong was gone. They had you stay as a dragon and where you were so not to have you near the town. With your enhanced hearing you started to hear the conversations around and it didn’t make you feel any better. Since most of the topics were how to get you out of there. Eventually they even convinced Luffy that you were too dangerous to keep around. However you did as you instructed and remained completely still and eyes closed until they came to address you.

“Hey dragon.” Said Luffy’s voice which was a bad sign. Sure he was either to innocent or stupid to know better than fear you but if he was calling you dragon instead of Max than he was not here with good news. You opened your eyes and of course they could only see one of them. As you focused on the crowd that was there and more directly on your fellow crew members most of them flinched, again not a good sign.

“You want me to leave don’t you?” you asked with the other side of your mouth but it was impossible to completely hide the movement and it was obvious that they no longer trusted you as their eyes went straight for it.

“Yep.” Luffy said without a care in the world. Your expressions drooped a little but then you looked to Nami who was coming forward.

“Look, we can’t have someone that could swallow the ship in one gulp around all the time. We are all really glad you took care of Arlong but it also proved that if you were to lose control even for a second, it would mean our death.” She explained.

“Then there is only one option.” You said as you raised your head then setting a barrier between them and you so your transformation didn’t harm them and removed it when you were human again. “I chose being a pirate because it is the only faction I can think of that I would be able to live free despite my power. If I stay in one place than it will bring danger as people try to capture, kill, or enslave me. Luffy is the only pirate I would follow so if that option is no longer available than I should use the jutsu to take me to a different realm. Is that what you want?” you asked more in confirmation than any kind of guilt.

“If it is the only way than I suppose so.” Zoro stated as Luffy didn’t understand what you were really saying.

“Just don’t eat us on the way out!” Usopp requested and as usual got looks for being to direct and to loud.

“Very well, I’ve made adjustments to it so I’ll be out of your way in about an hour.” You said after a sigh of almost depression at Usopp’s remark. With that done you put up a barrier so no one went through or disrupted your work then started on the hand signs. You were closed to figuring out this jutsu but that was a relative term since you didn’t know how truly complex it was as of yet. It could take minutes more or years to figure it out completely. True to your word you were done in just over an hour however this time you were full of energy from both the remains of Arlong and his crew along with the sun that was bearing down on you. “This is goodbye then.” You said as you looked over at them.

“So, that’s the portal you came through to get here.” Zoro stated.

“See you later.” Luffy said with a smile. You looked down as he said that as you knew it wasn’t the case.

“I don’t think… Well yeah maybe if I get back I will.” You corrected mid sentence as you didn’t want to trouble the happy and innocent captain with the weight of this decision. Unlike most people you left and were leaving behind in these realms, you actually wouldn’t mind seeing him again. However from the look on the others face, they caught what you were going to say and understood it. With a wave you walked through the portal and let it close behind you. Your time in that one was short but slightly enjoyable in comparison and hopefully the next one would be better or back home. One thing was for sure though. Where ever you ended up you wouldn’t be telling your secret so easily to them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They start to fear you.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Your trip through the portal wasn’t anything like the last time. Maybe it was because you weren’t starving and abused but this time you spent only a short time in an almost dark void before you were let down on your feet into a very strange surrounding. The ground under you was hard and flat but not like rock. The buildings around were made of different materials and far larger, yet more fragile. Than as you walked you had to dodge many objects that were made of metal and glass but were on wheels and sounded like some kind of motor was in them. This type of trial and error kept on for a few weeks as you learned and observed your new environment. One nice young boy showed you how to use something called a computer and once you figured out how to use it without breaking it you sped through mountains of data to learn everything possible about this realm. The biggest thing in this realm for you was that dragons were idolized by some, and especially where you were, but mostly thought of as fictional. You also learned that for a 16 year old kid that you needed to be in school.

So you created an identity and entered one that was close. You didn’t really have a home but since you were a fully trained “Dragon Ninja” as you thought of a combination of what your specialty was, you just materialized what you needed and lived on the street. The school was simple enough and despite the bullies you were able to live peacefully as long as you didn’t excel at anything to high. You even let the gangs and bullies pick on you and, with a little genjustu, appeared pretty weak and pathetic. However as you could feel the increased skill in some of the higher class fighters such as a Girl named Miu and her friend Kenichi, you assumed that they could to you, to some extent.

“Come on, it’s no fun when you just lay there.” Said a kid from the karate club. It was a real pain when you allowed kids like this beat you up. You had to cast such a high genjutsu to cover your high muscle mass, to make injuries, and to cover up the movement so they didn’t break their own bones when beating on you.

“Hey, get away from him!” a voice said as a rather short kid you knew as Kenichi said which made the kid run. Ever sense he beat the leaders of the karate club Kenichi was feared by those under that level, at least the bullies. Some were too stupid to know he was far stronger than they were, which sometimes included Kenichi himself, but most understood their place.

“Let’s get you to Akisame.” Miu said and you opened your mouth to refuse but she put a finger to your lips for you to hush. “None of that, this time I insist.”

“I would do what she says.” Kenichi advised as he looked worried at your injuries. “You say all the time that you don’t need medical attention but these don’t look good at all.” he said and it was true. Kenichi in particular but a few times Miu as well would break up a fight with you being beaten on to which you often said that you were ‘ok’ of ‘would be fine’. They were obviously weren’t buying it this time as they helped you to the place they referred to. Halfway there you passed out. While usually you didn’t need medical attention, the amount of energy you wasted on appearing weak was quite sizable and took a toll on your body. At times you cut yourself deep enough to make it stay around long enough to look convincing and did likewise with the bruises and such. You even had a few gunshot wounds from gangs and such. So this rest was welcome but a little awkward. You hoped they didn’t take a blood sample. Once ounce of your blood would be all it took for them to know that you were far from human.

You woke once your energy was back up. If you had to guess you would say they tried to feed you while you were asleep but the real energy came from the sun that was draping over you from the window. You listened around for a while to access where everyone was and concluded that no one was in the room. Heck, no one was in the building. You sat up in the bed, letting your back brace against the frame as you took in the room. Your human clothes were set out neatly and you looked to see your ‘wounds’ were bandaged. Quietly, you put your clothes back on and made the bed before going over to a chair and sitting. You were well aware of procedures that didn’t allow patients to just leave and at the very least you had a bill to pay. Just in case you sat in the chair near the window so you could make a quick exit if necessary. You didn’t have a very good experience with hospitals.

“I admit I thought you would be up sooner than usual patients but I didn’t think you would come around this quickly.” Akisame stated as he walked into the room.

“Well I need to get to school so it makes sense that I get up before it starts.” You replied.

“But not with wounds like that.” He said.

“Well if I let their bullying prevail in any way I would just be legitimizing it.” You stated and surprisingly he knew what you meant. Normal people got lost in what you said in such phrases but he got it right away.

“Then why are you still here?” he asked as he was well aware that you would have to hurry to make it to school on time.

“Well if I was treated here there must be a fee and I wasn’t just going to run away without paying.” You said.

“Ah, well since Miu was the one that brought you in and apparently against your will I will wave it this time.” He said with a smile but his eyes looked as if he was looking deep within you. You could tell this man was a very capable individual so he could know something was up but was making an effort not to show it. “Well if you are feeling up for it than you should hurry. I do believe your school starts class in about a half an hour.” He stated to which you bowed politely and headed off. You arrived just in time and at a slower rate than you were able, since you could smell a few people from the place you just exited following you.

“I’m serious, you need to learn to defend yourself.” Kenichi said as you left school for the day. You were attacked again but they had arrived before it got too bad.

“But there is nowhere to teach me. Let’s face it, the clubs at school are a joke with any serious training and most dojos are too afraid of a lawsuit to teach anything worth learning.” You said with a half baked excuse. However it did have some truth to it. You were already above everyone’s level so receiving additional instruction from infants in the arts was idiotic. But the real reason for not joining any was that you didn’t want the attention and possible exposure of your other side. Although most were too dumb to expect anything near the truth.

“I think we have a solution to our problem.” Kenichi said.

“OUR problem?” you asked.

“What he means is that he feels compelled to protect you so he ends up in more fights than he would like. If getting you some training will help limit the number of fights he is in. Than it solves his desire to not fight and yours to get stronger.” Miu explained.

“So what is the solution?” you asked.

“Well I used to be like you and got picked on all the time. I still do but now I have the strength to not only protect myself but also protect others.” he said but put more emphasis on the ‘protecting others’ point, but not in relation to you. “I usually wouldn’t suggest training with the Masters but then again if you all accept it will be a good step for you.”

“I assume it is some kind of Dojo?” you asked to which they both nodded. “And they would be willing to let me train with them, these Masters you spoke of?”

“We won’t know until we ask.” Miu stated. You would normally politely decline but they both had legitimate reasons why it made sense. Also you were actually going through withdrawal from not training and exerting necessary power like you used to. Not to mention that with all the bullies picking on you, you needed an outlet before you retaliated.

“Ok, let’s see if they will agree to it.” You agreed and the both smiled and led the way, to Ryosanpaku.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kenichi

choices: They require you to not lose anymore.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So… You want to receive our teaching do you?” asked a man that introduced himself as “Elder”.

“Yes, from what I can tell, I can learn a lot in this place. Not to mention be a little more outgoing than at school.” You answered.

“What do you mean by that?” asked another called Master Sakaki.

“Well, at school and out in the world, being singled out as a strong fighter is more of a hindrance than an asset. I noticed that people that are strong are often sought by the weak for protection and the strong for a punching bag. The higher the rep the more collateral damage. Here I see that won’t be a problem.” You explained.

“Well, you seem to be very confident.” Akisame said and you were amazed that he gathered that deduction from what you said. “We will first need to see what level you are so we can build you up from there. Miu can you test him for us?” he asked to which she stopped her training with Kenichi and hurried over. He motioned to her and you nodded then stood. Then after moving to the middle and bowing to one another you got in a defensive stance but at an angle so you could block with one hand or foot from both sides without losing any dodging speed.

“Do your best.” She said to which you nodded to which the Elder started the match. She came forward and started to attack, slowly at first. However as you easily deflected, dodged, and avoided her attacks with noticeably little effort and not even losing your breath as she sped it up and increased her effort until she was going all out but still not being able to make contact. “What are you doing? Fight back.” She advised with remarkably no frustration at her lack of contact but rather she was giving you advice. So at one of her attacks you caught a moment when she had the back of her neck exposed for a fraction of a second. You hit a pressure point and she froze as temporary paralysis set in. This move was like a button, if you could hit it right and all the people in the room looked on as you turned to the Masters for their instruction.

“Very impressive but you should release her before she falls over.” Akisame stated and you obediently poked the same spot on her neck, making her active once again. “It is clear you have some skill but we still need to see how much.” With that said he got up and stood beside Miu.

“Wow, you’re going to test him yourself?” Mui asked after she took a seat by Kenichi, who was watching you with bugged out eyes. He was leagues away from Miu’s skill and she was the same to the Masters. But you were able to beat her in one poke while not surrendering one hit.

“Now, let’s see what you can do.” He stated, you responded by getting into a more serious stance. This time when you started fighting you immediately saw why he was at the level of master. As his intensity increased so did yours and soon you were both moving around at dizzying speeds but like before you didn’t let him land a single blow but you felt better about dealing them to a man at his level. Miu was just too fragile in comparison to fight seriously. As a Jujitsu Master he used a lot of throws as well but any that he did you simply reversed and sent him flying. However you were always careful not to damage the surfaces you fought on. The fight ended when you were able to get him in and restrain him with a hold where it was impossible to move. It was hard finding a move capable since the man was obviously at an insanely high level but everyone has things to learn so you used a move you saw a Jounin do one time on accident. “Very impressive.” He said after you let him go and in between breaths as he remained exhausted, but only for a moment. You were slightly more winded than before but not much more.

“You wanted to be a student of the dojo?” Sakaki asked, a bit confused.

“I agree, I don’t think that will be possible.” the Elder said and you lowered your head at the comment.

“But he is strong enough isn’t he?” Miu asked as she tried to understand her grandfather’s decision.

“That’s the point. Keeping him here as a student would be disgraceful. However as a fellow Master it would be tolerable.” He said as if offering it to you.

“Are you saying that you would let me stay as a Master?” you asked.

“If you accept I think that would be a wonderful idea. You have many of the same reasons for being here than the rest of us do. What style do you specialize in?” he asked.

“Well I was trained as a ninja and because of some tendencies of the jutsus I utilize I was known as a ‘Dragon Ninja’.” You stated this got the woman named Shigure to peak her interest.

“Very well than. If you accept we would like to offer a position as ‘Master Max the Dragon Ninja’.” He stated formerly.

“I would be happy to stay with you.” you answered with a smile. The rest of the day was filled with things like getting you settled and in a room of your own. You settled for building your own as there was a shortage of spots and your life at Ryozanpaku.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They offer a Master position.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were delighted that you no longer had to hide and get beat up every day. Now that you had a place to go you didn’t have to worry about people attacking you or people you lived with. Not a lot of people could pose a threat to your fellow masters or even Kenichi for that matter. Although the day after you moved it you were confronted by the same karate club bullies and soundly defeated them. Shortly after you were approached by a bunch of people to fight you but the fights hardly lasted more than a second or two and sometime ended with only a glare.

“So you won’t teach him anything?” asked Miu as you all met to decide if you would also instruct Kenichi.

“It’s not that. I can teach him a few things and help with some muscle training. But as far as ninja techniques and Jutsu, those require him to already have an understanding of Charkra. So I can’t train him until he can do at least a transformation jutsu.” You answered. “However I wrote some scrolls on how to learn it. Once you know chakra is there it is easy to use, but also costly. Most ninja use weapons and hand to hand until the battle progress to genjutsu and ninjutsu.” You said as you placed forward the scrolls in question in front of him so he could take them if he wished.

“You are kidding right? The jutsu how you describe has been a lost art or fiction for ages.” Master Sakaki retorted.

“I could always show you a few, like the illusion jutsu.” You said as multiple versions came from different parts of the room. “Jutsu are very useful in many respects… It can even… be used… for entertainment.” You said from different illusion bases before they disappeared.

“What about me?” Miu asked as she seemed captivated by what you just did.

“You may be easier to instruct but we will still run into the same problem. I suggest you study with Kenichi and I’ll show you both how to climb a tree at the same time.” You said to which you got multiple looks of confusion.

“Climb a tree?” Apachai asked. “What so hard about climbing a tree?” he asked.

“Well there is a rule; no hands.” You said and seeing them still confused you got up and headed for the nearest pine tree, a few feet away. “Like this.” You said as you didn’t miss a step as you walked straight up the tree like you were taking a stroll as well as walking upside down on a branch than staying there. “See, no hands.” You waved your hands to clarify.

With that decided you demonstrated some other jutsu in some sparring matches or to wet Kenichi’s appetite in learning what you gave him. He and Miu spent nights after their homework studying the scrolls and after a month or so they were finally doing some of the lower ranked jutsu and understood what you were saying about how tiring it was. But finally they got to the point that you accepted teaching them, Miu before Kenichi but the deal was they both had to succeed or neither would be trained.

“So that’s how it works.” Miu said as you explained how and why the walking on tree exercise both worked and why it was a necessary step in leaning chakra control.

“Yes, hypothetically, if you learn this one and the technique after it you should be able to master any justu.” You explained.

“What is the next step?” asked Kenichi.

“Later, you have enough on your plate with this one.” You said and they both bowed and turned to their perspective trees to implement and learn what you taught.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Training Kenichi...

choices: Kenichi and Miu want to learn more.
Kisara want you to be her master.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So you’re coming with us.” said yet another kid that was getting in your way. It was the 5th time someone from Ragnarok had tried to take you back to this Kisara person.

“You know something. This whole process of beating you weaklings up is really getting to be a drag.” You said then half realizing that you were referring to the situation like Shikamaru did and laughed a little. The group of men and boys attacked but with, what looked like no movement, but was really a sever rotation utilizing wind charkra you knocked them all into the air and they landed hard on the ground.

“Wow, what was that?” asked a female voice from behind. You turned to see a girl with red hair and very defined legs. While she looked overall athletic you were drawn to her almost slitted green eyes. You turned fully and sniffed the air. You had hoped that her eyes were betraying something similar to you, some kind of half-breed but was disappointed. However you still liked her eyes and gazed into them as they into yours.

“It was a sorry attempt at negotiations. Some girl names Kisara sent them, you don’t happen to know where she is do you?” You asked.

“Why do you want to know?” she asked.

“Well I would ask her to stop sending these weaklings to get their faces beaten in. If she wants to talk than she should come herself. But I have no intention of joining this Ragnarok gang thing that they kept clinging to.” You stated and judging but her tone and attitude you guessed that she was Kisara.

“Well it just so happened that I am Kisara. Why are you staring at me if you don’t want to join my crew?” she asked.

“Your eyes, they are rather unique and intense. I rarely see eyes like that and when I do it is on people who don’t deserve them. At first glance you look like a frail little girl but now that I see them and the way you carry yourself I can tell that you are definitely higher than these. I would even go as far as to say that you have great potential. If you trained right you really could be a scary young lady. Definitely not one I would want to fight alone in a dark alley.” You answered.

“I’m strong enough!” she yelled and came at you with a high kick that you blocked with a finger but clamped around her leg and held it there. From there you lifted and brought her down so her legs and arms were pinned; her arms under her back and her legs with your weight on her to hold her and them stead and still. You looked into her eyes from this new distance and they glared at you. You slitted your eyes for her but didn’t change their color or made them glow.

“Yes I agree. You’re strong enough to deal with petty street rabble and the occasional decent fighter but you limit yourself to much. I’ve seen women that could literally reduce the bedrock of a Cliffside to rubble with a single hit and others that could take down armies or fully armed men in seconds. You have that potential but it is wasted on what you think is strength and power.” You said back and she listened and gazed into your eyes as you did her’s. But eventually you got off her and started walking again.

“Wait, you think I could even beat that cow?” she asked. You looked at her as if to explain. “I think her name is Miu or something. That Kenichi kid is in love with her I think.”

“Not right now. You’re too occupied with gaining status rather than true skill. To get better you need to find a master or at least someone that is better than you to learn from. She has been training since she was in diapers so if you want to catch up you’re going to need do likewise. But I stand by what I said. I see a lot of potential in you Miss. Kisara. More than some high school gang deserves to hoard. See you around.” You said and disappeared from view as some other people were coming. You raced back and rested in your house before doing a little training yourself. You had multiple jutsus to perfect and that portal jutsu to work on as well. Not to mention the muscle training.
