1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Fire style, fire dragon justu.” You said as you worked on a fire version of the water dragon. Usually the problem was that there wasn’t enough fire to create one but with you breathing fire it solved that problem but opened up another with the whole secret thing. Breathing fire would be a sure way to say that you are very different so you had to do so in a way that allowed for the end result. In a series of complicated moves you figured it out and was well on your way to controlling it. The fire dragon soared above you as you directed it around, stabilizing its accuracy and heat that different parts of it emitted, giving it a roar for extra theater.

“Whoa! What the hell is that?” asked a voice. You knew it was Kisara so you retracted the dragon until it was little more than a candle flame then disappeared. You looked over at her as she looked at you in wonder while Akisame had been escorting her and the others watching as you trained, well the ones that weren’t training Kenichi at the time.

“Max, you have a guest.” Stated Akisame and you bowed to him as he did the same.

“What was that?” she asked.

“It was a high level fire jutsu known as the Fire Dragon jutsu.” You said and produced a mini one in your hand before snuffing it out. “Kisara, why are you here?” you asked.

“Could you teach me to do that?” she asked.

“Possibly, if you could do other high level fire jutsu.” You answered.

“Jutsu?” she asked.

“A ninja technique. There are multiple kinds of jutsu and whole series of jutsu in each kind.” You answered.

“I… well I was wondering if.” She stumbled then went down and bowed with her face to the ground in front of you. “Will you be my master?” she asked. Kenichi almost fell over when he heard this and most of everyone else was surprised but looked glad that someone was actually asking you rather than seeing you as a side show after them.

“I have only one rule for me to accept. You must do everything I say. If that means stripping naked in front of countless strangers or killing yourself and those you care for than you must do so without hesitation. I don’t have time to waste on someone who will quit and whine about every little hard or confusing exercise I give them. If you can do that then my answer is yes.” You stated. You knew that this was a tall order and that normally people would shy away from it. But as she was on the fence as far as morality was concerned you had to be sure that, if she learned the more deadly art you could teach her, she would listen and obey the terms and conditions of their use. To the others it showed that if she accepted that they didn’t have to worry about her and if not she would just leave. She seemed to think about it for a while as she was in her face down position.

“What the hell! What kind of bogus rule is that?” Kenichi asked as Miu was also confused but not willing to speak out. “You train us all the time and never expect that.”

“And look where it’s gotten you. A ninja has to train with chakra and train to kill if necessary. It has been a few months and still you haven’t made it even a few feet up on that tree. That is because you have other things and training to do and that is your choice. She isn’t asking to go through that training. She is asking for me to train her and if she wants me to teach her the ninja way than she must obey me with no question. The stuff I can teach her could kill someone easily or her if she does them wrong. So the slightest hesitation in following my order in such a situation could cause multiple deaths and countless amounts of destruction. That and if she goes rough and starts using her ninja power immorally I have full reign to kill her before she wipes out thousands of lives.” You explained and he backed down.

“But won’t that make her your slave?” asked Miu.

“Yes it will.” You said simply then as they were about to speak you started again. “I’m not going to lie and say that it will be easy or that I’m going to expect her to sit down and eat sweets for the rest of her life. I plan on putting her through hell if she accepts. But you know all too well Kenichi that it is a sure way to learn years of training in a vastly short amount of time.” You said then turned to Kisara. “Just so you know. The first thing I’m going to make you do is go in that house and strip naked and wait for me to check you out. Then after I am satisfied I will require you to quit Ragnarok.” You said and saw her expression, even in her position, change a little. You saw that she was on the edge. She had just seen your do something when she came in the sparked her imagination and her urge to get stronger was a definite factor. But like most humans she had her pride and her tendency to be in control and not looked down on for being a woman was forcing her to battle with the other points. Her body shook a little as she fought internally for what she would do.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“I… I accept. I want to be strong.” She answered.

“Very well. Go into that house and lock the doors. Undress then stand in the center of the room and wait.” You instructed. She got up and went over. You watched as she went and Kenichi was speechless until the door closed and locked.

“Do you mind telling me what you’re doing?” Akisame asked for the rest of them as they gathered around you in varying degrees of seriousness for what you just told her to do.

“I don’t have time to train someone that is going to die of cancer or a heart attack. I have some magic that will heal her completely but I have to see what is wrong. Old wounds, previously broken bones that haven’t healed right, cancer, weak heart, and so on are just some of the things I can take from her. If she has so much as a broken bone that hasn’t healed properly, the training I am about to give her will shatter them like toothpicks. But I needed it to sound like a highly perverted demand to prevent any kind of pride based obedience issues later on. She just showed that she is willing and able to trust me regardless of what her personal stance is on the matter.” You explained.

“You can do that?” Kenichi asked. You answered by touching a new cut he got on his head and in a flash it was gone.

“I can do a lot of things. If she commits herself to what I have in mind, then she may be near master level in a month or so. Now I think your break is over Kenichi and I got some work to do.” You said and they nodded and Kenichi was grabbed by an excited Apachai and carried off for training while you went to your small house that Kisara was in.

You took a breath then melted into the walls and came through on the other side of them. A way of entering using chakra that you found useful when Miu wanted to get dressed away from any prying eyes. You quietly approached her as she stood in the room and looked to you. She almost covered herself but you shook your head and she put her hands to her sides as you circled to her front.

“Like what you see?” she almost spat but for the sake of her future training she didn’t do so that offensively. You ignored it and started looking at parts of her body.

First you touched part of her head and a glowing red line appeared where there was an old fracture in her skull, probably from another fight. She didn’t see what you were doing until you touched her arm and another fracture was outlined. You touched her right breast and a blotch was indicated. You continued this until all her… problems were noted for you.

“I suppose you are wondering why I had you strip. I will explain myself only this once. Do you see all the red marks that are now erupting from your body?” you asked.

“Yes.” She answered.

“They are health concerns. Such as this one.” You said as you pointed to her arm. “You broke your arm a while ago and didn’t get it set. Now it is healed but not like it should’ve been. If I let this go unchecked then the amount of pressure I’m about to put you through would shatter that bone. And this…” you pointed to her breast to which she blushed and angered a little. “Did you know you had breast cancer? Not very far along but you would be dead by 50 if you left it unchecked.” You said and she looked at the mark with a combination of disbelief and shock.

“I have cancer?” she asked.

“Yes, in a couple places that wouldn’t show until your late 30s but it also impedes your progress in training by a small amount. This I can’t allow. So… I’m going to heal all your health problems. Do you have any questions? This is the last time I will accept you talking back while being my student. And once you learn a single jutsu than you will be my student and my responsibility. That means if you start slaughtering people for fun or start choosing equally heinous crimes I will kill you. So this is your last shot to quit out of this. After I heal you. I will expect you to do what I say to the letter and without any hesitation. No talking back, no whys, no complaining, and no disobedience. You do what I say when I say it. Now with no one here to hear or judge you, what do you say?” you asked.

“I admit I thought you were just going to try and take advantage of me. Telling a girl to strip naked right away is just… wrong. But not for you, my Master.” She said as she looked into your eyes with her answer.

“Very well, don’t move. This is going to hurt a little bit.” You said and put a hand on her chest, below her neck but above her breasts.

She continued to look into your eyes as they changed to your dragon eyes. Full of concentration as you used your magic to pull all her aliments out and into your body for it to deal with them. However you also input a general knowledge of chakra and its use. Not too much but just enough to rival a genin level ninja fresh out of the academy. She winced at the pain but, true to your command, she didn’t move. It was over in a few minutes and you both crumbled to the ground. Your body worked out her aliments and healed you body of them as she made sense of the new information she had and her more fluid movement.

“Wow, this is feels really good. I never knew I had this power inside me.” She said as she flexed her chakra a little bit.

“Here, put these on. You can change into your clothes after you get done training, if you get done for the day.” You said with a grin as you stood and handed her some ninja training clothes. She took them and put them on as you placed her other clothes on a shelf in a neat pile then turned to her as she finished dressing. “Now let’s begin.”

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Master?” asked Kisara as she approached. She was limping a little and very sore after yet another day at hard training. She stayed with you, mostly, but you slept outside on clear nights like there was at the moment.

“Kisara?” you asked back as she took a spot next to you and you both laid on the ground with your heads against the same log while looking up at the stars.

“You told me to quit Ragnarok and I did. But I have to tell the leadership about it. I had planned to tell them then run back here. I mean they’d be crazy to attack a place with so many masters. But with the level of fatigue I have I don’t think I can outrun them and fighting them would just get me broken bones that you’d have to heel. So I was wondering if you wouldn’t mind helping me with it?” She asked.

“Normally a master never interferes with a student’s battles. However they are also attacking me on a daily basis and I find it rather annoying. And you do make a good point. Usually, if you were like Kenichi back when he first started, I’d say just tough it out. But with this group might actually kill you in your weakened state. Although you’d be surprised what your training has improved so far. Normal people can’t use chakra at all, so if you were at 100% I’d say that you should do it yourself. But you aren’t and I can’t have you out for a few weeks nursing injuries when you should be training. Good thing tomorrow is Saturday. We’ll go speak with them in the morning.” You said and she got a cheerful look on her face. “After your morning training.” You said, which switched her expression to a pained one but still had a grateful look in her eyes that you didn’t have to see to know it was there.

In the morning she worked hard to finish her morning as fast as she could. But with her still sore body it wasn’t that fast. She was still losing badly to how well Kenichi was doing. But she never complained, to you anyway, as you would just add more reps if she did. Truth was, you were increasing her training so it appeared she wasn’t making any progress. But in actuality she was much higher than Kenichi at this point. You took out a few guards, gently, and eventually made it to some kind of warehouse with a bunch of kids with their numbered gloves on.

“Valkyrie… well saying that you’re late is an understatement. And who is this kid you brought with you?” asked a boy with a number ‘1’ glove on and a white suit.

“Well it’s your show. I’ll step in if you need me but at least attempt to do this on your own.” You said then backed up a little to give her room. She nodded at this and stepped forward to put even more distance between her and you. In her training, she had learned a few different jutsu at the basic level and some like the substitution jutsu for fighting. But she was obviously not at 100% and they saw it as well.

“He is my master. I’ve come here to officially resign from Ragnarok.” She said in a clear voice.

“Oh really, and what if we defeat your master?” someone with a weird set of glasses asked. She looked back at you as multiple versions of himself surrounded you. The best way to describe you at that point was unimpressed and even gave a yawn to that effect.

“This is my choice and my fight. Leave my master out of it Loki, or…” she started.

“Or else what?” he asked sarcastically as his ‘clones’ rushed you. But you used a cyclone jutsu without moving to send them up into the air and land unconscious on the ground. You never got out of your board persona as you waited. “Wha… what the hell?” he asked.

“Well it’s your funeral if you attack him.” Kisara said and you just raised your arms in a ‘sorry about that’ expression that got her to giggle a little.

“Kisara, I don’t understand.” Asked another girl that looked like a young adult.

“I told you before. I need to walk my own path. He is more than adequate to be accepted as my master. I want to get stronger and he is teaching me how.” She responded.

“You talk about him like Odin or Hermit does about the great Sage Fist.” Said a rather large, again young adult looking, guy.

“I’ve never met him. But I would guess that my master is stronger.” She said and this got a boy with a hood on to chime in.

“You dare mock the Sage Fist?” the hooded boy boomed.

“Wow, you really are just a bunch of kids, hot tempers and all. But I’ve had my fill. Kisara, unless you intend to challenge them I would like to get back and resume training. Although fighting them might be easier.” You interrupted and that got more tempers flying but they were silenced by the white suited boy standing and walking forward.

“Are you really stronger than the Sage Fist?” he asked.

“Probably, if you’re talking about the man in the all white robes that pokes around from time to time then definitely. But then again, I haven’t fought him so I wouldn’t know for sure until then. But I am on a level a few higher than master so it would only make sense that I’m near or beyond it. However there is always someone better so you never know.” You said with a shrug. He responded by striking you with enough speed to be impressive, well for a kid. But you had long casted a genjutsu so when the body he hit the wall behind and Kisara saw it she knew all too well from her training with you that it wasn’t you.

“So that’s genjutsu.” She said as she laughed at the boy’s confidence at taking you down. In reality you were standing upside down on a beam above them.

“What are you talking about? You ‘master’ just got pummeled by Odin and you are stuck in some kind of delusion.” Loki started but stopped after Odin struck at her as well. What they didn’t see was that you had revealed yourself to her and she jumped up to join you. You then were controlling genjutsu puppets while remaining hidden.


“Genjutsu. A set of Ninja techniques that mess with an person’s mind or perception.” Kisara stated as her puppet got up as did yours. For extra theater you gave them broken bones and a few gushing wounds from the impact and strike.

“What in the…” said a boy that was in a red jacket of sorts and chewing some bubble gum. He jumped down and put a punch to your puppet’s face and it was then you had an idea. When he connected the head flew off the shoulders and blood spurted everywhere. Your head bounced around like a bouncy ball before coming to a stop in front of him, along with the lifeless puppet body.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She needs help with leaving Ragnarok.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Oh come on, do you know how hard it is to put a head back on?” You said from the puppet head that was beside your genjutsu body. This got them to all jump back and the boy who did it to look at his blood stained hands.

“Are you going to keep toying with them?” Kisara asked but since her voice was attached to the puppet it looked like she was talking to the talking head.

“What can I say? I told you it would be easy. I just thought that scaring the crap out of them would be a fun activity while showing you a basic illusion genjutsu.” You responded and, for an extra effect, used the hand on the puppet body to scratch the head that was talking as if trying to think. Kisara just laughed as her agreement.

“Illusion?” asked ‘Odin’.

“Yeah, illusion.” You said then made the images disappear, along with the blood and other things you created to freak them out. You then revealed yourself and Kisara to which they looked up as you both dropped down. “Now I got a bone to pick with you, Odin is it?” you said then rushed forward and lifted him up by the throat. Not tight enough to impede breathing but hard enough that he couldn’t escape. You backhanded the red jacket boy, who flew into a box some of the others were sitting on. “I am getting really tired of all these idiots that you send after me. As a master I won’t interfere with Kenichi or Kisara if you wish to pursue them. But if you target me then I’ll be back. So unless you are organizing a fight with this ‘Sage Fist’ you keep blabbering about than bug off.” You said with a fake smile then tossed him back into one of the others.

“You ready to go?” Kisara asked and you just nodded as you both headed out the door.

“Wait, we’re not done!” said the boy in the red jacket.

“Yes we are. You’re all too weak for me to fight, just little kids.” You said as you continued walking.

“You’re not better than me!” he said as he rushed forward. But you sprouted a fire dragon from flames you created in an outburst of charkra. The boy skidded to a stop and ran to join the others as they looked at the 70 foot tall Fire Dragon justu.

“I don’t like repeating myself. You can challenge me when my little friend here is no longer a concern. Otherwise you’ll be fried and served as breakfast.” You said as your eyes glowed and they stumbled back while the dragon you controlled coiled and flew around the warehouse until retracting into you again.

“You got to teach me how to do that.” Kisara said as you both started walking again.

“One thing at a time. I just learned it and I don’t even know if you can do fire jutsu yet. But there are plenty of amazing jutsu out there and if they don’t appeal to you, then you can always make your own.” You said casually as you both walked.

“Well anyway, thanks for coming with me. It was sure a lot of fun to see them squirm like that.” She said as she thought back to their faces when your head was talking, after being separated from your shoulders. Even if it was just a Genjutsu, they didn’t know that, which made their faces and expressions priceless.

“Well, they were picking a fight with me anyway. But for future reference you should fight your own battles, it builds experience and teaches you restraint.” You said.

“Restraint?” she asked.

“Yeah, I didn’t want to say anything until it was more obvious but you’re already much stronger than any of them back there. The way I have your training set up, you don’t see the results until way later. So when you get into fights it would be really easy to kill someone if you’re not careful. Your moral decision on the matter, no matter how mad you get, will determine why you are different from them.” You answered.

“I guess so. If you hadn’t held back with me when I attacked I know I’d be dead. But there is something bothering me. You said that there is always someone better. Who’s better than you?” she asked.

“I don’t know. But you didn’t know I was better than you until I revealed myself. So if there is someone better than me. Well they would probably be able to do the same and hide or avoid me if they wished. In the end it is safer to assume there is someone out there that is stronger so I train to make sure that list remains as short as possible.” You answered.

“Oh.” She said and looked down as she walked. “Do you think I could beat Miu?”

“No, I think that if it came down to it you would be able to kill her but not defeat her. I’ve been focusing on your chakra control lately and moves that specialize in utilizing it. A ninja are not usually sought out for a sparring match. Usually it is stuff like assassination and death matches. Therefore the move sets and tendencies are different. You wouldn’t be able to safely spar with her until you master your control so you don’t accidentally kill her out of reflex. That amount of hesitation in a sparring match would only make you lose as it stands now.” You answered.

“But if you don’t want me to kill then why are you teaching me those kind of attacks?” she asked.

“Ninja need to know many different styles to prevent death themselves. By knowing those moves and how to counter them you will be less susceptible to them. Imagine that with all Kenichi’s training, only a single poisoned Kunai would be needed to kill him. Since you know how to block, avoid, and throw Kunai you have a better chance than he does in the same situation. Eventually when you fight someone new you will be able to read and utilize their own style against them. The more you know the more efficient you will become in both attack and defense. For instance if plunge a sword into your gut I can do so to kill you, or I can hit a nerve just to the left of your spinal column that would paralyze you for an hour or so. First I learned the sword technique, then I learned how to use the same motion for a different purpose.” You explained.

“Sounds like a lot of work.” She sighed and you just laughed as you both walked on home.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Earth style, head hunter jutsu.” You said as you attempted it on Kisara. You had taken her to a secluded island so you could teach and practice more impressive jutsu while fighting on a more realistic level. It had been a month and she had just reached Jounin level and knew many jutsu but since she was in the middle of the city she was unable to use most of the higher profile ones. She had been getting good enough to avoid some of your attacks and while you weren’t going full power against her she was doing quite well and actually was making it fun for you.

“Fire style, fire ball jutsu.” She said back and shot one at the ground where you were to which you threw a kunai with a teleportation mark on it so you could move out of the way quickly to where you threw it. This continued until you finally got her when she ran out of chakra, or enough to do any jutsu. With a water gun jutsu you finished your sparring match as she collided with a rock then sank to the bottom of it. “Not fair. You have more Chakra than I do.” She whined.

“Well than it is a good thing my mission isn’t to kill you, or you’d be dead. But you lasted for much longer this time. It’s different fighting with jutsu and defending against it, rather than the restricted style we are forced to use in the city, isn’t it?” you asked as you sat beside her, both of you looking over the ocean.

“Yeah, can’t tell you how frustrating it is to not use this stuff with my old Ragnarok pals. But I guess it just means that I’m just that much better for restraining and still being able to kick their ass.” She agreed.

“Kisara, there is something I want to show you… or maybe I should tell you first, then show you.” You said in a nervous voice. She had never seen you nervous before. Usually you knew exactly what to do and when to do it, perks of having a dragon instinct.

“You can tell me anything Master, you know that.” She said as she looked at you and you turned to look at her.

“Well then I should say that I lied. I lied when I said that my fire jutsu and eyes are what made me a ‘dragon ninja’ although now that I’ve given you dragon eyes I think my definition has changed.” You said as you brushed some of her hair away from her eyes. You had created a dou jutsu that you could insert, similar to the Sharingan but using your own eyes as the source and it could be passed on after implantation. If she activated it, her eyes would turn red and look like your dragon eyes but not glow. Potentially they gave the wearer all the vision of a dragon. On a more practical note she could use it to look through genjutsu and see leagues away and with great detail. She could tap into night vision or heat vision and catch the slightest movement in a forest. It made finding a needle in a haystack a piece of cake. She wasn’t as good with them yet but then again she was the first you gave it to.

“So what was the reason?” she asked and hoping she wasn’t asking too much as you looked away then up at the sky like you weren’t going to see it again as well as longing to soar in it, free and clear with no restrictions.

“First understand, that I have been betrayed, shunned, and cursed by anyone that knows. As my student I can order you to stay silent and obey me anyway but I would rather not have to. Even IF you accept it, others will not and can not follow your example. I also want you to know that no matter what you think after I tell you this, I am the same person and feel the same way about you. You are my precious student and I will not harm you, well nothing besides our usually life and death training. But even passed all this I think that I can trust you with the secret. Most of all I don’t want my past to creep up on me and turn you before I can explain for myself.” You said

“Don’t worry, I won’t judge you, or run, or anything like that. Promise.” She said, taking your hand in hers then stroking it and almost playing with your digits. She liked to massage your hands for some reason and you didn’t mind, actually she was rather good at it.

“Ok her it goes.” You said then breath in deep before continuing. “I’m only half human. I’m a half-breed and can change from completely human to completely what my other side is. I’m assuming you can guess what my other half is.” You said.

“Are you saying the you’re a dragon, or half dragon?” she asked and you nodded. She had froze and therefore stopped her hand massage to which you retracted it. “Is that why you have dragon eyes and why you could give them to me?” she asked.

“Part of it. A normal dragon can’t do that. But I’ve been trained as a ninja while in human form and the knowledge and power of both sides carry over to the other side. I can just as easily do jutsu as a dragon and just as easy breath fire as a human. Which is why you can’t learn the fire dragon jutsu. It requires a lot of fire and I breath it to make it work. I can also grow certain dragon parts in human form, which is how I can make my eyes glow. They are actually my dragon eyes.” You said, growing claws then retracting them to prove your point. At this point you didn’t know if you should stop there or continue. There is only so much you can say before you have to admit that you came from a different realm.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kisara's acceptance.

choices: She is a little scared, still.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Well, that just makes you a better Master than one could dream of. How much better could someone do to learn fire jutsu from a dragon.” She complimented, trying to lighten your mood a little.

“I see that ignorance is still bliss. Well there’s more, but how about I show you my dragon form first. Then I’ll change back and we can talk more.” You said then stood and leaped back so she was safe from both the blast and your size. She jumped over the rock you two were sitting against to watch. You then exploded to which she covered herself, then looked in shock at the enormous dragon before her. She would’ve fell off the cliff if not for the rock behind her. You flexed your wings a little as it had been so long and as a side effect it blew the excess smoke and fire away. She was shaking badly at the sight of you. But it was hard to tell why she was shaking. Part of it was defiantly fear, but the other parts were still unclear.

“M…Master?” she stuttered.

“Yes Kisara, I told you that I wouldn’t harm you. You are my student and I am your master, even when I’m like this.” You responded.

“Can I… touch you?” she asked. You answered by bringing your head forward then laid on the ground. She shuffled forward then took more hesitating steps. It took near 10 minutes for her outstretched had to make contact with your snout. But once she did she began moving it and walking around your head, trailing her hand up and down as she walked and admired you. She stopped at your eyes and saw the familiar glowing red eye she had seen so many times. When she was done and looked at your colossal mass she and gave a close claw, that was taller than her, a brief tap she came in front of you and to the rock so you could talk without her being in direct line with her. “Wow, you’re so… People all over dream of meeting or even seeing a dragon. They would die for a chance to touch one and here you are.” She said in wonder.

“It is interesting to see how each realm reacts to me.” You said.

“Realm? Are you saying you’re from another planet?” she asked.

“Not exactly. You see… imagine the realms like the worlds on T.V. What if you could go there. That is what it is like. In a sense I’m still from earth, just not the one you know. Every realm is different and every one has their way of looking at dragons. The first one and my home are hostile. There are hundreds of thousands of dragons and they are unofficial enemies with humans. It is actually where I get my hatred from dragons from. It is a very savage world. The next one was friendly but treated me as more of a weapon and when I ran away I was evil, or so they said. The one before this, they are afraid and respect dragons. Finally this realm almost idolizes us. But I don’t think that if a government would find me that they would be too willing to harbor me.” You explained.

“Wait, you hate dragons but you are one, what’s up with that?” she asked. You resorted to your old trick and turned then exposed your side to her. She gasped at the scares but since there were more than one story you let you wing off the spots so you could tell them. “What horrible… who did that to you?” she asked. She made a few steps toward you but when you brought your head around to address her she back away again.

“These are from my mother.” You said as you used your tail to point to the fang scars she gave you. “You see… on my world, Half-breeds are hunted and killed on sight, even at birth. My mother did this to me not minutes after I hatched and it wasn’t out of duty, it was out of selfishness and pleasure. Most dragons have serious pride and superiority issues. In their relation to humans they also admire their taste so they tend to… well you get the point. I hate them for that. I hate how they treat others and humans, I hate that they kill their own children, I hate their demented view of pride, I hate everything about them.” you said with a growl that shook the cliff.

“I get it, you hate other dragons.” Kisara said, waving her hands in a motion to calm you down. “Anyway, what are the other ones from?” she asked, trying to change the subject but it just turned your angered eyes to deeply sad ones.

“The realm that I was exiled to from my mine did this. At first they accepted me and it is where I learned the way of the ninja. But one day I was on a rescue and retrieval mission with a little support and my comrades were gravely injured. So I did the only thing I could, I swallowed them.” You said them paused but that was all she needed to ask the obvious question.

“You ate them?” she asked in shock.

“No, I swallowed them. Like I said, I can just as easily do magic and jutsu in dragon form than I can as a human. I also have a second stomach used for storage where no digestion takes place. If I combine the healing magic and jutsu I learn with my flesh literally all around them, I can multiply my effective healing powers my at least 10. So I swallowed them and started to heal them. It ended up being a very draining task to fulfill the mission, heal some that were so close to death, and transport over 10 people to safety miles away. When I got there I was very weak and couldn’t explain myself and heal them so I concentrated on healing them. But then…” you stopped and she could see tear start to flow as you traced the long scar on your body.

“You don’t have to say it.” Kisara said but you sniffed and decided to continue anyway.

“They overreacted and cut them out of me. There I was half dead already and they didn’t really trust me at all. The pain was so great that I passed out but only after I learned a new magic and transferred their wounds to me before they were cut out of my storage stomach. When I awoke they had sewn me back up but placed paper bombs inside me and took the girl that came after me from my home realm. They used the paper bombs like a leash. If I did anything they didn’t like they made one explode; taking, growling, even trying to explain myself. Then they hit me with the final blow. The girl they took from me and who I considered my family, they wiped her mind so she too hated me. With that loss I left to the next realm…” You said and told of you adventures with Luffy then until present day.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You continue.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You instinctually closed your eyes as you knew that people were unnerved by them. But them you felt a light pressure near one of them and shot it open to see what Kisara was doing. She was there, right in front of your eye, wiping away the tears you had shed.

“Master… you don’t have to worry about that with me. I promise that even IF you were to turn evil and rip me apart. I would follow you and let you do it. I just trust you that much. I don’t care if others would call me a sucker for doing it, I won’t fade away from this. If you let me, I’ll be near you no matter what. I don’t care if you destroy the whole world or save it. You’re my Master and being a big dragon won’t change it. Although…” She said as she lifted your upper lip and looked at some of your large teeth. “…it is probably going to take a while to get use to these.” She said with a smile.

“Kisara… thanks.” You said, not knowing what else to say.

“Just one thing, have you ever eaten a cat?” she asked as she looked at your teeth, obviously for tearing meat apart for eating.

“Well, there was this one time. When I was little I was trapped by a mountain lion. I was really little so it got me in its mouth and tried to chew me up. But it didn’t count on my scales being so strong or my tail.” You said and flattened it so she could see what you meant. “I was so scared so I plunged in up and though its brain and ate for a week. Other than that there wasn’t really any house cats near my area and that mountain lion was a lone cat so… I guess I have if you count that time. But other than that they are too small for me to consider them a good meal.” You answered.

“Good, cause if you did I’d have to kick your ass.” She stated then smiled. You had almost forgot about her love for cats. You were actually thankful that she asked that before the one about eating humans. Although she already knew you did from your story. “Does the others at the dojo know about this?” she asked as she pet your eye ridge to which you purred a little. She remarkably knew it was a purr rather than a growl.

“No. I guess I am too scared to tell anyone. I only show my ninja side with them. I know I’m going to have to leave this realm eventually. I also expect that those other ninja to come around to get me as well, someday. I’m just too big of an asset to lose. I wouldn’t want to harm this realm any with their interaction. As you can now see, having multiple ninja at your level and higher would not be a good thing over here. But a sure way for them to force me away from this realm is to get them to turn on me. And of course an easy way for that to happen is to tell them about me. I just couldn’t bare one of those people being you.” you returned.

“You thought I would betray you?” she asked, slightly hurt.

“Well if you were told that I was really a evil, blood thirsty dragon who is wishing for a feast and I hadn’t told you anything how would you react. That is why I told you. Now you know and that won’t be a problem. Even if they do come I know that you wouldn’t and that is enough for me. Maybe I’ll tell them eventually but not right now. Let’s wait until your training is finished, then maybe I can get them to listen. But if they don’t react well I would have to leave again.” You answered and she felt better but concerned about you leaving.

“Couldn’t you just… I don’t know, make them believe you?” She asked.

“No, I don’t want fake friends or ones that are only there because they think I’ll eat them if they don’t. I want friends like you and how Sarah used to be. But since she is gone you are all I have left. You’re the closest thing to family I got. You’re like a sister and I’ll protect you with my life if I have to.” You answered.

“Master… will you take me with you?” she asked and when she heard only silence she continued. “If you need to go somewhere else will you take me with you?” she asked.

“If you are strong enough. There’s no point in taking you with me if those ninja are just going to turn you as well. But if you were to get strong enough so that it was no longer an issue than… I would love it if you came along with me.” You said to which she just hugged your head. All of a sudden you flicked her away and exploded back to human form.

“Hey!” she said as she got up and you walked over.

“Sorry, but I can’t have anyone see me like that, well accept you.” you said then pointed up to a plane that was passing over.

“Well I got a lot of work to do anyway, if I want to get good enough to come with you when the time comes.” She said and got into her stance. You smiled and did the same as you two got back to training.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She comforts you.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Through the following weeks, Kisara hit her stride and started absorbing more and more of what you taught her. She had gotten to the point where she could use Dragon’s Eye without a major strain on her chakra or mind. Finally her test was upon her. Her goal was to be a master but also reach a level that she could defeat Miu without causing long term damage. The elder and the other Masters watched as they fought in a match where Kisara couldn’t use any ninjutsu or Genjutsu. She was only allowed things that improved her fighting style like Dragon’s Eye and fie tuned chakra control to enhance her speed, strength, and other abilities. Finally the match was over and Kisara won but with the restrictions she was under it took a lot out of her, but not as much as Miu.

“Not fair. She used that Dragon’s Eye again.” Kenichi stated. He might’ve been a little upset since he and Miu were still on basic levels of ninja techniques. The best jutsu Miu could do was the substitution jutsu and that took a lot of chakra from her.

“I admit, the Dragon’s Eye is a rather hefty advantage.” The Elder agreed. “But so is what strength and skill we all learn from such diligent training. Max, did she pass your test?” he asked.

“What do you think Miu?” You asked.

“She is very strong, but she seemed to be hesitating. Even though she beat me and I feel out matched with her Dragon’s Eye and Chakra control, the hesitation in her moves made it possible for the fight to last as long as it did.” She answered.

“I agree. She does need more experience in restraint and fluid motion under those circumstances.” You said to which Kisara frowned as she heaved alongside Miu against a wall they were leaning on. “However, I did see what I was looking for. She didn’t mess up once as evidence to the lack of damage from the fight. Though her hesitation provided openings, in a real ninja battle she wouldn’t be restricted from using assassination moves and death blows like her body has been trained to do. I welcome the first addition to the Dragon Ninja ranks.” You said to which Kisara’s frown turned to a smile but was too tired to show her excitement.

“What do you mean, ‘the first addition’?” Akisame asked.

“Well my designation of being a ‘Dragon Ninja’ originated as a description, not a classification. It was only when the elder officially recognized it did it become such. So in a sense, I am the founder of the style.” You explained, the nodded in understanding. “Now, if you would accept my request Elder, I would like Kisara to start training formally at the dojo.” You asked.

“For what reason?” he asked as he stroked his beard.

“She has learned all I can teach her. She now needs experience and training in multiple martial arts to expand her knowledge. Most of what she know now are too deadly to be used in a match or fight, where death is not the desired outcome. She can only get so far when only sparring against me.” You explained, both to the masters and to Kisara as she was also confused.

“Would she still be your student?” He asked.

“Yes.” You answered bluntly.

“Then as a fellow master at the dojo where you reside I accept. I guess she has been technically a member of this dojo ever since you took her in. What do you say young girl? Are you willing and able to receive our training?” he asked.

“I would be… Yes, I am.” She stumbled.

“Kisara, you know you still have to do your morning workout. So don’t think this will be easy.” You warned. This got her to hang her head comically and cause the others to laugh, she followed suit after a short reprieve from her thoughts.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Dragon ninja Kisara

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Things were going well around you, well minus Kenichi’s Ragnarok troubles. Fortunately they were wise enough to not attack you or Kisara. However all your peace and happiness was bound to run dry eventually. It started with a scent you smelled. It was faint and you didn’t really remember what it was at first. But once you caught it again it was unmistakable. You smelled a few Leaf Ninja that you knew all too well. Most of the scents were usually well hidden even from your nose, so you couldn’t figure out who was there but the overall smell was hard to forget. You constantly touched your scar that that indicated the where they cut into you. The smaller ones couldn’t be seen from one form to another but that one was definitely worse than the others and as such carried over. You spoke with Kisara about it to which she was constantly looking around as well as hiding her ninja skill as much as possible. But they were ninja so the eventually tracked you down and on one sad evening Miu came to get you. She escorted you to the main area where everyone would go to talk if necessary. Everyone was assembled inside and as Miu opened the door and walked in you took a breath and followed.

“Well this can’t be a good sign.” You said straight away. You saw Sakura, Sarah, Kakashi, Naruto, and Lady Tsunade. If they were there then it meant they perfected the portal jutsu enough to travel backwards and get back. They wouldn’t risk the Hokage unless they could be confident of them returning. Which of course meant that they were able and willing to follow you across realms.

“Max, it seems some old friend of yours have come to visit. They’ve been telling us some interesting stories, most unbelievable but interesting.” The Elder said as you took as seat on the end of the little box they had formed, Ninja on one side and masters on the other. You took one end while the Elder and Miu took the other side. You looked over at Kisara and she just shook her head as she knew what you were going to ask. They hadn’t said anything about you being a dragon yet. The thought interested you but also made you on high alert.

“I guess you could call them that.” You responded. “What have you told them?” You asked them as a group.

“We told them where we are from and about the realms we have traveled to find you. That’s all, for now…” Tsunade said in a half concerned but half threatening tone.

“Max, are you telling us that what they are saying is true?” asked Akisame.

“I wasn’t here to hear everything but as far as the realms are concerned… yes. That is true.” You answered. The information came to a shock to all but Kisara and this didn’t go unnoticed by the keen eyes in the room. “They are who I learned the basic skills of a ninja from. Since my… we separated I have refined them and made it into the ‘Dragon Ninja’ style but if you were wondering where I learned of chakra and such, these would be the people”

“Kisara… you don’t seem too surprised by this.” Kenichi stated.

“He is my Master, it took him a long time but he told me this already. Along with the rest. It was well after he gave me the Dragon’s Eye.” She responded.

“Dragon’s Eye?” Kakashi asked.

“I created a jutsu that transfers the full power and potential of my eyes to others in the form of a Kekkei genkai. So her children will also have it… well if they are trained to a degree to utilize chakra like she has.” You explained in terms he could understand but went right over the head of those who didn’t know the vocabulary.

“You must have a lot of trust in her then.” Sarah said then looked down. Because of this you wondered if they had reversed her mind tampering. If they hadn’t then she would be angry and still vengeful.

“I do. While the rest of them are dear friends I consider her family.” You clarified. It wasn’t a shock to the master side as they knew you two were rather close but the ninja side now felt a little more guilt for some reason.

“I sense fire. Max, there is more here than what you are telling us. If you want to keep your past hidden then we will respect that. However I am getting the distinct feeling that you don’t want them here.” The Elder stated.

“I don’t.” you said bluntly.

“But they are your friends?” Kenichi asked as he was confused.

“OLD friends. I don’t think I have to tell you that an old friend sometimes means that they were friends once… a long time ago.” You responded and he nodded. “Truth be told I didn’t want to see them again and now that they are here, odds are I’m going to have to leave, one way or another.” You sighed.

“Leave?” asked Sakaki.

“Either they are here to pursue a dangerous enemy or they are here to bring me back to their realm. If they are here I assume that they can cause some nasty damage if they wanted to and continue to do so, even IF we dealt with them. I highly doubt they risked the portal jutsu multiple times and risked a foreign realm just to say hi.” You explained.

“I see.” The Elder said as he stroked his beard.

“Apachai don’t want Max to go.” Apachai stated.

“Ah! You guys don’t know anything about him. You’d probably want him to leave if you knew.” Naruto blurted out and was promptly knocked back down by Sakura.

“Well there goes that.” You said as you rubbed your head.

“Max?...What is he talking about?” Akisame asked.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Unwelcomed guests.

choices: take you back under their care.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You don’t have to say anything if you don’t want to. We accept you now and what you did in the past is little concern to us. You have always done right by us.” Elder stated.

“Thanks, but I know that it will be said eventually and the only way to control how it is portrayed is to say it myself. Actually, maybe it would be best for Kisara to retell the story. That way, everyone is on the same page and I don’t have to cover for someone adding bits from their imagination.” You suggested.

“You sure? What if I mess it up?” she asked.

“Don’t worry about it. You know all the important parts so a little detail misplaced will be of little consequence. If they have a question they can ask after you finish. But they need to know that I didn’t Idolize myself when I told you. You’re the one neutral person that can tell the story so go ahead.” You said with a smile to which she returned one then started. They listened in awed silence as she told your story. She had heard the whole thing and, through random questioning while training, she knew more of the details than most did that were there. When it got to the part that the ninja ripped you open they immediately glanced and located the scar that proved the action. But you were not looking at them, any of them, as you held in your emotions and refrained from bursting out in anger or crying like a baby. She added a little emotion in when saying certain things but for the most part she finished with an extremely small manner of error in the events, mainly hair color and specific dialog wording.

“Is that true?” asked the Elder in which you could only nod. “Before we start pointing fingers, do you have any proof that you are… what is it?... a half-breed?” he asked. You responded by growing multiple dragon parts including eyes, wings, claws, teeth, and your tail. You flexed them around a little before retracting them from sight.

“I can’t believe it. The guy that was training me was a real live dragon.” Kenichi said in a partial daze of shock and awe.

“None of that matters. He is still the same person, dragon of not. If he was so evil, do you think he would waste his time like he has?” Kisara defended. “He’s been nothing but kind and gentle, well except when he’s sparring with me. He has yet to take a life since he got here and even plays the weak card when bullied.”

“Apachai no care if Max a dragon.” Apachai stated.

“I agree, it makes no difference to us if you are a dragon. As I said, what happened in the past is none of our concern. If you want to stay than you are more than welcome. “ Elder stated with the others agreeing.

“As for you five, if your plan was to turn us on him so he leaves then you have failed.” Akisame said in a rather serious tone. All the masters were now on alert as they believed whatever you said was true over anything they would say to dismiss it.

“That was not our intension. Although we did come in hopes that he would return with us.” Tsunade stated.

“Then why did Naruto bring it up?” asked Kisara as she knew him well from your speech and them yelling at him before you arrived.

“I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to.” He said as he was forced to add a bow with his apology by Sakura.

“Naruto has never been one to hold his tongue. I honestly expected worse. What I want to know is why you are here. Yeah you came to get me, but why?” You asked.

“At first it was because we couldn’t afford to lose you. Having a 500 foot tall, and never mind how long, not aiding in even transportation is greatly missed. But mostly the enemies around us were given pause when you were there. With you gone they became more bold. We established a separate research faction to find out this ‘portal jutsu’ you found and used.” Tsunade said then looked over to Kakashi to continue.

“They made progress but not fast enough to stop the village from carrying out our normal missions and lives. Then we started getting intel on Sasuke Uchiha. We immediately tossed it out of pride but as more and more came in we couldn’t ignore it. Finally when I was recovering Naruto and the others ran into him with Orochimaru. From that moment on we were haunted by the realization of what we did. You had told us as much and we are ashamed that we did so much to you.” he said then paused.

“They restored my memory not to long after that. I hated them for what they did but since they were working to find you I helped.” Sarah said as she took over.

“Ok, nice history lesson. But you still haven’t answered my question. The portal jutsu is extremely dangerous as is the trip to the other side. There is no way that you risked the jutsu multiple times for an apology.” You said.

“Dangerous?” Asked Akisame.

“In the original jutsu there are over 32,000 hand sign and a lot of other preparations to make. If even one hand sign is out of place or the chakra flex too much in the process it could send a space several miles in circumference to another realm or space. Imagine if they get a single hand sign wrong when traveling back they could accidentally take the whole city and transport it to the vacuum of space. I’ve since refined the process but the risk is still the same. Not to mention that every realm you go to, there is a chance it is hostile or inhabitable. So in a sense they risked potentially thousands of lives to get here and will risk hundreds of thousands to get back.” You explained.

“Hmm… It does seem unlikely that someone would risk so much. Max is just one person so the sacrifice must’ve been worth it.” Elder agreed.

“I’ll tell you why we came.” Naruto burst out. “We came to…”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The truth comes out.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“What?” you asked as if not understanding and hoping you guessed wrong.

“Max, Kara came through the portal after Dark Hunters slaughtered the city, everyone we knew there is presumed dead. When they learned where she went they also came and started to wreck havoc on the land. There are only 3 of them, for now, but at night we are outmatched even with Kara there and summoning animals.” Sarah informed.

“Dark Hunters?” Kisara asked.

“That is the type of dragon I am. In the world of dragons the Dark hunters rule at the top by a large margin. We are usually the dragons that the evil stories are based on and why dragons are feared. Sure other dragons are dangerous but Dark Hunters are the dragons other dragons fear.” You explained.

“So do you stand a chance?” asked Sakaki.

“Well if they sent queens, which I doubt, I would be near 3 times their size as well as other stats. Not only that but I can use jutsu in dragon form. Even before I leaned the skills of a ninja I could take them down easy enough. Even if they had mounts it should be easy enough. I just wish I didn’t have to go back. If I was going to go back I would’ve liked to go home. But most likely they broke the portal to my home or more Dark Hunters would’ve came through. So I can’t go home, not that I want to at this point but still.” You said with your head down, saddened that you would have to leave.

“But you can come back right?” Miu asked.

“It’s not that simple. Imagine the portal system like a series of random hoops and you going through them with a rope attached. People can follow you and you can go back the way you came but… if you want to come forward it becomes random again. I assume the amount of realms out there are near infinite so the odds of me randomly picking this on again would be… slim at best. If I go back with them I probably won’t be able to come back here, ever.” You said with a sigh. “Just when I find a realm that accepts me I have to leave. What a pain. Yet another reason I hate dragons.”

“Yeah, I’m beginning to hate them myself.” Kisara said as she was understanding the silent hint you gave her. “Would you still take me with you? I mean if you plan on going?” she asked.

“Max, if we knew it would’ve been this hard on you…” Sakura started.

“You might not have but they did.” You said as you looked at Tsunade. “The portal jutsu had all kinds of warnings and things that made it impossible to be ignorant of why it was a forbidden jutsu in the first place. Besides, I said when I left that I hoped never to see you all again. Now I got to go back to hell and kill some demons for you and never come back to the only heaven I found. That’s just peachy.” You almost growled then looked to Kisara. “Kisara it is completely up to you. Odds are that if you come with me you will die. Dark Hunters play ruff and even if you survive you wouldn’t be able to return here, ever. You still have other family, while royally messed up, they’re still your family and plenty of friends. You have a real future here and if I ever do make it back then you’d be here, maybe even with some kids and a little Dragon Ninja family to pass on the Dragon’s Eye to. You deserve that happiness and I’ll have you in here.” You said as you touched your heart.

“Can I sleep on it?” she asked.

“Yeah, I got to get some sleep anyway.” You said to which she got up, glared at the other ninja, then left for the night.

“So you plan on going?” Kenichi asked.

“Yeah, as much as it sucks. If there is a mess made by my kind. It is only right that I clean it up. It is a real pain to be the only civil dragon of my kind. Now if you don’t mind I really do need some time to rest and to myself. I’ll see you all in the morning.” You said as you got up and went out after your sentiments were taken and returned. As you jumped onto the roof of your little house and looked up at the stars you felt a deep longing but also a sadness. Then it switched to concern. You knew how dangerous it would be for Kisara if she came with you. But selfishly you wanted her to come. It was a good thing you left it up to her.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: get help against dragons.

choices: You leave before they can talk.
You stick around to talk with them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
After a good night sleep you gathered with the others in the yard with the others. They all felt better if you were the one to perform the jutsu and within an hour of dizzying hand signs you opened the desired portal. Turning to the others you saw Kisara walking up with her head down and in a contemplative posture.

“We’ll wait on the other side. As well as start on the portal justu on their side.” Tsunade said to which you nodded. Sarah hesitated but also went through. She was feeling a lot of guilt of her part in your former torture as well as sadness for you obviously not trusting her anymore.

“So this is it. I really would prefer to stay but it appears that we all have our responsibilities.” You said.

“We understand. If you ever find yourself in this realm again, you know how to find us.” The Elder said and you nodded respectfully to him and the others then as a little time went on all eyes went to Kisara as she had yet to announce what she decided.

“It’s not fair.” She said then ran to you and embraced you. “I wish I could come with you. But I have responsibilities here just like you have them there.”

“I know. Selfishly I would love for you to come with. But I would never forgive myself if you died on my watch because of that selfishness. Don’t wait for me, if I am able to return I would like to see how far you’ve progressed in life. Maybe you’ll have kids or grandkids by that time. And I am sure that they will be just as beautiful as you are, with a healthy obsession with cats of course.” You said as you wiped some tears away from her face.

“It’s too bad that I won’t be able to learn from you anymore.” Kenichi said as he wasn’t to good at the whole goodbye thing.

“Kisara is more than capable of instructing others on the use of Chakra.” You said as you two separated. “See ya.” you finished with a wave then walked into the portal. You made sure no one followed as if closed then went to the other side. You were greeted by only Kakashi as there was another open portal ready for use. From a quick look around you recognized it as the spot you formed the portal in Luffy’s realm. You also figured that everyone else had gone through already, leaving Kakashi there to guard and maintain the portal.

“Max.” Kakashi started. “I know you’ll get a lot of these when you return. But I am truly sorry for what we put you through. I never thought the leaf capable of treating one of their own in such a way. The Third vouched for you and we knew what you could do and we let fear rule our actions. Not only that but you were part of our team and not just as a weapon but as a person. I know that your trust in us if near to nothing so I…” He ended as he didn’t know what else to say.

“I understand, doesn’t mean I don’t feel betrayed and still sore about it, but I understand. For now I need to take care of your dragon problem. Then I can concentrate on the village and my place in it. I can’t go home and I can’t go back that way.” You said to the now closed portal behind you. “So I either have to stay or go ahead to another realm. I haven’t decided yet.” Kakashi nodded at this then followed you though the portal. As soon as the portal closed behind you and Kakashi you took a look around.

You were in one of the training fields with a high concentration of ninja around. You smelled smoke from previous attacks and as it was midday you could see it rise while a figure of a dragon soared high in the sky. You growled at the sight as your enhanced eyes could see it as a male Dark Hunter. You then started to look around again when something hit you and forced you to the ground.

“Max!” said a voice you hadn’t heard in a while. Kara was no nuzzling you so hard that it was forcing you to the ground and making an indent in the grass and earth.

“Kara, I missed you to.” You said as you gave her still nuzzling snout a pet and rub until she settled down and let you get up. “Well you look good. I hear you’ve been having a little trouble with some distant relatives of mine. They didn’t harm you did they?” you asked.

“A bruise here and a scare there. Nothing too big to note.” She answered. Your reuniting was interrupted by a roar from above as the circling Dark Hunter came down then landed, causing the ninja in the area to scatter accept some of the higher ranked ones that were near you and Kara.

“Ah… so this is what you’ve been working on down here. All that work for just a human. We were expecting something a little more entertaining.” The dragon said as he looked at you.

“Bold ones, aren’t they?” you more stated than asked.

“Yeah, but they have an efficient system. If I attack or anyone attacks the other two come while we are distracted. It seems to be a game for them.” Kara growled.

“Well if you don’t mind, getting the others to stand back. It has been a while since I stretched myself out.” You said to which she carefully did as you asked while you walked forward until you were facing the dragon more directly. “I’m sorry that I’m such a disappointment. Before I gut you, what are you three doing here?” you asked.

“Ah, a humorous human. I bet you squirm all the way down.” He said as he reached for you. You didn’t know why you bothered to speak with him. You then exploded and changed to your dragon form. The dragon shielded himself then as he looked at you he started to quiver towards the ground. The sight of your colossal form snarling at him was a sudden and terrifying prospect. All he did was the slightest move at that point but before he could blink he was on his back and under your claw. But Kara was right, the other two came out of nowhere and knocked you over before landing on either side of you as you spun around and recovered. They were queens and snarling at you as the little male got up and did likewise but far away from the other two.

“So we finally found you, you filthy half-breed.” Said one of the queens but you only snarled at them as you kept in a ready position for them to attack.

“Give up, we have you trapped and outnumbered.” Said the male.

“You think so?” you snarled. Your body began to glow red as chakra poured out of it then in one big puff of smoke, that covered and area miles around, you preformed the multi shadow clone jutsu. There was now over 500 of you around and in the air. “I think you’re dead.” You stated as the queens scurried around to try and find a way out. But with so many 500 foot dragons around they couldn’t.

With them distracted you rushed forward and sank your teeth into one’s neck, twisting and using your momentum and body weight to snap her neck and force her lifeless body down and into the ground. The male was next as he came to her aid. He was so small that you just flattened your tail and sliced him vertically in half. Then you were left stalking the final one as you licked your lips of the blood.

“Now just hold on a sec…” she started but you didn’t and attacked. Two of your clones held her down as you took her head into your jaws and impaled it, ripping the head off her neck, chewing it to a paste, then swallowing it down. With that done your clones flew up and went away so the smoke didn’t deter anyone’s vision as they came forward to you tossing the dragons in a pile then standing over them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kisara stays behind.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
By the time they got to where you had laid, you had devoured the male and were licking your snout and claws or excess blood as the carcasses leaked and poured out of their respective wounds. You had put some distance between your feasting area and where you now laid but there was still a fair amount of blood from the incident around. This along with you licking your chops made those who approached to be on edge, well except Kara who flew over to you and laid next to you.

“Have fun?” Kara asked.

“Mmm, haven’t had fresh dragon since I left home.” You answered as you cleaned the last bit of blood from your snout.

“Well you’re the only dragon I know that eats other dragons. I guess that means you’re feeling better.” She stated and your look became more distracted and pain ridden.

“How much did they tell you?” You asked.

“Not much. When I arrived they tended to my wounds and left to go get you. When I asked why you weren’t there they avoided the question. The only answer I got was from a boy and his dog. They said they did something to you that you might not forgive them for.” She answered. “What did they do?”

“Not something I like repeating. Let’s just say that it has been the only wound that cut as deep as my mother’s… gifts she did when I was born.” You said in slightly a haze but was broken out of it by the humans around finally coming within an acceptable speak range.

“What did you do!?” Kara growled. Which got the crowd to cringe back. “Nobody will tell me what everyone else around here already knows.” She didn’t know much. But for you to compare it to the defining moment why you hate dragons, it had to be something pretty big.

“Kara… I’ll tell you if you take me somewhere we can talk for a while. It is a long story.” Sarah stated. With a nod from you Kara accepted and after letting Sarah on her back, she took off and went into the distance.

“Thank you Max. I don’t want to think about what would’ve happened if some of our less reputable neighbors would’ve done if they were to have ensured the help of…” Tsunade stated as she looked over at the pile of dragons.

“They were my mess. It was only fitting that I clean them up.” You said more dry than was necessary. As you were surrounded spikes grew from your hide as if your body was subconsciously protecting itself from enemies.

“Well you have some work to do. Since you left we have…” said Donzo to which you only snarled lightly at him. It wasn’t much but judging on how easily you defeated the other dragons and ate one to boot, he stumbled back as did the others near him.

“I can see nothing has changed, good to know.” You said as you were already on your feet. Before the others could do any damage control you took off into the air and soared out of sight. You heard a few words to get you to come back but you didn’t pay them any heed. You needed time to think anyway. You went to a mountain’s top that you knew they rarely climbed and was barren enough for them to think twice before making the trip.

Settling on a place you blew a hole in the side of the rising Cliffside then entered. The space was just big enough for you and Kara, if she came after Sarah tells her what happened. It had a little room so the elements didn’t get at you but other than that it was just a small, dark, and barren cave.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You stick around to talk with them.

choices: Stay in this realm and hope it gets better.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You didn’t really know what to do. You thought about it for a while but without someone there to help you were constantly moving towards leaving. The only thing was, Kara. If you left and she remained then they would do the same thing to her, or so you thought. In the midst of your deliberating you heard the flapping of wings then a landing. It wasn’t long after that when you saw Kara’s head poke in your little cave.

“There you are. I was looking for you.” she said and went to your side as you took your head off the ground to address her. She nuzzled you a bit then laid next to you but slightly at an angle so you could still talk. Sarah also came in and approached you. “Just give her a chance.” Kara whispered in your ear.

“Max, I understand if you don’t want to see me. I did things that I don’t forgive myself for, so I can’t expect you to. I just wanted to say that I’m so sorry for it.” Sarah stated but never made eye contact. She just stood there with her eyes glued to the floor, as it awaiting a swift death.

“I don’t blame you Sarah. You did nothing wrong. It was those leaf ninja that messed with your mind. I know very well that you are a good person. And while you did contribute to my pain during that time, I know that you wouldn’t be caught dead doing such things if your mind was right. But… I can’t help see it every time I look at you. When you raise your hand my mind immediately goes to the memory of you detonating a paper bomb. My body braces for it and I can’t help flinching, hoping that this time the bomb won’t feel that bad. The others don’t affect me this way because they have no emotional ties to me anymore. I think I am wishing they’d try it again so I can justify roasting them. But you… I can’t see myself ever harming you, so I feel… scared… I guess.” You said.

“So you don’t hate me?” she asked, lifting her eyes to meet yours.

“No.” you said. At that point Kara used her long neck and snout to push Sarah into you. She fell against you and you just looked down at her. She was surprised to which you both didn’t move except looking over at her.

“Come on. Kiss and make up already.” She said. You moved your head around as Sarah backed off so she was directly in front of it.

“Max… why?” she asked.

“You’re family. You, Kara, and Kisara are my family. I love all of you to death.” You responded.

“Max I love you too.” she said with considerably less control as she usually had as she just threw herself onto your snout so she was hugging the top of it rather tight, tears hitting your scales underneath. “Do I still smell good?” she asked after at least a half hour of crying and hugging. The sudden question got Kara to laugh and you to snort a little which in turn made her fly off but you caught her with your tongue then let her down on the floor.

“Yeah. You still got that smell… I can’t help but be in a good mood when you’re around.” You responded.

“Ok, now that we got that taken care of. We need to figure out what we are going to do.” Kara stated. “I mean the leaf village will probably send people for us one way or another.”

“Who cares, they can go to hell for all I care.” Sarah stated as you snuffed a silent half agreement while Sarah took a comfortable spot against your chest so she was still in the conversation but not separated from you. Something told you that she would be pretty close for the next couple days.

“I was talking about perhaps leaving this realm. I doubt any of us would have any peace while we stay here, even if the Leaf just wants to make up and be friends. I kind of owe them for patching me up so I can’t just torch them when they show up, as much as I want to at the moment.” Kara clarified.

“On the other hand, most realms would be hard for you Kara. Sarah and I could blend in but trying to hide a dragon like yourself is much harder than it may seem. Especially if the level of advancement was like the other two realms I went to. So it may be safer to be here. At least we know how to deal with problems here. On the other side I really don’t like this realm.” You said and growled the last part. “Oh I almost forgot. Sarah, a little gift for you, just so we are all seeing the same way.” You said then blew a red smoke at her. She coughed and inhaled some of it. Then she bent down and grabbed her face as her eye began to burn. She screamed a little but then almost fainted back on you, panting.

“Max, what the hell did you do?” Kara asked with a confused expression which Sarah followed.

“I figured out in the other realm how to give the power of my eyes to humans. I call it Dragon’s Eye. Usually it doesn’t hurt and you need some intensive training to master it. But we don’t have time for that so I just included the understanding with the eyes. Sarah, why don’t you give it a try. I promise it will be worth it.” You said.

“You could’ve warned me Max.” she said.

“Sorry, but it hurts less if you aren’t ready. Come on, give it a try. A dragon’s sight is really amazing and you can see through anything, genjutsu included.” You defended. She sighed then closed her eyes as if concentrating then opened them as they went red and were exact copies of yours, minus the glowing part.

“Holy crap! This is incredible. You dragons see like this all the time?” she asked as she looked around.

“I don’t believe it. You weren’t joking. You gave a human the power to see like a dragon.” She said as she looked at her eyes more closely then backed up.

“To answer your question yes we do. Although we don’t have to use chakra to see like you do when using Dragon’s Eye. You can activate it in the middle of a genjutsu as well to see through it if you wish. Dragons are rarely fooled by humans in a challenge of sight. Now you have that same advantage.” You explained a little more and the rest of the day was more or less relaxing as you all watched her enjoy this new power that you and Kara already had. Afterwards you three tried to decide wither to stay or leave.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kara comes with only Sarah.

choices: Kara doesn't have to hide or run.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok, we’re really sure about this?” You asked as you got ready to preform the portal jutsu, already having put up a barrier so not to be disturbed.

“Is it that hard?” Kara asked.

“Well… yeah, it takes a tremendous amount of concentration and timing. Also I never made a portal big enough to fit a dragon before. Usually I keep them as small as possible so that no one accidentally follows.” You stated as you flexed and stretched your hands in preperation.

“Well it is only a matter of time before your barrier attracts some attention so go ahead. We’ll make sure no one bothers you.” Sarah said to which they backed away from you and let you work. With a deep breath you started on the jutsu. You spent all you concentration, minus a little to keep the barrier up, on the jutsu so when an hour passed and it was finally open you looked around to see your status as well as the others. Remarkably there was no one there yet.

“So where are we going?” Kara asked.

“I don’t know. Like I said before, the forward portals are at random. So keep on your toes and as for you Kara. You might have to run or hide as soon as you get through. I just came back from a realm that thought of dragons as fiction and legend. So if we end up in another one of those then we’ll have little time to figure out what to do.” You informed.

“Ok, then why don’t you go first. If it is a hostile world then you can at least get a feel for it before we come through. Kara, open up please.” She said.

“Huh?” Kara asked, not really understanding.

“Ahh… I get it. Smart, awkward and portentially dangerous but smart.” You said.

“Can you hide me in your mouth until it is safe?” Sarah asked.

“Are you kidding?” She asked. “Max, she’s kidding right?”

“Normally I would agree with you. Mainly because if you have to fight when we get to the other side, then you’re going to have to swallow her to do it. But there are few things that can get through a dragon’s scales and if the air is toxic on the other side than she will be better protected. As dragons we can handle more than humans can. Which is why she is the smart one.” You explained.

“Look, no offense, but I would rather not be in your mouth or gut either.” Sarah stated to the nervous dragon as she thought about it.

“Fine, but you owe me for this.” she said then hesitantly opened her jaws in front of her. Sarah let out a light gasp but kept her focus. She reached over Kara’s row of teeth and into the slimy prison and safety of her mouth. Sarah climbed in but was only able to get mostly in due to Kara’s smaller size. Her legs still stuck out of Kara’s mouth to which she looked at you as if to asked ‘what next’.

“I can’t believe that I’m actually going to say this to a dragon with a human it its mouth. But, it looks like you’re going to have to swallow her now.” You said as you put your hand on you head to nurse the headache you were getting. This went against every fiber of what your mind was now wired to accept. But Sarah was a smart girl and she knew what she was doing.

“Weddeh (ready)?” Kara said around her mouthful.

“No but go ahead. But it better be your storage gut or I’ll kick your ass.” She said comically. With that Kara tilted her head back and started swallowing her. It only took a few gulps but she was eventually down and made a small bulg in Kara’s stomach area.

“She safe?” you asked Kara.

“Well as safe as she’s gonna get. She’s in my storage gut but that empties every week so she’s good for a few days before it empties into my digestion stomach. Hopefully that won’t be a problem. Is it bad it I compliment her on her taste?” she asked.

“Maybe after she’s out of you. She is probably freaked out enough as it is.” You said as you gave the barely noticable blug a pat. “Alright, give me a minute… on second thought we better go together. This barrier will only hold when I’m here to manage it. I can smell someone coming so let’s go.” You said to which you two ran through the portal and your past worries faded as the portal successfully closed. Now your future worries started as you wondered where you were going to be coming out.
