1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Going to another realm.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You both dropped a few inches to a concrete floor. You spun around to get a good sense of where you were. As soon as you did you saw that Kara was about to do likewise. You put a hand on her head to stop her from moving.

"Hold on, don't move that much yet." you said, after her closest eye looked at you. You said this quietly, so she just barely nodded to keep the inactive and quiet sense open. However, you could tell she was having a hard time. Not suprising, as she had never been in a modern city before. There were a lot of noise in general, not to mention sights and smells that took you a good month to get use to. It would be hard for her and you could see her cringe as a truck honked its horn somewhere outside the warehouse you all seemed to be in. You couldn't express how lucky you all were, relatively speaking. Technically you all weren't; Sarah was in Kara's stomach, Kara was adjusting to the chaotic enviornment, and you had to figure out how to hide a dragon that couldn't change to human in a modern world. The lucky part was not appearing in direct sight line to any number of things that could be a problem.

"Max, is it safe?" asked a muffled voice from Kara's stomach. What she was really asking was if she could have Kara get her out yet. Even if she was inside a friend, she wasn't too into the whole swallowed alive thing, regardless of why or how.

"For the moment. Kara, don't move too much, but you can let her out. I might need her help in a little bit." You instructed.

"Can you do something about the noise first? I can't concentrate." Kara almost begged, but kept her voice as quiet as her dragon lungs would allow. Unlike humans, her voice could rumble the floor at a very low setting.

"You'll have to get use to it eventually. But I suppose, for now..." you said and touched her head, putting a barrier jutsu as a buffer to keep most of the noise out.

"Thanks," She said with a shake of her head. Then she seemed to concentrate on something else. Within a few moments you heard her body groaning and squishing. Then you saw a bulge travel from her body, up her neck, then gently out of her jaws onto the floor. She was careful to keep her teeth away, as was Sarah. It was a few minutes before Sarah was laying on the ground, covered in different juices. "Hold still, let me clean you just a little."

"You just want another taste." Sarah teased but did as Kara requested.

"Hey, no tempting me." She teased back then gave her a tongue bath. Kara was rather talented in that regard. Sure, dragons had more control over thier longer tongues, but Kara had an extra skill level. Perhaps it was from being so close to humans for the time you were away. Either way, she continued as she used her tongue to turn Sarah over and clean the rest of her juices off her that wasn't a very thin layer of saliva. You guessed she was a little concerned about stomach acid, or more paranoid. You all know that there wasn't any in the storage gut of a dragon. But niether you or Sarah were going to rip on Kara for being careful, regardless of how unwarrented the concern may be. When she was done, she backed off a little. Luckily the bare warehouse was probably big enough to house both you and Kara. You were just unsure of everything at the moment. But for the moment it allowed Kara enough room to move... very lightly.

"Eww... dragon drool." Sarah comically whined as she wiped the saliva off. Kara seemed to blush a little, even for her blue scales, which got Sarah to smile as she used a jutsu to clean and dry off. She had won their little teasing match. They both basked in that thought for a while than looked over at you to get started. "So, where are we?"

"I think a modern society, not unlike the other one you found me in." you said as you tapped the concrete with your foot than glanced around. "If I have to guess... I would say that were are in a bare warhouse. Unfortunately, that is all the good news. As evidence to the noise, they are not going to be to use to a dragon. We need to think of something or somewhere we can hide you Kara."

"Can't I just fly to a high spot at night?" she asked.

"No. The modern Technology would find you in seconds. They have... observation machines that they launch into orbit, like the moon. We can't reach them but they can definitely see us. The other humans would see you and come to get you. Even I would lose if they came in ernest and we faught. So we have to find a way to hide you." You answered.

"But where are we?" Asked Sarah, being a little more knowledgeablt about such things than Kara was... but not by much.

"Not sure..." you started as you thought then looked over at them. "I will go check it out. For now, you two stay here. Sarah, try to keep from being seen. Make a genjutsu or something to hide Kara. No matter what happens... stay here, and stay hidden."

"Wait." Sarah said to which you stopped turning and looked at her approaching. She didn't stop until she was hugging you. "We just got you back, and I just got all sappy with making up with you. So you promise me that you will be coming back, VERY soon."

"I promise. I will come back as soon as I can." You said as you held her. You also looked over to Kara and gave her a look she knew well. The look was to take care of Sarah. Even is she didn't need it, she knew that there was more damage that couldn't be seen that needed fixing. Damage that was about you and stuff you couldn't touch or heal. You stayed in Sarah's embrace for a while then looked into her eyes when she started pulling reluctantly away. You held your gaze with her and brushed a stray lock of hair from her face. "Make sure you are here when I get back."

"I will." she said with a nod.

With that, you nodded to Kara and left. It wasn't hard to find the door. You had a lot to do and think about. But first... where are you???
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kara doesn't have to hide or run.

choices: Your genetic knowledge helps you find a way.
You find a way to do it via a jutsu or device.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You found yourself in a warehouse beside an interstate, somewhere in a state called Wisconsin. You looked at a sign that advertised the warehouse you had just left was for sale by owner, as well as the land you were on. That was perfect, what wasn't was that you had no idea where or how to purchase it. You saw a telephone number and headed off in a direction, praying to anyone that could hear, that no one would beat you to it or peak their head in the warehouse. You had confidence in both of them, but they were both out of their element here. You had to act fast.

The process was longer than you liked, but you finally got an 'emergency meeting' with the owner. He offered to show you the property but you just said that you just needed the information on the property line. His eyes almost bugged out when you preseneted him with double what he was asking and all in cash. You were as friendly possible but also put it in his mind that you wold be 'fine' and he was not to contact you or stop by the property ever again. With money clouding his happyniess, he accepted with no strings attached. You wondered how many problems you could fix with such an approach. It was about a day before you returned.

"You're late." Sarah pouted as she released the genjutsu she had on to make both her and Kara invisible to the observer. You could tell her mood was stressed but more stable in the emotions department than when you left.

"Yes well, I was able to buy this building and the land. Now we don't have to worry about people poking their heads in... well at least not officially. I also found out, this world... it is very modern, and very intrusive. We need to be very careful," You answered. Your conversation was halted by a loud rumble from Kara, who shyly recoiled a bit.

"Sorry, haven't eaten in a while. There isn't a chance I could go hunting is there?" she asked.

"Afraid not. They would spot you and come get you very quickly. But... I did take the liberty of getting you both some food. I know it is isn't as fun as hunting, but for now it will have to do," you answered almost appologetically. You then went outside and walked in a full dairy cow. It was so demesticated that it didn't realize the large predator it was sharing the room with. You led it over to Kara then walked over to Sarah with a paper bag from one of the fastfood places you saw. You were amazed at how fast they could come up with such food. But it did smell less enticing to you than what Kara was eating. You gave Kara's foreleg a pat as you passed her so she knew you two were out of the way and she could start.

"I suppose, if you insist," Kara stated then snapped the cow's head and bit down, severing it and began to enjoy her meal. You understood her feeling. Even if she liked the flavor, being fed wasn't the same thing as hunting. An activity that a dragon just loved to do. You and sarah walked a bit then sat on the floor so Kara's meal wouldn't effect Sarah's appetite. She had an interesting time taking the wrapping off the food but soon figured it out and finished her meal. She was rather smart.

"So... what now. We are relatively safe but still are in a place that is very strange to us. Not to mention Kara." Sarah stated after she burned the garbage with a jutsu and Kara cleaned the floor of her mess as well. Currently, you all were in a triagle, thinking and, in the case of Kara, licking the remaining blood off her claws and snout. She did take pride in her appearance.

"What about me?" Kara asked between licking her her snout.

"We mean...." you started, paused, then continued. "... Dragons, according to this realm, don't exist. We are just fiction to them. If even one of them tells the wrong person about any of us, we will be experimented on and locked away. While our personal skill is formidable, we are no match if they tried in ernest. Plus, there are like... a few billion humans in this time and realm. Way to many to avoid. So we have to come up with a way to get you to change to something more presentable. Or at the very least, hide you in a place no one would be able to find."

"I see. Is this realm really that dangerous for us?" she asked, still not really believing it. She was a dragon after all. What creature could cause her to fear, besides you.

"Very dangerous." You confirmed.

"What if we made a jutsu to help her either transform like you or at least be invisible." Sarah asked.

"That might work, but we would have to teach her how to use Chakra as a dragon then again as a human, not to mention all the things she would need to know to act believable. It would be hard, if it is even possible. Not to mention, I am not sure it would be a seemless or painless persuit." You answered and thought outloud.

"Well, you did say that me staying like I am now would be 'very dangerous'. I can deal with a little pain and education. Not like you haven't trained me before." Kara replied.

"True enough. Ok, Sarah, if you could start working with Kara in using Chakra, that would be great. She needs at least an expert level, if this is going to work." You agreed and started to dull out assignments. "Kara, you need to open your mind and do everything she says. She is the smart one in the group. If anyone can figure out how to teach a dragon how to do a jutsu, it is Sarah. We need you to a very high level in a very short amount of time."

"And what will you be doing?" asked Sarah to which Kara also wanted to know.

"Trying to invent a jutsu that will work. I'm not sure it is even possible, but I'll figure out something. That and I need to bring you all some food and other things." You answered while still half thinking.

"You really think it is possible? Making me into a human, or at least a human form?" Kara asked, very concerned about loosing her dragon half more than gaining a human one.

"Please... remember who you are talking to." you said as you comically waved a sprouted wing at her then retracted it. "I'll find a way, you two just make sure you are ready when I do."

And off to work you all went. You began recalling everything you could. You knew she couldn't be a half-breed like you. But gaining an ability to change into something else was vaguely possible. You knew it somehow. You just couldn't put your finger on it.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Heroes (The TV Series).

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were going nuts with trying to figure out a jutsu that would work. The closest one was an advanced form of a transformation jutsu. However, it would only last while the person had the Chakra to do so... and it burned up chakra very fast. You needed to find a permanent solution that could keep her in dragon form but not be vulnerable, like you.

"Max, you said you had a way to make me human?" Kara asked in a skeptical voice. She knew how hard you were working, and that you were not getting anywhere, as evidence to a few mental outbursts on your part.

"Yes. My genetic knowledge gave me something." you answered with a sigh of relief.

"I thought you were going to make a jutsu for it. Was all that training for nothing?" asked Sarah.

"No. Even if she becomes a human with SOME dragon abilities, she will still be very vulnerable in this age. She needs to be ready and have a head start on understanding a human's movements. The way it is, we'll have to teach her how to walk and all that. Dragon behavior will also be a challenge to cover. Take it from me, supressing dragon instincts and habits is not easy," You answered.

"Very well, enough with the waiting, what did you find?" Kara asked.

"I can make you like me... a little. It will be more restricted, but still, you will have the ability to turn human and dragon at will. However it won't be exactly the same." You started and paused to figure out a way to explain what only came to you as a feeling.

"What will be different?" Asked Kara.

"Well, you wont be able to grow dragon pieces like I do. At most, you will have your original eyes and be able to transfer back and forth with them, like the Dragon Eye jutsu I made. But most of your dragon things, like a tail, fire breathing, wings, and scales will be gone while in human form. Upside is that you keep your strength, speed, perception, and anything you don't need dragon organs for. Also, it wont hurt to transform, like it does for me. However, it requires you to have energy to maintain. It doesn't use any but if your energy meter goes below a certain point, than you will return to your dragon form, with you want to or not." You explained. With each point you could see their moods change.

"Anything else we should know?" Sarah asked.

"Well, it is about her human side. Until she learns something to bring clothes with her, she will not retain anything when she changes. If she has anything on when she goes to dragon form... well I think you get the point. I think I'll leave the whole girl preperation thing for you to explain." you added, to which she nodded in understanding.

"You mean I have to where those human coverings?" Kara asked in almost confusion. Like most dragons, including you in the beginning, she didn't understand why such things were needed.

"I'll explain later." Sarah snapped, in a tone Kara flinched at. "Ok, time to make this happen. Max, do your thing."

"Ok. Kara, my knowledge didn't say if this would hurt or not so... sorry if it does." You stated. She flexed in preperation, digging her claws into the cement below her. You breathed deep a few times before starting. "Here goes nothing."

With that you took a final breath and, upon your exhale, breathed out some red some. Kara seemed to understand that it was the same type of change that gave Sarah the Dragon Eyes. So she let the smoke envelope her as well as allow herself to breathe it in.

"It's burning!" she almsot snarled out but stayed where she was.

At that point, she started growling and snarling, not unlike when you changed. As if you understood her change had finalized, you stopped and breathed in the remaining smoke yourself to clear the area. What you saw, in a smoking heep on the floor, was a human body with... figures, light blue hair that matched her normal scales. But for the moment you both rushed over to her, you with a blanket of sorts to cover her modesty.

You only needed a minute and a first glance to take her new form in before you covered it up with Sarah's help to get her lifted and into the blanket. She was fit, like Sarah, but thinner. You figured it made sense. Her type of dragon was thinner physically, which made them bullets in the air. Her human body followed the same 'streamlined' description that her dragon one did. Also like her dragon body, her body was flawless and completely symetrical. Her skin, body type, and face looked highly Japanese but not quite. Here blue hair seamed and looked so smooth that it reminded you of one of those anime images with the 'silky long and straight hair' that reached her low back. She opened her eyes for a moment the closed them. You saw them go from an almost too bright blue dragon eyes she normally had, to a more human tone blue human looking eye.

"Come one Max, let's get her on the bed. I think she should wake up somewhere else besides a cold concrete floor." Sarah suggested. You nodded to which you picked up her limp and unconcious body, all wrapped up in the blanket you provided, and brought her over to the bed. It was some time of waiting, in the small human seating lobby, before you both heard her stir to get up.

"Uh... whoa, whoa! WOW!" You heard a very tender and young voice say then heard a smack as she fell out of the bed.

"Oh Jeepers..." Said Sarah as you both turned to see her trying to get up, but only managing a partway sitting position on the floor. Her hair spralled in front of her but not enough to completely obscure the view of her naked body that had falled out of the blanket provided.

"Having a little trouble there Kara?" you asked comically, to which she swished her hair out of her face with a whip of her head to glare at you. But the look was unpracticed in this form, so it looked very comical. So comical that Sarah almost forgot the whole girl completley naked thing that she had to coach her on.

"Oh ha ha ha... I suppose you think this is completely halarious." Kara said with a cute frustration.

"Well yeah. Not easy without a tail is it." You asked rhetorically.

"How do you humans do it?" she asked as she tried to prove herself more capable than how she just presented herself. She got on all fours than pushed herself so she was on her hands and feet, her butt sticking in the air. But when she tried to push herself to just her feet, she royally failed and flipped over completely. Her inhuman strength was to blame for that one. She tried it again, slower, but her wobbly and unpracticed leggs made her fall yet again. "Will one of you please get over here?"

"Fine, grumpy" You stated as you got up but was shoved back by Sarah.

"Not so fast mister. No touching the naked girl for you. Now if you don't mind... Put her in some clothes." She stated to which you and Kara, the two in the room that would argue with such logic, gulped. Sarah was in one of her moods again. She could really be a strict one when it came to female and male interaction. She once stuck you with a spear for looking at her while she changed. You were just asking if she needed help, but you got the message, it was the first time that you understood this obsession humans had with modesty, and clothing. You didn't waste any time and materalized a light set of clothes for her. It was only a pair of shorts, underwear, and a tube top. But it was good enough for Sarah to allow you to go help her. She knew that, with Kara's strength, she would just crush her if SHE tried to help her in this state.

"Why do human's wear these things again?" Kara asked quietly in your ear as you helped her to her feet giving her a chance to at least partially walk.

"To tell you the truth, I've never understood. Just accept that it is what they do and try to fit in." you advised.

"Right, Sarah can be a scary human when she wants to be." Kara said before you were in hearing range.

"Indeed." You agreed.

"This is so wierd." Kara said, as you sat her down on the open chair. She gripped the arms to steady herself and balance. "So, is that what it feels like when you change?"

"I don't know, what did it feel like for you?" you asked as you sat back in your chair.

"Like my body was ripping apart and suppressing into nothing. Like someone was crushing me between two rocks and my body was forced to get smaller to stay alive." she summerized.

"Yeah, pretty much the same. You shouldn't have that problem, if my genetic knowledge was right." you answered.

"So how do you feel now?" Sarah asked Kara, excited to hear what her old friend was feeling like as a human, a fellow human at this point.

"I feel... wobbly, lengthy, awkward, vulnerable, and cold. Really? No scales or extra layers to help with the temperatures? I don't even have my fire lung to help with heating myself from the inside. Not to mention this sight. I much prefer this." She stated then changed her eyes to her dragon ones. Unlike yours, or the verson you gave to Sarah, hers glowed a slitted blue. They were little replicas of her normal dragon eyes. "And no tail. How do human manage to transport themselves on these scrawny things you call legs with no tail?"

"We manage." Sarah said with a smile.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Your genetic knowledge helps you find a way.

choices: You intervene and reveal yourself to them, at least partially.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"This is never going to work." Kara complained as she pouted about the situation you all fell into.

After she got a human form, she mastered human things slowly at first. But once she hit her stride, she picked it up faster than you did. The real challenge was getting her to be a skilled ninja like both you and Sarah were. She would often get frustrated and use some of her Dragon enhanced abilities to make up for her lack of progress. But that was before. In lue of such outbursts and training, you created a bunker deep under the Wisconsin warhouse you all had. The only way in was by having you teleport them with a jutsu. On the surface, you tore down the warehouse and estabilished a super dense forest that could hide even you if need be, in your dragon form. You weren't willing to try it yet but either way, it was just a secret place to hide out at if need be.

That wasn't the reason for this latest change. You had all moved to California after the first winter. Kara liked the warm weather without her dragon body. But both you and Kara looked like teenagers. Apparently, 'kids your age' needed to be in school. So you both enrolled in school. Your cover was that Sarah was you older SIster to which your parents had died in a plane crash. A tragic story that would keep others from prying. You had arranged a measure of proof and new identities. Your 'parents' had left you three with enough money to last years and finish your education. So Sarah would stay home and maintain things while the two of you went to school. However she needed to learn just as much as you and Kara. The world was still strange to all of you. It seemed strange but had one perk, no supernatural predators to worry about. No dragons, no ninja, no sea kings. It would, hopefully, be an easy way to live.

However, what Kara didn't like was being forced to live as a normal human. She still had too many instincts to control to play the gentle new girl. But with an appearnce like her's, you doubted she would have too much trouble with NOT being noticed. She already had knocked a few guy's teeth in for grabbing her butt one day. You had... convinced the police to let it go. They're minds were relatively easy to enter and alter. They had no experience defending against foriegn invaders like the three of you had. But back on point, Kara was still learning how to be a human. The only luck she had was that you would be with her all the time and that no one suspected the secret, because... no one thought anything like either of you existed. So there the two of you were. Two dragons, about to enter Junior year at a High School that had thousands of kids running around.

"You'll be fine." You comforted.

"Really? Look at all these snacks." She grumbled.

"Kara..." you warned.

"I know, I know. I didn't mean anything by it. I just... If we were dragons, they wouldn't dare oppose us. But these... humans are just so arrogant. I don't believe I actually prefer Dragon Slayers." She huffed.

"Nice hair hot stuff!" yelled a young man probably in your grade, obviously saying it to Kara.

"If one more of them..." she started to which you cut her off by starting to walk toward the school. "Hey, wait up."

You both walked down the halls and eventually landed in your first class. You could tell it would be a long and boring day. Unlike the ecentric dragon you brought with, you actually had been in and conquered high school before. Sure some of the classes and subjects had different twists, but they were pretty much the same. Nothing really interested you that much until a blonde girl came into one of your classes. You and Kara were sitting at the same table of course but you looked over at her a few times.

"You see something you like?" Kara teased to which you looked at her as if to ask her to explain. She knew you never really was 'interested' in human girls. Even when she teased you with her new, apparently very attractive, body did you show hardly any interest. "That is the 10th time you've look over there."

"That girl and the boy don't smell strange to you?" you asked. You both took a secret whiff of the air from her direction.

"Now that you mention it... She does smell a little different than most humans, so does the guy I guess. What are you thinking?" She asked.

"Well, usually, there is one thing unique to each realm. Like the dragons in our, or the ninja in the last one. I've been keeping an eye out for this one's unique trait. Maybe it's nothing." You answered.

"Or maybe it's everything. When has a dragon nose ever been wrong?" She asked.

"Well there was that one time Sarah..." you started but she elbowed you to which you laughed at her.

"That wasn't fair. She used a genjutsu to make me eat that." She defended. Sarah had switched a burger with a rotten onion for her dinner one time. "Ok, wise ass, I'll ammend my statement. When has a dragon nose ever been wrong, excluding evil sister witches with ninja skills?"

"Alright, we'll watch her for a while. May give me something to do. But you still need to pay attention to the class. If you get an 'F' than you have to deal with Sarah. You're on your own for that." You warned and joked. She immediately straightened up to attention but smirked as you mirrored her. You both knew that Sarah was by far the scariest person to piss off, dragon or human. But you now had a new activity, watching this new girl, while you gave the boy's activity watching to Kara. It would keep your vastly superior attention spans busy during the long school days and what not. Besides, you were both going through withdrawl from the lack of physical contact and challenges.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A year passes.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It wasn't hard to find out why those two smelled different. Within the day, Kara observed the boy flying, and it didn't take you long to see a few injuries heal in Claire or smell blood from a wound that wasn't there anymore. Your family discussed this as well as the possibility of super powered individuals being this realms 'unique trait'. You all kept an eye out but all decided that the 'Butler' family should be approached. However, they seemed to be in hiding, like the 3 of you were, more or less. So you all picked a day when they were all in and a weekend to further ensure they would have time to tell their end and you three would be able to likewise tell them. So, here you three were, in front of the Butler home, awaiting the door to open from your knock.

"Hello, can I help you?" Asked an older woman with an annoyingly small dog. You had trouble keeping away thoughts that she was holding a candy sized snack, but managed to look past it. However, the dog seemed to pick up your and Kara's scent, at least partially. It wasn't sure what was going on but jumped away from the woman to get away from you two at least, barking all the while.

"Pardon the intrusion Ma'am. I go to school with your daughter. I was wondering if we could have a moment of your family's time?" You asked as politely as possible. Both you and Kara guided her mind to assume something nice rather than the slight panic she was otherwise headed toward. You all sealed it with pleasant smiles.

"Sure, by all means, come on in." She welcomed as she ushered you three into the house.

'Nice speach,' Kara thought to you to which you and Sarah just grinned. Kara was still having a hard time acting human. That, and she now understood what you meant when you said that your wings get cramped in dragon form. She was acheing to fly, but knew it would be a while.

You all were led to a family room of sorts then left there, you asumed so she could go get the rest of the family. You three sat on the same couch. You figured it would be safer that way. You were in the middle, with Sarah to your right and Kara to your left. You all waited patiently for them to come in, trying not to listen in as they talked just out of the room.

"Wow." Said a younger male voice as they came into the room to which you three stood in respect. He was of course referring to the two female members of your group. To humans, they were VERY attractive and 'hot'. Sometimes Kara would bath herself in fire, when in private, and say something like "Now I really am hot". Either way, the boy was getting a little red in the face.

"Hi Max, and Kara." Claire greeted, as she knew you two from school, a little bit at least. She more knew Kara for knocking out some of the more... intrusive cheerleader members when they came to rip on her. All the girls in that type of crows, since then, gave Kara a very wide birth. Claire on the other hand thought it was awesome. But her constant need to keep her identity a secret prevented her from vocalizing it.

"Hey Claire!" Kara greeted warmly as she could. A well practiced form that she was working on.

"Thankyou for seeing us like this," you greeted as well that ended in a hand shake with Mr. Butler and a smile to Claire.

"Yes, well, we are always glad to hear from friends Claire has made." He responded, giving Claire a look at the end of his statement. "Please, have a seat. Then you can tell us what brings you here."

You all sat down, your group back on the couch, and the others in seats around the room. Claire seemed to have a seat of egg shells. There was an uncomfortable silence in the room for a while. Neither side wanted to go first or confirm anythiing without the other doing so. In that regard, you nudged Sarah to start. She did look the oldest of your group.

"Well, we are here to talk to you about Claire." She started, to which they all stiffened. She waited a moment to let their imaginations work then added, "... and us."

"What about you three?" asked Mr. Butler. He was smarter than he looked. Rather than scramble to secure their own secret, he turned it around on you three.

"We... are different. But more different than anything you've ever seen." You started. You weren't really sure how to tell them. "We've observed Claire and saw her... injuries, or lack there of. We've noticed your family looks to walk on egg shells for some reason. We've also noticed other tell tale signs that your family are not what they appear to be. It took us a while to determine that you all were on the good side of that equation. We don't think its fair that we know about Claire and you don't know anything about us. Especially if we are in such close proximity. That, and we need help."

"What kind of help?" asked Claire, probably sooner than she should've. As evidence of this, her father looked her way to cut her off.

"We are having touble... adjusting to this 'normal life'. It isn't exactly the same with us, but we figured your family could help us out a little." Kara stated.

"What are you talking about?" Mr. Butler asked, trying to get more information before giving anything that could endanger them. You admired the concept of his protection but wouldn't be able to do anything worth gawking at while in their house.

"It might be easier to just show you." You stated as you held out your hand to them. Kara and Sarah made sure they were in contact with you for this. It took a while but, with Mr. Butler's nod, they all met your hand in the middle. As soon as they did you teleported them to the Wisconsin Bunker. They had to catch themselves then retracted to see the incredibly large structure around them. It was large enough for you to do VERY tight flying circles. Basically it was a place, other than the obvious reasons of a bunker, to stretch out your and Kara's wings. Along with training. Couldn't really practice any high level jutsu anywhere near anything that could observe you all.

"What did you do?!" Mr. Butler demanded as soon as he confirmed his family was safe.

"Hey, you asked." You responded comically then continued before any emotions could get heated. "Relax, we didn't want our conversation being overheard by anyone or anything. That and, what makes us different, can't be shown in the small confines of a house. So I teleported you all to a very large bunker. No one knows it is here except us."

"Do you expect us to trust you?" He almost spat back.

"Unless you can find a door, yes." you answered to which they looked around and noticed there were none. It was just a HUGE room. "Really, you can leave any time you want. If you can. But if you want me to help, then by default you have to at least trust me to do that. We didn't open up to you so we could kill or harm you."

"Fine. You're going first then." Claire replied, not entirely venomous but not nice either.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You approach their family first.

choices: They want you all to stay away from them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"We wouldn't bring you all here if we just wanted to see Claire cut herself. We know all about her... well as much as we can know by watching her for a little bit. We came here to show YOU what WE could do and what we are." Sarah answered her. They all looked at her with a doubtful glance. She then gave Kara a nod to which Kara turned and walked to an open spot. She didn't need that much room compared to you, but Sarah thought that the Butlers/ Bennets would need a little distance at first. "We would normally ask you not to overreact but it isn't like you can go anywhere so... just give us a chance, like we have for you. We will not harm you."

With that said, Kara turned to face you all again then started to glow. Her way of transforming was infinitely more preferable than yours. She started to glow a bright white and blue. Then smoke came from her, like the stuff that comes off of ice when it hits the warm air. Not enough to impede sight but enough to be seen. The source of the light became larger as she changed. It didn't allow people to see anything other than the bright light until she was done. She could do this in the span of a few seconds if she wanted to, but was taking it slow for their sakes. When the light began backing down it revealed hear beautiful dragon form, glimering in the extra light. She was definitely more majestic than you were, and beautiful in the full sense of the word. It was why she was going first. You were hoping you wouldn't have to change at all. One dragon was enough. Yours would no doubt scare the crap out of them.

"Wh... what is that?" Asked Lyle, Clairs brother.

"It's 'who's that?' mister." Kara corrected as she flexed her wings and tail before coming over and lying down in a presentable position. "My name only has 4 letters. Is it really that hard to remember for you humans?"

"She's a dragon!" Claire exclaimed.

"Well, good to see your eyesight is as keen as ever. Perhaps you would like to point out my blue color next." Kara teased.

"Kara..." Sarah warned as she gave her foreleg a good whack. "... be nice."

"Fine, let the curious humans have their questions." Kara relented.

"Mr. Bennet, that really isn't going to help." You said as you saw him holding and pointing a gun. "Even if you got a lucky shot, do you really think a bullet of that size could stop a dragon?"

"What did you call me?" he asked, as he switched his target to you.

"Dragons can read and enter minds. Helps with talking and understanding other sapient species. It also helps if our flapping jaws are making others nervous. So naturally we know your actual name." You answered then narrowed your eyes on him. "But back on the gun topic. The only person a gun would work on between us three is Sarah. However she is the last one you want to use it on. She's the ONLY human that both Kara and I are scared of. Try to shoot us and we'll brush it off. Try to shoot her, and she'll kick your ass."

"I suppose you're right." he replied then holstered his gun. "That makes you a dragon as well?"

"Indeed, but different type that Kara. Honestly, I don't really want to show you that form of me. It... well it is not anywhere near Kara's beauty. I would rather leave a good sight to establish us by. I can show you something she can't do though. I can grow parts of my dragon side." You answered and presented your wings and tail, along with your eyes, as did Sarah. They oggled at the new developments for a while, then continued.

"Are you a dragon as well?" Mrs. Bennet asked Sarah for the rest, because of her now showing eyes.

"No. Max was nice enough to give me the ability to see through a dragon's eyes. No, I... actually all of us, are also ninja. We can do many things that normal humans can't even dream of doing. I got enough power to hold my own against Kara in a straight fight. Max on the other hand... I am just glad he is on my side." Sarah answered as she stroked the edge of one of your wings.

"That can't be possible." Mr. Bennet stated.

"The dragon part or the ninja part?" You asked.

"All of it!" he exclaimed.

"Well there is two dragons and a teleportation to our count that says that it is possible. Do you have ANY proof to the contrary? Really, for someone who has a daughter that can grow back limbs would be able to accept things he hasn't seen before." Sarah replied back.

"What is it you want from us?" Mr. Bennet asked.

"Just what we said, some help. As dragons, and people, from... let's just say a very far off place, we try hard to fit in and live in secret. But supressing dragon instinct and helping the right people at times can be a challenge. So, we were hoping you could help us. At the very least, we can talk to people about things we don't understand." You explained.

"So... you need help adjusting?" Claire asked, glancing at Kara before going back to you.

"You can't imagine how hard it is to pass off as a human." Kara answered. "All your little things that you all do and don't do. It is hard not to roast someone that slaps my butt going down the street. Sometimes I lose it a little, like that instance with the other cheerleaders."

"But that was awesome." Claire defended to which Kara hummed a content hum with a friendly smirk, keeping her teeth hidden.

"Glad you liked it. But we had to work overtime to... convince the police and school board that Kara wasn't at fault. As warranted as it may have been, it was far too high profile a move to do. Kara still has a ways to go as far as her human actions are concerned." You said back, to which Kara turned her head away for a moment. "In the end, we have a lot to learn and could use the help."

"What's the catch?" asked Mr. Bennet.

"No catch, unless you count babysitting a couple of dragons a catch, in a manner of speaking. On the positive side, you have a few ninja and dragons to help if you need it." You responded back, in a tone that was a little embarassed. Your tail twitched along with your wings as you waited for them to respond.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Tell them everything right away.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"What if we say no?" Mr. Bennet asked.

"Well, I suppose I'll teleport you all back and leave you alone. If I've observed one thing about your family it is that you all know the value of our secrecy from personal experience of some kind." You answered simply as you could, retracting your dragon parts to help them become less distracted. "Kara."

"Awe, not already." she whined. "I just got changed. You have to at least let me do a few laps of flying before I have to be all cramped in human form again."

"Very well. Take your laps, but keep an ear open. We'll be leaving soon." You relented. She happily nuzzled you a little then took off to do some laps around the room. At the farthest point of the room she roared happily as she twirled and dove to her delight.

"She really is beautiful." Claire observed. You knew Kara could still hear you, but it wasn't worth saying at this point. Kara deserved some praise.

"She's happiest when she is flying with someone. Sadly, she hasn't been able to fly as much in general lately." You stated as you all watched her.

"She looks good as a human too." Lyle stated, that got him a few looks.

"I'm sure she would appreciate the compliment, Lyle." Sarah praised, which got him to blush and go silent.

"Ok Max." Mr. Bennet said suddenly, after a short round of just watching Kara soar around the room. Perhaps the whole situation was becoming clear to him, or he could've seen that you all cared for each other like he does with his family. Either way, he had come to a decision. "We'll help your family out."

"You will?" you asked.

"I suppose having you on our side would be a good thing. At the very least, you can keep Claire safer than what I can do by myself." He replied back.

"I suppose we can do that. Not like she will be a pain to deal with." Sarah answered.

"One thing, who's in charge between all of you?" Asked Mrs. Bennet, finally catching her voice in this conversation.

"I suppose I am." You said simply but then had to give some credit to Sarah, so you continued. "But Sarah is the smart one. She usually makes all the decisions. But if it came down to it, I would be the one with the final word."

"Isn't she older than you?" Claire asked, confused.

"Actually, I am the oldest, but only by about a year. We all are near 23 years old. Dragons just age slower than humans in appearance. That and we can live for a few thousand years if we aren't killed by an outside force. Our human forms follow that same rule." You answered.

"Right, dragons." She said, then leaned on her husband for support.

"So what do you look like?" Claire asked you. It was her best shot at asking a good question and breaking the silence while her father comforted her mother.

"My dragon form?" You asked.

"Yeah. Are you as big and beautiful as Kara?" Claire asked in return.

"Actually, I am a few times larger. But my dragon form is a little bit..." You started but didn't really know how to describe it.

"He's awesome." Sarah butted in. She nudged you a little as she joined the conversation. "But he is a huge black dragon with red eyes and REALLY big teeth. It isn't a secret why he doesn't want to show you. It isn't something that is peaceful or 'beautiful' like Kara. But once you get past his size and scary ass looks, he is a big teddy bear."

"Not true." You stated to which they looked at you. "Teddy bear? I got no fur."

"Ok smarty, how does a giant reptile plush toy sound?" she teased back.

"I guess I'll stick with the Teddy Bear reference." you joked back. Hoping that the intereaction between you two woule lighting things up around the group. You then looked at Lyle as he had his eyes still glued to Kara. "You don't want to ride her, do you?"

"What?" He almost coughed in suprise.

"Its been a while since anyone rode with her. If you want to, I'm sure she would love it. Although, she might show off a little. Its been a while since she's had a crowd or anyone new to impress." You said back.

"Wait a minute, is that even safe?" asked Mrs. Bennet, recovering from her mind overload.

"Sure, as long as he doesn't jump off or anything. Kara is an expert at flying." Sarah responded.

"Why don't I try first?" Claire offered but continued her point before her Father could say anything. "If I come back in one peace than we know how safe it is. If not, then I don't die... again."

"Alright. But only if you can convince her to take you." Mr. Bennet receded.

"Can I ride her?" Claire asked the two of you.

"She isn't a pet. You have to ask her." Sarah informed as she pointed for her to ask Kara instead of the two of you.

"HEY KARA, CAN I TALK TO YOU PLEASE?" Claire yelled. She recieved a roar as a response then saw her aproach. She backed up as Kara landed then approached the approaching dragon. "Um... I was... I was wondering if I c-could, um..."

"Well spit it out already." Kara stated. You could tell she was in a good mood from hearing all that praise of her.

"I was wondering... If Lyle and I, could go flying with you... on you... like riding you... please?" Claire asked to which Kara smiled at her nervousness, but even more than that was that someone new wanted to ride her.

"Of course you can!!!" Kara answered and gave her a lick. That made Claire fall back a few feet with suprise, not to mention a slightly wet frontside, wet with a barely noticable amount of dragon drool. "Oh, sorry. I forgot you humans don't do the whole kissing affection thing, or tongue baths."

"What was that?" Mr. Bennet demanded of you, not wanting to ruin a good moment for his daughter if it was just a communication error.

"We dragons are kind of like a dog/cat hybrid when it comes to human loyalty and affection... well when we value humans as company anyway." You started to explain. "Anyway, Kara just got her human form and, like I said before, lacks her human understanding. It wasn't a bad thing in any way. She was just thankful and excited."

"Am I taking you both at the same time?" Kara asked.

"No offense Kara, but my family just wants to make sure it is safe. Then, provided that it is, Kyle would like to ride you." Claire stated then peckoned for Kara to come closer to which she did. You didn't know how Claire was dealing with the normal fear that most humans had of being that close to a dragon's jaws, but she was handling it very well. Claire then proceeded to whisper something to Kara, that of course you could hear. "I think he has a crush on you."

"I though so, but I wasn't sure about human behaviors yet." Kara said back. "Well get on already."

"Uh, how?" Claire asked.

"Just climb up." Kara instructed, moving into a more obvious position so she could see what to do. It took Claire a few tries but she eventually got up and into the place at the base of Kara's neck. It was a good thing that you taught Kara how to make a saddle jutsu. Otherwise Claires legs would be shredded by Kara's scales. With that done and her holding onto Kara's neck spike, she turned and took off. It started with screams, and before her father could ask a concerned question she started laughing and screaming like she was on an insane roller coaster. Kara was really good at flying and knew, even better than you, what felt good to a rider. This anxious day was turning out good after all.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They will help.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"You know, I'm going through whiplash with all these change in moods. First you all need me, then you don't. Hide, then come out. You all really need to make up your minds." You scolded as Claire asked for your help.

You were a little cross when Mr. Bennet died and they didn't ask for your help. However, you felt he was still alive, so you didn't worry too much about it. The part that really got to you was the protective hiding they were doing with your group. In the end, they didn't want your family to be on anyone's radar.

"Come on, we can't let the company or anyone like them get their hands on you." Claire defended.

"And if they do? What in the world could they do? Seriously, you humans aren't THAT stupid as to openly threaten a dragon." You stated. You were alone with Claire at the moment. So much had happened since telling them that you all thought it was best to keep seperate unless needed and at least one dragon with Sarah at all times. Not that you doubted Sarah, but there was just something about being watched over by a dragon that made her feel a little safer, and you less worried.

"What about Sylar?" she asked.

"What, that guy that cuts open heads and gains abilities?" You asked.

"Yes, and if he gets the ability to turn into a dragon..." She started.

"Hold on." you interupted. "Is that really what you all are worried about? Being a dragon is not an ability. It is what I am. Would Sylar be able to turn into a dog if he cut its head open?"

"I suppose not. But what about the people that take away abilities?" she asked, thinking of another threat to your family.

"Chakra is a physical ability, not like the one you have. Our ninja skills will always remain. The only ability they COULD take away is my and Kara's ability to turn human. And if they take that away... well then they will be having a really bad day. I can be a little... annoyed when forced to change like that. I might even change my ruling on eating the people that do such a thing." You stated back.

"Yeah, I guess that would backfire pretty bad." She agreed then thought for a little bit. "What about time traveling?"

"That one would be a pain." You agreed. "But if things got too bad, I could always wait a few thousand years to eat the idiot."

"You being a dragon, just isn't fair you know." She teased then pushed you a little.

"Yeah, like I'm going to appologize for that." you answered back with a smirk. But your smirk turned to a concentrated face.

"What? What is it?" Claire asked.

"I know I haven't met a lot of your super powered friends but... are you expecting anyone?" You asked as you sniffed the air.

"No, who is it?" she asked.

"Don't know, never smelled this scent before. All I can tell you is that it is a person with an ability. People like that smell a tad different than normal humans.

"We do?" she asked.

"Just a little. Kind of like the difference between white and black people. Still human, just a 'tad' different. Not something that anything less than a dragon nose can pick up." You answered back, then snapped your attention to the direction of the person. "The person is in the house."

Who is it?
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A bit later...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Claire and you waited in the family room while the person moved through the house. You both got bord waiting so you started talking about random things, like school stuff and past experiences that were not emotionally draining to talk about.

"I can't imagine Sarah being that young and clueless." Claire stated. She had only seen Sarah as a calm SIster to you and Kara. Sure she was nice, smart, and hot, but never young and clueless like you were implying.

"Yep. She was all innocent back then. Still a smart ass but..." You stopped it there at the presence of the person finally coming into the room. Claire seemed to shoot up with fright. The chairs you two were sitting in were pointing toward the rest of the house. You wanted to have enough room to fight a little, if necessary. You remained seated, relaxed, as you felt nothing too dangerous from him. "Friend of yours?"

"Not exactly." The man stated for Claire.

"Then I suggest you tred carefully, boy." you said, glareing for a moment then looked to Claire. "So, who is he?"

"Max, that's Sylar." Claire stated, not taking her eyes off him.

"You don't say. Well, isn't this interesting. They say you are a monster, that hunts other people like prey." You said, looking over at him again but still not getting up. "I find that desciption comical. To think you are the highest predator alive is very arrogant of you."

"I don't think we've been introduced." Sylar stated as he looked at you as if trying to figure you out.

"My appologies. You're right, I didn't introduce myself." You said as you got up. "My name is Max."

"If you know about me, then you know why I am here." Sylar stated, as he looked at Claire than back at you. "But it seams I get one more for my trouble."

" 'One more', what do you mean by that?" You asked, cocking your head to the side as if confused.

"He's here to get our abilities, to kill us." Claire informed.

"Is he now? Claire, I already told you. No one can do what I can do. As for stuff like this..." you said then held out a hand and started cycling different styles of jutsu until you ended on a small verson of a fire dragon jutsu. "... it is not something that can be taken. Takes a lot of training to get this good. As for you, aren't you like the only person that can survive his little head examination? You really think he can kill us, or me in particular?"

"Right.... nevermind." Claire said, being snapped out of her fear.

"You think you can stop me?" Sylar asked in an almost vindictive voice. He obviously got a kick out of scaring people before he killed them.

"You could try attacking if you want. I am not about to tip my hand to you. I am not one to start a fight. But if you threaten or harm those I care about... then I'll retaliate." You answered in a strangely calm voice.

"Why don't you just kill him. He's killed dozens of people." Claire almost begged of you.

"And I've killed hundreds. People's intentions are hard to judge from a distance. I can't control what he will do, but I can control how I will respond. I won't kill someone simply because someone says he deserves to die. If I thought like that, there would be a lot of dead people around here." You scolded, to which she looked down in almost guilt.

"Sorry." Claire responded.

"You really think I am scared of you?" Sylar asked.

"Not right now. If I wanted to scare you, then you would be running from the house with soiled pants. But I tire of this. My Sister is waiting for me and Claire. I am sure that her wrath is far more harmful than yours. So make a move dumbass." You said rather bluntly.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Sylar, come for Claire.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"You've bitten off more than you can chew." Sylar said with a smirk. Then, with a flick of his wrist, flung both you and Claire against the wall.

"I told you." Claire said to you.

"And I told you that he couldn't do anything." You said back, not even thinking this as anything more than an annoyance.

"We'll see about that." Sylar stated then threw some knives at each of your limbs to hold you both still. However, this was more than forseen. You put a barrier on Claire before he got there, and your skin... well, if a bullet couldn't breach it, than how much less would a dull knife. Not to mention you grew a layer of scales underneath your skin. The projectiles broke to pieces as they tried to impale either of your limbs. "What is this?"

"Don't stop now. Go ahead, I'm sure you'll get us eventually." you urged sarcastically. Claire seemed to understand a little more and smiled a little.

"Is this your power? I'd like to see how that works." He stated then approached you. He pointed his finger with his smirk back on. But that too fanished as his little slicing off head trick was rendered useless against your scales and barriers. "I'll figure this out later. For now, I'll get what I came for." He then went over to Claire but didn't get past your barriers any more than he did with you.

"Oh, giving up already? I'm sure if you work at it hard enough, you would be able to cut us somewhere. It would take you about a hundred years, but that is nothing for an ageless guy like you... Oh yeah, you don't have that ability yet. Guess you don't have that long then. But we do, go ahead, take your time." You teased. Sylar would've sealed your mouth if he could. But you weren't about to forgo the pleasure of openly messing with him.

"I don't understand." Sylar said, but not letting either of you go.

"Max!" called an aggitated voice that you and Claire knew as Sarah's. Both of you cringed with a little fear. It wasn't long before Sarah and Kara came in. "What the hell are you doing?"

"Just hagging around. Oh, this is that Sylar guy." You said, introducing them to him. "He is trying to figure out a way to get our abilities. It is a comical exercise to say the least."

"So HE is why you are late?" She asked, glareing at Sylar, to which he backed to a position that he was still holding you and Claire but facing the two that just came in.

"If you don't want anything to happen to them than..." Sylar started but was thrown by a Shadow stitch jutsu from Sarah. You and Claire were let go and dropped to your feet. Sylar didn't have much time to recover as Sarah grabbed him by the leg and threw him into another wall, using a jutsu so he just hit it with a 'THUD' rather than smashing through it.

"You just ruined an entire evening of peace and relaxation. Claire, please let him take your ability." Sarah boomed then requested more calmly from Claire.

"What!?" She asked. Sylar looked shocked as well.

"I want to punish him properly. But he would die after a few seconds. Unless, he could heal. After that, I can pummel him to oblivion and lock him in a genjutsu for a hundred years if I want." Sarah explained. Claire seemed to think about it. It wasn't like she would die, as you had previously pointed out.

"Claire, you know I don't want you to be harmed. But in this case I agree with Sarah. I personally guarantee that you will be alive at the end of this. If he tries to kill you, I'll force feed him his own spleen." You assured as, the last part you said in a serious tone to Sylar, as he got up from his impact against the wall.

"Fine..." Claire agreed. It wasn't clear if she did it because she didn't want to risk Sarah's mood or if she like the idea of the three of your family pummeling Sylar for the fun of it, and not ending at the normal death state. Perhaps it was a little bit of both. She then walke nervously over to Sylar than say in a chair. "Just get it over with already."

"You are just giving me this?" he asked, confused.

"No, we are going to punish you afterward." Kara explained. "This will just allow us to take it further. So if you know what is good for you, you will make this a pleasant as possible for Claire. We like her, but already want to rip your arms off." She finished with her practiced smile on. As odd as it seemed, Claire smiled at this sight.

It was clear that Sylar didn't know what entirely was going on. But he did know that he was getting what he originally came for. So he started. You all flexed to hold yourselves back as Claire screamed in pain. But, either out of fear or sadistic equallity, he took what he wanted and put her head back together. He watched a cut on his hand heal then looked toward the three of you standing in his way. He charged up, what looked like a fire attack, and let loose on the three of you. But you simply sucked it in like air, then breathed out some smoke at its conclusion.

"That was foolish." You informed as Kara breathed in and let her own jet of blue flames out, covering him in the blue inferno. You had a hard time keeping the wards you placed to protect the house and Claire. But Claire was well enough to get out of the way and stand next to you. Upon Kara's completed exhale, Sylar stood there burned to the bone and in pain, as his remaining skin was aflame. But his body just healed and didn't end his agony.

"Now that was a proper flame attack, and I was holding back." Kara said with some pride.

"Right, my turn." Sarah stated then, in a flash, appeared before Sylar, reached into his revealed organs, and started reducing each of them to mush with her hand while the other held his throat so he couldn't stop her. She then started severing nerves until his skin and other parts grew back. He was in agony, begging her to stop by the time he was completely healed again. She then stopped after a few kidney jabs, but brought his face to hers, so she could speak more... intimately. "Now, I trust we don't need to have this conversation again. Agreed?"

"Ah! yes! What the hell are...?" He started but was cut off by her letting go but bringing her knee up to meet his gut. He might have a whole army of powers, but he was still human. A well placed punch or knee to the gut hurt just as much. He clutched his midsection and cumpled to the floor.

"The corrrect response would be, 'Yes, I understand' then leaving as soon as possible." Sarah informed, looking down at him.

"YES! I UNDERSTAND!" He yelled in an attempt to get across his obedience.

"One more thing." Sarah said to which he froze just as he had been able to get back to his feet. "You owe Claire an apology, then you can go."

"S-sorry." He stuttered out then stumbled out of the house as fast as he could.

"I never thought I'd see him run away scared like that." Claire informed in awe.

"Why didn't I get to kick his ass too?" Kara whined.

"Cause Sarah is scarier than you." You answered.

"Watch it mister!" Sarah snapped, to which you all stood staight up at attention. "Now the whole mood for a relaxing night is ruined."

"Oh come on... I'm sure we can still make something of the night. How about a heat massage and a lick down?" You offered. Even if you didn't like the idea of anything close to eating anyone, especially her, she still tasted amazing and your dragon tongue, even in your anthro form, was more than a comfortable bathing tool for her. Not in a sensual way. She bathed her private parts by herself. But you licking off blood or sweat from her legs, arms, and back was a very desired addition to the occasional massage you gave her.

"You got a deal. Let's go." She said, in a lighter tone. The rest of the night would be pampering each other in different forms while recapping experiences and sometimes picking on Claire. She was the only one there that was actually of this world. And the only one in this realm that could withstand any accidental instances where the jokes went too far. But, all things considered, you all like this kind of night. Slowly, there was another human becoming a part of your little group. You hoped it would be a good and lasting thing.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: He attacks, idiot.

choices: Teleported to another realm, less modern.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content: Here are more choices...
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: More choices...

choices: Search for a place to stay.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You had barely had time to open the door before there was a major shift in the realm you all were in. In a bright flash, you were out of the warehouse and all plopped into a forest of some kind. This caught you off guard and ran over to Sarah and Kara, making sure they were ok.

"What just happened?" Sarah asked as she looked around as much as you or Kara did. You immediately reversed the barrier you placed around Kara to deafen the noise. This made her able to hear correctly. She kept low, as she wasn't sure it was safe yet, but eventually pivoted her head to look at you for the answer.

"Must've been a faulty hand sign, or maybe the realm we were in was unstable for a few dragons to suddenly appear. Either way, it looks like we are stable now. But not in a building. Kara, make sure to keep out of sight. We don't know how this world will react to a dragon." You responded.

"What should we do then?" Sarah asked, while she was by far the smartest person in the group, she was completely out of her depth here.

"Well we should..."
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Teleported to another realm, less modern.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"What?" Asked Kara, not really understanding.

"Well, most realms have a reaction to dragons, and the only one of us that can't hide who or what we are, is you. Don't get me wrong, I think you are awesome and all that. But wither this realm treats you like a Angel or Demon is still up in the air. I think, that if you could change to a human form, it would only help with the process." You answered.

"What do you think, Sarah?" Kara asked, hoping the smarter person out of you three would come up with something else.

"Well, I think it is our best shot. It would certainly make you more versatile and probably effective as well." Sarah said as she thought about it.

"How would it make me more effective. Humans, no offense, are weaker than dragons." Kara stated, obviously not liking the idea.

"Ok, smarty, do you think what I did earlier was useful? The whole multiplication of myself thing when fighting the other Dark hunters?" You asked.

"Yeah, it was awesome!" Kara complimented.

"Well, that was a LOW level jutsu that can only be learned as a human. If you could learn it as well, you could do the same thing." You answered.

"Ok, fine, you've made your point. But how, you are the only one that can go back and forth between dragon and human at will?" Kara asked.

"Let me think for a moment." You answered then dove into your mind. You were getting better at the whole looking into your genetic memory think. It was still a very hard thing to do, but it was now possible for you to push a considerable amount to get a targeted reply from the memories about a problem you were having. After about an hour of searching, you found one that would work. "Ok, I have something."

"What is it?" Sarah asked for them both.

"Well, it is a combination of the Transformation Jutsu and a magical spell, but it also rewrites DNA a little bit." You answered, trying hard to find a way to explain it, but failing. "It is the only thing I have, and it is kind of hard to explain."

"Will it give Kara a human form?" Sarah asked, getting a little pointed, to which she backed off a little bit. She was still nursing what she did to you. She didn't want to do you any more harm, a feeling that would apparently be difficult to overcome, as will your feeling of fear around her.

"Yes, it will. But it will hurt you, a lot. After that though, you should be able to go from human to dragon at will." You answered, part directly at Kara.

"Well, if you are right about people possibly attacking us because of me, then I'll take the chance. Just do it and get it over with." Kara said, as she almost read your mind, laying down and bracing for what you would be doing.

With that ready, you started the process. You had to infuse an inhalable smoke with changing magic, transformation abilities, and the physical nature to withstand the form in either, while still keeping her primarily dragon. It took some doing, but finally you spewed the thick red smoke over Kara. Sarah jumped back, just in case, and Kara caught the hint and started breathing it in. After that, she started thrashing around. She was using almost all her control to keep quiet, so not to draw attention with a roar. However, that meant she would thrash and buckle to this pain and transformation. She did this for a while until, finally, she was no longer seen among the smoke. You cleared the smoke out of the area, to which you and Sarah rushed over to the limp body of Kara on the ground... her human body.

You got a look at it as you both approached. As Kara had never wore clothes, she had none on in her transformation. Her body was very fit, but also a bit thin, probably reflecting her thin nature as a dragon. In her dragon form, her thin body made her a bullet in the air, in human form, it probably made her more agile. She had average to well endowed breasts that weren't overly huge but big enough that they would never be considered flat by any means, while still not being big enough to impede fighting. Her skin was fair but had a little darkness to it, making it look slightly Asian in skin tone. Overall she seemed delicate, but you knew that she was anything but, as far strength and her overlapping dragon powers were concerned. Most noticeably perhaps was her long, silky smooth, flowing, blue hair. It reached the small of her back and was currently spread around her in an oddly attractive mess, covering her to a certain extent.

"Uh, let's get her somewhere else..." Sarah suggested. You could tell she was suppressing basic human instinct to have you turn away from her as she was completely naked. But she didn't want to be rude after just getting you back. But her point was sound. You could feel the hooves of horses approaching and it would be best if they didn't catch you all there. So, you grabbed Kara's limp body and you all made it away, off to find a place to stay.

But where are you???
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Get Kara a new body.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Life soon became more interesting. Luckily your group found a small village to hide in. Ninja and dragon instincts/powers made the transaction an easy one. It was useful for getting a place to yourselves and space to properly train Kara. But she needed a lot of work. After Sarah had got done teaching her how to be a human woman, she took it upon herself to ninja train her. But Kara still picked your brain as well. Most noticeable about this land though, that magic was outlawed, by penalty of death. Even things that weren't magic that looked like magic got people killed. So teaching Kara things and practicing yourselves was not an easy task. But you all managed, having dragon instincts helped immensely.

"No magic, are they insane? There is no way to beat half the 'magical creatures' without magic!" Kara complained as she practiced a spell that you had taught both Kara and Sarah. But for Kara, she still had Ninja training to do, a long way before she reached Sarah's level. So for her, she was practicing the spell while walking on the ceiling of the cave you all were in at the time.

"Not to mention that without good wizards and whatnot, the bad ones go unchecked. I mean really, if no one can defend against spells, then they just make easier targets... well except us ninja." Sarah added, as it was a source of frustration to her as well. As for Sarah though, you had also taught her 'Dragon's Eye'. Since Kara had all her strength as a dragon and her eyes as well, minus growing parts like you could, Sarah was feeling left out. So you developed a Jutsu that gave her some of your abilities, at a relatively high chakra cost. So she was working on endurance so she could use Dragon's eye without such a drain.

"I agree." You put in as you practiced a few jutsus as well. "Seeing people being executed for being different... good think we learned to blend in... well mostly..."

"Hey, I can't help my hair!" Kara defended.

Being that all three of your human bodies were highly attractive, you all got a good deal of attention for it. It was a constant battle to evade people so that you could all get out and train. But it sharpened your wits, so it wasn't all bad. However, you and Sarah had it easy compared to Kara. Her beautiful blue hair made her even more of a target. So she most often pin it up and keep it out of sight. In extreme cases she would color it with a jutsu. But it was her, and she actually really liked her hair. When cooped up in human form all the time, her blue hair made her remember herself better, making her happy.

"It also doesn't help that we are ogled by every guy in the area." Sarah added.

"Yeah, well considering the circumstances, I'd take that as a compliment." You replied.

"I don't mind the humans staring at me. At least this human body is good for something. I've gotten a few free meals with that... what did you call it Sarah?... batting eye routine." Kara commented, making you look over at Sarah and she started to blush a little.

"Either way, did you give what I said earlier any thought?" Sarah asked, changing topics rather quickly.

"Which one, you say a lot of things?" you asked.

"About moving, to Camelot. It seams like a good idea." Sarah reminded.

"Yeah, I gave it some thought. I suppose, after Kara's training is done, we can go. I am concerned about being in that city though." You answered.

"Oh, because of the rule on magic?" Sarah asked.

"Yes, it is strict enough out here. But in the heart of the kingdom, where their eyes are probably more vigilant about such things... We will have to be VERY careful. Even our enhanced strength could be viewed as magical in their eyes." You answered back, obviously concerned about their safety.

"What does it matter?" Kara asked, to which she got a look from you. "No, seriously though. I know we want to fit in and all that. But seriously, if it ever got to the point where were going to be executed then we can just turn into dragons and get out of there. At that point, we would have just as much reason to run, right?"

"I don't want us doing that though." You stated, more securely. Very rarely did you completely stampede over one of their ideas. They were both smarter that you, Sarah infinitely so. But in the area of dominating over humans, in any regard, you felt very strongly on the matter. "However, I understand. If they actually start burning us, it wouldn't hurt. But that would be the point where we could and should separate from them. And I suppose showing them a dragon wouldn't be a horrible thing in such a case. As long as we don't start fighting them in such a situation."

"We understand, Max. We do not want to be painted in that light either." Sarah confirmed.

"Plus, there is that rumor... or legend... or whatever that is." You stated, referring to Arthur of Camelot. While he was young now, you all had heard whispers that he was more or less destined for great things, and on the good side of that.

"We will have to see about him..." Kara replied.

"Hey, no seducing him!" Sarah boomed at her. Not out of Jealousy of anything like that. But they had already decided not to do that to the poor boy. Against two dragon ninja women like them, if they wanted him, he didn't stand a chance. Again, not like they needed it for how attractive they looked. Most girls and women around had at least a little bit of pudginess to them. Apparently it meant they were wealthy, and those that were fit, were that way from being poor and working all the time. However, toothpaste was not on the shelves and the poor didn't have the luxury of keeping their teeth clean. So most men had a choice; nobility with an arrogant and few extra pounds, or simple with bad teeth, humility, and a fit body. Some didn't have a choice, but for people looking at Kara and Sarah, they were obviously a sight not usually seen.

"I wasn't going to! But what is the harm in being friends?" Kara asked, oddly in an innocent tone and face.

"Because men are stupid. Show some interest in them and they will think you are in love... uh... no offense Max." Sarah commented back, the last bit with a little more tenderness.

"None taken, we males are... yeah stupid would be a good word." you agreed, winning both of their favor.

"Ok, that settles it then, right? We are heading to Camelot." Sarah said, slightly excited.

"As soon as Kara is done..." you reminded.

"Thanks Max..." Kara said sarcastically. The meaning soon became clear, as Sarah was in charge of training Kara and she wanted the most to head to Camelot.

"Come on Kara, time to pick up the pace!" Sarah said excitedly.

One thing was sure, with this new fire in her eyes and Kara's ability, as a dragon, to pick stuff up quickly, it wouldn't be long before you found yourself at the gates of Camelot.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Merlin (the TV series)

choices: It is a curious old man (Gaius).
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"Halt!" came yet another guard. It astounded you of how many of them stopped your group, yet didn't do normal security checks. You supposed that it was because Sarah and Kara had hooded cloaks. It seemed like a good idea at the time. But the hooded look only made people want to look underneath. "Who are you?!"

"Just visitors and future residence of this great city, hopefully." You answered for the three of you.

"Reveal yourselves." He commanded, speaking mostly the two girls. He was highly on guard at the moment. Even if you all could get past him with little difficulty, you thought it unwise to knock out every person that pried too much, because that would be a lot of people. You gave each of them a nod to which they took off their hoods. He started ogling almost immediately, but just like all the others, changed to impressment mode rather quickly. "What makes beautiful young ladies like yourselves want to cover your angel faces?"

"We would like to seek a future residence here and live in peace. We would like to avoid attention and wondering eyes to prevent getting in any trouble. But if we paraded through the city then we would gather a crowd of curious people rather quickly." Sarah stated in a very logical tone.

"You can let us go, won't you?..." teased Kara, giving the guard's arm a light stroke with her hand, a cute smile on her face. He was so distracted that he just nodded dumbly. "Thanks, you're the best!" she finished as she planted a small peck on his cheek, making him almost pass out before the put their hoods up and you all made your way through the city.

"You are getting rather good at that..." you observed, pointing your comment to Kara.

"Hey, I can't help it if men are powerless against a beautiful woman." She stated.

"Are you saying I am not a beautiful woman?" Sarah asked in a slightly hostile tone.

"NO! not at all." Kara answered quickly. The one thing that scared her, more than any threat you've made about eating her, was Sarah's temper. Sarah's temper could spark very quickly and end with a very... sorry person for whatever offense they had done against her. While she tempered her wrath towards you, as result of her actions against you with the leaf ninja, Kara was still fair game.

You all continued until you found a small piece of land or area that had a few broken down houses. You asked around and was able to find someone to buy the spot from. With your ability to materialize money, gold was an easy way to convince such people. So, with that done, you three started ripping down and building a forge and shop. You all figured that it was the best way to both stay under and over the radar. You also had a small area in the back for training. Although, the only training you all could do was with the normal kind. As any chakra use would be considered magic. Your excuse would be to train in self defense and test weapons your shop made. All of you would be able to use the forge and tailoring parts of the place, but each of you had specific jobs most of the time.
