You primarily made the metal and weapons, Sarah appraised them and did the running of the place and basically anything that made good use of her escalated brain, Kara was the greeter and customer service face. Her figure and blue hair made people look twice and come back for more... at least that would be the concept. As for supplies, you could materialize it but that would raise too many questions. So you all didn't mind going out of the city for extra training, disguised as getting supplies. And, in no time at all, you all had a working life in Camelot.

"Max! Can you come in here please!?" called Kara from the front of the shop.

She usually did this when you weren't busy and a costumer had a question that she couldn't answer, mainly about what you could make for them or how something was made, like ninja tools. (Not that they knew them as such, they just looked weird enough to ask questions.) You came into the room from the back forge area to greet whomever was there.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Get there and settle in.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"You are all so young in here!?" Prince Arthur stated as you bowed a sentiment to him. His gaze lingered on the girls for a moment too long, but came back to the collection that was displayed.

"We work hard, Sire." You answered with a slight bow. "What can we help you with?"

"Oh, I was just looking in this new shop. I make it a point to know about everything in this city. Mainly because I have to search it all the time. So, I came in, not expecting much. But I see a very... interesting collection here. Did you make them all?" Arthur asked.

"Yes, Sire." you answered, to which you got a look from Sarah, "Of course with the help of my sisters."

"Ah, so they are your sisters then?" He asked.

"Yes Sire." You answered.

"Well, I hope you don't mind my ladies. But you are quite fetching." He compliment to which they gave a polite bowing curtsey.

"We are honored you think so, Sire." Sarah stated, as Kara was still learning the whole polite and royalty way of responding to humans.

It was then that you noticed a boy that was about Arthur's age. You were surprised that you hadn't noticed him before, since you could clearly tell that he had the gift of magic, but far greater than anything anyone around the kingdom had. You wondered for a moment how he could be so powerful but still so unnoticed, then moved on to entertaining his apparent master.

"Is there something in particular that has caught your eye, Sire?" You asked, referring clearly to the collection of clothes, armor, and weapons that was displayed. You even had some potions around, but that wasn't the main attraction of the room. It was a forge and tailoring shop after all.

"Yes, this one. It seams a bit strange." He said as he picked up a Katana. Kara almost freaked at this, as did Sarah but wisely didn't vocalize it. However, Arthur seemed to pick up on this and put it down carefully, trying not to offend the gorgeous women in the room. "What?"

"My Lord, that is a Katana. Pardon the reaction, but most of the weapons that we make are very high end and VERY dangerous. For most that don't know what each item is, it is like having a child play with a loaded crossbow." You explained to which you saw him start to get defensive. "Not that you are a child, Sire, it is just that most of these things need a certain amount of training to wield them properly... Maybe it is best to just show you...?"

"Very well..." He said, slightly intrigued. You took the Katana off the rack. Arthur seemed to note the care you were taking with it. Then followed you into the back. He was slightly disappointed that the girls weren't joining him though. Eventually you made it to the training and testing area. "Nice training spot."

"Yes, we use it to train and test new weapons we make." You answered.

"Why do you need to train? You are just a blacksmith." he asked. Despite the rude comment, he was curious and it was a question you got a lot. Apparently a trained villager, blacksmith aside, was cause to expect trouble.

"Well it helps making new types of weapons. If I know how a weapon is used and the ways to used it, then I can improve on weapons that already exist with more accuracy." You answered then reached a practice dummy next to a rock. "Would you grace me with a demonstration of your sword's power, just so you can see the difference?"

Arthur may have been more noble then most if not all royalty, but he still had pride and liked to show off. So, with a smile, he took out his sword and started hacking away at the practice dummy, taking impressive chunks out of it. He stopped when he was satisfied that he proved his superior skill. The dummy was in rough shape, but still solidly standing. For what you had seen of the skill around this area, he was impressive for his age. Nothing compared to you and the girls, but still, not that bad. You stepped forward and he gestured to the dummy, as if to say, 'your turn, see if you can top that'. So you unsheathed the sword and held it in a basic but strong stance for a Katana. Then you sliced at the dummy four times in proper but again basic slashes. You didn't need them ogling at your fighting skill, just the blade. Which they did, as the dummy split into 8 cleanly sliced pieces of the dummy. You then moved over and did the same to the rock. After that you wiped the blade, very carefully, on your clothes and sheathed it.

"What matter of sword is that?!" Arthur almost coughed out, not knowing what to say. Even the boy with him seemed impressed, as if he'd just seen magic... then again, from the power you were feeling from him, magic shouldn't be a surprise to him.

"It is called a Katana. It is not made like the swords that are primarily around here. It takes a great amount of effort to make just one, but the result is well worth it. However, it also takes practice a separate skill set to master. It is extra strong and, as you have seen, VERY sharp. Which is one of the reasons why we were freaking out when you picked it up. If a random person wants to come in and accidently chop off their hand, then fine. Their fault for touching what is not theirs, but if you were to do it... that would be a bad thing in many senses of the word." You answered, you paused so he could understand your position then continued. "This type of sword is superior to many types, mainly because of the material and fighting style. But an amateur is more likely to hurt themselves than any opponent that they might have. I suppose the most prestigious effect of this type of sword, that tends to catch people's attention, other than cutting through other swords, is that it can be used against magic."

"Say again... does that mean that it is also made with sorcery?!" Arthur almost accused, getting very tense in a split second. You kept your cool, as freaking out with him wouldn't help anything. You didn't need to explain much to him, but using a Katana from the ninja world that could deflect the elements and magic was not magic in itself, but it looked like it. So having the prince understand, so you could use in in defense without being executed, could only be a good thing.

"No, it does not use magic nor is it made with magic." You answered, then thought about how to explain it in terms he would understand. He seemed still on edge, as evidence to the hand he had on his sword, but was less hostile. "Think of it like this. Imagine if the normal weapon material was wood, and someone comes in with the first steel sword ever. Cutting through their apparently strong weapons would seem like magic. When the reality is that the blade is just superior to what is before it. Likewise, the katana is made and crafted at such a high level that it is superior to many magical effects. So if, for example, a dragon was to blow fire at a person using a katana. The person would only need to tilt the sword at an angle that it splits the fire being thrown at him or her. So, in a way, a katana is perfect example of how a normal person can defeat magic, without using magic."

"That... that is hare to take in." Arthur stated, not really believing it yet.

"Think of it this way then. Would I boast about a magical sword in front of you? Especially knowing the penalty for sorcery?" You asked, pretty much rhetorically. He thought about it for a moment then nodded in agreement, taking his hand of his sword and standing more at ease. The boy with him still seemed to have questions though.

"It is a very interesting weapon. Could other weapons be made like that one?" He asked.

"Not really. You could make a knife or other type of sword with the same metal and it wouldn't be as effective as a Katana. Then again, when two swords are fighting with the same skill behind them, the stronger and sharper wins. So, find me a superior metal, and I can make a better sword for you than what you have, in any style you wish." You answered.

"Why would you tell me this? It has to be a secret of some kind." He asked.

"It is. But if a magical being comes around and I kill it with a katana, it would look like magic. Explaining it to you now would save on the explanation later, and you would understand. I really like my head, so losing it because I used a sword that others don't understand would be a pain." You answered, throwing a joke in there for good measure. He smiled at this, it probably also helped that you had jut complimented him.

"Well, it has been... interesting. I think I may return soon." Arthur said, taking a quick glance at the sword and toward the shop, as if penetrating the walls and looking at the gorgeous women inside. Women that could probably rip him apart, not that he needed to know that.

"It is an honor to have Prince Arthur as a guest." you said with a bow. He then took his leave through the door to the street, from the training area.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: It is Prince Arthur.

choices: Arthur leaves to get back to the Castle
He stays and talks with all of you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You thought for sure that one of them would've come back. Both Arthur and the boy seemed fascinated by the presentation you had done... and the eye candy you had around. On this particular night, Sarah and Kara were out hunting. While Kara couldn't turn into a dragon as part of keeping her other side and she was incapable of growing parts like wings to stretch, she still had fun hunting, even if she couldn't use her teeth and claws to do so. But either way, they were gone when you heard a loud pounding at the door, just after you had closed for the night. Unknown to him, there was a certain amount of protection for the building. No one, even you, could teleport in or out of the place. But you knew that putting barriers and wards to strengthen the walls and such would only cause suspicion. So you reinforced the frame with high grade steel and thick enough to withstand a few hard hits from a dragon. You didn't need a robber to intrude and make off with some of your advanced weapons. Either way, when you went to the door to tell the person that you were closed, you opened the door to see a very familiar prince.

"Sire..." You said, as if surprised. Honestly, you could smell him from a block away. But he didn't need to know that. You got out of his way so he could come in. He walked in and looked around as you shut the door. He was obviously looking for Kara and Sarah. "They are out, training and gathering supplies."

"So it is just the two of us?" He asked.

"Yes Sire." you answered.

"Good, I wanted to talk to you." He responded, pacing a little bit nervously. You squared your stance so he knew he had your complete attention. He took a pause then continued. "It has been bothering me, ever since I came here last."

"What has been bothering you Sire?" You asked. Honestly, he could have a bunch of questions that you had anticipated.

"You said that you train, and that you make weapons. Any idiot would understand that you have a halfway decent knowledge base of fighting if that is the case. I thought that maybe it was not the case. But after seeing that.... sword... I have to know, how good are you? And are you a Noble by any chance?" He asked and explained.

"I would like to say that I have a lot to learn, Sire. But I can handle myself. As for being a Noble... I can't say that I am." you answered.

"I would like to see the skills you possess." He stated, or more demanded. It was hard to tell with royalty when they were stating or demanding something.

"Is that why you came so late, and with no one around?" You asked.

"Yes, I don't want your customers being turned away when you lose. I know that could deter business." He answered.

"Very well Sire. I have a smaller area in the forge that is open enough to have a sparing match." You answered as you pointed him to a way to the place you suggested. You didn't know wither to be offended that he thought you would be bad enough to lose or impressed that he would think of a peasant's business as a concern. You both quickly arrived at the place where you could have a match without any prying eyes.

"Ok, are you going to use that Katana?" He asked as he got in a ready stance.

"No Sire. A fully dispatched Katana like that is not meant for sparing, it is meant for killing and/or defeating an enemy. I can use this though." You said as you took a practice sword from the bench. It was still metal but not sharp at all. However it still had the shape. You got in a ready stance.

"Don't hold back. I am not leaving here until I see your ability to fight." He said.

You nodded then he started by slashing at you. A solid opening move that you had seen many times since coming to Camelot. But he obviously hadn't faced a Katana before, or a Dragon ninja wielding it. While his arm was up you easily brushed passed him and rapped his side with a strike. You didn't hit him too hard, but enough to know that you had just beat him in a single blow. He tried again, and again, and again... over and over again, you beat him in a similar fashion every time. His final attempt he jabbed at you and you sidestepped, bringing your practice sword up and into his wrist in a way that made him lose his grip on his sword. You caught it before it was a few inches away from his hand while sweeping his legs then pinned him to the ground with both swords in a cross against his throat. He was out of breath from his attempts but you weren't even slightly winded. You looked into his eyes and he into yours so he knew you had beat him and wouldn't be losing anytime soon. After that you got up and he did likewise. You tossed your practice Katana on the bench and then humbly returned his sword to him. He took it, as if he didn't really understand it anymore.

"You... you are the best swordsman I have ever seen, let alone fought. You soundly defeated me, many times. I am glad we were inside." He stated as he sheathed his sword.

"My Lord, you said not to hold back. I didn't wish to displease you." You answered in a tone that implied that you thought you had done just that. While you weren't afraid of him, angering a member of the Royal house was drama you didn't need, especially if you wanted to stay in Camelot peacefully.

"Oh, no. You did very well. I am just wondering how someone as skilled as you is just sitting here making swords. You could be a Knight with the skills you have." he said before he realized what he was saying, then stopped himself. He knew almost better than anyone that people that weren't Noble couldn't be Knights. So flaunting that was not a nice thing to do. "I'm sorry, I didn't mean it as an insult."

"No apology needed Sire. You are right, I am no Noble. If it makes you feel any better, our skills are yours if you need them." you offered.

"Thank you... wait 'our'... you're not telling me that your sisters are as good as you...!" he said as you both made it back to the front of the forge.

"They are in fact, probably better than me actually." You responded. And you weren't lying. Sure you could do more damage. But as far as raw weapon skill, Sarah was by far the most skilled, you and Kara had different strengths that exceeded the other in that category. When using chakra and magic, not to mention dragon abilities you were better, but that was not allowed at the moment.

"That... that is just crazy." He said, staggering a little bit, trying to get his head around the matter. If he only knew how far above them and him you three were, he would probably faint. "W-will you three, fight for me if I ask?"

"Yes, Sire. Of course we will. Although...." you started, but paused as you thought about it.

"What?" Arthur asked.

"Well... You might want to keep the two girls out of it when possible. They can get moody and have a temper, especially Sarah. Having us deal with an enemy would be one thing, but stopping her when an enemy wants to kill her, for whatever reason..." you stated than added a shiver for dramatic effect. "Let's just say, she isn't that good and going half speed, even in tournaments and sparing. You shouldn't let those two loose unless you really want someone dead."

"Let who two loose?!" Said a slightly escalated voice of Sarah coming through the door, carrying a very large load of unprocessed metal, much more than even a horse could pull. Arthur almost gulped at the sight and your warning, not to mention that they were apparently more lethal than you are. However, as soon as they saw who it was, they put their loads down and bowed respectfully. "Forgive me your highness, welcome to our home!"
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: He comes back later.

choices: You have fun with him, before defeating him.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Arthur took his leave rather normally considering the events and what you had told him. In the end, you figured that he didn’t really know the really shocking stuff… yet. At the very least you had a potential ally on your side. But if any of you used any kind of jutsu or magic then… who knew what could happen, but probably nothing good. However, you didn’t think that things would remain quiet for that long. Something was always happening for some reason. Maybe it was because no one really liked Uther, or maybe it was as they said, magic in this realm drove most people evil. But either way, there was always something to keep the three of you entertained. It was just such an occasion that Arthur had invited your three to witness him being crowned prince.

“Why did he invite us?” Kara almost whined.

“He wants to become better friends with us. Isn’t that what he said?” Sarah almost repeated.

“I think he would like a friendship with us three, sure. But I also think that having two hot young women around all the time is another motivation.” You stated, Kara almost immediately agreeing.

“It isn’t like…” Sarah started but stopped as Arthur looked over at them, again. “… ok fine, he might be slightly interested at the eye candy.”

“But must we wear these uncomfortable dresses?” Kara asked, not liking the ‘formal wear’ that women had to wear to things like this. She was getting used to dresses and girl clothing, but the higher end things didn’t appeal to her. “For something that is supposed to look ‘proper’ it doesn’t feel any better.”

“At least they let you care a knife.” You said, trying to improve her mood.

“Yeah, and you got to bring a Katana and full battle gear. Even if these noobs don’t understand what ninja battle gear is.” Sarah stated for the two girls.

“More eye candy then. He has been mystified by the Katana ever since I showed it to him.” You returned, shifting the Katana a little bit. It was true, Arthur turned to look at it almost as many times as he looked at the two women.

“Like that is our fault.” Sarah replied back, sticking out her tongue at you for a quick second.

Then came the ceremony and the vows from the soon to become prince. He was crowned that way. And just as you all were about to celebrate and let young Arthur bask in his glory, something just HAD to happen. To that effect, a crash came from the large window at the end of the room. In crashed a knight on a horse, dressed in all black. The noncombat personnel we hurried out of the room. A few of those escorting tried to do the same to Kara and Sarah, but they wouldn’t have it. You all crowded around at the end of the room, you ended up to the immediate right of Arthur, while the girls were directly behind you, watching him approach. Arthur looked at you as if you were crazy, not pulling your sword out like the rest of them. In fact, you looked utterly bored. The Black Knight came to a stop before the crowd of people, and threw down the gauntlet, quite literally.

“Max, if you don’t pick that up, I will.” Sarah more demanded of you.

Arthur heard it as well. But still having a fresh memory of her apparent danger and temper, he didn’t hazard a quizzical look at her. Arthur’s muscles flexed in a preparation to pick it up, but you were quicker and without hesitation. The King, never had seen you before, looked strangely at you as you held the armor, then tossed it back to the knight.

“You wanted a fight, you just got one.” You stated, accepting his challenge.

“Single combat, Noon tomorrow, to the death.” The Black Knight said in a monotone voice, filtered by his helmet. You could tell that this ‘Knight’ was not a human. Well he was, but you had smelled the undead before. Wither it be a wrath, Vampire, or something else, you could tell when a dead person was walking again.

“Is there any other kind?” You answered Rhetorically.

The Knight turned and slowly trotted out on his horse. It took a moment, but finally the Knight was out the window and the room could recuperate. It turned into a hall with the people moving so the King and Arthur could address you. Sarah and Kara stood beside you.

“Finally we get some action.” Kara whispered to you.

“Not much though…” You said, before the King could address you.

“Who are you? Why would you accept the challenge?” The King asked, or more demanded an answer.

“Father, these are the three I told you about, from the forge.” Arthur put forward.

“My name is Max, Sire.” You started, throwing in a bow for good measure before continuing. “I accepted because I came here as Prince Arthur’s guest, not to watch some idiot trot in on his horse and ruin what could’ve been a very calm and delightful night.”

“And your sister told you to.” Arthur put forward.

“True enough.” You answered back, nodding comically, but still respectful in a sense. After all, you were still in the King’s presence.

“But you are not a Knight.” The King responded.

“Very true, Sire. However, I have reached a similar level where I come from. So, if you transcend the language gap and mannerisms, I guess you can consider me a Knight from… very far away. I am sure Prince Arthur can vouch for me that I have the necessary battle skill.” You answered.

“And what is it called where you are from, if not Knight?” The King asked. Probably nervous that some nobody was about to offset the power balance.

“My sisters and I are called, ‘Dragon Ninja’.” You answered simply.

“Dragon?” He asked with a gasp. “You are of magic?!”

“Excuse me for my forwardness, Sire. But isn’t your last name ‘Pendragon’? Just because something has a dragon in its name, doesn’t mean it has any connection.” You replied, sending mental winks to Kara and Sarah, who were having a hard time not smiling or laughing. Especially since the bluff seamed to be working.

“Very well. Even if I wanted to jail you till I am sure, you have a challenge to uphold tomorrow. The code demands you complete it. We will see if you are worthy of your own Knight title, and how it ranks with a true Knight.” The King stated, a touch too arrogant for your taste.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Arthur leaves to get back to the Castle

choices: The King want to talk with you.
The King rewards you and Arthur talks with you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
"Are you sure about this?" Arthur asked, as you were walking to the arena where everyone was pretty much waiting. Sarah and Kara were walking with you. But Arthur was concerned about people's safety, like always. "I could take your place..."

"Prince Arthur, my I be blunt and forward?" Sarah asked.

"Of course." Arthur returned.

"Then shut up. I doubt this Knight will put much of a challenge to Max. Are you really trying to take away the little bit of fun he is allowed to have? Trust me, you don't want to get in the way of this." Sarah stated to Arthur's shock, then accepted as he did say she could speak as such.

It was true though. The three of you were getting antsy, specifically you and Kara. Not being able to do magic, fly as a dragon, or use chakra was making each of you restless. Arthur finally nodded, remembering his own experience with fighting you. Although no one knew about it, he didn't need another lesson on how good you really are. Your walk split as you went to face the Black Knight and the other four (including Merlin) went to their spots to watch. You took your spot in the arena with the Black Knight. Arthur came forward to start the match.

"This duel will be determined by the Knight's code and rules... to the death. May the match, BEGIN!"

To this you turned and faced the readied Knight across from you. He was inching toward you, but you didn't even draw your sword. You just stood there, waiting as he got closer. People watched with eager anticipation, some with confusion or fear. Once the Knight got close enough he swung a good slash with his overly large sword. You simply dodged it with ease. He tried again, and again, and again. Each time you simply dodged. But you knew that you could do this all day and it wouldn't make him any more tired, he was dead after all, not that any other people knew that, other than Sarah and Kara. So when he to a lung, you hit a few points, making him drop his sword and you back handed him so his helmet flew off and you had his sword in hand. The crowd gasped at the dead face that was now out and for all to see. You figured you should address the situation before anyone else did.

"So, a Wrath huh? This is going to be more fun than I thought." You said so others could hear, then plunged his sword in the ground and backed away from it. This puzzled most of the crowed, but amused Kara and Sarah. They knew you were just playing with it. "Go ahead, pick it up. I have no desire to fight a Knight without his weapon. You are bad enough the way it is, without your oversized weapon you would be hardly a challenge."

"Ahhh!!! I will kill you!" The Black Knight Wrath screamed, which made some flinch after laughing at your mocking of him. He ran forward and grabbed his weapon, then started attacking you.

This time you would dodge and do some damage. A punch that would drive him back, or a kick to his back side to make the crowd laugh, despite the situation. You even saw the King laugh, despite his bias against magic. A few times you disarmed him again, but gave his sword back. The whole think looked like a charity case instead of a proper fight. Eventually the crowd would laugh at the previously frightening screams and cries of the Wrath. You had loads of fun, since he didn't tire. But eventually you had to end it. So, you finally flicked open your katana. And when the Wrath rushed you with blind rage, you drew your sword and sliced through his sword, his armor, his body and then sliced a few more times. This rendered his limbs and head separate from his body, then sliced each of them in half as well. As soon as this happened, the other pieces turned to ash. You then caught a glimpse of a woman that was different from the rest of the crowd, only in the fact that she was utterly furious at the sight, while everyone else was cheering at the conclusion. You only glanced at her then brought your attention to the front, where the King was standing... apparently well entertained, as was Prince Arthur.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You have fun with him, before defeating him.

choices: Merlin comes to see you, and the girls.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You thought that it only made sense that the King would want to address the whole thing. So after the whole celebration thing, you were brought to the Throne room. Sarah and Kara weren't invited, then again they weren't the ones in the spot light at the moment. So they headed home. You stood in the almost empty room, with King Uther and Arthur sitting on their respective seats/thrones.

"That was rather outstanding. Giaus has revealed that the Wrath was... well he wasn't a beginner by any means. Very skilled, and you beat him easily. In fact, I doubt you needed a sword at all. Making a grown and magic infested Knight seem less then a child in comparison. But also, Gaius has said that no mortal weapon can kill a Wrath. So, that begs the question, What manner of weapon did you slay him with?" King Uther asked.

"A Katana, Sire." You replied.

"What does that mean? Is it magical in nature?" King Uther asked. From both reputation and mood, he obviously was paranoid about magic. His campaign against ANY that practiced it was proof of that, wither they be bad or good.

"Not at all, Sire. The type of Katana that I used is simply superior to magic, which means that it can be used to destroy magic things and beasts. That, normally, would require magic to destroy. As I have said to Prince Arthur, it is like a kingdom that uses wood swords as the standard. If someone comes in with a steel blade, then it would seem like magic when it easily slices through the wooden swords. When in reality, it is just a better blade, made with better material, and wielded correctly." You answered, using your tone to direct King Uther's mind to an acceptable place.

"That... sounds very useful. Is there a way to make swords like that for our Knights?" He asked. You knew that it would come up eventually.

"Lower grade Katana, certainly. But those would not be on the level necessary to deflect and defeat a magic user. A Katana like the one that I wielded, takes a considerable amount of time, effort, and skill to make, not to mention the materials are extremely rare. Even if you are able to obtain enough to outfit your entire army, or even just the Knight, they would have to be trained to use it. The style of using this particular Katana is far different than the sword style you have come to know, as you've seen." You answered, a long winded way of saying no. But just saying it bluntly might've been considered as disrespectful. You had enough trouble without adding a pissed off King to the mix. Especially if you wanted to remain in Camelot.

"So, what would you suggest?" He asked.

"Well, if I may be so bold, my sisters and I could be like... mercenaries. Mercenaries that only serve the Kingdom of Camelot." You suggested.

"How would that help?" The King asked, almost on top of Arthur, who was thinking the same.

"Well, from what I've heard, there is no way that we can become Knights, and we do not wish to cause a conflict in this matter. We understand that you can't allow for allowances, otherwise everyone and his brother will request it, deserving or not. So, to make use of our talents, without losing face, we could be glorified mercenaries. Able to come and go as we please, answering only to Prince Arthur. That way, if someone would inquire, you could pass it off as a hobby of your son, rather than your kingdom relying on us more than your Knights." You suggested, again using tone of voice to make it seem like a good idea to his mind. Humans were so easy to manipulate in this way, especially arrogant ones like Uther.

"And you would obey this country's law's?" He asked sternly.

"Not really. In a sense we would be obeying Arthur. So if you or he needs something done that is not on the books, sort of speak, then we would get it done, even if it slightly outside the law. This instance with the Wrath can be an example. It would've taken magic to defeat it, but I was able to do so without compromising your kingdom, and without magic. So, I technically broke the law in accepting a Knight's challenge, while not being a Knight. But it worked out." You explained. They seamed to get it, Arthur would require more time, but understood a little bit. And... you could sense that his servant, Merlin, was listening in as well.

"You make a good point." King Uther replied. "Will you fight the curse that is Magic in this kingdom?"

"When necessary, but I wont go looking for it." You answered, which got a concentrated look from Uther.

"What do you mean? Magic is a blight on this land!!!" Uther exclaimed. He obviously felt strongly against magic, if there was any doubt...

"I respect that you think that, and I will definitely help when there are innocents in the crossfire. But I am not ok with committing genocide on any group of people, regardless of their choices in life, especially if they have done no harm to date. That being said, if a magic user were to start murdering people, I would definitely take notice. But, as I have said, I have no desire to slaughter any group of innocent people, magic or normal." You answered, sounding very logical in the matter.

"But those that practice magic are evil! You must understand that!" The King stated, pounding his hand down to emphasize his point.

"And that would include your own family?" You asked, to which his eyes narrowed. You saw that you would have to explain, before he blew... " Do you think that, if some sorcerer used magic to give... let's say Arthur a magical ability, against his will. Arthur would be the same person, and the sorcerer would definitely be at fault. However, what would become of Arthur. You know there are enchantments capable of this. So, would Arthur be evil at that point?"

"No, of course not!!!" Uther exclaimed.

"And THAT is my point exactly. I will not interfere with how you want to do with Magic users, but don't think that I will actively pursue all magic users, regardless of their ties. Until they identify themselves as a threat, I will not interfere." You put forward.

"I suppose that makes a certain kind of sense. But would you protect a sorcerer, if they were in hiding?" He asked, still in an accusing tone. But then again, he is the King, so he can do and say pretty much whatever he wants.

"No, I will not hide a dangerous magic user from you. I will at worst turn them away, but if they have committed a crime then I will probably hand them over to the guard or you to deal with as you wish." You answered.

"I suppose that will have to do." The King stated, slightly put off that you disagreed with him about his black and white vision of magic.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The King want to talk with you.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You had wondered when the young Magic user at Arthur's side would come around. All three of you could sense that he had great magic within, more so than any other mage you had met to date. You assumed that he would be able to feel that you and Kara were not normal. But after watching him a little bit, you noticed that he was keeping this part of him a highly guarded secret, even from Arthur. So you three just waited for him to be ready. And true to that, you all heard someone come into the shop at night, just before closing hours. After your display with the Wrath you had a considerable amount of business, but luckily the shop was empty at the moment.

"Well Hello, how can we help you?" Asked a cheerful Kara. She was getting good at that. Most of the time, people lost themselves in her... charms and bought something regardless if they needed anything. To this effect Merlin blushed a little bit but then seemed to remember why he was there.

"Uh... yes. I was... that is I was hoping you, or maybe just you..." looking over at you. "... could help me?!"

"Sure, was wondering when you would be coming around." you answered. He had a questioning face on, but you just waved him to follow you into the back. "... could you two close up shop and meet me back there?"

"Sure!" they both said, being in a good mood today, or maybe it was that they thought something exciting was going to happen that they could take part in this time.

You led Merlin to a back room that was usually used if you needed to add an enchantment on something. Since you couldn't have anyone from the outside hear the spell, the room was sound proof.

"Please, have a seat." you said as you gestured to a chair then sat down yourself. "The girls should be around shortly."

"But I just wanted to talk to you." he stated.

"I know what you want to talk with me about, and believe me, they are a part of it. Plus, they hardly ever get any excitement around here. Best to let them have some when they can get some..." You said and advised.

"Ok." He said.

Soon you two were joined at a table by Kara and Sarah. They took their seats and you could tell that Merlin was slightly distracted by their looks, but once again was motivated by why he was there in the first place. Sarah and Kara seemed amused and impressed by this. Boys his age, even Prince Arthur, could barely do anything around them besides try to look down their shirts and whatnot.

"Well, I am not sure how to ask this..." Merlin started, obviously nervous. After all, the magic topic got a lot of people killed.

"How about like this." Sarah suggested then used a simple spell to light some torches around the room for more light. Previously it was just lit by a few candles on the table. Now it was well lit and could see his admiration and shock all the more. Not that any of your eyes needed the help, perks of being dragons... and dragon ninja in Sarah's case.

"So you do have magic!?" Merlin almost whispered, but with a great deal of excitement.

"You know, even if we know your name, it is a bit rude not to introduce yourself..." Kara stated. She only knew this because she had to learn it herself. And if she, as a dragon, had to learn it, then others that were already born human should do it to.

"Sorry, I am Merlin, Servant or Prince Arthur." He responded quickly.

"Max"

"Kara"

"Sarah"

"And to answer your question, yes we have magic. Not that we use it very often, especially in this kingdom. We also know that you have magic as well." You answered.

"How did you know that?" He asked, a bit nervous.

"You mean beyond seeing you do a few spells? You really need to learn to hide those gifts of yours. Other than that, we can feel your magic. You have a great amount of power inside you. Some that I don't think you even know about." You responded.

This was more than true. Both you and Kara could tell that there was something familiar in him that you both liked and didn't like at the same time. It was as if he was a good friend, but one that could be a master if he wanted. More so for Kara, being full dragon. But you felt it as well. You were currently researching what kind of person would have such potential power over a dragon, but hadn't finished yet.

"Well, I guess I could... sense it about you as well. That, and Giaus had said that a Wrath could only be destroyed by magic." Merlin responded.

"Max wasn't lying to the king about that part." Sarah stated, making Merlin pay rapt attention. "A Katana like the one he used is more than enough to defeat a Wrath, and more."

"Main point is Merlin, we are Dragon Ninja. While we have a considerable knowledge of Magic, it isn't our main thing that we use. We utilize our abilities as Dragon Ninja first, especially around here." You started, then continued, "We have also found that of all the people around, there are a total of 2 people that we would serve if it came down to it; Arthur and yourself."

"ME?!" He almost coughed.

"Yes, you." Kara stated.

"Why me?... and why Arthur?" Merlin asked.

"Arthur, is a noble person. While we all agree that he has his moments, he is generally a good person and a just future King, leagues better than his father. As far as you are concerned, you are not ready to command us, but we find that your potential is there regardless. You two are the only two that we would heed of called to aid one of you." You answered.

"I don't understand..." Merlin stated, blushing at the attention, specifically from Kara and Sarah.

"Neither do we, to be honest." Kara stated.

"What they are trying to say is; for some reason we are being compelled to you. However, Max and Kara are getting the brunt of it. I still have the most freedom as far as that is concerned. That being said, if you tell them to do anything too dishonorable..." Sarah said then leaned forward with a suddenly serious face. "... I will force feed you your own stomach."

"I... I understand." Merlin stuttered out, sweating bullets. He obviously understood. Sarah had the unique ability to make someone feel extremely good and special in one moment and in the next be riveted with a sweating and shaking fear. It was safe to say that whatever power he had for controlling dragons, he would be careful if he ever learned of you and Kara.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Merlin comes to see you, and the girls.

choices: The village accepts with your weapons.
They don't like that you all started up trouble.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You aren’t going without us are you?” Asked Kara as you three rode up to the part of people that was leaving.

You had heard that Merlin’s mother was in town and asking for help. Besides being able to come and go in the castle, with limited supervision, you all had dragon and dragon like senses as well as being fully trained and very powerful ninja. So overhearing things was a constant. You each were on a horse with a considerable amount in packs strapped to each of your horses, not enough to tire the horse too much. But you knew that these people you were going to help probably didn’t have much, so you brought some good swords and light armor. Of course all three of you were dressed in full dragon ninja battle gear.

“You… you three are coming too!?!” Arthur exclaimed and asked. He obviously wasn’t expecting it.

“Uh… yeah. Merlin is our friend too. His Mother and his home village is in trouble and we are supposed to what?... just leave them to die? I don’t think so.” Kara replied and gave Merlin a smile.

“Merlin… friends…?” Arthur asked, thinking that it was too forward for him to admit such a thing.

“Sire, may I speak freely?” Sarah asked.

“Yes?” Arthur more asked than answered, knowing she only asked that when she wanted to be overly blunt with him.

“Then please shut your trap before I accidently put a foot in it.” She said with a sarcastic smile. Merlin was on the brink of laughing along with Gwen, Morgana however didn’t hesitate in her laughing at Arthur’s shocked and silent face.

“Ma’am…?” You addressed Merlin’s Mother. “We will be glad to help your village. We brought along some basic but decent arms and armor for your people as well. But we dare not intrude. May we help?”

“Yes, yes indeed. Thank you my lord.” She said with a bow. You held a hand to have her stop.

“Please, we are not knights or lords or anything like that, just friends.” You stated, being very clear.

With that you all started on your journey. Eventually you all stopped for rest and you could hear a small conversation between Merlin and his mother. First she addressed Arthur’s presence, as well as the lady Morgana. Then she got to you and your ‘sisters’.

“What of them. They seem strange, and the way they talk to the prince…?” She asked.

“They… they have magic as well. I think they are very powerful. They knew of me just by feeling I had magic. Not only that, but I’ve seen them fight and I’ve never seen anything like it. They use no magic, even though they could, and they still make people like Arthur look like kids playing with sticks.” Merlin explained. “I don’t think they will have any trouble.”

“How did you manage to gain their friendship then?” She asked.

“I don’t know, they just said that they felt drawn to me. I can’t explain it.” Merlin revealed.

They talked for a bit then went to sleep. The following day you all were riding to the village when another attack was heard. A man was in the middle of killing a villager for talking back when Arthur threw his sword and the fight began, though all you and your sisters did was get off your horses and wait, at least for a little bit.

“Now I’ve got you!” said a man as he pointed put a blade to Sarah’s throat. The fighting stopped with this development. “Drop your weapons!”

“I’d walk away, if you plan on having kids someday.” You said in a bored tone. Arthur was a bit concerned, but upon seeing Sarah’s souring mood and face to reflect it, he was more curious. He had never seen her fight before.

“Shut it!” He said and drove his blade toward her, while the leader got on a horse.

Sarah moved at the last moment and brought a foot up to meet his family Jewels. Everyone cringed as they heard a crunch and blood began to seep from his is groin area. He fell over, probably wishing he was dead.

“Jeepers, I told you so.” You stated before Sarah finished it by kicking his head in a way that snapped his neck. With this the leader rode away, yelling back curses and threats.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Helping Merlin with his Mother.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You really think that we can fight, let alone survive, this attack! They are trained in this kind of thing, while we are trained in farming and whatnot!” One of the villagers said.

“Yes, I think there is nothing stronger than someone fighting for their home.” Arthur responded as he addressed the village.

They were understandably nervous and frightened, even after a rousing speech from Arthur. Most had heard of Prince Arthur and didn’t doubt his skill, they just doubted their own.

“But we are mere villagers, with nothing but farm equipment and our fists to fight with!” Said another.

“About that…” Kara replied to which they all looked her way. You had just got done setting up a table and all three of you had just placed your packs on it. With Kara’s little outburst and everyone’s attention, you three started unwrapping an impressive display of weapons and armor. “… I am sure you can put these to good use.”

“What… how did you get these?” Asked Merlin’s Mother.

“We made them. We told you we didn’t come empty handed.” You answered then turned to Arthur and nodded for him to continue.

“If you are able and willing, you may arm yourselves for battle. It may not be what you are used to, but you deserve to live in peace, and this fight will determine that.” Arthur declared with gusto.

“Not that we are complaining, but most of us don’t know how to use half of these things.” Said another man as he held up a large but deceptively light broad sword.

“Not to worry, we will be doing a majority of the fighting. But you should still be armed to fight for your own village with quality arms. Better than a wooden stave if nothing else.” Kara responded.

“Are you certain? You are just a girl after all and they are highly trained soldiers.” Said a boy from the village. Kara almost took it as an insult but saw he was more trying to protect the ‘beautiful girl’ rather than promote his own skill over hers.

“We can handle ourselves.” Sarah butted in. As if to prove her point she flipped up a small knife from the table and threw it at a makeshift target that someone had set up to practice, burying the knife in the post to the hilt in the head of the target. The doubting members gulped nervously then went to outfitting and practicing with their chosen weapons.

“Amazing how you three just gave these weapons to them as if they were nothing. These swords are better then what most of Camelot’s soldiers have.” Merlin responded.

“Oh, it was no problem at all. Honestly, it was getting a bit crowded around the shop with all these just hanging on the walls and such. We need room for the new stuff. Ever since Max fought that wrath with his Katana, we have been visited by anyone and everyone that wants something similar.” Kara responded.

“Are you really as good as Max?” Merlin asked. He had seen you fight, but not the girls. So he was as worried for their safety as the others. Arthur just knew better than to voice it, especially around Sarah.

“Awe, you’re so cute when you are worried. Such a sweet boy…!” Kara flirted back with a brush of her hand on his arm, making him blush deeply. “… but honestly Merlin, no one is better than Max. I am far above Arthur and about Sarah’s level, but we are both below Max’s skill and power. Max is just too nice to take credit.”

“But you will be ok right?” Merlin asked insistently.

“Yes, we all will be fine. No need for you to… exert yourself, ok?” Kara said, making sure he understood that he didn’t need to resort to magic, especially not some that others could link to him.

“Yes, thanks again for everything.” He said then went about his business with his home village. He still had a bit to catch up on and talk with, most of which was his Mother and a boy that he seemed to know well.

“What?!” Kara asked as she saw you and Sarah looking at her suspiciously.

“I certainly hope you aren’t giving that boy any ideas without cause.” Sarah scolded.

“It was just a small bit of flirting. You said that it could be used?” She said, blushing a little bit.

“Just be careful. We still don’t know why we are pulled to obey him to some degree.” You warned.

“Not to mention the broken heart he would have if you lead him on just to tell him you are… what you are and he hate you for it.” Sarah added on.

Kara began heavily thinking on this. It was unclear if she actually was having feelings for Merlin, or if she was just pressing her knew advantage that her human beauty gave.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The village accepts with your weapons.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Most of the village was out of sight, waiting for the offending party of soldiers to come in and trap them. You however was in the direct center of the trap, standing in a cleared area in a relaxed position with one hand on your katana. Well, not yours but one that was of very high quality. You had been creating one for yourself that had some of your dragon attributes, materials, and skills in it. But that wasn’t ready yet. Unlike most of even the higher end things that you were making, it was far more complicated and potentially impressive. Either way, the men came into the village and surrounded you as soon as they saw you weren’t moving. They thought that they had trapped you, but it was more the opposite.

“Where have all the villagers gone?” Asked the leader, trying to usurp his power and pride over yours and was slightly put off when you were just looking bored.

“They are around somewhere. I am standing here to give you one last chance.” You said to which he looked comically at you.

“Chance for what?” He asked with a bit of a chuckle in his voice.

“Leave and never come back. Either way, this village is done doing your bidding and will not bend to you anymore.” You responded, a bit more serious than before.

“Are you insane? We number over fifty, and there is just you and some petty villagers.” He boasted.

“Last chance.” You stated, almost interrupting him, which he obviously didn’t like at all.

“Kill this dog, and burn this village to the ground!” He boomed.

With that a horsed spearman came forward and tried to impale you. You sidestepped and sliced him in half as you drew your katana. Of course the move was normally impossible with the armored horse in the way, but you had easily sliced through the armor, horse, and soldier in one fluid strike that was so clean that the man had time to look down before his half and the horse’s neck slid from the rest of their bodies’.

With this, the trap was sprung and the village was suddenly filled with fighting. As promised, your group did a high majority of the fighting. Most were so dumbfounded by your three style of fighting that they were easy to pick off by those less skilled. Even without magic, draconic abilities, or flash jutsu the moves that you and the other two ninja were so different, successful, and refined that people couldn’t help but watch. The only one that had any ability to look slighting good in comparison was Arthur. You all made it a point to leave him a few to play with. Of course it was hard fought for him, but it would make him feel accomplished later so you let him have his glory for what it was worth.

“Well, that was easy…” Commented Arthur as he took down the last of his enemies. The leader and all of his men were now dead. You half thought that there would be some king of last battle between their leader and either you or Arthur. But the Leader was stupid enough to gawk at Sarah then try to attack her… he didn’t last long after that.

“Still fun though.” Kara interjected as she joined you and Sarah with the rest of the Village gathering.

“You’re a strange girl, you know that right?” Said the same slightly rude boy from before. He was one of those that hated princes and any high form of government, mainly because of them leaving villages like his to fend for themselves.

“I get that a lot!” She said cheerily.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: The fight.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“One of you must know what is going on…!” Arthur stated after entering your shop. He had gotten rather comfortable around you, his attitude was a little shyer around the girls, but it was less of a royalty and subject relationship and more of a friend relationship. After all, you three were technically mercenaries. So you could, in theory, do whatever you wanted.

“You’ll have to be more specific, we know a lot of things.” Sarah answered as she dusted a weapon’s rack.

“The lack of food and water…” Merlin filled in for Arthur. As always, Arthur rarely went anywhere without his trusty servant by his side, wither he wanted him there or not.

“Oh, you mean the curse that you triggered. Yes, that is a right pain in the backside. Do you have any idea how far we have to go for water?” Kara replied in uncovered annoyance. But he didn’t really know the half of it. Normally, it didn’t matter, but Kara in particular had to drink a lot of water. Her transformation was not like yours. While a Dragon could survive without food for sometimes years at a time, water was something that they needed more often. And as staying in human form was a toll on her in the form of effort and suppressing dragon lungs, she needed a generous amount of water in storage inside herself or drinking it. While she could last about a year without food, she could only last a month tops without water.

“Where do you get water?” Arthur asked, wondering if there was some secret place that Camelot could utilize for the people.

“Brooks and streams just outside the kingdom. We have to tow it back here in the big reservoirs that we usually fill for making weapons.” You answered, pointing through the wall to where they knew them to be.

“You carry them there and back, by yourselves?” Arthur asked, looking at the two girls for a moment.

“Sire, can I speak bluntly?” Sarah asked.

“Na, I get the point!” He quickly said, knowing that question usually came with a blunt way of putting him in his place. He lingered for a moment then looked at you with a change back to the original topic and a question. “Do you know who and what is causing it?”

“Yeah. You were stupid enough to kill a Unicorn.” You replied.

“Not you too…” Arthur moaned, glancing at Merlin, then back to you.

“So you think that after killing an ancient, mystical, pure, magical, and protected creature like a unicorn that you can just mount the trophy on your wall and not pay a price?” You asked rhetorically.

“That can’t be it…” Arthur stated.

“So, you think it is some disease that seems to follow you were you go. Didn’t know you went out with plagues…” Kara teased.

“I don’t do any such thing!” He defended then caught on that she was just messing with him, “… oh ha, ha, very funny.”

You then saw Merlin smile humorously for a moment then hide it at Arthur’s glance, but it was enough to make Kara smile and you thought you saw a measure of pride as she had made Merlin smile. It was still unclear if she had feelings for him. You didn’t want to invade her mind just to find out something like that.

“So, you know what is doing this then?” He asked.

“I have little doubt it is the curse you released when you killed the Unicorn.” You stated with confidence, then changed to a questioning look. “What made you do something as foolish as to kill one???”

“I didn’t know any better?” Arthur blurted out.

“Please… There are many things that we have hunted over the years. Things that you can’t imagine… yet. But none of us would ever be caught dead killing a Unicorn. We’d rather fight a Dragon.” You replied.

“So, how do I fix this?” Arthur asked.

“Well, you have to prove to whatever governing body protects them, that you are of a pure heart. Either that or die. Either way, the curse is specific to the one that killed it. So, you must prove yourare worthy of clemency by their standards. Until then, I would recommend NOT killing any more unicorns.” Sarah revealed. He seemed ready to argue but she raised an eyebrow, as if to ask what he wanted. He stopped right before voicing his difference in opinion. He knew better at this point to go against Sarah in particular.

“There is nothing you three can do?” Merlin asked for him.

“It is something Arthur must do, since it was his had that killed the Unicorn.” You repeated.

“Very well, we will see you later then.” Arthur said, not so happy that you couldn’t just slice the curse in half, if that was even possible. Merlin bowed a thank you then hurried off.

“Idiots, the both of them.” Sarah said as she went back to work.

“Merlin isn’t that bad…!” Kara defended before she could stop herself, then blushed red and hurried off to go do some work.

“Did you just see that?” You asked Sarah.

“Yeah, she looks like she is falling for that Merlin boy.” Sarah confirmed.

“I thought so. But is it love, or whatever is driving us to obey him???” You asked.

“Hard to tell, maybe a bit of both." Sarah said as you both thought on it.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Kara, hide now.” You said as soon as you got through. The area around you was like a street corner in between a few buildings. You knew what they were from your time in Kisara’s realm but Kara was at a loss for all the sounds and smells that bombarded her. She went to jump but you just waved with a motion that indicated to hide low and quietly. She laid down and put on her cloaking ability. It wasn’t a cloak exactly, more of an illusion where her kind’s scales reflect and refract light around them to make her more see through but it was not by any means flawless. It was best in the air when it combined with her movements to make her even harder to see. As for now you hid in the shadows while she did something similar with that ability just as a few humans looked down the alley where you were.

“Can I let Sarah out?” Kara asked after she sensed the humans were far enough away to speak.

“Yes but quietly.” You answered. She did well as her otherwise noisy hacking was silenced and the only sound was the fleshy walls of her throat moving around Sarah as she moved up her neck and plopped out onto the pavement.

“Kara… not so much drool the next time. I’m completely soaked.” Sarah said as she dripped with dragon drool.

“Next time? No offense Sarah but I hope I don’t have to do that again.” Kara said back after catching her breath.

“Why, did I taste bad or something?” Sarah asked as she rid herself of the majority of the drool and you helped by magically doing so along with drying and scenting her so she didn’t smell like dragon breath and insides.

“No, you tasted really good actually and wouldn’t mind another taste. But while going down was enjoyable, the coming back up was… not that much.” Kara said as she tried to tip toe around the taste of humans and her specifically.

“Ok, ok. I get it. Max, where are we?” Sarah asked as she looked up at the buildings around them. Some were very tall while others as tall as Kara.

“I don’t know. But it looks like an advanced city. That means that we can’t fly without them shooting us down or making a spectacle of yourselves. We need to move carefully to…” you started but was interrupted by more voices coming towards you and the others. You all hid as they came and as there was nothing but a dead end where you were you hoped they were just lost and went away, soon. But the closer they got the more nervous you became. For starters they didn’t smell like humans not matter their appearance as they rounded the corner and stopped to look into the alley as if searching for someone.

“Ah, are you sure this is the right spot?” asked one of them.

“Yeah, can’t you smell them? They’re here alright but obviously good at hiding.” The other said.

“Excuse me. We know you are here. We don’t mean any harm, we just came to escort you to more… accommodating areas for our kind.” He said and you thought on it for a few seconds. ‘our kind’ was he a predator, it didn’t seem likely that he was a half-breed like you and neither of them were human.

“What do you mean by ‘our kind’?” you asked in a tone that couldn’t be pinpointed in the darkness of the alley.

“Well our security system alerts us when new arrivals come to our world or realm or whatever you think this is. Anyway we are monsters like you, or most of you. We can smell a human there as well, two humans actually.” One of them said.

“Monsters? I sure hope you are referring to a distinction and not a description or we might take offense to such talk.” You stated.

“Oh, no. I apologize. Rather than address each type of being by their kind and getting it wrong most of the time we just address most by the default ‘monster’ title. It makes it easier and less offensive when humans refer to us as such. It keeps tempers down as well from not getting breeds and variants right.” Said the ‘monster’ as he waved his hands at the accusation.

“Ok then, where can you take us so we can move more freely?” You asked.

“Well new monsters under a certain age usually go to the monster school to receive training and teachings with the rest. And of course you’re human friends are…welcome but their safety can’t be assured as much as a monster’s would. You see monsters usually eat humans so going to an all monster school as a human is… problematic. However, since you are all new to this new world, to you at least, it would be best to learn how to survive it.

“Ok, one of us is rather large. How do we get there?” You asked.

“Oh that won’t be a problem. We have emergency teleportation devices for such cases. How big are we talking about?” he asked. At this you stepped out and he eyed you. Then you waved the others to which Sarah came by your side then Kara stood to tower over the two of you. “What! A dragon? Holy crap I thought your kind was extinct!” he said.

“Well actually she is the full dragon, as you can see. I am a half-breed dragon and this is my… I guess you could say she is our rider, friend, and family all in one.” You explained.

“Well, I… we have more than a few questions but we need to get somewhere other than the back alley of the human world. Now I just have to touch you three and I can bring you to the Monster school administration area. Where we can get you all checked in.” he said as he walked forward but back peddled as Kara growled a little.

“You lay one finger on Sarah and I’ll gut you.” Kara said in a continuous growl.

“Whoa, hold on. I wasn’t going to harm her. I just need to be in contact with everyone one so I can teleport you there with me. Look I’ll let you each touch me as you see fit. I won’t even move.” he defended with his hands up in a passive stance.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Kara has to hide.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Very well, it doesn’t look like we have any other options at the moment so we’ll go out on a limb and trust you, for now.” You said as you took his outstretched hand and extended your tail so that the others were connected. The one you were holding onto looked intrigued at this but did something that resembled a few hand signs then teleported. The scenery changed to a wide open field in the center of a building, like a stadium and just as big. However there was desks in the middle as other ‘monsters’ we teleporting in then walking and flying out. None were anywhere near Kara’s size so a lot of them stopped to look at her.

“Why are they all staring at me?” she asked as she was slightly embarrassed.

“Well for starters you are the only dragon they’ve seen. They became extinct some… thousand or so years ago and even then they were very scarce and not as large.” He said as he turned into a large green ogre. “Ah, much better. Human form can be so… restraining.” You said as he stretched his arms out.

“Do I have to transform into my dragon form as well?” you asked.

“Yes, in order to enter the school we need a record of who and what you are. Just so that the faculty and facilities are notified and appropriately stocked to house you.” said an attractive woman that walked forward from a desk in front of the spot you and the others were facing. “Guard, you may leave now.” She said with a wave to which he bowed then walked off.

“Ok, here goes nothing.” You said as you grew wings and took off into the sky. When you got far enough away you exploded into your dragon form and soared for a minute above. Kara seemed to read your mind as she made a little extra room for you to land to which you did. The grass was somewhat soft so when you landed your claws sunk in a little to your steps. You then laid down but kept your head looking around at the silent group of ‘monsters’ that surrounded you. “Ok, all done.” You said to the woman.

“You’re a dragon as well? I… umm… My name is Vickie and I am… will be checking you in to Monster Academy.” She stuttered as she looked down at her papers.

“Max, come down here. You’re scaring them half to death.” Sarah stated.

“Sorry.” You said then lowered your head to lay on the ground and Sarah sat on a chair that she pulled next to it, Kara took the other side and both received her light petting like you both used to in the castle all that time ago.

The field got back to its normal functions, although you and Kara were constantly watched and gawked at. Vickie had begun asking spermatic questions and finally went to get the conversion representative.

“Good evening, it is a pleasure to meet you all.” Said a naga woman that was about twice Sarah’s size.

“Good to know. We were beginning to feel a little out of place.” Sarah said.

“Well it isn’t every day that two dragons come by. However I am here to assist in your disguise. From what I’m told, one of you needs a human disguise.” She said back as she looked at both of you.

“Why do we need one?” you asked.

“The school is open to all monsters. But having all those different individuals in one place and interacting can get hectic and unstable. So we have a rule against being in monster form while attending. Along with that another rule is that the students are not suppose to reveal what they are to each other. As you can imagine, a known vampire and a known werewolf would generate unnecessary problems and conflict. So which one of you needs the disguise?” she asked

“Does that mean I can change back?” you asked to which she just nodded. Sarah removed her caressing hand from your snout then you took to the sky again. Another explosion and you were flying in human form back down, afterwards retracting your dragon parts.

“So it’s you then?” she asked Kara.

“Yes.” She simply responded.

“This is a seal of sorts used by many monsters that are larger than usual like me.” She said as she pulled out a chained necklace with a symbol of a giant mouth with fangs on it. You couldn’t tell what it was but it kind of looked like a made up predator from all kinds of monsters. Probably to prevent the biased remarks on its design. “It transforms you into a human form. However it has never been placed on someone so large before.” She said and got a small growl from Kara that made her flinch.

“I’m sure she meant it as a compliment.” Sarah said and for the first time a monster in the area looked at Sarah with thanks and admiration as Kara calmed. “Do you mind?” Sarah asked as she held her hand out. The naga was more than happy to hand it over to Sarah so she could fasten it around Kara’s neck. As soon as the clasp was set the symbol started to glow and the mouth on it was shutting but it seemed to be having a hard time. You all waited to see if it would work and what the outcome would be. Kara closed her eyes against the bright light and when she opened them…

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Damn, it actually worked.” You said as you looked down at a stunned young woman. She was just as old as you and Sarah so she was about 17 years old and it showed. She blinked her eyes open and looked at her human parts with a mix of shock, amazement, and horror.

“For goodness sake Max, get her some clothes.” Sarah said as you observed a few hungry looks at her lean figure. She had blue hair like her scales but looked to be almost silky smooth and well kept. Her face looked… well in a word cute with silver eyes but slitted like her normal dragon eyes. Her skin was white and more Asian looking but just in color with a little darker shade to it. Otherwise her form was best described as ample and fit. Not too large to ogle on one thing in particular but not small enough to suggest that she still had some growing to do. She was not used to the concept of clothes she didn’t think to cover herself at Sarah’s reaction.

“Ok, I got it.” You said with a few hand signs and magic to make clothes that fit her appear on her to save time in explanation. “I trust you will show her where everything goes and why she needs them, later. We dragons don’t usually see the sense in clothes so…” you started but Sarah waved that she understood.

“What the hell. How do you humans walk?” Kara said as she tried to stand but fell over. The closest she got was on her hands and knees as if she was still in dragon form. You started laughing at her to which she just glared at you before responding. “What’s so funny?” she asked.

“I just remember my first attempts at walking and looking at you now is kind of hilarious.” You said as she tried again to stand and prove you wrong but only fell on her butt. “Here, you just need to figure out how your legs work. You can lean on me until you get the hang of it. After all, you don’t have a retractable tail to help balance. Besides, now you know why humans are so easy to catch, well except Sarah of course.”

“Nice save.” Sarah said as you propped Kara on your shoulder but made sure she was attempting to walk on her own. It didn’t take that must pushing for her to try walking, again to not be inferior in any way. Although she did crack a smile at the human remark and you were convinced that it was the only thing that saved you from a whack over the head from Sarah for it.

“Indeed it was. Now there is one more… concern you should be aware of before we permit you three to attend the academy.” The Naga stated to which you all looked up at her. “You see there has never been a human attend before, well not for more than a couple days. You see, while humans outside are rare treats to most of us, one’s that can be eaten without the public knowing of course. But here where Monsters are the majority you will find that humans are more in danger because we monsters don’t have to deal with running and hiding from the other humans. And while the students aren’t permitted to show or go to monster form this school is like any other as far as rule breaking. Do you understand?”

“Ok, just for the sake of argument, if someone tried to eat one of the other students what are our options?” You asked.

“Well you could just sit there and take it. Or you can fight them. Monsters tend to be more aggressive than humans so we do have a small amount of fatalities every year. However if your monster form is revealed it is seen as a major offense. So you can fight back but never in your full monster form.” She answered.

“Very well. These are you schedules and books will be provided by desk computers. You are all in the same classes as a favor to you three for your human being a rider and family. The bus to the academy will be leaving soon so you need to hurry.” She continued after a long silence as if to give you all a chance to change your minds. You couldn’t tell if she hoped that you did or didn’t.

“Uh, Max? What are we going to do about clothes and other… necessities?” she asked. “You know we girls have a few more things to take care of than guys do, especially our new arrival here.”

“It can’t be that hard.” Kara defended.

“Well let me put it to you this way. With all I know about humans and dragons I will never understand how and why women of either species do the things they do. I don’t think I am suppose to but in any case, from what I’m told, there is a lot more work than what guys are allowed to see.” You stated. “And as far as that is concerned, I can still do magic so I can materialize what you need and, as soon as you get me some of their money, I can materialize that as well for the more… sensitive products.”

“Right… forgot you could do that” She said, looking down as she thought and while you helped Kara along.

“Ah! This is going to be a pain. I can’t walk, run, fly, fight, or even breathe fire like this. What CAN humans do?” she asked.

“Humans can do all of those things.” Sarah stated as she demonstrated a fire jutsu small enough to not cause any major attention but big enough to make her point. “If you get good enough, I’m sure we can train you to be a Dragon ninja like the rest of the family.”

“Why would I want to do that? Besides being more powerful as a human. I mean if worst comes to worst I can just go back to dragon form.” She said as she was starting to get the hang of leg movements but not enough to walk in any decent amount.

“Remember how I was able to make over 500 of myself before?” you asked to which she nodded. “Well for starters you can do jutsu like that in both forms, if you learn how in human form. You can also create justu to bring out your dragon parts like I do. So being trained in both is extremely useful.”
