1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So why aren’t there any more students on the bus?” Sarah asked as she was hoping to get to see some of the other monsters before the rules took into place.

“Why? Well because this is the bus for new arrivals such as yourself.” Said the bus driver. He was in human form but had an almost hermit aura around him and under his uniform. “Most monsters that were born here already know where the Monster Academy is. So they just get there themselves.”

“Wait, the naga lady that processed us said that there wasn’t any humans there. What happens if a human wonders in by accident?” You asked, both testing if he knew about Sarah as well as the answer.

“That’s easy, they’d be dead in no time. We monsters are usually hunted if exposed so any that come in by mistake are usually dealt with by the students. In fact, it is one of the only ‘special occasions’ where students are allowed to go into monster form. To keep the school safe and a secret they can eat, kill, torture, or otherwise get rid of any human that comes in the barrier surrounding the school.” The driver answered.

“Well that’s good to know.” Sarah said with a shy and nervous laugh.

Soon you passed through a long, dark, and curvy tunnel where the scents around you changed, then the bus stopped after exiting the tunnel and you three got off. Then without a word the driver turned around and headed back. During the trip you had helped Kara with some limbering exercises so she could gain better control over her new human form. Her arms worked and she could write with a pencil without breaking it but when she went to stand she just fell over again. So she was back to leaning on your shoulder for support.

“What a strange place. Looks like a cheap horror house.” Sarah said as she looked around. There was a castle of sorts in the background but looked also to be an elaborate academy. A line of scarecrows lined the road with different fake bodies on them that spanned from human to naga and almost everything else. Long and gloomy forest was around with different specialty creatures inhabiting it. You noticed as you all went through it, the spiders were pretty much all extremely deadly as well as the snakes, tigers, wolves, and other things that probably protected the students as well as prevented them from changing to monster form out in the forest rather to get out of the school’s rule. Although for you and Kara it seemed like excellent hunting grounds.

“Well seeming as all the monsters are actually real in this place, I think that it would be for a human. Well accept you. I actually pity the monster that tries to get at you.” you complimented.

“True, you’re scary enough from a dragon standpoint. Plus everyone I’ve seen up to now look to be weaklings.” Kara agreed.

“I guess you two are right and I’ll take that as a compliment.” She said as she shot a look at Kara that got her to flinch and you to chuckle a little, to which Kara just slugged you with her free arm then continued. You noticed that, despite being in human form, she still retained a good amount of her strength. Not enough to be superman but more than enough to take care of herself when you aren’t around.

“Well hello!” said a woman at the entrance as she and a man beside her greeted the three of you. With your dragon eyes you could tell that the man was a wolf anthro and she was a neko, well under their human disguises. “Oh, my dear. Are you hurt?” she asked as she looked at Kara leaning on you like she was.

“It is her first time walking as a human. She’s use to walking on all fours with her tail so she just needs a little help with her new… human parts I guess you could say.” You said for her as she was too embarrassed. They seemed to immediately understand and smiled back.

“Don’t worry, we understand that all too well. Especially those of us who have tails to help balance us. But I’m afraid this is where we split your group up. You see we need to get you two to your dorms and, as you can probably guess, the guys side is separate from the girls for a reason.” The neko said as she smiled.

“Alright. Sarah you think you can…?” you asked as you gestured to Kara.

“Yeah, come on limpy. I got to show you the human ways to deal with your body anyway.” Sarah said as she took your place as her support. You got a little ‘see ya later’ look from Kara as you all waved and went your separate ways.

“So… how does a guy like you get two girls like that?” asked the man escorting you to your dorm.

“Well they are kind of like my sisters. We all came from rather… abusive families that threw us out so we found each other and bonded to make our own family when we were younger. So I guess, it isn’t what you’re thinking but yeah they are pretty amazing girls.” You responded.

“Sisters heh. So… do you mind if I hit on them?” he asked rather boldly as you both walked down corridors and halls.

“Be my guest. Although the last guy that Sarah rejected ended up in a hospital and in Kara’s case ended up in her stomach so… I’d be careful if I were you. They are two ladies, despite being family, that I wouldn’t want to piss off.” You answered that got the guy to gulp hard.

“What are they anyway?” he asked.

“Nope, not suppose to say what we are, remember? I just got into this school so I’m not really looking to get kicked out right away.” You responded with a comical finger wagging.

“Alright, alright. This is your room.” he presented as you both stood in front of…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Only you three and the driver on the bus.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ah… great, I think. Look I don’t mean to be rude but are all the rooms this small?” you asked. You had been led into a room that only had a bed and a desk with barely any room from that to the door. There wasn’t even a bathroom or closet to put anything that a student might’ve brought with them.

“Yeah, pretty much. You see, this is the only monster school in the world so it tends to be packed and overcrowded. But because of each monster being unique they need separate rooms so we/they don’t eat or kill each other in their sleep. So... the rooms tend to be rather small and the community bath is severely overused. I hear the girl’s side has slightly bigger rooms but we aren’t allowed over there so we wouldn’t know.” The man asked.

“OK… So when does classes start?” you asked as you went to your new desk and sat in the chair while the man walked in to get out of the hallway.

“Actually they started a week ago so you and your sisters are going to have to play catch up. In a sense you three will be the talk of the school since they have never seen a monster from another world before.” He answered then after explaining where everything was on a mini map he had with him he then left you to think for the rest of the night.

There wasn’t any formal curfew because of the night time monsters that were more active during that time, regardless if the classes were all held during the day. The barrier around the school allowed for things like vampires and other elemental dominated species to attend without worry. Not to mention that everyone was usually in their human form but you noticed, as you walked around exploring, that random students ‘accidentally’ changed to monster form and it wasn’t a huge deal. Even some of the teachers did it during class. Maybe it was similar to a ‘no running in the halls’ rule from human schools. I mean it is important but hardly enforced unless it becomes a problem or obviously intentional. You found a nice spot on a bench overlooking the very large lake near one of the school ground’s exits. The combination of the barrier, the clear water, and the moon was making the water shine and glisten beautifully. I was like a shimmering mirror in which you could see a glorified reflection of the sky between the ripples from students taking a swim.

“Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t know anyone was here.” Said a voice from a girl that had literally plopped right out of the sky and onto the bench you were sitting on. You took a moment to look her over as you did with the others in the school, mainly to check what kind of monster they were as well as their danger level to Kara and Sarah. This one had pink hair down to the small of her back with a thin yet wavy look that caught the breeze but was heavy enough not to fly everywhere. Her eyes were a radiant green that complimented her… innocent yet cute face. Her complexion was a little pale but not enough to seam weird. More like she had rarely been in the sun at all. The rest of her body was athletic but not slim like Kara’s new form. She wasn’t fat or pudgy, just… thicker in muscle mass while still looking dainty. Her pink hair brought out a blush as she waited for you to respond. Although you had to be careful as her scent betrayed a… dead scent but one with a tint of decaying blood, but not so much as to be unpleasant, unless you took it in too deeply The only monster that came to the description was a vampire.

“No problem, I was just taking in the view. My name is Max, my sisters and I have just transferred here today so I was just exploring while I had the time.” You answered back with a light smile before looking back over the lake.

“Oh, you must be those new transfer students that everyone is talking about from another world. I never thought I would meet you before everyone else like this. Oh… my name is Mia and welcome to Monster Academy.” She greeted but when she just saw you staring over the lake she joined you. “So you like the night as well?”

“Well, kind of. I guess I like it just as much as the day time. What I like about this spot is it seems so tranquil. Everything is so alive from this view, nothing out of place.” You answered then took a longing look up. You hadn’t really been able to fly that much. Sure when you first arrived but not for the pleasure of flying.

“I know what you mean. I come here after a long day at school for the same reason. No one is gawking at me or trying to take me somewhere. Instead I am the one caught gawking.” She said as she dazed off into the scenery with you.

“Hey you! get away from her!” came a voice that broke you pleasant thoughts, followed by an impact that sent you off the bench and through a tree before hitting another and crumpling down to the ground.

“Scott! What did you do that for?” Mia asked as she looked at you with a combination of guilt and pity but strangely no shock.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: It's a human sized room, like the others.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“I thought I told you babe. If anyone tries to get between us then they are as good as dead.” Scott said as he looked at her. He said it in a way that made it seem like he was deeply concerned about her. So much so that you did know if it was an act or not.

“But he didn’t…” she started but he just guided her along and out of the area while doing the equivalent of pouring honey into her ear, metaphorically speaking. She only took a concerned look back at the fallen tree that had fell right on top of you. It didn’t hurt by any means but it did give you a clear example of how tempers and personalities of the students could vary to extremes and what that meant.

When they got out of sight you picked up the tree and, with a little wood style jutsu, repaired both the small tree you were sent through and the one the cushioned your ride. But you thought it to dangerous or at the very least problematic to sit on that bench again so you leapt onto tall tree so you could look over from its top as you got comfortable.

“Hey Max.” called Sarah’s voice from the tree next to you. “Wow its beautiful up here.” She said as she and the leaning Kara she was holding looked where you were looking.

“So this is why you don’t just keep your dragon eyes active all the time.” Kara said as she looked over the scene with amazement.

“Yeah, dragon eyes are so powerful that they are at a loss when you just want to sit and relax like this. They would just target all the things you would want to see, except the unhindered or explained view. Sometimes I don’t want to know why the lake reflects the night sky or why it is just gorgeous to look at.” You agreed.

“So your room small like ours are?” Sarah asked.

“Maybe smaller. All I got is a bed and a desk then the door not 3 feet from that. I guess I won’t be spending a lot of time inside of it. Especially with nights like this. I would feel more comfortable though if I could sleep in dragon form out here.” You answered.

“Why not? They said we couldn’t reveal our form or change while IN school but while this is part of the barrier world it is OUT of school.” Kara asked with a confused look. She had obviously made plans to do so later instead of sleeping in a human bed in such a small room.

“Think about it. We are the only dragons on this world. Not to mention bigger than anyone else that we’ve seen. If we do that, than it will be like broadcasting our status to the world. It would rule the rest of our time here. Everyone would be either too scared to come near us or want to use our power for themselves. Don’t tell me you haven’t already seen that kind of action in small doses around campus.” You explained.

“Yeah I guess you’re right. But you can with only half transforming and such. Then I should concentrate on learning how to support myself and learn how to be a Dragon Ninja, like the two of you.” Kara stated.

“That reminds me, how are with walking? Did you both get around with… explaining all her new… parts?” You asked as you clumsily dodge the subject of open female anatomy. Even as a dragon it was still a social no fly zone.

“Yeah, thanks to a little skirmish with a cheerleader, she learned how to walk, run, and stuff like that rather quickly. And yes I taught her most of the other stuff about being a woman. However we need your help.” She answered but the final little bit got you to look at her as if to ask ‘how can I possibly help with girl problems?’. “Well you see… all we have is my ninja gear and the clothes you gave her. So… we need some money to buy a new set of things that are too... complicated to explain. Otherwise we would ask for you to just materialize it.” With that you all jumped down to the ground to address the situation.

“Well did you acquire some samples?” you asked to which she pulled out a gold coin, a few paper bills, and other assorted coins. Kara demonstrated how she was able dot walk around easily while Sarah explained their individual worth. Apparently the gold coin was the only one that was exclusively for monster like purchases and far more valuable than the others. “Ok then, try to conserve. If word gets around that I can materialize money…” you started but was cut off.

“Don’t worry about that. We are good at keeping secrets.” Kara said with a wink. You just laughed then tossed them each a bag that neither had seen you materialize. They opened to find at least 100 of the gold coins in each, the bags with a magic on them that allowed them to be small yet carry a lot more than a few trucks worth.

“Max… you didn’t have to give us so much.” Sarah said as they both gazed inside the bags. Kara hadn’t been human for long but she was well aware of gold’s value, and now that she needed it to obtain things she wanted in her current situation she shared in her amazement.

“Well, can’t have my sisters cutting corners when they don’t need to. Go ahead and be sure to get what you need without worry. Just don’t act like one of those idiotic and flashy nobles like we all love from home. No reason to flash your wealth like those peacocks.” You said back and they immediately agreed. Another thing you all had in commons was your displeasure with those kind of people. Mainly because the expected Kara to give them rides and Sarah to do… other things with them. Those reasons, plus many more, granted them a unique humility in such situations.

“Max, you’re the best!” Kara said then gave you a hug with Sarah. Afterwards you all headed back to the campus and split soon after revealing what you all learned so far. They almost blew up when they heard what Scott had done but you waved them down so not to make a scene.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: He is her boyfriend.

choices: step aside and and let them handle it.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Can I have your attention please? Yes we have a few new students today. I am sure you’ve been anxiously waiting the students from the other world and we get all three of them, since they are family.” Said the feline, almost neko looking, teacher. She wasn’t in her monster form but with your eyes you could tell what she was. Her human form was kind of typical for a young teacher like her. Although it appeared that she just LOOKED young. Her scent betrayed that despite her 20 something look she was closer to 40. Her light brown hair swished as she looked over to the door and beckoned you three in.

You all turned to face the class to which you observed an assortment of wonder and curiosity from all but two. They happen to be your two acquaintances from the night before. Scott was looking at you as if he thought you were nothing special then started drooling at Kara and Sarah with the rest of the guys. Mia looked at you mostly after looking the other two over. She seemed surprised as she didn’t see any bruise of wound from where her ‘boyfriend’ had hit you.

“Um… Miss. Burg. Why do they smell like humans?” asked Scott in a slightly confronting tone.

“Well they must be really good at their human forms.” She answered before assigning you and your sisters the three seats in the back corner. You were in the corner, while Kara was to your right and Sarah in front of you.

“Hey babe. You smell delicious.” Scott said as he turned around to Kara. Mia was just to the right of him and looked over as if she couldn’t stand his behavior. You couldn’t blame her. He was hitting on Kara while still claiming her. You didn’t really have a good chance to see what he was before, but now you saw that he was an Orc and a large one. He stretched out his tongue as if showing off but you almost cringe at his smell and couldn’t imagine his breath was any better for Kara.

“Ah chew!” Kara sneezed with a fire ball hitting his head and throwing him sideways into the wall. They whole class looked at her as she covered her face daintily. “Oh, I’m sorry. I’m allergic to jerks.” She said with a sniffle to further cover her.

“Scott, will you need to go to the nurse’s office?” asked Miss. Burns while most of the class was stifling some snickers.

“No, I think I’ll be ok.” He said then went back to his seat, the way that avoided making eye contact with your glaring sisters, both with their dragon eyes showing. This also got the others to snap their heads back to the teacher for the rest of the class. This immediately gained her support for you three. Although you saw several times during the course of the class, a certain vampire’s eyes drift to you then back to the board.

The rest of the class was pretty much like that through every subject. Every once in a while a student would get out of line but then another sneeze would come on or an ‘accidental’ kunai would fly that got them to pay acute attention. The only thing you did was put a slight snarl in the air when Scott looked back to you then flashed your eyes at him.

“Max wait up.” Interrupted Mia as she ran up to your small group.

“Go on, you need to practice chakra anyway.” You told Kara as they looked at her then you. Sarah gave you a teasing wink but you just sighed at it. Although it was true, Sarah developed a training schedule for Kara to learn about chakra and jutsu. That along with strict training sessions to improve combat as well. To them walking away you turned to her as she approached. “Mia, good to see you again. Although if Scott tries to pummel me again I might not just shrug it off this time.”

“Oh, I hope he doesn’t. He was kind of forcing me into a relationship with him. He might get jealous but other than that I don’t really care what he thinks. Your sister was right, he is a jerk and I’m glad he got torched.” She returned.

“How is he forcing you? I thought that V… ah… your kind were among the top in this world in terms of strength and overall prowess.” You asked.

“You know what I am? How?” she asked in a shocked tone.

“Well for starters your fangs grow when you’re around someone with a strong human scent for too long, like my sisters and I. The second is that I can tell what each student is just by looking at them and taking in their scent. I get a little confused if I haven’t encountered the type before but in general you all might as well being wearing name tags. So now that I answered your question now answer mine.” You answered but then asked her yours again.

“My father made my seal especially for me. I can’t take it off myself.” She said as she touched a chained cross hanging from her neck, similar to where Kara’s now hung.

“So you can’t transform and he can so he just… what? Forces you to put up with him and that horrid smell?” You asked to which she just looks down then nods. She obviously didn’t like it at all and the fact that she was a vampire was just an added factor. Besides Sarah and Kara, she was easily one of the top 20 hot girls for those who paid attention to that kind of thing. You had never really cared that much as a dragon that could eat her much sooner than consider her visually attractive. It appeared Kara had the same mentality about the guys around her. She had already knocked a few out that made the mistake of touching her without permission and although she was coming along way in such a short amount of time, she still had the habit of snarling when angry.

“Hey babe, get back here!” said the boy as he ran toward you and Mia.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: In class the next day.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Since she was a vampire you were tempted to let her handle it but your pride was getting in the way as well as the sudden urge to implant a kunai in his chest. It only got more of an urge when Scott looked at you and thrust his arm forward as if to back hand you without a second thought. However, unlike the previous night, you weren’t distracted and he was anything but subtle. So you easily caught his arm before it found its mark but when he tried to pull back to either retreat or to try again you didn’t let go.

“You know, I was just going to just let her handle this. That was until you tried to push your weight around and thought I would just let you do it. You must think you’re something special.” You said as you squeezed his arm, causing some bruising and obvious discomfort.

“Ow, get off!” he demanded.

“Careful what you wish for.” You said as he tried to pull you let go and he sent himself flying into a wall.

“You lowly human!” he said, which got more attention than the fight.

“Well if I’m a human than you just got schooled by one. It would actually be a compliment for me.” You retorted that got everyone that chimed in at the mention of a human to agree with you. Normal humans wouldn’t be able to fight a monster and survive, much less win by such a large margin.

“Max, who’s this?” asked Sarah as she and Kara were walking back to you.

“Stop mocking me!” Scott said. He obviously didn’t like that you weren’t taking him seriously or that none of those present was afraid of him. With that his body started to shake and turned into a 20 foot Orc, drooling everywhere. You looked around to see that you were just outside the school so he the most trouble he would get is for revealing his monster identity.

“Wow, didn’t think he could smell any worse.” You said with a smile that spread to Sarah and Kara.

“You think this is funny?!” roared Scott then stretched his thick and slimy tongue out and grabbed Kara by the ankle. Pulling it back he lifted her up into the air in front of him.

“Eww, you smell disgusting.” She said as she felt the drool from the tongue travel down her leg and drip onto her in various spots.

“Max, aren’t you going to help her?” Mia asked as she saw neither you nor Sarah was moving to do so. In fact you were both smiling a bit.

“She’s not the one in trouble. You see, Kara hasn’t really had a successful time controlling herself and gets a little carried away. And she has a temper.” You explained. Mia listened then looked at a flustered Kara just as she let out a good amount of flame breath. It was slightly comical to see it in her human form but it still did the job of roasting Scott’s face and tongue enough to drop her.

“You slimy… disgusting… perverted… sorry excuse for a monster… get… out… of… my… sight!” Kara said between blows that sent Scott into walls and trees. Each hit broke at least a few bones and made the observers cringe until her last word in which she kicked him and he flew about 100 feet and landed unconscious on the ground by the entrance. “What!?” she growled at the stunned crowd, making them start clapping making her, to their relief, calm down.

“Ok, now we have to get you a bath before training. There is no way I am going to train you smelled like that.” Sarah said and another round of comical bickering started as they both waved then left to the direction they were going as if nothing happened.

“Your sister is… strong.” Mia stated but she was obviously just as scared as everyone else.

“She’s a little rough around the edges right now. Her first time in human form so she gets a little moody. The real scary one is Sarah.” You said back.

“Can I walk with you?” she asked as you started walking toward the lake.

“Yeah, the road is open.” You answered. She hurried to your side and you both walked away from the growing crowd around the defeated and unconscious orc.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: help her out.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So Mia, you drink blood right?” asked Sarah.

“Yeah” she retorted. It had only been a week but Mia had hung around you and them all the time. Maybe it was because you were one of the few people that didn’t look at her by gawking at her and you didn’t care that she was a Vampire. Either way you all were now in the small group that protected each other and with Kara quickly learning jutsu and other ninja related tasks Mia was the only one that needed it, sometimes. As a vampire, even a sealed one, she was capable of many things.

“So I how can you eat normal food?” Sarah asked as she finished the sandwich she was eating and the others were completing their meals as well.

“I only really NEED blood about once a month. Like a transfusion since my normal blood isn’t really normal. I need blood that does what its suppose to do and for that I drink fresh blood from the living. But normal food satisfies my hunger and boosts energy just like anyone else.” Mia explained and glanced over to see that you, again, didn’t care she drank people’s blood. In fact none of you did.

“Well, no offense, but I’m glad I don’t have to do it. I mean just stopping at blood seams wasteful to me. But I guess we all have our ways.” Kara said.

“You know, it’s not fair that I don’t even know what you all are and you know about me.” Mia stated.

“Hey, it’s not our fault that the school has that rule.” Kara said in a pouty voice.

“But we can just go into the forest and no one will know, and it is outside school” she defended.

“Why do you want to know so badly? I mean it isn’t like it will change who we are or anything.” You asked.

“It isn’t anything that complicated, I just was curious. You three are so strong but no one knows what you are. Well except the teachers, they treat you like royalty or something.” She answered.

“Maybe they just like us…” Sarah teased to which laughed and Mia stuck her tongue out at her. While your home room teacher like the group for keeping the class attentive, most of the other teachers had tried to assert control over one of you at one point or another and didn’t get a very good response for their attempt.

“It’s not that we don’t trust you or anything. It’s just a pain to change back to our monster forms. On top of that we would be more inclined to act more primal in that state. Coupled with our desire to keep it a secret we would probably kill or eat anyone who ‘accidentally’ saw. So I guess we could tell you we get the time but defiantly not show you. Does that make any sense?” You asked.

“I guess. I still would like to see them eventually but I can wait. Maybe over summer break we can go to where you live and I can see it.” She suggested.

“Yeah… about that.” Sarah said which snapped Mia back to the three of you in confusion.

“You see, we are from another world and for complicated reasons we can’t go back. Which means we have no home in this world. Hopefully we find one but if not we’ll be pretty stuck” Kara explained.

“Well, maybe you can stay with me.” She suggested.

“Again, no offense but our personalities and that of normal vampires would probably clash. We think we are the top of the food chain. And I hear that is a sentiment that your kind also believes. So… it might be a little awkward for us to say otherwise and expect to still be housed. Not to mention each predator should have their own territory.” You input, but Sarah seemed to be getting uncomfortable with monster talk as she was the only human there, and no one besides you and Kara knew.

“Then can I help you at least find a place?” she asked.

“Of course. You know more about this world than we do. Thanks Mia, you’re the best.” Kara said as she gave her a comical hug. Kara had just figured out how good more subtle bodily contact could feel. As a dragon the pressure points and sensual contact was done differently so she was just learning why and how her body worked in that regard.

“Ok, ok. Come on will you stop that. You know how good you all smell.” She said as she pushed Kara off her in a more playful manner.

“But you said you wouldn’t drink our blood.” Sarah stated.

“I did, but you three just smell so good it is hard to resist.” She teased and for some reason, unknown to her, Sarah was the only one to react to such teasing. It made her wonder what monster you three were and if she was actually scared of her.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A week later.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok, now that we are in the forest you said you were going to tell me what kind of monsters you are.” Mia said as she had been sealing her mouth and patiently waiting. But now what the moment had come she was getting very anxious for what you and the others were.

“Ok I guess I’ll go first.” Sarah said to which Mia looked at her. “I’m a human.”

“What! You can’t be a human. Humans can’t throw orcs around like bouncy balls and shoot fire, not to mention your eyes that show every once in a while.” Mia stated.

“Well that’s because I am a dragon ninja. Max gave me dragon eyes and I was trained as a ninja so… I know how to do really cool stuff the trumps most monsters but I am still just a human.” She admitted.

“Does that make you two human as well?” Mia asked as she looked at you and Kara.

“No… well kind of. We decided that you should, despite our bias against it, see our monster forms. So now that you know Sarah is human we can show you what we are. Remember that I said we were adopted family and since Kara finished basic ninja training we are all dragon ninja. Kara, if you please.” You answered then she jumped to her right and touched the seal on the necklace. There was a bright light then Kara was back to normal.

“Holy crap! You… you’re… a… dragon?” Mia asked as she fell over, looking up at Kara who flexed her wings and looked down, almost blushing.

“Yes, I am.” Was all she could say. Mia shuffled back until she hit a tree then stood and braced against it. “Max, I don’t think you should transform. If she’s that scared of me then she’s going to freak when she sees you.”

“Why, he a dragon to?” Mia asked.

“Well more accurately I am what’s known as a half-breed. But unlike the ones over in this world I’m not some kind of anthro. Although I can grow parts like this.” you said as you grew some of you dragon parts to make your point then retracted them. “In my world, the half- breed can go from all human to all dragon. So in a sense I am 100% human, but being a half-breed allows me to keep all my powers as a 100% dragon in human form and likewise in dragon form. So I do have a very large and apparently very frightening dragon form I can turn to, but I won’t do it if you’re not ready.”

“I need to see it.” She answered.

“Ok then, here it goes.” You said then exploded into your dragon form. The trees and earth that blew away impeded her vision for s short time but you were hard to miss as you laid down and ducked your head so others didn’t see.

“You’re huge!” she said as she looked over you. You didn’t flex your wings but then again you didn’t have to and doing so would only broadcast your position.

“So… you’re ok with this?” You asked as you looked directly at her.

“How could she not. You two are the most awesome friends and family someone could ask for.” Sarah said as she jumped on your snout then hugged it. “I mean dragons are so cool and I’m a sister to two of um. And in this world your two are only known my myth and legend.”

“Well Mia, what do you think? Can you be friends with a human and two dragons?” Kara asked as you three looked at the very shocked and impressed vampire. It wasn’t every day that a dragon asks to be her friend.

“I… think… I… can… handle that…” she said between breaths then passed out. In a split second after that you and Kara were back into human form just as some students came by and ran as soon as they saw all your eyes, still having them out from the transformation and explanation. You three had become well known in the school and as such was certain tells and one of those were each of the group’s eye chance.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Telling Mia the truth.

choices: Mia's sister comes in to check on her, with you around.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You didn’t think that just leaving her there would be a good idea so, while the other two went back to their rooms, you took her to the nurse’s office and sat with her until she woke up. Her eyes fluttered open, looking around the familiar setting of the room. At one point or another, every person in the school visits the nurse’s office so her heart was beating at a normal pace. That is until she saw you sitting next to her. Her heartbeat jumped and you could hear it race but to her credit she didn’t show her temporary fright then suppressed it.

“Hey there Mia, you get a good rest?” you asked with a light smile.

“Yeah… what happened?” she asked with a confused face, remembering what happened prior to her fainting.

“You fainted and we didn’t think it would be considerate of us to let you sleep it off in the woods. So I brought you here while the others went back to their rooms. I stuck around to make sure you were ok and to answer any other questions you might have.” You answered.

“So all that… it really happened. So that’s why you three are so strong?” she finished.

“In a nut shell. Sarah is still…” you said before remembering that a few others were in the room. “…well she’s slightly different than Kara or I but we are still family. She is actually strong enough to beat Kara in a fair fight.”

“How can you all be family when your all so… different?” she asked. Your face almost immediately got remorseful and sad with a touch of anger.

“We… all three of us were abandoned by our parents in different fashions that demonstrated more hate than love. We found each other and bonded almost instantly through that. Eventually we were the only ones to trust in each other like a family should so we just made it official. While not related by blood or species we are no less family than any other out there. We each have our own story and demons in our pasts but love each other regardless.” You responded as if you were looking into your own memories before snapping back to her.

“So, what’s your story?” she asked out of pure curiosity before she could stop herself. Before she could make it right you separated yourself from her. Until that point you had your hand on her’s to sooth her emotions and provide stability.

“Glad you’re feeling better.” You ended with as you exited the room. While you felt comfortable sharing what you are with her, you didn’t even like thinking about what was in your past.

Most people got out of your way when you were walking. They knew that you wouldn’t beat the crap out of them for no reason so they made sure there wasn’t one. Besides, out of you and your sisters, you were the nice one by far and much more understanding. You made it to your room without really remembering how you got there then fell into bed after closing the door. Tear streamed down your face for reasons you didn’t know or were aware of at the time. Maybe it was the sudden overlook of your past and what had happened since then. You fell asleep emotionally confused and dampening your sheets with tears.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She wakes and is calm.

choices: Lesson learned is a lesson earned.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Mia was a little more careful around you when asking questions. Not for fear of you as a dragon, but because she obviously brought up a sore topic when she asked about your past. Honestly, you didn't really know why you reacted like you did. You hadn't cried in so long that you hadn't stopped for a while. Sarah, Mia, and Kara stopped by and saw you in that state. Your bed was actually soaked with tears. They helped cheer you up but were as confused as you were. They had never seen you cry before. Maybe it was pent up feelings from years of unfortunate and bad things. Or maybe having to leave a really good place and reminding yourself of what all the other places were. Maybe everyone in your home was gone forever was another side. It could've been all or none of those. So you pushed it out of your mind for the time being and focused on school, friends, and family. It was such a day when the 4 of you walking around the school when some commotion interrupted your conversation with them.

"Can you believe how he just took a swing at Max?" Kara asked.

"Yeah, and Max was just like, 'hey, did something just hit me or was that a mosquito?' The idiot was so freaked out he just ran off." Sarah laughed out as you all joined her in laughing. Not a lot of people were dumb enough to pick fights with your group. One at a time, sure, but not when all of you were there at the same time. But you all weren't bullies or anything. In fact, you were the people that deterred bullies, which made your group favorites with many of the others.

"FOUND YOU!!!" Came a voice that was getting closer. You instinctually dodged a person coming from behind but caught the young lady in midair, holding her up so she was dangling in front of all of you.

"Mira...??? What are you doing here?" Mia asked as she looked at her hanging from your grip.

"Oh, just hanging out. Can you tell your boyfriend to put me down?" she asked in a playful and irritated tone. You couldn't figure out if she was irritated that her attack, or lack there of, was so easily avoided or that she had lost any and all momentum in whatever she was trying to do. Perhaps both.

"Mia, you know her?" You asked, looking over to her. She nodded her head in both an answer and a request for you to let her down. You did so slowly so she wasn't dropped.

"That means I can't torch her?" Kara whined.

"Please don't. She didn't know any better and she is my sister." Mia answered to which all of you looked her over than Mia, then back to Mira.

"Really? I don't see the resemblance." Sarah remarked. She was right. Mia had long pink hair that flowed very well. She had a very long but attractive figure that was curvy when it needed but not so much to be considered by anyone to be too much. Mira had orange hair, freckles, short body type, and had a few pounds to lose. Her face wasn't even close to Mia's.

"What do you know? Human..." Mira blurted out, the last part obviously meaning in an insult. You and Kara froze at this and Mia sprung into action as she say Sarah's eyes narrow.

"Sure I am human. You have a problem with that... little girl?" Sarah asked, her temper rising. Sure people teased her from time to time. But not too many were stupid enough to insult her outright. Her glare alone was making Mira back down. She further glared as she bent down and glared daggers into Mira's eyes. Obviously not relying on her non human friends to help her. At this distance, a Vampire could decapitate a normal human in a flash and even you wouldn't be able to get there in time, despite being only a few feet away. But the only person in danger here was NOT Sarah.

"N...no Ma'am..." Mira stuttered out. Wither she knew why or not, this human was extremely scary.

"Good answer." Sarah commented as she backed off and bounded off. "Let's go Kara, training time."

"Awe, why do I have to get beat on because she called you a human?" Kara whined.

"NOW KARA!" Sarah hollered back that got Kara to stepping and bounding after her. "Max, you deal with Miss. Rude Bloodsucker. Next time being Mia's sister won't save her"

"You got it grumpy." You teased to which she and Kara both glared at you, for different reasons. Sarah for the tease and Kara for you making her training partner even more riled up. They turned and were on their way. "Mia..."

"Yeah I know." Mia said before you could advise her. She turned to address her shocked sister. "First, NEVER EVER talk that way to those two. Second, why are you here?"

"Can't I just visit you?" Mira asked.

"Sure you could!" Mia answered a pleasant smile. "But I know you better than that Sis."

"Fine... I was getting lonely at home. I want my sister back, and not this low version that you are. Why don't you take off your seal so the real you can come out?" Mira relented.

"Because we aren't allowed to. Plus, you know that Father made this seal so that I can't just take it off. I don't even know how. But I am still me." She responded. True enough, you hadn't actually seen her true form yet. Apparently, the seal had other effects than just altering her form and power. It had a 'nice' filter too. It made two separate but connected versions of Mia. You could almost sense the other side. But that seal was strong enough to keep you out if you weren't using a considerable amount of force. The kind that would rip her mind in half.

"Until I find a way to get that thing off." Mira stated as she started backing Mia down, but only to back into you. She looked at you as did Mira. "I could always kick your boyfriend's ass..."

"You could try." You stated with a little growl that made her back off a little. "Being Mia's sister has got you some grace in this rude streak you have going. But not much. You best be careful. I might like playing this game with people, at times, but Sarah.... you must be crazy to insult her. Also, we are trying to keep it a secret that she is human."

"What makes you think I won't tell everyone about..." She started to which you interrupted her by making your eyes glow and closing the gap between the two of you in seconds, having a mere inch between the two of your faces.

"You would have a better chance fighting us than surviving after you let Sarah's secret go." You said then you three looked to a commotion.

"PERVERT !!!" Came Sarah's voice to which a large "Boom" was heard, then a creature scream, followed by an airborne monster of some kind that was easily over 50 feet tall. You all could see that its face was caved in and it was heading toward a small cliff. It impacted the underside of it with a crash then fell with a much of the cliff itself. The monster in question was a flame demon that was a very accomplished peeping tom. He was really good at melting into the area and was almost impossible to find. But his kind were also REALLY powerful. Which is why other student didn't make him stop.

"As you can see, she isn't in the best mood right now." You highlighted. Mira just nodded dumbly to which both you and Mia sighed that she finally got it. It was oddly fortunate that the pervert was there to help things along in his own way. You doubted that is what he intended, but he was actually of use for once.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Mia's sister comes in to check on her, with...

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Going through the portal wasn’t that bad this time around, probably because you weren’t ignorant like before as well as not half dead in both body and mind. However on the other side you were bombarded with a lot of noise and an overload in sensory projection. It took you a while but with your natural athletic and physical prowess you avoided people until you could tell what was going on. Over the course of a month you learned a lot about this new realm you were in. For one there was no magic, at all, well accept what you knew. The buildings around you were so big that it memorized you. You were shown what a computer was by some kid then you spent a good amount of time learning all you could. You both learned and saw that the military hardware could take you down if they wanted and that it was an extremely bad idea to reveal anything about your other side. Luckily for you, when you worked your way into the system, your blood was human with a small abnormality in it. What they didn’t know what that it was your dragon blood seeping through the seams of your human side. Shortly after you learned what you needed you acquired your identity, without bringing up suspicion, as well as a small house in which you bought with gold since you didn’t know enough about money to materialize it. But that was a problem that easily was fixed via internet and experimentation. You were delighted to know that while you would no doubt be a subject of scientific interest if found, dragons were considered fiction in this realm by most people. A problem arose soon after you started phoning in crimes that you smelled from your house. The city was huge and you didn’t know everything about it but your senses could smell blood from miles away so you phoned in locations until one day when you opened your door to a group of people.

“Hello, can I help you?” you asked as you saw a few police officers and people you recognized from walking around murder scenes as they solved them. They were fascinating to you and it was a good thing you could see them from afar or they would’ve noticed you right away.

“Yes, I’m Gil Grissom with the Las Vegas Crime Lab and this is Sara Sidle. Are you Max Drake?” He one of the men you recognized asked.

“Yes.” You answered as you looked them all over in a general setting, eyes resting on specific things like a badge, gun, field kits, and sight line.

“Do you mind if we come in?” he asked.

“Do I need to ask for a warrant or is it at least partially a social call?” You asked.

“We just need to ask you a few questions. You placed over a dozen calls in the last month the Police Department of murders and other violent crimes before the crimes were even fully committed. We just are here on curiosity more than anything.” He answered. You nodded then ushered them in. Your house was very neat and open with comfortable couches and not a spot of anything misplaced. Mainly because you liked flexing your wings in the house and needed both the room and the privacy to do so. “Hmm, very clean in here. Never saw something this vacant of activity before.”

“I’ll take that as a compliment. I do have my secrets like most but I worked hard so they couldn’t be seen on the surface, nor any other activities that would put someone off. I do have to occasional visitor but that is easy enough to clean after.” You responded. The officers remained standing as the two sat on a couch and you in the chair opposing them.

“So you want to tell us how you can report these things so quickly?” The human named Sarah asked.

“Would you believe that call from here?” you asked and they both gave you a skeptical look. “I recently lost all my memory and the government had to make a new identity for me. Since then I have been walking around the city to get to know the place. It’s a big place. You’d be surprised what you can see just by taking a walk. Anyway, when I hear a gunshot, scream, or something like that then smell blood I call and report it. I know that going anywhere near the scene will just place me as a suspect and in some cases the only one. So I do what I can with the limited exposure at my disposal.”

“So when you hear someone scream out for help you don’t bother running to help?” Sarah asked.

“I don’t know the law that well but I have seen your unit work and know what I’ve already told you. I also know that by the time I get over there I would just be contaminating the scene and they would probably be dead by that point. Not to mention that I’ve almost been shot before and don’t really want to repeat the experience, especially if I can’t shoot back.” You answered.

“The law doesn’t say anything about self-defense in such situations.” Grissom said.

“It doesn’t matter. One bullet is all it takes to take another life and I want no part of it or the aftermath. I intervene and there is at least one more death added to the scope when you and your… team could’ve solved it without the extra casualty.” You retorted back.

“One reason we are asking is… we are investigating a murder that you called in. We were hoping you could share something you saw.” Sara admitted.

“I only smelled the blood and heard a shank before I called it in. Thinking back from it I would say that it is a bladed attack but not seeing a body I can only guess. But the sound was refined and swift, like someone who was using a sword and knew what they were doing.” You reported.

“You gathered that by just the smell and sound?” Grissom asked.

“Yes, and I know about that world a little. For someone to not scream but be cut down with a single stroke of a sword and disappear enough to not make an additional sound. That has to be someone very skilled and very efficient, like a ninja or something like that.” You returned.

“Ninja?” Sarah asked skeptically.

“Or something like that. Bare minimum someone that could use a weapon like that and assassinate someone well enough to get you guys stumped. Probably not the work of an amateur and not someone who sticks around after completion. Unless you know of another assassin like group in your society that uses bladed weapons rather than firearms I would not rule out a ninja of some caliber.” You answered.

“It appears you didn’t hear me. Maybe this will clear things up for you.” You returned and in a single snap of your fingers they dropped a few inches as the vault and weapons dematerialized and disappeared from view. “Go ahead and do what you want since it doesn’t seem to make a difference if I want you to or not.”

“How… did you do that?” Sara asked. As the others looked around, Grissom trying to find out how you did it and the officers in shock.

“Doesn’t really matter does it. You’ll believe what you think regardless of what I say. Now it appear like I get my first arrest on this.” You said as you walked over to the officers and they escorted you out of the house. You could hear the two of them try and figure it out and almost laughed. Magic was fake in this realm and not a lot of people even suspected otherwise. You had successfully dematerialized everything that could be used against you as well as the vast library of scrolls and books containing your research and jutsu lists, along with their instruction.

You were drove to the police station and put in a cell. You ignored the others in the room, taking the time to take a nap until you were shook awake by a larger man.

“This is a jail cell not a vacation, let’s go.” The man ordered to which he and another officer led your back down hallways then sat you in a room that you recognized as what the internet described as an interrogation room. You were left alone in the room so you looked around from your seat. You could see clearly through the one sided glass but didn’t allow them to know, heck you could hear and almost smell them through the thing layer and under the doors. You almost smiled as you could hear that they were confused.

They were letting you “Sweat” or so they said but you almost fell asleep yet again. Seeing that what they were trying wasn’t working they came in to talk with you. The large man was first, followed by the two you already knew while two others remained behind the glass. They started by placing photos in front of you. They were of a business man sliced in two like you’d expect from your limited observation.

“Detective Jim Brass, we didn’t get a chance to introduce ourselves. But then again you know this guy, don’t you?” he said as he fingered one of the photos.

“He’s a wealthy business man of some kind, not sure beyond that.” You responded.

“So you do this to people you don’t know? I doubt it.” He responded back.

“I didn’t kill this man. Not my style and far too low. It’s obvious to me that the killer went for the easy kill rather than the skillful one. What a mess.” You answered.

“If you were going to kill him, how would you do it then?” He asked.

“With a sword or in general?” you asked.

“Let’s start with a sword then go to the general.” Grissom chimed in.

“Well, with a sword I would’ve attacked from behind and penetrated the heart and left before he hit the pavement, I may have punctured a few other organs judging on the amount of exposure and time I had but this would be too clean up later. In general I would’ve brushed passed him, slicing him in an unnoticed spot with a poisoned Kunai. The type would numb the area so he would die in front of someone else and switch the suspects up then found an alibi for myself, or if it was a hit then I would already have one in place.” You answered.

“What proof do you have that you didn’t do this?” Sara asked.

“About as much as you have to put me there, which is not much. But don’t worry, I learned my lesson in this whole thing.” You responded to which she looked at you confused.

“You’re lesson?” Grissom asked.

“Yes, there is a lesson in everything we observe if we are willing to see it. This one was that it was not smart of me to interfere in your affairs. I thought I was helping by calling in the crimes that my ninja senses could detect. I was wrong so I learned that and it won’t happen again.” You said and immediately could tell that is not what they wanted to get across.

“No, that not what we meant for you to do.” Sara stated.

“Doesn’t really matter either way. Looks like you all don’t need the help. So if it causes this kind of trouble then there’s no point . It was a mistake to do it in the first place and my consequence is arrest, jail, and the destruction of all my ninja gear and research.” You responded.

“Yes, well for me anyway. Did you kill that business man out of a mission or freelance?” You asked.

“Does it really matter?” She asked as she moved around so her voice couldn’t be tracked.

“To me it does. I guess another way of asking is… Are you a rouge ninja?” you asked.

“Would you consider stopping that life if you had another option?” You asked.

“What do you mean?” she asked.

“If you did some time then were able to live free would you accept it?” You asked.

“How much time?” she asked.

“Well Detective Brass if she gave you her client how much time would she do for it.” You asked.

“Mandatory life sentence. She has murdered multiple people and may good police officers. There’s no jury or government in the world that would condone that.” He almost hissed out.

“Well in that case I can’t exactly ask you to just come in now can I? Instead I’ll give you a trade. You give them hard proof of every client that you’ve worked for in the last year, including this one, and I’ll give you a give you this.” you said as you materialized a scroll then threw it to her. She was somewhat surprised that you knew where she was but in any case she opened it and a gasp could be heard.

“What is this?” She asked.

“That is a ninja technique from ancient times of this country. I found it a while back and mastered it.” You stated.

“Why would you give this to me?” She asked.

“It was a trade. If you accept then you will do no more assassinations and give your client list with hard proof to these people. If you don’t accept then it looks like you and I will have a little showdown. However, knowing that I am capable of that technique should tell you that I am not amateur.” You answered.

“Magic?” Warrick asked as the rest of them were very skeptical but, since they had seen you do some rather interesting things, kept the option open for explanation.

The light turned into little particles then started to come together, floating in midair as they started to form something solid. You continued and soon they could see the starting of a pizza and one they all would eat. Soon the pizza was done and you got to work on the box. Soon after you brought the other hand and materialized a table in similar fashion then placed the floating pizza box on the table. Then you sat back and gestured to the box for them to analyze it. Anything that has the seal and/or contract can be summoned to another space. So that is how I get around town so quickly. I have marked areas with certain seals and can just… go there in an instant. Still have to walk from there to the final destination and it does have a range limit.”

“I am not going to say I understand, because I don’t, but I do understand the words you are saying. I never thought someone would prove magic in front of me.” Grissom said.

“You want to see another? I have a healing spell that is very effective but dangerous.” You said.

“What do you mean?” Sarah asked.

“The spell takes someone else’s problem, wither it be a paper cut or severed body part, and transfers it to me. That way my body can combat it and, as you have seen before, my body is better at healing than most people. However it still carries a risk that I will not be able to heal. I’m not all powerful, obviously.” You explained.

“What can you take?” Captain Brass asked as he was sick of taking a back seat to what the rest of them were so interested in.

“Well, I haven’t taken in anything yet that I couldn’t handle. Although the more sever the wound and problem to more affected my body is until it is fixed. I’ve actually cured someone of cancer before, spent a week unconscious and a month after that bed ridden but it still worked. Grissom, if you’d allow me?” you asked as you pointed to his ear. By this time everyone knew he had a hearing problem. He was hesitant but leaned forward to you. Then, reaching up, you placed a hand on either side of his head the magic took effect as light both kept him from moving and also entered his ears, then came out as if transferring the energy of his problem to your hands. You slouched for a moment and leaned back with your eyes closed and thankfully his problem wasn’t as bad as you thought. It took about 5 minutes to heal then you opened your eyes to address them. “How do you feel?” you asked.

“You did that as if it was nothing. I’m feeling fine, how are you feeling?” he returned.

“It was a little dizzy while my body dealt with the problem but it’s over now so I feel fine.” You said.

“Ok, just so I don’t end up fainting from shock.” Greg said then got up and walked a little bit away. “This is the most awesome thing in the world!” he yelled as if expelling the excess excitement then went over and sat back down.

“Max, there is one more thing. It’s been bothering me for a while and now especially after that little demonstration.” Grissom said as he rounded the topic to figure out how to say it. “Assuming that what you are saying is true, a human can’t do anything of what you do and especially not survive the things you’ve admitted to surviving. Forgive me for saying this but, and I wouldn’t even thing this a possibility before your little demonstration but… The way you act and react indicated that you aren’t human. Am I just assuming to much or am I actually accurate in that assumption?” He asked.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: "...will keep your secrets."

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Your eyes suddenly went downcast as you remembered all the times people have asked this of you and overreacted, right away or down the road. You weren’t really paying attention but they could see the sudden change in mood as Grissom asked his question. Normally they would just let it go and forget about it. However the question asked and the slightest indication that it was accurate spurred a great amount of curiosity. But it didn’t make them blind to the obvious mental strain it had on you.

“I see that my question has struck truth. But there is obvious pain behind it. You should know that no matter what you say or are, we will still feel the same way about you.” Grissom stated.

“Even if I am something that could devour you all in seconds?” you asked in a cryptic yet directed direction.

“The fact that we are all still here means that you’ve already shown restraint if that is the case.” Grissom responded and his answer brought the others back from the shock of what the question brought up. They didn’t know what they’d do if you turned out to be what you said. But he had answered it in a way and with a tone that indicated that they knew better.

“Well ok, here goes nothing. I should start out by saying that I’m not from this realm. Realm meaning I am from earth but… different. The best way to describe it is if you could enter a movie and live in that world or realm. You’re not fictional by any means but that is the closest thing to explain it. I arrived by a portal from another realm that kicked me out for being potentially dangerous, too dangerous to keep around. I know my kind have come here before because of the legends and myth surrounding my kind but it has been a while.” You said but saw a million questions pop up in their expressions.

“That’s impossible…” Sara said as they others just took it in.

“So is magic and I can do it just fine. Look, minus taking you to another realm there is no way to prove it so you’re just gonna have to trust me on that one. Although that is where my kind has come from in your realm’s history. Care to take a guess on what I am?” You asked, trying to lighten the mood a little.

“What? Are you saying you’re like a dragon of something?” Catherine asked in confusion but you suddenly looked at her with a face that indicated she had said something right. It didn’t take them long to figure out what she had said. “You got to be kidding me. A dragon, they are just fictional or at best myth. No one has ever proven the existence of dragons.”

“Tells you how long it’s been, doesn’t it?” you almost stated but looked down again. You were expecting them to freak out but then again they hadn’t actually seen you in that form yet so they had a little ways to go.

“You wouldn’t be willing to prove it would you?” Nick asked.

“Well… to be honest. Every time I have it brings the same result. In all my time I have met a total of 3 people, dragon or human, that accept me. Pretty much everyone else wants me dead just for being what I am. You have no idea what it feels like to be hated by literally billions of people when you’ve done nothing to spawn such hatred. My own mother hated me the day I was born. I like you people and I don’t want you to hate me to.” You said as you fought to remain emotionally stable but that fight was seen through your expressions and speech.

“Why would your mother hate you?” Catherine asked, being one herself.

“My type of dragon is called Dark Hunters. The most powerful type of dragon by far. We are like… a dragon version of Spartans where only the strong survive and as such we are feared by dragon and human. Dragons in general are not really that friendly so this only makes us more dangerous. Dark hunter females are about twice as powerful as the males except for one. Every 50 generations a single male is born that is known as a ‘Half-breed’ or a ‘King’. A Dark Hunter King has all the genetic knowledge of the Kings before him as well as genetic power and intelligence. Physically a King maxes out at double a Queen’s max, Queen’s being 250 and a King being 500 feet tall and proportionally long. There are two ways to tell off the bat if a hatchling is a King. The first is red eyes instead of orange eyes for males and blue for female. The second is if the hatchling is human when breaking out of one’s egg, then turns dragon. That one is one reason why humans don’t like Kings either. If a human can turn into a dragon to evade or catch them off guard then they got problems to say the least. So… when my mother saw me and being the head Queen she grabbed me minutes after me hatching, chewed me up and spat me off our mountain with disgust and distain. There was no love, not kindness, and because of Dark Hunter’s status in my home world, no mercy from anyone else either. But I survived and here I am despite the odds.” You said in a retelling of your mother’s rejection, or the short version anyway.

“So you’re being one of these ‘half-breeds’ is why you appear human now?” Warrick asked.

“Yes, I can grow dragon parts to help me and I have all my draconic powers in this form. However transforming is insanely painful, even with the jutsu I developed to make it instantaneous it is no picnic. Not to mention my fear of rejection. I can show you my dragon parts that I can bring out in human form. Those don’t hurt when I form them.” you offered.

“Why does it hurt for you to transform and not to grow… parts?” Asked Nick.

“Because going from a 6 foot tall human to a 500 foot tall dragon is a bigger change. My body literally has to rip itself apart to change, generate and destroy organs, and grow parts that are not applicable to the other body. For example, my dragon body has two stomachs and a human only has one. So I have grow a stomach and the organs to make it function then destroy it when going to human form.” You explained.

“Well can we see…”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Tell them the rest.

choices: Someone's coming, back to human form.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“I guess I should get it all out there. Come with me than.” You said as you got up and went to the vault door that led into the rest of the compound. It opened to which they all quickly followed and watched it close behind them before following you. “Ok, since my jutsu is, in a manner of speaking, an explosion, I need to do this the old fashion way. It hurts a lot so that is why I will be snarling. I has nothing to do with any emotion of feral behavior.” You stated.

“Max, thank you for doing this. You don’t have to if you don’t want. You’ve told us more than enough.” Grissom stated which made the others look at him but then realize that he was right, again. Grissom had a tendency to be right. So people tended to listen when he spoke.

“Just don’t panic and stuff and we’ll call it even. Now stay there.” You instructed as you walked into the open space then turned to face them. They nodded to you and you to them then started. Doubling over, dragon parts started coming from you and even though you were use to the pain it hardly helped when transforming like this. You kept it more contained but your claws were making trenches in the 20 foot thick titanium floor as they grew. After about 5 minutes of growing, growling, snarling, and puffing you were done and collapsed onto the floor. You were breathing heavily as you recovered and looked at them. Brass had his gun out, as did some of the others but Grissom quickly told them to holster them. For starters they wouldn’t do anything to what laid before them, that much was obvious at this point. You struggled to a more comfortable and composed position and was grateful that you built the complex with such a high roof as you could stretch out and so you did. Your wings stretched out then returned to your back as did the other parts after being suppressed in human form for so long. Finally you were composed enough to speak with them. “I’m done.”

“S…so this is you as a… d…dragon?” Catherine asked, remarkably before Grissom as he was too entranced with the sight of you to put a sentence together, at the moment. You answered with a nod as every movement you made had them on edge.

“I’ve got to be dreaming. I mean this kind of thing only happens in dream. That and movies, TV show, Mag…”

“Greg!” Warrick interrupted which ended his almost panicked rambling. “So can you do that magic stuff like this to?” He asked as he changed the subject slightly. You looked over at the trenches you made and they filled up like nothing happened. “Cool.”

“I… This is very… we could use you the force you know?” Brass said as he tried to comprehend the situation a little more.

“I think the point of him keeping it a secret was the opposite side of that. Do you really think that once others got wind of this that they would let him stay here? At best he would be a lab rat and zoo attraction.” Grissom stated and again they came back to the fact that he was right and you were still a person, just… bigger and with teeth, very large teeth. “So this is why you built this place so big.”

“Yes, I wanted a space I could stretch out and a roof so I could fly away if it was necessary. I can’t fly for fun because of satellites and other technology you humans have in this realm. I really do miss flying but in any case it is… cramped I guess to be in human form all the time.” You answered.

“So being a… dragon, you can do all that other stuff right; breathing fire, magic, flying, and other stuff like that?” Nick asked.

“Mostly yes. Although most of your realms facts about dragons have been idolized and obscured over the many centuries since the last one arrived and no I don’t know when that was. I can’t grant wishes minus what I can do via magic and other draconic abilities and there is one ability that I won’t do anymore.” You stated.

“Ah… which one is that?” asked Sara, as she was the one yet to react and was dead set on reacting better than the others.

“In the last realm I learned all my ninja skills and went on missions both as a dragon and as a human. For people without planes and cars I was quite useful. But one mission I was assigned was a rescue and aid mission because of me medical skills as I’ve already shown. But there is one place that I can perform healing spells that can cure almost anything without taking it into myself. So I put them in my second stomach in which I can increase my healing powers by at least 10 or more depending on the situation. When I got back I was tired from fighting and healing the people in that stomach so I drifted from consciousness but, as you can imagine, someone finding out I ate a bunch of people without the reason can be problematic. So they…” you started then rolled over so they could clearly see the scars.

“My goodness… they did all this?” Catherine asked as they looked at all the scares that riddled your dragon body.

“No, just this one.” You said as you traced the cut they made with your claw then went back to a more proper position. “The rest were from my mother when she tried killing me as a child. Anyway, they couldn’t get me to cough them up so they cut them out of me and sewed bombs inside to use afterward and use them they did. So that is the only ability I won’t use. It is probably a source of comfort for you but I will not eat anyone that is good or a friend, even to heal them.”

“Why couldn’t you cough them up?” Greg asked.

“For one I was unconscious from the energy I used in flying so far, healing them, fighting and a few other things. Second, they were in the middle of healing so removing them would’ve killed them from the shock alone. They were pretty bad off and in critical condition.” You answered to which they started to understand.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: "... you as a full dragon."

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
At that moment you heard a beep that indicated someone was entering the human section of your area. Not a lot of other people had the ability to get in but you couldn’t take the chance.

“Crap, someone’s coming.” You said then started to snarl again and in a matter of a few minutes you were back to human just as someone’s cell phone went off. You were, at this point, laying on the floor and steaming from the relatively cold body from your dragon one. Grissom spoke with the person calling then hung up. From his conversation, it appear it was the sheriff… again.

“Max, are you ok?” asked Grissom as they moved to you.

“Just tired. Transforming takes a lot out of me. Probably nature’s way to make sure I don’t go on random rampages after changing.” You said as you tried to get up but fell down again. You tried again but was caught by Warrick and Nick, who let you lean on them and was pretty much carrying you.

“Hey, can’t sleep yet. We need you to open the door.” Warrick said as they carried you and the others followed. When you got to the door you opened it for them to which they all went through and that ended your consciousness. It reminded you of why you made the jutsu to get to dragon or human form. You woke to a mostly empty room and on the couch you had in the human area. To your movement you saw Grissom look up from his book to address you.

“Ironic, the very act of you becoming more deadly leaves you so vulnerable. Welcome back, you’ve been asleep for a few days. We each took turns watching you.” Grissom said.

“Now you know why I created a jutsu for it. One more thing you should know. I am just as strong in this form as I am in dragon form, just a different shell to contain the power. Which is why I have nose far better than any dog. Hard to beat a dragon’s nose.” You said as you sat up and leaned back in your seat.

“You really are magnificent. Never thought I would witness both magic and a dragon in the same day, or at all for that matter. Two things that are supposed to be only fiction. I have to rethink my entire way of evaluation.” He said in a compliment manner of speaking.

“Not necessarily. I made it so no one could follow me to this realm. I’ve done a fair amount of research and have not found a single other person that can do magic in the real sense and the last dragon was at least a couple thousand years ago. So, other than me, your rules still apply. But now you know why all those murder claims are pretty much B.S.” You said.

“What do you mean?” he asked.

“Well, if I were going to kill someone and hide it. I have much more… permanent methods to do it. Incineration, teleportation, and digestion to name a few, just for future reference for future allocations.” You said with a smirk and he returned one. “Uh, do you mind if I stretch a little?” You asked as you looked over to make sure the door was shut.

“Stretch? Oh, yes, go right ahead.” He said as he figured out what you were referring to. You then let your wings stretch out as well as your tail and eyes. You flexed then just let them lay and pulse as they willed. “Amazing.” He said as he looked at your dragon parts.

“Thank you. Oh that reminds me. Being a scientist and all I grabbed one of these before I went back to human form for your collection.” You said as you tossed him a Frisbee sized scale. He caught it then gazed at it in wonder.

“Is this?” he asked

“One of my scales, yes it is. Dragon scales are harder than any metal I’ve come in contact with, well the armored ones on my back anyway.” You said as he looked over it more and smiled wide at you.

“I’m sorry Max, I’m somewhat confused. You’re so nice and helpful to us, why?” he asked as he held the scaled as if a treasure.

“I said it before, I like you guys… and girls. I like being useful to friends and family and hate when others threaten those people. It’s a dragon thing, a sort of complicated version of loyalty and such. Just don’t ask me to eat anyone, especially yourselves, other than that I would do anything for any one of you. Giving you a scale is just one of the perks of having a dragon as a friend. You are a friend right?” you asked, making sure you were gauging him right.

“Definitely. Max, we are all your friend.” He said calmly but with that glint in his eye.
