1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Hey boss, what’s going on?” you asked as you approached Brass and Grissom. Over the weeks since your little confession your group had gotten pretty close, using you as much as they could and you telling them about your past. You were a convenient scapegoat for using scent dogs and could actually see something as small as a scent trail when fresh. Both of them stood outside the house as the spoke, you could smell blood and death inside.

“Well, you know those serial killers we were tracking? We got a warrant but someone beat us to them.” Grissom explained.

“Then do you two want to look with me?” you asked and by this time they knew what you talking about. Instead of describing to them what your senses were picking up or training them in chakra to use Dragon’s eye, you could share what you were seeing with them and leave your senses in them for a little while. “How much time do we have?” you asked.

“About 5 minutes before they come over to report.” Brass said as he pointed to the two officers across the street. They turned to the house and you poked the back of their head, imparting your heightened senses to them for 4 minutes just to be safe. All three of you now had glowing red dragon eyes as you looked through the plaster, wood, stone, and metal to the crime scene. “I still can’t believe you can see like this all the time.” Brass stated as he looked around and sniffed.

“Doesn’t smell like it was those two that came. I can still see the vapor and scent trail he left.” Grissom stated as he wafted the air in front of the door. You all followed it with your eyes until it dispersed into the night. “If you excuse me, I need to locate all the evidence before this wears off.” He finished then quickly went through the house, identifying and targeting choice pieces of evidence to be collected later.

“What do you think?” Brass asked, still unable to turn around because his eyes were still glowing. However your senses were rarely wrong, and when they were it was because you hadn’t smelled the scent before.

“No offense Cap. But I think a cop or ex-cop did this one. If it was a civilian than the likely hood of them shooting and killing them both with only two shots with no noise and a makeshift silencer is almost nonexistent. They would also have access to the lab and the police reports and constant workings. Only someone inside somewhere would be able to pull it off. Not sure who did it though, yet. I’ve got the scent on record as well as those finger prints so I’ll know them when I see him. Grissom will probably find them before I do.” You said as you pointed to the prints and leftover bottle from what the suspect shot through. Grissom had already found them and were taking note of their location. “Definitely not those two, but you’re going to have to clear them anyway. They are here and these killers are dead so fingers are going to be pointing until you or CSI proves them clear.” You said as a returning Grissom came through the door and you all turned to them approaching, the effects of your senses departing.

They gave their statements or reports depending on one’s point of view. They kept looking at you and Grissom like less them they were. But they knew better than to act on any impulses, even if they were alone with you and off duty. The last dirty cop you helped expose tried to sucker punch you and ended up with a few broken ribs, hands, face fractures, tail bone broken, and bruised all over. That and you had helped more than your fair share of police chases to earn both their fear and respect. Although Brass was the only officer of any rank that understood why.

“So you think we’re dirty cops to?” one asked you.

“Even if I did, you know I wouldn’t be able to say. Just let us do our jobs. If you’re dirty it will show, if not than no harm no foul and you’re back doing what you were doing no less than you were before. Off the record though we know it wasn’t you, but we still have to prove it.” You answered and they got your reasoning better than how Grissom explained it. Soon after you caught a whiff of something and started walking to which Greg of all people followed.

“What you got?” Greg asked as you stopped and looked at a storm drain. You snapped your fingers, after looking around, and magically brought a cop shirt from the drain. You materialized an evidence bag around it and left it floating there for Greg to grab. “I take it this smells like the killer?”

“Definitely, most of the DNA will be useless but I do see some on the collar.” You said, flashing your eyes to be sure.

“I’ll take a look at it.” Greg said as he was off to do his work.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You sat in Brass’s office waiting for the officer with Grissom and Brass. Finally he came in to the room and looked over both you and Grissom with a normal level of scrutiny as most like him did.

“Sir, you called?” he asked as he stood before the two with you sitting off to the side.

“Did you lose your badge?” asked Brass as he showed him the badge that traced back to him.

“I lost one a few years back filed for a new one.” He answered.

“Yes I’m aware of cops losing their badges.” Brass stated back.

“Then we don’t have a problem do we.” He said.

“No, we have a problem because your badge was found in the proximity of a crime scene.” Brass revealed.

“How did you manage to lose your badge?” Grissom asked.

“Such is life.” He answered in a targeted way in a clear attempt to get under Grissom’s skin.

“Hold on, let me see if he even smells right.” You interrupted the scene tow which you got up and started lightly sniffing around him.

“That’s right, the human sniffing machine. Do you your thing long enough and people will think you actually do part of the work.” The officer stated.

“Wow, that almost sounded like an insult. Off the record, I’ve busted more ass than you will in 3 lifetimes so just shut up and stand there, silently.” You replied back that got on his nerves as you circled around him. “No good, not the right scent. He’s clean.”

“Glad the sniffer got something right.” He said back to which you stopped mid step back to your chair and pivoted on your heel to face him again.

“You may not be a match for this but I have caught you sent before and can prove multiple other things that could end your career in a heartbeat. I didn’t say anything because I agree that some people need a little something extra. But don’t mistake my passiveness and respect for Brass and the P.D. for fear. I am not and never will be afraid of you. But you should be afraid of me and you push hard enough you’ll see why.” You almost growled at him before slowly sitting down but keeping a glare to him and not backing down from it despite the one he returned to you.

“Why shou…” He started but was interrupted.

“I highly advise you not to finish that question. Even I’m afraid of what he could do.” Brass advised to which the officer’s eyes went to him as his Captain. “You’re dismissed.” They all stayed quiet until he was out of the room.

“You sure it wasn’t him?” Grissom asked.

“The scent wasn’t even close and wasn’t even faint at the crime scene. He wasn’t there at all.” You revealed as you thought about it.

“So who do we have left?” Grissom asked…

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So what’s up with this guy?” you asked as you were brought into the room with a rather angry individual. He was being held for beating a man to death and they just needed evidence to back it. Usually such conversations were done outside the room but it didn’t really matter if and when they told you about the people they wanted you to talk to.

“You know that guy that was beat to death? We thing Mr. Darian here is the one. Can you confirm?” Brass asked. You went over to the man and took a good whiff of him.

“Yep, that’s the scent that was on the dead man. But with evidence like this why do you need me here?” you asked, not even paying attention to the angering man in the room. You could feel his body temperature was hotter than normal people and could hear his heartbeat increase to your lack of legitimizing him.

“He doesn’t seem like the guy that listens to words in the same way we do. Plus with the beating he gave the our victim I wouldn’t mind you here, just in case.” Brass stated.

“Ok, looks weak to me but whatever.” You stated then sat on the other side of the table from him as he glared viciously at you. “I suppose you think that look scared me, it doesn’t. You just interrupted my lunch so I would love it if you threw a punch so I can have some fun.”

“I’m not soft.” He said above his anger.

“Why don’t we get to the good stuff that the evidence is going to tell us anyway. Did you beat that man Tony to death?” you asked and he got no answer.

“Well, I’m going to need to take some scrapings from under your nails.” Grissom stated as he took out his tools.

“Why?” Walter asked, still in an angered voice.

“Because he said so, you don’t need more of a reason. Just shut up like you were doing a moment ago and do as he sais.” You stated that got him to bolt up and try to push the table aside to get at you. But it was bolted to the floor. “Need a little help with that?” you asked as you ripped the table from the floor and flung it out of the way, coming face to face with the angered man. However even he had some kind of survival instinct and knew better than messing with you. “I’m not scared of you, I will never be scared of you. Now sit down and do as you’re told or I’ll kick your ass.”

This got him to lose his cool and throw his hands up to your throat but try as he might he couldn’t push you back. “I’ll kill you!” he said to which you rose a hand to the others to keep them away, you were fine and they knew it. Even if they didn’t know the reason, they knew that none among them could take you on. So this man with a serious anger problem wasn’t going to be able to do it.

“Glad you did that, now I get to work out a kink in my neck.” You said as you brought a knee up into his gut then grabbed both of his wrists in with your left and held them away from your but steady. He was coughing up blood which you instantly healed to which you took your right hand and picked him up by the throat. He dangled in the air but you continued to heal him so he would remain conscious and aware of his position but still feel the suffocation he felt from your hold. You waited there for a moment then brought his face down to meet yours. “Sit down and do as you’re told you little insect.” You said than almost threw him into his chair to which he grasped his throat and you put the table back as if it had never been broken then sat yourself.

“Was that necessary?” Grissom asked.

“Not really, but I felt like making a point. I could tell he was rearing up to take some of you on so I just made him relent such thinking.” you answered as you all looked at the coughing and wheezing man. “Care for another round?”

“No.” he answered simply as fear replaced his anger.

“Good, struggling for one’s life does wonders for cooperation.” You said the allowed the others to continue. Walter kept looking over at you as his temper flared but didn’t dare let it out while you were there. Later though he did and died do to his large heart and rush of a fight, his last fight.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok, Doc. I know you sometimes call me in but this is a first time you’ve done so with a question. You know being what I am doesn’t make me an all knowing expert.” You stated as you went into the morgue to inspect a body.

“I know but this one is strange, more strange than the usual cases. The victim is clearly dead but is still bleeding, the eyes still dilate and we have partial brain activity.” Doctor Robinson said as he referred to the body before him.

“So what makes him dead?” You asked.

“For starters there isn’t a heartbeat because the bullet that killed him destroyed it completely. One tends to miss when a heart is absent.” Grissom stated as you joined then in standing around the body. “We were hoping you could detect something before we go carving or knew something about this kind of thing. Perhaps with your genetic knowledge.”

“Ok, let me see here.” You sighed then let your eyes glow as you looked deep into the dead corpse on the table. You could see blood still going through the veins and a single heartbeat kept it going, to small and segmented for them to pick up. Muscles and cells were still getting messages from the brain and you could see his stomach and other organs still processing at a decelerated rate. Finally something triggered an alarm in your brain as you identified a weird infection coursing through the veins. The infection was immediately recognized as your genetic knowledge would know as the ‘Walking Dead Virus’. It caused your body to freeze almost in fear as it was confirmed from a single bite wound to the corpse’s arm. “Step away now.”

“What? Why, what’s wrong?” Grissom asked.

“Now!” you demanded and didn’t wait for them to comply as you used some magic to force then back and against a wall just as the corpse rose and took a swipe at them. You dodged as it came for you but incinerated it with a glance, turning it to ash. “We are in big trouble…”

“Max, do you mind?” Grissom asked to which you released them gently from your magical hold and thought for a moment. “What was that?” He asked.

“Ok you need to get everyone one in my vault that hasn’t been bitten, right now.” You stated almost in a panic mode.

“What? Max, what’s going on? Why did you burn that corpse and play it like a puppet?” Grissom asked.

“I didn’t do anything to move it I only burned it. You really don’t get it? Think outside the science and medical fields. What disease is contracted with a bite and turns the dead back to life?” You asked in a heightened state as it began to register to them. “Now you get it. Unless you have all the victims here now this will get really bad really quick. My knowledge knows it as the Living Dead Virus. My kind and other dragons on my world stopped it by wiping out all life in the area no matter how small or kind. But in a population in this planet’s size it is impossible to do that.”

“You’re kidding right. You mean to tell me that we are dealing with Zombies?” Grissom asked.

“That is the best description yes. It gets worse than that. While dragons are one of the few that can’t contract it no matter what, we can’t do anything to heal someone once infected. Now enough questions, you need to get everyone in my vault now and I will be there to put them in the main chamber as I clear them. If they aren’t cleared then we’ll put them in holding cells for their loved ones to say goodbye but you have to act fast. Call everyone back, now!” you explained and demanded.

“This is a little hard to believe.” Doctor Robinson said as Grissom went to do as you asked and you teleported him to your first room.

“I can do magic and am a 500 foot tall dragon and you want to argue on what is real? Look, I need your help in this so I’m going to give you my eyes for the rest of the day. When people come in, put the ones that have a bite or specifically the virus over there and those that don’t on the opposite side of the room. I need to go and get people to further help. Hopefully we’re not too late.” You requested.

“Ok I get it. What about my family?” He asked.

“Use your phone and tell them to meet you here. Once we get things going we’ll be able to store people in my safe area here, surrounded by a few foot thick titanium walls and floor. I can’t go flying in search mode until later when they are too focused elsewhere to try and shoot down the giant dragon.” You answered and he nodded as you dashed off.

“Greg, you get the text?” You asked.

“Yeah, what’s up with that?” he joked.

“No joke, go to my place and take as many people as you can and help out Doctor Robinson once you get there. I gave him my eyes so he can see clearly.” You stated which got him to become in shock. “Greg! Not time for being shocked. We just found this out when a corpse in the morgue came back to life from a bite and the virus. You need to get going now. You can be shocked later when we are safe. Understand?”

“Uh… Uh…” he stammered.

“Greg! Understand?” you said as you splashed water in his face to snap him out of it.

“Right, yes go and do your thing” he stated to which you nodded and vanished from his view to go get and warn more people.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A case that starts the end of the world.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Brass.” You called as you entered the very crowded police station. You could see that they were trying to apprehend the Living dead people and obviously not getting anywhere, some getting bit themselves as they tried.

“Max, not now. We are swamped as you can see.” He said with his hands gesturing to the people around them.

“No, now.” You insisted and pulled him into his office then shut the door. “They’re Zombies.” You said, pointing to a person trying to bread their way into his office but not getting very far.

“Max, are you playing some kind of joke?” Brass asked in an irritated tone.

“Why does everyone ask me that? No I’m not. To be fair they aren’t Zombies but they are close enough, otherwise known as the Living Dead that spread their disease via biting their victims and trying to eat them.” you asked back to a very shocked man. You smacked him in the face to wake him up “Hey, no time for that. I am gathering everyone I can think of to my place but I have to get back there. The thick Titanium wall should protect us once we close the doors but I have to go and help with that. You are the last person on my list.”

“You only saving the people you know?” He asked, still in a little shock but also concerned.

“And whomever they can vouch for. I simply don’t have the time to go get random people that would just start panicking and kill a few people once inside. After you I’ll close the doors and take trips out the roof to get people. You need to get as many people as you can and don’t worry about supplies, I got enough to last years.” You stated as you pointed to the men still trying to contain the ‘zombies’. “I won’t allow anyone that is bitten but you can save a few of them.”

“Ok, this is going to be hard.” He stated then when out with you and shot every zombie in the room, making the officers inside look to him in confusion. He reloaded his gun to the silent rrom as the came around him for an explanation. “Listen up everyone, this isn’t going to be easy to say or believe but, for what it’s worth, I’m ordering you to believe me as this is not a joke. We are dealing with, and I can’t believe I’m saying this, Zombies. Yes they are and no this isn’t a joke.”

“Is this because he sais so?” asked one of the officers that were bitten and also had a grudge against you.

“Yes it is, seeming as you are bitten you may not join those that aren’t in coming with me. But just for you I’ll prove it.” You said then used a bit of magic, that got them all to look on in awe to bring a new zombie that an officer just brought in to the center of the room. You then grabbed a pistol and shot the person in the heart and chest a few times. They all raised their guns to you as you did this but hesitantly looked over once the obviously dead person got back on her feet, foaming at the mouth and going toward one of the officers. He unloaded his gun on her but she didn’t go down. You got in front of the thing and pushed the barrel of a shotgun in her mouth then lifted so she was almost impaled by the weapon but still fighting to get at you as she swung in the air. “Any other questions or would one of you like to let this fine young lady infect you as well as you escort her to a holding cell?” You asked. Some dumbly shook their heads and when you knew they all got the idea you blasted the woman off the end, her head almost blowing completely off.

“Ok, show’s over. As you might have noticed. Our touchy friend here is not normal but that can wait in explanation after we are safe. Everyone that hasn’t been infected will come with us. The rest of you see to your families and get them safe before you turn. Let’s go people, move.” Brass commanded as they all started moving and they separated into 2 groups of bitten people and not bit people. Only one officer tried to hide among the uninfected and that was the hostile one from before. “Officer Rale, Max said you were bitten, go join that half so you can help those that haven’t.”

“Who says I’m infected, him? I can’t stay out here. I’m not infected! I deserve to…” He started.

“…die.” You finished for him and shot him through the heart, again to prove your point and counted down with one hand from 5 seconds pointed as the dead officer got back up to which you shot him in the head to finish it. “I don’t make mistakes and I can’t entertain such idiocy at the moment. You all need to go save your families and take out as many as you can. But on your last bullet I would recommend using it on yourself to prevent you turning your own family. Get the survivors safe and visible so I can find them later. I’ll be back for them as I fly over.” You instructed. They all went the opposite way then you turned to those that remained.

“What about our families?” asked one of the officers that was in the group.

“You all have phones for now so once you get to safety you can call them and get them to secure themselves. I’ll go get them if I can but dying yourself isn’t going to help them any more than advising them now. Everyone put a hand on someone next to you.” you answered and commanded and when they all were connected you teleported them all to the room where everyone else was. You almost fell over to which you were caught by Brass.

“You ok?” he asked.

“Teleporting that many people is no picnic.” You said as you pulled the people that were still in the area inside the door then closed it. “Doc Robinson and the others have my eyes and are sorting out the infected and putting them off to the side. Give them a hand while I get some rest.” You said and using a last bit of effort you imparted your eyes to him like the others you had trusted with it then passed out.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: It is just starting but spreads quickly.

choices: You have to deal with a few panicing or turned people.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Good you’re awake.” Grissom stated as you woke up and sat on the coach they put you on. The room was loud and chaotic with so many people in it. It took a bit to comprehend his words and address him that you were ready for whatever he had for you. “We separated the infected from the others but, as you can expect, some don’t want to admit it on either side.”

“Ok, well I have to get something to eat anyway so… I guess I can deal with this.” you stated then got up to which they all became quiet and those that you knew came forward. You went over to the vault door that led into the rest of the complex and opened it. “Come with me please, keep the infected separate.” You stated then the crowd did as requested. It was unclear why but they were all listening to you. Maybe because you were responsible for saving them. They were separated into the two groups with a little apprehension but followed what you said.

“You must be Max, I’m agent Smith from the FBI.” Stated a man in a suit that led a few others. You nursed a headache before turning to him and shaking his hand. “This is some place you have here. From what I see here, you could start a small war from this place.” he finished as he looked around and saw the assortment of military grade vehicles.

“Probably, but right now I should concentrate on the task at hand. I need to get these infected out or here and go look for more people. I promised that I would go get the families of those in here if they were still clean and I intend to do so. If you are looking to help then please keep them calm for the time being.” You requested.

“You, go get them? We can’t have someone open the doors just to do that. What we need is to establish a chain of command so we can unify and get some help.” He argued.

“That is easy. My house, my stuff, my rules and there is one door that won’t let any of them in.” you stated and brought up a display then opened the ceiling. “If you want to leave you may, I can take you anywhere after I secure things here and secure those I can still save now stand back please.” You said then walked to an open spot away from them. Agent Smith was about to follow you but Brass whispered something in his ear to which he stopped. With that you used your transformation Jutsu and went to Dragon form, blowing away the spoke and shaking your head to get the remaining cobwebs out.

“Everyone calm down.” Called Brass as the others approached you. “He’s on our side.”

“You good?” asked Sara.

“Yeah, little hungry but otherwise just peachy.” You answered then rose your head. “Hello everyone, I am Max and yes I am a Dragon, no I am not going to eat you, and yes I will go get what is left of your families. You are protected in these walls and safe for the time being. Anyone that would like to challenge me for this place please do so now or accept it.” After that the people got a better attitude and even the FBI agents back down from any argument of who was in charge.

“Ok Max, do you mind giving me a lift?” asked Grissom to which you lowered your head then raised it when he was on it. “Ok, if you still have family out within the city that you called and are still in contact with then make a line so he can take your requests one at a time. But we should deal with the infected problem among us first. I’m sorry for this but we can’t have those that are infected inside the walls. We all discussed it and you will each have 3 options; First is you can be let out and do what you can while you can before you turn. Second is we can end it for you now, either by feeding our friend here or whatever way you wish to go. Third is you can panic and resist to which you will have no choice in the matter.”

“I thought you said you wouldn’t eat us?” asked a woman in the infected group.

“I won’t if you don’t want me to. Honestly I would rather not but I can’t get infected and I need energy to save people and get you all food and stuff. So I can eat infected people, alive or dead, as a substitute. I can just as easily get a few on my way to save other people but if you wish to go out that way I’ll allow it.” You answered.

“You have nothing to fear from him. He has saved everyone in this room so you at least own him some time to prove himself.” Brass said as you let Grissom off and lay behind them but looked over the group.

“But for now we need to split into 5 groups. For those that are infected you need to pick one of the two options. He will take in any requests to search while he searches for others. For those that aren’t infected you need to get in a line of people who are in contact with living people waiting to be rescued and those that aren’t but would like him to check points as he is flying over. Everyone one else help out those that need it and above all, everyone needs to stay calm. We all are in this together and need all the support we can get.” Cahterine Willows called out to which they all started moving, all very wary of the large dragon looking over them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: When you wake.

choices: Picking up people can be a pain.
Familiars are done and on to random pickups.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok Max we’re ready for you.” Catherine stated as the infected was more or less separated into two groups. One on the right were looking at you in an apprehensive way while the others were slightly or mildly depressed. “This group has opted to feed you while this one would like to be sent outside with some kind of weapon to fight and take down as many as they can.”

“Very well. Brass, can you take those to the weapon vault and have them pick a weapon of their choosing? Don’t worry about ammo or anything, I have extras of all that are available so they can pick whatever they want and give them a back up to do themselves when the time comes.” You asked and he led the group out as Grissom turned the living group away from the scene as you turned to the group. “ I am both honored and sorry for this. If any of you decide to change your mind I understand but I’ll make it as quick and painless as possible.”

“Can you just do it before we lose our nerve?” asked a woman you knew from the front desk to which you looked at her then away with a sigh then back at them. There were about 25 of them total, while the other 50 went with the other group and were out of sight.

“Ok, please close your eyes.” You requested and they did so, well all but a few. Before you could second guess yourself you started. You used your tongue and teeth to scoop them up and swallow before they could react. You could hear screams as you swallowed but no one else could. You did this in three stages as you got a mouth full then gulped them down. You increased your digestive system so they were almost immediately digested as they hit your stomach. You closed your eyes for a little bit and allowed a few tears to drip down as you heard the last of their screams and cries. There was no pain, as you promised, but the sudden action had brought up the terror they were so desperately hiding up to that point. It felt a little better when it was all done and your power was back up to full. For the sake of the others you didn’t chew them so your mouth was empty of blood or body parts.

“Max… you’re crying?” Sara asked, bringing your attention back to them. With that all done the rest had returned and the others were turned to address their concerns to you.

“I… sorry… I just don’t like eating people that are still alive. Makes me feel like a mass murderer or at least a heartless beast, like the others I hate so much.” You explained as you wiped the tears away then shook the idea out of you mind and settling on the other infected. Some looked slightly comical with the large weapons they had while others looked like they knew what they were doing. “Now for this group. Just think about where you want to go and I’ll send you there… as long as it is within the city.”

“You can do that?” Warrick asked.

“Yes, they power the other people gave me allows me to do it. It is still a drain but I owe them that much at least.” You responded then waited for each of them to get a spot then teleported them out and finally the infected were out and you could concentrate on the living.

“Can I just say that you are like the coolest person I’ve ever met?” Greg said with a smile that, at first, no one followed. But seeing as it improved your slightly down mood they joined in as well.

“Thanks Greg, you think you can find some light music to lighten things up around here?” you asked as you brought up a display near him and he smiled then got to work.

“For the record Max. We don’t think of you as a monster or a heartless beast.” Grissom stated to which you smiled a little and nuzzled him as well before be gave you a pat then you all addressed the other people.

“Ok, now…” you started then brought up an interactive display of the city at the their level and between you and the people but slightly off to the side so you could see them and the display from your end. “One at a time, point out the location of places you want me to check for uninfected. As I am out and passing over I will pick them up if I can and bring them back here. Don’t be pushy as I won’t be leaving until everyone has pointed out where they would like me to search. You don’t have to explain, I’ll pick up any that are uninfected in the areas and this is time sensitive.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Nobody panics.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Amazing how quickly this has all happened.” Grissom stated as you flew above the city on your way back from another pass. You had gathered all the people from the places they said but not as many as you hoped you’d get. Most people were either too stupid or smart to think that they could get infected, making the uninfected search not as successful as you thought.

“What’s it been, 4 days?” you asked back to him as he was held on your back with some passengers you recently picked up with spikes. You also had a bus and van full of people being held by your front claws. The people had all stopped screaming after a while and just whimpered while comforting each other. Grissom did his best to calm the ones he could reach so they just silently observed the interaction between the dragon that saved them and the human on his back.

“About that yes. You getting tired yet? You have been searching and collecting for the better part of 3 days without sleep and I can’t believe that missile was as small as you made it out to be.” Grissom asked. When you first started flying around there was a military gunship that pursued you until it saw what you were doing and you…convinced the pilot to stop shooting at you.

“I healed just fine and I have no shortage of food, as bad as the walking dead are they do provide more than enough energy to keep going. Although I could use a nap now that my sweep is more or less done.” You agreed but then saw something. “Ah that’s just great.”

“What?” Grissom asked to which you soared at an angle so he could see. “Looks like a tour bus for one of those pro wrestling tours that were in town last week.”

“Yeah and full with clean people but I don’t have any open spots to carry them.” You stated to which Grissom understood you comment and thought for a moment.

“Hate to say it but you got one more.” He returned to which you glanced back at him and he pointed to his mouth as and teeth to replicate and communicate that your jaws would work.

“Oh come on, last time I captured a car in my mouth I impaled the driver on a tooth. Not to mention that it is a bus and a lot heavier than a car, especially filled with people.” You returned.

“It is the only spot left. If we don’t help them then they will probably all die. If you accidentally kill or injure some then at least most of them live. You know it is the only choice, besides we are almost back to your place anyway.” Grissom combated as the people both under and over were listening to the conversation.

“Fine, but you got people duty when we get back.” You said as you descended toward the speeding bus as it was barreling through infected people but running out of room.

As you closed the distance the driver must’ve saw you or someone through the windows because they made a sudden turn in the opposite direction that you were traveling. You adjusted as the course they were going ended in a demolished bridge. You sped quicker and as the bus attempted to jump the gap you caught the middle in your jaws then took off with the heavy load. You were immediately bombarded with screams and cries as you sank your teeth into the metal and glass of the bus to secure it as you flew with your head dragging to the building. You snarled a little as you felt sharp objects being rammed into the relatively softer tissue inside your mouth. The worst one was when they used something electrical and plunged it in the space that anchored you tooth to your gums. You almost dropped the bus a few times as it was hard enough to hold the couple ton metal box as you flew and it didn’t get any easier with people trying to get you to let go.

“Easy, almost there.” Grissom comforted after hearing an angry and annoyed snarl from you. Finally you landed and dropped the bus rather unceremoniously the last few feet and spit out some blood and tools that were used to cause multiple small wounds in your mouth that quickly disappeared. You were more gentle with the other two you held then laid to let the 50 or so people off your back along with Grissom as you got into your normal spot on the floor. Most of them were more than happy to get off while Grissom had grown to love flying with you, better than a roller coaster he would said.

When the people were away you shook your head and growled a little as you moved to pull out the few tools still imbedded in your gums and tongue. Some of the people winced as you spat out things that looked nasty to be stabbed with, even for you as evidence to the blood on them.

“Ouch, that has to hurt.” Greg stated and noticed that you still not done.

“You need some help?” Sara asked to which you looked down at her as you still were growling a little at the pain.

“Yes please, one of them lodged something in between a tooth and the gums that has an electric charge to it, feels like a cattle prod or something.” You stated then opened up your jaws and put the area right next to her. You waited as you felt her hands on your gums then the pain went away as she pulled the impending tool out as to which you closed your trap and looked at it as it sparked. “Thanks.”

“No problem, just as long as I stay on this side of your teeth I can pull out a few annoyances.” She joked back and you chuckled a little then looked at the almost panicking people coming out of the destroyed tour bus. “Looks like you really freaked them out.”

“No offense Max, but I can see why.” Nick stated and you just nodded a no kidding but Greg had a confused face. “They were running from zombies and a giant, unknown, legendary, and mythical being buries his teeth in their little hope and security. Again, no offense, but being in a dragon’s mouth in any situation is frightening. In their already panicked one it must’ve been beyond that.”

“Well I’m just glad I didn’t impale anyone this time.” You stated as you got into a more comfortable position and watched as Grissom, along with others, calmed and explained things. “That’s going to take a while.” You joked as they saw it to and laughed. They all had to do panic control at one point or another and could only laugh as the usually nonsocial Grissom attempted it.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Picking up people can be a pain.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Max, Max? Hey Max are you done yet?” asked Catherine as you concentrated.

It became very evident that the power and water would be turned off eventually. It was also obvious that sleeping in the open of the large area would also be a problem, especially if you kept bringing people there. So you started on a project to make a bunker like living area for everyone. You started with an elevator that went down a very long way. Then from there you began materializing each floor and of course extended the 100 foot thick titanium barrier around the entire thing. You didn’t need some tunneling zombie or idiot getting through and causing problems. You also were lucky enough to find a water line deep underground so you set up a hydro plant and water storage system to generate your own independent water and power, not enough to light up a city but pretty close and more than enough to power your whole compound even under liberal power spending. You put this part at an isolate spot so no one could get control over it, well except you of course. The rest were sub basement levels. The rooms were like a studio apartment size. Not to small but large enough to be a bedroom/personal space for each person. You of course had security systems around the place for multiple problems that could arise, chief among them to make sure NO infectious materials. You didn’t need to study it and you convinced Grissom as much… although you didn’t have to convince him that much. He knew all he needed and asked you about anything extra. You were just making the finishing touches when Catherine approached. You were in human form as your dragon one couldn’t fit in the living area.

“Just… It isn’t as easy as it looks you know.” You said as you took a seat on a nearby chair or rather slumped into it, visually tired from the 12 hour exertion. You were in human form but you still had your wings, tail, eyes, and some scales on your back showing. They flexed as if stretching to which you sat back before addressing the group that sat with you. Joining your close group of people was the FBI agent.

“So is it complete?” asked Agent Smith.

“Indeed, the personal rooms are the bottom 15 floors and the top two are for dining and entertainment. The water and power are separated and all the security devices are monitored by the complex and for view if I wish from anywhere I wish. The living areas will fill up and unlock the next so that people don’t get lost. Each room may be a tad small but more than capable of holding 1-4 occupants with their own water and power systems including shower and toilet.” You answered.

“What about the administrative area or rooms for important people?” he asked.

“Didn’t make any, but you can use the holding area on the 18th floor if you wish, but then again anyone can go in and out of there as well. Basically I am the only one in charge on that level and I stay in the main area, hopefully as a dragon for as long as I can.” You answered, not caring that it wasn’t what he was wanting.

“What if the president comes here?” he asked as he looked be pulling out his trump card in this argument.

“Then he can sleep where he likes but seeing as our current arrangement was just on the floor in the main area I think this is an improvement. But I’m not about to play a political game with you. In the end I am in charge of this place for 3 reasons. First is that I built it and know how to maintain it, second is I am the most capable in terms of strength to keep everyone safe, third is that all this was made in by my hand and so I am the only one that CAN manage it correctly. For instance the Power and Water deep underground is something only I can get to. So it you don’t feel comfortable in the titanium surrounded haven I have made then you are more then welcome to try your luck outside it. This isn’t a negotiation so stop trying to seize control.” You stated rather bluntly to the flustering man.

“Max, that wasn’t a very nice way to say it.” Sara said as you finished, the others following the same thought pattern.

“Sorry, I just got done materializing an entire sub basement for them and he wants special treatment. I guess I am just a little tired to listen to political crap. Maybe later I can have a proper argument but right now… not interested.” You replied to which Agent Smith just slumped grouchily into a his seat.

“Either way, we should probably get things situated. Is there anything we should know? You seem a little out of it to give us a tour.” Brass asked.

“Most of what I put down there should be safe unless someone is being an idiot. Pushing your finger in an electrical socket is still a bad idea.” You started with a joke that got them to grin a little before you continued. “Beyond that, the Kitchen and other areas should be stocked for the time being. My materialized versions of things might not be as… fresh as what you’re use to but they are infection free at least and better than what you would otherwise get or I have to eat. The holding area at the bottom has cells in it to hold people that cause trouble. Brass, Grissom, Warrick, Nick, Sara, Catherine, Greg, and Doctor Robinson are the only ones that can open or close them… for now. Other than that you can pick whatever rooms you like. I’ll only come down if something needs my attention. But be sure they know that coming all the way back up will be heavily restricted once they are down. Don’t need some little kid accidentally shooting off the tank or something like that. Besides that, you all can managed stuff down there as you see fit. Please don’t make me enforce things.” You answered as you were half asleep by this point. They all could see that so they didn’t bother you as you fully fell asleep just before it looked like you were going to say something else. You hoped that they would be ok with it. Living their lives underground would be a large change for them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: living situations.

choices: A soldier in a tank tries to kill you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You know, I’ll never really get use to that?” Grissom stated as you bent down and lapped up some infected people then either swallowed or chewed beforehand. Grissom insisted on being on your head so he could see around, unless you were flying of course. But his preference didn’t change when you ate. But for his sake you usually didn’t chew your food. Not that you wanted the decaying blood and meat stuck in your teeth anyway, or staining your mouth.

“Well, if it makes you feel any better, they taste like crap. Old, rotting, and decaying meat with equally descriptive blood, yuck!” you returned as you walked down a street.

Sure the slow zombies tried to attack or follow you. But they posed no threat to you. And as long as Grissom stayed off their level he was safe as well. Even if the streets were crowded with them you could simply walk over them and trample them under your massive clawed feet. You stopped killing every single one you saw as you needed food. Besides, there was no way they were getting into your home. Sure they could force iron gates and wooden doors open but if they could really get through a couple foot thick titanium wall than you would have more problems than you thought.

“I don’t mean to be insensitive but… yeah, it does kind of make me feel better.” He said than noticed you looked up at him before going back to your default search setting. “Don’t get me wrong, I wish you could have a decent meal for once. But I guess the less appeasing a human is to you to eat the better, for us anyway. Most of us know you wouldn’t eat us, even so it helps calm the nerves a bit.”

“I guess so. Maybe I’ll find a farm or something. That would be nice… provided that the animals aren’t undead as well. I could really go for a fresh cow about now.” You said as you licked your lips at the thought. You heard a chuckled that brought you out of your little fantasy. “What?”

“I just was recalling how strange this is. It’s been a month and even before then. I never would’ve guessed that I would be getting to ride a dragon. Never mind being this close to one’s mouth without going in it. Then there is the magic thing and this whole Zombie apocalypse that we are ironically being held safe by the same dragon most are deathly afraid of. Now here we are just taking a stroll despite the hoards of undead as if it was normal. Just funny how normal all this strangeness is getting.” Grissom replied. You chuckled, indicating that you understood and shared in his little attempt at humor. You also looked down at the ease you were walking through the street of undead hordes when so many were running for their lives from similar sights in other places. “Can I ask you a question?”

“You know you can. It’s not like I’m going to bite your head off for being curious. If I don’t want to talk about something you bring up I’ll let you know.” You answered.

“Does it feel good to be so… powerful? I mean over so many things. You are like the top… well let’s just say no a lot can push you around. Another way to say it would be that you are the top of the food chain. But I know you don’t like that reference. But you understand right?” Grissom asked, trying mid sentence to find better ways to address it.

“I understand and yes, I suppose it does feel exhilarating at times. But not all the time. Sure I can push my weight around, literally, if I want. But when people assume I do is when I have a problem with it. It just isn’t my way to do things like that. Sure I can put my foot down when I have to. But I much more prefer people like you that I can just talk with. People that let things fly and are not nervous when saying things. Of course I appreciate the respect for what I am, it is the fear and assumptions that bother me.” You answered.

“You really like us, don’t you?” He asked.

“Yes, I do. Some humans can be a little… too human I guess. But I do enjoy a human’s company very much.” You answered as you continued to walk.

“What does ‘too human’ mean?” Grissom asked.

“Well… It is hard to explain for you, as a human, to understand. Especially since it is a delicate matter.” You said then stayed silent for a moment before sighing. “But I suppose you’ve earned enough credit for me to just say it.”

“I may get a little, human, but I’ll be as understanding as I can.” Grissom offered.

“Ok. Well let’s face it. You humans are a food source to dragons, a delicacy even. Very delicious and very tempting even at a distance. But you humans also have a mind. You aren’t just like an animal that can be gulped down and not be missed. But I think you humans know it and expect everyone to treat you as such, even other humans. I’ve seen humans stick up their nose and expect one of the evil dragons to obey them. They… well they don’t last very long. Then the other humans get mad because the dragon killed or ate the idiot human. They start hunting us, causing more death on their end, and eventually paint the dragon as the bad guy. Sure the dragon was evil but the human was just as much at fault. I mean, what idiot would do something like that? Anyway, that is what I mean when I say ‘too human’. It has much more to it than that. But I won’t try to explain how a dragon’s mind works. For starters it can’t be explained in the human tongue.” You explained.

“I suppose we are like that. I half want to defend us. But you are right, we can be very… Human.” Grissom stated. He was about to continue when…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Taking a walk.

choices: She pets you and accepts you.
The approaching hoard makes her scared so she runs.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Your conversation stops as you both hear a scream to which you freeze as you are able to tell it is coming from underneath you. You must’ve not been paying attention as you were talking with Grissom. You looked down at an angle that Grissom could also see but not slide off your head. You saw a little girl not more than 8 years old bracing herself against the ground and curling up as if waiting to be crushed. A avid description from her position underneath your front claw as it was about to come down. But her scream had definitely saved her. You backed up and laid down on the street. The scream and your presence had drawn the hoard to the area so you had to act relatively fast. The Zombies would be there in a few minutes.

“Oh my! I’m sorry little one. I wasn’t watching where I stepped.” You stated. Grissom saw that it was probably partly his fault as he had distracted you with such a personal question. While you took the blame he was not by any means going to rub it in or bring it up without need.

“Go away!” she screamed without opening her eyes. Without a word you brought your head down which allowed Grissom to get off and go over to the little girl. He gave you a hand motion to his eyes that indicated he wanted you to cloak until he could calm her down. Seeing the thing that almost stomped her flat would not improve the situation. When you did and was invisible to her eye, and his, Grissom went over and put a gentle hand on the girl. It took her a few seconds but she opened her eyes to see a smiling Grissom looking down at her. “Where’d the monster go?”

“He is hiding. He was very sorry he almost stepped on you. He’s sad and didn’t want you to be frightened. Can you tell me your name?” Grissom asked. He usually wasn’t that good at this kind of thing. But with Catherine’s help, he was getting much better. Not to mention the ample amount of people he had to deal with on a daily basis.

“Rose. My name is Rose.” She whimpered then clamped onto Grissom. “Why aren’t you trying to eat me like the other adults?”

“Well, you see, the other people are really sick and died. But the sickness keeps them moving and tries to get you. But don’t worry, me and my friend will keep you safe” Grissom answered as he held and soothed the small child.

“Where’s your friend?” she asked, not getting that you, the dragon that almost stepped on her, was his friend.

“He is that dragon that almost stepped on you.” he said but felt her quivering and getting ready to run from him so he continued. “Don’t worry, he won’t hurt you. He is actually a really nice dragon. He just looks scary.”

“B… but he almost stepped…ed on me.” She stuttered out in her crying whimper.

“Yes, and he’s very sorry. He’s very big so it was hard to notice you all the way down here. He’s really sad that he scared you. You think you can forgive him and pet him a little?” Grissom asked in a tone that even got you to feel bad for yourself.

“But isn’t he a monster? A big scary monster?” she asked.

“No, he’s just really big and scary. But imagine what it is like for all those Zombies trying to get you. Wouldn’t you like it if the big scary dragon was on your side? He would be a pretty good friend to have wouldn’t he?” Grissom asked in an obvious but well hidden bait for little kids. She thought for a minute then nodded. “Ok, watch now, he is going to reappear.”

With a nod from him you slowly uncloaked yourself from your jutsu. You saw her bury her head back into Grissom’s chest at the sight of you. You saw Grissom comforting her then give you a look as if to tell you to speak to her.

“Rose? I’m really sorry for almost stepping on you.” You said and put on your best ‘puppy dog’ face. Granted your overall size and look made it hard to do but passable. You then decided to put a little joke in there. “I just have really, really, REALLY big feet.”

It seemed to help and she looked down at your ‘big feet’ then back at your face. She didn’t know what to do at this point so Grissom whispered in her ear, fully aware you could hear them.

“He really likes it when people pet him, especially pretty girls like you.” Grissom whispered. She nodded then he brought her over to your snout and wisely avoided the front but settled next to your eye and started petting your eye ridge. You blinked and purred, effectively rumbling the ground that got her nervous again. “Oh, don’t worry. That is just his purr. You know, like a cat when they really like the petting they are getting or are really happy.”

“He’s like a kitty?” she asked as she hid from your wondering eye by hiding behind Grissom’s back. It was unclear what she would do. But there was little time. You could feel the undead hoards on your back side and, even at their slow speed, would surround the two humans on the ground in less than a minute. Finally she…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Someone is yelling for help.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Thankfully there was a little more time since the undead seemed unable to climb your body no matter how hard they tried. So they had to go around and it took the additional time, since you were effectively blocking the street they needed to go around for a while to get to her. That is if something else didn’t catch their attention. For now, you all had a little more time.

“Nice dragon?” she asked Grissom.

“Yes, he is very nice.” Grissom answered as he continued to demonstrate petting you.

She shuffled forward with her hand out while rounding the temporary wall that was Grissom. She continued this until her hand made contact just under your eye to which you she stayed there for a little bit before rubbing. She flinched every time you blinked but eventually got use to it. She circled above to your eye ridge and got more confident as she moved around to which you nuzzled her gently then shot the end of your tongue out to lick her a little. You knew she was too young to realize you could just easily eat her. So she giggled at your soft muscle as it licked her face and she made a sudden game at fighting it back to its resting place behind your scaly lips and teeth. Grissom chuckled at this play time but soon your fun was cut short by the sound and sight of the undead coming down the only access to the street and area you all were in at the moment.

“Mr. Grissom, I’m scared.” She said as she now noticed them coming and clung to him.

“Don’t worry, remember, our friend is bigger than they are.” He said as you stretched your tongue out and wrapped around them. The girl squealed at this but stopped squirming when you placed them on top of your head before retracting your soft appendage. With that done you raised your head so they were now high above the hoard of approaching undead.

“Wow, we are really hi.” Said the girl as she looked over the side and saw your start walking, stepping on and over the hoard as if nothing was in the way.

“Before we go any further, do you have any family Rose? Max can pick them up if you want.” Grissom asked. But to his question he saw a look that he had seen all too often in the last month.

“No, they all got bit and told me to run. My Daddy tried to get some other people to open up and let us in but they killed him and told me to go away.” She said, almost sobbing the last part. Grissom held her close as you continued walking, this time back toward your home with you new package.

There was obviously more people out here that you couldn’t detect from the sky. Not to mention there was an entire world out there. You wondered when other people would hear about your little safe haven and demand entry. You doubted what was left of the government had turned a blind eye to the only functional building around with bright lights on it and the dragon that was flying around. You had demolished and cleared out a large area on all sides of the now single complex. It helped to see where all the undead were coming from as well as you made all the entries to the area have barriers on it. Barriers that didn’t allow the infected in. This got a few groups mad and killed for not leaving their infected loved ones but you couldn’t take chances and let any in. But you did make a safe zone for them inside the barrier but outside the building so they could say goodbyes and what not or keep them safe while deciding. You also made a runway on one side so that jets could land if there were any left.

It was impossible to keep conscious upkeep on those barriers all the time in the form of jutsus. So you made barrier and power emitters in different areas that could hold out if anything short of a nuclear blast hit them then built a hydo power plant for just the barrier system right next to the existing one. All in all you had a pretty good system. Not flawless as the occasional hybrid got through the barrier. But that was why no one that wanted to live was outside the walls. The outside area was just for arrivals and what not. Even most of those that you brought back were done via the roof entrance. There was talk about having you dig up gas pumps to fuel the cars you brought back but in the end you didn’t need it and could always materialize the gas if it really was a necessity.

“Don’t worry Rose. It is completely safe where we’re going. Nobody eats anyone and I’m the only dragon.” You said up to her. It was as if she didn’t realize that the thing carrying her could still speak, despite what she had heard before. She acted just as surprised as the first time, minus the terror of being stepped on… or almost stepped on.

“You mean I don’t have to run anymore?” she asked excitedly.

“Not unless you want to play tag with the other kids.” You replied.

“There are other kids there, that aren’t like… that?” she asked in equally as excited tone as she pointed at a group of undead children. For a little kid, she was surprisingly conditioned to the whole Zombie Apocalypse thing.

“Nope, only the living ones where we are going.” Grissom chimed in and it looked like she was about to burst with excitement and anxiety until her stomach growled. She looked down at it then back up at Grissom in an embarrassed but cute face that you could picture in your head. “How about Max makes you something special while we are traveling, would you like that?”

“He has food to?!” she exclaimed.

“Yes, why don’t you tell him what you want, just this once?” he asked with a playful wink that got her imagination going. The little girl went over a little until she could see part of your eye.

“Do you… I mean can you get a cookie and maybe some juice?” She asked. You could tell she was holding back so you looked in her mind just deep enough to see she wanted a cream filled Danish with some chocolate milk.

“No.” you said that got her to look down disappointed. “Because I think I’ll give you this instead.” You said as you materialized a cup in Grissom’s hand then filled it with ice cold chocolate milk and a plate with the Danish she desired. Her eyes sparkled as she looked over the treat and was too shocked to move. Finally she took her treat and bit into it while Grissom smiled and held her cup for her as she ate. She then drank the beverage before the dishes dematerialized and she was there licking her fingers of the precious cream that had gushed out of her treat when she bit into it.

“See, nice dragon, isn’t he?” Grissom asked rhetorically as all the children you rescued seemed to fall in love with you like only little children could. You assumed that when they got older they would be more wary of what you were but for now you enjoyed their innocent and childish love and admiration for you. She burst into tons of question as you all made your way back to your home. Questions that were so overly asked that you could answer them on default.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She pets you and accepts you.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Mr. Max Sir!” came a voice just when you were at a rare good part in a dream. Granted a good part was dedicated to a lack of substance because of your constant nightmares but even so you were actually enjoying the relative peace just as the unmistakable sound of Agent Smith’s voice woke you. You drearily opened the eye closest to him and moaned an affirmative and for him to continue. “Air Force One is in trouble and needs help landing, here!” he exclaimed in a rare form of exertion for the self important man.

“Air Force One?” you asked more to yourself as you thought about it. You supposed that it was a good enough reason to get up. So you felt around to make sure no one was too near then stretched and yawned sleepily but in a large way that you needed but knew frightened a high majority of people. But if you were going to get up for this man than he would just have to bear it. As you did this your tail accessed the roof and opened it. “What is the trouble? Isn’t that like the most secure plane ever made or something, thus why it holds the President?”

“Yes, but they’ve been in the air for a few days and just made radio contact. They are almost out of fuel, not enough to land on your air strip not to mention their escorts.” Reported Agent Smith.

“I suppose this is a stupid question, but do they know who they are asking. I don’t need a missile up my ass because they are ‘surprised’ to see me.” You asked as you flexed your wings to get the sleepiness out of them.

“They do, now please help them. They didn’t have much time when they called and that was 10 minutes ago. The will probably risk a crash landing before long.” Answered Agent Smith.

“Fine, go and tell them I’m coming and get all the others up that need to be notified; Grissom and all them. Might as well get Doc Robinson and some of the doctors on standby. One more thing. Make sure they know that if any are bitten I can’t let them inside. Even if it is the President.” You replied. He looked at you as you said that last part with a face that betrayed his hostile feelings of what you just said. “Go, not point getting mad if it won’t be a problem. Even so, report the message so they don’t panic and all that.”

With that done and Agent Smith running along the door finally opened all the way and you shot from your spot into the air. It didn’t take you long to reach a normal plane’s altitude but it wasn’t there. You then saw they were lower and went to their level as they lined their jet up with your newly made runway. It was massive, even by your standards. I would take a considerable amount of effort to life and guide down safely. You would no doubt have to use chakra, and wind style jutsus to help as well as all your draconic might. But that wasn’t your only issue. First you had to get them to turn off their engines… and not shoot at you. So you flew up to the rear escorts and lined your head up with one of them.

“Hey you.” You called as the pilot looked at you and banked to get away but you held his jet with a front claw as you soared. “Hey, I’m here to help that big boy land so relax. I need to approach without receiving a missile up my ass. Can you refrain from shooting for a few minutes please?”

“You the dragon they said is coming?” asked the pilot.

“How many dragons do you know?” you asked sarcastically. “Never mind, just let your buddy know and the pilot of that big guy that I’m coming to talk with him.”

You received a hesitant nod and waited till he did his calling before you let go of him and made your approach. You did likewise as you soared so the Pilot could see you out his window while the other windows were filled with gawking faces.

“You the dragon?” asked the Pilot.

“Why does everyone ask that? Like there are so many dragons around here.” You stated with a clear annoyance in your voice then calmed down. “Ok, I’m going to grab a hold then I need you to shut the engines off.”

“What, you’re kidding right?” He stated.

“It is going to be hard enough to land this sucker without your engines burning the crap out of my wings or working against me. I would just materialize fuel for you but we don’t have the time and I don’t know how to make this type of jet fuel yet, not to mention I wouldn’t know where the gas tank on this thing is. So just do it. Heck, you were going to crash land anyway right?” you reasoned. There was a few shouting matches before the Pilot nodded to you. You then positioned yourself above and grabbed the thing. With that done you waited for them to get closer before you took over. “Now.”

Thankfully the Pilot did as you requested just in time for your wings to spread and not be burned but the engines. You felt the strain you were waiting for as you used all the tricks you could to keep the thing gently moving down. You had your new air dragon jutsu times 10 under it and a half dozen others along with your own strength as you pulled and steered it until you were right about a fitting parking spot within the barrier but not within reach of the building so you could separate them. It was also off to the side of the runway so the escorts could land without dodging the huge thing. When all was said and done you got off the metal tube so it didn’t crush under your weight. But you more than were happy to feel the ground beneath your feet as you slumped into a halfway decent sitting position between the parking and emptying aircrafts. You let your head rest on the ground as you panted from your sudden exertion. You relaxed for a bit as they collected themselves and came over to you. Not that they had much choice.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: President in trouble.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
(Author’s note: This story is fictional and so are the people in relation to it. As such I also have both real and fake characters in the story living out fictional lives. It by no means describes what I think of them. In regards to the President the one I use is not a real person in relation to the real world. But it doesn’t reflect the respect I have for the office and those under him in reality. Just wanted to make sure I was clear on that before someone thinks that I am radical in political views or bashing someone in response to something or to my political views. This is FICTION so treat it as such. That being said thanks for your patience and read on.)

You were panting heavily until they were about halfway to you and by the time they were in speaking range you had settled but was still laboring under the previous strain. Your wings would stretch and muscles would as well, flexing your claws into the ground in deep trenches before relaxing than doing so again.

“We thank you for your hard work in keeping us safe on behalf of the United States of America.” Said a suited man. Judging by the way he was treated you assumed he was the President. You never really paid attention before about politics. Sure you understood it but the few years you were in this world didn’t strive the importance of learning names and faces of the countries’ leaders, especially if you were planning on leaving anyway. But you now had an obligation to stay, for the moment.

“I am honored to have the President give me such high esteem and praise. I apologize but I am a little out of the loop on names and faces.” You said as you unofficially asked for his name.

“I suppose I can’t fault you on that.” Said the man. You could tell that the others were ready to draw their weapons if you made even the slightest false move. “I am Henry Olson, President of the United States of America. May I be so bold as to ask your name?”

“Honor to meet you sir. My name is Max. I never really had a last name until I came here but if you must have one that Drake is one I placed on official records. I assume I don’t have to say why.” You joked as you flexed your wings again then pinned them closed.

“Now that we have introduced ourselves, may we enter your fine… home?” he asked. You took a moment to look over the crowd before answering. It was faint but there was a few that were infected and a few on the plain that had yet to rise. When they did the barrier would incinerate them but you couldn’t let them inside with those people among them.

“With respect Sir, I can’t let any that are infected inside. No matter who it is. It is one of very few ground rules of this place that keeps it safe. No infected people, no testing even to make a cure, the barrier itself will incinerate any walking corpses inside with the exception of hybrids, which the thick titanium wall keeps out.” You explained with a bow of your head at first but got more serious when vocalizing your answer.

“There are none. We checked.” Mr. Olson stated.

“Then either they are lying to you or the ones that are infected are trying to sneak in on their own accord. But either way my eyes and dragon senses can instantly see who is infected and who is not. There are 10 people in your group that are infected and I believe a few scientists carrying some infected tissue samples. With your permission I can root them out. I can tell you aren’t infected so I can let you in. Or you can stay while I deal with the others then all go in at once.” You stated.

“I think I would like to stay until things are settled. I would like to see those who thought it was ok to bring such things onto my plane and deceive me. Will we need to surrender our weapons when we go inside?” He asked.

“No, you can do as you wish with them. But there are a few rules. Just common stuff really. No murdering. Don’t bully others with them. No rebellions. Trying to kill me or overthrow me. Stuff like that. I can read minds if I need to so I can tell when someone is lying. But as a sign of respect I won’t read yours unless the situation demands it.” You answered.

“That is awful thoughtful of you. Now we should get on with this. I’m not too keen on being out here in the open.” President Olson stated to which you nodded and looked over the group.

“Ok, I’ll take the nice approach then the mean one if I need to. Will all the infected people and samples, including parts of the original virus, go over in that red box please?” You more directed then asked. One by one a few of the infected walked over and stood where you asked them to. The President was surprised that his personal assistant was one of them as she walked over. “Thank you for your cooperation. The box is surrounded by a barrier so you can’t get out or touch anyone on the outside but we can touch you if needed. But we still have a few that think they can escape my gaze. Those will go in this other red box barrier. Just so they don’t cause any unpleasantness to those that came forward.”

“Excuse me, Mr. Drake, I don’t think you have the right to tell us what to do.” Said a white haired man as he stepped out of the group.

“And you would be?” you asked.

“Richard Barkly, Vice President of the United States.” The man said with his nose in the air, that posture was really starting to piss you off. But you could see why he was acting like that. He was infected and obviously didn’t want to lose a position he had worked hard for. That and he looked a decent bit power hungry.

“Well being one of the infected you must want to stay alive until a cure is found. Let me tell you something. I have over 6,000 years of information in this head of mine. A genetic knowledge passed down. I can cure cancer, heart failure, broken or severed body parts. But there has never been a cure for this disease. Long ago, on my world, we only could wipe out every living thing and start the population over to get rid of it. So don’t expect me to allow your selfishness to influence my decision.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They are thankful.

choices: They go with the Vice President and leave.
They continue to argue, bad idea...
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Who says I’m infected?” Mr. Barkly stated.

“I do. But just for the sake of argument I’ll play nice.” You said then thought about it. “Ok, go in the circle. It is designed to keep infected people that are still alive in so they can speak with their loved ones but not accidentally infect them. But uninfected people can walk in and out at their leisure. So walk in then out. If you can than I will admit I am wrong and you are clean. If not or you refuse than it is proof that you are infected.”

“I don’t have to do anything you tell me to do. I am the Vice…” he started to which you growled at him and cut him short.

“I was woken from my sleep to save your ungrateful butt. I carried the whole plain and brought it down safely. As you can imagine I am quite tired from all that, not to mention I haven’t got more than 9 hours of sleep the last few days. Suffice to say, you are wearing on my limited patience.” You almost growled more so at him but also in general.

“Richard, do as our large friend says.” President Olson stated. Being the only society ridded person that could order him around he reluctantly went into the empty circle then tried to come out but was stopped by the barrier. “I don’t mean to pry but are you sure he is infected?”

“I do not control the barrier in those spots. I am sure but even if I wasn’t, the barrier senses it as well and doesn’t allow him to come out while the infection is present in his system. You can walk in the other red circles if you want to test that an uninfected person like you could come and go.” You suggested. You could tell he was doing so just for the sake of the others. He walked in one of them then back out. Just to be sure he walked in the one the Vice President was in then walked out.

“I’m sorry my friend.” President Olson stated as he looked at him then back at you. “Will you kill him?”

“I was going to give those that came forward an option to go out fighting, quick death, or being eaten. I would’ve just tossed the others out as carelessly as they had thought of the others. A single person inside could kill the thousands that are safe inside. I am not too happy with people that think they can play with that many lives. But I can leave him alive or end it quickly as a favor to you.” You answered.

“Are there any others?” asked President Olson.

“Just the samples those two scientists are holding.” You stated as the two in question flinched as they were pointed out.

“They hold the key to my salvation. If they can synthesize a cure than…” Barkly stated but again was silenced by a growl from you.

“I said it before. I will allow NO infectious things inside. I don’t care if you do have a ‘possible cure’. Like I said, you are wanting me go against a couple thousand years of wisdom on the chance you MIGHT be right. No I will not risk all the lives here for that. I can fly you anywhere in the city but that stuff is not getting inside.” You said, this time more bluntly and with more authority.

“But we must be able to…” argued one of the scientists but you snapped your attention over to them that made them be silent as well.

“Say another word about it and I’ll incinerate those things on the spot. So I’ll give you a choice.” You said as you materialized a full commercial helicopter all fueled up off to the side and inside the Vice President’s circle. “The A.I. in the Chopper will take you anywhere it has the fuel to take you then dematerialize upon your arrival. You can either put that stuff in there and come with the rest of us, or you can go with him and do your research elsewhere.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They argue and resist.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
With snooty looks but no words the two scientists and a few others went with the Vice President into the Chopper. Soon it was off and far away but not too soon for your taste. With that done and everyone separated you used your tail to access a virtual control panel on the side of the door that you were in front of. It was more like a hangar door as it was big enough to fit you or the big Air Force One jet through its frame. The humans watched the 4 foot thick titanium door opened. They were both intimidated and happy that such a large and thick door would be protecting them. When the door was open enough the humans from inside came out.

“Sir, Agent Smith at your service.” Agent Smith said with a salute to the president that was received and returned so he could continue. “Where is the Vice President?”

“He was infected. So our mutual friend let him and the scientists take a chopper out to do their research.” One of the other Officers said to which Agent Smith looked at you.

“Jim Brass, you mind taking care of the other infected? I’m pretty sure they’ll opt for the going out with a fight option but let me know if they choose one of the others.” You said than looked over at Grissom and the others. “Sorry, as usual, you guys are on people duty. Don’t think they want be scared out of their minds while figuring things out.”

“We’ll handle it Max.” Brass replied.

“Good, I could use a nap.” You said as you got up shakily then went into the building.

It felt good to be able to trust them. You had did your best to rid the city of hybrids but they were always on the look out with really big guns. Some of the officer snipers went up top to practice or be a look out. So there was no way a Hybrid Zombie would be able to surprise you or them. This was the first time you were tired but still had a majority of your energy. So you just needed a nap. Hopefully longer than the others that you have gotten lately. You took one last look in their direction as you took a spot on the floor and curled up to sleep. Unfortunately your dreams weren’t as calm as when you had been woken up. It seemed the harder you tried to have good dreams the more you had the bad ones.
