Either way you knew that you had regain your rest so you forced yourself to remain in the nightmares for a while then woke up when you figured you had enough rest.

“Hey Max!” came a voice as soon as you were moving and opened your eyes. You knew who it was all too well. Even if she didn’t have the same feel as Sarah, Rose was still a joy to have around. She was in midair by the time you opened your eyes and landed as far up on your snout as she could. You chuckled as she climbed your snout and sat on the end of it. “You were asleep for like a whole day. The adults said I couldn’t play with you until you woke up. But now you’re awake now right?”

“Yes, as awake as I’m going to get. Did you have a good day so far?” You asked back.

“Some of the boys were picking on me but other than that it was pretty good. I had a hotdog for lunch too!” Rose answered.

You could hear a conversation start over to your side and you glanced quickly over there to see a circle of the President, some of the high ranking people he arrived with, along with Agent Smith and Grissom. You kept playing with Rose but half listened to their conversation.

“Isn’t that girl scared?” asked one of the men as he looked over at you.

“She use to be. They met when he was out on patrol and almost stepped on her. But now she really has taken a shine to him.” Grissom stated as they looked over at you and Rose as she jumped around and excitedly told you about her day and asked meaningless questions that children often thought of like why metal was gray and how long it took to make the door. You didn’t mind as she was just a kid and, unlike most of the others with parents, she was both allowed and desired to be around and with you. That desire made her infantile questioning almost cute and acceptable.

“Did I hear you right, that he can turn into a human?” asked President Olson asked.

“Indeed he can Sir. It appears to come with a considerable amount of pain and effort. So he stays as a dragon. Can’t really blame him. If I could change to a dragon you would bet I would stay that way to, especially now days.” Agent Smith replied and they seemed to all nod and put sounds of agreement out.

“From what I’ve seen, he could probably rid the whole city of the undead. What’s stopping him?” Asked another General of the group.

“That is simple, he needs to eat.” Grissom stated in a less demeaning way than it would otherwise sound.

“He eats them?!” asked President Olson.

“With respect Sir, I didn’t understand for a while either.” Started Agent Smith. “But there are very few abundant food sources to feed him. Most have been killed or are being used by… well us. He can survive a bite or eating them so he does. He does say they don’t taste too good. That I also believe as they are decaying and I don’t know of even too many animals that would eat decaying meat. He also needs energy to fight, live, and materialize things including our food. I guess eating a materialized version of pizza is better than what he eats.” He finished and you felt oddly better as the man usually did nothing but question you and now he was defending you… kind of.

“I guess I should be glad he doesn’t eat us instead.” He said as he looked over just in time to see you catch Rose as she jumped off you snout with your tongue and pull her into your mouth, closing it behind her. “What the hell!”

“Hold on.” Grissom said calmly before any of them could panic and looked over at him and Agent Smith as they sat there as if nothing was wrong.

When they had taken their seats again they looked over to see you open your mouth again and Rose bouncing around on your soft tongue like a extremely soft and wet bouncy house. They seemed to become more calm as they heard her cheers and laughter as you played with her. You had to admit that it was not your favorite thing to do with your mental injuries to this sort of thing, not to mention she was really tasty. But as long as she didn’t go down your throat or get impaled on your teeth you were ok with it. She would be too old for this kind of thing soon enough so you just let it happen and was pleased you were making her happy. With a snap you closed your mouth again and let her play inside to her heart’s content.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They go with the Vice President and leave.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“How someone could want to be in that position is beyond me.” Stated one of the Generals.

“It isn’t as bad as it sounds.” Grissom stated but to all their heads snapping to him he was pushed to explain. “You see he isn’t a death trap. In fact his body can heal people from injuries and diseases as serious as mutilated body parts, paralysis or cancer. He has a second stomach that can enhance those healing abilities and techniques by at least 10. I admit that his mouth would be the last place I would dream of being. But for a child that has no concept of things except trusting her loved ones and friends. Being on a bed of velvety soft tissue inside her closest friend that can protect her from the Zombie threat we all fear. Can you really not see why?”

“So he what? Swallows people to heal them?” President Olson asked.

“No, he CAN but he WON’T. He has had a rather colorful and betrayed life so far. Let’s just say he has his reasons for not eating innocent people. I’m sure he is having a hard time with catering to Rose’s wish of playing. Even if the flesh of humans is apparently a dragon delicacy. Honestly I am surprised that he chooses humans over his own kind. Instead he hates dragons and loves humans. Again, he has his reasons that I am sure will get around soon enough.” Grissom answered.

“And what is his intentions? It looks like he could start a war from here.” President Olson said as he looked behind him at the collection of military grade vehicles as well as ammunition stockpiles.

“Apparently all of that was just research at one point. He also wanted to be able to help in situations like this. So he researched things so he could materialize things like Ammo or the Chopper the Vice President used. I think his number one goal is just to live peacefully. But people don’t make that very easy. So he thinks it wise to be well versed in as many areas as he can. The way it is, a thousand or so people depend on him. He provides shelter, food, water, power, training, Safety, and many other things. All he asked in return is for us to give him a chance if a trust issue ever comes up.” Grissom explained.

“But he also is in command here, isn’t he?” asked a suited man next to the General that spoke earlier.

“Yes. But is what he asks really that hard. He has yet to command us to do anything. He always asks and if we can’t than he does it himself. The only things he doesn’t budge on is safety. There has only been one instance of murder here. He was quick to find the person and place him out in a remote but relatively safe section of the city. Instead of starving or stomaching the slop others are probably having around the world. He can materialize real food for us. We don’t go wanting and he isn’t exactly charging us rent or anything. He just wants us to live happily with each other. Anything that threatens that can make him a little… feral or angry I guess.” Grissom explained.

The all looked over as you put Rose on the ground, dried her off from her playing, and sent her along with a woman that was in a teacher’s uniform. The teacher was understandably nervous but Rose was giggling and waving goodbye to which you waved back with your tail, which got her to laugh. Now that she was gone and out of the way you could stretch and yawn out the rest of your kinks. You were a little sore from the whole lifting their Jet but other than that well rested. With that done you walked over to the group.

“Good morning, I hope you all slept well.” You greeted with more of an upbeat attitude than they saw the night previous.

“Well enough, your set up here is very impressive.” Said President Olson. He obviously didn’t realize you could hear the whole conversation. But it looked like Grissom understood and just nodded that he too had slept well.

“Grissom, did Captain Brass send the others on their way?” You asked.

“Yes, they left once he brought them some weapons to use. You might want to restock soon. He said a few of the more popular guns and ammo are running low.” Grissom answered.

“I’ll remember that. For now I think I’ll be off to make my rounds and get some breakfast.” You replied back then looked over to the whole group rather than just him. “Make yourselves at home and don’t be shy about grabbing what you need, baring stealing from others. We have plenty and I can always make more.”

“We thank you for your hospitality Mr. Dragon.” Responded one of the Generals.

“Please, it’s just ‘Max’. Saying ‘Mr.’ just makes me feel old.” You joked then walked toward and open space over the roof door that was opening. You knew they were watching as the morning light came in and you spread your wings before taking off once again.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They continue talking without you.

choices: You need to learn how to duel, their way.
You would like to just live in peace.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You woke slowly in a similar manner as before, in an apparent hospital bed but instead of the silent noise you were used to it was loud and chaotic. It was so overbearing that you had to dial back your senses so not to pass out. Although, despite the loud noises, you were glad that once again you woke to the sun nourishing you. You heard a beep in the room then snapped to the sound, finding a small device that you looked to. You examined it for a while and determined that it was some kind of advanced security device. It was also obvious to you that you had just appeared in a realm that was full of relatively advanced technology but also, you could feel great power that rivaled yours, not surpassed but rivaled. You couldn’t located the feeling but it was definitely there. You hit a button on the side of the bed by mistake and found that it rose the back so you could sit relaxed and upright. It was then that the door opened and a very proud looking person came in.

“So you finally awake.” Said the man as he closed the door which was followed by the surveillance device beeping again then, with you enhanced vision, you saw it lose power. The man was wearing a very nice suit made of silk, had brown hair, blue eyes, and a powerful feeling coming not from him but his case that he carried. It was as if something in the case was watching you but not directly.

“Who are you? Where am I?” you asked in rapid succession. For some reason he seemed offended that you didn’t know who he was but then he looked past you at something. You followed his gaze to see your tail twitching beside you. You quickly retracted it but you guessed it was too as anyone that saw you or heard would know about it.

“I’ll take that as a confession that you’re not from around here. You plunged through my building and into my office half dead. You’re currently in a private hospital because of your… tail. As for who I am, I am Seto Kiaba CEO of KibaCorp and the number one duelist in the world.” He stated.

“Duelist? That means you fight other people in a ring or something?” you asked then looked his body over. “No offense but you don’t look like the physical combat type.”

“You’ve never heard of duel monsters?” Kiaba asked.

“You mean beasts you force to fight each other, like dogs or something?” you asked back, trying to gauge the man you were dealing with.

“What! No, duel monsters is a card game.” He stated then went on to describe the basis and background of what it was about. Some of the things he mentioned were obviously fabricated but in general you got the general idea, especially when he showed you a few cards. You immediately sensed the living… soul was the best term but not really. More like a compliant and illusion based transportation jutsu but utilizing magic instead. Each card had an original where the ‘soul’ or the monster resided then copies of it where it could also be used but on a much less… direct manner. However, on the surface they were just cards in a childish game.

“Hmm. Amusing little game, might actually be some fun. Is that really all this realm has to offer?” you asked.

“Realm? Where are you from?” he asked and based on his explanation you decided to try to explain some of it.

“Basically a different world or version of earth that is, apparently, very different from this one. The realm(s) I come from are still using knives and swords to settle our differences, that and dragons, giant animals, and other things that honestly put these things to shame.” You said as you handed him back a card of a dragon type monster. “I mean, have you actually ever seen a real dragon before? Not on the councils things you created, but one that could just as easy eat you than have a conversation with you?”

“I have, Slifer the Sky dragon, Winged Dragon of Ra, and Blue Eyes White dragon to name a few.” He stated as he said the last one it was obvious which he preferred.

“And you’re still alive, that either means that they are relatively loyal, weak enough not to attempt an attack, or just didn’t care to take a chunk out of you. Never really heard of them before but the way you said it means that they have some kind of loyalty but also favor. Doubt you had an actual conversation with one of them but…” you stated back at him.

“And you have spoke with dragons?” he asked skeptically.

“Yes I have. Although I mostly slay and eat them but I do have one that I’m on good terms with. That and I am a dragon so I know a little more about that topic than you would.” You stated.

“Don’t make me laugh…” he started but left a pause for you to fill in you name.

“Max.” You introduced.

“Max, you… a dragon, do you take me for a fool?” he asked.

“Well you already saw my tail. But to be more accurate I am a half-breed. I can go from 100% human to 100% dragon as well as grow dragon parts and not lose any abilities as human or dragon.” You said and to make your point more accurate you grew your tail again, along with wings, eyes, and some skin.

“Ok, ok, I get it.” He said to which you retracted your dragon parts. “Then what are you going to do?” he asked.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Yu Gi Oh GX

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
After your little conversation with Kiaba, he brought you to his lab then showed you a ‘duel disk’. With his permission you made one of your own. It was retractable so that it appeared to be a titanium wrist band on your left arm. You could activate it and it sprang out with a more sickle like or long axe blade shaped design with a razor sharp edge so it was not only for dueling but could be used as a deadly weapon. He inspected it and made sure its programming was correct. While doing this you got a crash course in modern, to them, technology so you could function in the world. But when it came down to picking a deck you were at a loss. He knew you had to get schooling so he enrolled you into the school that he started for teaching students how to duel as well as the other classes. But you had asked about specialized cards for you, dragons being the main focus. He knew a lot but when you asked if your dragon form could be a card he was at a loss. So he, reluctantly, escorted you to a man named ‘Maximillion Pegasus’.

“Hello young man, I was briefed by Kiaba boy here about your unusual request. You want to be made into a card and have a specialized deck, yes?” He asked.

“That is correct. How much do you know?” you asked.

“Everything, Kiaba boy has been nice enough to share the video conversations so you don’t have to repeat you most magnificent story. I also know that you wish to remain a secret. I’ve never actually made a card from a monster that is physically in front of me, and both willing and able to tell me what it’s capable of.” He answered.

“Enough of this nonsense. I came here to get him started and to finally see him as a dragon. Let’s get on with it.” Kiaba said, probably sick and tired of being called ‘Kaiba boy’ by Pegasus.

“Yeah, I’m kind of anxious to fly around a bit. It’s good to know that I don’t have to worry about people overreacting to it in small and distant doses, since they see your holographic monsters all the time.” You agreed.

“Very well then. I gave my entire staff off then went over to this private island by my lonesome for this. You can change when you wish.” Pegasus stated the Kiaba looked at you as if to tell you to change.

“I’m going to need more room.” You said then was led out to a large and open area that looked to be prepared for you to pose and plenty of room on the side for you to land, stretch out, take off, and anything else you needed. You formed wings and a tail then took to the sky like a bullet to their surprise. But they fell over when you exploded and turned into a dragon, larger and more fearsome looking than they had been expecting. You decided to push them a little and let out a deafening roar that you know was loud enough to reach the cities that were miles away. You soared for a while then came down and landed in the open area in front of them, flexing your wings before slowly walking over to them then laying down.

“C… can you still talk?” Pegasus stuttered.

“Yes, as I have said, I lose none of my abilities of one form when going to the other. It was because of this that I am known as a dragon ninja.” You said down to him as he looked your body over and Kiaba was recycling his pride and stature.

“You’re bigger than the Egyptian gods!” Kiaba exclaimed as he looked at your body in awe.

“Well yeah, I already told you that Dark Hunters are at the top of the dragon tower. Sure we may not be as long as the sky dragons by our size is nothing to snuff at, and it is one of the smallest considerations when judging our level of potential danger. I can do magic, ninja techniques, normal dragon skills, and a host of other things that even I am not aware of that my genetic memory tells me about.” You responded and the info intrigued Pegasus more than a little bit.

“Um, can I get started please?” asked Pegasus as he attached some kind of digital art brush system to his head and body to begin designing.

“Yes of course Mr. Pegasus.” You answered and Kiaba reluctantly but also instinctually retreated to a seating area nearby to which he just gawked at you.

“Now, if you don’t mind, stand up so I can get a good look at you.” he said to which you complied. He walked around you, under you, and even on top of you (with your permission).

Finally he looked to have a few ideas. He asked you to perform attacks and abilities that you were more likely to do in a fight, only in dragon form. He drew, and drew, and kept drawing as he created card after card of your attacks, magic, and poses. The one he went with for your personal card was a picture of you roaring at him. You looked like you did when attacking another dragon, fierce, blood lusted, ferocious, with your eyes glowing, your muscles flexing, some spikes out, claws digging trenches, tail flattened, your jaws poised to tear the offending dragon to shreds. You thought it portrayed you perfectly how people that didn’t know you saw you. The other cards depicted your exact look when you did something that he thought deserved a card, which was a lot since he had never seen a real dragon outside his creations do what you were doing. Kiaba just sat back and watched the show. Finally the surprisingly exhausting exercises were over to which you took both of them for a ride then went back to human so they could explain things to you and you could to them. Most things about what the cards should be able to do and how to play them, what the rules in do so were and such. But then it came down to distribution.

“I agree with you Pegasus. I mean no offense Kiaba but I can sense the living forces inside the cards you hold. It is strange but I can feel this card resonation with me and when you put it in a duel disk I could actually see through its eyes, moving on its behalf to your commands. I can’t imagine my consciousness being split again and since the rest of these are exclusively for him and the other dragons to support him and also exclusive to this deck I feel like these should be the only copies of… well me. I know that having a card out there that is more powerful than the gods and that Exodia thing is a little strange and one sided but that is another reason why there shouldn’t be a copy of it.” You said as Pegasus and Kiaba were arguing over wither or not to mass produce this new set of cards that literally had your essence in them. You even could materialize them at will and have them appear inside your customized duel disk.

“You do?” Kiaba asked as he was surprised by that fact.

“Yeah, imagine how you’d feel if someone was giving you orders that you literally had to follow. Makes sense why the big three kick the crap out of people that they don’t want controlling them. I do thank you Mr. Pegasus and Mr. Kiaba for this wonderful gift and help.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You need to learn how to duel, their way.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were relaxing in the duel hall after you arrived. Pegasus and Kiaba had given you two more things, besides themselves as possible support figures. The first was a copy of every card they had ever produces, even god cards, and stayed around till they were certain you could materialize them at will. Although they insisted that you only materialized the cards that you’ve dematerialized, for no other reason than to not piss off the monsters for making extra copies of them, which you now more than agreed with. You also had one blue eyes, compliments of a fourth to Kiaba’s three that he told you about. So in essence you could materialized any deck you wanted as you dueled. The second thing was a unlimited data retrieval unit that displayed all the information on anything they had access to. Through this you were studying everything, from the elements to different tech and what to expect. By this time you had a fair knowledge about most of what people knew, as well as a flawless knowledge of dueling and the society that had now built itself around it. You also met with each of the monsters to determine who and what they were, along with what level of willing cooperation they were up to. The gods were harder to convince but in the end, and after a transformation on your part, they submitted to you.

“Max Drake, please report to exam field three.” Said a voice that snapped you back to the room. Even with Kiaba’s jet you had arrived late but with a call from him directly the professors let you in. You saw a kid named Jaden duel and he seemed ok but young. It almost pained you that you were going to be in the same level of class he was in. Little kids that looked weaker than… well they were very weak, physically at least. Dr. Crowler waited for you in an attempt to rebuild his loss to Jaden by defeating you. He looked at you with disdain as you entered the arena and exam field across from him.

“Did you lose your duel disk amateur?” He asked which caused some laughter until it came out of its hiding spot with your deck already inside it, activating without you even raising your arm. The action got the laughing to stop and Dr. Crowler to drop the cards he just drew. He quickly picked them up and started the match after you drew your set. “Well I’ll start just like last match except I can’t look at your cards, pity. But I can still do this!” he said as he brought out his ‘legendary rare monster’ that looked more like a legendary scrap yard to you.

“I win.” You said as you drew a card then placed all the pieces of Exodia on the disk in one sweeping motion. The big guy came out and just stood there to the crowd’s amazement. “Kick his… butt” you said as you had to censor yourself around so many kids. Exodia almost laughed at you for this but wisely decided against it. Unlike the others that summoned him, you could come over to his space and kick his ass if you wanted. In fact, that was exactly what you had to do to… convince him that you were worthy of his power and stronger than he was. Exodia sent the oversized scrap yard off the field with one attack than overloaded some of the circuits, ending the duel with you the winner. “Later.” You said to him then deactivated and retracted your disk and sending him back. The room was silent as you bowed to your overdramatic teacher who laid on the ground after the attack. Sometimes the attack power of the monsters appeared physically to the combatants, which is why people’s clothes ruffled and such when cards were played. But in the case of such powerful monsters like him or you, the attack power could have a slight effect on those that it was aimed at. Nothing fatal of near actual injury but enough to send someone off their feet or blow them hard enough to take the cards out of their hand if they didn’t have a firm grip. With that you assumed you got perfect scores on both your exams and went back to your seat. You could feel many eyes on you as you did so but you didn’t really care, that was until that kid Jaden came over.

“Dude, that was awesome! Never actually saw someone play Exodia before and I don’t think it has ever been done on the first turn. Not to mention your duel disk is cool to.” Jaden said as he sat next to you but not in the seat, rather on the one in front of that one looking back straight at you.

“Thanks, I think. But you beat him just as easy.” You said to him.

“True, but it wasn’t as fast that. I’ve never seen someone win that fast against someone like him before.” He continued.

“Yeah, how’d you do it?” A blue haired kid that was named Syrus asked.

“Same way you did. Draw cards, play them right, and win. Doesn’t really matter how fast you win. You both won so that about sums it up. Not that hard once you figure it that way.” You answered.

“Yeah, I guess so. I just get really nervous when I duel.” He sighed.

“Please report to the administration desk for your departure.” The announcer said over the loud speaker.

“Sounds like that’s us.” Jaden stated and you all went that direction. It was then they saw how big you were. Even if your relatively young age to dragons gave you a youthful look you were 6’4” tall and obviously very well built, like a fleshy looking statue made of metal.

“Hey, you’re huge to? Man you got everything.” Syrus stated as he looked up at you.

“Not everything. Besides, being small isn’t that bad…” you said and purposefully walked into a low sign, although it looked accidental to prove your point to which it improved his attitude and caused the three of you to laugh.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Entrance match.

choices: Helping out new friends in a jam.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So you’re in red to huh.” Jaden asked as he was observing the others and making friends. You were in the Slifer dorm but for you it was by choice rather than doing poorly on the entrance tests. You liked how open it was and that you were allowed to sleep in the woods or outside if you really wanted.

“Yep, although for me it was by choice as I did ace the entrance exams and was suppose to be in blue.” You replied.

“You were? Then why did you choose this place?” asked Syrus as he gestured to their dorm.

“Because this is the only dorm that doesn’t require you to sleep in your room. I can sleep outside under the sky if it’s nice. That and all that overpriced stuff they got in the other two dorms is just too… eccentric to me. I like things simple. As for the color, I’m not wearing it anyway and I couldn’t care less what color rank I am when wiping the floor with someone in a duel, doesn’t matter what their wearing either.” You answered as you gestured to your clothes. They were a pair of boots that were durable but also good for running, a black pair of loose pants, and a black sleeveless shirt that was tight enough to show your highly developed body but not tight enough to be considered skin tight.

“So you’re not even going to sleep in the dorm?” Syrus asked.

“Nah, I got permission to build my own if I want. But I like it outside and it is still considered my dorm.” You answered.

“What about your deck and duel disk? You got to be able to put it somewhere safe and to recharge.” Jaden said.

“Not really, this is my duel disk.” You said as it sprang from your wrist band and slinked out like a sword or switch blade knife. “It also stores my deck and other cards. I really don’t need much else. I use the dorm for showers or use the water over the cliff to wash up. Either way, I’m fine and more comfortable traveling light.” You explained then retracted the duel disk as they watched it sink back into the wrist band like magic.

“That has to be the coolest duel disk I’ve ever seen. Where’d you get it?” Jaden asked with Syrus listening intently for your response.

“I had KibaCorp make it for me. Got a specialized and exclusive deck from Industrial Illusions as well. Not that I’m going to need to use them but all the same.” You answered.

“You know Seto Kiba and Maximillion Pegasus?” asked Syrus.

“Kind of, currently we are more acquainted than anything.” You reported to him as you nervously scratched the back of your head. “Well I need to take a look around and you two need to go find your room so, see you later.” You said and they dumbly waved back as you walked away toward the woods.

You identified several spots of interest, including an abandoned dorm that gave off a weird vibe. You also checked out the coast and the cliffs around it. This lasted for a while as you became familiar with the area then went back for the welcome dinner. It was fine but a little small for your large appetite. So when you all went to bed you took a quick swim and caught enough fish then wolfed them down. All in all you thought that this slightly boring but easy life would work out just fine. Unlike the other realm, monsters here were accepted and, despite the belief by most that they were just cards, were pretty accepting of people like you. Even if you were leagues away from spreading your true self to anyone but the two already had, you hoped that things would remain the way they are. As you drifted off to sleep in on the grass near the edge of the cliff you slept peacefully for the first time in a while.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Getting started and sorted.

choices: You leave help Alexis to the nurses office.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Life was working out just like you hoped. Sure the long classes and the exams were a little boring but that was more or less what you liked about it. You only had to duel once during a field test that Dr. Crowler set up and you creamed them in a single move with 5 headed dragon, Heavy Storm, Future Fusion, and Dragon’s mirror to get him out on the first turn and clear the field of nasty magic and trap cards. Other than that it was very peaceful around with no real drama, for a while at least. But just for fun you hung out with Jaden, as he seemed to be the one that had the most excitement around him and accepted people more often. As a default you got to know Syrus and Chumley pretty good as well.

“Alexis?” asked Jaden asked as the four of you looked around and arrived at the abandoned dorm. They exchanged words about why she was there. How the dorm was a spot where students disappeared frequently and one of those people was her brother. Then she melted away into the forest when they weren’t looking. You were almost impressed at her ability to mask her presence but then you and the others went inside the dorm. You and Jaden kept agreeing on ways that you could make the place livable then a scream was heard and you all tracked it to a space where Alexis was being held.

“Alexis!” they all called as they saw her in a freaky looking coffin of sorts.

“Ha, ha, ha… she can’t hear you. She’s locked away… in the shadow realm.” Said a man as he rose skillfully out of some artificial smoke.

“Ah, give me a break.” Jaden said.

“Don’t believe me? Then let me show you, in a shadow game.” It was then you chimed in. You had been in the shadow realm before when talking with duel monsters and traveling to their world of sorts. Not only was this guy a fraud but a bad one that only the kids beside you would believe. It also didn’t help him that he was only asking for a duel and that you could see right through it with your dragon senses and your skills as a ninja.

“Shadow game? If you can actually pull one off then I accept. What are the stakes?” you said before Jaden said anything.

“I can, and I will.” He said as you stepped forward.

“Hey, I wanted to duel this guy.” Jaden whined.

“You can’t have all the fun Jaden. I doubt this guy will last more than a single turn just like the rest. But it will be worth it just to see him squirm. With his half baked tricks and attempt at magic.” You retorted and he agreed.

“Oh my magic isn’t fake nor is it weak. I will send your soul and those with you to the shadow realm.” He said in an ominous voice that echoed through the room. You then noticed that while he might’ve been playing around the space he picked wasn’t. It was a doorway for doing exactly what he was bluffing.

“You want to have a shadow game, you should be careful what you threaten. For those who are actually responsible for this kind of thing don’t play halfway or in your circles. One more threat like that and I’ll make you wish you had never crossed me with such an inferior display of power and trickery.” You warned.

“Ah, but that is exactly what I am doing.” He said as he activated his duel disk and started up with the smoke again. You just sighed and activated yours as well. “Now witness the terror as my fiends come out to play.” He said then put on a show as he summoned a fiend type monster in attack mode with a fair amount of attack points with a field spell that changed the room to his liking.

“Alright, if you want a shadow game so badly then let this room do what it intended.” You said as you stepped forward, making the room activate a glyph on the floor then you both were surrounded by a space to duel in the shadows.

“What! What have you done?” he asked as he tried to regain his composure.

“It’s not what I did. You did this. This room was made to house shadow duels and all it takes is someone to call for one and another to accept. So you called and I accepted and they are the security. However, unlike me our little slug friends are not as fearful of you as they are of me.” You answered as the little mud or slug like monsters shrilled away from you but swarmed him until he was taken over.

“The shadow’s hunger for a soul.” The man said as he was possessed by the little buggers.

“You just don’t get it. We’ve met before you insignificant little pest and my answer still hasn’t changed. But this time you challenged me to this childish card game. To top it off you won’t even face me yourself. So I’ll kick your ass then leave and you can have the idiot human that thought he could intimidate me.” You stated then drew. You smiled then put your card on the field. “This is something special. No one has seen it in battle before so you’re the first. A monster more powerful then the Egyptian God cards and Exodia. The Dark Hunter King, if drawn on the first turn I can immediately summon him to the field. He is immune to traps, magic, and other effects other than ones that specify his name directly. To top it off he starts out with 10,000 attack and defense points and gains 1000 extra for every dragon type I send to the grave yard, with from the field or from my hand. Not that he needs any extra power so I’ll just introduce you to him.” You said then summoned… well yourself and just for fun you let your eyes flash red as well, just to put the little man in his place.

Your dragon form came out and almost crowded the space, roaring at the man and making him shake. This was a shadow game so everything was more physical than just an ordinary duel. The extra slugs screeched away. You didn’t even have to command him as you were both the duelist and the monster. So… you incinerated the opposing monster and his life points along with it, careful to leave him alive but highly scorched and smolder. That left the slugs as you deactivated your duel disk and walked to the exit, they consumed him and you left him there as he willed and remembered to change your eyes back before exiting, joining the others as they saw to Alexis.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Helping out new friends in a jam.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ah, what happened? What are you all doing here?” Alexis asked as she woke from her sleep to see the four of you near her and she laying on the ground. She sat up and observed the people around her.

“What? Well that’s a hell of a way to say thank you. We’re here because we defeated the bad guy, and rescued the damsel in distress… or more or less. Max did the whole shadow game thing and carried you out here.” Jaden answered as he referred to you as you sat on a low branch of the tree next to them.

“He did, I mean you did?” she asked you to which you swung and dropped to the ground then sat against the tree.

“What were we suppose to do, just leave you there?” you asked.

“Most people would’ve.” She stated.

“Well, we aren’t most people then. Oh, we found these.” Jaden said as he handed her a picture and her card that led your group to her. Of course you could smell her but that was beside the point.

“This… this is my brother. This is the first sign of him that I’ve seen in a while.” She stated almost in shock as she looked at the picture. You also made a mental note of his appearance to reference later, if you ever saw him.

“Well you know what. You don’t have to search for him alone. Because, from now on, we’ll be searching with you.” Jaden said as she took it in with a pleasant smile of gratitude and happiness. But any form of verbal acknowledgement was gone as the sun came up. “Darn, we got to get back before they notice we’re gone.” Jaden said as the three of them quickly got up and started running back to the dorm. They knew that you didn’t have to so they didn’t even bother asking why you were staying. “Oh, and if anyone asks, we were never here.”

“You you guys were here.” She said more to you but also in response to him, although they were too far away to hear it. “You don’t have to get back?”

“Not like they do. I got special permission to sleep outside if I want, which I exercise more than enough to make sleeping in the woods believable.” You answered.

“Well, thanks for saving me. That guy, he just grabbed me out of nowhere. Such a creep…” she said as she droned off.

“You should be more careful. You of all people know about this place. If you’re not ready for things like that to happen you shouldn’t be here. You will not do your brother any favors if you end up disappearing too.” You returned.

“I know, I just can’t stop from coming here in hopes of seeing him again.” She said as she looked at the abandoned dorm.

“Just be more careful next time or learn to defend yourself against idiots like that. Either way, you are the last person that should be taken by surprise around here. Unlike the others, you know more about what and why people are disappearing.” You advised as you got up and helped her to her feet.

“Wait.” She said as you turning to walk away. She had her hand on your arm in an attempt to hold you there but not force you. You turned toward her so she could speak. “Why did you come in the first place?” She asked.

“Originally, we just came as a follow-through of a horror game we played back at the dorm. We didn’t even know you were here until we saw you at the entrance. After, when we heard your scream there was only one option as far as we were concerned.” You answered.

“Well thanks for saving me.” She said again.

“No problem Alexis.” You said then started walking back to school and leaving a smiling Alexis before she to left for her dorm.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Alexis wakes and thanks you.

choices: Zane, the big man on campus.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Unfortunately your group’s little visit to the abandoned dorm was leaked somehow to the school which caused you and Jaden to be put at the school’s mercy. It was then decided that you and Jaden would be in a tag duel where if you won you would be cleared and if you two lost then both of you would be expelled. You both agreed to it. A few days later and a few drama filled events, including Jaden dueling Zane on Syrus’ behalf and Chumley facing his dad to stay at the school, you and Jaden now stood on the field waiting for your opponents. Neither of you were even the slightest bit worried. Although Jaden had asked you after you beat him a single move to allow the duel to play out so they could have some fun.

“Now let me introduce the Parodox Brothers.” Crowler said as he did so and they addressed you and Jaden in a rather demeaning manner. But Chancellor Sheppard wasn’t going to let it slide.

“Jaden, Max. Are you two willing to continue?” asked.

“Hey, these two couldn’t even beat male pattern baldness, so there’s no way we’re going to lose.” Jaden said to which you knuckle pounded him and you two took you spots. “Now remember, don’t beat them right away.”

“You think beating us will be easy…” One of them started to which the other finished with “… We will make this more than breezy.”

“Yeah whatever, You’re not even going to touch us.” you said as you started off your move with the same strategy as another time to get 5 headed dragon out and with future fusion having another ready in two turns. Crowler seemed ready to piss his pants as he saw how easily you brought such a high level monster out on the field.

“Hey, take it easy. We want to have some fun remember?” Jaden said as you brought out his hero.

“Yeah well, it doesn’t mean I have to leave myself wide open. It also helps that my friend here can’t be destroyed in battle. So let me know when you want to end it while I bolster my line with monster capable of doing the job.” You returned to which the crowd cheered, Jaden and your other friends smiled, and your opponents scowled. You attacked one of the monsters just for fun as you knew it wouldn’t get through the squall barricade while Jaden did his thing. By turn three you had another five headed out and a baby Dark Hunter that was a level 4 monster but at 2000 attack and defense points it was a hefty addition, not to mention the special ability. If destroyed it is resurrected as a Dark Hunter Adult with 6000 attack and defense points but can’t attack for 2 turns. You also had a new card called ‘Dragon Wall’ that protected all dragon type monsters on the field from the effects of spells, traps, and monster effects. By turn five you had those three plus Red Eyes black Dragon and Blue Eyes white Dragon on the field. Your line up stunned most that looked at it as the brothers, even with gate guardian on the field, didn’t risk attacking in fear of your counter attack. For a short while you just used traps and sells to protect the life points, boost them, and protect Jaden’s monsters as they were attacked by different strategies. But in the end Jaden used a super powered Tempest to take them down and with a little help from your lineup of course. The final life point count at the end of the match was 10,000 with all your bolstering and of course there’s was 0.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Duel to stay.

choices: He faints, he is still a kid...
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
As time went on you noticed that you helping Jaden all the time only hindered him so you helped when you could but let him do all the heavy lifting. You also had taken a long enough vacation from training and, to be honest with yourself, missed the physical exertion of ninja training. The only problem was that any kind of ninja or dragon training would be noticed to readily by others around. So you built a home out of the cliff near the dorm. The door looked to be part of the cliff but led into a vast system of rooms. The first section was for people and hanging out, when you were ready to show your place to the others. Then there was a vault door that led to your training room and weapon armory, which included new weapons you saw and wished to be trained in. With that done you made a space rift so that the enormous complex was housed in the cliff itself and was protected so that someone couldn’t just destroy the cliff to destroy your new home, even if it was on purpose or accident. However you couldn’t just stay inside all the time so you set up a small training area outside and practiced outside when you could. Nothing much in the open as far as dragon abilities or jutsu but you could more than practice fighting moves and get some target practice in. Inwardly you felt better to get some pent up aggression out and more than once people saw you train, but since you weren’t doing anything compromising to your secret you didn’t really care if they watched.

“Max.” said a voice as you were wailing on a punching bag and firing Shuriken at targets between rabid strikes. You stopped to address whomever it was to see Zane walking up. You had changed to shorts and no shirt to be more relaxed while training so you quickly washed yourself off with a bucket of water then used a towel to dry as you walked over to him.

“Zane? What’s the number one ranked duelist in the academy want with me?” You asked.

“You can cut the ignorant rap. We all know you are the best here. Most are just in denial or chalk it up to luck. But I’m no fool, you draw your cards and play them as if it were second nature and effortless.” He stated.

“Best at winning I’d say that is accurate, but I’m far from a decent duelist. The title of best duelist in the school still belongs to you, although Jaden is nipping at your heels in that respect. Personally, I like physical combat multitudes more than this passive version of it. However, since it isn’t really possible around here I decided to make the best out of it and use dueling as a substitute, and to be honest it isn’t that bad of one. At least at the end of a duel no one dies or is seriously injured.” You returned to him.

“I see, I guess that makes sense. But there is still one thing that I saw in your entrance match and in different doses in your other matches, as short as they are. Every monster that is summoned reacts to you personally in some way. The opponent’s monsters are wrought with fear and the ones you summon are proud and relational. How do you explain this?” Zane asked.

“Ok Zane, we’ll talk inside. This isn’t exactly something I want any audience to hear.” You said then led him into your home then back to training vault, closing the door behind the two of you. “Do you recognize these cards?” you asked as you handed him 8 cards. He stood there, stunned and shocked at what he held.

“How did you get these?” he stammered as he looked at the 5 pieces of Exodia and the 3 Egyptian god cards. You held out our hand for them to which he gave them back before you continued.

“Well that is a simple question to answer. I got them from Mr. Pegasus and Mr. Kiaba made my weaponized dual disk. The real question is how I can summon them and it directly corresponds with why the monsters respect and fear me.” You started as you took out… you and handed your card to him. Again, it was a strange feeling. When it was with you it felt normal but when separated it felt like your consciousness was being split but you were still there. “That is the reason why.”

“What is this? Is it a form of god card?” he asked.

“No, truthfully I don’t like the title ‘god cards’ in relation to duel monsters or like creatures. But in a sense it is a card more powerful than the god cards and Exodia. It has an entire deck surrounding him and made exclusively form me with no copies. You want to take a gander at why?” you asked and explained.

“Because… you’re friends with its creator?” he asked.

“No, although that is true. Zane, what I’m about to tell you is a highly guarded secret and I’ll probably erase your memory or kill you if you spread it around. Do you understand?” you asked as a final precaution to which he simply nodded his head. “I am that card, that is me. I allowed Mr. Pegasus to make a series of cards for me and of me only for me. The reason why even the big four fear me is because I am, in a sense, a duel monster vastly more powerful than they are.”

“No… that’s impossible…” he stammered.

“Then play it and find out. Only this once will I allow you to summon me. Otherwise I would react similar to the other three.” You stated as you and them had that in common as far as punishing those that summoned you without your support in doing so. He activated his duel disk and summoned you. He looked up at your enormous holographic form as it snarled and growled at him instead of facing the direction he was. “Believe me now?” you asked through the hologram.

“You… him… how… Wait a minute, if you’re a duel monster than why are you in two places at once?” he asked.

“It is a weird feeling to say the least. The best way to describe it is looking through an interactive camera made in your image. I can see you through either eyes and act in both bodies. However the hologram version has less… freedom I guess. It is highly governed by the rules of duel monsters and as such so am I, when looking through his/ my eyes. Which is why I am the only possessor of… well me I guess.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Zane, the big man on campus.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ah, you’re finally awake.” You said as Zane came to from fainting out of shock from what he saw. You had brought him into the living quarters and placed him on a couch as you looked out the window and over the academy. The window was like a hologram and space distortion so it couldn’t be visible or accessed as a normal window, rather it just acted as a peep hole outside.

“What happened?” he asked.

“Well, I might’ve put too much on you at once. It’s a lot to take in you know.” You answered as your wings and tail flexed. He seemed put off by this and more visibly with your back turned but calmed down as he collected himself.

“You mean, that wasn’t all just a dream?” he asked.

“No, it wasn’t. I hope you don’t feel like I placed an added burden on you. You’re a strong guy so I thought you could handle it. I could always wipe your memory if you would prefer it.” You suggested.

“No!... ah no, that won’t be necessary. You trusted me with this and I’ll gladly accept. Although…” he started then almost froze when you turned and looked straight at him with your glowing eyes. Perhaps the added emotions was him seeing those eyes in the dragon version of you.

“Yes?” you asked which broke his temporary silence.

“There are a few things that I would like to know, I rather not be partially informed then be victim to rumor and speculation.” You said to which you nodded then sat down in a chair opposite of him. “You’re not like other duel monsters, why is that? For starters you can turn human and interact on both sides.”

“Well actually I’m from another realm all together and traveled through many to get here, learning and such on my way. Best way to describe my relation to your realm is a movie or TV show, but if the episodes really took place. Anyway, I entered this realm and was found by Mr. Kiaba. I was then introduced to Mr. Pegasus and he agreed to make a specialized set of cards for me and of me, along with some of the abilities I am capable of. They also gave me a few welcome gifts, like a copy of every card ever made by them and my duel disk. Since this school is basically the main mode of education around Mr. Kiaba entered me into it.” You explained.

“S…so you weren’t originally a duel monster?” He asked.

“Nope, I’m a half-breed. I can turn all human, all dragon, or grow some parts from either side. I don’t lose any power or abilities in either form. Like I said, when my card is played it is an interesting experience to say the least. But I’m kind of like the god cards as I don’t like being summoned by others unless I authorize it and will punish those that do. Also makes it easy to locate… well me if it is stolen.” You answered.

“Would you be considered a on the side of good or evil?” he asked.

“That’s a tough question to answer. I try to be good and do what is right. But let me ask you. If you were a dragon and other people and even other dragons were actively trying to kill you and those you loved, what would you do to protect them?” you asked back.

“Anything.” He responded without hesitation.

“Likewise. To that effect I have done some things, while noble from my point of view, still weigh heavily on my heart and could easily be considered as an evil action. I do hold back though. I don’t bite people’s heads off, literally, if they are offending me or those around. Heck, I’ve been close to dying multiple times and not done anything to retaliate or get revenge. So if I had to answer from my perspective then I’d say I’m on the good side but not on the side of what others say is good, if that makes any sense to you.” You explained.

“It does, you are on what you thing is good and not some corrupt politician’s version of good. So why don’t you help out more when… bad things happen?” He asked, a little more comfortable now but still being careful.

“If it something that someone can handle I let them. People can’t grow if you take all their opportunities to do so. I intervene when I feel like having some fun, when the opposing side makes the mistake of challenging me or low balling people around me, or if they really can’t handle it. The hardest part is when people die or are majorly injured and I know I shouldn’t do anything about it. I feel almost helpless in those situations.” You answered.

“Huh. I thought I had the hard end… It’s tuff being you, isn’t it.” He stated as he became more relaxed and more like his usual self.

“Harder than you know. I won’t bore you with details of predator mindsets and abilities that are always active but it is very difficult to interact with humans and not, well split them in half when just putting a hand on a shoulder. Keep in mind I still have all the power of my… other side so shaking hands, drawing something as flimsy as a card, not flying or speeding somewhere, and the list goes on…” you said as you let out a sigh.

“So, do you think I’ll ever be able to use… your card in a duel?” He asked.

“Maybe. If you really need the help and I find the reason to be worth it. Try to think of it from my end. How would you like someone summoning you and ordering you to attack or just take hits from other monsters, not a lot of fun you know.” You answered.

“I guess not.” He smiled which spawned more conversation and story time.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: He faints, he is still a kid...

choices: Night Shroud, the first shadow rider.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You to huh?” Zane stated as you all met in Chancellor Shepard’s office.

“Hey, we’re all here! Wait we didn’t do anything bad did we?” Jaden asked Shepard.

“No.” Chancellor Shepard said then explained about the Sacred Beast Cards under the school and you wondered why they weren’t with your collection, if you really had all the cards ever made. But you guessed there was a good reason. But finally you were able to really sink your teeth into a world threat. You were all presented with the keys to which you and the others each grabbed one.

“So these Shadow riders HAVE to win these things in a duel?” you asked in confirmation.

“Yes.” Shepard answered.

“So the keys we are holding are, more or less, bound to us until that time by more than just proximity.” You stated as you looked at it then put it in your pocket which was a portal of sorts that transported things you put into it to a little area in your vault. This made your pocket very deep and secure.

“I wouldn’t take this so lightly if I were you. These shadow riders play for keeps and fight dirty.” Shepard stated.

“Don’t worry about it. I’m sure that, between the 7 of us, we won’t let the world end on our watch.” You stated and you could sense Zane crack half a smile. After all, he was the only one in the room that knew how easy this would be for you. While he was still the best dualist you had told him your story and he had asked many questions over the weeks. So there was virtually no chance that someone would be able to beat you in a dual or otherwise for that key.

“So who’s dueling first?” Jaden asked then an open argument started on who the best was, each voting for themselves and each arguing against the other. You just looked at Zane with a comical look then you both shrugged.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Guarding a key.

choices: Use the ones you got on the field.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So, are you going to just sit back and watch?” Zane asked as you both walked through the woods.

“Nah, I need to let some aggression out. Maybe these idiots will at least be able to last a few rounds, doubt it though. I am curious to see what bluffs and threats they use. I’ve seen pretty much every type of monster that each shadow rider could be in their natural habitat and shadow games will be easy on my part. Can’t wait…” you answered but was cut short as you caught the scent of high level magic and a bunch of people being rapidly moved to another location. You tracked it with your senses as it deposited in a volcano.

“What?” he asked.

“Time to have some fun, want to come and watch?” you asked.

“Might as well, that’s why we’re guarding these things.” Zane said to which you grabbed him then raced to the volcano as some guy in black robes was introducing himself.

“You can call me Night Shroud… what the hell!” he said as you and Zane leapt beside Jaden and Alexis.

“Dibs.” You said after a little silence.

“What?” Alexis asked and Jaden looked at Zane as he cracked a slight grin before it disappeared.

“I call Dibs on… sorry what was your name again?” you asked.

“I am Night Shroud and…” he started but you didn’t let him finish as you made Syrus and Chumley, who were being held hostage, appear next to you in the group.

“Right, that guy. I call Dibs on him.” You stated.

“Hey, I was hear first!” Jaden declared.

“So, you were still shaking in your boots when I got here so I called it. Besides, you get to duel in all the cool matches and I get stuck with… Crowler. You can have the next one, unless they challenge me directly.” You persuaded.

“Fine… you can have him. Now that Chum and Sy are ok I guess it doesn’t really matter. But I get the next one.” He verified.

“How entertaining. You kids are arguing on who gets to lose to me in a shadow duel.” Night Shroud said as you walked forward, after putting an invisible barrier on the others so that Shroud couldn’t use them as hostages again, or be effected by the heat around them.

“Funny, I never said anything about losing. But since I want to stretch my legs I will indulge in a longer match, rather than beating you in one turn like I usually do.” You said as you both drew your hand from your respective duel disks.

“One turn? How will you deal with me in one turn with this?” he said as he summoned a troop dragon in defense mode. You growled under your breath and it caught everyone’s notice that the dragon was quivering from you. All the monsters in the world knew you and they also knew you hated dragons, well most dragons.

“Hmm. It appears you have a dragon deck, what a coincidence, so do I. But mine are more powerful than yours are. Let’s start small by bringing out a friend of mine with this.” You stated as you used one of your cards called ‘dragon summon’. It takes up to 10 stars off a dragon type for one turn, in your hand or otherwise. To his amazement you summoned Blue Eyes white Dragon with that and fused Red Eyes and Summoned skull from your hand to bring out Red Eyes Black Skull Dragon. Then you used another original to fill your hand with new cards. “Unfortunately for me, I can’t attack the same turn ‘Dragon Summon’ is activated so I’ll just put two face down cards and end my turn. Good luck little dragon boy.” you said.

“You have a Red Eyes?” he asked in shock.

“Obviously, and no offense to either of these two, but I have stronger dragons to call on if I need to.” You stated to which the two in front of you nodded to you in understanding. At the very least you were one of the dragons you were talking about so they didn’t take offense to it and appreciated the respect in summoning them rather than others you had at your disposal.

“Ok then, it’s time I brought out mine as well.” he said as he did a succession of moves that brought out his Red Eyes Black Dragon then put a face down card of his own out. “Just try and attack.” He challenged. You were planning to but with what?
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Night Shroud, the first shadow rider.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok then I will, but not with these two.” You said as you activated a spell card that helped summon… you. Anyway it provided 3 sacrifices without taking up zones in the battlefield. Since your card used 5 if it was summoned normally. But that wasn’t the one you were aiming for. Black clouds formed overhead and lighting erupted as you called Slifer out. He gave you a courtesy growl before roaring at your opponent. You used another spell card to bolster your hand to six cards, making him 6000 attack points.

“What! You have Slifer?” Jaden asked as he was the only one, other than Zane, that could speak from the shock of you having one of the most powerful cards, to them, in the world.

“Yeah I know, he’s pretty amazing isn’t he?” you asked rhetorically as you reached up and scratched under his chin. This being a shadow game allowed you limited interaction while still on this side of the duel. He rumbled the area with a purr that, to the untrained ear, sounded like a light growl. “Ok, will you three please teach this idiot a lesson on a real dragon’s appreciation?” you asked. They all roared then attacked. First Slifer attacked the Red Eyes and Shroud, followed but the other two in on large beam that brought his life points down to zero. With that done and the protection fields crumbling you deactivated your duel disk and transported everyone outside the volcano like it was an effect of you winning.

“Wha… what just happened?” asked Chumley.

“Max defeated the shadow rider and freed you.” Zane stated and walked over to the older boy, now that you got a good whiff of him without his mask on. The mask was now locked in the cards that the Shadow duel was played in. You transported it to one of your vaults for such items then joined them as Alexis recognized the boy as her older brother.

“Hmm, guess we kept that promise didn’t we. Not the way we wanted to find him but at least he’s back.” You stated amongst Alexis’ crying and the others still shocked but, for the moment, happy for Alexis. There was also a certain amount of relief in the air as you bent down and picked up Atticus.

“Hey! What do you think you’re doing?” Alexis asked as she was not done crying over him.

You landed next to her but didn’t stop as you closed your hand around her throat and shoved her against the wall which shook with the force you used.

“You will release the others right now or I will crush you and so that maybe reducing you to ash will do the trick.” You roared at her. She was grabbing at your hand in an attempt to force you to let go but she soon realized that you were no ordinary human, to her eyes. You stood over her to which she looked up at you glaring down at her, waiting for her to make a move in the wrong direction so you could justify killing her. “Who are…” she started before you hit the wall next to her head as she stood, demolishing it in the process.

With a quick analysis of them both you got very close to her so you could whisper in her ear. The position would normally be a stupid move to have one’s neck so close to a vampire but there wasn’t a hope in hell that she could penetrate your skin. “If I have to have this conversation again with you it will be to your corpse little vampire.” You whispered in her ear to which she started shaking and continued to after you separated and went over to help Zane get to his feet.

“What did you say to her?” he asked as he saw her shaking in fear of you.

“Don’t worry about it. Just a little predator talk.” You said cryptically as you pulled him to his feet and he nodded. He wasn’t going to pretend what that meant but he did know that it probably wasn’t a set of compliments to get her shaking like she was. “I need some rest. She’s going to apologize to each of you and Chancellor Shepard before she decides wither to stay and help of leave and not bother you again. I’ll be in the nurse’s office.” You said to the others and also shot a look to Camula as if to say that she didn’t have a choice in refusing your command.

“Ok, we’ll talk about it later.” Jaden agreed to which you left and went back to the bed in the nurse’s office.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
As soon as you got back to the nurse’s office you felt horrible again. You didn’t know what it was so Miss Fontaine put you in bed to which you almost immediately fell asleep. You were again pelted by your usual nightmares but couldn’t really get out of them. One thing strange though was 3 figures that you never saw before, roaring at you. From afar one could mistake them for the 3 god cards but up close they were extremely different. You could also feel a muck over your mind as your body worked on it. It seemed to eat away at your control to stay in human form. Once it healed it wouldn’t be a problem anymore but it was taking forever. However, finally, you were well enough to wake up.

“Hey, you’re finally awake.” Said a voice you knew was Zane’s. It took you a little bit to recognize shapes and figures as your eyes darted around. Finally you locked on his figure from your slightly inclined position.

“How long was I out?” You asked as you rubbed your head and eyes.

“You were out for quite a while. Longer even than Atticus, Alexis’ brother.” Syrus answered in his usual insecure voice.

“What happened to you? You were rocking that last duel and that Vampire lady left for good. Never saw anyone do the stuff you did. I thought you were invincible and then you were in here for all that time.” Jaden asked.

“I… I guess the shadow duel infected me somehow. I must’ve caught something from them. But I’ll get over it, what’s happened around here?” you asked.

“You missed a lot. We got all the way through the last Shadow rider, Professor Banner.” Jaden said in a shocked and excited voice in telling his/their story. He told you a play by play timeline about how everything was done and all that. You then noticed the absence of your spirit key as he pointed it out.

“Wow, and now you’re just waiting on this danger Banner was worried about. I suppose you’ll be the one having all the dueling fun?” You summarized and asked to Jaden.

“Of course, who else is there?” He asked with a laugh and a smile. It was true enough. For whatever reason he had risen to a very high level of dueling. With you bed ridden he was the only one to do it.

“In that case I’ll lend you this.” you said as you activated your duel disk, took out your card, then retracted it while giving it to him. “That is my most powerful and prized card. Even higher than Exodia and the Egyptian gods.”

“The ‘Dark Hunter King’ it has… 10,000 attack points! I could win against anyone with this thing. But wait, if this guy is stronger than the others and they kick the living mess out of people that play them won’t he do the same?” asked Jaden. You looked over at Zane, who looked at you with both a questioning and shocked gaze.

“Don’t worry about it, he’ll let you this once. Just don’t overdo it and he’ll be glad to help.” You answered. “It will return after you use it once so you don’t have to worry about returning it to me, yeah he is that powerful.”

“Ok, um… I’ll take good care of it.” Jaden said as he carefully put… you in his deck. You could feel the other cards around you as he did so. They seemed to all have the same feeling you did. Except they were weakening from it more so than you were. After a little more pointless talking and you avoiding questions about how you did the things you could do and how you had such a powerful card, they all left and Zane remained behind.

“So how are you really? You wouldn’t have given your card away to him if you had another choice.” Zane induced.

“Truthfully? The shadow games took a toll on me, but not in the way I said it did. The sickness is actually eating away at my ability to suppress my… other side. If I exert myself too much I’ll have no choice in the matter, I’ll be force into the other form. Luckily my body is working on it and it won’t be a problem after it is done. However, I am also feeling a presence that is making it harder to resist. Something else nearby that is tapping at that control. If it gets much worse I’ll… well I better be outside when it happens.” You explained.

“It must be the Sacred Beast cards. They say it has a strange effect of those around them, especially duel monsters.” Zane returned as he thought.

“Yeah, I can feel the monsters that are weak around me starting to fade, even in Jaden’s deck. Well if Jaden summons me, there is a pretty good chance I’ll lose it or be there in person rather than the hologram, or in addition to it… hard to tell what’s going to happen.” You agreed then looked at your had, flexing it then putting it back down.

“Well then, I’ll get to see you in action, finally. Not that saving me from that Vampire wasn’t impressive enough. Thanks for that by the way.” Zane said back, trying to lighten you mood.

“No problem. No one picks on a friend of mine without angering me. Using your brother as a blackmail chip. That girl had it coming.” You stated and the anger caused your eyes to shine until you slapped your hand over them and calmed down.

“Just take it easy until you have to do your thing. Last thing we need is a full grown dragon bust the school up… yet.” Zane stated with a hand on your shoulder in a comforting and secure fashion. You just nodded and shut your eyes to rest and soon his hand was gone and walking out the door.

“Zane?” you called.

“Yes?” he replied.

“Thanks.” You finished then went back to sleep.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Unlike most times when you slept, you didn't feel the drain or the need to get up. You basked in this rare time to just relax as much as you could, needed, and wanted. While you couldn't be sure, you had a halfway decent gauge on time when you were sleeping by choice. If you had to guess, you would've said that you were asleep for about a week. Well beyond enough time for your body to heal and come up with immunities to the Shadow realm effects and Sacred Beast powers. However, there was an even bigger concern that you decided you wouldn't worry about until you woke' which was now.

'Now, now. We don't need to crowd him as he wakes.' Said a voice as you started to flicker your eyes open. The voice was unmistakably Chancellor Shepard. You were lying in a slightly declined position, a few higher than 60 degrees. They must've put your bed like this so you could address them and they you when you awoke. As your eyes adjusted you saw most of your inner circle of growing friends, Chancellor Shepard, Doctor Crowler, and' Seto Kaiba.

'It's about time. I have been waiting long enough while you were taking your nap.' Kaiba said. His presence in the room was well known and respected by the others. Why not? He was in the top 2 duelist spots in the world and the owner of the largest gaming company in the world and also the academy you were currently residing in. Each one of them had a reason to look and admire him with awe.

'It's good to see you to. Not that I mind the company, but what are you doing here?' You asked more directly to Kaiba.

'I heard you were directly involved in a duel' and that you helped seal the Sacred Beast cards. Then I heard you were in here for your efforts so I came to see why. Was one trip to the shadow realm too much for you?' Kaiba asked sarcastically.

'Well, I've never been there before' and I've never met beasts like the Sacred Beasts before. My body just needed time to adjust, time that the idiots trying to steal them didn't seem too fond of giving me. So I did what I could and just slept it off. Wait' are you jealous you didn't get to see me duel?' you asked in a joking manner and he just huffed at it. 'I have to assume that you told some of them?'

'Even Yugi had the other twerps to help him. If you are really going to be at this school than you need your cheerleaders.' Kaiba stated in a sort of confirmation. It was just his way of expressing his concern. You didn't really mind the off book approach. As long as he wasn't condemning you.

'How much did you tell them?' You asked.

'I let the ones in the room see the footage of you speaking with me and with Pegasus. I'm not a fan of telling stories, nor am I suited for such an obscure task.' Kaiba answered. You looked over at the rest of them and at Zane, he gave a nod in agreement of what Kaiba just said. This confirmed for you that they knew EVERYTHING.

'Well I guess I better start Q&A.' You sighed and let your wings and tail go so they could flex and remove any doubts of what and who you are. 'Before I start with them, do you have something else?'

'I only came here to make sure my investments were well and growing.' He stated then stormed out of the room. It was hard to read him but you had been use to such things from others so you knew a back handed compliment/concern when you heard one.

'Wow, you' know him?' Syrus said, he obviously didn't know what to ask first.

'I kind of crash landed into his office. Made a big mess and all that. He was kind enough to get me started around here and make my Duel disk.' You answered.

'Ok Max, I think it is time for you to tell us what is going on. We still have a few holes to fill.' Doctor Crowler said, but when you looked over to him he flinched at your gaze.

'If they told you everything and you saw my' other side, than what other questions do you have?' You asked as you flexed your wings a little and your tail was draped but swaying off the bed.

'Are you really that kick but dragon?' Jaden asked as his excitement burst and lost all sense of subtle insertion into the conversation. You activated your duel disk and drew you out of it before returning the disk to its closed state. Then handed the card to him. He took it with even more care than before.

'Look at the eyes and the tail, wings are a little hard to see the subtle differences. Then look at mine.' You instructed as you brought your tail up, flattened it, then let your eyes glow like your image in the picture. Being as he could hear monster spirits you roared through your card to get his attention. The roar was loud and obvious enough so that all in the room could hear it.

'That is so' cool!' Jaden started, first slow than with more excitement as he passed your card to the others so they could see. When it got to Zane he handed it to you and you made it disappear, sending it back to your hidden deck. You heard the door open and instantly retracted all your dragon parts so that the interrupting students didn't see anything then left, seeing all the high level teachers in the room. Not a lot of students prefer to be that close to such people, especially around this academy' and Crowler.

'I take it that you would prefer not to be known around the school for your dragon half.' Chancellor Shepard induced.

'I am sure that it will come out eventually. If for no other reason that trouble seems to be popping up all the time. But would like to keep the whole dragon thing a secret as long as I can. I don't need people around here to be afraid of be biting off their heads for walking past me the wrong way.' You answered.

'You wouldn't do that would you?' Alexis asked to which you looked over at her with the same gentle face you usually had with her. 'Just for the record' She added quickly.

'Ok, just for the record' No, I wouldn't. It would take someone very evil and beyond saving for me to do something like that. Duel monsters and that area is one thing. They and I have an' understanding about dueling. I don't incinerate them and they respect me and come when I call. I won't even eat any of you for the sake of transportation or healing. I'm sure I covered why in the videos you watched.' You answered.

'Yes, we heard. Those people were mean and disgusting to do such a thing. But' I am kind of glad that you don't and will not do it again. No offense, but I would like to stay on this side of your other side's teeth.' Syrus blurted out.

'None taken, I don't plan on using that form outside of duels anyway. Unless I get a little stiff, to which I'll just take a few laps to stretch out my other side. You can't imagine how cramped it feels in this small body for so long.' You said as you gave another stretch as if to emphasis the point. 'Have no fear, I will not be pushing that point in the slightest. Duel or no duel, I will not be swallowing, eating, killing, or in any way harming any of you. This is a peaceful world and I plan on living peacefully in it as long as I can.'

'Well said.' Zane added to which another round of fan and paranoid based questions started surfacing and lasted well into the late afternoon.
