You couldn’t believe that a whole year passed. While you still trained and improved as a ninja and with research for the Portal Jutsu you also were really enjoying the relative peace you had in this realm. You were able to stay on school grounds and move around as a dragon during the summer. When you weren’t doing that you had your vault that you could stay in. But you really preferred the open sky and elements when relaxing, even if it was raining. You were so use to it that you really didn’t care.

As the new year started you were greeted with some returning friends. They were all glad to see you, which was a first for you. Even Sarah had her reservations about you, perhaps she was glad to see you at times but you always could feel that she had a little ping inside her emotions that feared you, regardless how calm she made you. Either way, it was good to be wanted as you were. Maybe it was the constant exposure to monsters in this game of Duel monsters but they really admired you, even the Chazz. But with Zane gone you had to find a new person to confide in. That may take longer but you were hoping one of them would be ok with it. They were friends but not as close as you’d like.

“Hey you, stop right there civilian.” Came an authoritative voice that snapped you out of your concentration. A boy with a yellow vest and strange bandana was blocking the bridge. “Hey, where’s your duel disk private?”

“Uh… who are you?” You asked. Everyone knew about your duel disk. Even if they didn’t know about your other side, word had gotten around about you having the big three in your deck as well as something more powerful. Your deck and your disk was more than known. So for this guy not to know was strange to say the least. Then again, you didn’t know his name either.

“Name is Sergeant Hassleberry, now your turn.” He almost commanded. You were actually impressed at the instant presence he was giving off. You sniffed the air and picked up a scent you didn’t know how to place. All you could tell was that it was old and as if it was grafted into him. Not like you but… it was a hard feeling to explain. He was just different.

“My name is Max, just Max is fine. As for my duel disk… well, if you challenge me to a duel then I’ll show you.” You replied.

“Hey Serge, that is the guy we were telling you about. The one that can summon Exodia in one turn, that and he beat the mess out of 10 people at once last year when they tried to steal his deck. Maybe we should let this one go.” Said one of the boys that looked to be following him.

“So he’s the one with the dragon deck?” Serge asked to which he received a few nods. “In that case… go on through soldier. Dragons are just as old as Dinosaurs, perhaps older. That qualifies you for a free pass.”

“Thanks.” You responded as you started walking. This one was weird. You were completely ready to kick this guy’s teeth in or crush him in a duel. But he seemed to instinctually know you were higher than him. Your body was larger than his but not enough that it was intimidating him. “I’m sure I’ll see you around.”

“No doubt about it friend.” He said then took off. Even though the word was just thrown out in a casual sense your mind locked onto the word ‘friend’, he just called you his friend. It may have been just a manner of speech but it lifted your spirits for the rest of the day, as you went about your business and continued.

‘Wait, dinosaurs…’ you thought to yourself as you walked. ‘That is what he smelled like. But how could he smell like a Dino if he wasn’t a half-breed. He wasn’t a demon or any other kind of thing like that. With that mystery opening you walked off and accepted that it would be another good and relatively exciting year. At the very least, you would have a few more friends by year’s end. Slowly but surely you were forgetting about the pain and suffering of your former life. You more than accepted this peace as the one you would like to stay in.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A new year and new people.

choices: She wants to be the one you can talk to.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You were at your spot on the edge of a cliff that looked over the rest of the island just relaxing. It was a good spot not only for the view and the ability to see almost anywhere on the island but also it was secluded enough to stretch your dragon parts, which you did on more than one occasion. Flying was reserved for night so the darkness could hide your body. But for now you were just relaxing and letting your other side out as much as you could without transforming.

“That never gets old.” Came a voice from behind you, as you looked to see Alexis walking up. You retracted some of your less slightly things like teeth, claws, and scales so that she would be more comfortable.

“Here to please.” You stated with a flick of your tail as it coiled and swung happily. Obviously not enough to get anywhere near Alexis or concern her but still she saw it as a good sign. Then after a moment you looked out over the school and area again. It was a few seconds before Alexis sat beside you and her legs joined yours as they dangled over the edge. “So… what brings you all the way out here?”

“Can’t I just stop by to say hi?” she asked defensively.

“Sure you can. But I can tell by your scent and heartbeat that something is bothering you.” You replied as you looked over to her. At first she gave an offended look. It wouldn’t be the first time you had brought up your keen nose. The first few came with a repercussional slap for any comment about her smell. But now she understood that you could smell much deeper than simple bad body odor.

“Fine, I just can’t stand this new Crowler thing.” She started. “I mean, what is his problem. I’m actually surprised he hasn’t use you as a publicity figure. Seeing as you can command any monster in the game and being one on top of it all.”

“Well Mr. Kaiba keeps that secret on a short leash with the faculty. Since he controls a majority of his salary, Crowler tends to do what he says.” You answered back.

“That’s not the point. He is just going too far. Did you see what he was going to have me wear?” she asked as she held up a pink dress of sorts. “Could you imagine me wearing this?”

“I think you would shred it before it had a chance. No offense, but it isn’t exactly your style.” You answered which seemed to be the answer she wanted to hear.

“Thanks, all the boys that I try to talk to are either imaging me with it one and blushing, or like Jaden and too stupid to realize the point. That reminds me, what do you think about that Hasselbery guy?” She responded back to you as she put the dress away.

“He seems ok. Kind of weird but then again I can’t really be the judge on weirdness by human standards. He does add a bit of… structure I guess, to the group. We were missing the muscle bound meathead.” You partially joked and she laughed a little for it.

“Ok, now your turn.” Alexis said, catching you off guard.

“What do you mean?” You asked.

“Well, you asked what was up with me and that I had something on my mind. I’ve talked about it and now it is your turn. The others may be to dim witted to see it but I can tell you changed a little. You seem more distant than usual.” Alexis answered, putting the ball in your court.

“Well… ok. I’ve been kind of lonely.” You said more bluntly than you should’ve.

“Lonely? Why would you be lonely? You have all of us right?” Alexis asked in an exasperated confusion.

“Oh, I don’t mean it that way. You’ve all been wonderful, especially considering the welcome I usually get. This has been like a really long and pleasant vacation, despite being in school. Usually I have to fight, kill, eat, and claw my way through life. I greatly enjoy this new pace.” You said defensively, your wings slightly spreading in that regard.

“Then why lonely?” she asked, this time more concerned.

“Well… the first year Zane was here. He actually found out about me right away. I was able to talk and confide in him about the problems I was having. He had a rather unique way of taking in information. I could talk with him about anything between dueling strategy to feeding problems and… delicious scents I was picking up, tempting my dragon half.” You started as you tried to choose words that were less offensive and such. “I guess with him gone I’ve lost that little bit of support I once had. I can’t exactly speak with random people about how they taste and smell in relation to food without them getting insanely nervous.”

“I see, so you are missing Zane. But without him here, you don’t have an outlet to talk about your dragon problems.” Alexis stated.

“Yeah, that is pretty much it in a nut shell. So I guess I’ve been distant because I’ve been thinking on those things on my own.” You concluded.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Alexis...

choices: Later in time for the promised tasting...
You are approached by a white suited rich kid.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You can always dump on me if you want.” Alexis offered in a strange sense of duty and pride that usually she didn’t expel openly. You looked at her as it to evaluate if she meant it.

“I mean no offense Alexis, but you seem to gentle and… breakable I guess to do so. Not that you aren’t strong, but I tend to let loose when talking openly with someone. I have to trust that they aren’t going to take things the wrong way, even if I suggest something more hard to process.” You replied.

“Like what?” she asked, determined to prove that theory wrong.

“Ok, I’ll bring up one point and question for you.” You said, then sighed and took a deep breath to prepare for a verbal onslaught. “Can I taste you?”

“What?” she asked as she froze. He heart immediately speed like a race horse.

“You smell really good and I’ve wondered how you tasted for some time. Obviously I was too scared to bring it up. But if I am going to trust you with not overreacting than I can just ask and not worry about it.” You started and looked into her eyes as her body started to retreat subconsciously as she shook and started to sweat. Her eyes were wide as she tried to process what you were asking. You looked away from her in a sad expression. “That is what I’m talking about. You don’t really trust me either. Sure, being friends with a Dragon is cool in theory and I have given my word that I would never harm any of you. But when something comes up like that, there are very few people I can just be openly honest about it. Even fewer that would not be affected emotionally by such a request. I can’t ask you to be that person.”

There was a silence for a long while as you both thought about what you said. You were hoping that she wouldn’t think of you more as a mindless beast because of the small confession you had hit her with. You didn’t even want to look at her as you half expected her to get up and run. Your extra limbs drooped as you thought about it. Every minute was agonizing as you waited for her reaction. She was a smart girl and there was more going on in her head than what appeared on the surface. You could easily read her mind if you wanted but you thought that would be going in the opposite direction as trust would be. You could hear her heart race then calm and race again as she thought about what was going on. Usually it wasn’t like this. But You waited patiently as she processed the information.

“I guess it would be fine.” She finally said.

“What?” you asked in an open confusion.

“It would be fine if you wanted to taste me.” She stated more clearly. You still weren’t looking at her. You didn’t want to at this point. Not for anything bad she did or you did but for a temporary foolish thought that this understanding version of Alexis would disappear if you made eye contact. This stopped as she turned your head with her hand on your chin to meet her gaze. “I trust you Max, now trust me. I can handle anything you throw at me.”

“But, you’re still scared. I can hear your heartbeat. You sound like a race horse that just chugged a gallon of Red Bull.” You clarified.

“Well of course I am scared. I’ve never been in a dragon’s mouth before. But I trust you that you would not harm me. If you really wanted to eat me than you could do it without my permission. So you aren’t some mindless beast that is just looking for a tasty meal. You are just curious and I’ll make you a deal. If you trust me then I’ll trust you. Deal?” She asked.

“Deal.” You agreed after a long session of you looking deep into her eyes.

“Now get it over with.” She instructed to which you cocked your head as if to ask what she meant. “The whole tasting thing.” You thought about it for a moment then just brought up her arm and took a lick of it before putting it back down. “What, that’s it?”

“For now, I can’t transform in the middle of the day. People might see a large black dragon in the middle of the day. I’ll do it later, if you’re still ok with it.” You answered. To which she stared at you then started laughing.

“Ah… you are one strange fellow. But you’re too good looking to stay mad at.” She said as she hugged rather informally into you.

“You’re look pretty good yourself.” You commented back as you closed your wings around her and you in a more complete hug. She felt it and was uncomfortable for a moment but just snuggled into you and accepted. “Hey Alexis.”

“Yes?” she asked back as she looked up to your face from her position.

“Thanks.” You said softly and almost as a purr as she stroked your chest a little. She just smiled and rested in your embrace and you in hers.

choices: They want you to find Jaden, NOW.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Things were going great for a while… until Jaden lost in a duel and something started messing with his head. You tried helping but it wasn’t a problem you had any knowledge on so you couldn’t do more than support him until he left for somewhere. You didn’t really know where he went. It was as if he had fallen off the face of the earth. His scent simply vanished.

On the flip side, you and Alexis were really close. She really lived up to her promise and you were more than happy to trust her in return. Even after a slightly sensual time of you tasting her and her begging you to swallow her in the heat of the moment. You of course didn’t and she apologized for asking you to. She knew by now that you would never do it. Even if you could make it safe and more than enjoyable, she didn’t bother asking as she was given a more in depth description of what you went through on that end. Either way, you were more than a little connected to them and more specifically her. Jaden being down was an emotional drain to be sure. But you didn’t know what you would do if Alexis joined the club of the mindlessly distressed.

“Hey you.” said a voice as you cooled off from training a little outside. Obviously nothing to fancy but enough to wow any who watched… which wasn’t much as they seemed to be in awe of anything slightly escalated. It wasn’t like any of them were anywhere near a ninja strength level. You slipped your shirt on and looked over to see the infamous Aster Phoenix coming your way.

“What does the new school mascot want with me?” You asked in a bored tone.

“I want to duel you.” He stated in a commanding tone.

“Take a hike, little boy.” You returned that got him to slightly stagger at the words. It was obvious that no one spoke to him like that.

“What? You can’t be serious. Do you even know who I am?” Aster asked in an exasperated tone.

“A little pipsqueak that thinks he can judge others as if he knows everything. I have no time for such an arrogant fool. If you want to pick on someone then go pick on someone who gives a damn.” You answered, again he was blown back slightly by what you said and how you said it. Then his eyes turned to a combination of anger and furry.

“You think you can talk to ME like that?” He exclaimed as he made a move to you in an attempt to land a physical blow. This slightly surprised you. Normally people in this realm dealt with everything with dueling each other. This was one of the first times that someone tried to physically harm you. But your surprise didn’t impede your highly trained and toned body. With one deathly quick move you brushed aside his incoming hand then used your other one to grab a hold on his throat, lifting him up but not putting enough pressure to bruise.

“And what are you going to do about it, pipsqueak?” You asked as he dangled from your grasp and tried to force your hand to let him go. “You think you are so strong? You are nothing. You prey on the weaknesses of others to expose good people to your misguided set of morals. Then when you don’t get your way you show your childish nature by throwing a fit.”

“Please… don’t hurt me.” He begged as he finally stopped trying to force his way out of your grasp.

“By all rights I should kill you. But you aren’t worth it.” You said then released him to which he slumped into a sprawled out mess facing up at your towering form. “Dueling may be your life but combat is mine. Run along pipsqueak, while I still allow it.” You finished to which the dirtied and frenzied Aster Phoenix scrambled away. You smelled that he had soiled his pants and wet himself. In fact, the only thing he didn’t do was go scream like a girl.

“Ah!!!” Came Aster’s voice as he ran.

“Scratch that thought.” You said out loud as his scream was remarkably girl like. You huffed a small laugh as you turned and went into the forest to sleep under the stars again.

choices: Someone comes and you have to swallow her.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So, you’re the young dragon boy that I’ve heard so much about.” Said a voice from an approaching person that you had seen as Aster’s manager. Didn’t think much of him and his stench was something you definitely didn’t like. Something about him just seemed wrong. But you had more than prepared and was careful not to show any dragon characteristics, yet. So you wondered if that was just a nickname or if he actually knew about you. If he did you then wondered who told him.

“I already told your little pipsqueak. I don’t waste time on arrogant fools like yourself. So what do you want?” You asked.

“Well you obviously. Rumor from some of my servants is that you are actually a dragon, a duelist, a ninja, and the most powerful duel monster in the game. I’ve also heard you defeated all the sacred beasts in one attack.” He answered.

“Anyone with halfway decent connections could get that information. If I didn’t want people to know about me than you wouldn’t have found out. If you actually believe the rumors than you should know that I have ways of silencing people, permanently.” You warned as you stood and faced the strange man.

“I suppose you do, but I am destined for greater things than to be digesting in a dragons gut. And you are destined to help me get it.” He replied and although he had brave words you could sense he was on the verge of bolting.

“Who ever said I had to eat you? I could just trap you in a genjutsu for a few days. You would be alive but tortured and half dead.” You said as you grew some dragon parts and let your eyes glow. “You seem to be under the false assumption that you can force me to do something. I would run along if I were you. I am not one that looks for a fight in such a way. But push me too far and you will see how hard I can push back.” You remarked back then started a genjutsu in which he was trapped in a swirling space with your dragon form snarling at him.

“What is this?” He asked as he braced against the illusion. You allowed his mind inside your genjutsu to start running from your approaching form. It was a slow and methodical stalking and manipulation of his mind, driving him into a pit of fear before he fell and was about to get eaten by your illusion. At that point you dispelled the illusion and he collapsed in a similar position as his mind counterpart did.

“That… was a warning. Challenge me at your own peril. But let’s be clear about one thing. I am not scared of you nor will I be compelled to do what you say, ever. So don’t be so arrogant as to think that you can control me. You can’t. But I’ll happily prove it to you again, and again, and again.” You responded as his clean white cloak was in the dirt with his quivering form before he used a similar escape tactic that Aster had done, minus the girlish screaming. As evidence to the similarity, his white pants were stained with a wet and brown stain traveling down his pant legs as he ran. You gave a courtesy snarl that you were fairly certain he could hear as you heard him yelp, trip, and continue fleeing.

It wasn’t often that you relished the reaction of someone in such a manner. But with people like him, it was more fun than you would care to admit.

“Was that necessary?” asked Alexis as she walked into the area.

“I guess I could’ve entertained him for a little longer. But I honestly don’t care for conversations with arrogant guys or girls like him. At least he didn’t throw a punch. I scared the crap out of Aster as well, literally. Plus, can you believe he wanted me to work for him?” You answered, scratching your head in slight embarrassment.

“I suppose it was fun to see him scamper out of here like that.” She said than you both sat down, you changing to a dragon first. It was night time so you could easily hide if someone came around. No one really came this far out.

“You can’t sense Jaden, can you?” she asked.

“Sorry, it is like he is completely gone. I can’t find him anywhere. But I guess he’ll come back when he is ready. If getting lost is the key to getting him back than I suppose I should let it be.” You replied as you set your head down by her and she pet your snout as you spoke.

“You’re right, but I still miss him.” She said to which she stopped her stoking and looked over the school with sad eyes.

“We all miss him. I guess we wouldn’t be that good of friends if we didn’t. And I’m sure he misses us.” You replied and for a while you both just sat and laid there in silence as you both took in the sight. Every once in a while you both would see or hear something. Wither it be an after hour duel, a dorm room light, or a random animal, either way you both just sat there for the longest time.

“Hey, you mind if I… Well you know?” Alexis asked as she stroked your scaly lips a little.

“As long as you keep your emotions in check this time. I don’t need someone tempting me anymore to eat someone. Especially not the girl already in my mouth. You are so delicious it is hard not to do it off instinct and taste alone.” You replied.

Since your little session with the first tasting she sometimes asked to be tasted again. But one time she fell asleep on your nice warm and silky soft tongue. You didn’t mind and it turned out not to be that hard to keep her safe while you were asleep. The biggest problem was when she woke up and started to pleasure herself on your tongue. The taste was great and you didn’t mind her doing so as she was that age and you loved seeing her happy, even if it was only because she was horny. But when she commanded you to chew her up and grinded her foot on your teeth to produce some blood is when you spat her out rather harshly. You both had a very serious conversation about her actions and she apologized.

“Ok, I promise not to lose my head.” She agreed as she used your snout to get up and started to remove her clothes.

She had learned after the first time that dragon drool was insanely hard to remove from clothing. It stimulated healing in living tissue, not by much but enough for her skin and hair to be fine. Even if the smell had to be conditioned it was still better to not have her uniform along. Besides, she loved the feel of your tongue on her bare skin and the feeling was mutual… from the other way around. Without the taste of clothes she was absolutely delectable. Soon she stood to the side of your head completely naked. The first time she did that, she was too embarrassed to have you look at her. However she soon came out of that as she figured there that seeing her was actually a step down from tasting her.

“Ok my delectable treat, in you go.” You said then opened your jaws for her to enter. You felt her hand shortly after on one of your teeth as she admired you.

“Funny, this scared me before. I can’t imagine why when I think back. Each time we do this I am reminded how gentle you are. Each one of these could impale me with little trouble. Yet even in the heat of the moment you are the one to say no.” She said then started to climb in until she rested on your tongue and snuggled into it. Letting its softness take her in and rubbing herself deep into it to give you the taste you were so desiring and drooling for. “I hope I taste as good as you say I do. I can’t imagine a safer or any other place I would rather be.”

“Thanks.” You said, careful not to move her around too much as you spoke, or too loudly while she was in your jaws.

“Hey, didn’t I say you shouldn’t speak with your mouth full?” She asked in a teasing yet maternal tone of voice. You chuckled then started to gently taste her. You had found the more preferable positions she preferred and used them all as you tasted her body, letting out a ominous ‘MMMmmm…’ as you did so. But eventually you both settled down and both fell asleep in your new favorite position with your most loyal friend trusting you so much it made you sleep peacefully, free of your usually constant nightmares. After all, how could you have nightmares with her delicious and trusting form in your mouth?
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Sartorius comes to see you.

choices: Chaz challenges you to a duel, idiot.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Through a series of events the Slifer dorm was hanging on a thread and on the balance of a duel between Aster Phoenix and Alexis. Since the two in charge of the duel wanted it to happen they didn’t allow you to duel. They all knew you and what you could do. Hassleberry had joined the group as well and you had found out that he actually had Dino DNA in his body from a bone that was grafted in him. However, Alexis remained as you closest friend by far. As you sat in the stands, Aster kept on giving you nervous glances. He was always conveniently absent when you were around but now Alexis could see what you meant when you said he was scared of you. But just as the duel was about to start, a familiar voice cut through the tension, Jaden’s voice.

“Jaden.” You said as you jumped down to meet him. Unlike Aster he was not scared of you but he did respect you greatly.

“Yes?” he asked, slightly nervous.

“Welcome back.” You said with a fist raised. It took him a second but he just smiled and knuckle pounded you. “He kicked your butt last time, you need any help?”

“Nah, I got a whole new deck and a bunch of my new alien friends to help me.” Jaden answered with such a straight face that you actually believed him. Combined with a feeling you were getting from his deck was the end of any doubt. You nodded then escorted Alexis to her seat and watched his duel.

“Do you think his new cards are actually from outer space?” asked Syris as you all watched. But since you were a duel monster, kind of, they asked you these kind of questions.

“I wouldn’t doubt it. Remember, I couldn’t sense him at all before. It was as if he was wiped off the face of the earth. That and I formally met with every duel monster in the game and these are new to me. So, yes, I would say that there is a very high probability that he did do and get those from where he said.” You answered to which you all watched and continued to talk while he dueled, mainly on how strange and different his deck was.

Finally, after showing off his new deck and throwing out a few Jaden style remarks, he won and was back with the group again. You heard Aster go over and announce to Crowler and Bonaparte that he was staying at duel academy. He gave you a wary look before exiting. You pretended you didn’t notice.
“Hey Jaden, can I talk to you for a moment?” you asked as you all were almost back to your dorm.

“Sure…” he stated in his usual unbiased tone, not to mention clueless.

“Well, I was wondering if I could have a chat with your new pals. I’ve met almost every duel monster out there and I would like to formally introduce myself and they to me.” You stated.

“Ok, what do I do?” He asked.

“Just summon them with your duel disk and I’ll do the rest.” You instructed to which he did so soon there were four new monsters in front of you, Neos being the strongest in terms of power. “Hello”

“Hello to you as well. Who are you, young human?” Asked the Dolphin looking one.

“I am… well it would be easier just to show you.” You stated then sprang out your own duel disk and summoned your dragon form. They understandably were quivering as it landed and turned it/your gaze to them. “I am known as Max. I am a duel monster as well… in a manner of speaking. I am really a half-breed dragon so I can go from human to dragon and everything in between. I was able to convince Pegasus to make me into a card and a deck around me. So I’ve made it a point to make contact with all the other monsters I know of. I also ask permission to replicate their cards if needed.”

“And what did the others say?” asked Neos.

“Well… Exodia, Slifer, Obelisk, and Ra were harder to convince. I actually had to beat the crap out of Exodia to get the respect. After that they are becoming pretty decent friends. Everyone else agreed… well except for the Sacred Beasts. I kind of got pissed at them for trying to steal my essence and charred them really good. They are currently locked underneath the school so I can’t strike up a conversation with them. Anyway, I have more of a respect deal with the others.” You answered.

“Well, with names like that trusting you I suppose we should as well.” Said the scarab looking one with a nod from the others. You deactivated your duel disk so they weren’t as intimidated by your colossal dragon form. “Will you call us often?”

“Probably not. It looks like you picked Jaden. But if someone steals his deck or something I may make a copy to let him use, or I may. I have a deck that allows me to draw any card I need at any time. So usually I use the big three or Exodia. After that there is dragons then… well me I guess. But it helps if I have a working relationship with everyone else. That way if I end up facing you in a duel than we know to be more respectful than my just charring you to a crisp.” You answered.

“We are honored by your consideration as well as your thought toward our… um… safety.” Said the humming bird one as they all bowed and you returned one to which Jaden deactivated his disk and put them away.

“Well, they seem to be nice.” You said.

“Yeah, they are awesome. Can you really just create a copy of them?” Jaden asked.

“Well, let’s see. I don’t materialize cards that don’t wished to be summoned by me. So if they were true to their agreement I should be able to.” You said than materialized Neos out of thin air, to Jaden’s amusement and Alexis’ smile. The rest of them that couldn’t see monster spirits had gone on ahead. After looking it over you dematerialized it. “Yep, looks like they will let me.”

“That isn’t really fair, is it?” Alexis pointed out. “You can essentially materialize any card in the world as you need it. So, in the middle of a duel you can just think of a card you need and then draw it.”

“Sure I can. I’ve said it before. I am not a duelist anywhere near any of your calibers. I am at best a Duel monster and a friend. One that just happens to be able to interact with your side and duel myself. So I am the best at winning but far from the best duelist.” You answered.

“Is that why you don’t want to duel me when I ask?” Jaden asked.

“Yep. Like Alexis said, it is kind of unfair. But if someone challenges me and I feel up for it, like those shadow riders or something, then I am more than happy to cream them. A little fact to, I can manipulate a deck my card is in as well. So if you put… me in your deck, I can force my way to the top no matter if you physically put me on the bottom. You simply have to communicate you want to draw me and you will. But that is on the rare occasion that I lend you my card, like against the sacred beasts.” You answered and explained.

“I got like the best life ever. I am friends with the strongest duel monster in the world.” Jaden said with a cheer like tone.

“Indeed, you are all my friends.” You said as Alexis came over and gave you a side hug as you spoke to which you squeezed her fragile form gently to return the half embrace.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Jaden returns.

choices: End the duel quick, but not too quick.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“No, I already told you Chaz. I have no interest in dueling you.” You said as he asked for the countless time. Actually he never asked, he more demanded and you just refused. He was trying to get you to join that Society of Light thing that Sartorius had come to lead personally. He still had that arrogant attitude but didn’t dare challenge you directly. Aster was more fond of you as you seemed to make his former manager squirm. He found that as long as he wasn’t being the arrogant fool you had described him as, he was more or less safe around you.

“How about a deal then Max.” Alexis stated. You had been rather cross that Chaz had dueled her and brought her over to ‘the light’. She didn’t denounce you but she was very cold to you. She hadn’t hit any of the emotional rejection buttons but she had made it clear she no longer wished to be anywhere near your dragon half. You chalked it up to Sartorius and his influence to the threat you posed. “You beat him this time and he won’t challenge you again, at least not in relation to the Society of Light is concerned.”

“Or are you afraid of dueling a master like me.” Chaz stated with a laugh but abruptly stopped as you looked intensely at him.

“Very well.” You answered as you walked over to the playing field. It was in the arena as they seemed to have a superiority complex that forced their actions to always put themselves on pedestals. You would’ve tried talking to Alexis but she just turned and walked to her seat, cold as always.

“Hey, good luck Max. You can do it.” Jaden cheered.

“Of course, who do you think you’re talking to? But thanks for the support.” You said with a smirk. He was well aware that Alexis’ attitude was draining on you so those that were still left gave you support. Even those that didn’t know about your other side would cheer as they were amazed at both the cards you had and definitely didn’t like the new ‘white dorm’.

“You may have been good enough to beat me before. But there is no way you can beat me now. Now that I have the light watching my back.” Chaz stated in a cocky and arrogant tone.

“You see Aster, doesn’t that whole arrogant thing get annoying?” You asked back to him. He was beginning to see what you were referring to when you had not to subtly threatened to kill him way back. With that said you both got to your places.

“Let’s duel!” you both said. Sure it was a tad bit nerdy but you didn’t really have anything else to let out aggression so you indulged a little.

“I go first.” Chaz said with a demeaning tone as he drew. You didn’t mind, you didn’t need to go first to win. “I play Armed Dragon Level 3 and place two face down cards. Let’s see what you got.” He stated to which you simply smirked as you drew your card and played it before he could do anything.

“Goodbye face down cards.” You said as your heavy storm did its work. Good thing as it was Mirror force and trap hole. “If it is ok with you. I’m going to have a little fun and stick around for a bit. Instead of ending this in one turn like I usually do.”

“Fine whatever.” Chaz pouted.

“Here it goes. I play Mausoleum of the Emperor and an original from Pegasus named Dragon Compensation. So I don’t have to pay 1000 life points per sacrifice as long as they go toward a monster that is either divine or dragon. Bringing me to my first guest.” You said as you placed your selected monster on your duel disk. The ground seemed be coming apart and circuits were blowing as the summoning was proceeding. “Meet Obelisk the Tormentor”

“No way!” Chaz stated as the big guy rose out of the cracking ground and was accompanied by multiple effects and blown circuits.

“Good thing for you, he can’t attack the same turn that Dragon’s Compensation was activated so I place on card face down and let you go.” You said. The card called ‘god’s protection’. You were well aware that while the god cards were one of the supreme cards in the game under yours they were still vulnerable to some indirect effects. So this card was made just in case and of course only give to you. You nodded to Obelisk and he to you then stood with your arms crossed and waiting for the dumbfounded Chaz to make his move.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Chaz challenges you to a duel, idiot.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“That’s not fair.” Chaz complained as he looked at the colossal monster in front of him.

“You are the one that challenged me to a duel.” You simply stated as you glared over at him. He flinched at as he saw the gazes of both you and Obelisk baring down on him while drawing his next card.

“Fine, I’ll just destroy your oversized puppet.” He mocked that got Obelisk to do his version of a growl or battle noise. You didn’t really know what to call the sound he made but it was more than effective in demonstrating his displeasure as Chaz used a combination of moves to bring Armed Dragon level 10 out and boost him about Obelisk’s 4000 point mark. Your field spell card helped him in this goal. “Now my dragon, attack!”

“You’re an idiot. I show my trap card ‘god’s protection’. It allows me to activate one ability from one of the god cards. I choose his sacrifice ability. By sacrificing two monsters I can raise his attack points up to infinity. Luckily my spell card is still out so I have no shortage of sacrifices for him to use.” You said as Obelisk reached down and grabbed two of the statues from the spell card to use. His blue skin tinted red as his power was overflowing and sky rocketing. “Now I do believe your dragon was about to attack.”

“No, don’t attack!” Chaz exclaimed in an attempt to stop his dragon from attacking the now powered up Obelisk. But it was no use as it let out its blast and Obelisk used its infamous ‘fist of furry’ to demolish both him and most of the remaining circuits that had survived his summoning. Obviously winning the duel in the same action.

“Thanks buddy.” You said up to Obelisk before he nodded and disappeared from the field, leaving in his wake a knocked out Chaz and a ruined dueling platform.

You then turned and walked away from it as the others that knew you surrounded you and the others were silent in shock. They had heard about you using Slifer but most didn’t believe you. Most common thing you used besides Exodia was Blue Eyes White Dragon or Red Eyes Black Dragon in relation or in addition to 5 headed dragon. Of course there more than enough of other dragons and cards you used in the course of the year and during tests but this was most unique to say the least. Even Sartorius was shocked out of his words while you had silently told Obelisk to take it easy on Chaz so to make him not think about insulting him again but wasn’t injured that much. As evidence to this he was beginning to stir from his passed out state.

“Man that was crazy!” Jaden exclaimed as they got to you and joined you as you all walked out and leaving the Society of Light to their thoughts and shock. Alexis was the only one that had a head on her thoughts as she knew as awesome as that was that you had a more powerful card to play if you wished, you.

“No doubt soldier. You have some amazing and insanely strong soldiers in your deck.” Husselberry agreed as he gave you a pat on the back.

“Why did he challenge you again?” joked Syrus, which caused you and the others traveling along side your group to laugh and understandably infuriate the Society of light that was left in defeat. Now there was two people they couldn’t beat. If they hadn’t figured out how impossible it was to defeat you before now than they sure as hell did now. The presence of one of the god cards does wonders for opening people’s eyes too such a truth. It was crazy to challenge someone that had one in their deck, much more all three.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: End the duel quick, but not too quick.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You’re not allowed, monster.” Alexis said to you as you all were tossed from the intended hotel. Obviously they couldn’t physically force you but she more than mentally compromised you with that little phrase. And with a threat to expose your secret to the world you were restricted out of Kaiba land as well. You couldn’t do anything as they all went their separate ways and you were left alone at the docks.

You and Jaden had walked around all day with Syrus and the others that weren’t in the Society of Light. It was fun to see a self guided tour of things that happened. But it was even more enjoyable for you to see how Jaden’s face lit up at each sight and when you all met Yugi’s Grandfather. He was a funny old man to talk to, especially watching Bastion try to explain things to the old man over, and over, and over again. But now that you had been restricted to the docks by emotional turmoil and blackmail your time was spent. You just laid on the dock, staring up at the sky with the same longing look to fly in its endless expanse. It always made you feel better when you could let loose and fly around.

“Damn I hate being all alone.” You said out loud.

“You aren’t alone.” Came a voice, unmistakably female but your senses couldn’t detect anyone around you. You decided to remain quiet and still until the voice’s owner came forth. You didn’t have to wait long as your wrist glowed and a light shot from it and landed beside you. Shortly after you saw a large white dragon that you knew to be Blue Eyes White Dragon.

“Since when do you talk the human tongue?” you asked with a glare. It was fine when they were in your deck but this was the first time a duel monster had searched for you and approached. Not to mention… she, was a dragon. Didn’t really matter that she was only there in spirit form but they all knew rather well of your dislike for dragons, despite being one yourself.

“I have been around for a long time. Please don’t be angry with me, it just looked like you needed a boost.” She said as she was understandably nervous just reclined as she was next to you. You had beat the crap out of more than a few duel monsters and was particularly vicious with Slifer and Ra when you had made contact. Regardless how strong she was, she didn’t want to be anywhere near your bad side.

“So they all sent you?” you asked.

“Well, no. Truth is… they were all too afraid to come with. That and the gods are too powerful to come over without causing all kinds of problems. So they were just going to leave it alone but I couldn’t. You have been summoning me almost as much as Seto Kaiba does. So… well I’ve become more connected with you. It isn’t often a superior dragon summons me so often, in either world. Usually it is either weak humans, weak dragons, or abusive stronger ones. You are nice to me so I couldn’t just leave you when you were so down.” She explained. You looked into her eyes as she nervously looked at you, away, then back.

“You remind me of someone I use to know. You are significantly stronger but still, you have the same attitude.” You said to which you looked back up into the sky as you remembered Kara. It had been a while since you thought about the past hells you left and people, dragon or otherwise, you left behind. “She was a good friend of mine. Respected life and was insanely loyal, even after I threatened to eat her a few times. So if you are even half the dragon she is… she was… then, thank you. I would love your company.”

“It would be my honor to keep you company.” She returned and scooted closer, now that it was ok for her to so. She laid her head so it was right next to where your human body laid. She saw your gaze at the sky, followed it then back down to you. “You miss the sky don’t you?”

“If you were flight restricted, wouldn’t you? There isn’t anything like soaring through the sky. But being that this a human filled world I have to wait until it is dark.” You responded.

“But that isn’t the source of you depression is it? I mean sure you are restricted to night flying and human during the day but it can’t be that bad.” She asked, trying to help.

“Well… I think I just lost a very close friend. She said some rather hurtful things that she promised never to even think. Worse of all, I think she meant them.” You revealed.

“I take it she was one of your human companions?” She asked to which you nodded. “What did she say?”

“What didn’t she say is more like it. I think the lightest thing she said was refer to me as a monster. I’m not talking about our duel relationship with the humans of this world but as a person. She was close enough to know all of my emotional buttons and she used all of them on the negative side.” you revealed and some latent tears came from your eye and dripped down until they felt to the ground.

“If I understand from the other monsters correctly, it is all due to that ‘Society of Light’ thing. It is messing with the human’s heads. She probably doesn’t really think that.” Blue eyes replied in an uplifted tone.

“No, I checked by reading her mind. While the extra influence helped her voice her thoughts, she always had them. Until now they were being pushed down by her kind and gentle nature. But now she doesn’t care and just lets it all out. Even when she comes back, it won’t be the same.” You responded.

“Well, I’ll be here. I won’t lie, we are all scared of you. But we are willing to look past that if you let us… well some us anyway. Personally, it felt good to see you kick those ignorant Sacred Beasts back a few. At the very least, I can help with your dragon side… a little. Maybe you can teach me a few things and I can be there for you… when I’m not being summoned by Seto that is.” She offered, again, in an escalated tone to uplift you.

Maybe it was because she was a light creature but you felt loads better and you both continued talking until she was forced to leave by Kaiba’s summoning and the student’s returning. But you felt better, not good enough to face Alexis but good enough to stop feeling sorry for yourself.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Going to Domino City.

choices: You are able to get her some more friends.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Whoa!” said a voice, followed by a crash as you laid in your dragon from at night. You were at your spot and enjoying a clear night. Secretly you hoped Alexis or one of the others would come around. You rose your head to see who it was to find the spirit version of Blue Eyes White Dragon, again. This was the second time you’d seen her out of duels, more accurately it was the second time she came to see you.

“Blue Eyes White Dragon?” You asked as you looked over to her, blinking your red eyes and speaking low enough to be sure no one else could hear. A 500 foot dragon has a pretty loud voice otherwise.

“You can just call me Blue for short if you want.” She returned as she got up and walked over to you, laying down more in front of you and obviously lower than you.

“Ok, Blue, what’s up?” You asked in a new form of exertion.

“Well, I wasn’t expecting to catch you in your Dragon form but I was hoping to talk for a bit. Not a lot of others on the other side come around when so many are dueling. I’m lucky as there is only copies with you and Seto Kaiba. But either way, I can only have a segmented conversation with the others at best. You’re the only one left that will talk with me, or that wants to talk with me.” She explained, the last part in a more sad tone.

“Who wouldn’t want to talk to you? You’re beautiful, smart, powerful, and seem nice to me.” You asked.

“Thanks” She said, her scales slightly blushing at the compliment. Maybe it was fear or infatuation for your dragon body but she seemed more shy then last time. “But that is the problem. Most smaller monsters are either too irritating to talk to, or to scared I’ll eat them to come near.”

“I can understand the feeling.” You agreed.

“But you don’t have the other problem as well. My other problem is that the only ones left that don’t fear me or are decent to talk to are too powerful to waste time on me. Some are nice but are too far away to see every day. So I end up in segmented relationships and alone most of the time. That is why I love helping out Seto or you whenever I can. But Seto is to proud to have a conversation with me. So, as bad as this sounds, you are the only one that I can talk to. I don’t mean that as to say you are my last choice. But being the only one makes these visits special to me.” She finished, saying the last part faster so she didn’t upset you.

“Well it is nice to speak with another dragon. As relational as they can get, humans can be a little dense to say the least. Worth getting to know and being friends with but the change is welcomed none the less.” You replied back. “Although, I have a question.”

“Sure, what is it?” she responded cheerfully. Interesting since her demeanor in duels was so fierce that she was never pegged for female. But now she seemed more gentle then Kara.

“If there is only one of you than how do you change to Blue Eyes Ultimate Dragon? I only ask because when I change it hurts a lot. I was wondering if I cause any pain when I bring that form out.” You asked.

“It hurts when you transform?” she asked, almost stunned.

“Indeed it does. Changing from a human to a dragon or vise versa is not a small change. My body has to forcibly rip itself apart while trying to heal itself to make the change. That is why I am glad Mr. Pegasus made a card so I don’t have to do so every time I wish to show someone. Now your turn.” You answered than switched the focus on her.

“Not at all.” She said then changed to a Blue Eyes Ultimate then back to her normal form. “I can change effortlessly. Although it does use more energy to go around at such a size. So I prefer my normal form. Plus the other dragons say I look to vicious like that.” She answered.

“Well that’s a relief. I would hate to cause you any pain just to win a card duel. But I can’t imagine how weird it feels to have your essence shared with multiple copies at the same time. I have only one and it already is more than a strange feeling.” You sighed then added the last bit as a mode of conversation for her to pick up.

“I actually like it. Granted I wouldn’t like being split into hundreds of cards but I like that I am needed so much. It makes me feel… important I guess. Although when three of me are on the field at the same time, it is slightly comical. I have to stop myself from laughing and keep the ferocious act up.” She said with a growling form of a giggle as she thought about it.

It pleased you that she was happy with you. While you hoped Alexis would come back you were far from lonely with Blue there. Maybe you could get her and Jaden’s monsters to talk, so she could get some more friends. But for now you settled for being the one.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: R&R with Blue Eyes.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
While hanging out with Blue Eyes was interesting you still had school. You were also pleasantly surprised when both a tournament started and when you caught Chumley’s scent. But what bothered you was that you also sensed the Winged Dragon of Ra a few times. You met with the big guy and found out in not to many words that someone was summoning him and forcing him to duel. Just as you were about to go searching you were called to Shepards office. You walked in as Jaden was done figuring out what was going on.

“Well hello there.” Pegasus greeted “I trust that everything is going well with my favorite half-breed.” Him calling you a half-breed was overlooked for two reasons. One, you owed him a lot for creating your deck. Two, he seemed to make nicknames for everyone so you knew he didn’t mean anything by it.

“I’m doing alright. It is good to see you Mr. Pegasus. To what do we owe the pleasure?” You asked.

“Someone stole the Winged Dragon of Ra!” Jaden exclaimed before anyone could say it any more subtly.

“I know, he came to me and told me such when I was visiting with Blue Eyes. Since I have him in my deck he asked for my help. Apparently whomever is using him is using a card to make a slave out of him. I ripped on him a little for letting someone control him like that but in the end I agreed to help. So what does it look like on this end?” You answered.

“It must rock to talk with the gods like that.” Chumley said.

“Hey Chumley, yeah it is… interesting to say the least. But they don’t speak human language to good so dragon tongue is all he can speak.” You agreed and greeted him. He seemed to brighten when you spoke to him.

“Getting back on topic, my company’s top researcher stole the copy of Ra we had. His name is Franz and we don’t know why he did it. Would you mind helping finding him without… well punishing him? I have a feeling that when Ra is eventually able to retaliate the result won’t look pretty on his end, or on mine for that matter.” Pegasus asked.

“Sure, like I said, I already told Ra I would help track his card down. Chancellor Shepard, do you mind if I use my card to duel when we find him?” You asked. After Obelisk destroyed the duel arena Shepard had requested that you ask him before summoning anything near that level again. In return he allowed you emergency judgment and the authority to refuse duels that you didn’t deem worthy. It was more of courtesy than a rule.

“Very well, you may. Just keep the match outside so that the school isn’t damaged. I don’t need and Egyptian god and you tearing the place down.” He agreed and requested.

“Agreed.” You said and got a sigh of relief from him before looking to the group that seemed to be ready to track with you. “Alright, let’s go find Ra.”

“So Max, you really think you can handle Ra?” asked Jaden.

“It shouldn’t be too hard. Even though the big three are at the top of the mountain they have their weaknesses. And I am stronger than all three so… yeah, I think I should be able to go head to head with him.” You answered.

“I haven’t seen you in a while Max boy. I almost forgot that you are really a duel monster.” Pegasus replied. “And did I hear you say you were conversing with Blue Eyes White Dragon?”

“Yes. She gets lonely since only Mr. Kaiba and I are the only ones that can summon her. And let’s face it, Mr. Kaiba wouldn’t be caught dead talking with monster spirits. So she comes over and hangs out with me every once in a while, more so lately.” You answered.

“You’re friends with Blue eyes?” asked Syrus in a stunned tone.

“Yep. She came too cheer me up at Domino City when Alexis said all those things to me. Ever since then, we have been hanging out when I’m alone. Not a lot of people can see monster spirits but she likes seeing be in full dragon form so I change and we talk at night… sometimes.” You answered, a little sad when mentioning Alexis.

“Don’t worry Max. I’m sure she’ll come around eventually.” Jaden said, full of optimism.

“I know she will come back. But now that I know she at least thinks that stuff. I can’t really ask her to be as close as we use to. I promised her that I wouldn’t read her mind unless something like this happened. So when I did I found out that what she said is how she really feels. Granted she is to kind to say so out loud but the feelings are still there. Knowing that, I can still be friends but not as close as before.” You responded back.

“How close were you and this young girl you are talking about?” Pegasus asked, chiming in for a drama filled conversation.

“Well. As weird as this sounds, she let me taste her and slept in my mouth a few times. So… pretty close.” You said.

“You tasted her?!” asked Jaden, voicing the concern and surprise from the rest of them out loud.

“Well yeah. We began talking and I told her more detail on what happened and with all the shadow realm injuries she thought it would be useful if I could swallow someone and heal them instantly. But I am too scared to do so. That and being a dragon it is hard for me to say that humans are delicious, much more act on it. I would never eat anyone but she offered to let me taste her and while doing so she hoped to get me over my little mental block… ok big mental block. So it wasn’t like I was going to eat her or anything. But that was how much I thought our trust was. I like having someone I can talk to about things that other people would react bad to. For a while, that person was Alexis. But I don’t think I can do so again.” You stated, the first part in a tone to help them understand and the last part back to sadness.

“Don’t you trust us?” asked Jaden asked, being the more outwardly vocal person in the group.

“I trust you as friends but not to that level. I mean I can tell you are still panicking about me saying humans taste good. If I can’t say something as simple as that without you thinking that I would eat you than I can’t really open up. It isn’t a bad thing but when I open up to someone like Alexis then she turns the things against me like that. It proves that I can’t really talk about that kind of stuff with humans. Luckily Blue Eyes is a dragon, so I can talk to her.” You replied.

Jaden was about to reply but something stopped him… which was…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Next...

choices: He ends the duel and apologizes.
He tries to win anyway, despite Pegasus' warning.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“There you are president.” Said a man that looked to be the description of Franz. If there was any doubt he went on a tangent about Ra and how he stole him. You just watched as he ranted and was combated by Jaden and Pegasus. But finally his attention drifted to you. “And who are you?”

“I’m a friend of the Winged Dragon of Ra. He asked me to help because of some stupid magic card you use to force him into submission. So here I am. So if you are done measuring your manlyhood or lack thereof, maybe we can get down to dueling.” You answered which got him understandably heated, especially for the stuck up crowd he probably prided in being a part of.

“You think you can take on an Egyptian god? Let’s see you try.” He said.

“You know, I’ve answered that question too many times today. So I’ll just let my dueling do the talking. You’ll need all the help you can get. So why don’t you go first.” You suggested as the others stood back and you activated your duel disk to him doing likewise.

“You’ll regret that.” He boasted and via a few well timed moves and special summoning three monsters he was able to bring out Ra on his first turn. “Luckily for you, I can’t attack.”

“You don’t happen to have your card in your had to you?” Asked Pegasus.

“Not yet.” You answered.

“Why does that matter?” Asked Hassleberry.

“That’s right, you’ve never seen him in dragon form or the card that Mr. Pegaus made depicting it have you?” Asked Syrus to which he received a dumb shake. “If he draws his card on the first turn he can immediately summon it. Otherwise it takes 5 sacrifices.”

“Five!?” Hassleberry asked/ exclaimed.

“The gods are the most powerful cards in the game… except one.” Said Pegasus to which he paused as they all turned their heads as you drew a card. The displacement of drawing your card caused a small shockwave of energy to disperse around. “His card, the Dark Hunter King.”

The sky was already decorated with dark clouds because of Ra, which battled the light he gave off to disperse them. He was known as the ‘the sun god’ for a reason after all. But they returned and in greater numbers as you placed your card on your duel disk. Soon a distant roar could be heard then your dragon form broke through the clouds and landed on the field with a thud that caused all to quiver, and the follow up roar from your hologram form made Ra do the same and the rest to fall over.

“What is that?” Franz asked as he got up and starred agape with the rest as his so called ‘all powerful god’ shook with fear. “Uh… I play a trap, the…”

Halfway between his command you controlled your hologram body as it gave a roar and destroyed all his spell and trap cards, including the one holding Ra down. It also forced the relatively frail man to his knee as he braced himself.

“I can still add my points to Ra.” He said, trying to salvage his pride and the game.

“No, you can’t. Without your little chain card to force Ra he can refuse. Even if he didn’t, I have 10,000 attack points and capable of raising it a great deal higher if I need to. Not to mention it is my turn so you can’t activate his Phoenix mode… again, if he were to let you.” You replied.

“There is no way a card that powerful exists without my knowledge. Did you create that one in secret?” he asked Pegasus.

“I did, but only because… the original requested it to be made. He is like and more powerful then the gods or Exodia. Obviously people would seek it if they knew so all mention was limited to a very as needed basis. But make no mistake. Only this… young man can command him. You should not press this duel any further Franz. His attack is far worse than the gods are capable. You need to end it, now.” Pehasus answered and advised.

The Man might’ve disregarded his warning but he saw the general concern and truth in his face that made him pause before his decision.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Franz.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Franz looked to be fighting an inward battle. On one side he had is actions and point of view to prove and on the other he had his safety and realizing that he might have been wrong. He started going on a story telling session of what happened and why. But in the end he was beginning to realize that he was in the wrong.

“I… I will resign from this duel. I can’t put the Winged Dragon of Ra in any more pain or humiliation.” He said as he reached over to his disk to surrender.

“Not yet.” You said, which caught everyone’s attention. “You owe someone else an apology. I think he has shown great restraint in not striking you down where you stand. Your magic card is no longer in play so he could easily do so. The moment one of these two are on the field it opens a small port to the shadow realm and it makes the damage they inflict very real.”

“But he is just a…” he started but stopped as he saw Ra look at him directly. He was well aware of what the hologram could do and this wasn’t one of the things it was capable of. With that he fell down to his knees and looked up at him. “I apologize to you and thank you for putting up with my selfishness.”

Ra seemed to think it over as he looked down at the man. He then looked at you as if to gain advice. After all, even if he was summoned by humans every once in a while, he was just as lacking in their behavior as a majority of them would be. You nodded over to him and used your hologram that still stood over you to send him a response in a growling dragon speech. In short you told him to accept and take it easy on him. With that he ended in a roar then burst from the field in a flaming glory that was a spectacle for all to witness and left the stunned Franz in a kneeling shocked position.

“What did he say?” Pegasus asked you as Franz surrendered the duel and your card form was gone and hidden again.

“He agreed to take it easy on you. For no other reason than that you let him stretch his wings a little. But firmly suggests that you restrain from doing so again. He is only patient to a point.” You responded, half to all of them and half to Franz.

“You can understand him?” Franz asked.

“Yes… Let’s just say that we know each other and leave it at that. I’m sure you’ll find out why some other time. He also suggests you destroy that magic card… or he will.” You responded.

“Wow, you have the coolest friends.” Jaden said as he jumped up and was his normal excited self.

“Indeed I do.” You said as you looked at all of them as if to insinuate that they were the friends you were talking about.

choices: Alexis duels Jaden and comes back, mostly.
Syrus doesn't like you condoning Zane.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
After your little brush with Ra and all that no one wanted to duel you. Surprise… as no wanted to duel you anyway as they witnessed your duel with Chaz. With him back on your side and the others scared of you it was easy to rest in peace. You were able to speak with Jaden more as well as create a little zone so Blue Eyes could come and be seen by those that couldn’t see monster spirits. Jaden was surprised when he found out that she was female and so nice. Hassleberry, Syrus, and Chaz were just amazed at yet another dragon that was talking… at times with them. But as they had curfews they couldn’t be around all the time when she could. So it gave you a lot of alone time with her. Suffice to say that you two were getting close. It was common for you two to talk then she would watch over you while you slept in dragon form so that she could scare any threat off and warn you if necessary. This gave you more freedom to relax and get some much needed rest in the severely underused dragon form. It was one of those nights where she was watching over you and more so watching your colossal body sleep that an old friend came by. You immediately awoke but she told you to go back to sleep and you decided to listen to them and attempt to do so… if you could.

“I can smell you, human.” Said Blue Eyes as she lightly growled at an area that Zane’s scent was coming from. He had arrived but was avoiding you thus far. He had not shown you any hostility like Alexis, so you just accepted his new turn in attitude and accepted he would also accept you in return. When he dueled Atticus you checked to make sure he was in control. After you determined he was you left his mind alone, as promised.

“I wasn’t aware he had dragon friends.” Can Zane’s voice as he came from the woods into the clearing where you lay ‘sleeping’ and she lay near you so there was a cage over the edge and curved toward the opening into the area with her head and yours in the center so you both could just look the other way and take in the view or sleep with your senses toward the forest. “Last I heard, he was more likely to tear other dragons in half rather than speak with them, much less sleep next to one.”

“If you know that much than you must be at least familiar to him and about him. But not every human he has shared his past with has remained an ally. I have proved to be his friend and supported him like only dragons can. So he graciously left the tearing me apart out of our relationship. Now your turn. Are you one of his friends or are you an enemy?” Blue Eyes asked. Admittedly it was a question you wanted to know as well. With this new attitude he had, you weren’t sure if he was really cross with all his old friends or just changed his style but still felt the same, more or less.

“I wouldn’t say that I am as close as we use to be. But I wouldn’t describe myself as an enemy either. At the very least I am one that respects him.” Zane said back, interesting enough without sounding to scared of the very recognizable form of Blue Eye in front of him. Perhaps it was his new attitude or that her form was comparatively miniscule to yours. Either way you could tell he was holding together rather well. Even Pegasus was slightly put off by the sight of her, and he created her card. However he was surprised when she thanked him.

“I suppose that puts you in the friend category. As long as you aren’t planning to tell him off like that other human then you may approach.” She replied.

“No need for being so cautious Blue.” You said in a groggy tone as you lifted your head and before you yawned some of your sleepiness away. “He is one of the first friends I made in this world. He kind of reminds me of Mr. Kaiba, sort of. Even has a similar monster choice.”

“Yes, I’ve heard from his monsters while I was flying around. Cyber End Dragon can be rather particular and possessive when it comes to this human.” Blue Eyes relented, as she accepted his status.

“As flattering as that is, I didn’t come here for that. I came here to see an old friend and to duel quality opponents.” Zane replied in a rather cold tone. “But what other human were you talking about? Did one of the others betray you?”

“In a manner of speaking. Alexis, she joined that Society of Light thing. It brainwashes people and what not.” You replied but wasn’t too fond of repeating the experience.

“That human girl has made it a point to destroy her connection to him. She has accused him of being nothing more than a heartless, blood thirsty, beast. A monster, not as you humans like to refer to us but as a person. And that is all the gentle stuff she has brought up. I have half a mind to send a white lightning attack over. But Max is too nice to allow such a thing.” Blue eyes finished for you, perhaps not like you would say it but got the point across.

“I’m sure she’ll come around.” He said, in a rare form of civility in his new look. “Why haven’t you tried to duel me?”

“Thanks Zane. I miss you around here. Everyone else is a little too… fruity and oblivious. Accept Blue of course.” You started as you nuzzled Blue Eye then got back to the conversation. “As for why I’m not dueling you. I trust you. Your new… attitude may not be a favorite but you are still you. And just like before, you are a duelist and I am not. There would be no reason to duel you. Someone like me that can pull any card I want, when I want is hardly a fair or even legitimate duel.”

“I suppose so.” He said, remembering that was why he challenged Jaden instead of you for his last duel of the year, and his education. “And when did you start seeing Blue Eyes White Dragon?”

“A little while ago. She caught me at a rough time and was able to cheer me up. Been friends ever since. No offense, but it is refreshing to talk to a dragon once in a while. As relational as you or the others can get, there is only a certain amount that can be said to a human about… dragon problems.” You replied.

“I suppose I should be going.” Zane said, reaching a stopping point in the conversation.

“Why’s that? Are you really going to stay in the woods, alone, or in one of the preppy dorms?” You asked.

“Why not?” He asked, back in his normal cold tone.

“Well…” You said as your eyes glowed more than usual as you materialized a room for him to sleep in. You remembered how his preferences were and gauged his body to better calibrate the room. “… having a dragon as a friend has its perks. Don’t worry, I’m not expecting you to spoon with Blue over here. Just thought that on the rare occasion you are hear I can make it a little less inconvenient for you. Can you honestly say you prefer to stay at the white reject dorm?”

“Fine.” He relented after a little bit of silence. “But if you start singing campfire songs then I’m out of here.”

“No promises, and Blue snores.” You joked to which you got a whack with her tail and for the first time you three were all laughing. You had a feeling that Zane didn’t do a lot of that now days. You all settled down and you went back to sleep, with Blue Eyes watching over you and your old friend sleeping nearby.
