1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
During Jaden’s dual with Alexis you watched with the rest of them. But under more verbal assaults, you were more or less forbidden to help him like the rest of them. So you just watched. Not that Jaden needed your help anyway. Your presence there helped a little as Jaden was able to use the things she was saying about you to help turn her around easier. Even if what she was saying was what she felt like underneath, her feelings and nature couldn’t really agree with what she was forced to say. Wither it be subconscious guilt or whatever, she eventually cracked after Jaden beat her. You went down there with them to greet her coming back, although you were slightly at the back of the group. You wanted to support her but all of the times telling you to ‘get out of my sight, friend eating freak’ made you keep your distance on habit alone.

“Max!” she said as she hugged you. She didn’t have any memories but she was missing you a bit. Unfortunately you had all of yours. So what usually got you to hold her in a more complete sense, she just got a one armed half hug to her full body attempt. “Hey, what’s that about? Did I do something really bad when I was out?”

“Not really. You were just honest.” You answered as she separated from you with a confused expression. It wasn’t a small change to say the least. Usually when she did that you twirled her a little so her hold around your neck was all that kept her from falling off. Then you hugged her and sometimes, rarely, kissed her on the cheek. This was a subtle way for you to taste her like she wanted, back before her little mind lapse. But for you to be so distant and her not remembering what happened to make it like that was very confusing… and a little hurtful to her. You didn’t mean to but your default smile that had no realism behind it also was a potential slap in the face. It was a clear indicator that you didn’t trust her with the real answer and just used one that you used with the rest. “Now that you are ok, I need to do… some things.”

You left them there after knuckle pounding Jaden for his victory. As much as they were supporting you they also knew you really couldn’t be around an uninformed Alexis at the moment. You could still hear them but just didn’t pay attention as they continued the conversation while they went to a more… private setting to talk and ended up in Chaz’s room at the red dorm. While you ended up at your spot. You could still hear them if you wished but tried to tune them out with not a lot of success. You were almost forced to listen in.

“Ok, that what I did to you guys and how I got brainwashed in the first place.” She said while glaring at Chaz, making him sweat bullets and stutter out half completed apologies before she continued. “But you all still didn’t tell me what happened with Max. It was like he didn’t even recognize me, like I was just some random person or at most someone that knew about him by accident. He was there to support Jaden in rescuing me and me as indirectly but not much else. What happened?”

“Well… how to put this.” started Atticus as he tried to figure out how to phrase it. There wasn’t really a subtle way to say that she betrayed her giant dragon friend and he confides in a dragon from the duel monsters realm now. On top of that you had no intension of letting her get back to her previous status.

“Just tell me!” she said in a rather exasperated tone. She was getting tired of all this tiptoeing around the issue.

“You kinda destroyed him, in a way. I can’t even repeat some of the things you said and none of them were nice.” Hassleberry responded.

“But I was brainwashed, he would’ve seen that right?” she defended.

“Actually Alexis, he saw the opposite.” Jaden stated which got her head to snap to him in partial shock as she listened intently as he continued. “You started saying things like he was only your friend so he could eat you and other things that really made him depressed. At that point he entered your mind to reassure himself that it was all because of the brainwashing, like everyone else. What he found was that you actually thought that deep in your mind. You, apparently, were just too nice and accepting to let those thoughts grow. So in a sense you were only bluntly and antagonistically honest with him.”

“He told us how close you two were and that he trusted you with more than he should’ve.” Syris continued for the group but in a more hanged head expression. “He was really depressed for a while and feared telling us anything. Basically what you said was more than proof enough to keep him from telling us anything that he previously told you. So he found someone else to talk to and has more or less filled your old spot with her.”

“With who?” Alexis asked, not the first emotion she was suffering from but the first she could get audibly out of her mouth.

“Well he spends most of his free time at his little spot on that hill looking over the school with Blue Eyes White Dragon, or Blue for short. He even puts up a little area where she can be seen and felt by us just as easy as we can feel him.” Atticus replied. “He is now convinced, despite our attempts to get closer, that it is not right to put ‘dragon problems’ on us. He still hangs out with us and lets us hang out with him and Blue. But he far from confides in us like he does with her, or like he used to do with you.”

“I… I can’t believe this. I’m brainwashed and when I come to I find out I not only am partially responsible for almost destroying the world but also destroying my relationship with my closest friends. I have to go to him. I have make this right.” She rambled off as she tried to wrap her head around what she, apparently, did.

“That might not be a good idea right now.” Said Hassleberry as he got between her and the door with his arms waving her away from both the idea and the door.

“Why, I need to go to him!” she exclaimed.

“He’s right Alexis.” Jaden agreed, which carried significantly more weight in it. “Most nights Blue comes by and talks with him till he goes to sleep then watches over him. Considering you have been the source of a lot of pain for a while, I would say presenting yourself in front of his new protector and very loyal dragon friend is not a good idea. As it was yesterday Max was the only thing keeping her from blasting you from her spot. A white lightning attack from a Blue Eyes White Dragon could’ve easily taken you out in the white dorm. I don’t think she would allow you to approach… not right now anyway.”

Their conversation continued as you were too drained from all this to wait up for Blue to get there. So you changed to dragon form and went to bed right away. The nightmares were worse than usual with the distance conversation in your ears. That was until a white light came over your subconscious and almost literally chased away your negative thoughts and allowed you to sleep in peace. You didn’t need to wake up to know the source. Blue.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Alexis duels Jaden and comes back, mostly.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You couldn’t help but awaken as you sensed a hostile scent coming. It didn’t do your mood much better to know that the scent was Alexis. Even your subconscious mind, regardless if she was back, was painting her as an enemy. The only thing keeping your from a few tears were the feeling of blue next to you. She actually had her head and neck resting on yours as much as she could. She was far too small to match your large body in any size sense. You remained asleep as she would just tell you to go back to sleep if you started moving around. So you waited and listened as Blue addressed the scent that was coming.

“Well you aren’t very quiet and I haven’t seen you before. Who are you?” asked Blue as she glared at the approaching Alexis as she walked towards the two of you.

“Did he not tell you what happened today?” asked Alexis.

“No. He was asleep when I arrived and I didn’t want to wake him. He is rather cute when he is sleeping. But he was crying in his sleep when I arrived, so it couldn’t have been good.” Blue replied.

“I see. I… I was an old friend of his. Before I say anything else I would say that I was advised by the others not to come because of you. I did some things to Max that I am not proud of and they said that you wouldn’t be too happy with me showing up. But I had to at least try to apologize.” Alexis finally answered.

“You must be that human that made him get all depressed when I first met him, aren’t you?” she accused with a growl underlining her tone.

“To tell you the truth, I can’t remember what I did while I was brainwashed by the Society of Light. But I have no doubt that I am that person. My name is Alexis Rhodes. I know I am probably the last person he wants to see but I have to at least try and make up for what I did.” Alexis said back in confirmation but in a way that made Blue think.

“Make up for what you did? You weren’t here to see the aftermath of whatever you did. Do you really think I would let someone like you get that close to him again? I have half a mind to bite you in half.” Blur replied back. She was battling her nature and her closeness to you along with what you asked of her and your feelings on such things.

“Then I offer myself as payment for my visit. If I cause any more damage than I will walk right into your jaws if you wish.” Alexis replied, strangely serious at this point and more so than Blue.

“Deal. Even if he may not like it I will protect him from you if I must. Tred very cautiously, little human.” Blue accepted then nudged your snout gently with hers. You took this as a sign to wake up. It took a few prods but you finally opened your eyes sleepily. You might’ve been listening but that didn’t make you any less tired.

“Hmmm?” You asked as you looked to blue’s head that blocked your view of Alexis.

“You have a human visitor. Brace yourself, it is that girl that said all those mean things to you.” Blue reported to you. You rose your head and yawned out some of the sleep then came down to them to address Alexis as she stood there, considerably nervous as she realized what she just agreed to. She had doubted that she could successfully make up with you before. But now, if she didn’t, she would be dealt with by Blue Eyes White Dragon. Entering a dragon’s body under those conditions were not favorable to the way she use to do with you, a way she was convinced would never be open to her again.

“Alexis, how are you feeling?” You asked.

“Uh… fine I guess. I came here to… to ask your forgiveness, and mercy. I realize, even in the indirect story the others told me, that I did exactly what I told you I wouldn’t do. Mind slave or not, it shouldn’t have mattered, I should’ve known better. I am ashamed to say that I am the first person in this realm that has betrayed you and not in a small fashion. I don’t expect to be as close as we were before. But do you have it in your deep heart to forgive me?” Alexis asked as she took the frog pose for a bow to add sincerity to her request. You could see her shaking as she looked at the ground, waiting for your response.

It was definitely weird. You went to sleep after explaining everything to them. Working off the effects of shadow realm was harder than you thought. Spending a generous amount of time sleeping wasn't really what you wanted to do, but your body was getting better around it and building an immunity to it... or at least the harmful effects.

You felt yourself to spinning as you slept. You thought it weird, but the way you dreamed... you usually had something that felt like that. You knew something was off when you woke and was bombarded with strange sights and sounds... which was hard to do as you were used to both pre-tech eras and super high-tech dueling eras.

Where were you???

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You shook your head and looked around. You were hazy and disoriented, obviously, but then got grounded as you heard and felt some familiar things. You were in a hospital bed, hooked up to an I.V. bag and such, with the beeps and other noises that you were listening to in the nurses station that you just left. But the odds of you being dropped from the portal into a hospital, never mind a bed in one... with meds hooked in... and no frantic people running around... not very likely. That meant that someone had to have found you and at least dropped you off at a hospital... that was nice of them... you hoped. You began looking and feeling around. You could see, hear, and feel a normal 21st century town for the most part. However, there was something strange about it... magic. Being the places you've been and what you are capable of, it wasn't the magic that was strange, it was the present magic. It was more of a magic that suppressed other magic and a host of other things, but not suppressing existing magic or enchantments... as if someone had developed this area as a sort of Matrix like prison for those of their choosing. You were obviously not with them when that happened, so it didn't effect you. Then again, the level you were feeling, it wouldn't do more than transport you, if used on you.

"Ah, you've awakened, finally." Said what looked like a very uptight woman. Your head snapped to her as she spoke. You didn't mean to be aggressive, but in your heightened state, it came across that way and she flinched just slightly. Most wouldn't have seen it, but you did. You were a highly trained dragon ninja after all. If you dragon senses didn't pick it up, your other training did. "...and it seams like you're feeling better."

"I am. A bit confused but otherwise unharmed. Why am I here? Where am I? Who are you?" You asked in quick succession. You had thought about just letting her talk herself into such topics, but you didn't want to give this person, whomever it is, any indication that you were anything but a confused person that was there on accident. Definitely NOT a dragon from another realm that could kill her in a blink of an eye... or less than that if you felt so inclined.

"You are in a Hospital in Storybrooke. I am the Regina Mills, Mayor of this town, MY town." She answered, the last bit was a bit direct, as if flaunting her authority. You stared at her, thinking it unwise to glare at the moment. Under the circumstances, she had every right to be defensive. Although there was something about her that made your skin crawl a bit, like a threat that was underneath a smile, just teasing you.

"Then..." you started, then relaxed a little and addressed her more calmly. "... I thank you for admitting me into your town's hospital, assuming it was you that put me here."

"Then you assume wrong. It was my son Henry that did that. If it wasn't for him, I'd have sent you out of here just as quickly as you appeared. I do not like strangers. So, as soon as you are feeling up to it..." She corrected and answered. Although to this part she got closer as if ready to strike. This got you readjust, which she took as squirming, making her smirk and almost downright evil smirk. She dwelled in her amusement before finishing with, "... get OUT of MY town. Have a nice day and please don't enjoy your time in Storybrooke."

With that she spun on her heal and walked confidently out of the room and down the hall. She had a confidence as if she owned the place... which she very well could've. You didn't know why you were here, or where here was, but you planned to find out. Meanwhile, this Henry person, he may be someone to introduce yourself to, as he seemed to have a good enough heart to put you in a hospital, rather than leaving you or driving you out like his Mother seemed exceedingly willing to do.

choices: Humor him but send him on his way. You have enough to deal with right now.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You thought about what the Mayor had more demanded than asked you to do. It was HER town, apparently, but you were not really interested in doing as she commanded. She sounded more like those stuck up royals that you had known way back. More like a self entitled Queen than any kind of respectful Mayor. So, suffice to say, you decided to stick around. You checked yourself out of the hospital, after of course finding and destroying and additional records and samples of you. With that Mayor Lady and the magic you were feeling, you didn't want them to have access to your DNA. Even if you had no Dragon traces in it right now.

You got out of the hospital and melted into the shadows, like a ninja would. You felt and saw many things that both made sense and didn't. Such as, a sign that had no reason for being broken, but was being repaired. Then you would come back the next day and find it "broken" in exactly the same way and the man fixing it the exact same way. Or buildings, that despite being void of direct magic, were magically sealed. Then seemingly random items that had obvious enchantments, to you anyway. Finally, time didn't seam to go anywhere with a high majority of the things. Not even ageing worked the way it was supposed to. The strangest person you saw was a guy named Mr. Gold. He owned a pawn shop in town, stocked full of almost all magical items and stuff that even you had to admit were impressive. He walked around with a limp and cane, despite not needing it, and had an insane feeling of darkness around him. His power too was hampered, but you could feel a massive reservoir of power underneath whatever seal or curse that was keeping it from surfacing. However, unlike everyone else, even though he acted the part, he remembered everything about wherever they were all from, which apparently not from whatever realm you all were living in.

The whole situation was very strange. Then, there was the little boy named Henry, the Mayor's son. He would go to school, visit people, and generally be an overall good boy. Then he would run around with a book, read it, talk to people, then run around as if he found out something invaluable with an overly joyful look on his face.

So, you decided that you would stay in town. You quickly assessed what was used for currency, then found a small house to call your own. You were going to go for some kind of business, but thought that would attract far too much attention. Your place was a nice little two story house that had 3 rooms upstairs and a full bathroom, with 1 bedroom, a living room, 1 full bathroom, and a kitchen/dining room, then a full and undivided basement. You quickly paid for it and went to work on it. You didn't know how long this sense of people leaving you alone would last, but you were going to get as much done as possible. With the amount of ambient magic around, you needed to be ready. You treated the whole place with anti-magic enchants and barriers to prevent anyone or anything from intruding in any matter, even listening through the door would be impossible. Then you strengthened everything to withstand a great deal of damage, both magically and physically. Lastly you made an area in the basement that accessed a training and storage area that was invisible to anyone but you unless you allowed them access. With all the preparations done you were just in time to reach the door as a knock came to it. You barely had to guess who it was.

"You were supposed to leave, NOT take up residence!" The Mayor hollered at you. She had an accusing tone, as if to say 'how dare you disobey her every wish'. Typical pampered royal brat attitude. She obviously was used to getting her way. Definitely NOT being treated as if she was of no consequence.

"Well, Madam Mayor, I checked to see if you truly owned the whole town. As I thought, you are just the Mayor. There was no law forbidding me from staying a while. So, regardless on your feelings on the matter, I think I will be staying for a time. I am sorry to say that you have no power to deport me for no other reason than your personal preference." You answered.

"What!... Just who do you think you are?!?" She seemed to scream at you, seething openly about it. You couldn't believe it, a grown woman having a temper tantrum. Her office earned her some respect from you, but not her personally. You decided to play nice, for now.

"My apologies, my name is Max Drake. Good to meet you Madam Mayor!" You greeted. By this point, there was a growing crowd to see what had the Mayor's undies in a twist. She seemed to see this and how you were reacting. She had no power to do anything at the moment. But for you to say it out loud and her admit it to herself was not a preferred feeling for her. She seethed, then changed to another grin, as if she just thought of something. You could read her mind, but you didn't see the point at the moment. Plus, you didn't need to. Her own laws were restraining her at the moment.

"Fine, You'll regret this." She said, as if satisfied at just having the last word and whatever she had thought of. She bounded out of your meager yard. It definitely wasn't much to look at from any angle, unless someone had a magical eye or knew about jutsu. You also used your knowledge and duel monster game to make some interesting additions. You smiled to yourself as you closed the door and went about your business.

It wasn't long after that when another knock came to your door. You opened it to see the person you actually wanted to talk to around here... actually you also wanted to talk to a few others but he was the number 1 on your list at present. Henry stood there clutching his book and looking at you excitedly.

"Hi, Um... I'm Henry. You're looking better!" He introduced.

"Yes, thanks to you." You said, then added a smile. He seemed to want to come in, so you moved aside and gestured for him to enter. He did so and promptly sat on a couch that was in the living room that was immediately inside the front door. You were in the middle of knocking out a wall to make the living room and bedroom on this level as one big room. He looked at that before he noticed that you had closed the door and sat on a couch directly opposite of him.

"It was nothing, really. What was I supposed to do? Leave you in the street like that?" He asked.

"In the street? Is that where you found me?" You asked.

"Yep! I've never seen a stranger around here before! How'd you get into Storybrooke?" He asked as if it was a huge thing. You had noticed that the border of the town was impossible to cross without magic. But most people had at least a little bit in them. It wouldn't take a very powerful wizard or magical being to enter. Then again, you weren't sure if humans in this realm had magic on default or not. The last one they did. Gave them the ability to interact with the shadow realm and duel monsters. It was definitely different around here. Perhaps it was harder than you thought for most to get into Storybrooke. Which meant that he probably had a bunch of questions on how you managed it.

"Well, sorry to burst your bubble Henry, but I don't really know how I got here. I was somewhere else and I just... woke up here, in the hospital that you were nice enough to take me to." You answered before he could ask, but you could tell that it just added to his curiosity.

"But where are you from?" he asked.

You wrecked your brain with how to answer truthfully, but also withhold the whole coming from another realm thing. You assumed that massively long range teleportation was better then a Dragon Ninja realm traveler duel monster of sorts. You were tempted to say 'Duel Academy' First. But you figured a well known country would be better.

"Japan. I was going to a university there... well outside it a bit but still." You said. There, now it sounds like you were in college or something like that. He didn't look to have any ninja interrogation techniques to notice that he should press harder. His assumptions were good enough.

"Oh..." He said, visibly disappointed for some reason then brightened a little bit. "... but you still randomly appeared out of nowhere."

"Why, what were you hoping for?" You asked.

"Well... promise not to laugh?" He asked, you nodded. "Well, I was hoping you were a prince or something."

"Or something?" You asked.

"Well, it may sound strange, but I think that everyone in this town are from this story." he said, holding his book tightly. "Heroes and Villians, Dragons and Dwarves. I was... well I was hoping you were something from here as well. No one here can remember who they are or where they are from. I have figured some of it out but, they are still in the dark."

"I see..." You said. This seamed a bit like a imagination gone overboard moment. But then again, you were a dragon, and this place was filled with a strange magic and feeling. He could be on to something. Still, the way he said it was a bit childish to be fact, at least at the moment. you could go either way as far as believing him.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Explore a bit.

choices: You go talk to Mr. Gold.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You figured that of all the things that you have seen, done, and experienced, having a town cursed to become a 21st century non-magic, magic town was by far more believable. You looked at the eager boy in front of you. He smiled very wide, but more than that you saw a great hope, faith, and belief. You had seen it before, mainly with people that couldn't separate fiction from reality. Although, in this case, he was probably right. You decided to give the little kid the benefit of the doubt.

"Ok, bud, tell me about this place and the people in it." You replied.

"You believe me!?!" He asked in an excited tone.

"I have no reason to doubt you. Start jerking my chain though and I might, fair warning." You answered.

"I won't" He replied.

For the rest of the day, he regaled you with great stories and their connection to the people that lived in the town. You smiled at how apparently innocent he and the stories were. Good always won, evil always lost, true love found each other, and magic was ever present. You almost growled at the mention of Maleficent. But held back, as you figured that the lady was a woman that could transform into a dragon, not the other way around. Still, you wouldn't mind ripping her head off if she made a wrong move, and for you and dragons a wrong move could be something as small as looking to intensely at an innocent. The fact that she was already designated as evil didn't help her case either.

Henry also asked you questions about many things, but you didn't really feel comfortable letting him known anything too crazy.

"Well, your memory will come back eventually, it always does." He said as you blocked yet another attempt at him prying into your past. You had a feeling that he was becoming suspicious but had no angle to find out the truth unless you told him.... or someone from another realm told him about you. Eventually he would find out, so you decided to tell him... just not this second.

"I'm sure it will." You replied. Implying that he would hear about what he wanted in time, your time.

"So, you going to help me defeat the evil queen?" He asked hopefully.

"Nope." You said rather bluntly. So much so in fact that he almost fell over. He definitely dropped his book, which you caught and handed back to him.

"What? Why not?" He asked, astounded.

"Because, for all her threats to me, she has yet to actually move against me or mine. I have rule that I mostly live by. If Someone doesn't mess with me or mine, then I let them be. It would be impolite to just go around demanding people change because I think so." You answered.

"I suppose you're right. But I have to find a way to help the people around here. I have to find my Mom. Can you help with that?" He asked.

"Nope." You answered again.

"Ok, why not this time. I'm your friend right? Friends help friends out you know...?" He reasoned. He kind of jumped the gun with calling the two of you friends. but, with the type of person he is, you didn't mind him as your first friend in this realm.

"Yes, they do. But I know next to nothing about America and this place. I would be of no help. I'll help in other ways, getting you out of trouble if needed, but I can't help you FIND her. Make sense?" You asked.

"I suppose so..." He replied back. What interested you most of this kid was that your answer didn't defeat him. He just got contemplative and inspired to "save" the town. You were liking this kid more and more. So, you had an idea...

"What do you think about tattoos?" you asked.

"Not really my thing... but I suppose I'm not opposed... plus I think it would drive my Mom nuts, why?" He asked.

"You want a magical tattoo?" You asked, your tone feeding his fantasy appetite just enough so that he would want to do it without asking questions, or too many at least. He did seem like a curious chatter box of sorts.

"Do I?!?" He asked excitedly with a clear sign that he wanted one.

"Ok, give me your hand then..." You said, which he eagerly gave you.

You turned it over so it was palm up and his fingers spread. You then did a few dozen hand signs in a flurry of moves with mixed magic in there. He couldn't see the energy, but he was so enthralled by your hand signs that he didn't mind. You then pointed at his hand and the magic infused jutsu threw a symbol on his palm. He flinched, as it stung for a second. His eyes bugged out as he saw the symbol of a Dark Hunter almost burn onto his hand then disappear. He stared at his hand as if was going to fall off, then stared at you for you to explain.

"It is an emergency call button, kind of. If you are in actual trouble, like life and death trouble, and need me there, it will call me there. Odds of you needing it is very unlikely, but if you are going to save the world from evil queens, ogres, and dragons than you need some protection. Just be careful with whatever you're doing, alright." you said, putting a concerned hand on his shoulder.

"You got it... and thanks!" He said, still excited about the now invisible tattoo on his hand.

What he didn't know was that it wasn't just a call button, it was a type of magical summoning contract. It would allow you to appear at will by his side, and keep tabs on him. The more danger he got into, the more it would notify you. Sure, it had its quirks, but it would help you protect the little guy. Out of all the people and memories that you had seen so far, he was the one you didn't mind protecting.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Believe him.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You, to be honest, were getting a bit bored, aside from hanging with Henry from time to time. The same thing happening over and over again was not inspiring you to do anything new. You tried to keep busy, but there was really only one other person, besides the Mayor, that seemed to not be on a constant loop, despite his actions to the contrary. After Henry ran away to find his Mom, you decided to pay this man a visit. Mainly because anytime you got close to his place Henry stopped you from going in. Saying that he was a ‘Very Bad’ guy. He gave you the lowdown from his book. You had to admit, if half the things were true about him from that book, then it both made sense and could cause you a slight amount of concern.

You stood in front of “Mr. Gold’s Pawnshop” for a moment, watching him through the window and doors. Such small materials didn’t impede your vision and senses. After you were sure that you wanted to confront him, you walked through the doors, giving the bell at the door a ring.

“Ah, yes. Can I help you? I don’t believe I’ve seen you around before? New to the area?” He asked.

“You could say that.” You responded with a small smirk. He was playing his part well, whatever that was. You smiled at him then looked around. As you suspected, a high majority if not everything in the shop was not what it appeared. Magic was everywhere here, but most was dormant, for the moment.

“Your name would be?” Asked Mr. Gold.

“Max. Nice to meet you Mr. Gold.” You replied, stopping at a few of the more powerful artifacts in there before moving on. This, it seemed, didn’t go unnoticed by the man.

“What can I help you with?” He asked pleasantly, with an underlining tone that implied that he didn’t have time to waste on trivial matters and if you wanted something, you should not waste his time.

“Two things actually. The First is to store something for me.” You answered as you made your way to the table and register.

“That’s not exactly what I do here.” He said with a smirk that even you couldn’t decipher the meaning behind.

“I understand. However, I have a feeling that you are the type of person that is into making deals. Plus, you have no idea what I am looking to keep here. I guarantee it is something you’ve never seen the like of before… Ever.” You replied with your own knowing smirk.

“Very well, what is it that you wish to store here?” Mr. Gold asked, obviously curious but keeping a lid on how much so.

“These.” You said as you placed your deck on the table, your card on the top.

“A fictional card game for children?” He asked with an almost offended tone.

“Hmm… I don’t think I have to tell YOU that there are some things that are more than they appear.” You replied then took a materialized dagger out of your coat.

His eyes bulged out then corrected, but he knew you saw him. For what you held was HIS dagger, with the name “Rumplestiltskin” on its blade. He had trained himself well and didn’t look where the real one was, but was obviously stuck. You laid the dagger on the table to which he picked it up then sighed in relief.

“That is a dangerous game you’re playing.” Mr. Gold said as he handled the dagger copy then placed it carefully down.

“Not really. I haven’t threatened anything yet or blackmailed you. I just did that to prove a point and to get a level or respect from you. I may not know everything, as I am new to the area, but I’m not an idiot either.” You replied as if it was nothing, picking up the dagger and putting it back into your coat. You didn’t use a coat very often, but this was a use for it. You’d take it off after this. Plus, as a fully trained Dragon Ninja, you could hide daggers like that on your person quite easily. “I’ll dispose of that. No need to keep something like that around.”

“I… appreciate it.” He said, still catching himself a bit. “I hope you would know that I will store your item for you, but you can’t see where.”

“I understand that. As for what you are getting in return…” You said, then pulled out an enchanted blade with a dragon insignia on its blade and hilt. You laid it down on the table and let him pick it up. “…I’m sure you’ll find a use for that at some point.”

“Just to store your cards???” He asked, skeptical.

“Yep.” You answered with a smile.

“Ok, deal. What is your second thing that you need?” Mr. Gold asked as he sheathed the blade and put it aside carefully.

“Kinda goes with what I said before. I don’t really get everything that is going on around here. But, I’m going to be sticking around for a while. I can tell you are… well less than ordinary at the very least. So, a bit of mutual respect would be nice. I’m not going to tell you about me until I want to, nor will I ask you to explain yourself. I’m not really into the whole stabbing in the back thing either. If I have a problem with you or something you are doing, I’ll tell you first, then confront you more… aggressively.” You explained.

“Assuming that I know what you’re talking about… Is there anything that you want me to steer clear of or want to say off the bat?” He asked.

“I guess. You know the Mayor’s son, Henry?” You asked. Now getting a stronger whiff of him, you could tell they were related by the scent. But either he didn’t know or didn’t want others to know that he knew. Either way, that wasn’t why you brought him up.

“Yes.” He answered bluntly, as if he knew everything.

“Well I think he is a rather unique kid that I have come to value…” You said, that part in a kind and carefree tone, then switched to a serious glare that actually got Mr. Gold to flinch. “… Harm him and I’ll make you wish you hadn’t. I do believe that is clear enough for you, correct?”

“I do believe so, yes.” Mr. Gold replied. He had flinched before, but obviously didn’t like doing such things. Now his expression was that of someone that was saying, do what you will, if you dare.

“Good. Now, that I got that out of the way…” You started in a lighter tone and expression. “… I can leave my deck in your hands. Have a wonderful day Mr. Gold!”

“Yes, I’ll be seeing you around I suspect.” He replied as you were leaving.

“That would be a fair prediction.” You said with a smile, then exited his shop.

You walked down the street and could feel his eyes watching you as you walked. You didn’t know what would happen with that whole situation, but you hoped that his curious gaze was one of interest, not of spite. It was hard to tell with him, but for now you were good. You had a feeling that Henry was going to be the center of things of change, if he was right about the magic in this place.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You go talk to Mr. Gold.

choices: Emma needs help with another dragon.
Emma is now sheriff and comes to you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Max! Max!” Called Henry as he knocked excitedly on your door. You sighed, got up from your reading, then when to the door. You opened it to find Henry and a tall blonde woman at the door.

“Hello Henry, I assume your trip to find your Mother was fruitful?” You greeted and asked, then looked up from his face to hers with a pleasant greeting smile. “Good morning Ma’am!”

“Yeah… good morning… Wait… you knew he was coming to find me, by himself?” She asked, a bit angry and shocked. You could see why, but then again she wasn’t seeing all the pieces of the situation yet.

“Why don’t you both come in and we can talk about it?” You suggested, seeing as there were already a few people looking on. You looked passed her and saw, in the far distance, the clock had started working again.

“Yeah, ok…” The Woman agreed, to which Henry ran in and sat on one of the more comfy chairs that he had sat in a few times when he was over… ok, more than a few times, but still, he excitedly waited for everyone to join him. The woman followed him a bit, then nervously sat down in a seat next to him. “Wow… comfy!”

“Thanks.” You answered as you finished shutting the door and joined them. “Henry, introductions please?”

“Oh, right!” Henry responded, sitting up to do so. “Max, this is my Mom, her name is Emma Swan. Mom, this is my friend Max… he doesn’t really have a last name.”

“Good to meet you, Max.” Emma greeted with a hand out.

“Likewise, Miss. Swan.” You greeted back, taking her hand and shaking it.

“So, you let Henry come find me and didn’t tell anyone?” Emma asked with an accusatory tone.

“And who would’ve I told exactly?” You asked.

“His mother, the Mayor?” She more stated than asked.

“Right, have you met her?” You asked with an amused tone.

“Yes, not to keen on me staying in town. That one has a few screws loose.” Emma responded, then saw what you were referring to. “But she is still his Mother.”

“Agreed, on both points. However, knowing that and knowing young Henry here. Do you think I would’ve been able to stop him or tell anyone of consequence in time to do just that?” You asked, spurring her mind.

“Ok, I get it.” Emma replied, Henry just sitting and watching the exchange with a smile on.

“Plus, I’m not Henry’s Father or family. I’m his Friend, and that doesn’t give me responsibility to judge or prevent his choices. If anything…” You said, then raised a fist for a knuckle pound, to which Henry happily met and sat back with a smile. “… nice, job finding her by yourself bud.”

“Thanks!” Henry responded.

“Ok, that is… interesting… but do you know WHY he brought me back?” She asked.

“I assume he brought you back for 2 reasons. First, you are his Mother. Second, he says you are the savior.” You answered, numbering off the reasons on your fingers.

“Wait… you believe it to?” She asked, careful to not make the question sound like she didn’t. She seemed to be ‘playing along’ with Henry, so she had to keep up the act while getting information from you.

“It is more like I haven’t seen any evidence to the contrary. Henry has yet to lie to me, so I have no reason to doubt him. Then again, wither these people are Fairy Tale characters from a book or not, doesn’t bother me in the slightest. In the end, it is more fun and safer to believe him than not. Plus… provided that it is all real as he describes it, it wouldn’t be the weirdest thing I’ve seen or heard about.” You answered and explained.

“That is a way of looking at it I guess…” She said, still not willing to put her weight behind it.

You could tell that she was barely holding onto her sanity with what was happening. But it also looked like she was clinging onto Henry, wither she knew it or not. Plus, the magic of this place seemed to be enticing her to stay.

“Hold on, what is the weirdest thing, if this is all true?” She asked, catching that bit and prying to see what other surprises were going to reveal themselves to her.

“Right, no offense, but if you aren’t ready to hear what he just told you and believe it, then there really isn’t any reason to assume you would be ready to hear things vastly stranger than that.” You said in a sarcastic and logical tone.

“I can handle it. You’d be surprised what I can handle.” She defended, obviously not keen on being underestimated, even if it was warranted.

“Not yet you can’t. Let’s just say that it this town isn’t normal, than I am even less normal.” You said, trying to say points that would make her drop it, but the opposite was happening. So, you decided to go with a different approach. “How about this? When you figure out what is going on in this town, then I’ll give you a bit more.”

“Fine, I guess that will do.” Emma answered.

You could tell that she was not really buying it and defaulting back to what she knew. Humoring people until she got her footing would be the best bet, according to her. You couldn’t really blame her, as she was rather thrown into this whole thing rather fast. Henry himself moved rather quickly on this stuff, and she was playing catch up. You had no doubt with the clock starting to move again, she would understand things in a short while. You were secretly glad that it would take a bit more until you had to actively participate in things. You weren’t overly thrilled with turning into a dragon and starting that cycling again. Just an ordinary life was good enough for you. Of course you had a few instincts, and training that you felt like continuing, you still liked the lack of eventful conflict you had been a part of lately.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You meet Emma

choices: First experience with the predatory and feeding system of Felarya.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Your sleep was undisturbed for a while. Well, to be more accurate, you couldn’t wake up. Your sickness hit a peak because of your exertion so you couldn’t wake up for a while. The only good thing about it was that you didn’t dream while you were out. Normally people would see that as a bad thing. But in your case, with every dream being a replay of the betrayals of your past or your bad deeds, you basked in the relative peace that this rest and relaxation was giving you. Eventually your bliss of nothingness was interrupted, as you were cleansed of the sickness, by a loud banging.

It was like a truck was slamming into a metal cage. You could hear a yell of exertion then a loud “BANG!” as if a giant or something was trying to break out of a prison by force… and not getting anywhere. Then it hit you, prison? Why did it seem like you were in or around a prison? Duel academy didn’t have any such facilities. Then as the rest of your senses started coming back you began to notice things. You were on a cold, hard, metal floor. You could hear the light breathing of others around you, lots of others, along with the heavy breathing of whomever was slamming against their cage then a larger set of lungs opposite that side of the room. You could smell that not a majority of the… people around you or in the immediate space were human. They had hints of something else or full on different scents all together. You didn’t dare move or give away that you were awake for two reasons. First was that you didn’t want to reveal yourself before you had effectively woken up, enough to move properly. The second was that your wings, tail, and probably your eyes were out. Other than that you were stripped of your cloths but thankfully not your duel disk, which was concealed in the titanium wrist band on your left arm. This was definitely not the same realm you knew. That much was obvious.

“Should we try waking him up?” asked a voice. You tried concentrating on recovering but with them so close it was hard not to hear what they were saying.

“I’ve never seen his kind before. He looks like a demon but the tail isn’t spaded. Either way, we should keep our distance. You never know what Felarya has.” Said another voice that was followed with some agreement from the others around you. Felarya? Was that where you were? Or was it the name of the world/ realm you were now on? From their speech you guessed it was. As there was not much variety in here… well, not to the degree the man that spoke was referring to anyway.

“You talking about me over there?!” yelled a loud voice from the direction of the slamming sound. You had to guess that whatever this female voice belonged to was fairly large. About as large as that giantess that you met back on Naruto’s realm.

“If they are, they are probably speaking about how damn loud you’re being. Can’t you tell by now, belly dragger? All the banging in the world isn’t going to get you out of that cage.” Said another large voice that felt the same but a different hint and from the opposite side of the room as the other. This one was more controlled and calm when she spoke.

“Shut up! I’ll do what I want you spider reject!” Said the other with a hiss before slamming into whatever cage she was in. Obviously they were not friends and they were understandably separated, leaving only verbal attacks to be used on each other.

“Look, he’s getting up.” Said a smaller voice, maybe a child of some kind. You must’ve moved your tail or wings without thinking about it. Damn, they always gave you away. Like a dog wagging his tail, your extra appendages were linked to your emotions to an extent.

You weren’t going to get any more rest as is so you slowly started to get up. It started with just getting to your hands and knees but then you staggered to your feet then braced against the wall you had been placed near. You shook your head then opened your eyes, glancing around at the people around you. Although you didn’t know if you could really call them people. There was about 10 humans but the rest were kind of like you. There was about another 10 of them that had cat like features as far as ears and a tail were concerned and probably other things if you got a closer look later. Another type near the 10 count as well were ones that looked human accept they had knife shaped ears and a more elegant complexion. There were two in the same cell that looked human from the top half but a snake tail replacing their feet. Then 3 that looked human but had almost clear wings on their back that fluttered as you looked at them like butterflies would. Outside your cage but in their own were two huge figures, well not by your standards but still compared to the rest in the room, huge. One was a 100 foot tall version of the snake ladies that were in the same cell as you. On the other side of the room was a slightly bigger but still around 100 feet woman but her lower half was that of a spider, tarantula maybe as it was hairy enough but also elegant to give you pause in that description. Finally you looked at something that was attached to your right arm. It was a white band that was near 1 inch thick with a crystal lit up on the top. You noticed they all had one on as well.

“I wouldn’t mess with that if I were you. Last person in here that did ended up passed out, missing meal time.” Said a knife ear man. You gave it a tap curiously then straightened then stretched a little before addressing them.

“Thank you for the warning.” You said back as your wings came back to rest on your bare back. It seemed none of you had any more than a loin cloth as far as clothing were concerned and some of them didn’t even have that, like the large ladies that were also looking at you but not as much as those in your cell. The cell you were in was against and as wide as the back wall of the room with 1 foot thick steel bars that were small enough apart to keep even a child inside. The other cells had relatively thicker bars and were on either side of the space in the middle of the room, far enough away from your cell so they couldn’t do more than yell at each other but close enough to give the occupants of your cell a fearful apprehension of them.

“Well at least HE… has manners.” Said a woman with the knife like ears as she glared at the human group. They seemed to glare back. Obviously there was some tension between species of this world.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Your secret stays your secret.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So…” you started which snapped them out of their glare battles to look at their common mode of interest. “Where am I and, excuse my rudeness, what are you?”

“Wait, you don’t know where you are?” asked one of the cat people to which you shook your head. “That means you were a victim of the random portals that bring people here. Don’t worry, it happens all the time… well maybe you should worry as this is easily the most dangerous world there is.”

“Dangerous for tasty things like you.” Said the giant snake lady as she licked her lips. You got the distinct impression that with their half predator bodies came predator tendencies like eating those under or different than them. Then it hit you. You knew what these things were. Your genetic knowledge was giving you information on them. The snake people were Naga, the Spider people were Dridders, the winged people fairies, the cat people Nekos, the Knife ear people were Elves, then there was obviously humans. Most were species that were wiped out from your home realm many generations ago by the dragons. Their arrogance and pride didn’t allow them to share their human meals with other predators so all the dragons killed and consumed the other predators. They were long extinct on your realm but here it was obviously not the case.

“She is one of the reasons why. Everything in Felarya wants to eat you and I do mean EVERYTHING. Plants, animals, giant predators, even the ground itself has traps to consume the unlucky prey they catch. There is even things lower than us that we eat, like Tomthumbs.” Said one of the nekos as she licked her lips.

“Ok that is interesting and unnerving. But you still haven’t answered my question. Where am I, or we I guess? Is this a prison of some sort?” You asked.

“Not likely, we are in the dark as much as you. We all started waking up a few hours ago and you were already here as were they.” Said a human as he pointed a thumb at the two giant predators in the room.

“Best we can tell it is some kind of lab or something. We have yet to see our captors but this is definitely not a prison.” Said an Elf woman.

“Now enough about us. It looks like you recognize what each of us are. But what are you?” asked a male fairy as his wings fluttered.

“I… well I’m a half breed. Half Dragon and half human.” you started then paused. You didn’t see the point in hiding that part as most of them were half human and half… something else as well.

“And can you do magic?” asked the female fairy.

“I can, well not right now. Something seems to be blocking my magical power.” You answered as you flexed your hand then opened it, trying to materialize something but only getting a light spark. It then made sense why you couldn’t retract your dragon parts. If there was something sealing your magic then you wouldn’t be able to protrude or retract any more than what was already out. It wasn’t pure magic but magic was definitely an essential part of the process. So without it, you wouldn’t be able to go to dragon form. But you still had Chakra and your dragon based abilities. “What’s up with that?”

“These things seem to limit magic.” Said a human that gave the appearance of a mage with his long white beard and old but wise persona. “Otherwise we would’ve broken out by now.”

“And none of you can get them off?” you asked.

“Would we be here if we could? I would’ve eaten you by now if I could. You may be a… Half-breed or whatever but you smell tasty to me.” Said the giant Naga with a hungry but also playful look at you that got all the others to flinch except the giant Dridder on the other side.

“I’ll take that as a compliment and I’ll return it. You do smell delicious as well.” you responded back as you took in a good sniff in her direction. She did smell very good. You didn’t know what made you like her scent as a food dish; her willingness to eat people or the fact that you hadn’t had a naga before. Your empty stomach and lack of sunlight could also have been playing a role in it.

“Ha, you’re a funny one. I like you already.” Said the giant Dridder as she looked at the flustered response of the Giant Naga at your response. “You acting like you could eat us… funny guy.”

“Sure, here to please… I guess. Might as well have some fun until we find out what our lovely hosts have in store for us. No reason to be afraid of something that may or may not even happen. I mean it would be a waste of time being scared of a stomach if they end up just shooting us or something.” You said with a shrug.

“You think they will?” asked a child Neko asked as his eyes widened with fear.

“Same difference really. Personally I would rather be eaten than be shot. No reason to give whomever put me in here the satisfaction of killing me themselves. But my point is there is no reason to fear death if you don’t know what is going to happen. Besides worrying that much gives me wrinkles.” You explained and joked the last part to get the little one to smile a little.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Gathering and giving information.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Before any side could respond the lights got brighter as a door opened at the far side of the room. Shortly after a human male came in, stopped at a small table, deposited a clipboard, then took out a sort of controller as he walked in the middle of the two big cages until he was able to speak to everyone without yelling.

“Welcome. I am Doctor Hasmond and I am here to tell you why you are all here.” He said in a calm but arrogant voice.

“So it is humans that captured us, I knew it.” Said an Elf.

“Oh not just humans. I represent a company of Mercenaries made up of all species that provide muscle for hire to anyone willing to pay. We provide safe transportation through the jungles of Felarya and even lead buffets to paying predators.” He countered to which it stopped the Naga from yelling an interruption. She was half angry why she was held in the cell but the other half intrigued at what she just heard.

“Then why are we here?” asked the Dridder.

“Quite simple really. We do research on predators of note to find ways to help our organization. The research about what you prefer to eat to how to best assassinate your kind.” Doctor Hasmond responded.

“And why are we here?” asked a Neko.

“I would’ve thought that obvious. If these two cooperate with the tests then they will be given something to eat. That is where you all come in. You will provide an ample food source until we can capture more prey to award the predators for their efforts. So, in case you still need a hint, you are here to feed them.” Hasmond said as he waved a thumb at the two predators beside him.

“And what makes you think that we will just let ourselves be eaten?” asked a fairy. You watched silently as the conversation unfolded but the tension was obviously rising and understandably so. The Doctor didn’t answer right away as he held up the controller and hit a button. Instantly you felt an electrical current running through your body. It was a strong one and ironically enough to replenish you reserves in place of sunlight. But as you saw the reaction of the others, you joined them in falling to the floor in pain. It was an act for you but it was clear that the current running through all of them, even the predators, was there to keep them obedient. No one was immune to this and everyone seemed to be begging for him to stop… well accept you. You were just acting. You had no idea what was going on in this new world. Then he pushed a button that took away the current and allowed everyone to recover before speaking.

“As you can see, I am in control here. If you refuse what I say then it will happen in a much more painful way. Either way, I get what I want wither you accept it or not. That was the lowest setting. I can increase it until it is an instant kill for any of you.” he said in warning to the two predators, who were panting at the conclusion of the physical assault done by this man. “Oh, in case you get any ideas. If I don’t return to that table and punch out before the allotted time, a signal will be given to repeat that punishment until someone else comes down to turn it off, and that could be days.”

“You son of a…” the giant Naga started but he hit a different button that shocked only her. He smirked as he watched her writhe on the ground, enjoying her pain perhaps a little too much.

“Don’t think I can’t target individuals.” He said after he turned it off and she turned her smitten face towards him. She was too tired at this point to say anything back. “Now, I’ll be back later on tonight to hand out food for the smaller of you and get samples from the predators. If you are good, I may even give you two of them instead of just one.”

The giant naga hissed defiantly at him but that was all she could do. He just smirked before pushing a few things on the table then left without his Clipboard. You immediately glanced through the pages from where you stood. It was the specifics and overall operations guide for the room. Apparently the wrist bands acted as a part of a two part system. The first was restraint. The restrained magic ability and allowed a current to enter the body in order to cause an effect like he had just done previously. The second part was to allow the people to phase through the bars. It wouldn’t work on you so you wondered how they got you into the cell. But other than that it just gave instructions on how to work the controller, what band was for what person and all that. There also seemed to be a group security system. Like a magical shield around the bars. Even if someone could get out the shield and bars the sensors would render them unconscious or dead in seconds with a signal to the table that the Doctor referred to before.

“So it seems we are stuck in here for a while.” Said the giant Dridder.

“Easy for you to say. No offense, but I would rather not be eaten by you. At least you get to live.” Said one of the Fairies.

“Actually I think we got the better end of the deal.” You stated to which everyone’s heads snapped to you as you leaned against the wall behind you. “Think about it. They are the ones that will be experimented on. Would you rather live as an expendable lab rat that will be killed slowly over the course of many years or months, or be eaten by one of them? Sure it stinks that it has to happen at all but at least we aren’t the ones being prodded and tested. I mean do you think that a real experimentation will just be a few shots and samples of blood? Imagine if they need some of their skin or an organ to study. They could skin them alive and leave them just enough to heal before they do it again. Think of all the questions each of you have about each other and then imagine the ways to get those answers. That is what could happen to them. Like I said, I prefer being eaten. I suffer for what? Maybe a few hours verses a few years, not a hard choice.” You ended as they thought on what you said. Perhaps the ones that thought of the most was the predators as they seemed horrified by the prospect of what they imagined could happen to them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Captors come in.

choices: No, you use shadow clones in place of people.
Yes, they pick two that suggested they be left behind.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
As the conversation continued in their little groups you were designated to be at a corner closest to the Giant Dridder while the Faries were in the corner near the Giant Naga. You were thinking heavily on how to escape. It would have to be soon and timed just right if you wanted to save everyone else.

“What are you thinking on?” asked the Dridder as she came over and sat against the bars close to you.

“Well, Miss…?” you started, asking her name.

“Rudy” she answered. “You?”

“Max.” you responded before continuing. “Well Rudy, I was thinking on how to get all of us out of here. But it is harder than I thought. I could just get me out but you all would die.” You said.

“We would?” asked the Giant Naga to which you asked her name silently. “Carol.”

“I can read that clipboard from here. In addition to the bars and magical barrier, there is a sensor. If one of us gets past it then all of us are shocked while the one that is out is either knocked unconscious or killed but these things.” You revealed as you held up your wrist. “In the end, I could get everyone out but there is a few problems with that.”

“Why didn’t you say so before?” Asked Rudy. This conversation started to attract the others as well, especially the part about you saving all of them.

“I didn’t know, we are all thinking about it aren’t we?” you asked back then looked away as if thinking out loud. “The main problem is these damn things. They are a nuisance to say the least. I don’t know how to take them off. I’ll have to read the Doctor’s mind to get the answer. But that brings another problem. He is coming back to feed us. And at least two of us in this cell be fed to Rudy and Carol.”

“So… are you worried that you’ll be the one?” asked Carol seductively to which you just huffed with a comical smile. “What?”

“I am a Half-breed. I can go from fully human to fully dragon at will, with a great deal of pain when switching. But that requires magic, which is why I am stuck in between right now. My dragon form is 500 feet tall and I lose none of my power or abilities as a human. So let’s just say, you eating me is the last thing concerning me right now.” You said with a little growl, the information was caused them all to give you a little more room, even if they didn’t really believe it yet. “No, my point is; if I learn how to disable these things, then how am I supposed to disable the ones you eat? I am not about to be swallowed and risk being digested just to get something that you could’ve just not have eaten. With them in there, you would still be in contact with them and be restricted as such.”

“I see.” Rudy pondered.

“On the other hand, if you don’t eat whomever he says then you will be punished and be too weak to escape. The only way I see to do it is if you eat someone then bring them up and out afterwards. Come to think of it, other than that sensor and barrier, those bars on your cage are easy enough for us to pass through easily.”

“So what are you saying? That we are going to have to get eaten by one of those… monsters?” Asked an Elf with disgust. “Why don’t you just leave them here? That is what they deserve.”

“Keep that up and you’ll be my first meal.” Hissed Carol which got the woman to stick up her nose but was scared to death on the inside.

“As to answer your question. No I won’t just leave them. And I wouldn’t push too much. They can still digest you and spit up that bothersome wrist band to achieve the same effect.” You warned.

“What! Why would you save them?” asked another person but this time a black skinned Neko with the same type of thinking.

“I am a 500 foot dragon and you are arguing with me about predatory worth? I just arrived here so I can’t just go around forcing my way. Well I can but I won’t. This is how things are on this world, from what it looks like and you are all strangers. I do have a personal bias against eating people but it doesn’t mean I’ve never eaten someone before and will do so again. Don’t tempt us. As for eating each other. Why don’t we just wait until we get out? We can go our separate ways than you can eat and insult each other to your heart’s content. Until then, let’s work on getting out of here.” You responded. The predators looked relieved that you said as much and looked to agree with you.

“Hear that? After we get out of here I can hunt you down little Elf. I got your scent so don’t expect mercy from me.” Carol hissed which got the Elf to quiver into another at her folly and potential consequence.

“So is that the plan? You read the Doctor’s mind while we eat and bring back the people we eat to get the bracelets off?” asked Rudy.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Talking with the Predators.

choices: Doctor comes in and the plan works.
Plan works but the Doctor took samples.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“As entertaining as it might be to see you eat some of the more arrogant people around. I don’t think that would be a wise move. On the off chance the bracelets can attach to your insides it would make retrieving them a problem and, like I said, I am not going in after them.” You responded to which the two wondered what another option was. “However, I can use some ninja techniques to fool our good doctor into thinking as such.”

“Using what?” asked Carol in confusion.

“Just shut up and watch.” You responded. You got up then performed the shadow clone jutsu. Then each of them went over to someone. One of them went over to a neko male and another a Elf Woman, looked them over, then walked back to you. They used a transformation jutsu to turn into a believable Neko and Elf, complete with wrist bands and all. “All you need to do is eat these two instead. They are called shadow clones. More or less fake replicas of me that act as I would in their situations. I will gain the knowledge they gain when they disappear like this.” You stated and brought another out then had him poof away.

“So, we eat those then… what?” asked Carol.

“While the Doctor is in I’ll read his mind to find out how to remove these things. When that is done we’ll all be able to use magic to bust out of here… Wait, I got a better idea.” You said after thinking on it for a moment. “We will have to wait anyway to get out. So, we can wait for the Doctor to come back in the morning. He will probably bring some people with him. Once he opens the door I’ll speed over to the other side and make sure it doesn’t close. Then we’ll have a bunch of snacks for the predators and some well deserved payback for whatever they do to us in the mean time.”

“Mmm. I’m liking this plan more and more.” Carol said as she licked her lips.

“So am I?” Rudy agreed with a similar expression. “And I suppose there will be more than enough… snacks that get in our way on the way out of here.”

“You two are…” the Elf from before started but wisely stopped then thought about it. One thing about Elves, that you knew from your genetic knowledge, you didn’t want to cross one then have them live for you to regret it. “I suppose they more than deserve it.”

“Hmm. Maybe I won’t hunt you.” Carol giggled out.

“Wait, what if they have weapons? Some of us aren’t as tough as a giant predator.” Said an older human as he held onto a young child that was obviously scared and whimpering.

“I… I suppose some of you can ride on by back when I transform. But once we’re all out, we go our separate ways. I’m not flying you all to your homes or whatever. Got enough exploring to do without protecting strangers.” You answered as you scratched your head nervously.

“You weren’t bluffing about you being a dragon?” Carol asked.

“Half dragon, and no I wasn’t bluffing. Oh and if any of the people on my back decide to act arrogant and all that… well I might amend my bias against carrying you in my stomach.” You said to which you glared at a few that you had heard talking in such a tone.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: No, you use shadow clones in place of people.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Well hello there my guests. How are you all doing today?” asked the Doctor… huh, you didn’t even bother remembering his name. Well odds were that he wouldn’t be around much longer if either of the ladies had anything to say about it. He received obedient yet intensely angry glares from most of them, wrapped in fear of him using his little controller on them. “I asked a question.” He demanded with a smirk then activated the controller, sending everyone to their knees in pain. You started right away on mining his mind of not only the wrist bands but also any other information you would need; passwords, layout, guard strength, and other things that you didn’t need to know but came with the package. He seemed to be getting a kick out of causing pain, especially to nonhumans.

“We are doing just fine considering.” Panted Rudy, as she was the only one besides you and your clones that would give a decent and believable response. The man kept looking at their naked bodies, obviously lingering on the human parts of interest and not subtly either. You could see most of them that were looked at in this way restraining from giving him a piece of their mind. Any hesitation on his soon to be fate were disregarded at this point, even but the children and especially from Carol, who had to bite her lip to keep from either yelling at him or licking her lips. You could see in her eyes that she was measuring him up. On the outside it seemed seductive and sexually suggestive but you knew that look all too well. The look of a predator eyeing up future prey.

“That’s good. Well all the other staff will be here in the morning so that is when we’ll start the tests. Unfortunately they are also the ones that bring the food for the… other food.” The Doctor said with a pause and grin as if egging someone to say something to allow him to punish them all again. You decided it would be a perfect way to get your clones picked as meals so they stood forward from each group.

“That’s unfair!” Your Neko clone said, a classic and one that the Doctor was expecting. Carol and Rudy looked at you slightly so not to arise suspicion to which you winked at them. Thankfully they understood as the Doctor hit the button again, causing all of you to writhe in pain.

“You can’t feed us to them if you aren’t feeding us in return.” Said your Elf Clone as if pleading but got the same result. You used your mind power, as you were downloading his memory, to give him an idea.

“Oh really, I think you two just volunteered.” The Doctor stated and hit another button to which they were lifted by the bracelets as if they were being pulled up by wire. It would’ve hurt a lot so the two clones started acting the part. They begged and pleaded for him not to do it as they were brought remarkably through the bars and into the Giant predators’ cells then dropped a ways in front of each Carol and Rudy. Your clones gave a wink to each that only they could see before buttering it up more. Typical prey speech that you had heard over and over again. Things that were so convincing it had the children in your cell crying, forgetting what they were. To be fair you didn’t explain it as well as you should’ve. But they did a hell of a job acting.

“Well eat up girls, I love this part.” He said as he signaled Carol to start first with a threat of the controller to further command her. She decided to add to the show and played with your clone by dangling him over her open mouth by his Neko tail while he begged pathetically. She smiled a little, unclear to you if it was a fake or real smile, then dropped him in. She tasted him for a while then made a show of her gulping him down, still struggling to give the man less reason to not like the show.

“You’re next sweet heart. And none of that cocoon stuff while it is just me in here. I like seeing them squirm.” He demanded.

“As you wish. I’m sorry young lady, but this is going to hurt a bit.” She said to which your Elf woman clone screamed and similarly begged in a very believable sense. You had watched enough sacrifices to know what worked and what the perverted men in the villages liked to hear. You kept it real enough to Rudy’s comforting to be believable and highly entertaining, as evidence to the tent growing in the Doctor’s pants. Rudy slowly brought your clone up and wasted no time shoving her into her mouth, tasting her a little then swallowing. The clone worked hard to be noticed on the way down. “Was that satisfactory?”

“Very, almost making me want to come in there to hear them scream in pain while they digest. But maybe another time. You two have a good night… oh and the rest of you… I hope you had a good look at what is in store for you.” The Doctor stated as he gathered his things and headed out rather rushed. Most understood why as he pushed around the tent in his pants from being uncomfortable. As soon as he shut and sealed the door they all looked at you.

“Was all that necessary?” asked Rudy, speaking of your clone’s theatrics.

“Well I was trying to get him out of the room as quick as possible. Any less entertaining for him and he might’ve fed more to the two of you until he reached the point of the need to jack off. I thought I did rather well, maybe a little over the top but still. It worked didn’t it and I hope I didn’t taste too bad… which reminds me.” You concluded with a hand sign that made the two clones disappear. The experiences came to you as well and you found that it wasn’t the most terrible thing in the world to get eaten. You had taken them out before digestion started, thank goodness.

“You were delicious, for a Neko.” Carol replied.

“Yes, I suppose you did well and did taste rather good.” Rudy reluctantly agreed.

“Ok, can we get off the subject of being eaten?” Asked that same damn Elf that was not rubbing you a good way. “Did you get what you needed or not?”

“I did, I simply need to match and clone each of your bodies then sinc the frequency with the bracelet you have on. After that the bracelet can be removed and still be reading that you are attached to it, via the cloned arm. We can throw those anywhere and they’ll disappear once I’m out of here. This will also keep the rest of us from being shocked while they are being removed.” You answered.

“Then let’s do it, time’s a wasting.” Said the Elf. You shook your head a little then got to work. It would not be so easy and you could use a rest before the morning. So getting all them made and separated should be done as quick as possible.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Doctor comes in and the plan works.

choices: They can't open the cages from this room, too bad for them.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Hey, Max…” came a voice as you woke. You had successfully replaced and removed all their wrist bands but then took a nap to regain some strength. The voice was Rudy’s as she was the only one that was hazarding getting anywhere near you. Although you had warned them multiple times in advance, when you decided to change to a dragon and escape that way, they got as far away from you as possible. Even with you outside the cages they didn’t like it very much. However, due to your size, you were in between the ‘food’ cage and Rudy’s. With their magic back you expected them to start some trouble. But even with all their differences they all had one thing in common, a healthy fear of what you would do to them if they disregarded your request to not cause each other trouble.

“Yes?” you asked as you rose you head and yawned. You didn’t even have to check to know that such an action always freaked people out. But, as you beginning to just accept, they would be freaked out wither you yawned or just sat there. So you didn’t really care if they added to the feeling they were already feeling.

“It is almost morning. You asked to be woken so you could get ready.” Rudy responded with a whimper in her voice.

“Thank you Rudy.” You said back to her with a smile but not showing any teeth. You didn’t know what you preferred more. This aura of conflict or the relative peace you had in the previous realm. True you didn’t have anyone fear you like usual but you were getting unbelievably board. After fighting dragons, ninja, knights, and all that. To just… sit there and play cards, even holographic ones with souls attached, was just too… yeah boring. A rumble hit the air and they all looked at you.

“What was that?” asked Carol, not really wanting to hear the answer or hoping it wasn’t what she already knew it to be.

“I haven’t eaten in… 5 days and before that it was a human sized sandwich. Guess I’m getting a little hungry.” You said as you straightened a little into a more sitting position. You noticed that they all seemed deathly afraid that you were referring to them as the food to rectify that problem. “I told you before, I don’t eat people like that. Although… I may have a few of the guards on the way out. And if one of those guards happens to be giant sized then… well you all might want to look away at that point. I’m not like a Naga, that I can just swallow something that big down.”

“Well, as long as it isn’t us… and I won’t have any problem with letting you have a few snacks.” Carol said perhaps more bluntly than she should’ve. But you gave her credit for saying ‘us’ rather than ‘Me’. You could also see a natural agreement from the room. That Doctor definitely didn’t make too many friends.

Before any of you could converse further the lights brightened and the door started to open. The others looked at you to which you used a cloaking jutsu to become near invisible. They were half between scared and glad at this to which they couldn’t see or sense you at all as you moved around to the incoming ‘staff’. As the Doctor had said, there were more than just humans. There was nekos, elves, and even a few really small looking people that were maybe 3 inches tall. You maneuvered yourself and with a bit of genjutsu and magic you dematerialized the door but made it look otherwise secured. The door was big enough to fit you through its frame, probably for machines or something to help bring in predators or build the place to begin with. However you still had an emotional drain on eating them. You saw no other option, as they were all at the Doctor’s level or worse but you weren’t sure if you could just gulp them down either.

“Well, how are my girls this morning?” asked the Doctor to which he got glares to his smirking face that seemed to be what he was after to begin with. “Lively as ever I see.”
