“Yes, we are doing well.” Rudy said more formally. It was becoming clear to you that while Dridders were the more aggressive they were also the more respectable as well. Probably had something to do with them balancing on eight small points all the time.

Her grey skin didn’t look alien on her with the designs that, for anyone else, would look like tattoos. The black markings blended with her black haired bottom half and equally shadow like hair on her head that reached her upper back in a loose but straight style. Like most predators of this apparent realm you were in, her body was very fit but not without its curves and relative voluptuous appeal. It was probably one of many things that gave predators an edge when hunting humans or like creatures. They were high in physical attractiveness. Her eyes were almost a Pinkish red that didn’t come near your Glowing blood red color but were noticeable against her darkened features. Lastly her teeth and fangs looked almost like a vampire’s but more primal and elegant, probably because she didn’t have to hide them like Vampires did.

“I suppose some breakfast will do you some good.” He said with a smirk as he looked at the assortment of choices in the ‘food’ cage. Idiot didn’t even notice their bracelets were off. He just trusted his little device that said you all did. “So who would like to volunteer this time?”

You let out an ominous growl that shook the room and made the bars rattle at the suggestion. It was half out of reflex from doing so when a dragon was asking the same question all those years ago. But to this the Doctor looked around to find the source, as did everyone else. The others that were in the cages knew it was you but it didn’t make them any more calm after such a noise. It definitely didn’t inspire a calm response. It was designed to scare Dragons and did more than that with those… a little lest physically inclined than that target.With that you spit some fire needles out at a majority of the lights so that it was darker in the room but still enough to more than see what was going on.

“What the hell is going on here?!” the Doctor exclaimed, raising his controller then hitting the button but, as they weren’t wearing the devices they didn’t do anything but break the cloned arms you used. When he noticed this he made a break for the door, which you were blocking as you laid down. He ran smack into your side, as did some of the others while they nervously looked behind at the predators and prisoners that were no longer under their control. You dispelled the cloaking jutsu slowly so they could react to you as you came back into their visual spectrum. “Whoa!!!” The Doctor and a few other said as the stumbled back into the middle of the room, not wanting to get too close to the other cages but got as far away from you as they could in the increasingly small space as you revealed yourself.

“First one to deactivate the doors gets a running start.” You said with as small growl afterwards. This sprung the Doctor into action, pushing the others out of his way but you flattened your tail and pointed it at him to which everyone stopped as the razor sharp and giant appendage was extended just in front of the Doctor’s throat. “Except you. You have a date with a pissed off Naga.”

“Wait we can work something out can’t we?” The Doctor begged but before he could add to his suggestion a long spongy surface wrapped around him and pulled him slowly.

It took a minute with the new lighting for everyone to see that the surface was Carol’s tongue and she was reeling him in towards her open mouth with an audible “Ah…” to further make his destination clear. Thankfully she pulled him slow enough to cause the look everyone in the cages wanted while fast enough to have him sealed away in her mouth before he could scream and beg with his annoyingly arrogant voice.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You escape as a dragon.

choices: You all get out easy enough.
The Tomthumb you let go raises the alarm.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
While this was going on you saw a small little man running toward the table. He was one of the 3 inch people. Everyone else was watching in horror as the Doctor was sucked into Carol’s mouth. They seemed frozen as they heard muffled screams and begging from beneath the blissfully smiling lips of the giant figure. Carol smiled and hummed as she savored the human, even through his cloths. The only thing about it that didn’t make you growl again was that the man was scum and now he was going to be turned to the very thing he had been living a life of. She played with him a while then slowly swallowed the fighting man, letting his descent further horrify those that could follow him, even those in the cage.

However the Tomthumb had just reached the top of the console to which he hopped around the keys to activate them. You memorized the sequence then he jumped onto an enter button that opened all the doors behind you in the facility and then pulled the bars of the cages from their place in the floor, up and into the ceiling through the holes that they came from. This snapped the group out of the horrified shock and started to panic, even the ones that were in the cage. The two giant predators were fee after all and the fairies joined them at that size making 5 giant sized people besides you in the room. But you weren’t going to wait for them to have this little game. So you snarled loudly with teeth bared at them, all of them. They may have been scared out of their minds of the man eating predators around them but they were more afraid of the dragon more than 5 times any of the giant’s size.

“Now.” You started with a little growl in your voice but still letting your teeth show and eyes flare. “Those that are breaking out are ALL going to get out of here, ALIVE and not in ANYONE’S stomach. I promised as much and anyone that tempts the predators by antagonizing them will be going in my stomach, which is where any predator will go if the eat those I’ve promised to free. As for you people…” you said as you finished giving the previous prisoners very intense glares that forbid any attempt at argument. They your eyes rested on the group of people you had already cleared as people worth of an end in a stomach. They were each just as bad or worse than the Doctor that was already in Carol’s stomach.

“I don’t get eaten either right?” asked the Tomthumb out of turn to which your gaze rested solely on him.

“I said you get a running start, so start running.” You growled. He staggered for a moment but then raced out as you lifted a portion of your tail to show a hole big enough for him to fit after which you dropped your tail over the spot again. “As for the rest of you. You have two options. Your first is choose the predator you want to eat you and get eaten the way they want. Or you can panic and I’ll eat you. Word of warning, I don’t swallow my food whole. I like a wiggling and bleeding meal if you get me drift.” You said to which your stomach growled to make your point that you were hungry as well.

You fully expected to eat one as they were facing certain death. So you glared at them from your spot but finally one of them made a break for the same area as the Tomthumb used. You snapped the woman up using a few teeth to impale her in nonvital areas but enough to cause a generous amount of splatter. Your aim was to get the rest to be too afraid of you eating them to try anything. Seeing the woman’s bloody and screaming form before you flipped her into your mouth then swallowed was all it took to quell any other thoughts. Even though you impaled her with a tooth to make it quick you used your magic to move her as she went down. Definitely a worse way to go then digesting in a stomach alive was to be full of holes and being digested alive.

You licked your lips a little to get the blood off and that got the rest of them to quickly move toward their chosen predators. The display was horrific enough to secure their cooperation and the relative mercy of the predators despite them eating them. The Tomthumbs that were left went to some of the nekos and each giant predator got a few.

“Ok, we ready to move out now?” you asked in a comparatively gentle voice from the one you used earlier. It was a big enough change that they didn’t want do anything to invoke the previous side of you.

“Yes, let’s get out of here.” Carol stated, eager as the rest of them to get out of this cage within a cage.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: A Tomthumb opens the cages.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
No one really got in your way after you blew a breath of flames down the hall. All the doors were opened because of the Tomthumb that did so and you were glad he did such. The doors were designed to keep predators from getting in or out. So they would’ve been a pain to force open. Finally you emerged from the complex into a field that was just before an enormous wooded area. For the first time, the trees were taller than you were. Well not the first time but the first time since you were at full size. Usually on worlds like the others there was nothing really your size… except the buildings in the last one. Not only were they tall but they were also wide. You had a problem, even when you hunted, of toppling trees over because of you size. It was a wonderful sight to see that you could walk through the forest in dragon form without worry of damaging it… too much.

“Is there something wrong?” asked Rudy as they saw you rush over and circle around, taking in the area as much as you could. You weren’t sure if a flight was the best idea yet but from the extremely enriching ground and dirt to the wonderful smelling air, you were on a sensory overload.

“This place, it is… wonderful. It smells so…” you started as you took a visual sniff of the air “No smoke, no exhaust, not too much blood, it’s just natural and rich. Everything is so filled of life, not like the broken worlds I’ve been on.” You finished, looking down and digging 5 trenches as you raked your claws in the dirt, feeling the enriched soil around them felt very relaxing and almost magical.

“Maybe it’s wonderful for you. For the rest of us, everything wants to eat us.” Said a cross neko as the smaller group members stood just in front of the entrance of the complex they just got out of.

“Hey, don’t ruin it for him.” Carol scolded as she bent down to give them all a stern look but when she looked up she noticed the damage was already done. You looked into the forest and saw many things in it that would more than willingly consume a human sized or even giant sized meal. Most of them not being sentient but some, like the giant beings you just saved, were. The reason why there was minimal blood in the air was that most didn’t chew their food, they preferred things as small as humans or such things to just swallow down whole. But thankfully there was a few things like enlarged plants and wild animals that you could eat that didn’t have a sentient mind attached to it.

“Well, I guess this is where we all split ways. I have a lot to explore. Does anyone want me to drop them off somewhere? I don’t know where I am going but you point me in the right direction and I can fly you there.” You offered.

“No offense, but we would prefer getting away from anything that COULD eat us. We’ve only known you for a day so you fit the category.” Said the mage.

“I guess that makes sense. Just at least let me do this.” you said then materialized clothes and outfits that they had in the back of their minds so they were clothed, well accept the predators. They didn’t seem to have any clothes in mind. You wondered if all predators were like that. But that would also make sense. Not a lot of people could make a shirt for a 100 foot tall naga that could withstand a life in the jungle, much less a wardrobe of them with other human coverings. “Didn’t think you would like traveling through the jungle in nothing, especially the humans, elves, nekos, and children.”

“Uh, what about us? You said we couldn’t eat them until we were all free.” Carol asked as she looked down at the group of people. The group got nervous set of expressions.

“At least let them have a decent head start. I mean if they were going to be eaten anyway I would’ve just waited to free us until they were all eaten in there.” You replied as you nodded to the complex you all just escaped. “You don’t have to take them anywhere but… what would be a fair time to wait?”

“A few days I suppose.” Rudy said as she thought with her hand under her chin.

“Will that work?” you asked the small group. Your direct attention was a little unnerving for them but most nodded dumbly. “Ok then, I won’t hunt you but they will wait for 2 days while you get to whatever safety you can find or whatever. Not sure if there is any places like that around here though… guess that is the point of exploring.” With that you backed up a little then exploded to turn back to human form. You used some chakra to clear the smoke and debris away so they didn’t have to look away except as a reflex.

“Why’d you change to human?” asked Rudy as she looked and didn’t see even your dragon parts.

“Well, for starters I’m hungry and I need less food in human form. That and I can sneak around easier like this and I don’t lose any power in this form so I thought it would be an interesting point of view so I can see what this world is like. If I am a huge dragon then things that most people know about will avoid me. I should really check out what this world is like before I debate staying here or not. Got any suggestions on things I should see as a tourist?” You answered.

“I… well you could always check out the human settlements. Negav would be the best if you’re going for maximum human exposure and they may have some maps for you to look at. But… predators can’t go in there because of the magic that keeps us away. Another option is looking but Vivian. She has a good knowledge of things… but not usually sought out by human sized people.” Rudy answered as she seemed the only one able to speak at the moment. But she seemed to be nervously trying to get you away from her, despite her towering over you now.

“Well, which is the closest?” You asked, using that as an indicator to where to start.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You all get out easy enough.

choices: You show her both human and dragon form.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
The answer Rudy gave was not one the rest of the human sized people liked to hear. Apparently you were very close to some place called, ‘Chordoni Waterfall’, which was the home of Vivian more or less. You could actually hear the Waterfall from where you originally which was proof on how large it was. With a final warning about Vivan and the nature of Felarya the said goodbye to you and you walked off into the forest.

Immediately you were almost eaten a few times by the plants and what not. Even the group had a mouth, which was weird as you wondered how a mouth in the ground had such white teeth. Was there a ground dentist or something? You decided to save that bad joke for later. Perhaps it was the naturally rich and life filled aura of the place but everything that wasn’t being eaten was in almost perfect health. No cancer, not even that many scars or blemishes. Understandably they were also extremely fit, as running for your life every day would probably keep a person, human or otherwise, in shape. Even though it bothered you about the eating other people you didn’t interfere when you saw it. You on the other hand found some tree bark and some kind of deer looking thing that you ate to replenish your strength.

“Wow” you said when you finally got there. You were perched on a high tree that looked over the area in front of the Waterfall but not the colossal sight itself. It was as if the water came from nowhere and just magically fell down over the beautiful scenery of the falls themselves. The light that came over the mist couldn’t just create one rainbow so it looked as if a rainbow had a kid and it was the area over and immediately around the falls. Subtle enough to not notice without looking but enough to look for it. You had seen many things in the worlds you visited and from every angle but this was the most beautiful sight you had ever seen. You simply couldn’t stop staring at the sight for a period of a day. It worked out because no one was there at the moment.

So you changed to what you were now referring to as your half-breed form and entered the area, thinking that this ‘Vivian’ person could be anywhere or hiding. Not that many things could hide from your gaze as a dragon but still you didn’t want to intrude on her home while she was taking a shower or something equally as awkward. You walked around for a bit then laid on a small incline that faced the Falls so you could be surrounded but the mist that was coming off. Not much of a mist at that distance but it felt good against the slightly humid environment of the jungle. You had watched the Waterfalls all day and night so you slowly fell asleep to the sounds of the running water and the pleasant aura that was currently around you. You had never before been so surrounded by life. The very ground under you seemed to be generating life in a way you had never felt. To the point where you had to check where you walked. You were afraid that some part of the ground would be alive as well and you didn’t want to harm it if that was the case. For the first time you slept and didn’t have a nightmare. You were completely at peace with your tail swaying and wings flexing as you left them stretched out to absorb both the rich ground under you and the rich sensations from around you from being in the mist and pleasant air.

“Well this is a pleasant surprise.” Said a singsong voice that woke you from a pleasant bliss. You didn’t have a dream but rather just a feeling of utter belonging as you floated in your dream state, like floating in a sea of pleasant emotions. The voice wasn’t an unpleasant one so you simply opened your dragon eyes and looked at a face that was looking down at you from behind, making her face inverted while you lay on the ground, inverted but giant like Carol’s.

“Hi, ditto.” You replied up to her.

“Ditto?” she asked as she didn’t understand the term.

“Oh, It was a creature on a world I went to that could replicate any person or animal no matter the size or detail, even abilities to a certain level. So it became a word to describe a like sentiment or description that was being returned so someone didn’t have to repeat the same thing to the person that said it to them.” You explained to which she looked to be taking in the new information then seductively smiled. Rudy was right, she did like to be sensual in her persona. Most people were subtle about such things. She just dove right into it. “You’re face wasn’t the worst way to wake up nor was it unpleasant to fall asleep to the one already provided. My name is Max by the way. I’m going to assume you are the infamous Vivian.”

“I’m infamous?” she asked in a teasing tone.

“Well, I’ve only been in this world for a few days and everyone seems to know you. I escaped mercenary research lab with a Giant Naga and Giant Dridder and they both suggested I come here if I want answers on this world rather than blindly exploring.” You responded then decided it was a bad idea to continue the conversation in a reclined position so you sprung up then turned to more formally address her as you flexed your wings and let your tail do as it willed.

“Well if you know about me, isn’t fair for me to know about you?” she asked in a suggestive manner. You could feel magic in the air trying to do something to you. You couldn’t tell what it was, it was a very complex spell that you didn’t know what to do with so you just repelled it.

“Of course, I suppose I should start out with information if I wish to gain any.” You agreed. “I am known as a half-breed. One half is obviously human while the other is dragon. I’m also a fully trained ninja and know a little magic.” You rattled off. Usually saying such things made you feel sorrowful but something about this place just didn’t let you feel bad in that way.

“Dragon, that is one I haven’t seen a lot of. I dare say I haven’t seen a bite sized dragon before, half-breed aside. And it seems you are repelling my charm spell. What an intriguing little snack you are.” She stated as she laid down on her side so her tail was curled around the area in front of her with you in it as well as her chest and front toward you.

“I guess everyone on this world likes eating people my size, well accept other people my size or smaller. But I really don’t want to transform to stop you. Hmm…” You stated as she smiled. You couldn’t tell if she was smiling to seduce you or because you would be a tasty and lively snack, if you let her eat you.

“Transforming? You may be more entertaining than I thought. Can you show me? Please? I really want to see.” She almost begged/pouted but in an almost sexual way to use her feminine charm to coax you to do as she willed.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Vivian

choices: She picks you up and you become friends.
She tricks you into her stomach. She is rather persuasive.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Well… is it ok if I just go to full human? You see, my kind go from full human or full dragon. As you can see, I can just dragon parts in human form and don’t lose any of my power in either form. Useful since a dragon body isn’t really good at using spells and other things like that and as human I can do stuff like this.” you explained then turned and breathed a huge amount of fire that blasted a 600 foot pillar into the sky before dissipating.

“What was that little Max?” Vivian asked in her sensual attitude. You wondered as she traced her finger along you’re body and tail then wings if she was scared or hiding it really well. She was visually curious but otherwise not effected by the display of power.

“Flame breath, basic stuff for a dragon really. Actually that was about at a light sneeze level. Not very powerful but enough to scare the crap out of a tree lady that tried to eat me.” You answered.

“You used flames on a Dryad?” she asked in a suddenly more stern voice.

“The flames didn’t touch her. She was just too persistent after I warned her what I could do. So I used and illusion and my flame breath to give her a good scare. Amazing what a presumed near death experience can do for the learning process. But she is fine, a little shaken, but fine with not even a burn on her lovely branches.” You replied, noticing that once you said it she came back to a more playful and cheery persona.

“I see. So why don’t you want to go to full dragon?” she asked to which you retracted your dragon parts just too keep her eyes sparkling. You didn’t know why but you loved to see that in the predators around here.

“Well, it is insanely painful. I have been through a lot in my life. Most of which I don’t wish to repeat. But nothing even comes close to the physical pain I go through when I transform from dragon to human or the other way around. I have to go from this to a 500 foot tall dragon. That means my body has to literally rip itself apart to do it. I don’t know if you have ever felt such a thing as your stomach being ruptured but it isn’t fun. Nor is it enjoyable growing lungs, a new heart, scales, and not to mention the size difference.” You tried to explain to which you shook your body in a massive shiver from the memory. Then you’re eyes lit up as you remembered your duel disk. “Hey, I can show you what I look like though, without transforming if you want.” You offered.

“How?” Vivian asked, now really interested. She seemed to have been hit by her own past memories when you said as much about yours. She was now more sympathetic looking towards you. And it seemed like she knew exactly what you were talking about in regards to a stomach rupture. You didn’t know if you should be sad for her or glad she was so accepting and civil… for the moment.

“Well, on the last world I was on. They played this card game that brought monsters to life through playing cards. Their essence was connected to them but were otherwise just holograms; holograms being illusions of things using technology instead of magic. Anyway, as a… well dragon, they made a whole series on me. Most of them are just holograms now, as they are another world away, but I can still show you the one they made of me. That way you can see what I look like without me transforming.” You explained as she listened to you. It almost seemed like she wasn’t listening and just looking with a… well the best way to describe it was a caring lust. But you could tell she was overly curious at this point. Wither he outward demeanor would admit it or not, she loved knowing stuff.

“Sure, it may be entertaining. You are certainly starting to be more interesting by the minute. I don’t think I can eat you… but maybe later.” She said with a suggestive wink as she laid her head on her hands to watch you more closely. She was obviously expecting something small. Her eyes brightened when you protruded your duel disk and drew your card. You were about to put the card down but then hesitated. “What’s the matter?”

“Uh, you might want to back up a little bit. Don’t worry, I won’t run.” You revealed. She humored you with a eyebrow raise as she put her tail behind her and backed up a little. Then rested her head on her hands as it was being propped up by her elbows. You then placed the card on the disk. Immediately you could feel a resonance with the card as it activated. Artificial and real clouds began forming overhead then a loud roar came from them as your dragon hologram came out of them and landed behind you, towering over both you and her. She fell back as your hologram landed and roared again then flexed your wings in a highly intimidating stance before you took control over the normal card functions and had your hologram sit properly.

“This… that is you?” Vivian asked to which you nodded. She was on edge but not as much as you would expect. Just to be sure you brought your dragon parts out again. She could definitely see the resemblance of the tail, wings, and eyes. Eyes were the big one. Hard to miss large glowing red dragon eyes. “This is that hologram thing you were saying?”

“Yes, although it has part of my essence in it so I can control it. Otherwise the game has him… me… or however you want to call him, snarling and all that. Just theatrics to make the game more entertaining.” You brought the holograms head down and waved your hand through it to show her. “See, just a hologram. It can do little more than cause a little wind. Or distraction. I did bring out a giant a day ago to scare a few wolves off.”

“Just an illusion… I mean hologram?” She asked as she got up and cautiously approached, towering over your real body then waving a hand through the image. She then got playful and kissed the hologram on the snout to which you got a little bashful, in both forms. “Then how does he react to me?” she asked, seeing your shy reaction to her advance, despite not feeling it.

“I already said.” You said through the hologram this time which got her to reel back a little before remembering it couldn’t hurt her. “My essence is linked to this card. I can see through his eyes and control his actions. Otherwise this is what the game does when I release control.” You answered as the image huffed, shook its head, then started to creep and snarl at her. She was visually scared of the image as it did look very real. When it roared again at her she shook a little, whimpering to which you turned your duel disk off and put it and the card away.

“How can that be a game?” she asked.

“Well, usually it is played with two people that have the monsters fight each other and all that. But can you really not think of anyone that you wouldn’t mind seeing scared for fun. They do look rather real so a dragon even a fifth that size roaring at someone could get them to fall over as a prank.” You suggested to which she grinned at the thought as she seemed to be coming up with a list as you spoke. You retracted your dragon parts again to which came over and…
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: You show her human form.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“So all that power is packaged into this cute little body.” She concluded as she picked you up, carefully then held you in her open and upturned hand so you were standing on her palm. It was relatively hard to balance without your tail out but it seemed she was rather experienced at dealing with smaller beings. You didn’t need to be told where most of those smaller ones went. She brought you to her face level so she could more easily observe you with her curious and almost naturally erotic gaze. As if she was just born to be sexually suggestive looking.

“So… what do you think. It is ok if you are scared and want me to leave. I am use to it.” You said as you sat down with a plop, looking down and away from her gaze. After all, Carol was a Naga just as big as Vivian and she didn’t want anything to do with you.

“And what if I wanted to eat you?” she asked, as if asking if you wanted such a thing.

“Then I would have to run again. Either that, or my instinct would take over and start trying to burn or slash my way out. I’ve been eaten a few times, even as a child, ah… what a mess. I smelled like the insides of the things I killed for months. I just used my tail and…” you answered as you brought it out flattened it to show her how sharp it was, then retracted it. “Well you get the idea. But as far as just playing around… I’m just not ready for that yet. As a large dragon I… I just have bad memories on both sides of that situation that I would rather not revisit. At least no right now.”

“Hey, are you crying?” she asked. Obviously she didn’t get that too often. She probably either got moans or giggles, judging from her personality. But sorrowful crying like you were doing was probably not a regularly seen thing. You weren’t crying much but a few tears did drop on her hand. Honestly you were surprised she could feel them as your face was downcast so she wouldn’t be able to see them. You wiped your eyes to pathetically hide your tears from her. “I was only trying to change the mood. If it really bothers you that much I won’t suggest it again.”

“Um… thanks.” You replied, still too afraid of rejection to look her in the eyes. She wasn’t having any of that as she used a single finger to raise your head to meet her gaze. She made you keep the gaze up until your head wasn’t falling down on its own anymore. She had a concerned and caring look on her face and in her eyes for a while until she changed back to her usual self.

“There is just one thing though.” She said as she brought up her fingers for you to rest your back against. “You do know what this world is like, right?”

“I assume you mean about the prey/predator system.” You stated.

“Indeed. I promise not to ask to eat you or you to eat someone else until you say you are ready. However, that is the way it works here and most will live by that. It is a eat or be eaten world and everyone thinks they shouldn’t be eaten. Do you understand?” She asked you as she gazed down at you and you up at her.

“I may not like it. But, I’ll accept it. I won’t push my views on you or the others and I’ll let you know if someone is off limits as family or something. The worlds I just came from… well let’s just say they have ways of finding me. So if my adopted human family comes in here to find me and gets eaten, that could be a problem. Here, I’ll even transform into them for you so you know what they look like.” You replied. She looked at you with confusion as you stood and transformed into every person you knew from the other realms.

“You can’t expect me to remember all of them.” she stated.

“No, it was just a reference so if something stands out to you than just ask before eating. The headband symbol or the funny outfits. Some have monster cards and some are just weird and you’d know them when you saw them. Most of the ones that could make it here could fight you off if push came to shove. Might be distracted but could, especially the guys. You are rather beautiful you know.” You complimented at the end to which she blushed a little but otherwise put on a ‘I know’ face with a pleasant smile.

“I understand. I can’t wait to show you to the others.” She said as she brought you close after you sat back down and gave you a kiss. The kiss almost covered your whole body but you didn’t mind. As a dragon it bridged the awkward meter as far as her sexual acts were concerned but your human half still understood so you blushed a little. It wasn’t every day you get kissed by a Giant beauty like Vivan. Although, you suspected it would happen a lot more if you hung out with her from now on.

“Others?” you asked.

“Oh don’t worry. You’ll love them. Maybe I can get you to scare some of them with that toy of yours.” She suggested to which she giggled as you smirked an ‘I told you so’ look to her.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She picks you up and you become friends.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
You slept in a curled up position in dragon form near the Falls. Originally you wanted to remain as a human but Vivian had explained that, unless you were ok with random predators eating you while you slept, that it was a bad idea. It became evident when a Harpy snatched you up. The winged beauty didn’t get very far before you used a substitution jutsu but it got the point across. So you remained in Dragon form. It wasn’t all bad. You got to hunt and the jungle was more your size anyway. It took a while for Vivian to get use to you but she used sexual situations to test and get closer to you. Eventually, within a week or so she was generally ok with having you around. In that week you built another vault. But with her help, you made the door a magic one. Basically you used the portal and dimension magic/jutsu to make the vault door accessible anywhere you summoned it. You still had to materialize the structure and power source but it was done and stocked with things to help you train or store your ninja and dueling gear. It was also a great place to research the portal jutsu and set up an anchor point to teleport to. You were beginning to like it here, a lot. For the sake of argument you had tried sleeping elsewhere in Felarya but you were plunged back into your usual nightmares. So the spot right next to the falls was the spot that you migrated to. It was the one place you could get a good sleep and rest. As of this moment, physically, you’ve never felt better.

“Hello… time to wake up sleepy head.” Said the unmistakable voice of Vivian as you were pulled from your pleasant dreams.

You felt a pressure on your body as she attempted to lay on top of you. This was her usual wake up call. She would either attempt to coil around you or just lay on top of you in a highly suggestive manner. She would then lay her head on yours and hug into your neck. At first you were worried about your spikes on her soft skin. But then you realized that while the predators, such as her, looked dainty, beautiful, and tender… they were called predators for a reason. The land of Felarya and being able to survive in it didn’t allow for one’s body to become a weak or frail shell. They were tuff and deceptively dangerous, especially to prey, hunting and surviving in Felarya for hundreds of years does wonders for their disposition. However, despite the danger of both the world and them in it, they remained innocent and mostly kind. Sure each predator had their own personality but there were not many that were evil. Sure they ate humans or other sentient stuff, but nothing like the dragons you hated so much on your home world. It was simply a way of life in this world, not one you shared but one you tolerated.

“Good morning Vivian.” You said without even opening your eyes. You felt her hug increase as he coils cycled on top of your body and around your wings.

“I have someone I’d like you to meet, a friend of mine.” She said in gentle voice as she laid her head on yours. But as she felt you begin to move she draped off and slithered away slightly. You stretched out after she got off. Your wings flexed and let out an enormous yawn before shaking any sleep out of you. It felt good to be fully rested. You finally opened your eyes and looked around as you laid down in a relaxed but proper position, more of a seating position but without standing on your front legs.

“Eeek!” exclaimed a light voice as you looked over at Vivian and another Naga she had by her side. Her coils were primarily teal with yellow underbelly. Fair skin, blonde hair, bluish teal eyes and a very innocent look on her face. But one look at her and you could tell that she was a very established hunter and by the scent she loved eating humans as much as or probably more than Vivian. As was the case in most of Felarya, the more beautiful they are the more deadly and dangerous.

“Max, you’re scaring her.” Vivian scolded to which you ducked your head like a puppy would.

“I’m sorry. I didn’t mean to. I just look scary.” You replied with your head lower to the ground and not showing your teeth as you talked. You found that hadn’t changed. Even Vivian was slightly unnerved by the large deadly teeth in your jaws. It got worse if she had just seen you eat. She knew that you tended to use those teeth rather than her way of swallowing things whole and alive.

“Oh, don’t worry Max. I like the way you look.” Vivian said as she came closer and put a hand on your snout. Unlike the people you use to know that would do such a thing, her hand could cover the tip of your snout. You were so use to humans doing it that it took some getting used to. But in the end you liked that you didn’t have to worry about hurting her when she did something like that. You raised your head and nuzzled her a little. She giggled before waving her friend over.

“Nice draggie…” she cooed in a childish way that added to her innocent looking demeanor. She had a hand out like a child inching her way to pet you. Eventually her hand made contact to which Vivian helped her get closer.

“This is Crisis. She is a good friend of mine, really good.” She said the last part had a little extra suggestive tone to it. You could guess that they did more than just talk when they hung out. Vivian had a way of bringing someone out of their shell in a sensual manner, usually for a time of pleasure but she wasn’t as shallow as to limit a visit to only a pleasure visit. However her persona did give that vibe out. They had stopped petting you so you could talk properly but were still pretty close.

“Crisis? That is a very interesting name. I’m sure I’ll remember it. And a friend of Vivian’s, no wonder why you’re so beautiful.” You complimented, making her blush in a cute fashion. “I’m Max, and as you can see, I’m a dragon.”

“Hi, you look really cool.” She said with a large smile as she tried to maintain her composure but was obviously bad at keeping her emotions a secret.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Meeting the others.

choices: She gets motion sickness, who knew?
She love flying so she loves you.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Would it help if I were a human?” you asked to which she got a both excited and confused face to replace her blushed one. This was no act, she truly was an innocent, childlike, and very beautiful person. All her little attitudes matched her person very well. It masked her dangerous side and food preference nicely and probably contributed to many meals, similar to Vivian’s hunting method but without the spells.

“You can be a human?!” Crisis asked excitedly. You couldn’t figure out what she liked more, that you could do something like that, or the tasty human part. But with the faint movements and yelling coming from her mid section you hoped that the hunger part would wait.

“Hmm. I thought you didn’t want to transform. That it hurt too much.” Vivian asked teasingly.

“It hurts?” asked Crisis, obviously not liking the idea from that point of view. Despite her food choices, she didn’t appear to like being the cause of harm to others. Felarya was definitely a weird place. In your home, if someone ate a human than they were evil. But here they could be as innocent as a baby and still eat someone.

“It does hurt a lot. But if it makes it easier than… I can. I have rested more than enough to change a few times. And as long as you don’t plan on eating me, I won’t mind being a human for a while.” You answered.

“But how can you be a human when you’re a big dragon?” asked Crisis.

“I’m like you. A Naga is like a half snake, half human. Well I’m a half dragon, half human. But I can go from full dragon to full human instead of trapped in between like you are.” You tried to explain, in terms she may understand. See seemed to get it… mostly.

“But why would you want to be a tasty human instead of a big dragon. You’d get eaten easier as a human.” Crisis asked, still confused how or why you can/would do such a thing.

“Because sometimes it helps. I get all my power as a dragon when I go to human. I can even grow wings to fly and eyes to see better. I’m just as strong. It is also fun to pull pranks on other predators as a human. They think I’m a helpless human then I can do all kinds of fun stuff.” You explained. She seemed to chime in on the prank part but still was slightly confused by the whole thing. Vivian gave a signal to you that said it was all she was going to understand.

“Why don’t we skip to the fun part.” Vivian suggested to which you smiled and Crisis cocked her head in confusion. You found everything Crisis did to be cute. But then again, that was becoming an overly used description of the way most looked around Felarya, well at least the innocent looking predators.

“Fun part?” asked Crisis.

“Why don’t I just show you?” You suggested as you walked over to Vivian then laid down so she could climb on your back. You secured her with spikes in well practiced places so she was secured and comfortable. The first could times you both had found out what worked and what didn’t. Leaving her tail wonder only invited a possible constriction on exciting parts of flight. There were a few other things but now you had got it down rather nicely without her crowding your wings. You stood with her then spread your wings.

“This is what we do if I can get Max to do it.” Said Vivian with a smile. Crisis just watched with eager expectation. You then took off, causing a rather large wind to whip around the area. It wasn’t as easy taking off with a full grown Naga on your back. It wasn’t the heaviest thing you’ve ever carried but it did require a certain amount of force to remain in the air, or to get up at all. You soared at a low height so Crisis could see what you were doing as you spun and banked with Vivian giggling and cheering for you to go faster. You did, as you could hardly tell her no. However when her excitement calmed down and you felt she was tuckering out you landed in the area designated as such then walked over to a very excited and shocked Crisis. “Ok, now your turn.”

“I can fly to?” she asked you as you laid down and let Vivian off.

“Of course. It isn’t every day I have enough energy to do this, plus it’s really fun to fly. Hop on.” You answered and waited as she almost did hop on. Normally that wouldn’t be a surprising sight but as she had a rather long tail it was more of a rarity among her kind.

“What are these for?” Crisis asked as you secured her wiggling tail and body with spikes.

“They are so you don’t fall off. We’ll be moving really fast you know.” You answered with a grin and she could barely contain her excitement. It was obvious that people her size, unless they were Harpies, would never be able to fly. So giving her this treat was no small thing to her, especially her. “Hold on.” You said at last as you stood up and walked a little away from the tired and spent Vivian. Then when Crisis was about to say something you took off, higher in the air than with Vivian until you were just below the clouds.

“Eeek!” she squeaked as the sudden increase in speed surprised her, like being on a very fast rollercoaster for your first rollercoaster ever. But you leveled off and soared in the air so she could recover.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Crisis likes you.

choices: They agree not to push the issue.
They want to help you past both areas.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Wee… this is so fun.” Crisis cheered as she spread her arms like she was the one flying. The extra wind resistance didn’t help on your end but her joy in flying made it more than enjoyable. “Are we really high?”

“Well, you know that giant tree? The one you live on. Vivian was telling the truth when she said you lived there right?” You asked to which she wrapped her arms around the top of your neck and put her head just to the side of it.

“Yes, I life at the Giant Tree, the really big one.” She clarified to which you soared in the direction. Vivian had shown you a few sights as you took her flying a few times. At the very least, you had a general map knowledge of where the major sights were.

“Well it’s right there.” You said as you pointed with a one of your front claws as she looked over your shoulder to the ground to see where you were pointing. She could see the large green structure but you were more than a few hundred miles above it so it looked small in comparison the vast landscape. You could almost feel her eyes widen at the realization of how high she was. “Do you like it up here?”

“Oh yes, this is fun. Can we go faster?” she asked with an excited voice, and what you would assume to carry over to her other features that you couldn’t see at the moment.

“Hold on tight.” You instructed and when you felt her hug around you increase you took off. Again, through experimentation with Vivian, you had determined what felt good and what was a little too rough. You sped, weaved, banked, and twirled. At one point you dove right toward the a lake of some kind. She shrieked as she thought you were going to crash, until you pulled up mere feet from the surface then headed back up above the clouds and among them. Eventually you both got tired and you decided to land as gently as you could and let her off near Vivian.

“Did you have fun?” Vivian asked Crisis as she came to the almost limp Crisis as you put her down gently on the ground. She was concerned for a moment but when she saw a wondered gaze on her face, similar to the one she had on her first flight, she lightened up. She knew you wouldn’t harm them but the thoughts did creep into her mind from time to time. You were a dragon and you could easily eat her if you wanted. A thought that she was usually on the opposite end of.

“So much fun. We were so high, then we Whoosh! And then we did Whir! Then Wee! Flying is so fun. Those Harpies are so lucky.” Crisis answered as she mixed in audible sounds to explain what Vivian already knew. It was a cute gesture as she also tried using her tired body to simulate your wings and motions you took when you flew with her. You smile at her as she spoke and laid there in utter sensory bliss, far different from a sensual bliss Vivian would’ve brought out. It brightened your day to have brought such happiness to her. You felt strange when around Crisis, a lot like the way you use to feel around Sarah. You simply wanted to see her smile like she was doing now. Although it didn’t seem like a hard task to get her to smile.

“Can I get you two something to eat? I got some delicious nekos and humans while you were gone.” Vivian offered but the topic instantly brought your mood down as you shook your head and looked away as she held the captive meals. Why did she have to offer you things she knew you had a moral bias against eating. You looked away when she ate them from time to time but she almost always offered you one.

“Nekos!” Crisis Cheered and within moments you heard a few screams and a few gulping and slurping noises. You didn’t want your view of the two to be hindered so you didn’t look at them while they ate. After a while they noticed your stoic and avoiding behavior. “Max, are you sure you don’t want a…” Crisis started but was stopped before she finished, probably from Vivian. You hear a few more gulps then they came over to the side your head was facing.

“Can you tell me now?” asked Vivian with a pouting face.

“Tell you what, tell you what?” asked Crisis, excited to hear a secret or story.

“Max doesn’t like eating humans or anything that can talk. As a human he doesn’t like being swallowed or tasted either. He said something bad happened in his past but won’t tell me.” Vivian answered, giving Crisis a sad face.

“Can you tell us? We can listen really good.” Crisis asked as she put her head on the ground sideways so she was looking into one of your eyes in a cute innocent way. Like a child asking their parent to share something with them. You lifted your head, looked away then back at them. Leaning over and rolling you exposed the ever present scars that decorated your body. You heard a gasp from them both. Even though you had let Vivian pretty much climb all over you, you had yet to show her the horrendous sight. After a moment you turned and positioned yourself so you could address them. As with most you explained this to, you would have to separate the stories and what each scar was from.

“My goodness, what or who did that to you?” Vivian asked as Crisis asked.

“It’s a long story.” You started then proceeded to show them where each of the scars were and told them were they came from. You turned over once that was done so you could finish the story. They both listened like little school girls. You had told your story enough times to be able to answer questions within the story before they were asked. Finally you were done and explained why you liked the spot of peace you had found and how Crisis seemed to be giving off the same feeling, plus that of what you felt with Sarah.

“So you don’t like eating humans or people because…?” Vivian asked as she verified your position.

“For one, I am half human so it is like asking Crisis to eat a baby Naga. I do remember you saying that you would never eat one but some of your friends, even other giant naga, do without a care. The second reason, and why I don’t swallow people to my second stomach to heal, is because of that ninja business. I can’t get a human anywhere near my mouth without thinking about it. No, I won’t eat another human unless they are evil or really bad and threatening people I care about. But not as food and never friends, no matter how hurt or badly they plead.” You answered. The statement about Crisis eating other Naga got her to understand more than your other one. But in combination with your story, they both understood.

“And why you don’t like being eaten or tasted?” Asked Vivian. She was obviously talking about from a play or sensual aspect. She licked you a few times and wondered what you would taste like or feel like going down. Since she wouldn’t digest you she asked you about it but you had not talked to her for a while after she asked. She didn’t like how it made you sad and angry at her for even suggesting it.

“Every time I see someone try to eat me, I think of my mother. It was the first thing I saw so I won’t forget it. I think that the person eating me hates me just like she did. I think they don’t care and, at best, just wants me for a meal. I know that you don’t but… I can’t help it. It is part of me now. And being eaten a few times as a child doesn’t help either.” You answered, shuddering as you curled your body into a tight ball as you thought about it.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: She love flying so she loves you.

choices: On the way, you meet someone or something Crisis doesn't like.
Giant tree and your new family, dysfunctional family but family none the less.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Ok, ok. We won’t try to get you to eat stuff you don’t want to. Since we could easily fit in that list I don’t think we will be too eager to break that bit of self control you have. And I think we would both much rather have you as a friend then a snack.” Vivian stated as she looked over at Crisis as if to ask if she agreed.

“But… what if I find some bad humans or nekos? Will you eat them?” Crisis asked, trying to figure you out.

“I… I guess so. But don’t push it. I can sense if they are evil or not. One evil act doesn’t mean they are all evil. Please don’t tempt me. I don’t want to eat people, period. I won’t try to stop you so please don’t force me to eat any. I can find and hunt animals in the forest just as easy as I can catch humans or nekos.” You replied.

“Are you going to make me stop eating tasty humans?” asked Crisis asked, strangely concerned. It was obviously something she didn’t want to stop.

“No, as long as you don’t eat a friend of mine. Vivian told me about your human friend back at your home. If someone ate Lea, I’m guessing you wouldn’t like that, would you?” you asked and almost immediately got a hostile face. A strange sight on the usually innocent and joyous face of Crisis. “That is how I would feel if someone I know was eaten. So if I ask you to not eat someone, please don’t eat them. They could be my family or really good friend. Other than that, I won’t stop you from eating others.”

“I see.” Crisis stated in an attempt to think on the subject, not really her style so she wasn’t getting very far in that pursuit. “Ok, no eating your friends. Got it!” she decided with a cheery voice, mainly because you didn’t try to change her eating style. Humans and like creatures were obviously a main part of her diet. Both Vivian and Crisis also seemed to have an understanding that you, as a human, were off limits. But perhaps you could grow a little in that tolerance as well as eating others, given enough time and judging by the company you were keeping.

“You know… it might be easier to be a human now.” Vivian stated in thought. “If for no other reason than to show Crisis what you look like. But if you intend on going with her, she will need to show you the way. That and… you would scare off all our… food if you walked around the jungle like that.”

“I suppose I wouldn’t need to eat as much as a human. Ok, here goes nothing.” You said as you stood and leapt into the sky. You got to a minimal safe distance then exploded into your Half-breed form so you could glide down to where you were previously. Crisis’ eyes seemed to be bugging out when she saw this. You didn’t notice until you had retracted your dragon parts and saw her staring at you and Vivian laughing at her stunned reaction. “What? Did I miss something?”

“Wow! You’re so cool!” Crisis cheered as she looked down at you like a child at their first magic show. Her face was mere feet away from you. A sight that you assumed would scare others to death. Not that her face was frightening but what it usually meant when one got that close is what concerned most people. You then caught something Vivian said.

“Vivian, did you say that I would be going with Crisis?” you asked. You had thought about it but didn’t plan on acting on it. You had said you would stay there and she like your… uniqueness. You were also probably the only person that she couldn’t push around if it came down to it. And you didn’t respond to her advances like most males of any species did. You were a rare find for her so her comment about you going with Crisis didn’t fall on deaf ears.

“What, don’t you want to?” Crisis asked as she moved back and looked at you with a pouting face.

“It’s not that. I feel very calm and content when you’re around. Like being here and with Sarah at the same time. It is just that I told Vivian I would stay here as long as she wanted me to. I am someone that keeps my word so I can’t leave unless she releases me.” You answered Crisis then looked at Vivian as she looked contently at you. “Do you really want me to leave?”

“I enjoy your company, you know that. But I’m not use to having someone higher than me around here. In small doses you are wonderful and I would love to remain your friend. But I do have a life to live. One that you… wouldn’t approve of. Doesn’t mean I wouldn’t mind a visit from time to time. I’ll even look out for the people you mentioned to me.” Vivian answered, being suggestive at times while concerned and caring at others. She reached down and picked you up. Her grip was well practiced, as was many predators, but she had a natural softness to her touch that couldn’t be replicated. Probably had something to do with the way she attracted her… prey. “Promise me this though. When you finally start allowing yourself to be tasted, you let me give you a nice long tongue session.” She finished as she kissed you then pulled you away.

“If I decide to start jumping in people’s mouths, you’ll be one of the first to know. Crisis probably at first, situation pending.” You agreed as you stroked a finger that she used to stroke your side. Funny, even in human form, you didn’t mind being pet like the animal you were.

With that, Vivian handed you to Crisis, who cupped you carefully in her giant hands until you settled onto one of her palms with perfect balance. Your use of chakra and a tail sprouting from your back with the rest of your dragon parts helped in this regard. Crisis looked excitedly at you in her hand. You saw a small glint in her eye that you knew as a predatory sign. You were the only Half-breed in existence so it was understandable. But her ties to friends obviously overshot her predatory instincts by a huge margin.

“So, you’ll live with me now?” Crisis asked as she held you at a comfortable level to talk and observe you.

“If you’ll have me, I would love to live with you.” You answered to which she brought you in a quick motion to her cheek. She seemed to be hugging you, albeit tightly but still in a warm and excepting manner.

“Oh, you’re so cute, and cool, and cool. Of course you can.” She answered in her cute fashion. Vivian seemed to like this aspect of Crisis as well. Not that she didn’t like the rest of her but Crisis seemed to have a calming and cheerful effect on you and Vivian as well. Although you suspected that her feeding habits and innocent style probably rubbed some the wrong way, mostly her meals.

“Well, you should go introduce him to Lea and Anna. He has some things that they may find interesting.” Vivian advised.

“He does? You do?” Crisis asked, first to Vivian then to you. You extended your arm and sprang out the duel disk then retracted it. It was a small device for her to see but it didn’t dampen her enthralled fixation on the strange object. “Yeah! Off to home!” she exclaimed and raced off with you and her lack of grammar structure to her home. You wondered what the other predators would think of you. Lea wasn’t one but this Anna person might think of you as a snack. Not to mention, Crisis looked to be quite popular. She probably had multiple people she saw and those that saw her. You didn’t want to harm them. It was clear that you would have to hold back at times until things were explained. Well, this was going to be fun and you couldn’t wait.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: They agree not to push the issue.

choices: Crisis comes to see if you are ok.
Anna is more or less forced to come and apologize.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Hey Anna!” Crisis greeted as she came into a sort of work room inside the Giant tree. The thing definitely lived up to its name. You had seen it before as you flew over but from so high it barely did it justice. You saw a pink haired naga turn to Crisis’ greeting with not a very hospitable face. You also saw a human on the table that this ‘Anna’ person was in front of. Judging from the size of the tools, this new Naga was probably a fan of technology and working on stuff. That meant that she had a escalated mind, which would make sense why someone with Crisis’ mindset would annoy her. Like a little kid, Crisis probably broke/played with more than one of the Naga’s inventions or projects. “Oh, hi Lea”

“Don’t touch anything, don’t even look at anything. You know how long it took for me to clean up this place and get replacement parts after the last time?” The Naga asked in a fiery mood.

“Ha, ha, ha,… a long time?” Crisis asked in response, missing that it was a rhetorical question. “Oh, I have to introduce you to someone.”

“Who?” asked the human, that you assumed was named Lea. This question cause Crisis to bring you between them and place you on the table. You flapped your wings to balance a little as she was too excited to do so as soft as Vivian had done with you thus far. “He is like the coolest… what are you again?”

“A half-breed.” You answered, slightly embarrassed as your tail twitched behind you and your wings clung to your back. You would’ve brought them in but you were unsure how that would affect things. They were probably use to seeing things with all kinds of appendages, from tails to wings it probably wasn’t something they had seen for the first time.

“Right, you’re that dragon that has been flying around. Vivian couldn’t shut up about you when she came over last. Aren’t you suppose to be big and scary looking?” asked Anna in a skeptical look as she looked down at you. Her gaze wasn’t predatory like you had feared but it was highly confrontational. She obviously had a problem with her emotions to go from content to hostile so quickly.

“Yes… well Vivian said that I should remain as a human unless I have to… or at least human like. Something about freaking people out and scaring the food sources away if I wondered around as a full grown dragon. I guess it makes sense, to a point.” You responded, trying not to offend the heated beauty above you. Why did all these predators have to look like high profile fashion models? That made it really unfair to guys. I mean it would take a couple seconds for any guy to look away from giant models and all their… glory. Probably why they were a main food source. The animals were too dumb to be affected like guys, mostly humans, would be.

“You don’t look like a human either.” A very sweet sounding voice said from Lea. You looked over at her then started retracting your dragon parts until you were in full human form. “Never mind.”

“He is awesome. Before he changed to human he took me flying. He is so big he had me on his back and was flying around like… really fast! And we did that… and zoom… and it was awesome.” Crisis exclaimed as she tried to almost act out the motions of you flying. You scratched your head nervously as she spoke. You were not use to all this praise. Sure people sometimes praised you before, but never as openly before and rarely if ever about your dragon half.

“And you brought him here because…?” Anna asked rather unceremoniously and right over your head, literally.

“He’s going to be staying with me.” Crisis said rather bluntly but with her natural innocent charm. This got both of them to stop and think for a moment.

“I can’t believe it. Another man eating freak around here.” Anna burst out in a temper driven fit of rage. This brought your mood down. You weren’t even in your dragon from and someone was calling you such things. And it was a giant predator no less. If a predator her size thought you as such… you were just having betrayal or torture scenarios from the past running through your mind. You definitely weren’t liking the hostility.

“Excuse me.” You said as you jumped off the table all the way to the entrance then leapt again out of their view. You heard a few yelling matches as you left. You just needed a little air. Maybe it was because things were so peaceful and not… like that, but that little outburst really affected you. You just needed to take a breath so you leapt to the edge of the surface before a drop that looked over the forest. You sat with your legs draped over the side and trying to overlay what she said with the beauty of the place. But all those memories and a new person that thought it of you wasn’t easy to just burry, especially because you weren’t expecting it and therefore weren’t emotionally guarding against such sentiments. That meant that they hit you with full force.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Giant tree and your new family, dysfunctional f...

choices: A while later when you all become closer.
You are right, Anna doesn't like you, at all.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Why’d you leave?” asked a voice as you heard the other two voices in the background. Crisis and Anna were going at it in a rather strange way as Crisis couldn’t recite why what she said was a bad thing and Anna took anything she said the wrong way. You had tuned them out but now this new voice was From Lea, as she sat next to you. She was rather direct with her question so there wasn’t a lot of room for misreading what she meant.

“It’s just been a while since someone said that to my face. Usually people wait at least until they think I can’t hear them to start such talk. Doesn’t seem to matter if I’m in human form or dragon form, I’ll always be considered that way.” You said with a sigh as you didn’t even bother looking over at her. You just swayed your legs as you looked over the forest.

“But aren’t you? Don’t you eat people?” She asked, again, rather directly.

“I… I have, before. Not by choice though. I’ve never eaten someone for food. It is complicated where I… use to live. I jumped to a few different worlds because I wasn’t wanted in any of them… well except the last one. That one sent me hear randomly, which I guess happens around here every once in a while. Anyway, on my world people come to kill me. Dragons in general are worthy of such action so I guess it is understandable why they don’t believe me when I say I’m different. Some times there are bad people that try to harm people I have grown to love or care for. So I deal with them. I also have a second stomach to heal people but… well I don’t do that anymore either.” You tried to explain but wasn’t really doing a good job of it. You paused before continuing, collecting your thoughts to bring it across a little better. “But no, I don’t eat people unless I have to and never for food. I have starved for over a year before and never ate someone to satiate the hunger. So when someone says something like that it does two things off the top. It make me feel like no matter what I do I’ll always be considered that way. And it brings back all the memories of people thinking of me that way.”

“Well, like you said, it is understandable. I saw you flying a few times already. I know you are big enough to eat even giant sized prey if you wanted and those teeth of yours didn’t do any image favors. You can’t expect us to just let down our guard that easily. This is Felarya you know. The moment you let down your guard you get eaten.” Lea said after a long pause. It was long enough to notice that two more people had joined the conversation. It was unclear how much the two had heard but it didn’t matter to you at the moment.

“So I hear you have something cool that I might like.” Anna said to break the ice again. She was obviously not expecting anything and wasn’t really looking to apologize but you assumed Crisis had her ways of forcing her to do so. You didn’t bother turning. You just extended your arm to the side so she could see your dual disk form and start a small tutorial of what duel monsters was and what the duel disk’s function in the game entailed. When the show was over you retracted it and let your arm fall down to your side. The whole time not addressing them while they observed the holographic show. At times they tested it by waving a hand through the image. Crisis seemed put out that she couldn’t eat the person that had appeared to explain it to them. She didn’t get most of the stuff that the other did. But she got that the image wasn’t real and you could make other stuff appear like the man that was there talking, the man she couldn’t grab, hold, or eat.

“Is that from the other world you were on?” Lea asked.

“Yes. Believe it or not. There was no war or anything close to predators and prey on that world. Everyone just concentrated on playing that game. It was a very… uneventful world. No real danger at all. But, for people like us, it was kind of boring.” You answered, still not looking at them. You just sat there, swinging your legs over the edge of the little place you all were occupying. But that stopped when two large fingers picked you up and placed you on a hand. A hand belonging to Anna. She looked at you with a slightly determined and slightly embarrassed face. She obviously wasn’t accustomed to apologizing.

“Look… Ok, I’m sorry. You happy?” she stated with some difficulty.

“Sure.” You replied, obviously not but you said it anyway.

“Hey. You don’t look like it.” Crisis said, stating the obvious.

“Ok, I’m not but I accept the apology” You confessed.

“What are you talking about?” raved Anna as she put her other hand to her head. She obviously wasn’t in this position enough times to know how to handle it.

“I accept your apology but I am far from emotionally recovered from it. I work hard to be as gentle and kind as possible. I don’t eat people and I try to help when I can. When someone just doesn’t care and assumes I will never be anything else than what I’ve worked so hard not to become. It doesn’t make me feel like what I chose meant anything. People beg to see my other form then try to kill me or betray me when given the chance. It has happened so often that I am waiting for you to make a move to do so. It would certainly not be the first time and I fear it won’t be the last. So as much as you don’t like me, I equally or more don’t trust you.” You responded. The words seemed to slap her in the face. It was then you realized that she probably didn’t like eating people either.

“Hey, Anna wouldn’t do that.” Lea said as she was being held by Crisis so she could be in the conversation more formally.

“I never said she would.” You stated to her then looked back to Anna. “I simple implied that I wouldn’t be surprised if she did. I let my emotional guard down to meet her and this is what happens. She acts just like the people that betrayed me before. On top of that she is larger and more dangerous than anyone else that fit the bill. Lea, you just explained it to me from your end but it works both ways. I have no reason to trust her at the moment. Crisis seems deathly loyal, you don’t say anything you don't mean so I can trust what you say. But Anna here is the wild card. The person that I can’t vouch for one way or the other. All I know is that, so far, she has no intention of having me around.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Anna is more or less forced to come and apologize.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
It took a decent amount of time for you and Anna to see eye to eye. But when you did you all started to get along. You saw the strange but loyal relationship between them. Anna really started to like you when you showed her your vault that you made. A vault with every tool and resource she could possible need. You thought it best that she browse and come back though. For the sake of Felarya in general it wouldn’t be fair to have people in a enclosed space, safe from harm or predators. You soon found that Felarya was so peaceful because of how that system worked. There was no war because everyone was so concentrated on not getting eaten. Idiots that would build or plan such activities in secret were found by hunting predators and… dealt with. The people learned to live in this world and those that didn’t or that were too arrogant ended up as someone’s meal. Even safe places had their dangers. Ironically the safest place to be was on the shoulder of a giant predator. If someone could befriend the gigantic beauties than they had an infinitely better but not flawless chance of living longer. Of course staying with a predator that could easily swallow you whole and desired to had its own risks.

You also took them flying on occasion when they weren’t doing anything too pressing and was now comfortable watching Crisis eat. The way you saw it, it was making her happy and it was the way nature was around here. Even if you didn’t eat them yourself you knew that there was a reason why this world wasn’t infested with skyscrapers and exhaust fumes and it had something to do with the way the food chain worked. You preferred a few people getting eaten then millions dying in a war. Plus, there were worse ways to go then to feed a beautiful giant woman, tail aside. Their last sights weren’t so bad if they thought about it. Granted in Felarya the people were more or less immortal if not killed or eaten. But you had seen people die of starvation, plague, disease, cancer, flesh eating virus, and many other things that your genetic knowledge showed you. That didn’t happen in Felarya. The worst way to die was in the stomach of a predator according to most. So, in a way, this way of life was significantly better than the other worlds. Harder for human sized creatures to survive but not worse because of that.

“Hey, let me down you monster!” hollered a man that Crisis was playing with as she slithered through the jungle with you on her shoulder.

You loved being with her. Something about her you never could explain just adored her. You slept with her and had no nightmares, you hardly ever got angry when she was near. You didn’t even hate dragons as much when she was around. You even let her lick you a few times but that was as far as you had made it to letting her taste you. She was an excellent hunter and as you were with her a lot you saw her hunt and eat many things, not all human or like species. While she didn’t have the smarts to compete with Anna she had more than enough instinct to make up for it. Plus her almost cluelessly cheerful nature made her always accepting of you no matter what you did, told her, or looked like. And that was perhaps the thing you liked most about her.

“You sure you don’t want him?” Crisis asked in her usual fashion. You just shook your head and she just smiled and licked her lips cutely as she was ready to finish off her morning snack.

“You traitor. How can you just watch while she devours people? You are…” he started but you interrupted.

“I would highly advise you not to finish that statement.” You said as you flashed your dragon eyes at him. “The last person that insulted her and me in the same sentence went to my stomach… in pieces. Wouldn’t you prefer to go into a beautiful young Naga like Crisis in peace, over an angry dragon half-breed in pieces?” You asked with a glare that shut him up rather nicely.

“Does that mean you want to be eaten by Max? I’ve been trying to get him to eat some more meat but he just won’t eat you little guys.” Crisis asked the man as she held him in front of her face.

“No!... uh, no. I think I would rather you eat me.” The man said as you continued to glare at him. Even with him not looking at you he could tell you were doing it. Your eyes were very unnerving when used this way. Even Crisis got the shivers when you glared occasionally at her. It was hard to do but she did do things every once in a while that rubbed you the wrong way to an extent that had to be corrected. The man took this opportunity to look at his captor. You saw his eyes wonder to her body and her bare chest. He allowed himself to find this erotic before either of them continued.

“Ok, down you go.” Crisis said cheerfully as she popped him in her mouth, savored him, then swallowed with a content gulp.

By this time you had your eyes back to human eyes and looking ahead where you were going. Or more accurately where Crisis was going. She wouldn’t tell you what she was doing or where she was going today. She only said that she was taking you to meet someone. Well you only knew a few of her friends including Vivian and only the other three well enough to call each other friends. Fairies came by every once in a while but rarely long enough for them to get to know you or you them.

You are going to meet...
