1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
Crisis slithered along and caught a few wondering humans on her way. But she wasn’t going out of her way to do so. You wondered how dumb those that were caught had to be. When Crisis was hunting even you had a hard time finding her. But the way she was moving now was far from stealthy. So to not see or hear her coming was very idiotic of them. Even the ‘I wasn’t paying attention’ excuse wasn’t valid. That was one thing you didn’t do in Felarya… will if you wanted to live that is. But finally you saw a sort of house or hut to which you were both moving towards. Strange as you had yet to see a dwelling like that for any of the other predators. Sure Crisis, Anna, Lea, and you had the Giant Tree and others had lakes or whatever but nothing like a material house or in this case a hut.

“Hello… Anybody here?” Crisis called but was, for some reason, being extremely careful where she slithered.

“Crisis? Come on in.” came a voice from the hut. This caused Crisis to speed into the hut, still watching where she went more than usual but also with her aura of excitement.

You had your tail, wings, and eyes out so you didn’t have to explain as much but still. As she came into the hut you saw a few things. The strangest thing was the decline in sizes. There was two giant sized people, one Naga and one Giantess. Then there was two human males and a few in a hanging cage but it also had a few nekos in it. Finally there was some of the little beings known as Tomthumbs in various places. Some seemed to be in places where they could have conversations with not only the humans but the giant sized people as well. The size difference was staggering, even if you dealt with if from time to time this was on a whole new level. You could feel hundreds if not thousands of them under her little hut. But were they pests or people, relatively speaking?

“Jissy, you’re here to? And you have your humans.” Crisis said and for once she didn’t lick her lips at the sight of humans, that was until she saw the cage. “Oh! Can I have some?”

“Milly!” one of the humans exclaimed as he seemed rather flustered.

“She’s a friend. It would be rude of me not to share a few snacks.” The Giantess, whom you heard called Milly, replied in a slightly stubborn tone as if she was wrapping up an argument.

“Crisis, do you think you can lay off just for a bit. If you keep eating you are going to be too full to fly later.” You stated, which snapped her out of the idea remarkably fast. It was true, she had eaten too much one time and puked all over a square mile when you took her flying right afterwards. Not just any puke either. Half digested nekos, humans, and other things she found with all their blood and her acid spewed over the area. It not only was a very unpleasant experience but it interfered with her hunting for a few weeks afterward.

“Ok!” She answered with a cheerful smile that got the other two to stop arguing to see the rare event of Crisis letting the thought of a wiggling meal go. She was rather famous for her appetite for humans and like creatures. Even famous among other predators.

“Who is that?” the human asked as he seemed to be the first to speak as the others stared at you. With that Crisis held out her hand and you jumped onto it, flexing your wings and tail as you balanced and she presented you to the room.

“This is Max, he is really a dragon. Isn’t that cool?” Crisis blurted out in her normal fashion, missing over half the concept of introducing someone. But they seemed to know and recognize this as you bowed to them.

“It is a pleasure to meet all of you.” You recited then straightened for them to address you.

“You… you are the dragon that has been flying around?” Asked the Naga. You flexed your wings and nodded in a sense of supreme recognition and acknowledgement. “But you are so… small.”

“I’m sorry. But Crisis said that it would be better not to be in dragon form. Something about small people I could accidentally squish. Now that I am here I can see what she meant. My claws alone would dig in and destroy some of their tunnels.” You defended in a slightly apologetic way.

“No, that’s rather considerate of you. We were just expecting someone more… intimidating I guess. That and I wasn’t expecting Crisis to bring you around here.” Milly replied. The Naga seemed to be shying away after her question as the first one was more to do with protection but now was slightly embarrassed and shy about her presence.

“Well, might I have the privilege of knowing all your names?” You asked, Crisis giggling at your polite way of addressing them.

“Oh how rude of us. Here you are being all polite and introducing yourself and we are leaving you with nothing.” Milly stated then stood more formally beside the Naga. “I am Milly and this is my home. The people underneath are the Tomthumb tribe under my protection, the Alsumi. Of course this is Isham.”

“I’m Jissy and this is Roshan.” The Naga said as each of them gestured to a human on the table. You took note of them all as they were introduced.

“And that one?” you asked as you pointed to a small figure scurrying off the table. The figure froze as she was discovered.

“Wow, you saw me?” she asked as if trying to get out of a dangerous position.

“I am a dragon. My eyes are extremely keen no matter my size. I can even see the little bit of dirt you have in your fingernails.” You answered but friendly enough to appear nonthreatening.

“Her name is Tina and she is a very close friend of mine.” Milly said in a protective and threatening tone.

“Oh, I didn’t mean anything predatory by it. I just wanted to say hi. I don’t eat people, no matter how small they are.” You responded.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Milly, Jissy, and their humans.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“You don’t?” Asked Isham in an almost hopeful voice but then got serious. “Or you can’t?”

“Um… Maybe I should show you.” You said but quickly realized that it wasn’t the right way to put it as Milly became a little more defensive. “Oh… I meant show how big I am. I can show an image via hologram to show a life sized image of me, without me actually having to change.” You quickly added that got them to calm down.

“Oh, yes. Do the magic trick!” cheered Crisis as that was what she referred to your Duel disk as.

With the growing tensions in the air she took you outside and was soon joined by the other five as they got in a small circle so they could talk outside and you could show them. You jumped in front of the little half circle and away from the two Naga tails. Then you activated your duel disk and summoned your hologram. You immediately took control of it so it didn’t scare them and had it land so they could see it. The sight made them cover their humans in a protective manner and Isham covered Tina in the same way in his hands as he was in Milly’s.

“You don’t have to worry. Just a hologram.” You said as you waved your hand through your hologram’s head as you brought it down. “See, all it can do is show you an image, realistic and fun to scare the crap out of other people but nothing more than that. This one was made to be an exact duplicate of me by a human in another world. I am greatly thankful so that I don’t have to change every time. But this more than proves my point doesn’t it?”

“Your point being?” asked Isham, after he took his turn waving his hand through the image, while being held securely by Milly and he holding Tina just as much.

“I am more than capable of eating people. Actually I prefer other dragons as they are… well where I come from they are mostly all evil as far as I am concerned. So the giant predators are in more danger of me eating them than anyone else as I like… using my teeth in my meals. But, like I said, I don’t eat people.” You answered.

“You’ve never eaten someone?” Roshan asked, looking as if he was asking for Jissy’s sake as she and Milly looked fearfully up at the dragon figure as it stood above them.

“That’s not what I said. I said I don’t, not that I haven’t.” You replied but saw that it required some more explaining. “I have come from worlds that are in constant war and evil beings roam the world including but not limited to dragons, giant snakes, giant frogs, humans, giantesses, serpents, and werewolves to name a few. In a feral and waring world it only makes sense to eat evil things rather than just kill them.”

“How does that make sense?” Isham burst out in a moral sense.

“Well, most humans that come to me are there to slay the big bad dragon. If they are good they see that I am good and I even fly them back home. If they are evil they are the kind of person that would slaughter their own loving Mothers to get a better shot at me, some do right in front of me. In those cases when I am backed into a corner and they are giving me no other choice I have to act. Just killing them only brings dragons or other heartless beasts around so the only way to get rid of their scent is to eat them. It is likewise for dragons and other things that usually visit me. But the bigger they are the more potential meat they have. So if they are evil and I have to kill them then it would be wasteful to just toss the meat. Not to mention the others of their kind will seek revenge on nearby human villages for slaying the beast, even if I did it.” You explained and they were coming down from their heightened alertness. “So to answer your question, yes I do eat people. But I don’t enjoy it and I never eat good people… well not anymore at least.”

“Not anymore?” asked Roshan.

“Damn, shouldn’t have said that. Now I have to explain.” You said in a sad tone that Crisis knew. It had taken her a while but you were finally able to explain your past to her so she was protective of you emotionally when it came to such things.

“You don’t have to say it again.” Crisis stated then looked up. “It is a really sad story and it makes Max really sad.”

“Sorry Crisis, but I have to know when he will eat us, if he has a reason to do it.” Milly responded then looked with the others toward you and Crisis came around and tried to be there for you as you got ready to speak.

“I have two stomachs. One is the obvious digestion one and one is like a storage one. I can use it to store anything, from extra food and armor to people for transportation. Because it surrounds the person inside in my living flesh it makes it the perfect place to heal people and do healing spells. I eventually got so good that I could heal someone’s leg after it was cut off completely. Or even grow a new one if needed. But I do have to eat the person to get them into the stomach. That use to be the only time I ate friends of good people.” You revealed.

“Ok, so you can do heal people. That’s a little better.” Isham stated.

“You weren’t listening. He said he doesn’t do it anymore.” Roshan interjected.

They all looked at you to continue and you told them the story and showed them on your hologram where the scars were. Of course that spawned a story about your whole past. It was well into the afternoon by the time you were done and in Crisis’s hand as she comforted you. Her presence prevented you from being too emotional but it was obvious that the story and memories were true and they greatly bothered you.

“So now you don’t eat anyone and obviously don’t let anyone eat you because of that? Sorry we made you relive such horrid experiences just to quell our concerns.” Milly stated. Luckily Tina had stuck around so you hoped she would spread it around so you didn’t have to repeat it in the future.

“But there is one thing I don’t get.” Isham stated. “Why are you ok with predators here eating people if you feel so strongly against doing it yourself?”

“If you had seen what I’ve seen you would to. It is amazing here. Sure a few hundred people die every month in this world by being eaten. From the places I’ve been a few thousand, in some cases a few million people die in a day from war, disease, murder, plague, and other things that humans do to each other just for the sadistic fun of it. I’ve seen two million people die in a battle where the whole thing was about a single acre of land where a gold mine was. Here, there is no such wars. Because everyone is so worried about being eaten. There is no sense in starting a war when the predators would eat all your gathered and marching soldiers. No one burns down the woods for fun because they are likely to be eaten by the trees themselves. This place is so peaceful by comparison. So to me, unless I know the person personally then I let Crisis or any of them do their thing. Because I would rather see Crisis happy and full than the casualty of war and dead, along with millions of other people for just some stupid gold.” You answered.

“I see, I don’t think I’ll ever be ok with it.” Isham said and gave Milly a glare. “But I can see why you are… I guess.”
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: Continue.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“If it makes you feel any better, I have saved a few from my lovely friend here. Sometime she just loves to eat. And honestly I like seeing her eat because if makes her happy.” You started as you rubbed a cheek Crisis brought you to in order to give you a small comforting hug. She smiled and giggled at this. “But sometimes she overindulges and doesn’t need to. So I explain it to her in a way she understands. You see, she loves when I take her flying. But she’ll puke if she had too much to eat. So… she doesn’t overeat in hopes I’ll take her flying. I admit it isn’t much but sensing as I am a predator higher than she is… it is better than nothing. Besides, if I’m not there watching her eat and enjoy herself than I can’t be there to save anyone, now can I?” You more stated. You used to many words for Crisis to understand.

“I suppose so. I just don’t think I’ll ever be ok with people eating other people.” Isham said. You wondered at his one track mind.

“You don’t have to. As annoying as it is to us predators that you push that idea on us wither we agree or not is what makes you… you. Obviously Milly thought of you as worthy of not eating or you wouldn’t be here. And that includes your moral stubbornness as well.” You complimented, which got the two to smile at each other for the first time since you’d been there.

“Huh, You are a strange one.” Roshan stated and you looked over at him. “I never thought I would here someone both condemn and condone eating people in the same conversation and make it morally believable”

“I do have one weakness though, in the regard of eating people.” You confessed. This got their attention but Crisis already knew what it was so it didn’t really peak her interest. “Dragons. I’ve told you my past and what they are like on my world. So it is a permanent part of who I am. If I see a dragon, especially one that is attacking or eating others. I kill it and eat it. I don’t wait for it to make up any number of excuses it may have. If I see it, he or she doesn’t matter, it is dead. Not a lot of people can convince me otherwise.”

“Judging from your past, I’m not surprised. I suppose if a dragon was trying to eat me I wouldn’t want you to hesitate it your resolve. And I’m glad you seem to like my kind.” Jissy stated as she noticed your comfort and contentment with Crisis. Them both being Naga made her feel more at ease.

“What can I say? Every predator I’ve met so far is too damn good looking even for me being a dragon to eat. With Crisis, I just feel compelled to see her happy.” You answered back to which they three giant women blushed deeply but then they all froze to an unmistakable sound of a stomach growling. “Sorry, that is me. Uh… do you mind terribly if I go hunting? No off limits spots or anything?”

“Can’t imagine what you are going to find. But go ahead. It is good I don’t have to tell you to not eat people or Jade would be cross with me with letting you roam around free.” Milly responded. You nodded then exploded into your dragon from as you leapt to a clear spot. You had gotten better with the jutsu and barely caused any burn damage when doing so anymore. “Is this your hologram?”

“No this is me. You can touch if you want.” You said as you stretched out a little but careful not to walk on top of the underground Aslumi tunnels but then lowered your head and let them approach so they could touch you. But the calm was interrupted by Crisis jumping on your back.

“Can we fly, can we fly?” Crisis repeated a few times.

“After I get something to eat and on our way back to the Giant tree. How about while I’m out that you figure out who wants to fly. And yours will be the longest and last one of the day.” You suggested and her eyes lit up at the idea.

“Ok! Go hunting and I’ll get them ready. Oh! This is so much fun. I can’t wait.” She finished and you smiled at the others as if to communicate that her joyful and happy response was what you were talking about. They seemed to enjoy this as well then let you creep into the jungle as you went hunting for food. Immediately you caught the scent of a few things that were on your menu and headed off as silent as the approaching night.
1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.title: More talking.

1323211112112211122111111112112112122212.content:
“Can’t you go a little slower…!” asked and exclaimed Roshan as you banked and spun to Jissy’s delight. Despite his old man persona of this experience, he was having a good enough time. If nothing else he was enjoying how thrilled Jissy was as you took her higher than even the Harpies could go and at speeds she only dreamed of going. Being do big she couldn’t just ask a fairy or Harpy to take her flying and if she was small enough to do so than she would be worried of them gulping her down. So she was having the time of her life at the moment.

“Ah, we’re going to crash!” Exclaimed Jissy as she held almost deathly tight onto your neck and shoulders as you dove from a very high altitude to a small lake, well small from the height but was large enough for several giant sized predators to call it home. It was a good thing you secured her tail as she would’ve squeezed the life out of you if it was free to roam around your body. At the last moment as she squealed you pulled up and a pleasant mist graced the two that were riding you at the moment before you took off toward the sky again. However flying Crisis, Milly, Isham, Tina, and now Jissy and Roshan; the whole accumulated task was making you understandably tired. But then again you rarely got a good workout in dragon form and you were far from an unpleasant level of fatigue

“This is certainly something.” Roshan said as you leveled off and soared. He was strapped on your head as there was little room on your back because of Jissy. Either way you had to look up at him if you wanted to see him, rather than looking back like you use to do. “It is also a great way to get over our fear of you.”

“Thanks… I think.” You said back.

“Enjoying yourself back there?” asked Roshan as he addressed Jissy while she was sitting up and spreading her arms. It was a constant thing for people on calm moments to do so. To feel the air run through their body as if they were the ones flying. The lack of effort and the escalated breeze that they couldn’t feel anywhere else.

“Oh, Crisis was right. Definitely worth not eating those last nekos. Thank you Max, this is wonderful. I can’t believe how high we are. I wish I could stay up here forever.” She said as she hugged back into your shoulders and neck, laying her head down on your neck and watching the scenery from so high up with a content smile on her face.

“I owe you a big one for this.” Roshan said as he looked back at her gleaming happy face. “You’re right, seeing that look on their faces is more than its own reward. Jissy has been through so much that I am filled with joy whenever she is.”

“Don’t worry about it. It is just as much a pleasure for me to create these happy memories as it is to see them. The only thing I ask is that you give me the benefit of the doubt. I don’t think it will be too long before some kind of drama hits and makes people question me. I am a dragon after all, and more than capable of doing a lot of people a lot of damage. But I would never do it. If you can trust that and help others do the same then consider all debts paid.” You said than looked back at Jissy as she was almost sleeping or dreamily gazing at the approaching jungle as you descended. “I don’t think I could take it too well if those joy filled faces turned like so many others.”

“Consider it done. If I have anything to say about it, she will listen before judging you.” Roshan agreed and got a content purr from you that was easily recognized as such

Soon you were in sight of the others and landed as lightly as you could but was more than happy to lay down and take a rest yourself to let them off. Not that most of the others were in any kind of condition to help them. So Jissy just slithered over your body and retrieved Roshan from your head then went over by the relaxing and content beauties, along with their perspective humans. With a final little bit of effort you exploded into your human form again. You were close enough to Crisis to come over and pick you up before reclining with the others. But you simply laid in her hand as she carried you.

“Oh, you ok Max?” asked Crisis as she brought you to her face to observe anything that could be considered the opposite of that.

“I’m fine, just tired. I think I’ll let you carry me for a bit, while I take a nap.” You replied as you stroked a nearby finger to which she smiled. As observed before, she wasn’t really smart in the book sense but her instinct was rarely matched. She couldn’t understand the complicated reason why you were tired but just knew that you were running low on energy and just accepted that she was going to be taking care of you until you woke. She didn’t mind as she liked being able to protect you when she could.

“Ok, have a nice rest!” she said cheerily and it was a pleasant sight of her bright and shining face of joy that you fell asleep to. Once again, the feeling she gave off lulled you to be completely calm and content and another sleep void of nightmares approached to which you embraced.

choices: Your arrival and how you survived.
13232111121122111221111121.content:
You had little control over how you went through the portal. However your instinct guided you a little. Such as not protruding your wings and curling up into a ball of sorts to brace for the impact that you shortly felt. You barely was left awake by the impact as you were hurdled so hard against the ground that you actually bounced and came out of the thick forest you had landed in. You barely could keep your eyes open as you saw you were headed to a small clearing and vaguely saw an old looking man with a beard and staff that was around a fire at the moment. Your dragon instinct almost required you to make note of everything you saw in such situation. But that came to an end as you hit the ground again and skidded both to a stop and into unconsciousness. It was a good thing you were still suffering the effects of that damned egg. Otherwise your body might’ve sprouted your dragon parts and that would be insanely hard to explain to a stranger. As it stood, you would have to explain how you could survive such a fall. Hopefully the man you had saw when you landed would be understanding and somewhere near kind. But you would see, as you awoke with the biggest headache you’d ever had.

“Ah, what a pain,” You said as you bolted up from the laying down position before you could stop yourself. But the sudden action only brought more pain to your head as you smacked your hands to it in order to nurse the throbbing headache. As your body was rather good at healing, it didn’t take long but long enough for the man from before to notice your sudden movement and address it.

“Well I would have a throbbing head to, if I had hit the ground like you did. Scratch that, I would be dead, so I am most intrigued how you survived with only a headache to show for it,” The old man stated.

“If it’s all the same to you, I would like to save the question game until I know you better than a few words,” you suggested as you got up and stretched. The old man seemed unnervingly calm for what apparently just happened in front of him. Most humans would be running or putting you in shackles as a freak or something. He seemed to be sitting there without a care in the world. You felt a little ping as you looked back at him as if his presence was in your mind as well as in front of you. The feeling was strange so you blocked it off of reflex alone. Soon you sat down on a log on the opposite side of the fire than him. It wasn’t a large fire, so there was more than enough sightline to talk.

“So, young man, how about we start with introductions. I am Brom, the… storyteller,” he said, although the designation was a little off.

You didn’t know what it was about this guy but you felt both angry and happy with him. Your instinct seemed to trust him but the scent of him threw you off. Then it came to you. He had the very faint scent of dragon on him. Like the dragon riders from Base Realm. You had only met one and it was one you almost killed. But he had been more sensible and decided to ‘let you go’. It was closer to the other way around but still, it was the one dragon, other than Kara, that had not attacked you. But the scent was not a welcome one to you. You had to suppress an urge to find and destroy the dragon you smelt from him.

“I’m Max,” you greeted simply.

“Max, do you have parents?” Brom asked just as simply but saw an instant change in your mood to which he apparently knew the cause. “I’m sorry if I pry too much. However, a young man like yourself falling out of the sky in the middle of the field does rise some questions. If I were your father, I would want to know you were at least alive. So I don’t mean to be intrusive into painful memories but I do need to know if I should be taking you somewhere.”

“I… my parents are… gone,” You said, trying to answer the question without giving too much away. You looked over your body and did give him the benefit of the doubt. You looked only like a 13 year old kid. Large for your age, certainly, but as a responsible adult he was doing right by asking.

“I’m sorry. I may not know what or who they are but I understand the loss of a loved one. Are you hungry? I got some stew that I was about to indulge in,” he offered. You were surprised at the end of personal questions that most people would’ve bombarded you. You took a whiff of the stew that was on the fire. It was like the stew Sarah had made on occasion with the deer you brought back. Oddly enough, you’d never tried it. Usually you preferred the raw meat of what was left over and allowed her to cook her own meal as such. But in human form your stomach growled at the sight of food. “I guess that’s a yes.”

He pulled out a bowl and another human utensil that you had seen others use. One thing you prided yourself on was the ability to learn quickly. Things that Sarah or others practiced you could duplicate when you went to human form. Sure, some things required more practice but basically you could replicate it. So you graciously took the bowl of freshly poured stew and the utensil and ate as ‘politely’ as you could. It took a good amount of effort to not just wolf the surprisingly good food down. Brom seamed surprised as you polished off the whole pot of stew after he had his share. But surprised or not, he just kept pouring and you kept eating. He washed the items and put them away after the meal as you licked your lips. He seemed to notice this with a certain fondness that you had to assume reminded him of whatever dragon he was attached to. But since you were in no hurry to meet such a beast you didn’t ask.

“Thank you Lord Brom, for the wonderful meal.” You complimented. You had only been around humans in pleasant company for a short time. Sarah was like your sister and all the others had titles to come before their name. So you used the most esteemed one you could think of.

“’lord?’ No, just Brom is fine. I have no attachment to royalty or status like that. But a very polite boy for you to treat your elders so well. I am flattered,” he returned to which you nodded in understanding of his lighthearted instruction. “Now, we do need to discuss something.”
13232111121122111221111121.title: Book

choices: Trading and suspicions of an egg.
132321111211221112211111211.content:
“Discuss something?” You asked as you tried to ascertain what he was talking about. You felt the presence again in your mind and easily blocked it. This seemed to get a gleam in his eye but nothing else.

“Well, if you have no family or person to take you to I have to make sure a young boy like yourself is at least taken care of. I can’t, with good conscious, just leave you out in the wilderness near the Spine on your own now can I?” he asked.

“I… I guess not. What is the Spine?” You asked as you didn’t know if it was some kind of dragon nest or something. The way he said it, it appeared it was avoided for some reason.

“My goodness, you must really be from far away indeed if you haven’t even heard of the Spine. I suppose all you need to know about it is that it is a dangerous and chaotic place that is as uncertain as the wind as far as magical and predatory worth is concerned. There are stories of groups of men going mad after coming back from the Spine, or not coming back at all. Not a place for a young boy like yourself,” Brom explained. He seemed to be evaluating just who and what you were. The thought that you were unfamiliar with the landmarks as known as this ‘Spine’ was not unheard in the old man’s ears.

“So where am I going to live?” You asked. This old man wasn’t just going to walk away and let you choose for yourself. In a way it was comforting to have someone put some worth on you again. Even a stranger, you were taking the situation with some salt in seeing that of all the people that could’ve found you, Brom was at least nice on the surface. If any person could handle you in the future it would be this man. Sure the dragon scent on him was a little infuriating but it also provided you with necessary acceptance at the moment.

“Well, I don’t really do this all the time but… I suppose you can stay with me. I have a feeling that no one would leave you alone if they found out how you ended up here, from wherever you are from. What am I suppose to tell people? Hey, adopt this kid. He fell from the sky so hard that it made the ground shake then landed in front of me. I might be able to handle it, but others will not. That being said, I would keep that to yourself as will I,” Brom advised.

“I thank you for your kindness, and wisdom… Brom,” you thanked. You didn’t know how long you would stay but you did know that you were lucky to find someone so accepting right off the bat. You didn’t know what his intention was but you could handle it if he ended up hiding some deep and dark secret. Couldn’t be worse than anything you already experienced. Or so you thought.

“Again with the polite talk. It’s enough to make an old man like me blush,” he joked as he smiled and reddened a little. Wither it was real or an act was still up in the air. But for now you took his word. He had earned that much from you in the short time you both had over the meal. Not only that but he was going to take you in for assumedly free.

The rest of the night was spent wondering back to a village called ‘Carvahall’. Both of you were like a sponge, soaking up anything you could learn from the other through seemingly idle conversation. But both of you were equally evasive about certain topics. Background and history of one’s self being chief among them. It was well into the night or early morning by the time you and Brom had made it back to the town. You took in everything. You had never been in a town like this with the intent to stay for a while as a resident. So you took in the layout rather quickly. At least you wouldn’t get lost, well for the most part. You still had no idea what humans did with some of the things you saw. Why did humans need shops to sell meat when they could just go out and hunt themselves? Why were little shiny trinkets apparently so valuable? That, and you never got why they needed so many layers or sets of clothes. You only wore your made up clothes to blend in. Why they NEEDED them was still a mystery to you. That, and why do humans need those things on their feet then complain they’re feet hurt when walking around without them? Humans were sure strange creatures and always hiding something.

“Here we are,” Brom stated as he ushered you into a relatively small house. You looked around but didn’t touch anything. You had learned from Sarah, long ago, that human stuff was usually brittle and private. Since you didn’t need such things you didn’t see the point in potentially breaking things just to sate your curiosity. “What do you think?”

“Uh… fine, it looks like a fine dwelling… house… it looks like a fine house,” You stumbled, aware that dwelling was not something humans said about their residence too often. Usually it was something like ‘home’ or ‘house’ and ‘farm’ for those that grew plants to eat. Brom seemed to catch this but, with everything else you said strangely, he put it in an internal archive of knowledge he was accumulating about you.

“Well, it is your house now as well. Let me show you to a room you can sleep in,” Brom suggested.

He showed you around the house. You were assigned to a smaller room in the ‘house’ and was shown certain things. As you thought, there were a few items like these things called ‘scrolls’, that were very brittle. You told him you couldn’t read and he was surprised. You really didn’t have the need to read before. You had genetic knowledge and no practical need to do so before. You both sighed, as it would take a considerable amount of effort for you to fit in. Not to mention, this ‘reading’ would be the only way you could find out information about how the portals worked. That more than anything spurred you on to learn. Over the next week or so, Brom ascertained multiple areas that you didn’t know much on. Ironically, fighting was already in your mind. So when he tested you, you thoroughly beat him in very few moves. Most of them you had seen Sarah, Nick, or any of the solders and assassins practice. However, most of the other things that needed to be learned as a human were sorely lacking. You decided to learn as much as you could about everything you could. You even got a job, hunting for meat and making leather on top of everything else you were volunteered for by Brom. That paid the bills nicely and gave you some pride that Brom wasn’t doing this for nothing. Hunting, as Brom found out, was just another of the things you needed NO help in. So it began, your life in Carvahall with Brom the Storyteller.
132321111211221112211111211.title: Your near future arrangements.

1323211112112211122111112112.content:
“Max!” Brom called to which you came over to him from a rare bit of relaxing you were doing. You came into the house to meet a young boy you had seen around. He was a few years older than you were but you both shared one thing, a thirst of Brom’s stories. “Thought you would like to know Eragon is here, again, and hear some more stories and questions that he is always full of.”

“Hello Eragon, how’s it going?” You asked politely with a short bow. You had been doing that to show respect to elders. Eragon seemed younger than his age the way he acted at times but he was still older than you so you paid him the respect.

You were amazed how quickly a simple human bow would bring someone’s opinion of you. It was like a switch to their internal pride and emotion based acceptance. You didn’t really need another reason to do it. Although it was harder to do to some, like when you sold meat to Slone. No matter how good of price you gave him or how polite you were, somehow he always seemed to have a stick up his butt. Always crabbing about one thing or another. The only good feature about him was his dedication to his daughter. The way he adorned her was probably the only thing that kept people around him. Thinking that he MIGHT be halfway decent under his rough exterior.

“Well enough. I royally failed in hunting today and almost got nothing from Sloan as well. You seem to be the only one that can catch anything of value around here. I have to go way out to the Spine to hunt,” Eragon stated.

“In the Spine? You must be either insanely brave or stupid to go into there,” you said in a clear compliment. He smiled at the statement as he normally did when you embellished him. He seemed to be upbeat when someone acknowledged his skill in anything, regardless how low it may be in the area. With your mastery of so many of the town’s professions it was compliment when you gave it to him that he was not shy in receiving.

“Ok, ok, now let’s get going on this session. You’re uncle will have my hide if I keep you too long,” Brom said with a fanned bit of impatience that you both knew was false. He may have complained every once in a while from the constant questions but he was far from not wanting to give the answers, or at least an answer. Sometimes you didn’t think it was quite true. You had heard a story then read one from one of his scrolls with a vague but distinct difference in what he had said. Not enough to be inherently false but not then ENTIRE truth either.

“Ok, you wish to know about dragons and their riders, again?” he asked as Eragon nodded. This was one subject that you didn’t really care for at first but was growing in intrigue. It appeared that Dragons were at least halfway honorable in this realm, even by your standards. You learned a lot, even when Brom only talked to you about and things he didn’t tell Eragon, that made your hatred of dragons become less prominent in this realm at least. You got the fact that some were still evil but there were so few and the others that would otherwise be good had dampened your bloodlust for them. If you slaughtered the wrong one, you could effectively destroy the mystical and good force of this realm and world. Something you weren’t willing to do. Didn’t mean you were going to accept one, even them being good, with open arms either.

This time Brom told the two of you about the history of riders and how they came into being. It was apparently a rarely told story, as the king had an active bias against anything that would threaten his rule. Saying that he betrayed anyone and the evil persona that he got from such a historical story was not one he would like to be repeated. So you listened intently at every detail. By the end of it you had a major question in your mind, as did Brom. The question to each other was relatively the same on both sides and growing with anticipation for the answer as you got to know each other. Your rapid ability to pick up things and you insane amount of ability in anything you mastered turned more than his head, regardless how well you hid it. On his end, he knew things that wasn’t in any of his books and seemed to have intimate knowledge of things he spoke of. Things that couldn’t be known unless he was there. That would make him insanely old by the timeframe he had set in his stories. Not to mention, his scent and the weird words he said every once in a while when he did things you knew were not anything but magic. You also saw, even through his glove, an insignia that he NEVER revealed to anyone.

The question to each other was simple; “Who and what are you?” Both of you wanted to know this about the other. But neither wanted to sacrifice what you had both gained over the months of living together. But as time went by, it became increasingly hard to bare not asking it. One of you were going to break at some point, but who?
1323211112112211122111112112.title: The boy named Eragon.

13232111121122111221111121121.content:
“What was that about?” Brom asked as he caught up with you.

You had been talking with him then all of a sudden you smelled a very strong scent of a dragon. It didn’t take you too long to find the source, a small ‘stone’ that Eragon had in his pack. The stone was obviously a dragon egg, well obvious to you at least. Either way, you had to leave the town to keep from smashing it. The sudden change in behavior had not gone unnoticed. What usually was a pretty calm day and final lesson on writing was now a very stress filled day. You just needed to blow off some steam but you couldn’t with Brom here. It was hard to control it but you managed as he got closer. Despite the dragon scent on him, the rest of him was rather soothingly calm. Not like Sarah’s scent but he definitely allowed you to feel relatively at ease.

“Nothing,” you answered as you turned away. You stopped walking as you were about to go into the Spine. Not that you were afraid of it but it was one of the things you didn’t do in order to remain inconspicuous. So you just stared into it, not wanting to give anything away to the keen eyes of Brom.

“Nothing? Sorry son, but that won’t cut it this time. I know we’ve been mysterious to each other while still becoming close. But this was the last straw. Not in a bad sense but I can’t justly NOT ask you about it now that an instance of you running off is so fresh in my mind. You don’t have to relive your past right now. But I will require you to explain the things you can do and have done. Put it to you this way, no HUMAN can do the things I’ve seen you do. You hide it rather well, but I’ve seen you do things that defy my knowledge, which is extensive. So start explaining. I don’t care how much, but something has to give at this point,” Brom demanded, although he did so in a voice that you wondered about. It was as if he had a power to guilt, calm, advise, consult, inspire, and convince someone all in one. This geezer was too wise for his own good. You had 2 options in front of you. You could start talking or find a way not to. You couldn’t imagine killing him to keep your secret and you had grown to attached to him to run away. Not only that but the guy was insanely good at finding you. Sometimes you sensed his eyes on you, even when he wasn’t within miles of where you were.

“You to,” you replied.

“What?” Brom asked back.

“It sounds like both of us have questions and concerns about the other. I admit that you have seen things I didn’t intend to show you, at least for a while. But it works both ways. I’ve seen you do things that… well are impossible underneath a certain light. Definitely not in the light of a common story teller,” you responded.

“Ok, if I go first, will you follow in revealing things about yourself as well?” he asked, getting back to a more sensible request then a simple command for you to do as he told you. This was actually the first time outside educational and story based questions that you defied his command. You had done what he said without question while learning the things you needed to learn.

“I… I will.” You conceded, obviously not liking the idea but was willing to trust him. He seemed to understand this, somehow, and went on with an agreeable nod.

“Ok, I can do magic. That is the first one. What about you?” he asked.

“Hey, if we are going to go this slow we will be here all day. Why don’t you just come out and say it? You are a dragon rider, right?” You asked, obviously not in a mood to beat around the bush when you had to give such a secret about youself.

“How do you know that?” He asked, as if some big secret was being revealed that he did not intend and wondered if you were some kind of spy all this time.

“Cause I’m a dragon.” You said simply but with a glare that revealed that you weren’t kidding or joking.

“W-what?” He asked, convinced he misunderstood you.

“I… AM… A… DRAGON…” you said slowly and as clear as you could.

“Ok… well you don’t look like…” he started but you had no intention of staying on this point for an extended amount of time. So you interrupted him by springing your severely cramped wings and tail out. He fell backward at the sudden action before getting up in a ready position but straightened then circled you as he saw the lack of aggression as you let him do so. “So… you are a dragon, and that is how you knew I was a dragon rider?”

“Yes, and no. You aren’t as subtle as you think when hiding things. Starting a fire with a single word. The light that glows when you do so from the symbol on your hand, and the books that explained what a Gedwey Insignia was. Not to mention your very scent has some traces of dragon in it. And about me being a dragon… that is true, and it isn’t. I am both human and dragon,” You explained as simply as possible so he could understand.

“How can you be both?” he asked, obviously never hearing of such a thing before.

“I am what is known as a ‘half-breed’. I can go from completely human to completely dragon. As you can see, I can stop in the middle to some extent and lose none of my power in either,” you explained as you moved your tail in an obvious demonstration of what your half and half form looked like, or mostly looked like. You left only your wings and tail out. Somehow you didn’t thing that the whole glowing red eyes was a good starting point with him.

“This is…” Brom started and you braced for one of 2 things. He was either going to condemn you like everyone else at first glance or he was going to accept you. He seemed very open to the dragon part, almost longing for it. But he was also unnerved by this whole thing, understandably so. So you waited for him to react.
13232111121122111221111121121.title: He breaks and asks.

132321111211221112211111211211.content:
“This is… incredible.” He finished then fainted. You sighed, as that was about as good as you were expecting.

If he was going to condemn you he would’ve attacked then fled like so many others over the years. You rushed forward and caught him before his body hit the ground. Lifting him up, you rushed off into the Spine and into a place you knew no one would follow and a place you had made just for this occasion. You could transform and not be seen, even by the air. There was only one way in and it was hard enough for you to get through. There was no way anyone else could without some serious effort and notice from all sides. But you didn’t transform right away. You just started a fire and waited. For him to wake up. You placed him in a comfortable spot among some blankets you materialized. The ground was cold just before winter. So you didn’t want him, the only person who you intimately knew, to die of cold. So you waited with your wings and tail still out. Finally he got up, he looked around to get his bearings then his eyes fell on you as you were just looking into the fire, obviously avoiding eye contact but also deep in thought. You were thinking of all the ways it could go wrong and also nervous about the one human in this realm that you liked more than any other. You’d never had a father figure before so you didn’t know what it felt like. But if you had to guess, it would be what you were feeling about Brom. Combined with your dragon loyalty and emotional attachment, you were insanely nervous of him.

“Where are we?” he asked to break the silence and bring your concentration to him. You hesitantly looked over to him.

“In a hidden area in the Spine. I found this place for when I eventually tell someone about myself so I could show them without prying eyes,” you revealed then looked back at the fire. It was getting low so you put some more logs on it and blew some light flames to it in order to keep the temperature to a comfortable level. This seemed to get Brom’s attention if you hadn’t already had it with your wings and tail flexing nervously.

“I’m sorry,” he said all of a sudden as he took a spot surprisingly right next to you. You almost bolted from the log you had set up for seating. But his hand on your leg kept you there. Not by physical force obviously but definitely out of concern that moving against it might hurt him, one way or another.

“What do you have to apologize for?” you asked as you looked into his eyes. He did the same so you let your dragon eyes go and he was strangely delighted at this. He was so entranced by your sudden features that he almost forgot to answer.

“An old dragon rider gets to meet another dragon and all I can do is faint. That paints a wonderful picture of me doesn’t it?” he asked sarcastically. He took one hand and draped it against your wings in amazement then looked back at you. “I don’t suppose you would go all the way to dragon form would you?”

“I can, but…” you started but stopped, looking away from him.

“But what?” he asked, probably wondering if he had done something wrong.

“It’s just, it hurts a lot to go all the way. Growing wings and stuff, that’s easy. But going from all human to all dragon, is a way bigger change… obviously. So my body literally has to rip itself apart to do it. As you can imagine, it isn’t something I enjoy doing multiple times if at all. Usually I like staying in one or the other,” you explained.

“Why would it hurt if it is something you were made to do?” he asked back in a concerned tone.

“I’ve thought on it. The only thing I can come up with is so that it makes it fair if I was to infiltrate a human village then transform into a dragon. I would be too tired and in pain to consider to go on a rampage. I suppose it is a way to keep me in check,” you answered. “But I’ll do it for you, if you really want to see it.”

“You will?” He asked hopefully but he also didn’t want to cause you any pain.

You nodded then got up. He was going to follow but you shook you head and had him sit down then went over to the open spot. You started it for the first time since you had done so in relation to the egg Kara’s parents had used on you. It hurt just as much as you remembered. You tried your best to keep from making too much of a fuss for Brom’s sake but it wasn’t easy and it was impossible to do completely. In the end you were growling and snarling just like normal. He stood and backed up until he hit the tree line. With nowhere to go he was forced to watch as you changed and convulsed. Finally you were done and panting on the ground. It felt good to be back in dragon form again, but the pain was still not something you looked forward to. As you recovered you heard his steps as he came forward. He stopped when you moved to a more approachable position. But doing so required you to rake you huge and deadly claws in the dirt, alongside the trenches you already made from the change in the first place.

“You can approach, I won’t bite,” You said softly and as nonthreatening as you could without showing teeth and ALL the tricks you learned to make it so.

“You can talk, in the human tongue, without using your mind?” he asked with astonishment.

“Yes. It took some doing, but like I said, I lose none of my abilities as dragon or human, talking included,” you answered. “Ah, it feels good to stretch out. I haven’t been able to do this for months. My wings were so cramped I was afraid they would have age cracks in them,” you said as you stretched them out broadly before folding them back against your body.

“I can imagine that isn’t the only thing you miss. If I miss flying in the sky as a human, dragon rider aside, I can’t imagine how it must be for you,” Brom said as he openly gawked at you and your body. Every move you made was like a treasure to him, from the look of it. He was actually on the verge of tears for multiple reasons.

“I suppose it’s obvious isn’t it?” You asked rhetorically.
132321111211221112211111211211.title: He reacts good.

1323211112112211122111112112111.content:
“So, where did you come from?” asked Brom.

“I came from Base realm…” you started and didn’t end until you had told your entire story up to meeting him. You showed him your scares and your hatred of dragons despite being one yourself. He understood but obviously didn’t approve. For a people the revered dragons so much, he was probably incapable of hating dragons. He asked if he could touch you more informally and you agreed as you answered his questions. As it stood you needed some time to rest from transforming so after a little Q&A you fell asleep and let him do as he willed around you. When you woke you found him laying on your snout, just listening to your body with an ear to your scales. With him there you didn’t think it wise to talk out loud so you spoke to him in his head. “You still there Brom?”

“Of course I am. Since my dear Saphira died I have missed being with a dragon. I can’t seem to get enough. I know it might’ve been intrusive to explore your body as you slept but I assure you it was not by any means immoral in the intension or execution. I would ask to go flying with you but at your size I would say that it isn’t really possible without showing yourself to the world. That would be a bad move until we can make it safe for you to do so. I assume that a bunch of people running in horror isn’t something you want”. He thought back

“I suppose you’re right, as usual. Although, if it is ok with you, I wouldn’t mind flying at night in human form?” You asked.

“I think that would be ok. As long as you’re careful. I suppose I should start teaching you dragon and dragon rider things when I get the time. You said you didn’t know any structured magic beyond materializing and things your ‘Genetic Knowledge’ has taught you. Some of those things are beyond anything any of us can ever do. I doubt you can read the Ancient language and words of power that the Elves use if you couldn’t read and write normally.” Brom answered and offered you.

“That would be wonderful. I would love to know more things. Even if I plan to stay here for a while, it would be nice to be able to learn how to get back eventually. Learning as much as I can is the best way and I couldn’t think of a better teacher. That and I don’t have to tiptoe around this side anymore when you wonder how and why I can pick stuff up so fast.” You replied with a great amount of excitement. Brom could feel this and got off your snout so you could move more freely without worrying about accidentally hurting him. You liked that he had enough experience to know what to do and when to do it, relatively speaking.

“Whoa there buddy. One thing at a time. I promise to teach you everything I can while I can as long as you promise me one thing,” Brom said to which you leveled your head that you had sprung up when he got off. It was a mode of high concentration that left your head inches away from him. Obviously you were taking whatever he said seriously and with high attention so he continued as it was more than enough to guess you agreed with the condition. “There are very few dragons in this world. I want you to promise that you will not slay, eat, kill, or slaughter any of them unless you are absolutely sure they are evil. An attitude much like the one you have towards close friends. I know you will be on edge and that is ok, as long as you keep your head and think very carefully and long before tearing into one.”

“That is a big favor to ask,” you almost growled at your obvious displeasure at his terms. You had already decided to think hard on it before killing the dragons of this realm. But the level he was implying was more so. To think of them as friends until proven otherwise, that was something you were very reluctant to do. “Very well, I will hold off my wrath on the dragons of this realm until they prove themselves a legitimate threat to those I have come to love, like, and protect. No instant killing or eating them.”

“That’s good enough,” Brom agreed as he put a hand on your snout to which you exhaled through your nose to plow some wind at him. Just enough to get him to know that it wasn’t your preferred way of dealing with things but was willing to trust him on it. “Ok big guy, as much as I would love to keep you company in this form, we should head back as soon as we can. So you should probably change back. I surely hope the occasion is warranted for you to stay as a dragon in the very near future.”

“As do I,” you agreed then backed off a little then started the hard and painful process of turning to human again. When it was done you were helped by Brom to the fire bit. He didn’t say anything about the dragon parts you left out. He probably didn’t want to be rid of them any more than you did. Now that he knew about you, he was obviously planning on having much more deep of a relationship with you. A rider and his/her dragon were very close. While it could turn slightly romantic on an impractical level it usually was just a very deep friendship that went deeper than family. So having anything near that level was probably a plus for him. You didn’t mind letting him get close to you. But you hoped it wouldn’t backfire if he was taken from you. You would use all your strength to make sure that didn’t happen.
1323211112112211122111112112111.title: Continue.

choices: The beginning of a journey. Where Brom goes, so do you.
13232111121122111221111121121111.content:
“That is just amazing.” Brom said as he tried teaching you magic and the ancient language. Apparently you already knew how to speak it as naturally as you could dragon tongue. In a way it made sense. If you had all the genetic knowledge including genetic ANCIENT knowledge of words before dragon tongue than you would know this ‘Ancient Language’ somewhere in your mind. You had rarely used it because no one could understand it and you couldn’t lie. Not that you did that much but it was a spoken trap if you agreed to something before you understood fully. But you had spoke simply with animals and such. Most didn’t have much to say on an intellectual level but they did have simple things like “ok” or “Prey”. Things that an instinctual side would use. However, while you understood the language and now understood how to access your magic through it, you were far from able to write it or read it. So that is what he taught you. But now you both were on a different topic.

“I think you should have a firm grasp on weapons,” Brom stated as he held up a bow and arrow to you.

“Right, the question was why?” you asked yet again.

“Ok, wise guy, what are you going to do when you have to hide and fight at the same time? Fighting at a believable level or as one like you were when that egg effected you. You can’t just use your tail, as sharp as it may be. You know the sword from watching people but you are far from talented as you could be. Not to mention you break every bow you put your hands on. Not only that, but magic will scare people away just as much as your dragon abilities will. You need to learn these things. Besides, you’ve learned everything else I can teach you. Might as well be well versed in combat,” Brom answered.

“Fine, but what good is a bow going to be against a dragon or something as heavily armored?” You asked.

“That is one of the reasons why we should make you YOUR bow. A bow and arrow that could penetrate a dragon’s hide would only be able to be pulled by a master inhumanly strong… like you. Naturally the bow that could do that could also be very strong and able to fire a very long distance. So… got any ideas?” Brom asked finally getting your imagination working. He was good with words and knew just what to get you interested. A bow strong enough to penetrate a dragon’s hide was just up your alley of impossible feats that had a worthy goal, in your mind at least.

As the winter came you spent an ungodly amount of time in the blacksmith shop working on your bow and arrows. Most of you experiments were in failure. A wood bow was too weak, no matter how well it was made. A metal bow would crack under the pressure and was too loud. So you mixed things with magic and everything you could think of to solve the riddle. Finally you got what you needed. It was hard to make but you got an idea from the Zar’roc. It was obviously stronger and more well made than anything you’ve ever seen. So you used a bit of magic and your own hottest flames to create a metal that was so hard that you had a hard time breaking it even with all your might but was as quiet as you were, no creaking or cracking at strain not to mention its sharp edge could be used for a blade. Connecting the two ends was a wire of the same metal but in ultra thin strands so it had the durability of the rest of the bow but the flexibility of a thread. Because it was metal it was not easy for even you to pull back once you strung the bow. With the bow you had to make and be able to materialize arrows of the same metal. But augmented them to disappear after they stopped moving for over an hour after being fired from your bow. You didn’t need some idiot copying your material to use it against you. When you were done you showed it to Brom.

“This… is crazy,” He remarked as he could no sooner pull the bow back than he could bend a sword in half. He settled with running his hands along its sleek black design, as it had your magic in its make, it was the same color. He remarked the sharp edges of both the bow but also the arrows. It wouldn’t do to have traditional feathers as they could support the velocity or weight. So you had thin membrane metal feathers that handled it well enough. But anyone but you could cut themselves badly by running their fingers over the metal feathers as Brom found out. “Can you even fire this?”

“Watch. You challenge me to make a bow that could kill a dragon. You shouldn’t have said it if you weren’t serious,” you stated as you pulled back the bow with a materialize arrow that got him to look on in wonder. You both had moved to the Spine to try it out. You pointed the deadly end at a series of boulders that you had moved in line. You let the arrow fly and shattered all 400 feet of them before lodging in the last boulder with a noticeable indent from its impact. The boulders before that shattered to the speed and force of the arrow as it had passed through them. Brom coughed wildly for a moment at the sight. “I made this strong enough to get through MY scales.”

“I feel sorry for whomever you point that thing at. You’ve just made something that combines a blade, bow, and siege machine in one. Forget the armor if you got that thing,” Brom complimented. You didn’t really notice it the way he said it at the time. But now that you looked at it he was right. You could fight melee battles with it and long ranged, EXTREME long ranged. You had been so excited in creating it you didn’t realize the implications of it. To top it off, you could dematerialize it along with the arrows to keep it safe. Not like someone could crush it without a considerable amount of force and magic.

“Maybe I did go a little overboard,” you stated as you scratched the back of your head.

“Not a chance. If anybody is at fault is I. I got that large brain of yours thinking and am solely responsible for egging you on to create it. The peaceful side of me asks you never to use that thing, but the pride side of me can’t keep from grinning at your accomplishment,” he stated as he didn’t hide the grin he was talking about.

“I suppose it is a better way that changing to dragon form to deal with quality opponents. With this thing, people will concentrate on the bow instead of me if I ever have to use it. Not that they could pull it back even if they could steal it,” you replied.

“You’re right about that. Why don’t you carry it around as a deterrent?” Brom suggested. “It looks mean enough by itself. Perhaps the mere sight of it will prevent you from having to use it. That and it is rising suspicion that you don’t go hunting with a bow like the rest of us.”

“Good thinking. I guess being old has its perks,” you joked.

“Yeah, yeah. Laugh it up you oversized rat,” he teased back as you sheathed your new bow on your back with the arrows in the case you made for it. You were both thoroughly proud and afraid of the new weapon you just created. Silently, even as you both laughed, you both wished you would never have to legitimately use it.

132321111211221112211111211211112.content:
“You knew about this, didn’t you?” Brom asked as he got his stuff ready to confront Eragon.

“Wow, nothing gets by you,” you replied jokingly to which he just smiled a sarcastic smile at you. You had told him about the new dragon you had caught the scent of. For that reason, you had kept your distance from the Spine where it dwelled most of the time. But you had not revealed who the rider was. He finally found out and was readying for a trip. He packed Zar’roc as well all his money and supplies. “In case you are wondering, he doesn’t know I know. I found out the same way I knew you were one, by his scent.”

“Well that’s just peachy. I suppose you want to come with me then?” He asked.

“Of course. Staying in a small town when you go out having all the fun isn’t my idea of a good time,” You answered. Brom would’ve said how dangerous it was but he had to constantly remind himself he wasn’t dealing with any kid when dealing with you. If there was one person he didn’t have to worry about in terms of safety, it was you, well not your safety at least.

“Ok then, get your bow and let’s go. We probably won’t be coming back here again,” he instructed to which you did so. It didn’t take long as your bow was the only thing you commonly kept out of your materializing library of stuff. When one has all their belongings always with them it saves on packing time. You both arrived at a spot where there was a cash of leather and shortly after saw Eragon coming. You could hear two conversations as Brom talked with him and he talked with someone called Saphira. You had to assume it was his dragon. You took in his scent and almost growled at the scent of blood. You knew the cause as you were a dragon. If you didn’t make a saddle from your protruding bone than your scales would shred the comparatively weak skin of a human in minutes flat. This wasn’t giving you to good of a picture of this dragon you were about to meet.

“What about you, Max, I suppose you know about my dragon as well?” Eragon asked as they talked about things and was convinced to let Brom join him.

“Of course. No offense, but it is hard to hid a dragon. Even if she steps light, a dragon’s presence is not hard to spot… well most of the time,” You said with a smirk that Brom returned.

“That’s just great. Am I the only one that is in the dark here?” Eragon asked in exasperation. To be fair, he had just been through a lot, especially for a boy of his temperament.

“Pretty much, but it is you that chose to keep your eyes closed right? How are we suppose to tell you anything if you won’t listen?” You asked.

“I am listening!” He exclaimed to which Brom just put a hand up to stop an argument.

“We can talk while we walk. We still have to get going. That is unless you want the whole town knowing your plans,” Brom stated to Eragon to which he reluctantly lead the way to his farm. He seemed to be thinking heavily on what was going on and what he was going to do. To be fair you were as well. Your very bones were creaking in anticipation of a dragon you had promised not to kill. You secretly hoped that she would make an off move so you could take her out. Besides, you were so missing dragon meat. Once you all made it to the farm it wasn’t long before the dragon in question landed. Eragon seemed to take her well enough. But Brom could see every muscle in your body strain with restraint to pull out your bow and kill her. He could almost taste the hostility and hatred you had for her as a dragon.

“You promised, remember?” he whispered.

“Yes, doesn’t mean I have to like it,” you almost growled back. He gave your shoulder a strong pat as he moved forward to introduce himself with a round of pleasantries both out loud and in their minds, both you could hear.

“Max, are you going to flatter your way into her graces to?” asked Eragon before he noticed the deathly glare you were giving her.

“He looks as if he would like nothing more than to see me dead.” Saphira shuddered. Your glare was so intense, even without your dragon eyes showing, that she backed down. Unlike most humans, there was no fear of her what so ever. Brom went forward to diffuse the situation.

“That is a very accurate assumption. Max here has a very deep hatred for dragons. When he was an infant he was nearly killed by one and has seen nothing but the ugly side ever since. Under those circumstances it is understandable that he hates dragons just as much as you hate those who killed your uncle,” Brom revealed.

“Then why bring him along?” Eragon asked as he noticed your eyes were not even blinking in your intense glare at Saphira.

“He is… all alone. I took up raising him when we found him remember? I figured that with all his talents that Saphira can be the example that not all dragons are evil. But it would be like convincing you that those of the same company of people that killed your uncle are worthy of putting your life in their hands. Either way, he hates one thing over dragons and that is evil. I can’t just leave him and he can more than help, you know he can,” Brom answered.

“Fine,” Eragon stated as he went over to you. “Can you stand to travel with us?”

“As long as you keep… HER… away from me.” You said than softened your eyes before you looked to Eragon.

“You know, she’s not that bad. I trust her well enough.” Eragon stated as Saphira walked around but kept her distance from you as you glanced at her then back at him.

“So says you. If you’d seen what I’ve seen you wouldn’t be anywhere near her unless you had a sword in your hand. I promised to try to make this work. I will…TRY to. But if she so much as twitches at Brom or you the wrong way, I won’t think twice about… dealing with her.” You said in a deathly serious tone that got all of them to shake.

Within a few moments you all were off, with a good distance between you and Saphira. You took a back position so you could watch her every move. Brom was stuck, for the moment, playing peace keeper. But when Saphira looked back even slightly at you she shivered. She obviously didn’t know why your gaze effected her so. But you didn’t care at the moment. Sure she looked a lot like Kara, but she also by default looked like Kara’s arrogant parents that got you to leave Base Realm in the first place. Perhaps that was what made you extra hostile toward her.

1323211112112211122111112112111121.content:
“Why don’t you have to do this?” asked Eragon as he struggled with Brom in his first practice match. Over the few days you had gotten better with having Saphira around but still had a deathly glare when she did anything remotely too high profile. But for now she lay down on the opposite side of the fire than you as you both watched Brom instruct Eragon in sword fighting.

“Because I don’t need it. I already passed Brom’s level of skill in sword fighting. Plus I’m use to killing dragons, even at my age,” you answered with a quick glare at Saphira before continuing. The first few times you said like things Eragon got rather defensive on her behalf. But now he knew you wouldn’t do anything because he trusted Saphira wouldn’t do anything that would make you attack her. However, only Brom knew you could more than slaughter her if you so wished. “Compared to a dragon, humans are easy to defeat.”

“But don’t you need practice?” Eragon asked as he tried to solidify his point.

“Not really,” you answered bluntly. Again, he didn’t know why but Brom smirked at your answer. Saphira seemed to notice this and took note of Brom’s lack of instruction on your part.

“Want to prove it?” Eragon asked as he might’ve thought you were bluffing and he could more easily win against you rather than Brom. “You are a few years younger than I. If you think you don’t need to than prove it to me and I’ll never bother you about it again.”

“Fine,” you agreed as you grabbed 2 practice sticks. “I doubt you’ll keep to that agreement unless I really prove it so I’ll take you both on at once. Don’t worry Brom, I’ll only leave lumps on Eragon’s all wise head.”

“How did I get roped into fighting you?” Brom asked himself as he readied his stance alongside Eragon. It was a more serious stance than what he was using against Eragon.

“Let’s go!” Eragon said as he charged foolishly before Brom could stop him. He slashed at you but you easily sidestepped him and brought an elbow across his face to drive him back to Brom’s side easily but without too much damage. You had enough to deal with without dealing with the aftermath of breaking Eragon’s nose. “You just got lucky.”

“If you say so,” you said as you playfully rotated your sword in circles in your hand before they both nodded to each other and attacked as a unit. It wasn’t that effective with Eragon’s lack of skill but Brom more than made up for the holes in Eragon’s defenses. But it took all of a few seconds for you to parry a slash from both of them by sailing over the top in a flip of sorts so you could whack their arms with your practice swords, making Eragon drop his and Brom to get stunned for a second so you could land and face them on the other side. “Yes, lucky indeed. Never would’ve seen that coming.”

“Do you mind slowing down so I can teach him at least something?” Brom asked as he looked at you as if to say ‘take it easy already’.

You nodded to which they tried again. You let them come at you to which you blocked slower and attacked in speeds that they could block and dodge. More often Eragon would drop his sword from a hard hit or something and you were stuck fighting Brom until rejoined. This continued till Eragon got a few lumps and Brom was tired enough to call it off. Eragon could barely hold his stick and you were just standing there as if you were just starting.

“Had enough, wonder boy?” You asked as you twirled the two sticks playfully, indicating you were more than ready for another round or to answer any doubts about his previous assumptions.

“Well if you haven’t than I have. Have fun kid.” Brom stated as he plopped down by the fire to get some rest and stoke his pipe.

“Fine, I admit that you’re good. Happy?” Eragon asked as he pouted while slumping on a bedroll against Saphira while you went to the opposite side of the fire, as usual.

“Quite. You would be to if you had been on the winning side. Do you want to try again tomorrow or would you prefer Brom’s teaching?” You asked in a way that indicated you were up for it if he was.

“NO!... uh no. I think Brom would be a good enough teacher, goodnight.” He said as he curled up with his fatigue and bumps to keep him company with Saphira. Soon he rolled again after she laughed at him as well. This light interaction didn’t go unnoticed as you observed them. Brom noticed this and nodded for you to get some rest. You hesitated while Saphira was around but he insisted, saying that he would wake you if anything arose. You trusted him and got your first night’s sleep in the time you had been traveling with her. But as usual, your night was not accompanied by good dreams and you were reminded why keeping an eye on Saphira was a good idea.
