13232111121122111221111121121111211.content:
You all arrived in Therinsford before too long to get the horses. But as you would soon see, there would be a slight problem other than the bridge idiot that made your little group pay to cross. You almost fell over laughing when you and Brom both had the same idea as you both paid him but ‘accidentally’ bumped into him to more than make up your money you lost. Either way, you all made it to the stable to get the horses.

“Ok, take good care of them,” The man selling the horses said to which Brom and Eragon led them away before addressing the issue.

“So what are we going to do about this?” asked Eragon.

“Indeed, we needed 3 horses but only got 2,” Brom agreed.

“One of you could always ride on me,” Saphira offered into all your minds. The only reason you left that door open to her was so that she could speak on occasion. But she didn’t really speak to you that often at the current time.

“Huh,” you snuffed at the idea. You knew that the only one that WOULD ride her at the moment was Brom and he wouldn’t for some reason. Maybe he was saving his riding for doing it with you. “I’ll just run. It won’t be that hard to keep the horses’ pace.”

“You crazy? You can’t run as fast as a horse!” Eragon exclaimed.

“You can think what you want,” you said then looked at Brom as he knew you could handle it. But he was the one you entrusted with the planning. You had told him that you would tell them about you when he thought it was the right time or if it was unavoidable for some reason.

“Max has been training to slay dragons and as such can run as fast as a horse. If nothing else this might give him a workout while we ride,” Brom agreed. What he said was technically true but also it wasn’t the whole truth. But it seemed to convince the other two to which you all were off and they saw first hand that you could keep up with them rather well. Brom was right on the other end as well. It was more of a work out that you were used to. They talked about what the schedule was going to be as you all traveled. Saphira was ether too far away or just patient in letting them decide. By the time night came you all slept while you took watch, again. Saphira would blink her eyes open every one in a while but see you glaring at her and go back to sleep. She was beginning to believe the unlikely fact that you were actually capable and experienced in slaying dragons, probably more impressive than herself. Your running all day at the speed of at least horses was not something that was now taken lightly by her and rose a few questions that she was beginning to be too afraid to voice a concern about.

It was during one of the last days across a long valley like place that a huge storm was upon all of you. You had thought Saphira would have some sense in getting out of the sky beforehand but apparently not as Eragon told her to get land. She was too late however and the strong gusts took her by the wings and were effectively throwing her around. Eragon looked to be moving to help but the wind was too strong so you reluctantly came to her aid. You ran to one side of her than dove with a considerable amount of force when she was rolling and her other wing was almost retracted but the other was out all the way. This forced the extended one to fold into place as you collided with her it made the other one hit the ground and closed it as well. She seemed to be having trouble keeping them closed so you reached out and held them to her side tightly so she could move more freely. This lasted a considerable amount of time as they all traveled and you could’ve sworn you saw a smile on Brom’s face at what you were doing. It almost made you let go and just let her weather this storm by herself. But you had started it so you were going to finish it. Finally the storm relented and you lay exhausted on her as you all stopped for the night.

“Tell him thank you.” You heard from Saphira as you jumped off her and went to your normal spot but almost fell to sleep as soon as you were sitting down.

“Saphira said ‘thank you’,” Eragon relayed as he was also thankful you helped.

“Yeah well don’t expect it all the time. She should’ve known better than to stay up in the air as long as she did. You being surprised in the air is one thing. She shouldn’t as a FLYING dragon,” you said back but paused between as she just sighed at your constant attitude. “Still, it wasn’t as bad as I thought. Maybe she isn’t like the other dragons I’ve seen.”

“Can I see your bow?” Eragon asked, changing the subject with an item you had that he was curious about for a while.

“Sure,” you answered as you pulled it out of its sheath and handed it to him. Brom almost had a fit but remembered that even if he held it he wouldn’t be able to use it. Only you had the strength to use it.

“Damn, how do you pull this thing back? It feels like solid metal.” Eragon asked as he tried but was unsuccessful, obviously.

“Like this,” you answered as you pulled it back a few times for show than handed it back to him to gawk at. “It is a dragon slayer bow, more or less. That is what I made it for. Basically it is strong enough to send an arrow through the hardest dragon scales. Brom can testify that it would be more than efficient to do so. Since it has blades on the shaft, it can double as a deadly melee weapon.”

“He must really hate Dragons.” Saphira said to Eragon. You felt like yelling at them that you could hear them but you didn’t want to ruin their little bit of privacy they thought they had. Eragon hesitantly looked at the weapon made to kill dragons then gave it back to you. You soon went to bed and left them with that thought as you got some much needed rest, however you would get as much rest as you usually got when sleeping, not much.

Brom calms them so you don't need to explain.
132321111211221112211111211211112111.content:
You all slowly made your way toward Yazuac. After they told Saphira to wait a safe distance away the 3 of you went to the village. At the first house you all stopped and you took an involuntary step back.

“What?” asked Brom at first as you spun around and did so as if searching for something but was highly agitated. Then he saw anger creep into your face to which he nudged closer before asking again. “What is it?”

“Death, and lots of it. I don’t like this place.” You almost growled out. He could see the hair on your neck stand on end to which he took a moment to talk it over with Eragon.

“We need provisions, so we’ll proceed carefully. We still need to at least see what happened here.” Brom decided so you all eased into the village. As you all got deeper it made each of you draw your weapon. Brom took it more seriously when he saw you do the same. You two had already talked about the use of that weapon. It should be done sparingly if not never. “gods above” he shuttered out as you three settled briefly at a literal mound of bodies that had been stacked as if a trophy to the carnage. But if it had been just soldiers that it would’ve been understandable, still disturbing at the sheer amount but understandable none the less. But no, the vast majority of them were women and children. As if to prove this there was an infant impaled at the top of the large mound that Eragon shot an arrow at a crow to protect the child even in death. “This is Urgal work.” He said at one point as Brom evaluated the scene and kept doing so to gain needed clues.

“Urgals,” you clearly growled to which Brom looked at you. Sure he’d seen you give deathly glares at Saphira for your hatred of dragons but this was on a whole other level. You were in a raged bloodlust at this point. It looked like he was going to try to calm you down but was unable to as a battle began. Unlike what would’ve happened you had all got there earlier due to your helping Saphira in the storm and her in turn helping the others. There were an entire company of them. Not the main force but you counted at least 20 as your senses opened up and your eyes changed. You didn’t care that Eragon saw it.

“Behind you!” Eragon exclaimed as an Urgal came up with a swing at you. You were in no mood… or to be more accurate you were in a very dangerous mood. With a quick turn you blocked his blade with your bow and punched him so hard he went through the wall and splattered inside the house with such velocity that the blood splashed out of the openings in the house. The move shocked those who saw it but Brom got Eragon going into a run to get out of the village. He seemed to notice that your mind was clouded at the moment with rage and with a target to point it all at there was little he could or would do to stop you.

You strung an arrow then fired it near Brom and Eragon as a line of Urgals came to intercept them. The arrow struck the first in the chest, went through him and carried on to the next until 5 lay dead and being flown from the high speed impact. Regardless how sleek the arrow was it had a certain effect from traveling so fast. On something hard it blew it to pieces but something soft like flesh or Urgals it went through and took its target for part of the ride.

With the follow through you sliced the head off of another then ruthlessly slaughtered every single Urgal in the village. Sometimes you shot into a wall to get the ones hiding behind it. In a flash you saw a fire magic from an alley then saw Eragon stumble out of it with 2 dead Urgals to his credit. He looked at you then ran to Brom as he looked at you in partial horror for 3 reasons. 1) your eyes were showing 2) you had just turned to literally rip the head off an attacking Urgal with your bare hands as you didn’t need the bow at this point 3) you were covered in blood from your fighting, including the flowing blood from the Urgals you were killing just then. Regardless how tired he was from using magic he ran to get Brom. However you were too blood lusted to stop until you found the last one and ripped him in half the long way so his inside spilled all over the place. You heard a yell as Eragon saw Brom’s injured condition followed by a thud you knew as Saphira as you stood among the dead you had killed, looking at the pile of dead they had killed. You were panting more from the attempt to gain some monocle of calmness, your back toward the others as you didn’t want them to see you until you were composed. But glaring at the heap of dead bodies in front of you didn’t do you any favors.

“Where are the ones who did this? I will tear them apart!” Saphira thought to Eragon.

“It will do little good. They are already dead.” Eragon replied as he pointed at the bodies he had killed and the others you had with you still in the center of it all, not moving but covered in blood from the fight and actually steaming as you body helped cope with your mental state by heating and by default evaporating the blood on you.

They tried to take their mind off of it as you heard a gasp from her as she saw the aftermath and you condition. They wrapped Brom’s wound then put him on Saphira and when ready to go they were hesitant but came to you as you were done steaming, half because you were calming down and half because there was no more blood to burn off your body. They flinched as a growl from you rumbled the ground. They didn’t know how you could do such a thing but at the moment they just needed to get you going with them so they could get out of there.

“Max, are you ok?” Eragon asked, half for your feelings and half for their safety.

“Not even dragons where I lived did things like this. The rare one would destroy an entire village but they saw no sport in slaughtering infants and their mothers in such bulk. There was no honor in this,” you replied as you glared at the pile of bodies. “Let’s get out of here, before I do something foolish.”

You get a good flying in before changing back.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111.content:
On the way out and at a safe camp spot you all walked in relative silence. There were a few more Urgals around and only one was acting as a scout but it didn’t matter. As soon as they were visible they died from your bow. The scout that was running away was a couple hundred yards away but you still nailed him in the head. Because of this, no one spoke as they were all either too tired or too scared to do so. You were distant to say the least. You didn’t even glare at Saphira when she came by or look even faintly at the magic conversation they were having.

“Max!” Brom called for probably a final time after a few others. This time it snapped you out of your staring at the flames of the fire. “Are you ok?”

“Fine, I’m fine,” you repeated.

“He isn’t fine,” Saphira thought to the other two. “He hasn’t glared at me since we got back. Usually he at least puts in a death threat or something by this time. Whatever made him snap in the village was enough to change something in him.”

“I agree,” Brom said to which you looked at him. “You’ve said you trust me and that we are as family, and I believe you. But part of a family is sharing our pains and… our secrets with each other. I think it is about time you did both. After all, I wasn’t the one that told you to show part of yourself in that fight. Fact, in this case, is more acceptable than speculation.”

“I… I don’t feel good right now,” you said, trying to make a good excuse why you could avoid the discussion.

“That is why it must be said. How can we help you if you don’t let us?” Brom asked to which he put a hand on your shoulder and gripping it firmly.

“How could they live with doing something like that?” You asked as you turned your gaze back into the fire. “Battle is one thing, or even a dragon’s hunger is another. Even if I hate dragons, where I come from, for doing so it is still understandable. But this… how can the taking of life that was so innocent be ok with anyone? What threat or reason is there for taking pride in taking so much pure and innocent life. I could see it in them, they were not only proud for what they did but also comically reciting it. What the hell is so funny about it?!”

“You are young, Max. There are forces at work that make that seem tame. I have only one answer for you in that regard. Those that take such delight in such a thing are more than deserving of the title ‘EVIL’. I am guessing you know that, or you wouldn’t have slaughtered them so mercilessly. Be just and pure Max, don’t let this evil form your life. Learn from it and move on. Not all Urgals are capable of such evil, just like the same for humans or dragons,” Brom answered. You didn’t like it and it would still be on your mind for a considerable amount of time but you understood what he was saying. “For what its worth, I’m glad you feel so strongly AGAINST such evil behavior. It says volumes about where your morality lies.”

“Thanks, I think,” you answered then looked over at the other 2, who were still concerned about your previous mood set, along with what you did with it. “You really think I should tell them, now?”

“We can handle anything you trust us with,” Eragon replied. For some reason he had a habit of keeping secrets but felt entitled to other people’s secrets. It was an annoying standpoint but in this case he was correct. It had long passed been the time to tell them. You had given the reigns over to Brom for that kind of talk so you were being sure. You looked at Brom and he nodded then moved slightly away, giving you some room.

“I will hold you to that Eragon, and Saphira,” you said. Then, with a long pause between, you let your eyes shine out again. They both seemed to react to it but not as much as when you suddenly sprung your wings and tail from your back to flex outward. Eragon would’ve fell over backwards if he wasn’t already leaning against Saphira.

“What! What are you?” Eragon almost demanded but with an aura of fear as well. Saphira acted similar but since she was already laying down she didn’t do the whole falling over thing. The only thing that was keeping them from acting out against you or away from you was that Brom seemed to be watching the conversation unfold with an entertained grin on his face.

“Isn’t that obvious? Here’s another clue,” you stated as you breathed in then let out some flame breath into the air long enough to be considered flame breath. “Come on; scales, slitted eyes, wings, a tail, and can breathe fire.”

“No way.” You heard Saphira state then seemed to realize that if you were a dragon that you would be able to here her. “You’ve been able to hear me this entire time?”

“Yes, I am a dragon after all.” You started then the conversation progressed quickly to one about your history. You reluctantly told them, again. The scene unfolded with more calm and collected understanding with Brom there to help. After a few lasting questions you got up and walked away slightly.

“Where are you going?” Eragon asked.

“Changing to a full dragon. You have no idea how cramped it can be, hiding out in human form all the time. Plus, I would love to get some flying in tonight, after the sun goes down,” you answered then walked a little bit further. When you got far enough away you started the process. Thankfully you were both far enough away and had Brom to keep them from ‘coming to your aid’. Eventually they stopped arguing as your cries of pain became snarls and growls. You must’ve been getting used to it or the running endurance was helping you with your endurance with this as well. Because as soon as you were all done you were actually able to move and walk. Sure it still hurt like no other but you weren’t limp by any means.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111.title: They want answers and you give them.

13232111121122111221111121121111211111.content:
“Ow, that hurt!” You growled out then shook your head to get the cobwebs out. When you finally made it back to the fire and looked at them Saphira was halfway between trying to protect Eragon while he hid behind her and cowering below you. Until this moment, she was the strongest person in the group, that they knew of. Now that a 500 foot tall, and never mind how long, dragon was looming over head it was a sudden realization.

“Still isn’t any easier?” Brom asked, trying to strike up more of a subtle conversation in order to bring everyone around to a common ground.

“Well, all that running made the endurance easier. Otherwise I’d be bed ridden for a few hours,” you answered as you laid down next to him then lowered your head so you were in the circled of people around the small fire.

“H-how can you speak out loud?” Eragon asked.

“I already told you that. I can speak for two reasons. First, ALL my human abilities transfer over to my dragon side as do they the other way around. Second, I trained a lot to do so. A dragon’s speech usually isn’t tuned to human or human like speech. It is hard to learn, but possible,” you answered.

“And… you’re not going to… uh???” Eragon started to ask but wasn’t sure how to ask if you were going to kill/eat Saphira. It was clear now that you could do as you wished in that regard.

“I won’t lie, she does smell very appeasing and I can imagine what she tastes like. But I’ve made a promise to Brom. Because this realm only has a few dragons left, I have to at least give each dragon a chance to prove themselves. If the dragon in question isn’t EVIL, then I won’t kill and/or eat them. That includes the King’s dragon and Saphira. While I still have my eye on her…” you answered than paused to look straight at her to which she quivered under your gaze. “… she seems to be at least halfway decent.”

“Thank you,” Saphira thought to you as she whimpered.

“Ok, enough scaring them to death,” Brom interrupted to which you came back to your new position around the fire. “Max, I’ve been thinking. I think it might be better if you stay in dragon form. As useful as it is to have you disguised it also dampens Eragon’s ability to learn when you do everything for us. So, at least until it is very necessary, will you be ok with staying as a dragon?”

“I won’t mind in the least,” you answered simply but with a content smile that he knew all too well. Brom knew how sky sick you were. You longed to go soaring through the sky as a full dragon and now you would be able to.

“Wait! Does this mean you’re HIS dragon?” Eragon asked.

“No. Like I explained, from my realm there are all kinds of dragons around. Only a small section of them are like the ones here that need riders. That and I am a half-breed. So, in a sense, I am my own rider. But I don’t mind having unofficial riders like that Sarah girl or Brom. Although…” You answered then paused to look right at Brom to which he returned a curious glance. “… I haven’t let Brom ride me yet. Well to be more accurate we haven’t had the time to do so.”

“I don’t think I can make a saddle for you. No offense, but you are HUGE,” Brom replied back.

“I don’t need one. My retractable spikes can make one for you to use. Come on, I’m not taking no for an answer,” you stated as you made a seat for him then grabbed him with your teeth on the back of his clothes, then deposited him onto the seat then took off all before he could do much about it. For a second it looked like you were snapping him up for a different reason. But as you flew with him secured to your back the feeling of danger was gone.

“That was a little dramatic,” Brom stated after he got his breath back.

“I figured that there would be a hundred reasons why you wouldn’t and only one reason why you wanted to and I couldn’t say it in front of them. Come on, you’re as sky sick as I am,” you replied back with a quick glance back at him before you leveled off and soared high above.

“Perhaps but…” Brom started then looked around as he realized you were more than right about it. He could see your relief at flying mix with his own. “… I suppose one flight won’t hurt. But this can’t happen often so let’s get it out of our system. Or at least my system, you’ll be flying with Saphira while we travel. So let’s GO!”

With that you banked sharply and went into a bunch of desirable maneuvers that you both were missing and some that made him laugh openly at the feeling. Other times he was crying at the riding another dragon. His thoughts went back to his own dragon so many years ago. But after a moment for sentimentality you didn’t let him dwell in sadness. To that effect you would pull something off to get his mind off of things. Diving, banking, twirling, dropping him then catching him in multiple ways were just some of the things you did, making him feel like a true dragon rider again and you his dragon, at least for the duration of this experience.
13232111121122111221111121121111211111.title: They want you in dragon form for a while.

132321111211221112211111211211112111111.content:
Traveling with the group as a dragon was a different experience. Because of your size, you had to hide in the clouds with Saphira. On completely clear days you had to wait for night then catch up with them, which wasn’t hard. You also made it a point to cover your tracks, or at the very least make it seam like you were smaller than your actual size. Hunting wasn’t really that much of a challenge so you took it easy at times. Suffice to say, you had a lot more time to get to know Saphira as you both flew in the sky. It took a little while before she broke the silence that her fear had caused. Wither she thought you would’ve already killed her if that was what you wanted or that you were starting to like her, either way, she started trying to talk with you.

“Max, is it ok if we talk?” Saphira asked. There was a wider range of how she could talk with you. Thanks to your genetic knowledge, you could pretty much speak any language without realizing it and naturally you could hear each one as well. But for the sake of others, you all decided that dragons should be restricted to thought speech unless something warranted a more feral approach. It also cut down on people knowing about you.

“A month ago I might’ve snapped your head off for doing so. But now… I suppose I can’t really hate you. I still hate dragons but you as a person are ok. I suppose you would have to be to put up with Eragon. As pure hearted as he is, he requires a considerable amount of patience that speaks a lot about you,” you answered.

“Well, thank you for that. If you don’t mind me saying so, you’re huge. I mean, Dragons in general are big but you… It looks like you could take on anything and still laugh about it,” Saphira stated. You weren’t really sure if it was a question or compliment. You were pretty sure she wasn’t confident enough to insult you, yet.

“Back on Base Realm, Dark Hunters are greatly feared as I have said. I am a great deal larger than most Dark Hunters in general but even one of your size fighting another type of dragon of my size, the Dark Hunter would still easily win. It would only make sense that a Dark Hunter King like me, born with all the genetic knowledge, would be more… impressive than the others. However, it doesn’t mean I’m any harder to kill if hit in the right spot. Cut my heart out or lop off my head, and I die just like any other creature would. Having me let someone do that is another story,” you answered as you soared through a tight cloud formation with her. It was tight enough for the two of you to brush against each other before widening out again.

“So… how many dragons have you eaten?” She asked nervously.

“Probably about as many deer you have, times the amount of years I’ve been living in Base Realm,” you answered.

“Oh.” She replied back in a quivering tone that you knew you would have to fix. You didn’t need her being wrongly scared of you. Respect you, yes but not blindly scared.

“What you need to understand about that is that there are very few dragons that put any value on humans where I come from, well nothing above food or sadistic entertainment. Those that are the normal measure in the hundreds of thousands. So to protect humans, even ones that hunt me in return, I have to take down a lot of them. Going out hunting after taking down a large dragon just isn’t considerate to anyone with all that meat there. So I eat the dragons I kill, more specifically the ones that threaten my territory, those that I am protecting, or me. It also scares the crap out of any foolish enough to try,” you explained.

“What about humans? With us probably going to war, I will probably have to kill some and I probably will eat a few as well. It would be foolish to do so if you are… very opposed to it.” She asked.

“I trust that you won’t take it too far. I’ve ate/killed my share of humans as well. However, not for being rude or some other small blunder. Dragons are the ones that earned the spot of blind rage on my part. I usually always give them a way out. If they are evil or don’t take it, even after some aggressive negotiating, than I do what I have to. Like my thoughts on dragons, no point wasting the meat. But for me to be ok with someone else doing it I have to trust them. You are at that level. Not blind trust, but enough for me to know you won’t try to eat innocent people,” you answered back.

“Of course I wouldn’t do that!” Saphira exclaimed when the thought was brought up. The recent slaughter of innocents by the Urgals might’ve spawned the high distaste for the sight. “What is ‘aggressive negotiating’?”

“That is when I let my body do the talking. Kind of like snarling at someone, it just scares them with minimal to no damage. In my case, the roughest I get is drawing a little blood or swallowing them whole,” you answered.

“Swallowing them whole?!” she exclaimed.

“Yes. You see, I have a second stomach for storage. But not a lot of people know that. So when I swallow them they are completely safe. I can even heal people considerably well while inside with magic and other means. But too someone that is on the receiving end, it can be a very frightening experience. Frightening enough to help them realize their mistake. I release them as good as new, minus some soiled pants from the scare. But, let’s keep that ability between you and me. I don’t need people asking to be eaten then others freaking out,” you requested. The way you explained it stimulated areas of her head that made her not only understand but agree.

“Sure.” She agreed. The group had already decided to almost forget that you could change back to human form. If hiding Saphira’s status was hard, try keeping a lid on a transforming half-breed. So you were to be taken as just another dragon. That meant no talking out loud on your part. Not a problem, since you could interact with minds and such like the others. You didn’t need to do more than growl to ignorant fools anyway.
132321111211221112211111211211112111111.title: Getting to know Saphira.

choices: You stay outside Teirm with Saphira.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
“Come on, you to,” you stated as Brom was having Saphira go flying with Eragon. Didn’t take much convincing on her part, but on Eragon’s it was harder. All he remembered was the feeling of his raw thighs afterward. But as soon as you turned the tables on Brom Eragon seemed more up to it. If for no other reason than to be better than Brom at something. Whining about it would only serve to show his weakness. Brom on the other hand saw what you were doing and its effect, as did Saphira.

“Fine…” Brom said in a mock tone. He secured the horses then got onto a spot on your back.

“Ha, got a taste of your own medicine you old…” Eragon started but Saphira took a leap then took off into the air before he could finish.

“Kids.” Brom stated to which you took off as well. The speed you were traveling made him smile in both memory and deed. You both saw Eragon almost freaking out when Saphira did something too radical. “Should we show the kids how it’s done?”

“As you wish, just don’t fall off… come to think of it, don’t worry about it. If you fall, I’ll catch you and make it seem like you planned it,” you agreed then banked to soar closer to Eragon as he got done surviving a barrel roll from Saphira. You and Brom seemed to have the same idea. So while he was complaining, you flipped so your back was facing down and soared that way, just above the other two.

“Don’t do that!” Eragon exclaimed. “It feels like I’m going to fall off.”

“What’s the matter kid, can’t handle a little air superiority?” Brom asked to which both of them looked up to see you and Brom not more than a few feet above them. For an old man, his legs were really strong. They held him while his hands were free to give Eragon a pat on the back without even looking like he was working at staying in his current position.

“Come on, you really think Saphira would let you fall all the way to your death?” You asked as you flipped over and soared beside her. “It’s our job to be good at the whole flying and support thing. You want to see what happens when a rider is separated mid flight from their dragon?”

Without waiting for his response you turned to which Brom let go and began to fall. You banked at an insane speed as Eragon yelled out of instinct of the event. You passed Brom a few times for good measure then caught him gently on your head a mere 50 feet from the ground. You kept your head so level he didn’t have to adjust his balance as you rose again to meet up with an awestruck Saphira and Eragon.

“You… you dropped him, on purpose!” Eragon accused.

“Technically he let go,” you play argued.

“Why would you even risk that?” asked Saphira, equally appalled why both of you would take such an insane risk. “You could’ve caught him sooner even and you decided to play with his life like that.”

“That’s an easy question to answer,” Brom stated. It was a good thing you all could speak in each other’s minds. With the speed and distance, neither of you could project your voice to be heard in any form of speaking normally. But either way, they both looked at Brom to continue. “I trust him with everything I have. I’m not even his rider and I trust that his experience and choices will not do me harm while my life is entrusted to him. Eragon and Saphira, you both are connected more deeply than Max and I will ever be and yet you can’t trust each other in something so basic. If Saphira wants to drop you for a second there shouldn’t be the slightest bit of worry that she will catch you. Sure some practice couldn’t hurt but trust should be a constant. Eragon, so what if you fall off? You really think Saphira would let you die if she could do anything about it?”

“Ok, I get it. Next question, how do you fly like that?!” Asked Eragon as the unique position was now addressed. You did have Brom on your head rather than on your back or in a saddle.

“Honestly, I got no clue. Max?” Brom asked.

“Well, I thought you would like not being strapped in a saddle for a while. I can use magic to keep you there, so there isn’t any problem as far as hanging on. That and it doesn’t seem like you mind at all,” you answered.

“Suppose so,” Brom agreed.

“You can use magic too?” asked Eragon in a tone that was clear that he was understanding just how out classed he was at the moment.

“Well yeah, I am a dragon with the abilities of both human and dragon. Why is it so surprising? You didn’t seem to mind when I had the strength of this form in my human one. It shouldn’t be too much of a stretch to believe that all the magic a normal dragon has could be exerted at my will,” you answered.

“I suppose you can breathe fire already as well?” Saphira asked.

“Well I’ve been alive for near 16 years so, yeah. You would be able to as well if you had that much time,” you answered so that she didn’t feel too bad about it. But it was hard not to feel outclassed on her side as well. You were not only huge size wise but also strong in multiple areas that she hadn’t even touched yet. “Well, you two won’t get any better or stronger just talking about me. So go at it and have fun. I know that is what we plan on doing.”

With that you four all played in the air for a bit. It was some time before you all had your fill and had filled the entire day with the joyous experiences of flying with a rider or dragon, depending who was thinking about it. You all got closer as a result and it was a necessary motivation boost to show the two young ones what was ahead for them as far as skill and whatnot.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: Continue.

choices: Payback on Urgals, more like clean up for Eragon.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
“Why the hell does he want me to be in human form and still outside the city, yet still retaining as much dragon as I can? I look like a side show freak.” You asked in frustration as you sat near Saphira.

Brom had asked you to change do in no small part to your massive size. However he still wanted you to be as different as possible for them to get use to you. That meant flying in your ‘Draconic human’ form, as they liked to call any form that had both characteristics. Most of the time he had you protrude every last bit of dragon as you could. You now looked like you were a 7 foot tall dragon that had a crude humanoid form mixed in. Your scales completely covered you, your claws and talons were protruded along with your teeth and a few spikes, your tail and wings of course, and also eyes and no hair. You looked very threatening but not unappealing. It was strange as Saphira still seemed relatively distracted by this perverse form you were asked to be in. Sure you could come out when other people were around but you still felt very uncomfortable as were they, which is perhaps one of the reasons why he required it.

“I think you look more than presentable and Eragon said you looked ‘cool’. I’m not sure exactly what that means as a dragon you are naturally hot but I assume that it means that you look most presentable and pleasing to both human and dragon alike,” Saphira answered nervously. She wasn’t nervous about you killing and/or eating her anymore. You all had gone far past that at this point. No, you suspected that her nervousness came from a much more primal reaction to you as a dragon, a male dragon to be more precise.

“I suppose so. I just get a little self conscious when like… this,” you paused as you gestured to yourself as you got up and was able to thoughtlessly skewer a rabbit and eat it as if an afterthought and fast enough to not miss a beat in the conversation. “I mean, this is why I was exiled from my realm in the first place. At least in all dragon or all human form people know what to expect. When they know that I am both and neither they don’t know what to do, either side. Thus I’m not too comfortable parading this out in the open.”

“Then don’t. We all said that it is better to only tell a selected amount of people and those a very limited amount. You can hide well enough to scare me and can pass as a human well enough. But then again, in a world like this, where magic is coveted and different species are just as much so, it can work in your favor. NO ONE will be like you so you don’t have to worry about it like Eragon and I do of another rider or the King. You get the best of both worlds, I would be proud of it but then again I am only half of what you are… kind of,” Saphira tried to answer. She may have been young but she knew more than she ought at such an age. You enjoyed listening to her, despite her being a dragon.

“Saphira, you may be right about that. I only need to satisfy a few people. It isn’t like they can just get rid of me and find another of my kind to fit their definition of what is proper and such. How about this, I will link my decision making roughly to yours. When you are revealed to others than I will be more outspoken. That way, my allies will be the same… hopefully. Does that make sense?” You asked, actually taking stock in her opinion. You knew that seeing her would cushion your presence.

“It does in fact. But I do have to say, you are no fair,” she answered then teased.

“No fair?” you asked.

“Yeah, NO FAIR. You get all this power and skill and we have to do things the long way. How in the world are we suppose to compete with that?” She asked.

“Very carefully,” you teased back. “You two are young, and Eragon VERY young. I’m sure you two will grow. I will say that I’ll help when you two get good enough to spar more openly with me. I would start now but I think having an open dragon battle may not fit Brom’s image of keeping a low profile.”

“You’re right about that,” Saphira chuckled in a dragon fashion. If she was having a hard enough time hiding without you adding to the mix. “Come and get some sleep. It is late and we should close to keep from being spotted as easy.”

“Ok, thanks for listening and talking with me Saphira,” you said back as you walked over to her side then laid down like you would as a dragon in a curled up position with your wings confined. She mimicked you but also spread a wing over you like a blanket.

“No problem…” she started then added a last part that she thought you couldn’t sense from deeper in her thought but you let it go. “… little dragon.”

At first you were angered by it. But you soon took it as a more possessive tense of the phrase. You had never had a mother and Brom was like your father. Even if Saphira was lower than you in most senses you liked that she treated you as something precious. As precious as a mother would a baby, or perhaps a dragon would to a mate. But you either way, you took it as pleasantly as possible. The feeling you got with her and Brom was very pleasant… and even Eragon. If all of them were there it was almost enough to negate the nightmares you had. Even with just her it helps a great deal. So you closed your red dragon eyes and slept.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: You stay outside Teirm with Saphira.

choices: Ra'zac cornered the group, bad idea with you there.
Ra'zac use something to capture you as well.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
While Eragon came to visit a good number of times it was still you and Saphira for a majority of the time. Suffice to say, you were both happy to get back moving when it was time. Hiding in such a fashion was not either of your preference. It was a little further and during one of Eragon’s flying that Urgals were perusing and had caught Eragon’s eye. You were zipping through the air too far away to stop him before he went to them then attacked with magic. Of course he passed out from the exhaustion just as you got there. You were just in time to smack an incoming Urgal that was trying to attack Saphira.

“Nice timing,” Brom said as he got there as well.

“Yes, very nice,” Saphira agreed.

“You think you are fast enough to get the rest of them?” Brom asked.

“It would my pleasure,” you answered in perhaps too eager of a tone then was off hunting all the Urgals that were in the area. They all knew that out of all them, you were the most against Urgals because of the village from before that was wiped out. With your Draconic Form you tore through them easily. You got to taste them a little this time and ironically they weren’t that bad. Sure they were a little off but the taste and texture was far from unpleasant. You actually took a few bites of one that you killed at the end. You made a mental note to try it again when you were full dragon again. It was a while, even at your speed, to track down all of them. As you got back, Eragon was awake and being drilled for his actions. “So, the wise spell caster has awoken.”

“Yeah, yeah. I’m already getting grilled about it,” Eragon said but it didn’t stop you from slugging him over the head hard enough to get his attention. “What was that for?”

“Let’s see; almost killing yourself, revealing Saphira, revealing me, and making me clean up your mess. It was hard enough normally, not to mention you giving them a head start by throwing them so far,” you answered before sitting down by the fire.

“So you got them all?” Brom asked.

“Yes, well at least all the Urgals. I couldn’t tell if there was any other forces in the area. From what I sensed from them, they were commanded by a shade. He could be spying on them all the while in which case it was pointless. But yeah, I did get all the ones that were here,” you answered as you wiped some of the blood off.

“Hmm, not bad,” Saphira commented as she helped you clean your body with her tongue. Naturally she was careful about your wings and being too forward but a tongue bath was well within her rights as a fellow dragon you trusted and cared for at this point.

“My thoughts exactly. If they ever make the mistake of attacking while I’m full dragon I think I will have a feast,” you agreed to which she gave you another lick than you responded by stroking her eye ridge a few times as she relaxed by you, Eragon on the other side of her head. As his dragon, she was closer to him but still liked your presence as another dragon.

“You would eat them?” Eragon asked, more than a bit grossed out. Brom was, as usual, just observing and smirking at dragon behavior that he knew all too well.

“Uh, yeah. What would it be like for you??? I suppose it would be like a cooked rabbit trying to attack you. Sure you could kill the thing, but you could just as easily eat it. I know it isn’t exactly the same but pretty close. If some enemy is stupid enough to attack us and is good tasting then they are fair game and they should know that as well. Seriously, who is dumb enough to attack a dragon and think there will be no fallout?” You explained.

“Fine, whatever you say dragon boy,” Eragon scoffed. You didn’t take too much offense to it as he was still young and dealing with dragon related stuff. With that he leaned against Saphira and went to sleep and left you to think with the other two and think you did.

“What’s bothering you Max?” asked Brom, seeing you thinking deeply.

“Nothing that another friend of mine hasn’t already helped me with,” you revealed then gave Saphira a final stroke before curling up to sleep yourself. You could feel her smile at the credit you gave her. She also was a little anxious as she knew you were still bothered by not only your current appearance but also the memories and emotions attached to it. You went to sleep and could’ve sworn you heard her explaining it to Brom but was too tired to care at the moment.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: Payback on Urgals, more like clean up for Eragon.

choices: You awake in a cell, still poisoned.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
Dras-Leona was the next stop of notice on your group’s journey to find the Ra’zac. To be honest, you didn’t really care if you found them or not. They hadn’t openly threatened anyone you knew or cared about, well accept Slone in which case you would actually want to thank them. But either way, that would change soon. As usual, Eragon and Brom went in and you were stuck outside the city for long periods of time. But just like before, they got into some trouble and barely made it out. Brom restricted you from using your flame breath to deal with the city and you waited for their explanation but something was wrong.

“What is it?” asked Saphira to which Brom noticed your behavior as well.

“I can sense something in the air. I can’t remember what it is but it is bad,” you answered as you rose to your feet and sniffed around. Your anthro looking snout and features were tuned toward the strange scent instead of the enemy you should’ve been focusing on. But you were so engrossed you didn’t realize it till it was too late and you just fell over like a tree.

“Max! What is wrong?!” Saphira exclaimed loud enough in your mind for the others to hear. You now knew exactly what was wrong. There was the same gas from the egg that Kara’s parent’s used. But since you were in the direct center of both forms it didn’t change you. That was all the luck you had in this situation. Because the paralyzing and knock out effects were still in play, as well as the limiting of your abilities to an extent.

“How did they know…?” was all you could say before everything went dark and fuzzy until you were trapped in your nightmares till the drug wore off

When it did you tried getting up but couldn’t. You tried to move other parts of your body but that didn’t work either. The only part you could move was your head, and just enough to look around as soon as your eyes would allow it. What you saw was not very welcome. You saw everyone restrained with you and Saphira more heavily so. You tried using your tail as soon as you could but it was like every inch of you was stapled to the wall with iron shackles. They would’ve been a piece of cake to break if that damn poison didn’t sap your strength. You estimated you only had enough energy to use a single long gust of flame breath. Maybe enough to burn Brom’s or Eragon’s ropes off, if you didn’t burn them to a crisp with the ropes. But there was another problem, the Ra’zac were walking around the room threatening each of you.

“What are you?” asked one of them as he looked at your new movement and your swiveling head. Your head snapped to him as he spoke and only answered with a snarl. You weren’t about to show you could speak to this idiot. You tried talking with the others but your mind speech didn’t work either. You guessed they were trying and hoping yours would work but they soon realized it wasn’t.

“Can we kill this one?” asked the other Ra’zac as he looked at you.

“No, he might be some kind of dragon and if that isss the casssse than the King would want to get hissss handsss on him,” the other answered.

“What about this one?” asked the other again as he gestured to Brom. He had already asked but obviously it was the only one out of your group he would be able to do so. You made a lunging bite for the nearest one but only got part of his cloak before he pulled away then buried his foot in your gut. A blow you just shook off in the adrenaline but actually did some damage in your weakened state. Being that this was your second time under this drug, you body was working very hard on building an immunity to it. But it would take a generous amount of time. Time that Brom didn’t have.

“Go ahead, do it!” the other said to both of their delight. You really began to struggle to get at them at this point.

They seemed to revel at this but that soon turned to a scream as arrows pierced the darkness and into them. A quick series of events played as a small battle was waged but the end was something you’d never forget. The arrows drove them back and at a last effort they threw a knife at Eragon. Why he was expendable at this point and not before was not clear to you. What was clear was Brom jumping in the path of the knife.

“NO!” Eragon yelled before he was rendered unconscious from old and new wounds.

However you lost all control as you saw Brom slumping, apparently dead, to the ground. You glared at the Ra’zac and let out all the flames you could at them. They fled faster than you could attack but the intensity was not a small matter. With your remaining strength you tried to break your binds but it just made darkness come upon you quicker. Your energy spent, you could do nothing but go into your nightmares again, with a new one that haunted you worse than the others. Brom was in no small manner your adoptive father now. You knew that without you there he would die. You knew that even with you there it was pretty sure he would die. Worse of all, you knew your binds were too tough to break for them to get you out, whomever came to your rescue. You would never be able to say goodbye to Brom, your father. And so your hatred of the Ra’zac finally matched Eragon’s. If you ever saw them again, you wouldn’t care what was at stake, you would make sure they were no longer in this world.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: Ra'zac use something to capture you as well.

choices: Jail break with Eragon and an elf, brought to you by Murtagh and Saphira.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
You didn’t wake for a very long time. That was torture for you as you were forced to relive your new darkest memory over and over in your usually line up of nightmares. No wonder why you hated dragons so much and why you were very quickly hating the Ra’zac equally for how many times their ending of Brom’s life was replayed. You were relieved when you finally woke up but only to be placed back in the land of confusion. The only perk was you had movement. You quickly got up but realized it was only a limited movement. Your tail, wrists, waist, and feet were all latched to chains so you couldn’t easily break them… well while under that damned drug/poison. You could feel your body almost had the immunity worked out. They seemed to have given you an extra strong dose because your fire lung didn’t work either this time. You thrashed and but finally sat on the floor facing the door with the sun coming in your window. At last some luck. You gained energy from the sun to use when the drug was rendered useless. You couldn’t wait for that. This was the second time that damned drug/poison had messed with your life, there would not be a third. There was one thing you could do though. With a large breath you roared as loud and as ferocious as you could. The roar shook your cell and you hoped the entire place to illustrate how very angry you were.

A few hours after that you heard your door starting to open to which you got to your feet and stood as intimidating as you could, glaring at the door. You soon saw a very… odd looking person walk in that actually got you to shiver slightly. You just didn’t like the feel of him. You really didn’t care what he looked like but your instinct was saying that he was not to be trusted in any fashion. When he came in the shut the door you tried to grab him with anything you could but the chains were holding you stead. Eventually you stopped snapping your jaws in attempts to bite his head off and just glared at him, growling and snarling when you got the chance.

“Well aren’t you the unique… whatever you are. I suppose I should be lucky the drug is working. I have a feeling that those chains wouldn’t hold you otherwise. I don’t suppose I’ve made too good of an impression have I?” the red haired man asked. You simply snarled as your answer but not enough to be overly redundant. You both knew you currently couldn’t do anything unless he came closer. “I’m going to go out on a limb and say that you are at least part dragon. Wither you are that way because you’ve willing changed your bodies like the Elves is still the question. But I would put money on the fact that you can definitely understand what I’m telling you… and that you could respond if motivated.”

With that he did something and the door opened to which a guard pushed a cart of fresh meat on it to you. you spread your wings and snarled at him to which he jumped and looked to make sure your chains were still holding you back. With a jerk of his head, the red haired man dismissed the guard, who was all too eager to put the CLOSED door between him and you.

“Here is what I propose. I give you meals like this and you at least have to speak to me. I don’t care if you just curse me to death, as long as you forgo this childish silent game you have going. Touching the food will be accepting my offer,” he said as he used some kind of magic to push the cart of meat and water to your reach and you backed away, not sure if you should eat it. You knew it would be laced with the same drugs but that wasn’t that bad. Your body needed more of it to help make your body immune to it. The problem was accepting anything from this man. With a little growl you gorged on the food and water till nothing was left but a slightly destroyed food cart which he disposed of through the door before continuing his talking. “Good, now you’ll talk.”

“Listen well human, I agreed to talk not to spare your life if you come within reach,” you snarled at him.

“Fair enough. Perhaps introductions then. I am Durza and what name are you known by?”

“Max.”

“And what about your other name?” he asked to which you intensified your glare. Brom had told you about someone’s ‘real name’. A name someone could use to control someone just as you did magic when using their style. “I suppose you aren’t ready to give that one. How about WHAT you are?”

“You have eyes to see,” you answered.

“So, you won’t give up such information willingly.” Durza stated in an almost threat.

“What wisdom is there in revealing all my secrets at a first meeting?” You asked, sarcastically appealing to his sense of reason. Asking such a question made him chose, either he admit he is ignorant and untrustworthy enough to receive your information or concede to your thought and try again later at a slower pace.

“Very well, I will come back later. Although I warn you, Max, that you would much rather deal with me than the King. He will not be as hospitable as I am. I would reach your decision soon, before he gets here,” Durza said in an attempt to get things to swing his way later. Most people would be swayed by such a revelation. No one like the king enough to trust their lives and freedom to his hands. So a apparent stranger was much more appealing than such a well known tyrant and power in the lands, not known for his kind heart. However you knew all you needed to know about this ‘Durza’. You could smell he was the Shade Eragon mentioned. If that was the case than he was in control of the Urgals and the Ra’zac to have brought you here like they must’ve done. Any affiliation with those two vile creatures made you instantly hate this Shade.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: You awake in a cell, still poisoned.

choices: You leave Durza to Eragon and help with the escape.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
You had expected that Durza would come by more. But he didn’t. You didn’t mind though. You spent your time meditating so your body could make a sizable dent in the immunity to the drug. You also took some pleasure in scaring the guards that were servicing you when they did. Each one of them ran from the room by the time you were done with your meal and threw the cart back at them. Your senses started coming back and so was your mind speech, along with magic and all that. But you noticed, from the mind of the guards, that the chains you were restrained by were made to restrain Durza. Must’ve been when he was captured and/or recruited, probably in the same fashion they were trying on you. But you didn’t let that stop you. It just took a different approach. You needed time for your body to work on the immunity and energy. They fed you, so that took care of the energy, and you had more than enough time. Every once in a while you would roar in frustration. You wanted to fly as you had done with Saphira and the others. Not to mention the emotion of knowing Brom died was wearing on your mood as well. However, as you got better you got a response from inside your mind from someone you didn’t expect… well you should’ve but didn’t think they would be dumb enough to come for you.

“Max, is that you?” asked a well known voice from in your head. It was Eragon, and he seemed very close from the clarity and volume.

“Eragon? Where are you?” You asked.

“I assume in the same jail or prison you are in,” he answered.

“What?! You mean you are captured? I thought you were all getting away. I understood my bindings were too tough to break but I thought at least you, Saphira, and Brom would make it out,” you hollered mentally at him.

“Wait, I did… we did. A guy named Murtagh helped us escape. That is another story for when we get out of here. Anyway, I got captured by the shade and ended up in here. We are actually escaping right now. We can talk about the other stuff later. Where are you, so we can come get you?” Eragon asked.

“I think I’m in a cell of some kind. They got me drugged up pretty good and restrained with chains designed to hold a shade. I can bust out but I haven’t the slightest idea what to do after that. I just got enough strength back to do that,” you answered.

“What do you mean? You are still eating the drugged food?” He asked.

“Yeah, I need energy and my body needs to make an immunity to this drug. I’m sick of getting trapped by it all the time… but that explanation is for later. Point is, I can get out and have a considerable amount of power now, thus me speaking with you. However I am nowhere near even half strength and I don’t know what to do or where to go. If I just start blasting then I could hurt you or the others you have with you along with everything else. Are you capable of coming and getting me?” You asked.

“Yes, send me some mental pictures of where you are. I’ll come and get you then we have to save the elf,” he answered.

“Elf? Oh, you mean the woman of your dreams,” you teased as you did as he asked, relaying as much as you knew about where you were.

“Yeah, yeah, laugh it up scaly,” Eragon replied back as he looked for you. He had said about the woman he had been dreaming about. You all determined she was real but that didn’t stop you from teasing him from it. She was literally someone that was the ‘woman of his dreams’ and you used that line more than often enough to be annoying to him, not to mention making him blush and Saphira to laugh. “Ok, we’re here but this door isn’t opening with magic or keys. The shad must have the key. You think you can open it?”

“Who’s we?” you asked as you smelled an unfamiliar scent. At first you hoped it was Brom but you knew that was impossible.

“He’s Murtagh, he helped us escape and came to rescue us with Saphira after I got captured. We’ve been looking everywhere for you.” Eragon answered, showing you mentally what he looked like so you knew the difference.

“Ok, Stand back.” You said and when you sensed them do so you loosed a flame so explosive that it both melted and forced the door open and into the adjacent wall in a red heap. They came in with the apparent ‘Murtagh’ freezing with the sight of you chained in the back of the room while Eragon rushed to the chains. “Just get my tail free, I can handle the rest after that.”

“Got it, guess you owe us one now.” Eragon said comically as you used your tail to flatten then slice the other chains to ribbons. You shook and stretched at your new freedom.

“I suppose so. As for you…” you started as you looked over to Murtagh. He flinched as you moved toward him. He must’ve been told about you a little to not brandish his sword at you but he was still as scared as the guards. You stopped when he backed against the wall at you approaching but you stayed slightly at a distance to address him. “… I thank you.”

“Y-you’re w-welcome,” he stuttered then his attention was shifted to sounds from the hall. “We have to hurry.”

“Lead the way,” you replied to which he was all too eager to do so.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: Jail break with Eragon and an elf, brought to y...

choices: Murtagh is not comfortable around you.
You and Eragon go into the Elf's mind.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
“Found her,” Eragon announced as you all were looking through the cells. You returned to him and Murtagh carrying her out with some difficulty. Apparently Eragon was really weak and they both were considerably tired.

“Here, give her to me,” you instructed but they hesitated. Murtagh you could understand. His eyes seemed glued to different moving parts of your anthro body and was nervous about all of them.

“You sure?” Eragon asked.

“What, are you really going to argue about who can carry the most weight? Even under half strength and a girl on my back I could still outrun you and Saphira and you know it,” you asked and stated sarcastically.

“Fine, just be careful. I doubt she has had a decent time here by the look of her.” Eragon relented as they handed her over to which you picked her up with ease.

“Ok, where to now?” you asked.

“This way,” Murtagh answered as he led the group. He led you all to a room and despite your thirst for action, you had to hide until the room was clear. “Now we wait for Saphira.”

“For her to do what?” You asked.

“This.” came yet another voice but this one exclusively from Saphira and in your head as you heard her roar and attack the top of whatever building you were in.

“We have to be quick. The shade will be here any minute,” Eragon revealed.

“A Shade?” Murtagh asked.

“Yeah, he came by me too,” you said outloud then looked up to Saphira and spoke to her with your mind but so the others could hear as well. “Saphira, it is good to hear your voice but I need you to be straight with me. Where is Brom?”

“Max… the wound the Ra’zac inflicted was a fatal one. I’m sorry but he died. We did bury him and I made a tomb of diamond so you can visit his grave and see him in his eternal and peaceful sleep,” Saphira answered, parts in a softer tone despite the roaring she was doing while attacking the top of the tower.

“Max, I know he was as close to you as he was to me, closer even. He said to tell you that he was proud to know you as long as he did and to be merciful. He wanted me to make sure you knew that he didn’t want his death to spawn more death, to leave vengeance aside. I personally think it is a load of crap but I can’t and won’t alter his last words to you,” Eragon stated out loud but also in his head so the conversation included Saphira as well.

“I’ll try, but the Ra’zac just made a very angry enemy,” you growled out and ended in a snarl.

“I suppose they did,” came a voice to which half the room froze as they saw Durza in the corner.

“You better be here in good spirit or you are about to have a really bad day. I am in no mood to entertain you Durza,” you growled at him while still holding the woman in your arms.

“Bad day you say? Let’s see who has the bad day.” Durza challenge back as he drew his sword and attacked with unnatural speed. Unnatural for others but slow to you. As the sword slashed in front of your body and the woman you carried, you grabbed his arm and hand with your clawed hand that was not holding the elf woman. In your grip he couldn’t get away, release the blade, or do anything but grimness in pain.

“This is a warning Durza. I know you Shades are a pain to get rid of. But next time you pick a fight with me, THIS…” you said as you brought your tail forward and flattened it so he could see how deadly it was before continuing on your threat. “… is going into your heart.”

With that said and his eyes telling you he understood, you stabbed it through his head then threw his body across the room where it turned to a mist or smoke of some kind. It was just in time for Saphira to get about halfway done with ripping off the roof.

“Saphira, move please,” you asked comically. It took her a second to understand but then flew out of the way as you charged another flame breath with enough pressure to blow the top off the tower you were all in. And blow off it did. You let go a mighty flame that left only charred remains on the sides of the walls. As Saphira came in they all looked at you as if they weren’t used to that kind of thing from you by now. “As you can tell, I really don’t like this place and I’m in a terrible mood.”

“Remind me never to get on your bad side then.” Murtagh stated in an attempt at humor. You politely nodded as you walked over to the landed Saphira and she brought her head down to you.

“I missed you,” she said to you as she nuzzled you and you did back with your little anthro snout, both careful of the Elf you were carrying.

“I missed you as well,” you said then looked at an awkwardly standing Eragon. “Of course you to Eragon. But seeing as you’re a guy and not a dragon… well you understand right?”

“Sure, let’s just get out of here before more soldiers come by,” Eragon answered to which he and Murtagh got on Saphira and you flew out with the Elf woman in your arms, leaving the castle/prison behind you.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: You square off against Durza.

choices: She is stronger than you thought and resists you at first.
She is no match for you.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
It wasn't with great joy or conviction that you were about to wander into the little elf's mind. No, it was out of necessity and annoyance. Eragon didn't know too much of magic and even if you could heal the elf's wounds, the ones Eragon couldn't, as well as keep her healthy, the contant drain on the group an Eragon's choice of conversation was beginning to get to you. Of course Saphira was a little more sensitive about such things, but she still was his rider and shared many of the same thought processes, at least the ones that her dragon instincts didn't overule.

On top of all that, you were all traveling toward the Varden, or where you all believed the Varden to be. Murtagh knew suprising too much on some topics but you didn't press him any further. He seemed to like you though, deathly careful no to desplease you in any way, but still liked you... 'maybe it was the eyes' you would say and he would just chuckle a little bit and point out that the teeth, tail, wings, and claws helped as well.

"Are you sure you want to do this?" you asked Eragon. You had expressed your concern for entering an elf's mind before and that was why you all had waited as long as you did. Beyond the obvious privacy issue that Sarah had taught you, there was also the unknown. Your genetic knowledge had taught you that Elves were not a species that would prove to be pushovers. They were deadly to dragons and others in a different but by no means smaller sense than most other dragons were. Coupled witht the fact that this realm was their home and would have the advantage in that regard upped the danger meter significantly.

"She is in obvious trouble and you said even you can't heal her poisoning. Why was that again?" He asked as if to stengthen his stance and decision.

"Because it is something that I have no knowledge. It would take weaks for me to figure out how to treat it. I don't think she has that kind of time. But I suppose she, as you pointed out, may be the only one among us that actually knows where the Varden are hiding," You replied back.

"Are you sure you can withstand the mind of an elf?" Murtagh asked then, seeing your gaze quickly explained his fear. "Not that I question your strength, but I have heard many tales of people going mad at best from even attempting to enter an elf's mind. If she is hostile and attacks, thinking perhaps that you are Durza or the King, will you be able to withstand her?"

"Thank you for your concern, Murtagh, but I am more than capable. How do you think I was able to beat other dragons when I was a mere foot long as a child? It is one of very few nice things I can say I gained from my early years and battles. Learning to fight with body and mind was a difficult but well learned exercise" you answered, trying to portray that you didn't take offense to what he said, but the flapping snout of teeth was probably hindering that attempt.

You want me to accompany you? Saphira asked.

"No. Sure I will be far from helpless but it wouldn't hurt having a dragon watching our bodies while we speak with her," you answered and she seamed proud that you picked her to watch over you when you were otherwise occupied and needed.

"What am I? Chopped liver?" Murtagh asked sarcastically before he could stop himself. In hindsight he hoped that it didn't mean he would join such a dish in a meal of the dragons he just spoke to.

"About as big," you answered in a joke but then headed his rapidly panicking state before it surfaced. "Of course I am thankful of your help as well."

"Uh... thanks," He replied, glad that it was a compliment and not something like he was thinking.

"Ok. Are you ready or what?" asked Eragon as he was a little anxious to get started. "Her position is no more safe with us blabbering about."

"I am sure that the fact she is an extremely attractive elf, of which you have never seen the like before, has no bearing on you wanting to help her," you teased, and not for the first time. You had done so, to his annoyance and Saphira's confused ammusement, a few times. "A woman or your dreams is under youf complete control and needs your help, Hero. That is the start of every sappy love story I know of, and that's a lot of them."

"Would you cut that out?!" Eragon exasperated. Saphira tried to be supportive but she chuckled involuntarily before doing so. This made Eragon wisen up and get back on topic, but first put in a jab of his own. "It was a vision, not a dream, in any case."

"Ok, let's go then," you agreed and he was thankful that you didn't stretch out such teasing and that you were ready to embark on the mental journey he was yearning to start. Regardless of where his... manhood would take him, you all knew he was actually pretty honorable.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: You and Eragon go into the Elf's mind.

1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.content:
Both you and Eragon go into her mind as softly as possible. You could've just bulldozed your way through, but that would undoubtedly harm her. Even if Elves were more competent than most with their minds, having a dragon rip through one's mind is not healthy not matter who the person may be, even elves and other dragons.

Why can't we go faster? asked Eragon.

I could... if you wanted me to tear her mind in half. The gentle approach is not one I have had much use for. Either an enemy was deadly enough for me to enter their minds or an ally was not worth being rude to intrude into their minds. Either way, I have not had much practice with the gentle approach. you answered as you both made steady progress.

Eventually you both made it to her mind, enough for which she noticed you and, at your slight intrusion, attacked with a furry that suprised you. It was more intense than most dragons you encountered. Even Dark Hunters were generally no this skilled. Then again, in your realm, they didn't need to be. Their mental defense was strong enough to hold things at bay while they ate/killed their physically inferior enemy.

I am a rider and a friend Eragon said, in the ancient language.

He knew very little but he knew some. His execution of the language was usually abstract or jumbled at best, compared to the completel knowledge you knew. Sometimes you had to use the name of the language itself to undo some of his errors. But for the most part you let him do as he willed as part of a learning experience. He would learn eventually... you hoped.

Who are you she asked after Eragon and her exchanged names. You could tell that she was running on very little energy and needed most of her remaining thought to contain the poison she outlined to Eragon.

Be at peace, Arya, I am known as Max. I am a... I suppose you could say I am a dragon, in a manner of speaking. you answered. Your speach was in the ancient language so your statement was all the more confusing to her, for she knew you couldn't be lying. But she had niether the strength nor time to figure it out. She would need to trust in what you said.

Are you his dragon? she asked.

No, I am a friend of Brom. I don't mean to be rude but we should save such talk for later. We have little time, and you less than we to to linger. We need the location of the Varden so we can get there, and get you healed. Saphira and Eragon may be Dragon and Rider, but they could do with some advise from and aged race such as yours, and for different reasons, I could as well. You replied, also in the ancient language. Eragon, you could feel, was getting a little annoyed at his lack of involvement in the conversation. He did perk up when he heard his name, and Saphira's

After that, she briefly described how to get there and accompanied it with flashes from her memory. Eragon was utterely lost in the see of information that was hardly worth a footnote of difficulty to you. You wondered if Saphira would've benefitted from taking a part in this conversation as well. Soon, both you and Eragon opened your eyes and looked at each other as if to soldify that this was real and you both were not in the Elf's... Arya's mind, anymore.

"Did you understand that?" Eragon asked, as if grateful he could speak to you outloud again... as well as hoping you gleaned more from Arya's information that ne did.

"I did. I know where the Varden are now... at least the enterance she revealed to us, along with the password. Did you at least hear that part?" You asked back.

"Yes, I just had a hard time putting together the other things she communicated. What were you two talking about in there in, what I assume, was the ancient language?" He asked. At this point Murtagh and Saphira were listening and trying to get what they could from your conversation before asking questions later.

"She was just curious about who and what I was. We didn't have time to explain so we left most of it for later. But she did need to make sure that I was trustworthy to recieve the information we needed." You answered.

"Couldn't you just take it if she didn't?" Murtagh asked.

"I could, but she was suprisingly talented and powerful, as far as minds of little things are concerned. I would've have to tear her mind in half to get at the information she had suprisingly well buried. I have yet to meet with the elves formally. I don't wish to make an enemy of them to simply learn something she would've thought us worthy to tell us anyway." you answered.

Smart move, as always. Saphira complimented.

"Ok, ok. We can talk about this as we travel. Can we get going please?" Eragon asked, probably in relation to helping Arya. The strength she had shown, and compliments from you, only made her more appeasing to him. You had to admit that, for a humanoid creature, you saw the attraction. You were half human after all. However, Eragon's desire spawned more than just infactuation. Yet another one of may attributes of his that you found oddly comforting. Despite him being near your age, you found that you resecting him a great deal. Perhaps because he was Brom's actual sone... oops, wasn't suppose to think that. You knew, along with Saphira, but was more or less sworn to keep your mind off it until Eragon was fit to know as well. It was an on going struggle with Brom's death so fresh in your minds. But, as it was his wish, you both carried that information in a very safe spot, surrounded by oaths made in the ancient language as well... just to be safe from temptation of accidental conversation slip.

"Of course." You agreed, to which you all started out again. You told them the general direction as you all traveled so you didn't have to do the whole 'right here, left here' thing. No specific but enough for you to get some rest in that regard.
1323211112112211122111112112111121111111.title: She is stronger than you thought and resists yo...

choices: He leaves you but you follow him anyway.
13232111121122111221111122.content:
Waking up was interesting to say the least. You were fairly groggy from your first trip through the portal. It wasn’t that it was that difficult, it was just that it was sudden high speed jerks that was hard to deal with if you didn’t know where they were coming from. You had little doubt that you could anticipate them if you ever got the chance to go through one again, hopefully on your way home. For now you were both sickened and confused. The sickened part was the infuriating stench of dragon around you. As your senses started to come back more keenly, starting with smell, you found that it wasn’t that there was one near you. It was more like a constant hint of dragon in the wind and more ominous than anything but still there like the smell of someone unknown stepping in dog crap. You don’t know who or where but you can smell the scent, even indirectly it was not a good constant scent for your preference. As your other senses came back online you heard people talking and felt the slightly cool air breeze over you and whistle through a window.

“Looks like he’s coming around.” Said a man’s voice, steady and firm yet playful in a way.

“He looks fit, he might make a good soldier.” Said an arrogant sounding male voice in response. As your eyes fluttered open you took in the figures still talking. The man that just spoke was a soldier of some kind and it sounded like most able bodied men were soldiers. Good thing you had learned blacksmithing as a trade to cover your obvious muscle mass but you were also young, even if you didn’t look it, well not your body definition anyway. Your overall size did betray your youth so it was believable.

“Hold on, hold on. Don’t rush it.” Said the man with the steady voice as you tried to rise quickly at their presence and was rewarded with a headache as you scooted back, with his help against the headboard. After nursing your head you slowly looked up to them with uncertain eyes. You had always been subconsciously afraid of humans for one reason or another. As a dragon you feared them attacking because it usually meant you had to kill them. On the other hand as a human it was more of a vulnerable thing, even if you were vastly more powerful than they were you were still a now 13 year old boy and acted likewise, minus the ignorance because of your genetic knowledge and dragon instincts. “Who are you little boy?”

“Max… You aren’t going to hurt me are you?” you asked as you looked at the soldiers and their drawn swords.

“See I told you he was just a boy.” he said back to them as they seemed to gain the same conclusion from your speech and behavioral patterns.
