You also entered their minds to help things along but not by much. They said a few insults then knocked over the man’s stool then left. You gathered the soldiers in this land you were in weren’t too friendly. Once they were gone and he was sitting by you again he continued. “So where do you come from, and where are your parents?” he asked. You might have taken offense to the question since your father was either dead or a breeding slave while your mother… anyway he didn’t know any of that and he was probably talking about a human family.

“I… I only have a sister. I was exiled through some kind of portal thing from… very far away.” You said in a clear indication that you couldn’t return. Combined with your age and apparent helplessness you were quite believable.

“Well you catch me at a rather rough time. In the middle of me searching for… well I found you and you don’t have anyone to look after you.” he said as he thought on what to do with you. You could tell he was a good and honorable man despite the fact that he wreaked of dragon. It was as if there was some dragon in him, not like you but more like a binding contract of dragon riders like home but more powerful. However that was the only scent of dragon he had, no actual contact for at least a while. You were lucky to be found by such a man but didn’t want to be a burden.

“Are you going to leave me too?” you asked as you verified his intensions.

“Well I had planned to leave you with your parents if I could locate them. But as you said you don’t have any that means I am responsible for you. I would try to find you a new family but there is something about you that is preventing me from doing that. It just feels like… well a presence or feeling I haven’t had in a long time.” He explained.

“I’m sorry, I won’t be a burden. I promise I will be good.” You said as you understood his position. Although you didn’t understand why or how he was able to sense your dragon half, there was a deep sadness in his eyes at the apparent thought of that ‘feeling’ instead of your anger or fear that most felt near dragons. Maybe you would tell him later without so many people around.

“Well this is a pickle. I should find a safe place for you to grow up. But I wish to look after you for some reason that is conflicting with the common sense option. The mission I’m about to go on is very dangerous and to take you along would only put you in danger.” He said as he looked you in the eye to give you his answer. It was strange but you felt you could trust this man well enough for now and your dragon instincts agreed for once with your human emotions on this point.
13232111121122111221111122.title: Movie

132321111211221112211111221.content:
As you rode with the man that now was known to you as Brom he told you a combination of stories and history about dragons, dragon riders, magic, and the empire. You quickly realized that Dragons here were not like they were at home, except one breed that was prized among royal families for their loyalty. You were both burdened and glad that a dragon dies if their rider is killed so they can’t really kill their masters. However humans can be more evil than dragons but thankfully lack the means to do much about it, giving them a dragon to command changes that. You still hated dragons in general but you would have to make allowances in this world for them and now that you and Brom had stopped for the night you were ready to tell him about you. He had asked multiple times but you had insisted that you weren’t ready yet. At that point you were still gaining information if it would be wise to say anything at all but also if he asked for you transform it would hurt a lot.

“I think I’m ready now” you said as he was once again pestering you about sharing your past.

“Know that no matter what I will not leave you.” he said as he seemed to catch on that it was a sore spot for you.

“Ok, the reason why I was exiled was because I am what is known as a half-breed. I am not from a distant place in this world, I am from a completely different world and was dumped here for their safety and law. My world is… let’s just say that seeing a dragon is a common thing and not a very good experience for most which is one of many reasons I hate them.” you started and his eyes jumped to a surprised and intense setting.

“So that is how you know of dragons. I wondered how a boy like you could know so much about them. So dragons and their riders are not useful like they are here?” he asked as he tried to understand why you hated them. “And what does half-breed mean?”

“It means that I am only half human and half… something else.” You said than looked down as if trying to find a way to say it.

“What is your other half?” he asked.

“Dragon.” You said simply to his amazement but his expression changed to one of disbelief. Coming from a 13 year old boy it did sound more like a children’s game or imagination. It was clear that you would have to show him certain things but hopefully you wouldn’t have to go all out. “I know it is hard to believe but maybe this will help.” You said then let your eyes glow and turn to your obvious dragon eye, you also grew wings and a tail out of your back then flexed them and returned them to your human body, leaving a very speechless Brom.

“But… How… I… So you can grow dragon parts as a… halfbreed?” he asked to clarify what you just showed him.

“I can actually go full dragon but that form is extremely large for such a small area and it hurts like hell to change from full dragon to full human. But I lose none of my strength as a human or dragon.” You said as you let your eye continue glowing.

“Then you are the dragon we are searching for.” He stated to which you shook your head.

“From what you said the sound of the dragon appearing is only when a dragon meets and is bound to his/her rider. I don’t have one so it isn’t me. Plus not all dragons from my world are like the ones from here. Some are but most aren’t.” you explained. “But I have been smelling a dragon for as long as I have been here and… you smell like you have been touched by one. Are you a dragon rider?” you asked as you now knew that was pretty much the only thing in this world that could make a human smell like he does.” He then nodded and proceeded to tell you about his dragon and that it was now dead. “I’m sorry, I shouldn’t have imposed.”

“Nonsense, you are quite a refreshing person to be around. I wondered why I was drawn to you since I met you. I have no doubt that you are what you say you are. But I must ask, if you are a dragon than why do you hate them?” he asked.

“I guess it all starts with the day I was born.” You started than gave him your back story and he began to understand your point of view and agreed to keep it a secret as well as you doing the same for him.

“I understand now, but this dragon and its rider that we are searching for is one of the Vardan’s only hope, along with you at this point. So please don’t be too negative around them when we find them.” Brom requested.

“I’ll do my best but the dragon will not be safe until it proves that it can be trusted. I’m not about to let a dragon do what it wishes and potentially lose a good friend to its whim.” You said in a clear sense that he was that friend.

“Point taken and I thank you. It is good to feel that from a dragon again. Perhaps when we find them you can fly with it and be more open about your other side.” he offered as he had seen your longing gaze at the sky. One that he had seen before on grounded dragons and one he had more than often. You wanted to fly and cut through the clouds again. So you made a mental note to try and get along with this dragon he was referring to.

“I would very much like that. But I get to eat the King’s dragon right?” you asked and he just laughed a little at the apparent superiority you had over most dragons and the ease it might take you to do so. He nodded and you both continued to track after your rest.
132321111211221112211111221.title: He takes you with him.

choices: You are woken for some reason.
1323211112112211122111112211.content:
Brom had you wait in the forest while he searched a small farm that the Ra’zac had attacked. If the rider was anywhere than they would be after him. So anywhere that they attacked was a possible location for the dragon rider he was searching for. But as you waited you didn’t need to be there to smell a dragon and observe as one passed above a few times. You almost growled at the sight of here except she looked a lot like Kara, smaller, but still quite similar. After a bit Brom appeared with another horse in addition to the one he left on. Yours had gotten used to you and soon after a brief but hurried introduction you all were on your way. You all rode for a while without too many words, as it appeared the boy Brom had brought back had lost someone very close. Finally you all stopped and the horse you were on was more than happy to get you off of its back. You gave it a pat then let it walk over to the others. You didn’t ride with a saddle as you didn’t need one so it was already set for Brom to handle and had less work involved. Then the moment you were not happy about came. Brom told Eragon to call his dragon to which you heard him call her as well as her answer. It wasn’t like reading a mind, rather it was being projected as speech and sense you were a dragon as well, you could hear it. From this you were able to ascertain her name, Saphira. She landed to which you were beginning to growl a little but a firm but calm hand on your shoulder calmed you as Brom remembered your feelings on dragons. You heard a round of apologize from Eragon for something he apparently said to her. Her demeanor was refreshingly like Kara if slightly different.

“And who are they?” you heard her say/think to Eragon as she looked your way, she had to notice a slight glare from you as you seemed more likely to attack than run or quiver in any type of fear.

“This is Brom, he knows about dragons.” Eragon introduced. “I’m not exactly sure who the little boy is.”

“HE knows about dragons? I’ll be the judge of that.” She said as she gave him a playful roar that got Brom to jump but you didn’t bat an eye at her comparatively weak roar, especially compared to yours or Kara’s. “What is up with this kid?” she asked as she was expecting you to react to her more than Brom. Brom seemed to guess where they were going with their silent discussion, to him, and moved to introductions.

“This is Max, he is a rather special boy that I think would be of great help.” He said as he saw the questioning eyes of the two before him. “He is very knowledgeable about dragons and such for a good reason but also has a rather one sided and negative history with them, leaving him scarred in more ways than one. But he has something that I believe we all need to see.” He said then turned to you. “You don’t have to if you don’t want. I know you said it hurts you a lot and I don’t want to see you in pain. But things might be easier if you remain in your other form.” He said as he gave you an option to back out if it was to much.

“What are you talking about?” Eragon asked for both of them.

“It may be hard to believe but Max is from a different world. He is also half human and half dragon and can turn into either form at will, but apparently it hurts a lot to do. I only met him about a week ago but I have seen more than enough proof for me to believe him.” Brom explained then they both looked down and over at you as you thought about what you should do.

“I guess if I don’t have to change back it will be ok.” you said to which Brom nodded and you walked over to a more open area. They all gathered around you but you held out a hand for them to stop. “No, I need some room and not to be disturbed while I do it. It hurts a lot but it won’t kill me but I might accidently harm someone if they get to close.” You explained and each obeyed with different fashions. Brom was excited but the other two were bouncing back theories of what they thought of this, most being that you were about to perform a trick of some kind. You then dropped to the ground and started bracing and bunching the ground as the transformation started. Your body burned and every punch to the ground rumbled it like a mini earth tremor then your body began changing as you grunted and sometimes yelled in pain. Soon they became snarls and growls until you were lying exhausted in full dragon form, breathing heavily from the effort and when you had enough strength from the sun you got up and looked over at them but you just stumbled as you tried to walk over to them but failed miserably, just accepting that this was all you were going to move for a while.

“Why is he looking that way at us?” Saphira asked Eragon as she noticed your glowing red eyes glaring intently at her in particular. Despite your current exhaustion you were much bigger than she was so she wasn’t going to take any chances.

“I can hear you.” you said out loud so Brom could hear at least half the conversation.

“What, you can use the human tongue?” she asked in surprise.

“Of course I can, all dragons can if they train hard enough. You just…” you started but growled as pain shot through you and you grasped part of your head than eased it off.

“I thought you hated dragons?” Brom asked as he was not expecting you to be so civil to her.

“Remember that other one I am ok with named Kara. She looks just like her, a little bigger and older but still they look a lot alike. But I still am holding in the urge to bite off her head.” You said with an intensity that made Saphira cower and Eragon get between you and her.

“You will do no such thing.” He stated to which you almost burst out laughing. “What is so funny?” he asked, slightly offeneded.

“You are. Do you really think that you could stop me barehanded if I really wanted to attack her? You would be a bug that could be easily or accidently squashed as we fought. Next time grab a sword or something that might make your stand more believable.” You advised. “As for you little girl, it appears you are a good dragon from what I have witnessed thus far. But if I see you raise a single threatening claw at Brom, Eragon, or any I care for I’ll slaughter you.” you growled

“I would never harm Eragon.” She insisted as she heard his name with the others. “Or others that are good.” She quickly added.

“Then it looks like we will get along just fine.” You said to Brom, who flinched at you speacking directly to him. Granted not as much as most people but still flinching as you answered his question from earlier.

“Can I?” he asked as he approached with his hand out. You brought your head down and lay it on the ground so he could pet/ touch you. A few moments went by as he walked forward then started to place his hand on you as if touching something fragile and precious. You saw him smile and observed some of your body’s movements for a while then went back so you both could talk. “Are you still in pain?” he asked.

“A little, I won’t be able to travel for the rest of the day. Transforming takes a lot out of me” You informed as you eyes looked to be quite heavy as your head rested on the ground in prime position for you to fall asleep.

“Well Why don’t you get some rest. I’ll have Saphira wake you if we need to move while you’re asleep. Otherwise I have some things to discuss with him.” He instructed.

“Very well, I won’t complain.” You said as your eyes darted to Saphira than hesitantly shut and you were off to sleep. It had been a little while sense you got any sleep, which usually didn’t matter. But with your fatigue from transforming combined with that was more than enough to snap you into a deep sleep to recover your strength as the sun still shown and projected its strength into you. You hoped you could sleep soundly but the way things were going you might be woken up before you were completely rested.
1323211112112211122111112211.title: Meeting the dragon.

13232111121122111221111122112.content:
You began feeling a nudge as you dreamed your usual nightmare or the things from the past that scared you. The most prominent was your mother but it rarely was shown on the outside, or if it did Sarah never mentioned anything. The nudge just so happen to come at a very bad time in your dream so when you woke and saw a dragon prodding you awake you lashed out and pinned her under your claws with lightning quick reflexes then with your hold secure you got your bearings. It wasn’t long before you remembered the more recent events along with who Saphira was. Perhaps her scent was still new to you but as soon as you realized she wasn’t a threat you immediately got off her and backed away.

“What was that about?” Brom demanded. “I thought we had an understanding.”

“Sorry, I’m not used to her scent.” You said but saw that they needed a little more as Saphira got up and shook it off. She looked at you as if betrayed, as did the others. “I… when I dream I only have nightmares. I relive the events of my passed that have scarred me in different ways. Everything between my Mother’s… welcome to crying babies from my mere presence. The only time I have been able to dream differently is around Sarah. So when a new dragon was prodding me awake I… I have not reacted as quickly in the past and it has resulted badly. Sorry if I hurt you.” you said a little worried that they wouldn’t accept it.

“How did you move that fast?” asked Eragon. “I didn’t even realize it until you were on top of her, and I was watching you the entire time.”

“Where I’m from the weak and the slow are killed by the strong and the quick. So naturally I had to become pretty quick and strong to survive in a world where dragons and humans are abundant and always trying to kill me.” You said to looks that were both understanding and confused.

“Well I’m glad that was all it was. We let you sleep for an entire day, but I thought you should be up for the telling of your story, just in case I miss something.” Brom stated then when you all gathered around the fire and Saphira surprisingly close to you, he started your story. You had to correct him on a few points but in the end he had the basic body of the story down pretty well, not that it made it any easier to hear or think about again.

“So that’s why you don’t have a rider?” Saphira asked.

“Sarah was the closest thing to a rider in my world but not like here. If she were to die I would still live on, though she does have some power over me. Something about her just makes me calm and I have never been able to figure out why. Her scent all the way to her voice, the mere sight of her makes me feel better.” You answered.

“Don’t take this the wrong way but how do we know it is true?” Eragon asked and got looks from both Saphira and Brom.

“It’s ok, I get that a lot, especially about my mother.” You said than leaned over to the side and rose your wing so they could see the scars underneath then after you heard them all react to them you sat back down properly. “Those are the scares from when she… well they are the only proof I can give. You already saw me change from a human to a dragon.” Eragon felt a little guilty, now that he had seen them, for doubting such a painful part of your story.

“So I look a lot like this ‘Kara’ dragon you used to know?” Saphira asked and you almost chuckled at the sight of Brom trying to piece together the conversation from only one side.

“It is almost scary. You’re a little smaller and have less prominent scale concentration but other than that you look just like her. And no offense but she was quite a bit stronger than you are. Probably from Sparring with me for a few months in near death matches.” You returned.

“Did dragons really eat humans?” she asked in an indirect concern about you eating her or the others.

“You don’t know because you have yet to try it. Not that I condone the behavior but I have had to eat a fair amount of humans that came to slay me or was threatening Sarah. However most dragons find humans to be a very high delicacy and beyond the incredible taste, one human can fill up a dragon of my size to the same amount as 2 full size dairy cows. Something about the flesh to soul ratio, not really sure why it works out like that. But most dragons on my world indulge in a few humans a month. Some actually accept sacrifices to keep towns safe from other dragons. One of many reasons I hate dragons, well most dragons. Most I have seen are rude, arrogant, self centered, treat humans little better than meat, and a host of other things I can’t stand.” You ended with a slight growl but this one was slightly comforting as it just drove your stance on such behavior further in.

“Well now that we know you better, maybe we can get going. Can you travel now?” Brom asked.

“I should be able to. The rest did me some good. I wouldn’t mind getting up in the sky again, stretch my wings and such. Although I’ll be more noticeable than Saphira unless I travel at night. My body will stick out in the day time.” You responded.

“Well they will probably see you eventually either way so don’t worry about it. But try to stay out of sight as much as you can.” Brom instructed.

“Alright, I’ll just follow you then. Just yell if you need my help. I’ll hunt later tonight, unless we run into those ra’zac or Urgals. Can’t say they will taste to good but I haven’t eaten in a few weeks so they’ll do.” You said.

“Wait you haven’t eaten in weeks?” Eragon asked.

“My body can absorb the sun for nourishment so I don’t NEED to eat as much as normal dragons do. Doesn’t mean I don’t get hungry though. Let’s just say that my belly won’t complain if it gets a meal.” You said and you could tell he was glad he wasn’t on your menu, as was Brom and Saphira. You had made it quite clear that you ate dragons as well as humans in the story. With a little stretch of your wings you pumped them and took off into the air. Feeling the wind and open sky again felt really good. So good that you almost forgot to remain in the clouds to hide your presence. You also had to make sure that your flying didn’t blow away those clouds. Soon after they were on their way and Saphira joined you in the sky.
13232111121122111221111122112.title: You are woken for some reason.

choices: You save Brom and Eragon from Durza.
132321111211221112211111221122.content:
It was painstaking to not interfere when the Urgals attacked. You did just enough but Brom insisted, after seeing your single gust of flame disintegrating both Urgal and building alike, that you not go so far in such public places. You had done so without thinking that even though no innocents were killed with your flames, the kings rule and the use of slaves to rebuild the village would take a few. So now you flew and watched as Eragon rode Saphira for the second time and learned the basics. You had offered to carry Brom but he declined, for now. But shortly after traveling a little bit you all became aware of Ra’zac closing in on Brom. Without thinking Eragon and Saphira rushed in despite your or Brom’s advice to the contrary. You heard a thud and a boom as Saphira crashed while a Ra’zac grabbed Eragon off her.

You had no choice but to go in after them, which would result in many destroyed trees. With a roar, that stopped an attacking Ra’zac, you broke through the trees like twigs and landed with one claw over Eragon so it protected him from falling debris and with a snap grabbed one that was jumping for him midair. You immediately regretted it as the taste was horrible, but you gulped it down anyway and allowed for it to be quickly digested rather than enjoy something in your belly. The second tried attacking Saphira which you flattened your tail and sliced it twice, once in half and another that cut off its head. The final one was going for the now present Brom but a small but intense fireball turned it to ash.

“Eragon!” Saphira cried as she saw the debris around your entry.

“Relax, he’s right here.” You said as you moved a few full sized trees off to the side then lifted your claw so he could get up. From the logs and branches that fell off as you did so indicated to all why you pinned him like that. Eragon moved to her while Brom searched the area for more. “There was only three.” You stated and he nodded and instructed for you all to move to a less, destroyed and ‘hot’ area. He was about to tend to Saphira’s wing when you moved forward. “Let me see.” You more asked than commanded. However, since she would have to stretch it out for either of you to treat it she saw no harm and did so.

“How did the Ra’zac taste?” she asked.

“Horrible, like a decaying and rotting corpse.” You said and shook your head to get the taste out. “Now hold still. I’ve only tried this once on Kara so I don’t know if it will work. I’m going to let my saliva heal it, sense it is a minor injury. That means it will be kind of awkward.” You said in a way to ask if you could continue.

“Go ahead.” She said and extended her wing more so you could get your jaws around the area. You did so and sealed only your lips around the section of wing in question, careful to keep your teeth as far away from her as you could in this position. You then started to lather the wound with saliva and felt with your tongue as it began to heal. She winced at first but was also feeling the healing start to work and soon you let go after wiping the last of your saliva off. Her wing was completely healed as she flexed it to make sure nothing else was the matter.

“How does it feel?” he asked and looked to Eragon for the translation.

“Like nothing was wrong.” He said for her. With that done he lecture him on responsibility and in turn got a lecture on truth, which ended in him telling them he was once a dragon rider and his back story or at least the part applicable to them. “You knew this?” Eragon asked.

“Of course I did. Even if he didn’t tell me it would only make sense that someone from this world would have to be a dragon rider to know the things he does. Did you think normal humans run around with dragon saddles?” you asked in a way the indicated that he should’ve figured it out.

“Max, I need to ask a favor of you.” Brom stated.

“Go ahead.” You replied as you had already made it clear that he could more than ask for favors.

“I need you to change back into a human again.” He said and the others looked at him confused. “You were right, you stand out to much as a dragon and this little incident only proved it. Plus it would be better if the enemy thinks we only have one dragon for now, not a massively larger one in addition to the one they are expecting.” He reasoned.

“I guess that makes sense. I got my flying in so I guess I’m ok with it.” You answered than got up and walked away a little than started the painful process of transforming and afterward warily made your way back to where they were all sitting. You let your eyes remain their usual glowing set as you caught your breath.

“I think you missed a spot.” Brom said as he saw a set of wings still protruding from your back.

“If it is all the same to you I would like to stretch them when it is just us. My dragon parts get cramped if they are hidden all the time.” You asked.

“You can do that?” Eragon asked in amazement.

“I lose none of my power by being human and that includes growing dragon parts when desired.” You answered.

“But don’t they hurt as well?” Saphira asked.

“Not really. Growing individual parts is comparatively easy. What hurts is the changing of my size and overall differences from dragon to human, or the other way around. Dragons are as different on the inside than they are on the outside. So growing or taking away organs or scales is what really hurts the most. Ever tried growing or ripping your own stomach apart?” you asked to further illustrate the point.

“Can you do magic?” Eragon asked, as he was slightly new to that part of himself.

“Not like you can. I learned magic by my genetic knowledge and instinct. So yes I can but I probably can’t teach you. I barely know why it works myself, only that it does. That and I still have all my natural dragon abilities to draw from; retractable spikes, flight, increased perception, speed, and strength, and fire breathing to name a few. Now that you have seen through dragon eyes you can appreciate that they are quite useful, except mine are more impressive and can see many more things than Saphira’s are able to.” You explained as he seemed mystified and agreed to your last comment about the eyes being useful.

“Can I make a request to?” Saphira asked.

“Sure go ahead.” You stated.

“Can you leave your scent as a dragon, just enough for me to smell?” she asked and you did so as you knew, from talking with Kara, that your dragon scent was very appeasing, frightening at first but still a very good scent to have around. She sniffed you a little then smiled at the change. “Thanks.”

“I guess as long as no one is here I can let it go like this. But I think my human scent would be better when others are around. I don’t need any undue attention.” You offered and she agreed.
132321111211221112211111221122.title: Ra'zac chow time.

choices: They take care of you until you awake.
They seal you in a prison of sorts.
1323211112112211122111112211221.content:
“You’re kidding right? There’s no way that…” you said as you got back from a resupply errand Brom asked you to go on. You were so quick that most of the time, if you didn’t force yourself to relax, looked like they were in slow motion, really slow motion. So when they ran out of a few supplies he asked you to run/fly to the nearest town. However, while you were away Eragon went on a mission to save Arya, the elf he was indirectly connected to. She was apparently the one that sent Saphira’s egg to him. She didn’t know at the time as she was just getting it away from Durza but it was her and he felt a bond to her. It could have also been something to do with him being attracted to her.

“He died protecting me.” Eragon said as he felt a combination of guilt and sorrow. It was tempered by Brom’s last words but he still felt it, therefore Saphira felt it.

“Who killed him?” you asked after dropping the pack of supplies and pacing for a while to cool off and think.

“Durza, the shade that sent the urgals and Ra’zac after us.” Eragon stated and with that your eyes flared and started to glow at the thought. Your wings broke out of your back as did your tail and claws to help deal with your anger. Arya was instantly captivated by this as you had seen her and purposefully hid your dragon parts when you came back.

“Who are you? What are you?” asked Arya. The question snapped you out of the growing bloodlust that you were in. As a dragon you were defensive of people close to you and felt driven to teach this ‘Durza’ how much of a mistake it was to take one of them away from you. But for now your mind settled on what Brom was doing and meant for you to do. Going after the shade would only put Eragon and Saphira in danger before they reached the Varden. You would carry out Brom’s last mission for him, after that all bets were off.

“The name is Max and I’m a half breed, one half human and the other half… I think you can guess.” You said as you flapped your distinctively dragon wings before starting to retract them till you were in full human form again.

“Half dragon?” she asked, half to the others and half out of obvious disbelief.

“He has already shown us his full dragon form. It hurts too much for him to do it again as a parlor trick and it would waste valuable time while he recovers from the fatigue.” Eragon stated or more recited since they were Brom’s words, not his. He had a comparatively infantile knowledge of dragons and what it was you were capable of.

“I’ll show you later, after we reach the Varden. Brom was bringing him there and I will carry out his final mission until it is completed. Plus we all agreed that it was better that the enemy know of only one dragon, for the moment.” You explained. Arya was about to say something in return but her body lurked in pain as she grabbed her chest and fell over. You moved quickly and caught her before her head could slam into the hard rock ground. It was the weirdest thing you ever saw. You had not smelled anything wrong with her before and now it was like her body was surrounded in an aura of poison. Such a transformation in such a small amount of time that it seemed instantaneous baffled you enough to look at the now kneeling form of Eragon as he moved to take the brunt of her weight, and Saphira for answers.

“She was poisoned, by the shade.” She informed which made you growl at yet another that was victim of this ‘Durza’s’ meddling.

“Can you heal her like you did with Saphira?” Eragon asked in a little more desperate tone than was necessary. You moved your hand to pull back the clothes covering the wound. At first Arya pushed your hand away, but Eragon held her other one to which she relented and you took a look at the nasty infection that was spreading over her body.

“No, my saliva would only heal the punctured skin and seal the poison inside. For this I would have to do something a little more dangerous and potentially problematic.” You said as you looked at him and Saphira and was pleasantly surprised to see concern for you in their faces, despite the circumstances. “I have a magic, or not really magic but that is the closest description, that would heal her easily. I take her injuries and aliments into my body thereby fully purging it from her’s.” you stated.

“But wouldn’t that just trade one poisoned person for another?” Saphira asked to which her expression was wrecked with worry. Despite the slightly escalated tension between you two, you were the only honorable dragon in the area and more powerful than any she would ever meet. So she had taken a silent and usually very hidden liking to you.

“Yes, I would have to be carried while you all travel until my body deals with the poison. My body has a better immune system than most, even other dragons, because of the whole transforming thing. It has to or the infection from my body ripping apart would kill me in minutes. Not to mention the poison was designed for her not me. So it’s effectiveness will be less. So if you are willing to carry me I can do this right now?” You asked.

“Do it.” Eragon said after silently conversing with Sahpira. You nodded and with that done you put one hand on her wound and the other on her forehead. Your eyes began to glow in concentration, which scared the trembling Arya enough for her to start whimpering. Then a light passed through you and into her from the hand on her wound and looked to be weaving itself through her veins than it all retracted into your other hand until it was all absorbed into you.

The intensity of both the transference and the poison paralyzed you and caused you to fall over the top of Arya. She on the other hand was instantly full of energy and rose, forcing the fall to land your head in her lap. She instinctually pushed you over so your head wasn’t face down in her crotch but as you rolled over and away they all noticed the lack of glowing eyes and the far away look that replaced it. It was clear that you were out, not unconscious but just as helpless.

This was a unique opportunity for them. On one hand you were a valuable resource and growing friend. But on the other you were a very large, even giant by dragon standards, dragon that if left unchecked could be a problem. So it was up to them to deal with your helpless but noticeably still conscious body.

You watched and was glad that your fear was unfounded. You had feared that they would use this rare opportunity to eliminate you in some way. Although they did have a slight discussion about it but as they traveled it was settled that you were not just an asset but a friend and betraying you would only prove them no better than the people responsible for Brom’s death. Your group was also joined by a boy named Murtagn. Apparently he saved them when they rescued Arya but most of them didn’t trust him as they traveled. Saphira was kind enough to carry you as they traveled to the Varden and as your condition was getting better but not very quickly they made it there and dove under a waterfall. Shortly after you heard Eragon’s voice and although the poison was muffling your senses you deciphered the meaning as Saphira went inside the mountain and soon you were being treated for the poison. It was remarkably quick once your body was steered in the right direction to heal its self so you were up and being escorted to a general council with Arya, Eragon, Saphira, and the leaders of the Varden. They picked a spot that was more or less open so you could transform, or that was your guess, since such meetings are usually done inside.

“Max, how are you feeling?” Arya asked.

“Well enough, the healers pointed my body’s immune system in the right direction. The poison should be completely gone in an hour or so.” You responded.

“Yes you were specifically hard to heal. Your body has a different feeling to it.” One of the members you didn’t recognize said.

“Which only makes what Eragon told me of you more believable.” Arya stated and it was clear the rest had heard it as well, from the lack of ‘what are you talking about?’ faces.

“Does that mean I can relax?” You asked and Saphira was the first to nod as she was the more eager to smell you again. The rest were slightly hesitant about what they had heard, both on believing it and seeing it.

“Actually they were hoping to have another dragon in the pending battle.” Eragon revealed you nodded in a way that both agreed and understood. You could smell the urgals and thousands of men and heard their pounding at the entrances, breaching them one after another. They were still at least a day from getting through the last one but still. You walked to an open area then turned to them. You then collapsed into your usual fit of pain and as Saphira got between those that wished to ‘help’ and your unstable transformation, but not enough so they couldn’t see what was happening. You then laid down but still your head toward above them.

“So it’s true.” Said the one addressed as the leader of the Varden. You could see that the only one that was glad to see you was Saphira but still hesitated before moving next to you. It was clear that her body still remembered your rather threatening position you placed her in before and flinched at your movement from time to time. The others were understandable afraid but some were also happy that a dragon of your size was going to help them in their fight. Things were looking better for them with two dragons on their side. “And you’ll fight with us?” he asked.

“I was thinking about it. Although I have one demand for doing so.” You said to which Eragon and Saphira looked a little quizzically at you. “I get the shade.” You stated with an underlining growl that shook the ground around you for a good distance.

“I think we can all agree to that.” Said the leader.

“Wait, that won’t work.” Eragon said which got you to look over to his direction. “Brom said that a Shade has to be stabbed through the heart. Your smallest tooth would only impale him and he would just escape to tell the king.”

“Fine, you can have him. But if you die I’ll kill you.” you said and almost got a growl from Saphira before she caught the joke in the statement. “I guess I’ll just take care of everything else.” You said or more asked to which the other leaders nodded their approval, not that they would refuse your help.

“Will you require armor? We are working hard to make a set for The rider’s dragon but we can try making you a set as well.” another man asked.

“Don’t bother, it would actually be weaker than my natural scales. So it would just get in the way. Save your effort for the battle. Just because I’m going to help you doesn’t mean I’m perfect or the enemy won’t get through. There is bound to be some to keep you all busy. Luckily for me I can hide in the night sky rather well so that takes care of my protection just fine.” You answered.

You looked over to see a middle aged man looking over at you as if you should say yes. You didn’t know what it was about this guy, but you didn’t like him. He had that arrogant look about him, as if everyone should be catering to him and letting him do as he pleased. His nose was up in a very stuck up pose that you felt like slapping from him. Given that your slap would probably kill him, it wasn’t exactly the thing you wanted to think about with thousands of soldiers to fight.

“I don’t think that is a good idea.” You answered as looked over at him and shook slightly as if you were just ruffling your scales or something but you were really shivering the feeling of having that man order you around.

“Do you think I can’t keep up with you?” he argued. You sighed then brought your head down to him. He flinched at this but you just started sniffing him to see if you were right. Not only were you right but you doubted if they guy could swing a wooden sword much more a steel one. You brought your head back before answering.

“I don’t think you’d be able to keep up with a child. But perhaps that is too insulting a way to answer this. I am not like Saphira in that I need a rider. I need two things to let someone ride me in such a manner; trust and respect. You don’t have either with me. I would have to spend half the fight protecting you and the other half taking your short sighted orders. In either sense I would lose a high majority of my combat readiness and ability.” You answered.

“That is ridiculous. I am a strong warrior. Stronger than most.” He said in an arrogant attitude that was really getting on not only your nerves but others as well.

“Sometimes I wish I didn’t have to speak.” You said to Saphira as she laughed at you more silently while Eragon did so out loud. “Such things could be so much easier by just snarling at him. Why don’t you be a ‘strong warrior’ somewhere else.”

“I swear, you will live to regret this!” Said the man as he bounded off with thick strides to pronounce whatever station he was. By the looks of the others, it looked like they were going to tell you.

“You know who that was?” Asked a dark skinned man.

“An arrogant Idiot that wanted to hide on my back during the battle?” you asked comically.

“He is Harold, a major influence among our people.” He revealed.

“I suppose he wanted to get some glory in battle while not actually doing anything. Not interested. He should be with the rest of us, not hiding behind the biggest thing he can find.” You responded.

“You’re right, we should be focused on the battle. We can worry about political stuff afterwards.” He finished then led Eragon off to somewhere inside. You were now outside with Saphira so you took off and she followed you to a ledge that was connected to the inside structure but looked over the whole camp. People looked at you two as you flew and it did feel a little good to be inspiring awe rather than horror.

“Well that was… interesting.” Saphira thought to you. She would’ve spoke in dragon tongue but a bunch of growls, snarls, and other dragon noises would not be productive for troop morale.

“If you say so.” You thought back as you both laid down and looked over the people getting ready. It was slightly refreshing to communicate like this. That way people weren’t staring and fearing your jaws and more specifically the teeth inside.

“So do you agree with the others?” She asked to which you looked at her in a confused look, telling her to continue. “I mean about expecting Eragon to be… more.”

“It is none of my business who you chose to be your rider. All that SHOULD matter to them is that you DID choose HIM. As for what I was expecting. I wasn’t expecting anything. So I guess that is a no. I wasn’t expecting ‘more’, as the others say. Seeing as the last enemy to say so received an arrow in the head. I can’t exactly say that he isn’t qualified. If that is the way Dragons and Riders operate here than he fits perfectly. Personally I wouldn’t be able to stand a rider in the sense you all seem to do. To much of a leash and I would be worried for the person too much to do any real fighting. Although… Sarah was a person I wouldn’t have minded being my Rider so… I guess it could work.” You responded, thinking as you did so in order to better explain yourself.

“Well that is a unique way to look at it.” She replied. “So how far are you going to go? In the battle I mean.”

“Well, you two can have some fun. Then I suppose when you start fighting the shade I’ll start on everyone else. It’s not like you’ll need help before that. They are just humans and… whatever those others are called. I sure hope I don’t have to taste any of those Ra’zac again. Yuck!” You replied and stuck out your tongue in a comical reference to your displeasure of the memory and taste.
