“Not really sure. I was following Brom when I got here. Then I took over his last mission. Now I’m going to roast a bunch of invading soldiers, or eat them, or whatever. But either way, I can’t imagine what is going to happen after that. I definitely didn’t expect to be having a conversation with a dragon I just met.” You answered, now thinking about that aspect.

“Is it really that bad to speak with me, or dragons rather?” she asked in an almost sorrowful tone.

“Depends who I’m talking to. In my realm there is a whole 1 other dragon other than me that is halfway decent. All the others are… well the exact way that humans think of us as. They are arrogant, self centered, vicious, sadistic, and the list goes on. You’re the second dragon that hasn’t met me with the intent to kill me for some reason or another. So for all my life I was use to slaughtering every dragon I see and them wishing the same on me and on the innocent humans I was trying to save. I even saw one take an infant hostage and when I complied to a demand of letting his brother go he chewed the baby up and spat it on the mother.” You revealed, obviously getting you heated as you thought about it.

“That is horrible. Dragons in your world actually do that?” She asked in aghast to the situation you were retelling.

“Worse, that was a light story. Needless to say… I haven’t had many good experiences with dragons. So to prevent bad experiences for me and those around I tend to slaughter dragons before they can do such horrendous acts. It also doesn’t help that even my Mother wanted me dead.” You ended as you laid your head down to rest and observe the humans and other like beings below as they readied for their battle. “Humans and that kind are much better, in my experience. Maybe it is because they are so weak that they can’t do anything but cater to us until they see that we are worth keeping around. Maybe they are just naturally more moral than dragons. Maybe that is why this world requires Dragons to have Riders. It is hard to say.”

“I suppose I have it easy then. When we are done here, I just have to follow Eragon wherever he decides to go. But you don’t have a Human to lead you. In a sense, you are your own Rider. I can’t imagine that man that wanted to ride you will let you stay among him and others under him after he gets done using you or us. No way he’ll keep you around to jeopardize his rule.” Saphira stated.

“So that’s what you meant by ‘after this’. I admit, it is a probably going to end up with me leaving this realm. Not that I mind. No offense, but even the scent of another dragon makes my blood boil. Even if your scent is ok, now, there are a few others in the air and variations of the scent saturated everywhere. But you never know, I could end up staying.” You answered back to her.

“For what it’s worth, I hope you do stay. There is no way I am going to mate with the King’s dragon. It would be a pain if he was the only other dragon in this world. Not to mention I would be back to only talking with Eragon.” She recited, as if giving you a list of things to consider.

“I’ll think on it. While I attempt to get some rest would you mind doing something for me?” you asked.

“Of course.” She perked up as she was eager to help you out in any way she could.

“It’s been a while since I slept with someone. The last person that slept by my side was Sarah and I… well she isn’t here at the moment. So I was wondering if you wouldn’t mind a little more contact. Just to know you’re there.” You asked, fully expecting her to say no. You knew that she was still a little weary of what happened the last time she woke you up and what might happen if your nightmares came and had you do something to her, a dragon, while she was so close to you.

“Sure.” She said simply and guided your head into her front lap just below her head then draped her head and neck over yours. It wasn’t much with the size difference. From a distance it could look like a kitten and a Large dog sleeping together. But it felt actually… quite good with her a friend’s heartbeat so close to you and harmonizing with yours to lull you asleep. You hoped the enemy would take a while to attack so that you could rest a while like this.
1323211112112211122111112211221121.title: She wonders about afterwards.

choices: You have to interfere to save Saphira.
You are called to heal her after they are victorious.
13232111121122111221111122112211212.content:
You were rudely interrupted from the first good rest you’d had since you left your home. Even though your dreams weren’t completely without malice, they still were significantly weaker in potency. You growled as you heard the sound of approaching horns that signaled the approach of enemy forces.

“Max, I have to go and get my armor on.” Saphira said as you woke to which she had uncoiled her limited body from your head and neck. Her wings had covered your eyes to help keep the late sun out of your sleep. But now that it was dark, she didn’t need to. You raised you head and let out a massive yawn.

“Why can’t the bad guys ever be late? They always know the most inconvenient timing and nail it perfectly without trying.” You complained.

“Well they are the bad side. So I suppose it would only make sense that they rub us the wrong way.” She said as she got up then looked at you. She left to some of the soldier’s calling to get her armor on. You rested your eyes as you listened to the things happening and guessed on the attack timing. If you came in too early than that Shade would just run. If you did it too late than Saphira and Eragon could end up as one or both of the casualties. That Shade had already taken one of your friends. You would be damned if he did likewise to any more.

“Holy crap!” said a male voice to which your eyes shot open to see Eragon looking at you. “I didn’t even see you until I ran into your head.”

“Come to think of it, I did feel a little presence just now.” You joked as you ripped on his presumed accident not even registering as a problem to you.

“Oh ha, ha. You’re a riot, you know that?” Eragon said back.

“Damn!” said an internal voice as you both saw Saphira come and you felt her walk into your side. “I can understand why he can’t see you but why can’t I?”

“That’s easy. Dark hunters in general are most dangerous at night because we blend in with the darkness and even our heat signatures are erased on default. If I don’t make an effort to be noticed than you wouldn’t be able to find me. It is, in a sense, my element.” You replied.

“I guess we don’t want them to see you until we are ready. It would be a shame if that Shade left here without my sword buried in his heart because you scared the crap out of him.” Eragon surmised.

“See, you’re thinking like a dragon already, little guy.” You said. “I agree. You two take out as many as you want. But save your strength for the shade. When he gets sick of you two interfering then he’ll come for you. Then I’ll show myself. He won’t leave this place once inside. I’ll see to that. You just see that he receives a sword in the heart. If you need help, I’ll be the one torching the rest of the invading army.” You complimented then all three of you were drawn to a pounding on the main gate as the attack begun. Eragon asked Saphira a few meaning of life questions but then roared and took off as soon as they were ready to deliver their wrath on the field. Good thing Saphira had learned her flame breath. However it hardly seemed fair to the human forces being torched by her flames.
13232111121122111221111122112211212.title: Why do bad guys have to be evil and annoying?

choices: Everything is fine when you wake.
They are OK, but you are in chains.
132321111211221112211111221122112121.content:
You watched as Saphira and Eragon did their thing. It was laughable how many she took out in relation to him. She would swoop down low for him to take a few but in the recoil or on the journey she would take out a hundred or so. You watched the show for a bit but stayed out of sight of the approaching Shade. You let out a subconscious growl that shook the area but not enough to cause suspicion of anything outside the battle or the already present dragon. However, finally, the shade conjured some kind of dark magic beast and went after them. This was your Queue to which you stood and looked over the battlefield and gave a deathly vicious roar then took off.

You were definitely using the darkness to hide you as you flew around. For how big you were it was slightly comical that they couldn’t see you as you passed feet from them. But finally you revealed yourself as you spewed a wall of flames the dwarfed Saphira’s by a wide margin. But you soon realized that such an attack was only good if they were all in groups. Not for the fighting soldiers. So you segmented and aimed a version of flames that were like solid needles of fire. They COULD be deathly accurate. So you flew over and riddled the field with them. You concentrated hard in not missing so that you didn’t hit allied forces that were sometimes inches away from the targets. From a distance it looked like a flamethrower and a machine gun had a kid.

At times you got tired and needed some energy. Good thing there was a fresh and flooding supply of ‘bad’ humans to pick from. So you would snag a few dozen in a pass to gulp down and digest to fuel your efforts. They tried shooting at you but they were lucky to catch the flash of you flying by and equally lucky to see you before they died when you attacked. If Saphira taking part in the battle was unfair, this surely wasn’t in the least. Finally however you got all that were in the camp and were just flaming the ones coming out of the entrance they made. So you landed in front of it, causing the incoming army to panic, with good reason. You then just blew your flames into the entrance so they flowed through the passages and incinerated all those inside. You could hear and see your flames exiting in weak points in the wall of the mountain and in the exit. There were a few that survived behind you. They tried to sneak up on you as the thought you were distracted. But you just weaved your tail behind you with the end flattened, slicing the incoming enemy units in half or, at the very least, in pieces.

You moment or reprieve from them panicking into a retreat was cut short by a scream of Saphira. Your head snapped to the sound to find Saphira’s Neck in the mouth of the dark magic beast that the Shade was flying. You snarled at the sight then took off with another roar that solidified any enemy units that were debating staying around. With that you went straight for the beast and zoomed past with your tail draping to slice the mouth that had her clamped in half. On your return trip you slowed down just enough for the Shade to see you glaring and snarling at him before you vanished into the darkness of the sky.

“Come get me you vile beast!” came the unwise words of the Shade as he switched from his intended target to you. You didn’t know what was more comical about this; that he thought he could defeat you or that he called YOU the ‘vile beast’. Did he even own a mirror?

“Saphira, Eragon,… are you two OK?” you asked in their heads.

“Saphira is hurt bad. We are better when we saw you taking the Shade on. Can you help her?” Eragon asked.

“I’m sorry Eragon. Provided that I can end this little game of cat and mouse quickly, I am not sure I can. I can heal normal wounds. But if that has any augmentation in it than I might not be able to. I’m sorry but you are both going to have to finish this. You’re right Eragon. I can’t nail his heart. You two need to be the heroes. I’ll take care of his little flying machine afterwards but he needs that sword in through the heart like we planned. I’ll keep his attention while you two figure something clever out.” You said then made another pass so the Shade knew where you were for a second. He fired some magic at you but missed horribly. You kept him steady and saw as Saphira didn’t have Eragon on her saddle then you saw an awesome move as she flicked her tail and Eragon was shot like an arrow straight at the Shade. He was so distracted that nailing his heart was easy. You finished the flying thing by catching Saphira before she collided with it, incinerating what was left of it with some impossibly strong black flames, then racing to catch the falling Eragon.

“Eragon!” called Saphira, trying to squirm out of your grasp and getting her wound to spray blood all over your underside. She was obviously in panic from watching her rider plummet to the ground below. You felt touched that she would think of a human so highly, even outside the fact that if he died so would she.

“Stop Squirming. It is hard enough to fly and catch him without you thrashing.” You scolded to which she whimpered and watched as you zoomed toward Eragon. “OK, this is going to get a little awkward. My claws are occupied with Saphira so I have to catch you in my mouth. I promise you will be fine so don’t panic.” You communicated to both of them. They barely had time to think on it as you caught Eragon mere feet from the ground in your jaws, wrapping your tongue around him like an airbag as your speed and angle made it impossible to not hit the ground. The last thing you could do was turn so Saphira wasn’t crushed by the fall. But you on the other hand had collided with the ground at near full speed.

The last thing you could do, as you were close to passing out, was release Eragon and place him, with your tongue, next to Saphira. She was bleeding pretty bad while laying on your stomach, being protected by your wings that you had retracted now that you were on the ground and they were broken for the moment. With that done you passed out from the pain and probably concussion that was a understandable result of colliding with the ground. You were strong, but you were no match for a planet.
132321111211221112211111221122112121.title: You have to interfere to save Saphira.

choices: Someone is able to attack and send you away.
They accept you and are asked to stay...
1323211112112211122111112211221121211.content:
“Hold on Max, don’t move around.” Came the inward voice of Saphira as you woke and started to do just that.

You stopped doing so at her request but opened your eyes to see why. But you didn’t really have to, as your wings and other parts of your body gave you enough reason why by themselves and the pain you were in. Looking off to each side, while blinking your eyes awake, you saw your wings were bend and bandaged. You assumed that you had a few internal injuries as well. Things that would take about a day to heal. You couldn’t complain as it would take months for someone else to recover enough to move properly and even longer to be in fighting shape.

“How long was I out?” you asked without moving too much but still out load so the others could hear at least your side of the talk. They assumed that Saphira got the message across to not move as you weren’t getting up. But of course they couldn’t hear her say it.

“Over a week. I can’t imagine anyone being alive after landing as hard as you did. You left a sizable crater in the ground.” Eragon answered, again, out loud for the same reason you did.

“Hey, I thought you were bleeding out.” You asked as you looked at the form of Saphira come to rest near your head so you could easily see her. “Not that I mind you being… well, alive. But one tends to miss the amount of blood you lost.”

“Eragon healed me with Magic. By all rights, we both should be dead from the spell he used. But he was able to pull it off and here we both are to tell you about it.” Saphira responded and the limited humans around that were tending to damage and your injuries just accepted that the silence was her ‘talking’ with you.

“Looks like you were right to pick him for your Rider than.” You complimented but could only look over at the smiling Eragon then back at Saphira. “Doubt anyone else would be foolish enough to attempt such a move.”

“Indeed.” She agreed and gave Eragon a light nuzzle.

“So, how bad is it?” you asked, glancing at your wings.

“Well, we were able to move you barely thanks to Saphira. She insisted in cleaning her blood off you herself.” Eragon started to which you could of sworn you saw her blush, even beyond her blue scales. “But your wing bones were shattered and so was a few of your inside bones. I remember you saying that you could heal most injuries by yourself. But we weren’t sure when you would be up. So we set your wings and they are almost healed. I would say another week should be safe.”

“Well I suppose I could do for a little R&R.” You agreed. However your stomach growled loudly that got the humans around you nervous. They probably saw you gulp down soldiers in the battle and, as your whole body was clean, they probably cleaned some human blood from your jaws at some point. So their nervousness was understandable. “I don’t suppose you would be willing to hunt for me?”

“Just for this week I suppose I could bring you your meals.” Saphira offered.

“Sounds great.” You agreed.

“You don’t mind if we feed you some of the enemy that are sticking around do you? We have tried to get them out, but there are still a few of them that are around. You said yourself that a human could last you longer than a considerable amount of other meat.” Asked Eragon.

“You are OK with watching me eat other humans, evil or not?” You asked skeptically.

“No offense, but I’ll probably not watch. I just asked as it would be better for… ah… Saphira to feed you the ones she catches, rather than having them be hanged or executed. At least this way we don’t have to deal with the clean up and we are feeding a friend.” Eragon stated, looking to Saphira to make sure it was ok to volunteer her for such a thing.

“I guess I’ll trust that the ones she brings me are ok to eat. I am not too thrilled about eating humans in general. But I guess with her bringing my food, I can’t be too picky.” You agreed.

“For the record, I hope I don’t have to feed you any. I think you are rubbing off on me. I don’t want to eat humans either. But I see the point. No reason to waste fresh meat.” Saphira added.

“Well, that settles that. Why don’t you rest and we’ll bring you a cow or something in a little bit.” Eragon stated and it seemed the other humans were glad that at least your current meal wasn’t one of them or even close. They could only guess what was on the dragon side of the conversation. All they knew was that you three had been discussing food and filling the complaining stomach that gave them pause when it was audible. You couldn’t imagine that the rumors that were spread because of the conversation would be very good. But you hoped they wouldn’t affect you or your status in this world.
1323211112112211122111112211221121211.title: Everything is fine when you wake.

choices: On the way back thieves attempt to mug you
Once at your estate you see a Dark Hunter flying off with one of your servants
A few days later you set out for the expedition
133.content:
You were hunting down your prey. Over the years you have reached your full potential. In human form you were eight feet tall and extremely muscular, however you were fast for someone of such size and power. In dragon form you were fully grown. As a dragon you stood over 500 feet and knew how to hunt to the point that no other dragon could stand up to you. The prey you were chasing was a warlord. Upon growing up you offered yourself to clients as a mercenary. You had little care for socializing due to your hatred towards your mother.

Upon growing up you learned that she was queen of the Dark Hunters. It made sense why she tossed you aside. The last thing she wanted was her own child to usurp her reign over the Dark Hunters. As you were chasing the warlord you leap high into the air. You then land in front of his carriage. The horse panic as you unsheathe your sword.

"It's you! You're Havorok Huntfire!" the warlord gasped as he looked into your blood red eyes.

"Is that all you have to say? Pathetic. You'll die like the cowering worm that you are!"

With one quick thrust you pierce the warlord through the heart. As you pull out your sword the warlord falls to the ground. You then proceed to take any valuables he has as a bonus to the payment that your client will give you. You then spot a woman tied up in the back. Your job also required you to rescue this damsel. The damsel was a noblewoman around your age and by the looks of it she must be skilled at fighting. She was also tall for a woman. By your guess she had to be a foot shorter than yourself. You cut her bindings with your sword. She then wakes up. Upon waking her white blond hair briefly covers her emerald eyes. She then notices you looming over her. Unlike other humans she doesn't cower in fear. Once on her feet she continues to look into your eyes.

"If you're ready we have to leave. Your father is paying me to bring you back safely."

The woman nods in understanding. You can tell that she was recovering from the trauma of being kidnapped. You then transform into your dragon form.

"Get on. I have to take this gold and other things to my place. It shouldn't be too far from town."

The woman nods and climbs on your back. You then take off and carry the carriage, horses and all to your estate. For a mercenary the extra wealth you've gathered has allowed you to buy a castle of your own. Once there you are greeted by your servants.

"Greetings master. What would you like us to do?" A maid said as she curtsied before you.

"Put the treasure in the vault and take the horses to the stables. If the horses give you any trouble kill them and put them in my private chamber. I have some work I need to finish. Once I return make preparations for my meal."

"As you wish master." The maid replied.

The servants then do as you commanded. You then transform into your human form.

"We'll walk to town. The last thing I need is for your father's men to attack me."

The woman nods in agreement. You and the noblewoman then walk into town. As you walk you see many people socilize. You sigh knowing that for someone like yourself socializing was not possible. You were too fixated on exacting revenge on your mother to care.

"Excuse me, Lord Huntfire. I just noticed that you seem lonely. Don't you have someone you care about?" the woman spoke up.

You ignore the woman for the time being. You then run your fingers through your short beard.

"I guess that's a no. I'm thankful that you saved me. If you would like maybe we can be friends. As a princess I barely have time for friends. Everyday my father has me studying a book or practicing my swordplay. It also doesn't help that I'm heir to his throne either."

You furrow your brow in response. No one in your life has wanted to be your friend before. You have servants that's for sure, but no one you could call a friend. But you knew that if you did make a friend your diabolical mother would send one of your sisters to kill them.

"Are you going to be silent during the whole way back? I understand that you didn't achieve your title through birth or had any comrades to help you, but please don't shut me out. You may chose to live a lonely life built on your terrible upbringing, but deep inside your intentions are justified. Deep down inside you want to do the best to end your suffering."

"My only obligation is my job. If you would like to chat with me go ahead. Whether I chose to answer is up to me."

"Isn't it part of your job to talk to me? You really don't want the Dark Hunter queen to exploit feelings of friendship for weakness. That's total bull crap! I've heard the stories of her tossing you over a cliff and leaving you for dead. Friendship isn't a weakness. It's strength!"

You grin in amusement. You knew from her thoughts that she was going to say what she said, but you never thought she would be so outspoken. Somehow something was unique about this princess. You couldn't put your finger on it but there's something more to her. Yet Princess Clarina Bruskolov did come from an intriguging bloodline. The knowledge from past Kings tell you that her family has a connection with dragons, but how much wasn't clear yet. After walking for fifteen minutes you arrive at the castle. You then spot the king waiting at the gate.

"Thank you Lord Huntfire for rescuing my daughter. Here's 100,000 gold for your troubles."

You take the bag of gold and tie it to your belt. "Thank you your majesty." You then prepare to leave until the king calls out to you.

"Lord Huntfire, I have another job for you."

"What kind of job is it?"

"This job is more of an expedition. I'm sure you know about the ill-fated Light Knight Dragons of long ago."

"I've heard of them. They're the polar opposite of Dark Hunters who vanished long ago. In the past they were evenly matched. Some rumors say that they went extinct, yet others say that they were cursed to take on human forms until they can access the legendary temple. If said temple is found it is said that a Light Knight Queen will restore the race's ability to shift from human to dragon form." You said as knowledge from one of the previous Kings came to your mind.

"Impressive Lord Huntfire."

"So when do we start this expedition your majesty?"

"We'll set out a few days from now. Like last time I'll pay you after the the job is done."

"Fair enough."

You then walk back to your estate.
133.title: 20 years old.

choices: The visitor is the sheriff. He bears a gift.
The visitor is concealing their identity. They give you an ominous message.
1331.content:
You took time to enjoy your solitude as you walked through the town. The sun was setting and most of the people were inside. During the day if in town you usually hear people gossip about you. It wasn't out of the ordinary, but most people described you as a dark knight or a heartless monster. Yet that didn't phase you. Ever since you were twelve you started you career as a mercenary and killed people with bounties without regret. You even torched a band of pirates because it was the job you were hired to do. Sometimes though people respect your work. Life as a mercenary isn't pleasing to people, but in a way it did help you gain wealth and a fearsome reputation. The people who respected you often called you the lord of dragons or the lone hero.

After the sun went down a gentle breeze blew through your jet black hair. You then examined the bag containing the 100,000 gold. In the land in which you live one gold bar equals at least 20,000 gold coins. With five gold bars in the sack you were carrying you have enough gold to add another expansion to your own castle outside of town. You then stop walking as your ears detect light footsteps. Your nose picks up the scent of thieves. They would be fools to attack a dragon like yourself. It wouldn't even be worth transforming into a dragon to put those lowlifes out of their pathetic existence.

"Come on out cowards! You picked the wrong guy to mug!"

You then hear one thief run towards you. On instinct you leap into the air and kick the thief. The thief is sent hurling into a wall. The impact from the blow broke his neck leaving him dead. You sense fear among the other thieves hiding in the shadows. Three more thieves come rushing at you from three different directions. You unsheathe your sword and quickly slice the thieves in two. You then spot two thieves cowering before you.

"Hav... Have mercy on us Lord Havorok Huntfire!" A female thief cried.

"Why should I consider sparing your lives after you attacked me?" You replied.

"We'll do anything!" the other thief said as sweat rolled down his face.

"If you really want to make it up to me then pledge your allegiance to me. You'll be hired as my servants and be my guards. If I need information for a job such as the layout for a town you two will find out all you can. Failure to do that will result in consequences. Do you understand?"

"We understand."

"Good now come with me."

So you and your newly acquired servants head back to your castle. You then eat a feast made for a king. Normally eating this much would be bad for a human, but given that you are a dragon meals as large as this were required to keep yourself in tiptop shape. Also with your proficiency in magic you could easily replenish your own food supply in months of famine. Of course if such was the case you would sell your food to the townspeople. You can't afford to let them die of starvation or you wouldn't have clients to hire you for your services.

After eating your fill your servants eat the small portion that you left for them. You then head to your bathing chamber. There you take off your tunic, gloves, and pants. You then use your fire breath to heat the water the maids have prepared while you were out. You then step into the pool of water and relax. You look at your body and remember how you were nearly killed twenty years ago. It's a surprise that the scars you received long ago were completely gone from both of your forms. As you grew older the scars slowly faded.

It wasn't until you were twelve that they were completely gone. Now every time you get cut or scratched the wound instantly heals. You relax for thirty minutes before you hear a knock on the door. You then slip on your pants and answer the door.

"What is it?"

"There's someone here to see you m'lord." A butler said.

"I'll be right out. I just need to put on my shirt."

"Very well. I'll let your visitor know that you'll be ready soon."

After slipping on a shirt you go out to the throne room to meet your guest. The guess you meet must have a reason for wanting to meet with you this late at night. Upon entering the throne room you see your visitor.
1331.title: Thieves of a Foolish Fold

choices: A few days later you begin the expedition
Two days later you go to the royal palace to discuss the expedition
13311.content:
After a close inspection you identify the visitor to be Princess Clarina Bruskolov herself. She was wearing the same white armor as before, however this time she had a sword on her person.

"Greetings Lord Huntfire. I do not mean to intrude, but I thought it would be best to thank you again."

"Are you sure this isn't an attempt to buddy up with me because you think I'm lonely?" You asked as you saw through her greeting.

"So what if it is. We're that different in some aspects of our upbringing."

"How so?"

"Even though I have a father he never spent any time with me. He's always spending time with my cousins or his personal guards. His glowing purple eyes always look on with disapproval. If he does want to spend time with me it's usually to extort me for my natural abilities."

"He's a king and your a princess. He's only doing what's in your best interest."

"How do you explain the fact that he left me all alone in the forest when I was five. I was lucky to find my way back. That fraud of a king was too busy pleasuring his concubines. Have you ever seen him at least embrace me in a hug? No, he didn't even do that. All my life I've been alone. It was nothing but reading, swordplay, and magic, but without the embrace of the man who should always be there it felt like I was being trained as a weapon." Clarina said as she tried holding back her tears.

You begin feeling sorry for her. It didn't occur to you that the king just saw his daughter as just a mere flower to be tossed away.

"I've had it worse as you've heard. As soon as I was born my mother chewed on my body with her teeth, threw me off a cliff, and left me to die. Upon growing up I learned to trust no one. People were always trying to kill me or sometimes exploit me. Yet in the end...", You feel yourself at a loss for words as your own loneliness took over. You haven't cried since you were twelve but you felt the strange desire to let it all out.

You try holding back your own tears, but find yourself unable to. Were you and the princess who stood before you no different? You then notice Clarina besides you. How she approached you so quickly surprised you.

"It's okay Havorok. Just left it all out. As your friend I'll always be there till the very end. That's what friends do."

You smile at Clarina's gesture. In all your life you haven't known what kindness was. None of the prior Dark Hunter Kings even knew the concept, yet they should have. Instead they lived the similar lifestyle you did.

"Recently I've been looking more into my family history and the Light Knight Dragons that once lived among your kind. I've found some information that explains my father's motivations."

"What info is that? I may already know it."

"You have a point Havorok, but did you know that all men in my family have purple eyes while the women have yellow eyes. I also found out that Light Knight Queens are the only ones of that race of dragon to have green eyes. Given this info then the rumors about my family once being able to turn into dragons at will must be true."

"Is that so? Wouldn't that mean you would have draconic powers. If I remember the legends correctly the Light Knight Queen always maintained these powers in her human form unlike the other Light Knight Dragons."

"That's correct, but Light Knight Queens don't possess genetic memory. The only thing passed down from previous Queens are adaptability, intellect, and the ability to copy any skill they see, except shapeshifting."

"If that's true then you have to go to the temple to have your shapeshifting ability restored."

"That's right. It was a pleasure talking to you. If you need to talk before we meet for the expedition then I'm available."

Clarina then waves her hand and she disappears before your eyes. So that's how she made it in. For once you actually felt happy. Maybe after the expedition and the rumors are true you might even wed this princess, but before thinking about that you'll fix the wrongdoings of your mother. Surely her reign over the Dark Hunters must come to an end and the era of Dark Hunter Kings to begin. Deep inside you knew that if male Dark Hunters weren't malnourished that they can match a female in size and power. Deep inside you wanted a Dark Hunter society where both male and female were capable of standing on their own and proving their worth. Yet it is that reason you spare a few people during your quests; for some reason you always saw a person's true potential.
13311.title: A Heart to Heart Conversation

choices: You and Clarina are tasked with securing supplies.
You and Clarina head to the town square to purchase a map
On your way to the in a dragon attacks the city
1333.content:
The next morning you wake up in your bedchambers, a massive room fully capable of fitting a 500' 2" dragon such as yourself. Your bedchambers had a reflective roof that allowed sunlight to fill the room so you could feed off the sun's energy. Once you were done stretching your limbs you transform into your human form. You then proceed to the bathhouse in the adjoining room. Like your bedchambers the roof also allowed sunlight to filter in. Despite the roof's transparent nature from the inside it was made of a special mineral.

The mineral was known as Dragonstone, a mineral made through alchemy and whose properties gave it a sturdy and reflective texture. During your travels as a boy you were working in Salchemgic, the magic and science capital of the Base Realm. You were hired by an alchemist as a bodyguard despite being twelve, but it was during that time you had access to the skills of the previous Kings. You were only 300 feet tall back then in dragon form, but taller than any grown man in your human form standing at 6'1". It was by that time you had no scars left on your body for they slowly disappeared as you matured. It was there you mastered your client's craft.

Nowadays you can successfully create servants out of the raw materials that made up their composition and through necromancy to create artificial souls. That's why most of your servants showed their loyalty to you since they were merely empty dolls with with fake souls. You take your time relaxing in the hot water as you recollect the first time you began your job as a mercenary. It didn't give you the trust of the people, but it did create a fearsome reputation that makes people cower before the name that you had given yourself.

Once you finish bathing you change into your armor, which is as black as your hair. You the use your powers to fly. After leaping into the air your wings sprout from your back. You fly to the meeting place and wait for the king and his men to arrive. As you wait you eat the meal that your homunculus servants have made. Once finished you teleport the waste back to the castle kitchens to be cleaned. You then lay on your back and take in the sun.

Thirty minutes later you hear the sound of marching soldiers and horses galloping. You quickly rise to your feet and brush yourself off. You see the king riding on horseback. His purple eyes shone in the distance. Behind him Princess Clarina was walking on foot. You found it odd that she wouldn't be on a horse and that she's tagging along, but you're certain it has to deal with the expedition.

"Greetings Lord Huntfire."

"Greetings Your Majesty." You replied.

"I see your ready for the expedition to the Light Knight Temple. Where we are going will be dangerous. This time of year the Dark Hunter Queen is mating. All her daughters will be out and about once the sun goes down."

"So that's why you hired me. Just to fend off dragon attacks knowing very well of the dragon you spoke of also tried to kill me when I was born. I can easily take out one or two, but I wouldn't be able to take on an entire army without an army myself. It would take five or more of them together to take me down."

"That's why I brought my other insurance policy. My daughter is very capable of killing a dragon all by herself. My army could also kill two dragons at their current level of training."

"Have you no concern for your flesh and blood. She's your heir, not some weapon."

"How I use my daughter is no concern of yours. I need her to stay alive so we can get to the temple. If she dies I'm certain you can just resurrect her anyway." The king said in an arrogant tone.

You then sigh seeing that arguing with your client would get you nowhere.

"Fine, but I'll charge you extra for any resurrections, got it King Sycamore?"

"I understand clearly Lord Havorok Huntfire, but if you even dare disrespect me again I will make sure the Queen of the Dark Hunters destroys everything you hold dear.

"Fine." You grumbled.

"Excellent, now let's get going."

You and the king's men then walk towards Salchemgic to pick up supplies. As you were walking Clarina approaches you."

"Thanks for standing up to my father for me. I would have done it myself, but I couldn't do it without the urge to end his life." Clarina whispered into your ear.

"Don't mention it. I've worked with less savory employers before. It takes patience and control not to lash out." You replied.

"True, but my father is the type of man who wouldn't bat an eye if his flesh and blood were slaughtered before his eyes. Whatever he has planned is definitely evil."

"That may be the case milady, but if the king gets out of line you have the power to take over. All you need is trusted advisers."

"Unfortunately my father bribes them with gold. I have no one I can trust, but I do have hope that someday things can change for the better."

"You're optimistic. I just do what's necessary."

"Lord Huntfire, that's good and all, but you need friends. Without them life is a dull existence."

"This coming from a sheltered woman who only knows what she's read or the art of swordplay."

"You know that I'm right milord. You just don't want to admit it."

A grin appears on your face. Clarina's straightforwardness was admirable for a human woman. While male Dark Hunters are treated as toys for the Queen in human society women seemed to face similar troubles, but definitely better off than your own brothers. A few hours later you arrive in Salchemgic. From there you are briefed on what to expect.
1333.title: Setting off for the Light Knight Temple

15.content:
Unknown to you, you passed through an ancient device known as a portal. Portals could send one anywhere, even places two feet away or forward in time via a parallel reality. However in the case of unconsciousness or someone else opening the portal you could be sent anywhere at random with virtually no way of tracking you or knowing yourself how to get back. No one had ever come back from a trip through the portals before, when sent to an unknown at least.

So you plunged through the portal that went to…
15.title: You went through a portal before landing.

choices: Wake up as you were before.
Wake in a bed with Natsu sleeping next to you.
Wake up somewhere cold and dark.
151.content:
You were lulled awake by a strangely comforting feeling of warmth. You nuzzled into the feeling but felt no body to nuzzle other than underneath you. So you stayed there as you felt an unnatural amount of warmth that you thought was your mother. You were wishing that the horrid events that plagued your dreams were just a nightmare and that she really did love and care about you. All that was dashed when you tried to move and found a harsh shot of pain reel through your body from the places you remember being chewed on. To the pain and memory you started to whimper as you were too weak to cry but not too weak to open your eyes and see where you were.

“Gramps, you got to do something. Can’t you see he’s in pain!” said the face that was just above you.

“Natsu look!” interrupted a voice coming from a blue flying cat. “He’s waking up.” The boy looked at you as you looked at him. You had stopped whimpering for a moments to observe the apparent human that held you.

His face was intense yet innocent looking and with a strange familiarity to it with black eyes and rose colored hair. Besides the clothes he had on you could smell his scent. It almost smelled like he was part dragon, almost. Lastly you noticed flames coming from around you. Not able to move, you looked with your eye that was still on the side that was lying on his hand to see the flames were coming from his skin. You didn’t know how a human could do this and every part of your mind was wondering why as well but you took it as a sign that you were in good hands, both figuratively and literally.

“Hello little guy, are you feeling ok?” asked the human, that was called by the others, ‘Natsu’. You answered by nuzzling into his hand and whining some more. Your wounds had healed enough to not be a bother as far as bleeding but the pain was still very real as well as your hunger and sadness. But this ‘Natsu’ guy seemed nice and more importantly to your current situation, warm.

“Well Natsu, it looks like you were right for once.” Said another voice but you didn’t look as you were whimpering and whining into his hands as if they would provide more comfort than they were already giving. “Who’d have thought that dousing the poor thing in flames would help heal the little guy?”

“Indeed. Natsu seems strangely equipped to take care of the young dragon.” Said yet another voice, this one more aged and masculine than the others.

“But what do I do? He’s gotta eat something. I can hear his stomach growl from here.” Natsu asked worriedly.

“Well what do dragons eat?” Asked one of the other voices you heard before. But you couldn’t really pay attention at this point as you drifted off to sleep again. You were glad that you had been found by someone nice and at least partially a dragon, from the smell of him. You weren’t too sure about them being human and stuff like that but your thoughts were interrupted by another onslaught of nightmares as you slept, hoping for a relief soon.
151.title: Fairy Tail (the Anime)

1511.content:
You wake up with a similar warmth around you as before but with less chaos and noise. You opened your eyes to see the Natsu human looking down at you intently. This time when you moved it barely hurt at all. You stumbled to your feet and it was then that the relative silence broke.

“You’re awake!” Natsu yelled to which you cringed down into a fearful position. The noise was obviously not welcomed and he seemed to get it right away as you looked around to see more than a few human faces looking at you as you spun to look at them. You went in circles on his hands for a while as you looked and sniffed around. It smelt chaotic to you. So many smells and most of them you didn’t have the slightest clue what or who they were. You stretched your wings and took to the air. “Hey, come back.” Said the human but you didn’t really understand him, yet. You were learning quickly and by the tone of his voice and his body movement you could guess what he wanted.

“Hold on their Natsu. Just looks like he’s getting a good look around.” Said the old voice from before. You took to soaring after you discovered a hard surface above a certain point. Around and around in circles you went as you gazed down at the humans watching you, taking in every little detail. But the more that you did so the more you were getting confused. They were so weird and well different then the memories that flooded your head. You quickly noticed that you wouldn’t be gaining any considerable knowledge like that but just as you figured that out your still partially damaged wing gave out and you began to fall to the ground. But it didn’t last long as a familiar pair of hands caught you.

“Hey, be careful. You’re still weak from whatever happened.” Said Natsu and again you couldn’t figure out what he was saying but got the gist of it as his concerned face and trembling hands told the story all too well. You rolled over and stood again, flexing your wings and looking at the injured one. You licked at it but realized that it was still too damaged to fly.

“Ah, the poor thing’s wing is still to hurt to fly.” Said a female voice that you tracked to a young looking girl with blonde hair and brown eyes. You then felt a sneeze coming but not knowing what that was yet you just let it fly. As you did a massive amount of flames went out and took out part of a stone wall and sent you back into Natsu from the propulsion. You shook your head then continued to explored up Natsu’s body until you came to rest on his shoulders and in a small whitish looking clothe that was around his neck and was for some reason really comfortable to you. So you snuggled into it and his neck then looked back out to the humans as Natsu stood and looked at you the best he could. They were all slightly shocked at what just your sneeze did which was followed shortly by Natsu laughing.

“Yep, he found someone just as destructive as he is.” The blonde haired girl said, slightly annoyed.

“You got that right. What a sneeze wouldn’t you say Natsu?” asked the blue flying cat as he tried to land next to you but you sent a growl over and although weak the little blue cat listened.

“Hey, be nice to Happy Max.” instructed Natsu. You were slowly getting the hang of their language and understood him, mostly. Understood enough to know that he had named your Max and didn’t growl as the cat sat on the shoulder next to you.

“Max? Is that what you’re going to name him?” asked the little blue cat as he reached over and started petting you. At first you had to stiffen a snarl but then you got to liking what the little blue fur ball was doing.

“He likes it, right Max?” asked Natsu to which you raised your head and licked his neck then laid it back down on the cloth apparently called a scarf. As you relaxed your genetic knowledge began coming to you and filling in the blanks. “See?”

“Yes Natsu, it seems you have yourself a pet dragon.” Said someone else in the room to which you growled at the words. The act got him and the others around him to flinch as they didn’t want to cause another sneeze in their direction.

“Max is not a pet! He’s going to be my partner, right next to Happy.” Natsu said as if getting ready for a fight. Well that was until you nipped at his ear. “Ow! What was that for?” he yelped to which you chirped back at him. “Huh?” he asked, still not understanding until he and the rest of them heard your stomach growl. “Oh! You’re hungry, that’s it isn’t it?” he asked to which you licked him and chirped an affirmative sounding response. You didn’t have the vocals to mimic human speech yet so you just had to make do until you grew a little.

“Come on Natsu, let’s get him something to eat.” The blue cat said, which immediately sent away any feelings of distrust from the little fur ball. “Hope you like fish.” Happy said to which you just cocked your head and chirped in a way that got across that you were confused. “What! You’ve never had fish before? Well you’re in for a treat then.”

“Better be careful Happy or he might eat you when he gets big enough.” Said another human in the room. You growled at him but he didn’t back down like the others. “What are you going to do little fire breather” he taunted to which you blew a hefty amount of light flames at him, charring his clothes and hair and leaving him stunned and coughing up a little smoke from the experience. “Right… you’ll breathe fire.” he said then passed out, causing a round of laughter. You were slightly worried that you went to far but with that reaction you were really liking this place and it almost got you to forget why you were there in the first place.
1511.title: Wake up as you were before.

15111.content:
“I got to tell you, now that you can talk it makes thing a lot easier then biting my ear or leg every time you want my attention.” Natsu said to you after about a week. You had been growing at an accelerated rate because of being a Dark Hunter King and going through the portal a mere couple hours after birth. In that week you had already grown to a horse’ size and quickly found out how to go from human to dragon and back. Although currently your human form was still an infant size so you just stayed as a dragon.

“I’m sorry, I didn’t hurt you did I?” you apologized. You used extra care as you got bigger not to bite to hard but he had pretty tough skin for a human.

“Hey don’t worry about it, it just surprised me sometimes. Which reminds me… were getting a team together, do you want to join?” he asked.

“Wasn’t I already with you Natsu?” you asked. It was true and your received a guild seal on both your dragon form and human form. In your human form it was on your arm like Natsu’s but black. In dragon form it was put on your side and as you grew it did as well. “I mean you’re like my family so…?”

“Well yeah, we’re all a big family in Fairy Tail and it’s awesome hanging out with you and stuff but we still have to go on missions and for that we should put together a team so other people don’t think they can grab you.” he said just in time for one of the other members to come forward.

“Hey Max, why don’t you join up with a real man?” said Elfman and you got a look from happy as if to say ‘see what he means’.

“No way, I asked him first!” Natsu yelled.

“Maybe he doesn’t want to.” Elfman hollard back.

“Well I…” you started but they weren’t listening anymore as they started fighting, again.

“They never change do they?” came Lucy’s voice from the same table. They were about to go on a job and was about to form a new team so they naturally thought of you. You and Natsu were pretty close as he was like a father to you, kind of. He was the second person you saw so he was held in high station by instinct if nothing else. But that feeling slowly passed through to the rest of the guild.

“Well, it’s never boring.” You agreed. While your genetic memory gave you wisdom beyond your years and understanding far beyond normal people or even other dragons you still had only been alive for a little more than a week. So you watched a lot of what went on and experienced a lot of everything to add to your own personal experience of things. “So you three want me in your…?” you asked, not remembering the word Natsu used.

“…team? Yes we do. Just as long as you don’t eat me or any of my spirits again.” She said as a half joke and half warning. A few days ago when you were going through one of your growing spurts you had an instant increase in appetite. In that state you clamped down on one of her spirits and swallowed it down on pure instinct. She tried to stop you but it only ended in swallowing her half down as well. Luckily you caught yourself and spit them out. She wasn’t really mad at you but she was more careful around you from then on.

“I… you don’t have to worry about that. I didn’t mean to do it.” You said as you looked down and away from her. It was obvious that you felt really bad about it and she was kind of sore about the incident as well but she knew you were still really young so she had forgiven you quickly.

“Oh, I know Max. But I got to know, did I taste good?” she asked in a weird sense of fascination.

“I, don’t really know… you had too much clothes on to get a good taste and that little plush toy thing didn’t taste that good. Lucy, you got to know that I would never hurt you.” you said as you were worried that she thought you would really eat her in the future and it showed.

“Whoa Max, I already know that. Don’t worry, I don’t think that you would.” Lucy said as she waved her hands in both your and her defense.

“So are you going to join our team or what?” Happy asked as he flew and landed on your head. Despite almost eating him a few times, Happy was very relaxed around you and it meant a lot that he didn’t even bring it up.

“Yes, I think I will.” You answered after thinking about it for a while.

“Alright! You hear that Elfman? I win!” Natsu said but was soon in another ‘manly’ fight.

“Well I guess we’ll be leaving on our first mission after he gets done.” You said as you sighed.

“See, we all know each other so well already.” Lucy said as she seemed to be more fascinated by you then Natsu but was overall still star struck from being and equally new member as you.
15111.title: Growing up.

1551.content:
Slowly your body recovers, and eyes blink open to see the vista of a grassy field. Where are you? What is this place? Your mind is a mismatch of complex ideas and naivete and you both know that this must be a well tended field by the look of the grass, and wonder at the simple beauty of a single blade of grass before you, dew glinting in the morning sunlight. Squinting you realize that you've been unconscious for... well a long time, but don't feel hungry. Some times it is awkward 'knowing' things, but not truely understanding them. You spread your small wings in this place, glad that there appear no predators here to worry you at your small size, and soak up the sunlight, feeling yourself banish more hunger further.

Some time later you realize you have, drifted would be the best word. You weren't asleep quite, but didn't truly feel the passage of time till just now... when noises brought you to full awareness. Shapes are moving through the grass ahead of you and you wonder where you are and who these individuals are?
1551.title: Location.

choices: A jogger stops her run and sees you in the grass!
You hide till dark and then try to find a place to hide until you are grown.
15511.content:
A blur moves past you, your still dazed senses not able to make things out. Somehow you feel that, even with your injuries, you should be better than this right now. Should have healed faster, have more acute senses, be faster. Something is wrong!

While the shapes move by above and to the side of you you focus on yourself, your simple mind struggling to grasp what your Inherited memories tell you. As young as you are it takes a long time for you to get it, but you finally understand the gist. This world is limited. Something in it stops magic. Normal magical beings can not exist here and spells fizzle almost totally. A normal dragon would survive, but would be weakened and a pitiful thing, certainly not able to fly, or flame, and a lot of other abilities would be impossible. However, you... ah, that is different. This place will limit you, but still you will be strong here... given time. You might not be as powerful as you might be else where, but you will still be vastly greater than anything living in this realm, and more than any normal dragon would be in a more normal realm! Growing to that size and power however will take some considerable effort and time.

As you think on this it's almost as if there are two voices in your head, your own simple attempt to grasp this, and the memories of the previous Dark Hunter Kings and their understanding. You don't have their personalities, but something of them does survive within you somehow. Perhaps it is just when you are young, to help you survive? You don't know. If you're lucky it will stay with you. You hope so.

The blurs surrounding you become clearer as the day wears on, though they become somehow different. Different shapes maybe? Further through the day you feel the sun helping a great deal to heal and still your hunger, but it does not... The concept is tricky, but you think there is a difference in you between feeding hunger and feeding growth. For the latter you will need actual food, but to just survive, the sun will do. It certainly feels good to just lay here in the tall grass and soak it in!

Ok, this is going to be a different style of interactive than my previous ones. This is going to be a plot based fantasy interactive with a solid main character. Because I would like to establish this interactive as such there are a few more rules than I usually put forward. I retain the right to delete or edit any entry that doesn’t follow these rules if I desire.

1) Keep it accurate ----- I don’t care if you make the character any way you want, gay stuff included. However if a specific storyline has him, for example, Straight and you suddenly change him to be Gay, that is not ok. If you want to establish something about him that is contradicted earlier than add before that point.

2) Keep grammar a priority ----- I am not going to delete an entry if it has some miss spellings or one large paragraph but if it gets to ridiculous than I will delete it and notify you if you wish to resubmit. It just isn’t cool if no one can understand someone’s lack of education or proficiency and over use of things like (lol, WTF, OMG, or otherwise text language) this is not your phone and other people want to read chapters without decoding it first.

3) Keep it interesting ----- This will be a little more strict this time around. I WILL NOT be accepting any one line or word entries. ALL entries must be over a paragraph, and if you have to ask if it is too short than it probably is. Suddent dead ends are also going to be delete as well as chapters that are to me only. If you want to ask me to put an option in than send me a private message and I will accommodate as best I can.

4) This is NOT a fetish based interactive ----- I have one other interactive that you can go all out on if you wish to do so. If you want to add something with a fetish attached to it than it must have some other purpose to it. For example: if you have someone eat someone else you could be transporting them somewhere. Or if you want someone unbirthed than maybe it was so that they come back as an anthro or full on animal. But do NOT dedicate a chapter or storyline to fetish or erotic based themes. You can use them but not as the main plot point of your addition. This is once again a PLOT based interactive and I have one other interactive if you want to expand on the Fetishes or Erotic preferences.

5) Lastly, don’t rip on anyone’s writing style ----- If it really is bad enough to the point I don’t like it I will delete it. If something is inaccurate to a realm or other pet peeve of yours than you either need to write some and get it back on track or just read and enjoy their creativity

So… if you wish to add please do so and have fun regardless. I would love some feedback eventually if you like this. Can’t tell you how far a little positive encouragement goes as far as fuel to keep going.
